English: hear thou whose ear is quick my call; take to thee readily my songs  o indra let this laud of mine come nearer even than thy friend

English: we know thee mightiest of all in battles hearer of our cry  of thee most mighty we invoke the aid that giveth thousandfold

English: o indra son of kuśika drink our libation with delight  prolong our life anew and cause the seer to win a thousand gifts

English: our songs of praise have glorified indra who ruleth by his might  whose precious gifts in thousands come yea even more abundantly

English: such agni purifier bright bring hither to our sacrifice  to our oblation bring the gods

English: so lauded by our newest song of praise bring opulence to us  and food with heroes for our sons

Sanskrit: i̱me somā̍sa̱ inda̍vaḥ su̱tāso̱ adhi̍ ba̱rhiṣi̍   tām̐ i̍ndra̱ saha̍se piba
English: here are the drops of soma juice expressed on sacred grass thereof  drink indra to increase thy might

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ te̱ stomo̍ agri̱yo hṛ̍di̱spṛg a̍stu̱ śaṁta̍maḥ   athā̱ soma̍ṁ su̱tam pi̍ba
English: welcome to thee be this our hymn reaching thy heart most excellent  then drink the soma juice expressed

Sanskrit: viśva̱m it sava̍naṁ su̱tam indro̱ madā̍ya gacchati   vṛ̱tra̱hā soma̍pītaye
English: to every draught of pressedout juice indra the vṛtraslayer comes  to drink the soma for delight

Sanskrit: semaṁ na̱ḥ kāma̱m ā pṛ̍ṇa̱ gobhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ śatakrato   stavā̍ma tvā svā̱dhya̍ḥ
English: fulfil o śatakratu all our wish with horses and with kine  with holy thoughts we sing thy praise

Sanskrit: indra̱ soma̱m piba̍ ṛ̱tunā tvā̍ viśa̱ntv inda̍vaḥ   ma̱tsa̱rāsa̱s tado̍kasaḥ
English: o indra drink the soma juice with ṛtu; let the cheering drops  sink deep within which settle there

Sanskrit: maru̍ta̱ḥ piba̍ta ṛ̱tunā̍ po̱trād ya̱jñam pu̍nītana   yū̱yaṁ hi ṣṭhā su̍dānavaḥ
English: drink from the purifier's cup maruts with ṛtu; sanctify  the rite for ye give precious gifts

Sanskrit: a̱bhi ya̱jñaṁ gṛ̍ṇīhi no̱ gnāvo̱ neṣṭa̱ḥ piba̍ ṛ̱tunā̍   tvaṁ hi ra̍tna̱dhā asi̍
English: o neṣṭar with thy dame accept our sacrifice; with ṛtu drink  for thou art he who giveth wealth

Sanskrit: agne̍ de̱vām̐ i̱hā va̍ha sā̱dayā̱ yoni̍ṣu tri̱ṣu   pari̍ bhūṣa̱ piba̍ ṛ̱tunā̍
English: bring the gods agni; in the three appointed places set them down  surround them and with ṛtu drink

Sanskrit: brāhma̍ṇād indra̱ rādha̍sa̱ḥ pibā̱ soma̍m ṛ̱tūm̐r anu̍   taved dhi sa̱khyam astṛ̍tam
English: drink soma after the ṛtus from the brāhmaṇa's bounty undissolved  o indra is thy friendship's bond

Sanskrit: yu̱vaṁ dakṣa̍ṁ dhṛtavrata̱ mitrā̍varuṇa dū̱ḻabha̍m   ṛ̱tunā̍ ya̱jñam ā̍śāthe
English: mitra varuṇa ye whose ways are firma power that none deceives  with ṛtu ye have reached the rite

Sanskrit: dra̱vi̱ṇo̱dā dravi̍ṇaso̱ grāva̍hastāso adhva̱re   ya̱jñeṣu̍ de̱vam ī̍ḻate
English: the somapressers fain for wealth praise the wealthgiver in the rite  in sacrifices praise the god

Sanskrit: dra̱vi̱ṇo̱dā da̍dātu no̱ vasū̍ni̱ yāni̍ śṛṇvi̱re   de̱veṣu̱ tā va̍nāmahe
English: may the wealthgiver grant to us riches that shall be far renowned  these things we gain among the gods

Sanskrit: dra̱vi̱ṇo̱dāḥ pi̍pīṣati ju̱hota̱ pra ca̍ tiṣṭhata   ne̱ṣṭrād ṛ̱tubhi̍r iṣyata
English: he with the ṛtu fain would drink wealthgiver from the neṣṭar's bowl  haste give your offering and depart

English: as we this fourth time wealthgiver honour thee with the ṛtus be  a giver bountiful to us

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā̱ piba̍ta̱m madhu̱ dīdya̍gnī śucivratā   ṛ̱tunā̍ yajñavāhasā
English: drink ye the meath o aśvins bright with flames whose acts are pure who with  ṛtus accept the sacrifice

Sanskrit: gārha̍patyena santya ṛ̱tunā̍ yajña̱nīr a̍si   de̱vān de̍vaya̱te ya̍ja
English: with ṛtu through the housefire thou kind giver guidest sacrifice  worship the gods for the pious man

Sanskrit: indrā̱varu̍ṇayor a̱haṁ sa̱mrājo̱r ava̱ ā vṛ̍ṇe   tā no̍ mṛḻāta ī̱dṛśe̍
English: i crave help from the imperial lords from indravaruṇa; may they  both favour one of us like me

Sanskrit: gantā̍rā̱ hi stho 'va̍se̱ hava̱ṁ vipra̍sya̱ māva̍taḥ   dha̱rtārā̍ carṣaṇī̱nām
English: guardians of men ye ever come with ready succour at the call  of every singer such as i

Sanskrit: a̱nu̱kā̱maṁ ta̍rpayethā̱m indrā̍varuṇa rā̱ya ā   tā vā̱ṁ nedi̍ṣṭham īmahe
English: sate you according to your wish o indravaruṇa with wealth  fain would we have you nearest us

Sanskrit: yu̱vāku̱ hi śacī̍nāṁ yu̱vāku̍ sumatī̱nām   bhū̱yāma̍ vāja̱dāvnā̍m
English: may we be sharers of the powers sharers of the benevolence  of you who give strength bounteously

Sanskrit: indra̍ḥ sahasra̱dāvnā̱ṁ varu̍ṇa̱ḥ śaṁsyā̍nām   kratu̍r bhavaty u̱kthya̍ḥ
English: indra and varuṇa among givers of thousands meet for praise  are powers who merit highest laud

Sanskrit: tayo̱r id ava̍sā va̱yaṁ sa̱nema̱ ni ca̍ dhīmahi   syād u̱ta pra̱reca̍nam
English: through their protection may we gain great store of wealth and heap it up  enough and still to spare be ours

Sanskrit: indrā̍varuṇa vām a̱haṁ hu̱ve ci̱trāya̱ rādha̍se   a̱smān su ji̱gyuṣa̍s kṛtam
English: o indravaruṇa on you for wealth in many a form i call  still keep ye us victorious

Sanskrit: indrā̍varuṇa̱ nū nu vā̱ṁ siṣā̍santīṣu dhī̱ṣv ā   a̱smabhya̱ṁ śarma̍ yacchatam
English: o indravaruṇa through our songs that seek to win you to ourselves  give us at once your sheltering help

Sanskrit: pra vā̍m aśnotu suṣṭu̱tir indrā̍varuṇa̱ yāṁ hu̱ve   yām ṛ̱dhāthe̍ sa̱dhastu̍tim
English: o indravaruṇa to you may fair praise which i offer come  joint eulogy which ye dignify

Sanskrit: aibhi̍r agne̱ duvo̱ giro̱ viśve̍bhi̱ḥ soma̍pītaye   de̱vebhi̍r yāhi̱ yakṣi̍ ca
English: to drink the soma agni come to our service and our songs  with all these gods; and worship them

Sanskrit: ā tvā̱ kaṇvā̍ ahūṣata gṛ̱ṇanti̍ vipra te̱ dhiya̍ḥ   de̱vebhi̍r agna̱ ā ga̍hi
English: the kaṇvas have invoked thee; they o singer sing thee songs of praise  agni come hither with the gods;

English: indra vāyu bṛhaspati mitra agni pūṣan bhaga  ādityas and the marut host

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ bhriyanta̱ inda̍vo matsa̱rā mā̍dayi̱ṣṇava̍ḥ   dra̱psā madhva̍ś camū̱ṣada̍ḥ

Sanskrit: īḻa̍te̱ tvām a̍va̱syava̱ḥ kaṇvā̍so vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣaḥ   ha̱viṣma̍nto ara̱ṁkṛta̍ḥ
English: the sons of kaṇva fain for help adore thee having strewn the grass  with offerings and all things prepared

Sanskrit: ghṛ̱tapṛ̍ṣṭhā mano̱yujo̱ ye tvā̱ vaha̍nti̱ vahna̍yaḥ   ā de̱vān soma̍pītaye
English: let the swift steeds who carry thee thoughtyoked and dropping holy oil  bring the gods to the soma draught

Sanskrit: tān yaja̍trām̐ ṛtā̱vṛdho 'gne̱ patnī̍vatas kṛdhi   madhva̍ḥ sujihva pāyaya

Sanskrit: ye yaja̍trā̱ ya īḍyā̱s te te̍ pibantu ji̱hvayā̍   madho̍r agne̱ vaṣa̍ṭkṛti
English: let them o agni who deserve worship and praise drink with thy tongue  the meath in solemn sacrifice

Sanskrit: ākī̱ṁ sūrya̍sya roca̱nād viśvā̍n de̱vām̐ u̍ṣa̱rbudha̍ḥ   vipro̱ hote̱ha va̍kṣati
English: away from the sun's realm of light the wise invoking priest shall bring  all gods awaking with the dawn

English: with all the gods with indra with vāyu and mitra's splendours drink  agni the pleasant soma juice

English: ordained by manu as our priest thou sittest agni at each rite  hallow thou this our sacrifice

Sanskrit: yu̱kṣvā hy aru̍ṣī̱ rathe̍ ha̱rito̍ deva ro̱hita̍ḥ   tābhi̍r de̱vām̐ i̱hā va̍ha

English: dear narāśaṁsa sweet of tongue the giver of oblations i  invoke to this our sacrifice

English: strew o ye wise the sacred grass that drips with oil in order due  where the immortal is beheld

English: thrown open be the doors divine unfailing that assist the rite  for sacrifice this day and now

Sanskrit: nakto̱ṣāsā̍ su̱peśa̍sā̱smin ya̱jña upa̍ hvaye   i̱daṁ no̍ ba̱rhir ā̱sade̍
English: i call the lovely night and dawn to seat them on the holy grass  at this our solemn sacrifice

English: iḷā sarasvatī mahī three goddesses who bring delight  be seated peaceful on the grass

English: tvaṣṭar i call the earliest born the wearer of all forms at will  may he be ours and ours alone

Sanskrit: ava̍ sṛjā vanaspate̱ deva̍ de̱vebhyo̍ ha̱viḥ   pra dā̱tur a̍stu̱ ceta̍nam
English: god sovran of the wood present this our oblation to the gods  and let the giver be renowned

Sanskrit: svāhā̍ ya̱jñaṁ kṛ̍ṇota̱nendrā̍ya̱ yajva̍no gṛ̱he   tatra̍ de̱vām̐ upa̍ hvaye
English: with svāhā pay the sacrifice to indra in the offerer's house  thither i call the deities

Sanskrit: indrehi̱ matsy andha̍so̱ viśve̍bhiḥ soma̱parva̍bhiḥ   ma̱hām̐ a̍bhi̱ṣṭir oja̍sā  0a tasmā̱d aśvā̍ ajāyanta̱ ye ke co̍bha̱yāda̍taḥ  0c gāvo̍ ha jajñire̱ tasmā̱t tasmā̍j jā̱tā a̍jā̱vaya̍ḥ  1a yat puru̍ṣa̱ṁ vy ada̍dhuḥ kati̱dhā vy a̍kalpayan  1c mukha̱ṁ kim a̍sya̱ kau bā̱hū kā ū̱rū pādā̍ ucyete  2a brā̱hma̱ṇo̍ 'sya̱ mukha̍m āsīd bā̱hū rā̍ja̱nya̍ḥ kṛ̱taḥ  2c ū̱rū tad a̍sya̱ yad vaiśya̍ḥ pa̱dbhyāṁ śū̱dro a̍jāyata  3a ca̱ndramā̱ mana̍so jā̱taś cakṣo̱ḥ sūryo̍ ajāyata  3c mukhā̱d indra̍ś cā̱gniś ca̍ prā̱ṇād vā̱yur a̍jāyata  4a nābhyā̍ āsīd a̱ntari̍kṣaṁ śī̱rṣṇo dyauḥ sam a̍vartata  4c pa̱dbhyām bhūmi̱r diśa̱ḥ śrotrā̱t tathā̍ lo̱kām̐ a̍kalpayan  5a sa̱ptāsyā̍san pari̱dhaya̱s triḥ sa̱pta sa̱midha̍ḥ kṛ̱tāḥ  5c de̱vā yad ya̱jñaṁ ta̍nvā̱nā aba̍dhna̱n puru̍ṣam pa̱śum  6a ya̱jñena̍ ya̱jñam a̍yajanta de̱vās tāni̱ dharmā̍ṇi pratha̱māny ā̍san  6c te ha̱ nāka̍m mahi̱māna̍ḥ sacanta̱ yatra̱ pūrve̍ sā̱dhyāḥ santi̍ de̱vāḥ
English: come indra and delight thee with the juice at all the soma feasts  protector mighty in thy strength

Sanskrit: em e̍naṁ sṛjatā su̱te ma̱ndim indrā̍ya ma̱ndine̍   cakri̱ṁ viśvā̍ni̱ cakra̍ye
English: to indra pour ye forth the juice the active gladdening juice to him  the gladdening omnific god

Sanskrit: matsvā̍ suśipra ma̱ndibhi̱ḥ stome̍bhir viśvacarṣaṇe   sacai̱ṣu sava̍ne̱ṣv ā
English: o lord of all men fair of cheek rejoice thee in the gladdening lauds  present at these drinkofferings

Sanskrit: asṛ̍gram indra te̱ gira̱ḥ prati̱ tvām ud a̍hāsata   ajo̍ṣā vṛṣa̱bham pati̍m
English: songs have outpoured themselves to thee indra the strong the guardian lord  and raised themselves unsatisfied

Sanskrit: saṁ co̍daya ci̱tram a̱rvāg rādha̍ indra̱ vare̍ṇyam   asa̱d it te̍ vi̱bhu pra̱bhu
English: send to us bounty manifold o indra worthy of our wish  for power supreme is only thine

Sanskrit: a̱smān su tatra̍ coda̱yendra̍ rā̱ye rabha̍svataḥ   tuvi̍dyumna̱ yaśa̍svataḥ
English: o indra stimulate thereto us emulously fain for wealth  and glorious o most splendid one

Sanskrit: saṁ goma̍d indra̱ vāja̍vad a̱sme pṛ̱thu śravo̍ bṛ̱hat   vi̱śvāyu̍r dhe̱hy akṣi̍tam
English: give indra wide and lofty fame wealthy in cattle and in strength  lasting our lifetime failing not

Sanskrit: a̱sme dhe̍hi̱ śravo̍ bṛ̱had dyu̱mnaṁ sa̍hasra̱sāta̍mam   indra̱ tā ra̱thinī̱r iṣa̍ḥ
English: grant us high fame o indra grant riches bestowing thousands those  fair fruits of earth borne home in wains

Sanskrit: vaso̱r indra̱ṁ vasu̍patiṁ gī̱rbhir gṛ̱ṇanta̍ ṛ̱gmiya̍m   homa̱ gantā̍ram ū̱taye̍
English: praising with songs the praiseworthy who cometh to our aid we call  indra the treasurelord of wealth

Sanskrit: su̱tesu̍te̱ nyo̍kase bṛ̱had bṛ̍ha̱ta ed a̱riḥ   indrā̍ya śū̱ṣam a̍rcati  1a saṁ jā̍gṛ̱vadbhi̱r jara̍māṇa idhyate̱ dame̱ damū̍nā i̱ṣaya̍nn i̱ḻas pa̱de  1c viśva̍sya̱ hotā̍ ha̱viṣo̱ vare̍ṇyo vi̱bhur vi̱bhāvā̍ su̱ṣakhā̍ sakhīya̱te  2a sa da̍rśata̱śrīr ati̍thir gṛ̱hegṛ̍he̱ vane̍vane śiśriye takva̱vīr i̍va  2c jana̍ṁjana̱ṁ janyo̱ nāti̍ manyate̱ viśa̱ ā kṣe̍ti vi̱śyo̱3̱̍ viśa̍ṁviśam  3a su̱dakṣo̱ dakṣai̱ḥ kratu̍nāsi su̱kratu̱r agne̍ ka̱viḥ kāvye̍nāsi viśva̱vit  3c vasu̱r vasū̍nāṁ kṣayasi̱ tvam eka̱ id dyāvā̍ ca̱ yāni̍ pṛthi̱vī ca̱ puṣya̍taḥ  4a pra̱jā̱nann a̍gne̱ tava̱ yoni̍m ṛ̱tviya̱m iḻā̍yās pa̱de ghṛ̱tava̍nta̱m āsa̍daḥ  4c ā te̍ cikitra u̱ṣasā̍m i̱veta̍yo 're̱pasa̱ḥ sūrya̍syeva ra̱śmaya̍ḥ  5a tava̱ śriyo̍ va̱rṣya̍syeva vi̱dyuta̍ś ci̱trāś ci̍kitra u̱ṣasā̱ṁ na ke̱tava̍ḥ  5c yad oṣa̍dhīr a̱bhisṛ̍ṣṭo̱ vanā̍ni ca̱ pari̍ sva̱yaṁ ci̍nu̱ṣe anna̍m ā̱sye̍  6a tam oṣa̍dhīr dadhire̱ garbha̍m ṛ̱tviya̱ṁ tam āpo̍ a̱gniṁ ja̍nayanta mā̱tara̍ḥ  6c tam it sa̍mā̱naṁ va̱nina̍ś ca vī̱rudho̱ 'ntarva̍tīś ca̱ suva̍te ca vi̱śvahā̍  7a vāto̍padhūta iṣi̱to vaśā̱m̐ anu̍ tṛ̱ṣu yad annā̱ vevi̍ṣad vi̱tiṣṭha̍se  7c ā te̍ yatante ra̱thyo̱3̱̍ yathā̱ pṛtha̱k chardhā̍ṁsy agne a̱jarā̍ṇi̱ dhakṣa̍taḥ  8a me̱dhā̱kā̱raṁ vi̱datha̍sya pra̱sādha̍nam a̱gniṁ hotā̍ram pari̱bhūta̍mam ma̱tim  8c tam id arbhe̍ ha̱viṣy ā sa̍mā̱nam it tam in ma̱he vṛ̍ṇate̱ nānyaṁ tvat  9a tvām id atra̍ vṛṇate tvā̱yavo̱ hotā̍ram agne vi̱dathe̍ṣu ve̱dhasa̍ḥ  9c yad de̍va̱yanto̱ dadha̍ti̱ prayā̍ṁsi te ha̱viṣma̍nto̱ mana̍vo vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣaḥ
English: to lofty indra dweller by each libation the pious man  sings forth aloud a strengthening hymn

Sanskrit: endra̍ sāna̱siṁ ra̱yiṁ sa̱jitvā̍naṁ sadā̱saha̍m   varṣi̍ṣṭham ū̱taye̍ bhara
English: indra bring wealth that gives delight the victor's everconquering wealth  most excellent to be our aid;

Sanskrit: ni yena̍ muṣṭiha̱tyayā̱ ni vṛ̱trā ru̱ṇadhā̍mahai   tvotā̍so̱ ny arva̍tā
English: by means of which we may repel our foes in battle hand to hand  by thee assisted with the car

Sanskrit: indra̱ tvotā̍sa̱ ā va̱yaṁ vajra̍ṁ gha̱nā da̍dīmahi   jaye̍ma̱ saṁ yu̱dhi spṛdha̍ḥ
English: aided by thee the thunderarmed indra may we lift up the bolt  and conquer all our foes in fight

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ śūre̍bhi̱r astṛ̍bhi̱r indra̱ tvayā̍ yu̱jā va̱yam   sā̱sa̱hyāma̍ pṛtanya̱taḥ
English: with thee o india for ally with missiledarting heroes may  we conquer our embattled foes

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ indra̍ḥ pa̱raś ca̱ nu ma̍hi̱tvam a̍stu va̱jriṇe̍   dyaur na pra̍thi̱nā śava̍ḥ
English: mighty is indra yea supreme; greatness be his the thunderer  wide as the heaven extends his power

Sanskrit: sa̱mo̱he vā̱ ya āśa̍ta̱ nara̍s to̱kasya̱ sani̍tau   viprā̍so vā dhiyā̱yava̍ḥ
English: which aideth those to win them sons who come as heroes to the fight  or singers loving holy thoughts

Sanskrit: yaḥ ku̱kṣiḥ so̍ma̱pāta̍maḥ samu̱dra i̍va̱ pinva̍te   u̱rvīr āpo̱ na kā̱kuda̍ḥ
English: his belly drinking deepest draughts of soma like an ocean swells  like wide streams from the cope of heaven

Sanskrit: e̱vā hy a̍sya sū̱nṛtā̍ vira̱pśī goma̍tī ma̱hī   pa̱kvā śākhā̱ na dā̱śuṣe̍
English: so also is his excellence great vigorous rich in cattle like  a ripe branch to the worshipper

Sanskrit: e̱vā hi te̱ vibhū̍taya ū̱taya̍ indra̱ māva̍te   sa̱dyaś ci̱t santi̍ dā̱śuṣe̍
English: for verily thy mighty powers indra are saving helps at once  unto a worshipper like me

Sanskrit: e̱vā hy a̍sya̱ kāmyā̱ stoma̍ u̱kthaṁ ca̱ śaṁsyā̍   indrā̍ya̱ soma̍pītaye  1a ya i̱mā viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ juhva̱d ṛṣi̱r hotā̱ ny asī̍dat pi̱tā na̍ḥ  1c sa ā̱śiṣā̱ dravi̍ṇam i̱cchamā̍naḥ prathama̱cchad ava̍rā̱m̐ ā vi̍veśa  2a kiṁ svi̍d āsīd adhi̱ṣṭhāna̍m ā̱rambha̍ṇaṁ kata̱mat svi̍t ka̱thāsī̍t  2c yato̱ bhūmi̍ṁ ja̱naya̍n vi̱śvaka̍rmā̱ vi dyām aurṇo̍n mahi̱nā vi̱śvaca̍kṣāḥ  3a vi̱śvata̍ścakṣur u̱ta vi̱śvato̍mukho vi̱śvato̍bāhur u̱ta vi̱śvata̍spāt  3c sam bā̱hubhyā̱ṁ dhama̍ti̱ sam pata̍trai̱r dyāvā̱bhūmī̍ ja̱naya̍n de̱va eka̍ḥ  4a kiṁ svi̱d vana̱ṁ ka u̱ sa vṛ̱kṣa ā̍sa̱ yato̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī ni̍ṣṭata̱kṣuḥ  4c manī̍ṣiṇo̱ mana̍sā pṛ̱cchated u̱ tad yad a̱dhyati̍ṣṭha̱d bhuva̍nāni dhā̱raya̍n  5a yā te̱ dhāmā̍ni para̱māṇi̱ yāva̱mā yā ma̍dhya̱mā vi̍śvakarmann u̱temā  5c śikṣā̱ sakhi̍bhyo ha̱viṣi̍ svadhāvaḥ sva̱yaṁ ya̍jasva ta̱nva̍ṁ vṛdhā̱naḥ  6a viśva̍karman ha̱viṣā̍ vāvṛdhā̱naḥ sva̱yaṁ ya̍jasva pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām  6c muhya̍ntv a̱nye a̱bhito̱ janā̍sa i̱hāsmāka̍m ma̱ghavā̍ sū̱rir a̍stu  7a vā̱cas pati̍ṁ vi̱śvaka̍rmāṇam ū̱taye̍ mano̱juva̱ṁ vāje̍ a̱dyā hu̍vema  7c sa no̱ viśvā̍ni̱ hava̍nāni joṣad vi̱śvaśa̍mbhū̱r ava̍se sā̱dhuka̍rmā
English: so are his lovely gifts; let lauds and praises be to indra sung  that he may drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: indra̱m id gā̱thino̍ bṛ̱had indra̍m a̱rkebhi̍r a̱rkiṇa̍ḥ   indra̱ṁ vāṇī̍r anūṣata  0a vana̍spate raśa̱nayā̍ ni̱yūyā̍ de̱vānā̱m pātha̱ upa̍ vakṣi vi̱dvān  0c svadā̍ti de̱vaḥ kṛ̱ṇava̍d dha̱vīṁṣy ava̍tā̱ṁ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī hava̍m me  1a āgne̍ vaha̱ varu̍ṇam i̱ṣṭaye̍ na̱ indra̍ṁ di̱vo ma̱ruto̍ a̱ntari̍kṣāt  1c sīda̍ntu ba̱rhir viśva̱ ā yaja̍trā̱ḥ svāhā̍ de̱vā a̱mṛtā̍ mādayantām
English: indra the singers with high praise indra reciters with their lauds  indra the choirs have glorified

Sanskrit: indra̱ id dharyo̱ḥ sacā̱ sammi̍śla̱ ā va̍co̱yujā̍   indro̍ va̱jrī hi̍ra̱ṇyaya̍ḥ
English: indra hath ever close to him his two bay steeds and wordyoked car  indra the golden thunderarmed

Sanskrit: indro̍ dī̱rghāya̱ cakṣa̍sa̱ ā sūrya̍ṁ rohayad di̱vi   vi gobhi̱r adri̍m airayat
English: indra hath raised the sun on high in heaven that he may see afar  he burst the mountain for the kine

Sanskrit: indra̱ vāje̍ṣu no 'va sa̱hasra̍pradhaneṣu ca   u̱gra u̱grābhi̍r ū̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: help us o indra in the frays yea frays where thousand spoils are gained  with awful aids o awful one

Sanskrit: indra̍ṁ va̱yam ma̍hādha̱na indra̱m arbhe̍ havāmahe   yuja̍ṁ vṛ̱treṣu̍ va̱jriṇa̍m
English: in mighty battle we invoke indra indra in lesser fight  the friend who bends his bolt at fiends

Sanskrit: sa no̍ vṛṣann a̱muṁ ca̱ruṁ satrā̍dāva̱nn apā̍ vṛdhi   a̱smabhya̱m apra̍tiṣkutaḥ
English: unclose our manly hero thou for ever bounteous yonder cloud  for us thou irresistible

Sanskrit: tu̱ñjetu̍ñje̱ ya utta̍re̱ stomā̱ indra̍sya va̱jriṇa̍ḥ   na vi̍ndhe asya suṣṭu̱tim
English: still higher at each strain of mine thunderarmed indra's praises rise  i find no laud worthy of him

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̍ yū̱theva̱ vaṁsa̍gaḥ kṛ̱ṣṭīr i̍ya̱rty oja̍sā   īśā̍no̱ apra̍tiṣkutaḥ
English: even as the bull drives on the herds he drives the people with his might  the ruler irresistible

Sanskrit: ya eka̍ś carṣaṇī̱nāṁ vasū̍nām ira̱jyati̍   indra̱ḥ pañca̍ kṣitī̱nām
English: indra who rules with single sway men riches and the fivefold race  of those who dwell upon the earth

Sanskrit: indra̍ṁ vo vi̱śvata̱s pari̱ havā̍mahe̱ jane̍bhyaḥ   a̱smāka̍m astu̱ keva̍laḥ  1a bṛha̍spate pratha̱maṁ vā̱co agra̱ṁ yat praira̍ta nāma̱dheya̱ṁ dadhā̍nāḥ  1c yad e̍ṣā̱ṁ śreṣṭha̱ṁ yad a̍ri̱pram āsī̍t pre̱ṇā tad e̍ṣā̱ṁ nihi̍ta̱ṁ guhā̱viḥ  2a saktu̍m iva̱ tita̍ünā pu̱nanto̱ yatra̱ dhīrā̱ mana̍sā̱ vāca̱m akra̍ta  2c atrā̱ sakhā̍yaḥ sa̱khyāni̍ jānate bha̱draiṣā̍ṁ la̱kṣmīr nihi̱tādhi̍ vā̱ci  3a ya̱jñena̍ vā̱caḥ pa̍da̱vīya̍m āya̱n tām anv a̍vinda̱nn ṛṣi̍ṣu̱ pravi̍ṣṭām  3c tām ā̱bhṛtyā̱ vy a̍dadhuḥ puru̱trā tāṁ sa̱pta re̱bhā a̱bhi saṁ na̍vante  4a u̱ta tva̱ḥ paśya̱n na da̍darśa̱ vāca̍m u̱ta tva̍ḥ śṛ̱ṇvan na śṛ̍ṇoty enām  4c u̱to tva̍smai ta̱nva1̱̍ṁ vi sa̍sre jā̱yeva̱ patya̍ uśa̱tī su̱vāsā̍ḥ  5a u̱ta tva̍ṁ sa̱khye sthi̱rapī̍tam āhu̱r naina̍ṁ hinva̱nty api̱ vāji̍neṣu  5c adhe̍nvā carati mā̱yayai̱ṣa vāca̍ṁ śuśru̱vām̐ a̍pha̱lām a̍pu̱ṣpām  6a yas ti̱tyāja̍ saci̱vida̱ṁ sakhā̍ya̱ṁ na tasya̍ vā̱cy api̍ bhā̱go a̍sti  6c yad ī̍ṁ śṛ̱ṇoty ala̍kaṁ śṛṇoti na̱hi pra̱veda̍ sukṛ̱tasya̱ panthā̍m  7a a̱kṣa̱ṇvanta̱ḥ karṇa̍vanta̱ḥ sakhā̍yo manoja̱veṣv asa̍mā babhūvuḥ  7c ā̱da̱ghnāsa̍ upaka̱kṣāsa̍ u tve hra̱dā i̍va̱ snātvā̍ u tve dadṛśre  8a hṛ̱dā ta̱ṣṭeṣu̱ mana̍so ja̱veṣu̱ yad brā̍hma̱ṇāḥ sa̱ṁyaja̍nte̱ sakhā̍yaḥ  8c atrāha̍ tva̱ṁ vi ja̍hur ve̱dyābhi̱r oha̍brahmāṇo̱ vi ca̍ranty u tve  9a i̱me ye nārvāṅ na pa̱raś cara̍nti̱ na brā̍hma̱ṇāso̱ na su̱teka̍rāsaḥ  9c ta e̱te vāca̍m abhi̱padya̍ pā̱payā̍ si̱rīs tantra̍ṁ tanvate̱ apra̍jajñayaḥ
English: for your sake from each side we call indra away from other men  ours and none others may he be

Sanskrit: yu̱ñjanti̍ bra̱dhnam a̍ru̱ṣaṁ cara̍nta̱m pari̍ ta̱sthuṣa̍ḥ   roca̍nte roca̱nā di̱vi  0a ya̱mād a̱haṁ vai̍vasva̱tāt su̱bandho̱r mana̱ ābha̍ram  0c jī̱vāta̍ve̱ na mṛ̱tyave 'tho̍ ari̱ṣṭatā̍taye  1a nya1̱̍g vāto 'va̍ vāti̱ nya̍k tapati̱ sūrya̍ḥ  1c nī̱cīna̍m a̱ghnyā du̍he̱ nya̍g bhavatu te̱ rapa̍ḥ  2a a̱yam me̱ hasto̱ bhaga̍vān a̱yam me̱ bhaga̍vattaraḥ  2c a̱yam me̍ vi̱śvabhe̍ṣajo̱ 'yaṁ śi̱vābhi̍marśanaḥ
English: they who stand round him as he moves harness the bright the ruddy steed  the lights are shining in the sky

Sanskrit: yu̱ñjanty a̍sya̱ kāmyā̱ harī̱ vipa̍kṣasā̱ rathe̍   śoṇā̍ dhṛ̱ṣṇū nṛ̱vāha̍sā
English: on both sides to the car they yoke the two bay coursers dear to him  bold tawny bearers of the chief

Sanskrit: ke̱tuṁ kṛ̱ṇvann a̍ke̱tave̱ peśo̍ maryā ape̱śase̍   sam u̱ṣadbhi̍r ajāyathāḥ
English: thou making light where no light was and form o men where form was not  wast born together with the dawns

Sanskrit: ād aha̍ sva̱dhām anu̱ puna̍r garbha̱tvam e̍ri̱re   dadhā̍nā̱ nāma̍ ya̱jñiya̍m
English: thereafter they as is their wont threw off the state of babes unborn  assuming sacrificial names

Sanskrit: vī̱ḻu ci̍d āruja̱tnubhi̱r guhā̍ cid indra̱ vahni̍bhiḥ   avi̍nda u̱sriyā̱ anu̍
English: thou indra with the tempestgods the breakers down of what is firm  foundest the kine even in the cave

Sanskrit: de̱va̱yanto̱ yathā̍ ma̱tim acchā̍ vi̱dadva̍su̱ṁ gira̍ḥ   ma̱hām a̍nūṣata śru̱tam
English: worshipping even as they list singers laud him who findeth wealth  the farrenowned the mighty one

Sanskrit: indre̍ṇa̱ saṁ hi dṛkṣa̍se saṁjagmā̱no abi̍bhyuṣā   ma̱ndū sa̍mā̱nava̍rcasā
English: mayest thou verily be seen coming by fearless indra's side  both joyous equal in your sheen

Sanskrit: a̱na̱va̱dyair a̱bhidyu̍bhir ma̱khaḥ saha̍svad arcati   ga̱ṇair indra̍sya̱ kāmyai̍ḥ
English: with indra's well beloved hosts the blameless hastening to heaven  the sacrificer cries aloud

Sanskrit: ata̍ḥ parijma̱nn ā ga̍hi di̱vo vā̍ roca̱nād adhi̍   sam a̍sminn ṛñjate̱ gira̍ḥ
English: come from this place o wanderer or downward from the light of heaven  our songs of praise all yearn for this

Sanskrit: i̱to vā̍ sā̱tim īma̍he di̱vo vā̱ pārthi̍vā̱d adhi̍   indra̍m ma̱ho vā̱ raja̍saḥ  1a i̱dam i̱tthā raudra̍ṁ gū̱rtava̍cā̱ brahma̱ kratvā̱ śacyā̍m a̱ntar ā̱jau  1c krā̱ṇā yad a̍sya pi̱tarā̍ maṁhane̱ṣṭhāḥ parṣa̍t pa̱kthe aha̱nn ā sa̱pta hotṝ̍n  2a sa id dā̱nāya̱ dabhyā̍ya va̱nvañ cyavā̍na̱ḥ sūdai̍r amimīta̱ vedi̍m  2c tūrva̍yāṇo gū̱rtava̍castama̱ḥ kṣodo̱ na reta̍ i̱taū̍ti siñcat  3a mano̱ na yeṣu̱ hava̍neṣu ti̱gmaṁ vipa̱ḥ śacyā̍ vanu̱tho drava̍ntā  3c ā yaḥ śaryā̍bhis tuvinṛ̱mṇo a̱syāśrī̍ṇītā̱diśa̱ṁ gabha̍stau  4a kṛ̱ṣṇā yad goṣv a̍ru̱ṇīṣu̱ sīda̍d di̱vo napā̍tāśvinā huve vām  4c vī̱tam me̍ ya̱jñam ā ga̍tam me̱ anna̍ṁ vava̱nvāṁsā̱ neṣa̱m asmṛ̍tadhrū  5a prathi̍ṣṭa̱ yasya̍ vī̱raka̍rmam i̱ṣṇad anu̍ṣṭhita̱ṁ nu naryo̱ apau̍hat  5c puna̱s tad ā vṛ̍hati̱ yat ka̱nāyā̍ duhi̱tur ā anu̍bhṛtam ana̱rvā  6a ma̱dhyā yat kartva̱m abha̍vad a̱bhīke̱ kāma̍ṁ kṛṇvā̱ne pi̱tari̍ yuva̱tyām  6c ma̱nā̱nag reto̍ jahatur vi̱yantā̱ sānau̱ niṣi̍ktaṁ sukṛ̱tasya̱ yonau̍  7a pi̱tā yat svāṁ du̍hi̱tara̍m adhi̱ṣkan kṣma̱yā reta̍ḥ saṁjagmā̱no ni ṣi̍ñcat  7c svā̱dhyo̍ 'janaya̱n brahma̍ de̱vā vāsto̱ṣ pati̍ṁ vrata̱pāṁ nir a̍takṣan  8a sa ī̱ṁ vṛṣā̱ na phena̍m asyad ā̱jau smad ā parai̱d apa̍ da̱bhrace̍tāḥ  8c sara̍t pa̱dā na dakṣi̍ṇā parā̱vṛṅ na tā nu me̍ pṛśa̱nyo̍ jagṛbhre  9a ma̱kṣū na vahni̍ḥ pra̱jāyā̍ upa̱bdir a̱gniṁ na na̱gna upa̍ sīda̱d ūdha̍ḥ  9c sani̍te̱dhmaṁ sani̍to̱ta vāja̱ṁ sa dha̱rtā ja̍jñe̱ saha̍sā yavī̱yut
English: indra we seek to give us help from here from heaven above the earth  or from the spacious firmament

Sanskrit: ā tv etā̱ ni ṣī̍da̱tendra̍m a̱bhi pra gā̍yata   sakhā̍ya̱ḥ stoma̍vāhasaḥ
English: o come ye hither sit ye down to indra sing ye forth your song  companions bringing hymns of praise

Sanskrit: pu̱rū̱tama̍m purū̱ṇām īśā̍na̱ṁ vāryā̍ṇām   indra̱ṁ some̱ sacā̍ su̱te
English: to him the richest of the rich the lord of treasures excellent  indra with soma juice outpoured

Sanskrit: sa ghā̍ no̱ yoga̱ ā bhu̍va̱t sa rā̱ye sa pura̍ṁdhyām   gama̱d vāje̍bhi̱r ā sa na̍ḥ
English: may he stand by us in our need and in abundance for our wealth  may he come nigh us with his strength

Sanskrit: yasya̍ sa̱ṁsthe na vṛ̱ṇvate̱ harī̍ sa̱matsu̱ śatra̍vaḥ   tasmā̱ indrā̍ya gāyata
English: whose pair of tawny horses yoked in battles foemen challenge not  to him to indra sing your song

Sanskrit: su̱ta̱pāvne̍ su̱tā i̱me śuca̍yo yanti vī̱taye̍   somā̍so̱ dadhyā̍śiraḥ
English: nigh to the somadrinker come for his enjoyment these pure drops  the somas mingled with the curd

Sanskrit: tvaṁ su̱tasya̍ pī̱taye̍ sa̱dyo vṛ̱ddho a̍jāyathāḥ   indra̱ jyaiṣṭhyā̍ya sukrato
English: thou grown at once to perfect strength wast born to drink the soma juice  strong indra for preëminence

Sanskrit: ā tvā̍ viśantv ā̱śava̱ḥ somā̍sa indra girvaṇaḥ   śaṁ te̍ santu̱ prace̍tase
English: o indra lover of the song may these quick somas enter thee  may they bring bliss to thee the sage

Sanskrit: tvāṁ stomā̍ avīvṛdha̱n tvām u̱kthā śa̍takrato   tvāṁ va̍rdhantu no̱ gira̍ḥ
English: our chants of praise have strengthened thee o śatakratu and our lauds  so strengthen thee the songs we sing

Sanskrit: akṣi̍totiḥ saned i̱maṁ vāja̱m indra̍ḥ saha̱sriṇa̍m   yasmi̱n viśvā̍ni̱ pauṁsyā̍
English: indra whose succour never fails accept these viands thousandfold  wherein all manly powers abide

Sanskrit: mā no̱ martā̍ a̱bhi dru̍han ta̱nūnā̍m indra girvaṇaḥ   īśā̍no yavayā va̱dham  1a ma̱hat tad ulba̱ṁ sthavi̍ra̱ṁ tad ā̍sī̱d yenāvi̍ṣṭitaḥ pravi̱veśi̍thā̱paḥ  1c viśvā̍ apaśyad bahu̱dhā te̍ agne̱ jāta̍vedas ta̱nvo̍ de̱va eka̍ḥ  2a ko mā̍ dadarśa kata̱maḥ sa de̱vo yo me̍ ta̱nvo̍ bahu̱dhā pa̱ryapa̍śyat  2c kvāha̍ mitrāvaruṇā kṣiyanty a̱gner viśvā̍ḥ sa̱midho̍ deva̱yānī̍ḥ  3a aicchā̍ma tvā bahu̱dhā jā̍taveda̱ḥ pravi̍ṣṭam agne a̱psv oṣa̍dhīṣu  3c taṁ tvā̍ ya̱mo a̍cikec citrabhāno daśāntaru̱ṣyād a̍ti̱roca̍mānam  4a ho̱trād a̱haṁ va̍ruṇa̱ bibhya̍d āya̱ṁ ned e̱va mā̍ yu̱naja̱nn atra̍ de̱vāḥ  4c tasya̍ me ta̱nvo̍ bahu̱dhā nivi̍ṣṭā e̱tam artha̱ṁ na ci̍ketā̱ham a̱gniḥ  5a ehi̱ manu̍r deva̱yur ya̱jñakā̍mo 'ra̱ṁkṛtyā̱ tama̍si kṣeṣy agne  5c su̱gān pa̱thaḥ kṛ̍ṇuhi deva̱yānā̱n vaha̍ ha̱vyāni̍ sumana̱syamā̍naḥ  6a a̱gneḥ pūrve̱ bhrāta̍ro̱ artha̍m e̱taṁ ra̱thīvādhvā̍na̱m anv āva̍rīvuḥ  6c tasmā̍d bhi̱yā va̍ruṇa dū̱ram ā̍yaṁ gau̱ro na kṣe̱pnor a̍vije̱ jyāyā̍ḥ  7a ku̱rmas ta̱ āyu̍r a̱jara̱ṁ yad a̍gne̱ yathā̍ yu̱kto jā̍tavedo̱ na riṣyā̍ḥ  7c athā̍ vahāsi sumana̱syamā̍no bhā̱gaṁ de̱vebhyo̍ ha̱viṣa̍ḥ sujāta  8a pra̱yā̱jān me̍ anuyā̱jām̐ś ca̱ keva̍lā̱n ūrja̍svantaṁ ha̱viṣo̍ datta bhā̱gam  8c ghṛ̱taṁ cā̱pām puru̍ṣa̱ṁ cauṣa̍dhīnām a̱gneś ca̍ dī̱rgham āyu̍r astu devāḥ  9a tava̍ prayā̱jā a̍nuyā̱jāś ca̱ keva̍la̱ ūrja̍svanto ha̱viṣa̍ḥ santu bhā̱gāḥ  9c tavā̍gne ya̱jño̱3̱̍ 'yam a̍stu̱ sarva̱s tubhya̍ṁ namantām pra̱diśa̱ś cata̍sraḥ
English: o indra thou who lovest song let no man hurt our bodies keep  slaughter far from us for thou canst

Sanskrit: su̱rū̱pa̱kṛ̱tnum ū̱taye̍ su̱dughā̍m iva go̱duhe̍   ju̱hū̱masi̱ dyavi̍dyavi  0a jī̱vaṁ ru̍danti̱ vi ma̍yante adhva̱re dī̱rghām anu̱ prasi̍tiṁ dīdhiyu̱r nara̍ḥ  0c vā̱mam pi̱tṛbhyo̱ ya i̱daṁ sa̍meri̱re maya̱ḥ pati̍bhyo̱ jana̍yaḥ pari̱ṣvaje̍  1a na tasya̍ vidma̱ tad u̱ ṣu pra vo̍cata̱ yuvā̍ ha̱ yad yu̍va̱tyāḥ kṣeti̱ yoni̍ṣu  1c pri̱yosri̍yasya vṛṣa̱bhasya̍ re̱tino̍ gṛ̱haṁ ga̍memāśvinā̱ tad u̍śmasi  2a ā vā̍m agan suma̱tir vā̍jinīvasū̱ ny a̍śvinā hṛ̱tsu kāmā̍ ayaṁsata  2c abhū̍taṁ go̱pā mi̍thu̱nā śu̍bhas patī pri̱yā a̍rya̱mṇo duryā̍m̐ aśīmahi  3a tā ma̍ndasā̱nā manu̍ṣo duro̱ṇa ā dha̱ttaṁ ra̱yiṁ sa̱havī̍raṁ vaca̱syave̍  3c kṛ̱taṁ tī̱rthaṁ su̍prapā̱ṇaṁ śu̍bhas patī sthā̱ṇum pa̍the̱ṣṭhām apa̍ durma̱tiṁ ha̍tam  4a kva̍ svid a̱dya ka̍ta̱māsv a̱śvinā̍ vi̱kṣu da̱srā mā̍dayete śu̱bhas patī̍  4c ka ī̱ṁ ni ye̍me kata̱masya̍ jagmatu̱r vipra̍sya vā̱ yaja̍mānasya vā gṛ̱ham
English: as a good cow to him who milks we call the doer of fair deeds  to our assistance day by day

Sanskrit: upa̍ na̱ḥ sava̱nā ga̍hi̱ soma̍sya somapāḥ piba   go̱dā id re̱vato̱ mada̍ḥ
English: come thou to our libations drink of soma; somadrinker thou!  the rich one's rapture giveth kine

Sanskrit: athā̍ te̱ anta̍mānāṁ vi̱dyāma̍ sumatī̱nām   mā no̱ ati̍ khya̱ ā ga̍hi
English: so may we be acquainted with thine innermost benevolence  neglect us not come hitherward

Sanskrit: pare̍hi̱ vigra̱m astṛ̍ta̱m indra̍m pṛcchā vipa̱ścita̍m   yas te̱ sakhi̍bhya̱ ā vara̍m
English: go to the wise unconquered one ask thou of indra skilled in song  him who is better than thy friends

Sanskrit: u̱ta bru̍vantu no̱ nido̱ nir a̱nyata̍ś cid ārata   dadhā̍nā̱ indra̱ id duva̍ḥ
English: whether the men who mock us say depart unto another place  ye who serve indra and none else;

Sanskrit: u̱ta na̍ḥ su̱bhagā̍m̐ a̱rir vo̱ceyu̍r dasma kṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ   syāmed indra̍sya̱ śarma̍ṇi
English: or whether god of wondrous deeds all our true people call us blest  still may we dwell in indra's care

Sanskrit: em ā̱śum ā̱śave̍ bhara yajña̱śriya̍ṁ nṛ̱māda̍nam   pa̱ta̱yan ma̍nda̱yatsa̍kham
English: unto the swift one bring the swift mancheering grace of sacrifice  that to the friend gives wings and joy

Sanskrit: a̱sya pī̱tvā śa̍takrato gha̱no vṛ̱trāṇā̍m abhavaḥ   prāvo̱ vāje̍ṣu vā̱jina̍m
English: thou śatakratu drankest this and wast the vṛtras slayer; thou  helpest the warrior in the fray

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̱ vāje̍ṣu vā̱jina̍ṁ vā̱jayā̍maḥ śatakrato   dhanā̍nām indra sā̱taye̍
English: we strengthen śatakratu thee yea thee the powerful in fight  that indra we may win us wealth

Sanskrit: yo rā̱yo̱3̱̍ 'vani̍r ma̱hān su̍pā̱raḥ su̍nva̱taḥ sakhā̍   tasmā̱ indrā̍ya gāyata  1a sa̱mā̱nam u̱ tyam pu̍ruhū̱tam u̱kthya1̱̍ṁ ratha̍ṁ trica̱kraṁ sava̍nā̱ gani̍gmatam  1c pari̍jmānaṁ vida̱thya̍ṁ suvṛ̱ktibhi̍r va̱yaṁ vyu̍ṣṭā u̱ṣaso̍ havāmahe  2a prā̱ta̱ryuja̍ṁ nāsa̱tyādhi̍ tiṣṭhathaḥ prāta̱ryāvā̍ṇam madhu̱vāha̍na̱ṁ ratha̍m  2c viśo̱ yena̱ gaccha̍tho̱ yajva̍rīr narā kī̱reś ci̍d ya̱jñaṁ hotṛ̍mantam aśvinā  3a a̱dhva̱ryuṁ vā̱ madhu̍pāṇiṁ su̱hastya̍m a̱gnidha̍ṁ vā dhṛ̱tada̍kṣa̱ṁ damū̍nasam  3c vipra̍sya vā̱ yat sava̍nāni̱ gaccha̱tho 'ta̱ ā yā̍tam madhu̱peya̍m aśvinā
English: to him the mighty stream of wealth prompt friend of him who pours the juice  yea to this indra sing your song

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā̱ yajva̍rī̱r iṣo̱ drava̍tpāṇī̱ śubha̍s patī   puru̍bhujā cana̱syata̍m  0a ā̱varvṛ̍tatī̱r adha̱ nu dvi̱dhārā̍ goṣu̱yudho̱ na ni̍ya̱vaṁ cara̍ntīḥ  0c ṛṣe̱ jani̍trī̱r bhuva̍nasya̱ patnī̍r a̱po va̍ndasva sa̱vṛdha̱ḥ sayo̍nīḥ  1a hi̱notā̍ no adhva̱raṁ de̍vaya̱jyā hi̱nota̱ brahma̍ sa̱naye̱ dhanā̍nām  1c ṛ̱tasya̱ yoge̱ vi ṣya̍dhva̱m ūdha̍ḥ śruṣṭī̱varī̍r bhūtanā̱smabhya̍m āpaḥ  2a āpo̍ revatī̱ḥ kṣaya̍thā̱ hi vasva̱ḥ kratu̍ṁ ca bha̱dram bi̍bhṛ̱thāmṛta̍ṁ ca  2c rā̱yaś ca̱ stha sva̍pa̱tyasya̱ patnī̱ḥ sara̍svatī̱ tad gṛ̍ṇa̱te vayo̍ dhāt  3a prati̱ yad āpo̱ adṛ̍śram āya̱tīr ghṛ̱tam payā̍ṁsi̱ bibhra̍tī̱r madhū̍ni  3c a̱dhva̱ryubhi̱r mana̍sā saṁvidā̱nā indrā̍ya̱ soma̱ṁ suṣu̍ta̱m bhara̍ntīḥ  4a emā a̍gman re̱vatī̍r jī̱vadha̍nyā̱ adhva̍ryavaḥ sā̱daya̍tā sakhāyaḥ  4c ni ba̱rhiṣi̍ dhattana somyāso̱ 'pāṁ naptrā̍ saṁvidā̱nāsa̍ enāḥ  5a āgma̱nn āpa̍ uśa̱tīr ba̱rhir edaṁ ny a̍dhva̱re a̍sadan deva̱yantī̍ḥ  5c adhva̍ryavaḥ sunu̱tendrā̍ya̱ soma̱m abhū̍d u vaḥ su̱śakā̍ devaya̱jyā
English: ye aśvins rich in treasure lords of splendour having nimble hands  accept the sacrificial food

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā̱ puru̍daṁsasā̱ narā̱ śavī̍rayā dhi̱yā   dhiṣṇyā̱ vana̍ta̱ṁ gira̍ḥ
English: ye aśvins rich in wondrous deeds ye heroes worthy of our praise  accept our songs with mighty thought

English: nāsatyas wonderworkers yours are these libations with clipt grass  come ye whose paths are red with flame

Sanskrit: indrā yā̍hi citrabhāno su̱tā i̱me tvā̱yava̍ḥ   aṇvī̍bhi̱s tanā̍ pū̱tāsa̍ḥ
English: o indra marvellously bright come these libations long for thee  thus by fine fingers purified

English: urged by the holy singer sped by song come indra to the prayers  of the libationpouring priest

English: approach o indra hasting thee lord of bay horses to the prayers  in our libation take delight

Sanskrit: omā̍saś carṣaṇīdhṛto̱ viśve̍ devāsa̱ ā ga̍ta   dā̱śvāṁso̍ dā̱śuṣa̍ḥ su̱tam
English: ye viśvedevas who protect reward and cherish men approach  your worshipper's drinkoffering

English: ye viśvedevas swift at work come hither quickly to the draught  as milchkine hasten to their stalls

Sanskrit: viśve̍ de̱vāso̍ a̱sridha̱ ehi̍māyāso a̱druha̍ḥ   medha̍ṁ juṣanta̱ vahna̍yaḥ
English: the viśvedevas changing shape like serpents fearless void of guile  bearers accept the sacred draught

Sanskrit: pā̱va̱kā na̱ḥ sara̍svatī̱ vāje̍bhir vā̱jinī̍vatī   ya̱jñaṁ va̍ṣṭu dhi̱yāva̍suḥ  1a ā no̍ de̱vānā̱m upa̍ vetu̱ śaṁso̱ viśve̍bhis tu̱rair ava̍se̱ yaja̍traḥ  1c tebhi̍r va̱yaṁ su̍ṣa̱khāyo̍ bhavema̱ tara̍nto̱ viśvā̍ duri̱tā syā̍ma  2a pari̍ ci̱n marto̱ dravi̍ṇam mamanyād ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱thā nama̱sā vi̍vāset  2c u̱ta svena̱ kratu̍nā̱ saṁ va̍deta̱ śreyā̍ṁsa̱ṁ dakṣa̱m mana̍sā jagṛbhyāt  3a adhā̍yi dhī̱tir asa̍sṛgra̱m aṁśā̍s tī̱rthe na da̱smam upa̍ ya̱nty ūmā̍ḥ  3c a̱bhy ā̍naśma suvi̱tasya̍ śū̱ṣaṁ nave̍daso a̱mṛtā̍nām abhūma  4a nitya̍ś cākanyā̱t svapa̍ti̱r damū̍nā̱ yasmā̍ u de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā ja̱jāna̍  4c bhago̍ vā̱ gobhi̍r arya̱mem a̍najyā̱t so a̍smai̱ cāru̍ś chadayad u̱ta syā̍t  5a i̱yaṁ sā bhū̍yā u̱ṣasā̍m iva̱ kṣā yad dha̍ kṣu̱manta̱ḥ śava̍sā sa̱māya̍n  5c a̱sya stu̱tiṁ ja̍ri̱tur bhikṣa̍māṇā̱ ā na̍ḥ śa̱gmāsa̱ upa̍ yantu̱ vājā̍ḥ  6a a̱syed e̱ṣā su̍ma̱tiḥ pa̍prathā̱nābha̍vat pū̱rvyā bhūma̍nā̱ gauḥ  6c a̱sya sanī̍ḻā̱ asu̍rasya̱ yonau̍ samā̱na ā bhara̍ṇe̱ bibhra̍māṇāḥ  7a kiṁ svi̱d vana̱ṁ ka u̱ sa vṛ̱kṣa ā̍sa̱ yato̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī ni̍ṣṭata̱kṣuḥ  7c sa̱ṁta̱sthā̱ne a̱jare̍ i̱taū̍tī̱ ahā̍ni pū̱rvīr u̱ṣaso̍ jaranta  8a naitāva̍d e̱nā pa̱ro a̱nyad a̍sty u̱kṣā sa dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī bi̍bharti  8c tvaca̍m pa̱vitra̍ṁ kṛṇuta sva̱dhāvā̱n yad ī̱ṁ sūrya̱ṁ na ha̱rito̱ vaha̍nti  9a ste̱go na kṣām aty e̍ti pṛ̱thvīm miha̱ṁ na vāto̱ vi ha̍ vāti̱ bhūma̍  9c mi̱tro yatra̱ varu̍ṇo a̱jyamā̍no̱ 'gnir vane̱ na vy asṛ̍ṣṭa̱ śoka̍m
English: wealthy in spoil enriched with hymns may bright   desire  with eager love our sacrifice

Sanskrit: co̱da̱yi̱trī sū̱nṛtā̍nā̱ṁ ceta̍ntī sumatī̱nām   ya̱jñaṁ da̍dhe̱ sara̍svatī  0a sta̱rīr yat sūta̍ sa̱dyo a̱jyamā̍nā̱ vyathi̍r avya̱thīḥ kṛ̍ṇuta̱ svago̍pā  0c pu̱tro yat pūrva̍ḥ pi̱tror jani̍ṣṭa śa̱myāṁ gaur ja̍gāra̱ yad dha̍ pṛ̱cchān  1a u̱ta kaṇva̍ṁ nṛ̱ṣada̍ḥ pu̱tram ā̍hur u̱ta śyā̱vo dhana̱m āda̍tta vā̱jī  1c pra kṛ̱ṣṇāya̱ ruśa̍d apinva̱todha̍r ṛ̱tam atra̱ naki̍r asmā apīpet
English: inciter of all pleasant songs inspirer of all gracious thought  sarasvatī accept our rite

Sanskrit: ma̱ho arṇa̱ḥ sara̍svatī̱ pra ce̍tayati ke̱tunā̍   dhiyo̱ viśvā̱ vi rā̍jati
English: sarasvatī the mighty floodshe with her light illuminates  she brightens every pious thought

Sanskrit: kaṅka̍to̱ na kaṅka̱to 'tho̍ satī̱naka̍ṅkataḥ   dvāv iti̱ pluṣī̱ iti̱ ny a1̱̍dṛṣṭā̍ alipsata
English: venomous slightly venomous or venomous aquatic worm  both creatures stinging unobserved with poison have infected me

Sanskrit: a̱dṛṣṭā̍n hanty āya̱ty atho̍ hanti parāya̱tī   atho̍ avaghna̱tī ha̱nty atho̍ pinaṣṭi piṁṣa̱tī
English: coming it kills the unobserved; it kills them as it goes away  it kills them as it drives them off and bruising bruises them to death

Sanskrit: śa̱rāsa̱ḥ kuśa̍rāso da̱rbhāsa̍ḥ sai̱ryā u̱ta   mau̱ñjā a̱dṛṣṭā̍ vairi̱ṇāḥ sarve̍ sā̱kaṁ ny a̍lipsata
English: sara grass darbha kuśara and sairya muñja vīraṇa  where all these creatures dwell unseen with poison have infected me

Sanskrit: ni gāvo̍ go̱ṣṭhe a̍sada̱n ni mṛ̱gāso̍ avikṣata   ni ke̱tavo̱ janā̍nā̱ṁ ny a1̱̍dṛṣṭā̍ alipsata
English: the cows had settled in their stalls the beasts of prey had sought their lairs  extinguished were the lights of men when things unseen infected me

Sanskrit: e̱ta u̱ tye praty a̍dṛśran prado̱ṣaṁ taska̍rā iva   adṛ̍ṣṭā̱ viśva̍dṛṣṭā̱ḥ prati̍buddhā abhūtana
English: or these these reptiles are observed like lurking thieves at evening time  seers of all themselves unseen be therefore very vigilant

Sanskrit: dyaur va̍ḥ pi̱tā pṛ̍thi̱vī mā̱tā somo̱ bhrātādi̍ti̱ḥ svasā̍   adṛ̍ṣṭā̱ viśva̍dṛṣṭā̱s tiṣṭha̍te̱laya̍tā̱ su ka̍m
English: heaven is your sire your mother earth soma your brother aditi  your sister seeing all unseen keep still and dwell ye happily

Sanskrit: ye aṁsyā̱ ye aṅgyā̍ḥ sū̱cīkā̱ ye pra̍kaṅka̱tāḥ   adṛ̍ṣṭā̱ḥ kiṁ ca̱neha va̱ḥ sarve̍ sā̱kaṁ ni ja̍syata
English: biters of shoulder or of limb with needlestings most venomous  unseen whatever ye may be vanish together and be gone

Sanskrit: ut pu̱rastā̱t sūrya̍ eti vi̱śvadṛ̍ṣṭo adṛṣṭa̱hā   a̱dṛṣṭā̱n sarvā̍ñ ja̱mbhaya̱n sarvā̍ś ca yātudhā̱nya̍ḥ
English: slayer of things unseen the sun beheld of all mounts eastward up  consuming all that are not seen and evil spirits of the night

Sanskrit: ud a̍paptad a̱sau sūrya̍ḥ pu̱ru viśvā̍ni̱ jūrva̍n   ā̱di̱tyaḥ parva̍tebhyo vi̱śvadṛ̍ṣṭo adṛṣṭa̱hā
English: there hath the sungod mounted up who scorches much and everything  even the āditya from the hills allseen destroying things unseen

Sanskrit: sūrye̍ vi̱ṣam ā sa̍jāmi̱ dṛti̱ṁ surā̍vato gṛ̱he   so ci̱n nu na ma̍rāti̱ no va̱yam ma̍rāmā̱re a̍sya̱ yoja̍naṁ hari̱ṣṭhā madhu̍ tvā madhu̱lā ca̍kāra
English: i hang the poison in the sun a wineskin in a vintner's house  he will not die nor shall we die his path is far he whom bay horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath

Sanskrit: i̱ya̱tti̱kā śa̍kunti̱kā sa̱kā ja̍ghāsa te vi̱ṣam   so ci̱n nu na ma̍rāti̱ no va̱yam ma̍rāmā̱re a̍sya̱ yoja̍naṁ hari̱ṣṭhā madhu̍ tvā madhu̱lā ca̍kāra
English: this little bird so very small hath swallowed all thy poison up  she will not die nor shall we die his path is far he whom bay horses bear hath turned thee to sweet meath

Sanskrit: tṛ̱ṇa̱ska̱ndasya̱ nu viśa̱ḥ pari̍ vṛṅkta sudānavaḥ   ū̱rdhvān na̍ḥ karta jī̱vase̍
English: o bounteous givers touch ye not o maruts tṛṇskanda's folk;  lift ye us up that we may live

English: maruts to you this laud with prayer and worship formed in the mind and heart ye gods is offered  come ye to us rejoicing in your spirit for ye are they who make our prayer effective

English: the maruts praised by us shall show us favour; maghavan lauded shall be most propitious  maruts may all our days that are to follow be very pleasant lovely and triumphant

English: i fled in   from this mighty indra my body trembling in alarm o maruts  oblations meant for you had been made ready; these have we set aside for this forgive us

Sanskrit: yena̱ mānā̍saś ci̱taya̍nta u̱srā vyu̍ṣṭiṣu̱ śava̍sā̱ śaśva̍tīnām   sa no̍ ma̱rudbhi̍r vṛṣabha̱ śravo̍ dhā u̱gra u̱grebhi̱ḥ sthavi̍raḥ saho̱dāḥ
English: by whom the mānas recognize the daysprings by whose strength at the dawn of endless mornings  give us thou mighty glory with maruts fierce with the fierce the strong who givest triumph

English: do thou o indra guard the conquering heroes and rid thee of thy wrath against the maruts  with them the wise victorious and bestowing may we find strengthening food in full abundance

Sanskrit: na nū̱nam asti̱ no śvaḥ kas tad ve̍da̱ yad adbhu̍tam   a̱nyasya̍ ci̱ttam a̱bhi sa̍ṁca̱reṇya̍m u̱tādhī̍ta̱ṁ vi na̍śyati
English: naught is today tomorrow naught who comprehends the mystery?  we must address ourselves unto another's thought and lost is then the hope we formed

Sanskrit: kiṁ na̍ indra jighāṁsasi̱ bhrāta̍ro ma̱ruta̱s tava̍   tebhi̍ḥ kalpasva sādhu̱yā mā na̍ḥ sa̱mara̍ṇe vadhīḥ
English: the maruts are thy brothers why o indra wouldst thou take our lives?  agree with them in friendly wise and do not slay us in the fight

English: agastya brother why dost thou neglect us thou who art our friend?  we know the nature of thy mind verity thou wilt give us naught

Sanskrit: ara̍ṁ kṛṇvantu̱ vedi̱ṁ sam a̱gnim i̍ndhatām pu̱raḥ   tatrā̱mṛta̍sya̱ ceta̍naṁ ya̱jñaṁ te̍ tanavāvahai
English: let them prepare the altar let them kindle fire in front we two  here will spread sacrifice for thee that the immortal may observe

Sanskrit: tvam ī̍śiṣe vasupate̱ vasū̍nā̱ṁ tvam mi̱trāṇā̍m mitrapate̱ dheṣṭha̍ḥ   indra̱ tvam ma̱rudbhi̱ḥ saṁ va̍da̱svādha̱ prāśā̍na ṛtu̱thā ha̱vīṁṣi̍
English: thou lord of wealth art master of all treasures thou lord of friends art thy friends' best supporter  o indra speak thou kindly with the maruts and taste oblations in their proper season

English: as indra from great treason thou protectest yea from great treachery these who approach us  so marking well controller of the maruts grant us their blessings for they are thy dearest

English: the various doings of all mortal people by thee are ordered in thy wisdom indra  the host of maruts goeth forth exulting to win the lightbestowing spoil of battle

English: that spear of thine sat firm for us o indra the maruts set their whole dread power in motion  een agni shines resplendent in the brushwood the viands hold him as floods hold an island

English: vouchsafe us now that opulence o indra as guerdon won by mightiest donation  may hymns that please thee cause the breast of vāyu to swell as with the mead's refreshing sweetness

English: with thee o indra are most bounteous riches that further every one who lives uprightly  now may these maruts show us lovingkindness gods who of old were ever prompt to help us

English: heard is the roar of the advancing maruts terrific glittering and swiftly moving  who with their rush oerthrow as twere a sinner the mortal who would fight with those who love him

English: give to the mānas indra with maruts gifts universal gifts of cattle foremost  thou god art praised with gods who must be lauded may we find strengthening food in full abundance

Sanskrit: ya̱jñāya̍jñā vaḥ sama̱nā tu̍tu̱rvaṇi̱r dhiya̍ṁdhiyaṁ vo deva̱yā u̍ dadhidhve   ā vo̱ 'rvāca̍ḥ suvi̱tāya̱ roda̍syor ma̱he va̍vṛtyā̱m ava̍se suvṛ̱ktibhi̍ḥ
English: swift gain is his who hath you near at every rite ye welcome every song of him who serves the gods  so may i turn you hither with fair hymns of praise to give great succour for the weal of both the worlds

Sanskrit: va̱vrāso̱ na ye sva̱jāḥ svata̍vasa̱ iṣa̱ṁ sva̍r abhi̱jāya̍nta̱ dhūta̍yaḥ   sa̱ha̱sriyā̍so a̱pāṁ normaya̍ ā̱sā gāvo̱ vandyā̍so̱ nokṣaṇa̍ḥ
English: surrounding as it were selfborn selfpowerful they spring to life the shakersdown of food and light;  like as the countess undulations of the floods worthy of praise when near like bullocks and like kine

English: they who like somas with their wellgrown stalks pressed out imbibed within the heart dwell there in friendly wise  upon their shoulders rests as twere a warrior's spear and in their hand they hold a dagger and a ring

English: selfyoked they have descended lightly from the sky with your own lash immortals urge yourselves to speed  unstained by dust the maruts mighty in their strength have cast down een firm things armed with their shining spears

English: your winning is with strength dazzling with heavenly light with fruit mature o maruts fall of plenteousness  auspicious is your gift like a free giver's meed victorious spreading far as of immortal gods

English: pṛśni brought forth to fight the mighty battle the glittering army of the restless maruts  nurtured together they begat the monster and then looked round them for the food that strengthens

Sanskrit: joṣa̱d yad ī̍m asu̱ryā̍ sa̱cadhyai̱ viṣi̍tastukā roda̱sī nṛ̱maṇā̍ḥ   ā sū̱ryeva̍ vidha̱to ratha̍ṁ gāt tve̱ṣapra̍tīkā̱ nabha̍so̱ netyā
English: when chose immortal rodasī to followshe with loose tresses and heroic spirit  she climbed her servant's chariot she like sūrya with cloudlike motion and refulgent aspect

English: upon their car the young men set the maiden wedded to glory mighty in assemblies  when your song maruts rose and with oblation the somapourer sang his hymn in worship

English: i will declare the greatness of these maruts their real greatness worthy to be lauded  how with them she though firm strongminded haughty travels to women happy in their fortune

English: mitra and varuṇa they guard from censure aryaman too discovers worthless sinners firm things are overthrown that neer were shaken he prospers maruts who gives choice oblations

English: none of us maruts near or at a distance hath ever reached the limit of your vigour  they in courageous might still waxing boldly have compassed round their foemen like an ocean

English: may we this day be dearest friends of indra and let us call on him in fight tomorrow  so were we erst new might attend us daily! so be with us! ṛbhukṣan of the heroes!

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa va̱ḥ stomo̍ maruta i̱yaṁ gīr mā̍ndā̱ryasya̍ mā̱nyasya̍ kā̱roḥ   eṣā yā̍sīṣṭa ta̱nve̍ va̱yāṁ vi̱dyāme̱ṣaṁ vṛ̱jana̍ṁ jī̱radā̍num
English: may this your laud may this your song o maruts sung by the poet māna's son māndārya  bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance

English: now let us publish for the vigorous company the herald of the strong one their primeval might  with fire upon your way o maruts loud of voice with battle mighty ones achieve your deeds of strength

Sanskrit: nitya̱ṁ na sū̱num madhu̱ bibhra̍ta̱ upa̱ krīḻa̍nti krī̱ḻā vi̱dathe̍ṣu̱ ghṛṣva̍yaḥ   nakṣa̍nti ru̱drā ava̍sā nama̱svina̱ṁ na ma̍rdhanti̱ svata̍vaso havi̱ṣkṛta̍m
English: bringing the pleasant meath as twere their own dear son they sport in sportive wise gay at their gatherings  the rudras come with succour to the worshipper; selfstrong they fail not him who offers sacrifice

Sanskrit: yasmā̱ ūmā̍so a̱mṛtā̱ arā̍sata rā̱yas poṣa̍ṁ ca ha̱viṣā̍ dadā̱śuṣe̍   u̱kṣanty a̍smai ma̱ruto̍ hi̱tā i̍va pu̱rū rajā̍ṁsi̱ paya̍sā mayo̱bhuva̍ḥ
English: to whomsoever bringer of oblations they immortal guardians have given plenteous wealth  for him like loving friends the maruts bringing bliss bedew the regions round with milk abundantly

English: ye who with mighty powers have stirred the regions up your coursers have sped forth directed by themselves  all creatures of the earth all dwellings are afraid for brilliant is your coming with your spears advanced

Sanskrit: yat tve̱ṣayā̍mā na̱daya̍nta̱ parva̍tān di̱vo vā̍ pṛ̱ṣṭhaṁ naryā̱ acu̍cyavuḥ   viśvo̍ vo̱ ajma̍n bhayate̱ vana̱spatī̍ rathī̱yantī̍va̱ pra ji̍hīta̱ oṣa̍dhiḥ
English: when they in dazzling rush have made the mountains roar and shaken heaven's high back in their heroic strength  each sovran of the forest fears as ye drive near aid the shrubs fly before you swift as whirling wheels

English: terrible maruts ye with neerdiminished host with great benevolence fulfil our heart's desire  whereer your lightning bites armed with its gory teeth it crunches up the cattle like a wellaimed dart

English: givers of during gifts whose bounties never fail free from illwill at sacrifices glorified  they sing their song aloud that they may drink sweet juice well do they know the hero's first heroic deeds

English: with castles hundredfold o maruts guard ye well the man whom ye have loved from ruin and from sin  the man whom ye the fierce the mighty ones who roar preserve from calumny by cherishing his seed

Sanskrit: viśvā̍ni bha̱drā ma̍ruto̱ rathe̍ṣu vo mitha̱spṛdhye̍va tavi̱ṣāṇy āhi̍tā   aṁse̱ṣv ā va̱ḥ prapa̍theṣu khā̱dayo 'kṣo̍ vaś ca̱krā sa̱mayā̱ vi vā̍vṛte
English: o maruts in your cars are all things that are good great powers are set as twere in rivalry therein  rings are upon your shoulders when ye journey forth your axle turns together both the chariot wheels

Sanskrit: bhūrī̍ṇi bha̱drā narye̍ṣu bā̱huṣu̱ vakṣa̍ḥsu ru̱kmā ra̍bha̱sāso̍ a̱ñjaya̍ḥ   aṁse̱ṣv etā̍ḥ pa̱viṣu̍ kṣu̱rā adhi̱ vayo̱ na pa̱kṣān vy anu̱ śriyo̍ dhire
English: held in your manly arms are many goodly things gold chains are on your chests and glistering ornaments  deerskins are on their shoulders on their fellies knives they spread their glory out as birds spread out their wings

Sanskrit: ma̱hānto̍ ma̱hnā vi̱bhvo̱3̱̍ vibhū̍tayo dūre̱dṛśo̱ ye di̱vyā i̍va̱ stṛbhi̍ḥ   ma̱ndrāḥ su̍ji̱hvāḥ svari̍tāra ā̱sabhi̱ḥ sammi̍ślā̱ indre̍ ma̱ruta̍ḥ pari̱ṣṭubha̍ḥ
English: mighty in mightiness pervading passing strong visible from afar as twere with stars of heaven  lovely with pleasant tongues sweet singers with their mouths the maruts joined with indra shout forth all around

Sanskrit: tad va̍ḥ sujātā maruto mahitva̱naṁ dī̱rghaṁ vo̍ dā̱tram adi̍ter iva vra̱tam   indra̍ś ca̱na tyaja̍sā̱ vi hru̍ṇāti̱ taj janā̍ya̱ yasmai̍ su̱kṛte̱ arā̍dhvam
English: this is your majesty ye maruts nobly born far as the sway of aditi your bounty spreads  even indra by desertion never disannuls the boon bestowed by you upon the pious man

Sanskrit: tad vo̍ jāmi̱tvam ma̍ruta̱ḥ pare̍ yu̱ge pu̱rū yac chaṁsa̍m amṛtāsa̱ āva̍ta   a̱yā dhi̱yā mana̍ve śru̱ṣṭim āvyā̍ sā̱kaṁ naro̍ da̱ṁsanai̱r ā ci̍kitrire
English: this is your kinship maruts that immortals ye were oft in olden time regardful of our call  having vouchsafed to man a hearing through this prayer by wondrous deeds the heroes have displayed their might

Sanskrit: yena̍ dī̱rgham ma̍rutaḥ śū̱śavā̍ma yu̱ṣmāke̍na̱ parī̍ṇasā turāsaḥ   ā yat ta̱tana̍n vṛ̱jane̱ janā̍sa e̱bhir ya̱jñebhi̱s tad a̱bhīṣṭi̍m aśyām
English: that o ye maruts we may long time flourish through your abundant riches o swift movers  and that our men may spread in the encampment let me complete the rite with these oblations

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa va̱ḥ stomo̍ maruta i̱yaṁ gīr mā̍ndā̱ryasya̍ mā̱nyasya̍ kā̱roḥ   eṣā yā̍sīṣṭa ta̱nve̍ va̱yāṁ vi̱dyāme̱ṣaṁ vṛ̱jana̍ṁ jī̱radā̍num
English: may this your laud may this your song o maruts sung by the poet māna's son māndārya  bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance

Sanskrit: kayā̍ śu̱bhā sava̍yasa̱ḥ sanī̍ḻāḥ samā̱nyā ma̱ruta̱ḥ sam mi̍mikṣuḥ   kayā̍ ma̱tī kuta̱ etā̍sa e̱te 'rca̍nti̱ śuṣma̱ṁ vṛṣa̍ṇo vasū̱yā
English: with what bright beauty are the maruts jointly invested peers in age who dwell together?  from what place have they come? with what intention? sing they their strength through love of wealth these heroes?

Sanskrit: kasya̱ brahmā̍ṇi jujuṣu̱r yuvā̍na̱ḥ ko a̍dhva̱re ma̱ruta̱ ā va̍varta   śye̱nām̐ i̍va̱ dhraja̍to a̱ntari̍kṣe̱ kena̍ ma̱hā mana̍sā rīramāma
English: whose prayers have they the youthful ones accepted? who to his sacrifice hath turned the maruts?  we will delay them on their journey sweepingwith what high spirit!through the air like eagles

Sanskrit: kuta̱s tvam i̍ndra̱ māhi̍na̱ḥ sann eko̍ yāsi satpate̱ kiṁ ta̍ i̱tthā   sam pṛ̍cchase samarā̱ṇaḥ śu̍bhā̱nair vo̱ces tan no̍ harivo̱ yat te̍ a̱sme
English: whence comest thou alone thou who art mighty indra lord of the brave? what is thy purpose?  thou greetest us when meeting us the bright ones lord of bay steeds say what thou hast against us

Sanskrit: brahmā̍ṇi me ma̱taya̱ḥ śaṁ su̱tāsa̱ḥ śuṣma̍ iyarti̱ prabhṛ̍to me̱ adri̍ḥ   ā śā̍sate̱ prati̍ haryanty u̱kthemā harī̍ vahata̱s tā no̱ accha̍
English: mine are devotions hymns; sweet are libations strength stirs and hurled forth is my bolt of thunder  they call for me their lauds are longing for me these my bay steeds bear me to these oblations

Sanskrit: ato̍ va̱yam a̍nta̱mebhi̍r yujā̱nāḥ svakṣa̍trebhis ta̱nva1̱̍ḥ śumbha̍mānāḥ   maho̍bhi̱r etā̱m̐ upa̍ yujmahe̱ nv indra̍ sva̱dhām anu̱ hi no̍ ba̱bhūtha̍
English: therefore together with our strong companions having adorned our bodies now we harness  our spotted deer with might for thou o indra hast learnt and understood our godlike nature

Sanskrit: kva1̱̍ syā vo̍ marutaḥ sva̱dhāsī̱d yan mām eka̍ṁ sa̱madha̍ttāhi̱hatye̍   a̱haṁ hy u1̱̍gras ta̍vi̱ṣas tuvi̍ṣmā̱n viśva̍sya̱ śatro̱r ana̍maṁ vadha̱snaiḥ
English: where was that nature then of yours o maruts that ye charged me alone to slay the dragon?  for i in truth am fierce and strong and mighty i bent away from every foeman's weapons

Sanskrit: bhūri̍ cakartha̱ yujye̍bhir a̱sme sa̍mā̱nebhi̍r vṛṣabha̱ pauṁsye̍bhiḥ   bhūrī̍ṇi̱ hi kṛ̱ṇavā̍mā śavi̱ṣṭhendra̱ kratvā̍ maruto̱ yad vaśā̍ma
English: yea much hast thou achieved with us for comrades with manly valour like thine own thou hero  much may we too achieve o mightiest indra with our great power we maruts when we will it

Sanskrit: vadhī̍ṁ vṛ̱tram ma̍ruta indri̱yeṇa̱ svena̱ bhāme̍na tavi̱ṣo ba̍bhū̱vān   a̱ham e̱tā mana̍ve vi̱śvaśca̍ndrāḥ su̱gā a̱paś ca̍kara̱ vajra̍bāhuḥ
English: vṛtra i slew by mine own strength o maruts having waxed mighty in mine indignation  i with the thunder in my hand created for man these lucid softly flowing waters

Sanskrit: anu̍tta̱m ā te̍ maghava̱n naki̱r nu na tvāvā̍m̐ asti de̱vatā̱ vidā̍naḥ   na jāya̍māno̱ naśa̍te̱ na jā̱to yāni̍ kari̱ṣyā kṛ̍ṇu̱hi pra̍vṛddha
English: nothing o maghavan stands firm before thee; among the gods not one is found thine equal  none born or springing into life comes nigh thee do what thou hast to do exceeding mighty?

Sanskrit: eka̍sya cin me vi̱bhv a1̱̍stv ojo̱ yā nu da̍dhṛ̱ṣvān kṛ̱ṇavai̍ manī̱ṣā   a̱haṁ hy u1̱̍gro ma̍ruto̱ vidā̍no̱ yāni̱ cyava̱m indra̱ id ī̍śa eṣām
English: mine only be transcendent power whatever i daring in my spirit may accomplish  for i am known as terrible o maruts i indra am the lord of what i ruined

Sanskrit: ama̍ndan mā maruta̱ḥ stomo̱ atra̱ yan me̍ nara̱ḥ śrutya̱m brahma̍ ca̱kra   indrā̍ya̱ vṛṣṇe̱ suma̍khāya̱ mahya̱ṁ sakhye̱ sakhā̍yas ta̱nve̍ ta̱nūbhi̍ḥ
English: now o ye maruts hath your praise rejoiced me the glorious hymn which ye have made me heroes!  for me for indra champion strong in battle for me yourselves as lovers for a lover

Sanskrit: e̱ved e̱te prati̍ mā̱ roca̍mānā̱ ane̍dya̱ḥ śrava̱ eṣo̱ dadhā̍nāḥ   sa̱ṁcakṣyā̍ marutaś ca̱ndrava̍rṇā̱ acchā̍nta me cha̱dayā̍thā ca nū̱nam
English: here truly they send forth their sheen to meet me wearing their blameless glory and their vigour  when i have seen you maruts in gay splendour ye have delighted me so now delight me

Sanskrit: ko nv atra̍ maruto māmahe va̱ḥ pra yā̍tana̱ sakhī̱m̐r acchā̍ sakhāyaḥ   manmā̍ni citrā apivā̱taya̍nta e̱ṣām bhū̍ta̱ nave̍dā ma ṛ̱tānā̍m
English: who here hath magnified you o ye maruts? speed forward o ye lovers to your lovers  ye radiant ones assisting their devotions of these my holy rites he ye regardful

Sanskrit: ā yad du̍va̱syād du̱vase̱ na kā̱rur a̱smāñ ca̱kre mā̱nyasya̍ me̱dhā   o ṣu va̍rtta maruto̱ vipra̱m acche̱mā brahmā̍ṇi jari̱tā vo̍ arcat
English: to this hath mānya's wisdom brought us so as to aid as aids the poet him who worships  bring hither quick! on to the sage ye maruts! these prayers for you the singer hath recited

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa va̱ḥ stomo̍ maruta i̱yaṁ gīr mā̍ndā̱ryasya̍ mā̱nyasya̍ kā̱roḥ   eṣā yā̍sīṣṭa ta̱nve̍ va̱yāṁ vi̱dyāme̱ṣaṁ vṛ̱jana̍ṁ jī̱radā̍num
English: may this your praise may this your song o maruts sung by the poet māna's son māndārya  bring offspring for ourselves with food to feed us may we find strengthening food in full abundance!

Sanskrit: yad akra̍ndaḥ pratha̱maṁ jāya̍māna u̱dyan sa̍mu̱drād u̱ta vā̱ purī̍ṣāt   śye̱nasya̍ pa̱kṣā ha̍ri̱ṇasya̍ bā̱hū u̍pa̱stutya̱m mahi̍ jā̱taṁ te̍ arvan
English: what time first springing into life thou neighedst proceeding from the sea or upper waters  limbs of the deer hadst thou and eagle pinions o steed thy birth is nigh and must be lauded

Sanskrit: ya̱mena̍ da̱ttaṁ tri̱ta e̍nam āyuna̱g indra̍ eṇam pratha̱mo adhy a̍tiṣṭhat   ga̱ndha̱rvo a̍sya raśa̱nām a̍gṛbhṇā̱t sūrā̱d aśva̍ṁ vasavo̱ nir a̍taṣṭa
English: this steed which yama gave hath trita harnessed and him the first of all hath indra mounted  his bridle the gandharva grasped o vasus from out the sun ye fashioned forth the courser

Sanskrit: asi̍ ya̱mo asy ā̍di̱tyo a̍rva̱nn asi̍ tri̱to guhye̍na vra̱tena̍   asi̱ some̍na sa̱mayā̱ vipṛ̍kta ā̱hus te̱ trīṇi̍ di̱vi bandha̍nāni
English: yama art thou o horse; thou art āditya; trita art thou by secret operation  thou art divided thoroughly from soma they say thou hast three bonds in heaven  that hold thee

Sanskrit: trīṇi̍ ta āhur di̱vi bandha̍nāni̱ trīṇy a̱psu trīṇy a̱ntaḥ sa̍mu̱dre   u̱teva̍ me̱ varu̍ṇaś chantsy arva̱n yatrā̍ ta ā̱huḥ pa̍ra̱maṁ ja̱nitra̍m
English: three bonds they say thou hast in heaven that bind thee three in the waters  three within the ocean  to me thou seemest varuṇa o courser there where they say is thy sublimest birthplace

Sanskrit: i̱mā te̍ vājinn ava̱mārja̍nānī̱mā śa̱phānā̍ṁ sani̱tur ni̱dhānā̍   atrā̍ te bha̱drā ra̍śa̱nā a̍paśyam ṛ̱tasya̱ yā a̍bhi̱rakṣa̍nti go̱pāḥ
English: here courser are the places where they groomed thee here are the traces of thy hoofs as winner  here have i seen the auspicious reins that guide thee which those who guard the holy law keep safely

Sanskrit: ā̱tmāna̍ṁ te̱ mana̍sā̱rād a̍jānām a̱vo di̱vā pa̱taya̍ntam pata̱ṁgam   śiro̍ apaśyam pa̱thibhi̍ḥ su̱gebhi̍r are̱ṇubhi̱r jeha̍mānam pata̱tri
English: thyself from far i recognized in spirita bird that from below flew through the heaven  i saw thy head still soaring striving upward by paths unsoiled by dust pleasant to travel

Sanskrit: atrā̍ te rū̱pam u̍tta̱mam a̍paśya̱ṁ jigī̍ṣamāṇam i̱ṣa ā pa̱de goḥ   ya̱dā te̱ marto̱ anu̱ bhoga̱m āna̱ḻ ād id grasi̍ṣṭha̱ oṣa̍dhīr ajīgaḥ
English: here i beheld thy form matchless in glory eager to win thee food at the cow's station  wheneer a man brings thee to thine enjoyment thou swallowest the plants most greedy eater

Sanskrit: anu̍ tvā̱ ratho̱ anu̱ maryo̍ arva̱nn anu̱ gāvo 'nu̱ bhaga̍ḥ ka̱nīnā̍m   anu̱ vrātā̍sa̱s tava̍ sa̱khyam ī̍yu̱r anu̍ de̱vā ma̍mire vī̱rya̍ṁ te
English: after thee courser come the car the bridegroom the kine come after and the charm of maidens  full companies have followed for thy friendship the pattern of thy vigour gods have copied

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyaśṛ̱ṅgo 'yo̍ asya̱ pādā̱ mano̍javā̱ ava̍ra̱ indra̍ āsīt   de̱vā id a̍sya havi̱radya̍m āya̱n yo arva̍ntam pratha̱mo a̱dhyati̍ṣṭhat
English: horns made of gold hath he his feet are iron less fleet than he though swift as thought is indra  the gods have come that they may taste the oblation of him who mounted first of all the courser

Sanskrit: ī̱rmāntā̍sa̱ḥ sili̍kamadhyamāsa̱ḥ saṁ śūra̍ṇāso di̱vyāso̱ atyā̍ḥ   ha̱ṁsā i̍va śreṇi̱śo ya̍tante̱ yad ākṣi̍ṣur di̱vyam ajma̱m aśvā̍ḥ
English: symmetrical in flank with rounded haunches mettled like heroes the celestial coursers  put forth their strength like swans in lengthened order when they the steeds have reached the heavenly causeway

Sanskrit: tava̱ śarī̍ram patayi̱ṣṇv a̍rva̱n tava̍ ci̱ttaṁ vāta̍ iva̱ dhrajī̍mān   tava̱ śṛṅgā̍ṇi̱ viṣṭhi̍tā puru̱trāra̍ṇyeṣu̱ jarbhu̍rāṇā caranti
English: a body formed for flight hast thou o charger; swift as the wind in motion is thy spirit  thy horns are spread abroad in all directions they move with restless beat in wildernesses

Sanskrit: upa̱ prāgā̱c chasa̍naṁ vā̱jy arvā̍ deva̱drīcā̱ mana̍sā̱ dīdhyā̍naḥ   a̱jaḥ pu̱ro nī̍yate̱ nābhi̍r a̱syānu̍ pa̱ścāt ka̱vayo̍ yanti re̱bhāḥ
English: the strong steed hath come forward to the slaughter pondering with a mind directed godward  the goat who is his kin is led before him the sages and the singers follow after

Sanskrit: upa̱ prāgā̍t para̱maṁ yat sa̱dhastha̱m arvā̱m̐ acchā̍ pi̱tara̍m mā̱tara̍ṁ ca   a̱dyā de̱vāñ juṣṭa̍tamo̱ hi ga̱myā athā śā̍ste dā̱śuṣe̱ vāryā̍ṇi
English: the steed is come unto the noblest mansion is come unto his father and his mother  this day shall he approach the gods most welcome then he declares good gifts to him who offers

Sanskrit: mā no̍ mi̱tro varu̍ṇo arya̱māyur indra̍ ṛbhu̱kṣā ma̱ruta̱ḥ pari̍ khyan   yad vā̱jino̍ de̱vajā̍tasya̱ sapte̍ḥ prava̱kṣyāmo̍ vi̱dathe̍ vī̱ryā̍ṇi
English: slight us not varuṇa aryaman or mitra ṛbhukṣan indra āyu or the maruts  when we declare amid the congregation the virtues of the strong steed goddescended

Sanskrit: yan ni̱rṇijā̱ rekṇa̍sā̱ prāvṛ̍tasya rā̱tiṁ gṛ̍bhī̱tām mu̍kha̱to naya̍nti   suprā̍ṅ a̱jo memya̍d vi̱śvarū̍pa indrāpū̱ṣṇoḥ pri̱yam apy e̍ti̱ pātha̍ḥ
English: what time they bear before the courser covered with trappings and with wealth the grasped oblation  the dappled goat goeth straightforward bleating to the place dear to indra and to pūṣan

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa cchāga̍ḥ pu̱ro aśve̍na vā̱jinā̍ pū̱ṣṇo bhā̱go nī̍yate vi̱śvade̍vyaḥ   a̱bhi̱priya̱ṁ yat pu̍ro̱ḻāśa̱m arva̍tā̱ tvaṣṭed e̍naṁ sauśrava̱sāya̍ jinvati
English: dear to all gods this goat the share of pūṣan is first led forward with the vigorous courser  while tvaṣṭar sends him forward with the charger acceptable for sacrifice to glory

Sanskrit: yad dha̍vi̱ṣya̍m ṛtu̱śo de̍va̱yāna̱ṁ trir mānu̍ṣā̱ḥ pary aśva̱ṁ naya̍nti   atrā̍ pū̱ṣṇaḥ pra̍tha̱mo bhā̱ga e̍ti ya̱jñaṁ de̱vebhya̍ḥ prative̱daya̍nn a̱jaḥ
English: when thrice the men lead round the steed in order who goeth to the gods as meet oblation  the goat precedeth him the share of pūṣan and to the gods the sacrifice announceth

Sanskrit: hotā̍dhva̱ryur āva̍yā agnimi̱ndho grā̍vagrā̱bha u̱ta śaṁstā̱ suvi̍praḥ   tena̍ ya̱jñena̱ sva̍raṁkṛtena̱ svi̍ṣṭena va̱kṣaṇā̱ ā pṛ̍ṇadhvam
English: invoker ministering priest atoner firekindler somapresser sage reciter  with this well ordered sacrifice well finished do ye fill full the channels of the rivers

Sanskrit: yū̱pa̱vra̱skā u̱ta ye yū̍pavā̱hāś ca̱ṣāla̱ṁ ye a̍śvayū̱pāya̱ takṣa̍ti   ye cārva̍te̱ paca̍naṁ sa̱mbhara̍nty u̱to teṣā̍m a̱bhigū̍rtir na invatu
English: the hewers of the post and those who carry it and those who carve the knob to deck the horse's stake;  those who prepare the cookingvessels for the steedmay the approving help of these promote our work

Sanskrit: upa̱ prāgā̍t su̱man me̍ 'dhāyi̱ manma̍ de̱vānā̱m āśā̱ upa̍ vī̱tapṛ̍ṣṭhaḥ   anv e̍na̱ṁ viprā̱ ṛṣa̍yo madanti de̱vānā̍m pu̱ṣṭe ca̍kṛmā su̱bandhu̍m
English: forth for the regions of the gods the charger with his smooth back is come my prayer attends him  in him rejoice the singers and the sages a good friend have we won for the gods banquet

Sanskrit: yad vā̱jino̱ dāma̍ sa̱ṁdāna̱m arva̍to̱ yā śī̍rṣa̱ṇyā̍ raśa̱nā rajju̍r asya   yad vā̍ ghāsya̱ prabhṛ̍tam ā̱sye̱3̱̍ tṛṇa̱ṁ sarvā̱ tā te̱ api̍ de̱veṣv a̍stu
English: may the fleet courser's halter and his heelropes the headstall and the girths and cords about him  and the grass put within his mouth to bait himamong the gods too let all these be with thee

Sanskrit: yad aśva̍sya kra̱viṣo̱ makṣi̱kāśa̱ yad vā̱ svarau̱ svadhi̍tau ri̱ptam asti̍   yad dhasta̍yoḥ śami̱tur yan na̱kheṣu̱ sarvā̱ tā te̱ api̍ de̱veṣv a̍stu
English: what part of the steed's flesh the fly hath eaten or is left sticking to the post or hatchet  or to the slayer's hands and nails adherethamong the gods too may all this be with thee

Sanskrit: yad ūva̍dhyam u̱dara̍syāpa̱vāti̱ ya ā̱masya̍ kra̱viṣo̍ ga̱ndho asti̍   su̱kṛ̱tā tac cha̍mi̱tāra̍ḥ kṛṇvantū̱ta medha̍ṁ śṛta̱pāka̍m pacantu
English: food undigested steaming from his belly and any odour of raw flesh remaining  this let the immolators set in order and dress the sacrifice with perfect cooking

Sanskrit: yat te̱ gātrā̍d a̱gninā̍ pa̱cyamā̍nād a̱bhi śūla̱ṁ niha̍tasyāva̱dhāva̍ti   mā tad bhūmyā̱m ā śri̍ṣa̱n mā tṛṇe̍ṣu de̱vebhya̱s tad u̱śadbhyo̍ rā̱tam a̍stu
English: what from thy body which with fire is roasted when thou art set upon the spit distilleth  let not that lie on earth or grass neglected but to the longing gods let all be offered

Sanskrit: ye vā̱jina̍m pari̱paśya̍nti pa̱kvaṁ ya ī̍m ā̱huḥ su̍ra̱bhir nir ha̱reti̍   ye cārva̍to māṁsabhi̱kṣām u̱pāsa̍ta u̱to teṣā̍m a̱bhigū̍rtir na invatu
English: they who observing that the horse is ready call out and say the smell is good; remove it;  and craving meat await the distributionmay their approving help promote labour

Sanskrit: yan nīkṣa̍ṇam mā̱m̐spaca̍nyā u̱khāyā̱ yā pātrā̍ṇi yū̱ṣṇa ā̱seca̍nāni   ū̱ṣma̱ṇyā̍pi̱dhānā̍ carū̱ṇām a̱ṅkāḥ sū̱nāḥ pari̍ bhūṣa̱nty aśva̍m
English: the trialfork of the fleshcooking caldron the vessels out of which the broth is sprinkled  the warmingpots the covers of the dishes hooks carvingboardsall these attend the charger

Sanskrit: ni̱krama̍ṇaṁ ni̱ṣada̍naṁ vi̱varta̍na̱ṁ yac ca̱ paḍbī̍śa̱m arva̍taḥ   yac ca̍ pa̱pau yac ca̍ ghā̱siṁ ja̱ghāsa̱ sarvā̱ tā te̱ api̍ de̱veṣv a̍stu
English: the startingplace his place of rest and rolling the ropes wherewith the charger's feet were fastened  the water that he drank the food he tastedamong the gods too may all these attend thee

Sanskrit: mā tvā̱gnir dhva̍nayīd dhū̱maga̍ndhi̱r mokhā bhrāja̍nty a̱bhi vi̍kta̱ jaghri̍ḥ   i̱ṣṭaṁ vī̱tam a̱bhigū̍rta̱ṁ vaṣa̍ṭkṛta̱ṁ taṁ de̱vāsa̱ḥ prati̍ gṛbhṇa̱nty aśva̍m
English: let not the fire smokescented make thee crackle nor glowing caldron smell and break to pieces  offered beloved approved and consecratedsuch charger do the gods accept with favour

Sanskrit: yad aśvā̍ya̱ vāsa̍ upastṛ̱ṇanty a̍dhīvā̱saṁ yā hira̍ṇyāny asmai   sa̱ṁdāna̱m arva̍nta̱m paḍbī̍śam pri̱yā de̱veṣv ā yā̍mayanti
English: the robe they spread upon the horse to clothe him the upper covering and the golden trappings  the halters which restrain the steed the heelropesall these as grateful to the gods they offer

Sanskrit: yat te̍ sā̱de maha̍sā̱ śūkṛ̍tasya̱ pārṣṇyā̍ vā̱ kaśa̍yā vā tu̱toda̍   sru̱ceva̱ tā ha̱viṣo̍ adhva̱reṣu̱ sarvā̱ tā te̱ brahma̍ṇā sūdayāmi
English: if one when seated with excessive urging hath with his heel or with his whip distressed thee  all these thy woes as with the oblations' ladle at sacrifices with my prayer i banish

Sanskrit: catu̍striṁśad vā̱jino̍ de̱vaba̍ndho̱r vaṅkrī̱r aśva̍sya̱ svadhi̍ti̱ḥ sam e̍ti   acchi̍drā̱ gātrā̍ va̱yunā̍ kṛṇota̱ paru̍ṣparur anu̱ghuṣyā̱ vi śa̍sta
English: the fourandthirty ribs of the swift charger kin to the gods the slayer's hatchet pierces  cut ye with skill so that the parts be flawless and piece by piece declaring them dissect them

Sanskrit: eka̱s tvaṣṭu̱r aśva̍syā viśa̱stā dvā ya̱ntārā̍ bhavata̱s tatha̍ ṛ̱tuḥ   yā te̱ gātrā̍ṇām ṛtu̱thā kṛ̱ṇomi̱ tātā̱ piṇḍā̍nā̱m pra ju̍homy a̱gnau
English: of tvaṣṭar's charger there is one dissectorthis is the customtwo there are who guide him  such of his limbs as i divide in order these amid the balls in fire i offer

Sanskrit: mā tvā̍ tapat pri̱ya ā̱tmāpi̱yanta̱m mā svadhi̍tis ta̱nva1̱̍ ā ti̍ṣṭhipat te   mā te̍ gṛ̱dhnur a̍viśa̱stāti̱hāya̍ chi̱drā gātrā̍ṇy a̱sinā̱ mithū̍ kaḥ
English: let not thy dear soul burn thee as thou comest let not the hatchet linger in thy body  let not a greedy clumsy immolator missing the joints mangle thy limbs unduly

Sanskrit: na vā u̍ e̱tan mri̍yase̱ na ri̍ṣyasi de̱vām̐ id e̍ṣi pa̱thibhi̍ḥ su̱gebhi̍ḥ   harī̍ te̱ yuñjā̱ pṛṣa̍tī abhūtā̱m upā̍sthād vā̱jī dhu̱ri rāsa̍bhasya
English: no here thou diest not thou art not injured by easy paths unto the gods thou goest  both bays both spotted mares are now thy fellows and to the ass's pole is yoked the charger

Sanskrit: su̱gavya̍ṁ no vā̱jī svaśvya̍m pu̱ṁsaḥ pu̱trām̐ u̱ta vi̍śvā̱puṣa̍ṁ ra̱yim   a̱nā̱gā̱stvaṁ no̱ adi̍tiḥ kṛṇotu kṣa̱traṁ no̱ aśvo̍ vanatāṁ ha̱viṣmā̍n
English: may this steed bring us allsustaining riches wealth in good kine good horses manly offspring  freedom from sin may aditi vouchsafe us the steed with our oblations gain us lordship!

Sanskrit: a̱sya vā̱masya̍ pali̱tasya̱ hotu̱s tasya̱ bhrātā̍ madhya̱mo a̱sty aśna̍ḥ   tṛ̱tīyo̱ bhrātā̍ ghṛ̱tapṛ̍ṣṭho a̱syātrā̍paśyaṁ vi̱śpati̍ṁ sa̱ptapu̍tram
English: of this benignant priest with eld greycoloured the brother midmost of the three is lightning  the third is he whose back with oil is sprinkled here i behold the chief with seven male children

Sanskrit: sa̱pta yu̍ñjanti̱ ratha̱m eka̍cakra̱m eko̱ aśvo̍ vahati sa̱ptanā̍mā   tri̱nābhi̍ ca̱kram a̱jara̍m ana̱rvaṁ yatre̱mā viśvā̱ bhuva̱nādhi̍ ta̱sthuḥ
English: seven to the onewheeled chariot yoke the courser; bearing seven names the single courser draws it  threenaved the wheel is sound and undecaying whereon are resting all these worlds of being

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ ratha̱m adhi̱ ye sa̱pta ta̱sthuḥ sa̱ptaca̍kraṁ sa̱pta va̍ha̱nty aśvā̍ḥ   sa̱pta svasā̍ro a̱bhi saṁ na̍vante̱ yatra̱ gavā̱ṁ nihi̍tā sa̱pta nāma̍
English: the seven who on the sevenwheeled car are mounted have horses seven in tale who draw them onward  seven sisters utter songs of praise together in whom the names of the seven cows are treasured

Sanskrit: ko da̍darśa pratha̱maṁ jāya̍mānam astha̱nvanta̱ṁ yad a̍na̱sthā bibha̍rti   bhūmyā̱ asu̱r asṛ̍g ā̱tmā kva̍ svi̱t ko vi̱dvāṁsa̱m upa̍ gā̱t praṣṭu̍m e̱tat
English: who hath beheld him as he sprang to being seen how the boneless one supports the bony?  where is the blood of earth the life the spirit? who may approach the man who knows to ask it?

Sanskrit: pāka̍ḥ pṛcchāmi̱ mana̱sāvi̍jānan de̱vānā̍m e̱nā nihi̍tā pa̱dāni̍   va̱tse ba̱ṣkaye 'dhi̍ sa̱pta tantū̱n vi ta̍tnire ka̱vaya̱ ota̱vā u̍
English: unripe in mind in spirit undiscerning i ask of these the gods established places;  for up above the yearling calf the sages to form a web their own seven threads have woven

Sanskrit: aci̍kitvāñ ciki̱tuṣa̍ś ci̱d atra̍ ka̱vīn pṛ̍cchāmi vi̱dmane̱ na vi̱dvān   vi yas ta̱stambha̱ ṣaḻ i̱mā rajā̍ṁsy a̱jasya̍ rū̱pe kim api̍ svi̱d eka̍m
English: i ask unknowing those who know the sages as one all ignorant for sake of knowledge  what was that one who in the unborn's image hath stablished and fixed firm these worlds' six regions

Sanskrit: i̱ha bra̍vītu̱ ya ī̍m a̱ṅga vedā̱sya vā̱masya̱ nihi̍tam pa̱daṁ veḥ   śī̱rṣṇaḥ kṣī̱raṁ du̍hrate̱ gāvo̍ asya va̱vriṁ vasā̍nā uda̱kam pa̱dāpu̍ḥ
English: let him who knoweth presently declare it this lovely bird's securely founded station  forth from his head the cows draw milk and wearing his vesture with their foot have drunk the water

Sanskrit: mā̱tā pi̱tara̍m ṛ̱ta ā ba̍bhāja dhī̱ty agre̱ mana̍sā̱ saṁ hi ja̱gme   sā bī̍bha̱tsur garbha̍rasā̱ nivi̍ddhā̱ nama̍svanta̱ id u̍pavā̱kam ī̍yuḥ
English: the mother gave the sire his share of order with thought at first she wedded him in spirit  she the coy dame was filled with dew prolific with adoration men approached to praise her

Sanskrit: yu̱ktā mā̱tāsī̍d dhu̱ri dakṣi̍ṇāyā̱ ati̍ṣṭha̱d garbho̍ vṛja̱nīṣv a̱ntaḥ   amī̍med va̱tso anu̱ gām a̍paśyad viśvarū̱pya̍ṁ tri̱ṣu yoja̍neṣu
English: yoked was the mother to the boon cow's carpole in the dank rows of cloud the infant rested  then the calf lowed and looked upon the mother the cow who wears all shapes in three directions

Sanskrit: ti̱sro mā̱tṝs trīn pi̱tṝn bibhra̱d eka̍ ū̱rdhvas ta̍sthau̱ nem ava̍ glāpayanti   ma̱ntraya̍nte di̱vo a̱muṣya̍ pṛ̱ṣṭhe vi̍śva̱vida̱ṁ vāca̱m avi̍śvaminvām
English: bearing three mothers and three fathers single he stood erect they never make him weary  there on the pitch of heaven they speak together in speech allknowing but not allimpelling

Sanskrit: dvāda̍śāraṁ na̱hi taj jarā̍ya̱ varva̍rti ca̱kram pari̱ dyām ṛ̱tasya̍   ā pu̱trā a̍gne mithu̱nāso̱ atra̍ sa̱pta śa̱tāni̍ viṁśa̱tiś ca̍ tasthuḥ
English: formed with twelve spokes by length of time unweakened rolls round the heaven this wheel of during order  herein established joined in pairs together seven hundred sons and twenty stand o agni

Sanskrit: pañca̍pādam pi̱tara̱ṁ dvāda̍śākṛtiṁ di̱va ā̍hu̱ḥ pare̱ ardhe̍ purī̱ṣiṇa̍m   athe̱me a̱nya upa̍re vicakṣa̱ṇaṁ sa̱ptaca̍kre̱ ṣaḻa̍ra āhu̱r arpi̍tam
English: they call him in the farther half of heaven the sire fivefooted of twelve forms wealthy in watery store  these others say that he god with farseeing eyes is mounted on the lower sevenwheeled sixspoked car

Sanskrit: pañcā̍re ca̱kre pa̍ri̱varta̍māne̱ tasmi̱nn ā ta̍sthu̱r bhuva̍nāni̱ viśvā̍   tasya̱ nākṣa̍s tapyate̱ bhūri̍bhāraḥ sa̱nād e̱va na śī̍ryate̱ sanā̍bhiḥ
English: upon this fivespoked wheel revolving ever all living creatures rest and are dependent  its axle heavyladen is not heated the nave from ancient time remains unbroken

Sanskrit: sane̍mi ca̱kram a̱jara̱ṁ vi vā̍vṛta uttā̱nāyā̱ṁ daśa̍ yu̱ktā va̍hanti   sūrya̍sya̱ cakṣū̱ raja̍sai̱ty āvṛ̍ta̱ṁ tasmi̱nn ārpi̍tā̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ viśvā̍
English: the wheel revolves unwasting with its felly ten draw it yoked to the farstretching carpole  the sun's eye moves encompassed by the region on him dependent rest all living creatures

Sanskrit: sā̱ka̱ṁjānā̍ṁ sa̱ptatha̍m āhur eka̱jaṁ ṣaḻ id ya̱mā ṛṣa̍yo deva̱jā iti̍   teṣā̍m i̱ṣṭāni̱ vihi̍tāni dhāma̱śaḥ sthā̱tre re̍jante̱ vikṛ̍tāni rūpa̱śaḥ
English: of the coborn they call the seventh singleborn; the six twin pairs are called ṛṣis children of gods  their good gifts sought of men are ranged in order due and various in their form move for the lord who guides

Sanskrit: striya̍ḥ sa̱tīs tām̐ u̍ me pu̱ṁsa ā̍hu̱ḥ paśya̍d akṣa̱ṇvān na vi ce̍tad a̱ndhaḥ   ka̱vir yaḥ pu̱traḥ sa ī̱m ā ci̍keta̱ yas tā vi̍jā̱nāt sa pi̱tuṣ pi̱tāsa̍t
English: they told me these were males though truly females he who hath eyes sees this the blind discerns not  the son who is a sage hath comprehended who knows this rightly is his father's father

Sanskrit: a̱vaḥ pare̍ṇa pa̱ra e̱nāva̍reṇa pa̱dā va̱tsam bibhra̍tī̱ gaur ud a̍sthāt   sā ka̱drīcī̱ kaṁ svi̱d ardha̱m parā̍gā̱t kva̍ svit sūte na̱hi yū̱the a̱ntaḥ
English: beneath the upper realm above this lower bearing her calf at foot the cow hath risen  witherward to what place hath she departed? where calves she? not amid this herd of cattle

Sanskrit: a̱vaḥ pare̍ṇa pi̱tara̱ṁ yo a̍syānu̱veda̍ pa̱ra e̱nāva̍reṇa   ka̱vī̱yamā̍na̱ḥ ka i̱ha pra vo̍cad de̱vam mana̱ḥ kuto̱ adhi̱ prajā̍tam
English: who that the father of this calf discerneth beneath the upper realm above the lower  showing himself a sage may here declare it? whence hath the godlike spirit had its rising?

Sanskrit: ye a̱rvāñca̱s tām̐ u̱ parā̍ca āhu̱r ye parā̍ñca̱s tām̐ u̍ a̱rvāca̍ āhuḥ   indra̍ś ca̱ yā ca̱krathu̍ḥ soma̱ tāni̍ dhu̱rā na yu̱ktā raja̍so vahanti
English: those that come hitherward they call departing those that depart they call directed hither  and what so ye have made indra and soma steeds bear as twere yoked to the region's carpole

Sanskrit: dvā su̍pa̱rṇā sa̱yujā̱ sakhā̍yā samā̱naṁ vṛ̱kṣam pari̍ ṣasvajāte   tayo̍r a̱nyaḥ pippa̍laṁ svā̱dv atty ana̍śnann a̱nyo a̱bhi cā̍kaśīti
English: two birds with fair wings knit with bonds of friendship in the same sheltering tree have found a refuge  one of the twain eats the sweet figtree's fruitage; the other eating not regardeth only

Sanskrit: yatrā̍ supa̱rṇā a̱mṛta̍sya bhā̱gam ani̍meṣaṁ vi̱dathā̍bhi̱svara̍nti   i̱no viśva̍sya̱ bhuva̍nasya go̱pāḥ sa mā̱ dhīra̱ḥ pāka̱m atrā vi̍veśa
English: where those fine birds hymn ceaselessly their portion of life eternal and the sacred synods  there is the universe's mighty keeper who wise hath entered into me the simple

Sanskrit: yasmi̍n vṛ̱kṣe ma̱dhvada̍ḥ supa̱rṇā ni̍vi̱śante̱ suva̍te̱ cādhi̱ viśve̍   tasyed ā̍hu̱ḥ pippa̍laṁ svā̱dv agre̱ tan non na̍śa̱d yaḥ pi̱tara̱ṁ na veda̍
English: the tree whereon the fine birds eat the sweetness where they all rest and procreate their offspring  upon its top they say the fig is luscious none gaineth it who knoweth not the father

Sanskrit: yad gā̍ya̱tre adhi̍ gāya̱tram āhi̍ta̱ṁ traiṣṭu̍bhād vā̱ traiṣṭu̍bhaṁ ni̱rata̍kṣata   yad vā̱ jaga̱j jaga̱ty āhi̍tam pa̱daṁ ya it tad vi̱dus te a̍mṛta̱tvam ā̍naśuḥ
English: how on the gāyatrī the gāyatrī was based how from the triṣṭup they fashioned the triṣṭup forth  how on the jagatī was based the jagatīthey who know this have won themselves immortal life

Sanskrit: gā̱ya̱treṇa̱ prati̍ mimīte a̱rkam a̱rkeṇa̱ sāma̱ traiṣṭu̍bhena vā̱kam   vā̱kena̍ vā̱kaṁ dvi̱padā̱ catu̍ṣpadā̱kṣare̍ṇa mimate sa̱pta vāṇī̍ḥ
English: with gāyatrī he measures out the praisesong sāma with praisesong triplet with the triṣṭup  the triplet with the two or fourfoot measure and with the syllable they form seven metres

Sanskrit: jaga̍tā̱ sindhu̍ṁ di̱vy a̍stabhāyad rathaṁta̱re sūrya̱m pary a̍paśyat   gā̱ya̱trasya̍ sa̱midha̍s ti̱sra ā̍hu̱s tato̍ ma̱hnā pra ri̍rice mahi̱tvā
English: with jagatī the flood in heaven he stablished and saw the sun in the rathantara sāman  gāyatrī hath they say three brands for kindling hence it excels in majesty and vigour

Sanskrit: upa̍ hvaye su̱dughā̍ṁ dhe̱num e̱tāṁ su̱hasto̍ go̱dhug u̱ta do̍had enām   śreṣṭha̍ṁ sa̱vaṁ sa̍vi̱tā sā̍viṣan no̱ 'bhī̍ddho gha̱rmas tad u̱ ṣu pra vo̍cam
English: i invocate the milchcow good for milking so that the milker deft of hand may drain her  may savitar give goodliest stimulation the caldron is made hot; i will proclaim it

Sanskrit: hi̱ṅkṛ̱ṇva̱tī va̍su̱patnī̱ vasū̍nāṁ va̱tsam i̱cchantī̱ mana̍sā̱bhy āgā̍t   du̱hām a̱śvibhyā̱m payo̍ a̱ghnyeyaṁ sā va̍rdhatām maha̱te saubha̍gāya
English: she lady of all treasure is come hither yearning in spirit for her calf and lowing  may this cow yield her milk for both the aśvins and may she prosper to our high advantage

Sanskrit: gaur a̍mīme̱d anu̍ va̱tsam mi̱ṣanta̍m mū̱rdhāna̱ṁ hiṅṅ a̍kṛṇo̱n māta̱vā u̍   sṛkvā̍ṇaṁ gha̱rmam a̱bhi vā̍vaśā̱nā mimā̍ti mā̱yum paya̍te̱ payo̍bhiḥ
English: the cow hath lowed after her blinking youngling; she licks his forehead as she lows to form it  his mouth she fondly calls to her warm udder and suckles him with milk while gently lowing

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ sa śi̍ṅkte̱ yena̱ gaur a̱bhīvṛ̍tā̱ mimā̍ti mā̱yuṁ dhva̱sanā̱v adhi̍ śri̱tā   sā ci̱ttibhi̱r ni hi ca̱kāra̱ martya̍ṁ vi̱dyud bhava̍ntī̱ prati̍ va̱vrim au̍hata
English: he also snorts by whom encompassed round the cow laws as she clings unto the shedder of the rain  she with her shrilling cries hath humbled mortal man and turned to lightning hath stripped off her covering robe

Sanskrit: a̱nac cha̍ye tu̱ragā̍tu jī̱vam eja̍d dhru̱vam madhya̱ ā pa̱styā̍nām   jī̱vo mṛ̱tasya̍ carati sva̱dhābhi̱r ama̍rtyo̱ martye̍nā̱ sayo̍niḥ
English: that which hath breath and speed and life and motion lies firmly stablished in the midst of houses  living by offerings to the dead he moveth immortal one the brother of the mortal

Sanskrit: apa̍śyaṁ go̱pām ani̍padyamāna̱m ā ca̱ parā̍ ca pa̱thibhi̱ś cara̍ntam   sa sa̱dhrīcī̱ḥ sa viṣū̍cī̱r vasā̍na̱ ā va̍rīvarti̱ bhuva̍neṣv a̱ntaḥ
English: i saw the herdsman him who never stumbles approaching by his pathways and departing  he clothed with gathered and diffusive splendour within the worlds continually travels

Sanskrit: ya ī̍ṁ ca̱kāra̱ na so a̱sya ve̍da̱ ya ī̍ṁ da̱darśa̱ hiru̱g in nu tasmā̍t   sa mā̱tur yonā̱ pari̍vīto a̱ntar ba̍hupra̱jā nirṛ̍ti̱m ā vi̍veśa
English: he who hath made him cloth not comprehend him from him who saw him surely is he hidden  he yet enveloped in his mother's bosom source of much life hath sunk into destruction

Sanskrit: dyaur me̍ pi̱tā ja̍ni̱tā nābhi̱r atra̱ bandhu̍r me mā̱tā pṛ̍thi̱vī ma̱hīyam   u̱ttā̱nayo̍ś ca̱mvo̱3̱̍r yoni̍r a̱ntar atrā̍ pi̱tā du̍hi̱tur garbha̱m ādhā̍t
English: dyaus is my father my begetter kinship is here this great earth is my kin and mother  between the widespread worldhalves is the birthplace the father laid the daughter's germ within it

Sanskrit: pṛ̱cchāmi̍ tvā̱ para̱m anta̍m pṛthi̱vyāḥ pṛ̱cchāmi̱ yatra̱ bhuva̍nasya̱ nābhi̍ḥ   pṛ̱cchāmi̍ tvā̱ vṛṣṇo̱ aśva̍sya̱ reta̍ḥ pṛ̱cchāmi̍ vā̱caḥ pa̍ra̱maṁ vyo̍ma
English: i ask thee of the earth's extremest limit where is the centre of the world i ask thee  i ask thee of the stallion's seed prolific i ask of highest heaven where speech abideth

Sanskrit: i̱yaṁ vedi̱ḥ paro̱ anta̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyā a̱yaṁ ya̱jño bhuva̍nasya̱ nābhi̍ḥ   a̱yaṁ somo̱ vṛṣṇo̱ aśva̍sya̱ reto̍ bra̱hmāyaṁ vā̱caḥ pa̍ra̱maṁ vyo̍ma
English: this altar is the earth's extremest limit; this sacrifice of ours is the world's centre  the stallion's seed prolific is the soma; this brahman highest heaven where speech abideth

Sanskrit: sa̱ptārdha̍ga̱rbhā bhuva̍nasya̱ reto̱ viṣṇo̍s tiṣṭhanti pra̱diśā̱ vidha̍rmaṇi   te dhī̱tibhi̱r mana̍sā̱ te vi̍pa̱ścita̍ḥ pari̱bhuva̱ḥ pari̍ bhavanti vi̱śvata̍ḥ
English: seven germs unripened yet are heaven's prolific seed their functions they maintain by viṣṇu's ordinance  endued with wisdom through intelligence and thought they compass us about present on every side

Sanskrit: na vi jā̍nāmi̱ yad i̍ve̱dam asmi̍ ni̱ṇyaḥ saṁna̍ddho̱ mana̍sā carāmi   ya̱dā māga̍n prathama̱jā ṛ̱tasyād id vā̱co a̍śnuve bhā̱gam a̱syāḥ
English: what thing i truly am i know not clearly mysterious fettered in my mind i wander  when the firstborn of holy law approached me then of this speech i first obtain a portion

Sanskrit: apā̱ṅ prāṅ e̍ti sva̱dhayā̍ gṛbhī̱to 'ma̍rtyo̱ martye̍nā̱ sayo̍niḥ   tā śaśva̍ntā viṣū̱cīnā̍ vi̱yantā̱ ny a1̱̍nyaṁ ci̱kyur na ni ci̍kyur a̱nyam
English: back forward goes he grasped by strength inherent the immortal born the brother of the mortal  ceaseless they move in opposite directions men mark the one and fail to mark the other

Sanskrit: ṛ̱co a̱kṣare̍ para̱me vyo̍ma̱n yasmi̍n de̱vā adhi̱ viśve̍ niṣe̱duḥ   yas tan na veda̱ kim ṛ̱cā ka̍riṣyati̱ ya it tad vi̱dus ta i̱me sam ā̍sate
English: upon what syllable of holy praisesong as twere their highest heaven the gods repose them  who knows not this what will he do with praisesong? but they who know it well sit here assembled

Sanskrit: sū̱ya̱va̱sād bhaga̍vatī̱ hi bhū̱yā atho̍ va̱yam bhaga̍vantaḥ syāma   a̱ddhi tṛṇa̍m aghnye viśva̱dānī̱m piba̍ śu̱ddham u̍da̱kam ā̱cara̍ntī
English: mayst thou be with goodly pasture and may we also be exceeding wealthy  feed on the grass o cow at every season and coming hitherward drink limpid water

Sanskrit: gau̱rīr mi̍māya sali̱lāni̱ takṣa̱ty eka̍padī dvi̱padī̱ sā catu̍ṣpadī   a̱ṣṭāpa̍dī̱ nava̍padī babhū̱vuṣī̍ sa̱hasrā̍kṣarā para̱me vyo̍man
English: forming the waterfloods the buffalo hath lowed onefooted or twofooted or fourfooted she  who hath become eightfooted or hath got nine feet the thousandsyllabled in the sublimest heaven
