English: whoso with oil and poured oblation honours with goddevoted heart agni and soma  protect his sacrifice preserve him from distress grant to the sacrificer great felicity

Sanskrit: agnī̍ṣomā̱ save̍dasā̱ sahū̍tī vanata̱ṁ gira̍ḥ   saṁ de̍va̱trā ba̍bhūvathuḥ
English: invoked together mates in wealth agnisoma accept our hymns  together be among the gods

Sanskrit: agnī̍ṣomāv a̱nena̍ vā̱ṁ yo vā̍ṁ ghṛ̱tena̱ dāśa̍ti   tasmai̍ dīdayatam bṛ̱hat
English: agni and soma unto him who worships you with holy oil  shine forth an ample recompense

Sanskrit: agnī̍ṣomāv i̱māni̍ no yu̱vaṁ ha̱vyā ju̍joṣatam   ā yā̍ta̱m upa̍ na̱ḥ sacā̍
English: agni and soma be ye pleased with these oblations brought to you  and come together nigh to us

Sanskrit: agnī̍ṣomā pipṛ̱tam arva̍to na̱ ā pyā̍yantām u̱sriyā̍ havya̱sūda̍ḥ   a̱sme balā̍ni ma̱ghava̍tsu dhattaṁ kṛṇu̱taṁ no̍ adhva̱raṁ śru̍ṣṭi̱manta̍m
English: agni and soma cherish well our horses and let our cows be fat who yield oblations  grant power to us and to our wealthy patrons and cause our holy rites to be successful

Sanskrit: e̱tā u̱ tyā u̱ṣasa̍ḥ ke̱tum a̍krata̱ pūrve̱ ardhe̱ raja̍so bhā̱num a̍ñjate   ni̱ṣkṛ̱ṇvā̱nā āyu̍dhānīva dhṛ̱ṣṇava̱ḥ prati̱ gāvo 'ru̍ṣīr yanti mā̱tara̍ḥ
English: these dawns have raised their banner; in the eastern half of the midair they spread abroad their shining light  like heroes who prepare their weapons for the war onward they come bright red in hue the mother cows

Sanskrit: ud a̍paptann aru̱ṇā bhā̱navo̱ vṛthā̍ svā̱yujo̱ aru̍ṣī̱r gā a̍yukṣata   akra̍nn u̱ṣāso̍ va̱yunā̍ni pū̱rvathā̱ ruśa̍ntam bhā̱num aru̍ṣīr aśiśrayuḥ
English: readily have the purple beams of light shot up; the red cows have they harnessed easy to be yoked  the dawns have brought distinct perception as before redhued they have attained their fulgent brilliancy

Sanskrit: arca̍nti̱ nārī̍r a̱paso̱ na vi̱ṣṭibhi̍ḥ samā̱nena̱ yoja̍ne̱nā pa̍rā̱vata̍ḥ   iṣa̱ṁ vaha̍ntīḥ su̱kṛte̍ su̱dāna̍ve̱ viśved aha̱ yaja̍mānāya sunva̱te
English: they sing their song like women active in their tasks along their common path hither from far away  bringing refreshment to the liberal devotee yea all things to the worshipper who pours the juice

Sanskrit: adhi̱ peśā̍ṁsi vapate nṛ̱tūr i̱vāpo̍rṇute̱ vakṣa̍ u̱sreva̱ barja̍ham   jyoti̱r viśva̍smai̱ bhuva̍nāya kṛṇva̱tī gāvo̱ na vra̱jaṁ vy u1̱̍ṣā ā̍va̱r tama̍ḥ
English: she like a dancer puts her broidered garments on as a cow yields her udder so she bares her breast  creating light for all the world of life the dawn hath laid the darkness open as the cows their stall

Sanskrit: praty a̱rcī ruśa̍d asyā adarśi̱ vi ti̍ṣṭhate̱ bādha̍te kṛ̱ṣṇam abhva̍m   svaru̱ṁ na peśo̍ vi̱dathe̍ṣv a̱ñjañ ci̱traṁ di̱vo du̍hi̱tā bhā̱num a̍śret
English: we have beheld the brightness of her shining; it spreads and drives away the darksome monster  like tints that deck the post at sacrifices heaven's daughter hath attained her wondrous splendour

Sanskrit: atā̍riṣma̱ tama̍sas pā̱ram a̱syoṣā u̱cchantī̍ va̱yunā̍ kṛṇoti   śri̱ye chando̱ na sma̍yate vibhā̱tī su̱pratī̍kā saumana̱sāyā̍jīgaḥ
English: we have oerpast the limit of this darkness; dawn breaking forth again brings clear perception  she like a flatterer smiles in light for glory and fair of face hath wakened to rejoice us

Sanskrit: bhāsva̍tī ne̱trī sū̱nṛtā̍nāṁ di̱vaḥ sta̍ve duhi̱tā gota̍mebhiḥ   pra̱jāva̍to nṛ̱vato̱ aśva̍budhyā̱n uṣo̱ goa̍grā̱m̐ upa̍ māsi̱ vājā̍n
English: the gotamas have praised heaven's radiant daughter the leader of the charm of pleasant voices  dawn thou conferrest on us strength with offspring and men conspicuous with kine and horses

Sanskrit: uṣa̱s tam a̍śyāṁ ya̱śasa̍ṁ su̱vīra̍ṁ dā̱sapra̍vargaṁ ra̱yim aśva̍budhyam   su̱daṁsa̍sā̱ śrava̍sā̱ yā vi̱bhāsi̱ vāja̍prasūtā subhage bṛ̱hanta̍m
English: o thou who shinest forth in wondrous glory urged onward by thy strength auspicious lady  dawn may i gain that wealth renowned and ample in brave sons troops of slaves farfamed for horses

Sanskrit: viśvā̍ni de̱vī bhuva̍nābhi̱cakṣyā̍ pratī̱cī cakṣu̍r urvi̱yā vi bhā̍ti   viśva̍ṁ jī̱vaṁ ca̱rase̍ bo̱dhaya̍ntī̱ viśva̍sya̱ vāca̍m avidan manā̱yoḥ
English: bending her looks on all the world the goddess shines widely spreading with her bright eye westward  waking to motion every living creature she understands the voice of each adorer

Sanskrit: puna̍ḥpuna̱r jāya̍mānā purā̱ṇī sa̍mā̱naṁ varṇa̍m a̱bhi śumbha̍mānā   śva̱ghnīva̍ kṛ̱tnur vija̍ āminā̱nā marta̍sya de̱vī ja̱raya̱nty āyu̍ḥ
English: ancient of days again again born newly decking her beauty with the selfsame raiment  the goddess wastes away the life of mortals like a skilled hunter cutting birds in pieces

Sanskrit: vyū̱rṇva̱tī di̱vo antā̍m̐ abo̱dhy apa̱ svasā̍raṁ sanu̱tar yu̍yoti   pra̱mi̱na̱tī ma̍nu̱ṣyā̍ yu̱gāni̱ yoṣā̍ jā̱rasya̱ cakṣa̍sā̱ vi bhā̍ti
English: she hath appeared discovering heaven's borders to the far distance she drives off her sister  diminishing the days of human creatures the lady shines with all her lover's splendour

Sanskrit: pa̱śūn na ci̱trā su̱bhagā̍ prathā̱nā sindhu̱r na kṣoda̍ urvi̱yā vy a̍śvait   ami̍natī̱ daivyā̍ni vra̱tāni̱ sūrya̍sya ceti ra̱śmibhi̍r dṛśā̱nā
English: the bright the blessed one shines forth extending her rays like kine as a flood rolls his waters  never transgressing the divine commandments she is beheld visible with the sunbeams

Sanskrit: uṣa̱s tac ci̱tram ā bha̍rā̱smabhya̍ṁ vājinīvati   yena̍ to̱kaṁ ca̱ tana̍yaṁ ca̱ dhāma̍he
English: o dawn enriched with ample wealth bestow on us the wondrous gift  wherewith we may support children and children's sons

Sanskrit: uṣo̍ a̱dyeha go̍ma̱ty aśvā̍vati vibhāvari   re̱vad a̱sme vy u̍ccha sūnṛtāvati
English: thou radiant mover of sweet sounds with wealth of horses and of kine  shine thou on us this day o dawn auspiciously

Sanskrit: yu̱kṣvā hi vā̍jinīva̱ty aśvā̍m̐ a̱dyāru̱ṇām̐ u̍ṣaḥ   athā̍ no̱ viśvā̱ saubha̍gā̱ny ā va̍ha
English: o dawn enriched with holy rites yoke to thy car thy purple steeds  and then bring thou unto us all felicities

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā va̱rtir a̱smad ā goma̍d dasrā̱ hira̍ṇyavat   a̱rvāg ratha̱ṁ sama̍nasā̱ ni ya̍cchatam
English: o aśvins wonderful in act do ye unanimous direct  your chariot to our home wealthy in kine and gold

Sanskrit: yāv i̱tthā śloka̱m ā di̱vo jyoti̱r janā̍ya ca̱krathu̍ḥ   ā na̱ ūrja̍ṁ vahatam aśvinā yu̱vam
English: ye who brought down the hymn from heaven a light that giveth light to man  do ye o aśvins bring strength hither unto us

Sanskrit: eha de̱vā ma̍yo̱bhuvā̍ da̱srā hira̍ṇyavartanī   u̱ṣa̱rbudho̍ vahantu̱ soma̍pītaye
English: hither may they who wake at dawn bring to drink soma both the gods  healthgivers wonderworkers borne on paths of gold

Sanskrit: tvaṁ so̍ma̱ pra ci̍kito manī̱ṣā tvaṁ raji̍ṣṭha̱m anu̍ neṣi̱ panthā̍m   tava̱ praṇī̍tī pi̱taro̍ na indo de̱veṣu̱ ratna̍m abhajanta̱ dhīrā̍ḥ
English: thou soma art preeminent for wisdom; along the straightest path thou art our leader  our wise forefathers by thy guidance indu dealt out among the gods their share of treasure

Sanskrit: tvaṁ so̍ma̱ kratu̍bhiḥ su̱kratu̍r bhū̱s tvaṁ dakṣai̍ḥ su̱dakṣo̍ vi̱śvave̍dāḥ   tvaṁ vṛṣā̍ vṛṣa̱tvebhi̍r mahi̱tvā dyu̱mnebhi̍r dyu̱mny a̍bhavo nṛ̱cakṣā̍ḥ
English: thou by thine insight art most wise o soma strong by thine energies and all possessing  mighty art thou by all thy powers and greatness by glories art thou glorious guide of mortals

Sanskrit: rājño̱ nu te̱ varu̍ṇasya vra̱tāni̍ bṛ̱had ga̍bhī̱raṁ tava̍ soma̱ dhāma̍   śuci̱ṣ ṭvam a̍si pri̱yo na mi̱tro da̱kṣāyyo̍ arya̱mevā̍si soma
English: thine are king varuṇa's eternal statutes lofty and deep o soma is thy glory  allpure art thou like mitra the beloved adorable like aryaman o soma

Sanskrit: yā te̱ dhāmā̍ni di̱vi yā pṛ̍thi̱vyāṁ yā parva̍te̱ṣv oṣa̍dhīṣv a̱psu   tebhi̍r no̱ viśvai̍ḥ su̱manā̱ ahe̍ḻa̱n rāja̍n soma̱ prati̍ ha̱vyā gṛ̍bhāya
English: with all thy glories on the earth in heaven on mountains in the plants and in the waters  with all of these wellpleased and not in anger accept o royal soma our oblations

Sanskrit: tvaṁ so̍māsi̱ satpa̍ti̱s tvaṁ rājo̱ta vṛ̍tra̱hā   tvam bha̱dro a̍si̱ kratu̍ḥ
English: thou soma art the lord of heroes king yea vṛtraslayer thou  thou art auspicious energy

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ca̍ soma no̱ vaśo̍ jī̱vātu̱ṁ na ma̍rāmahe   pri̱yasto̍tro̱ vana̱spati̍ḥ
English: and soma let it be thy wish that we may live and may not die  praiseloving lord of plants art thou

Sanskrit: tvaṁ so̍ma ma̱he bhaga̱ṁ tvaṁ yūna̍ ṛtāya̱te   dakṣa̍ṁ dadhāsi jī̱vase̍
English: to him who keeps the law both old and young thou givest happiness  and energy that he may live

Sanskrit: tvaṁ na̍ḥ soma vi̱śvato̱ rakṣā̍ rājann aghāya̱taḥ   na ri̍ṣye̱t tvāva̍ta̱ḥ sakhā̍
English: guard us king soma on all sides from him who threatens us never let  the friend of one like thee be harmed

Sanskrit: soma̱ yās te̍ mayo̱bhuva̍ ū̱taya̱ḥ santi̍ dā̱śuṣe̍   tābhi̍r no 'vi̱tā bha̍va
English: with those delightful aids which thou hast soma for the worshipper  even with those protect thou us

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ ya̱jñam i̱daṁ vaco̍ jujuṣā̱ṇa u̱pāga̍hi   soma̱ tvaṁ no̍ vṛ̱dhe bha̍va
English: accepting this our sacrifice and this our praise o soma come  and be thou nigh to prosper us

Sanskrit: soma̍ gī̱rbhiṣ ṭvā̍ va̱yaṁ va̱rdhayā̍mo vaco̱vida̍ḥ   su̱mṛ̱ḻī̱ko na̱ ā vi̍śa
English: wellskilled in speech we magnify thee soma with our sacred songs  come thou to us most gracious one

Sanskrit: ga̱ya̱sphāno̍ amīva̱hā va̍su̱vit pu̍ṣṭi̱vardha̍naḥ   su̱mi̱traḥ so̍ma no bhava
English: enricher healer of disease wealthfinder prospering our store  be soma a good friend to us

Sanskrit: soma̍ rāra̱ndhi no̍ hṛ̱di gāvo̱ na yava̍se̱ṣv ā   marya̍ iva̱ sva o̱kye̍
English: soma be happy in our heart as milchkine in the grassy meads  as a young man in his own house

Sanskrit: yaḥ so̍ma sa̱khye tava̍ rā̱raṇa̍d deva̱ martya̍ḥ   taṁ dakṣa̍ḥ sacate ka̱viḥ
English: o soma god the mortal man who in thy friendship hath delight  him doth the mighty sage befriend

Sanskrit: u̱ru̱ṣyā ṇo̍ a̱bhiśa̍ste̱ḥ soma̱ ni pā̱hy aṁha̍saḥ   sakhā̍ su̱śeva̍ edhi naḥ
English: save us from slanderous reproach keep us o soma from distress  be unto us a gracious friend

Sanskrit: ā pyā̍yasva̱ sam e̍tu te vi̱śvata̍ḥ soma̱ vṛṣṇya̍m   bhavā̱ vāja̍sya saṁga̱the
English: in thee be juicy nutriments united and powers and mighty foesubduing vigour  waxing to immortality o soma win highest glories for thyself in heaven

Sanskrit: ā pyā̍yasva madintama̱ soma̱ viśve̍bhir a̱ṁśubhi̍ḥ   bhavā̍ naḥ su̱śrava̍stama̱ḥ sakhā̍ vṛ̱dhe
English: wax o most gladdening soma great through all thy rays of light and be  a friend of most illustrious fame to prosper us

Sanskrit: yā te̱ dhāmā̍ni ha̱viṣā̱ yaja̍nti̱ tā te̱ viśvā̍ pari̱bhūr a̍stu ya̱jñam   ga̱ya̱sphāna̍ḥ pra̱tara̍ṇaḥ su̱vīro 'vī̍rahā̱ pra ca̍rā soma̱ duryā̍n
English: such of thy glories as with poured oblations men honour may they all invest our worship  wealthgiver furtherer with troops of heroes sparing the brave come soma to our houses

Sanskrit: somo̍ dhe̱nuṁ somo̱ arva̍ntam ā̱śuṁ somo̍ vī̱raṁ ka̍rma̱ṇya̍ṁ dadāti   sā̱da̱nya̍ṁ vida̱thya̍ṁ sa̱bheya̍m pitṛ̱śrava̍ṇa̱ṁ yo dadā̍śad asmai
English: to him who worships soma gives the milchcow a fleet steed and a man of active knowledge  skilled in home duties meet for holy synod for council meet a glory to his father

Sanskrit: aṣā̍ḻhaṁ yu̱tsu pṛta̍nāsu̱ papri̍ṁ sva̱rṣām a̱psāṁ vṛ̱jana̍sya go̱pām   bha̱re̱ṣu̱jāṁ su̍kṣi̱tiṁ su̱śrava̍sa̱ṁ jaya̍nta̱ṁ tvām anu̍ madema soma
English: invincible in fight saver in battles guard of our camp winner of light and water  born amid hymns wellhoused exceeding famous victor in thee will we rejoice o soma

Sanskrit: tvam i̱mā oṣa̍dhīḥ soma̱ viśvā̱s tvam a̱po a̍janaya̱s tvaṁ gāḥ   tvam ā ta̍tantho̱rv a1̱̍ntari̍kṣa̱ṁ tvaṁ jyoti̍ṣā̱ vi tamo̍ vavartha
English: these herbs these milchkine and these running waters all these o soma thou hast generated  the spacious firmament hast thou expanded and with the light thou hast dispelled the darkness

Sanskrit: de̱vena̍ no̱ mana̍sā deva soma rā̱yo bhā̱gaṁ sa̍hasāvann a̱bhi yu̍dhya   mā tvā ta̍na̱d īśi̍ṣe vī̱rya̍syo̱bhaye̍bhya̱ḥ pra ci̍kitsā̱ gavi̍ṣṭau
English: do thou god soma with thy godlike spirit victorious win for us a share of riches  let none prevent thee thou art lord of valour provide for both sides in the fray for booty

Sanskrit: ṛ̱ju̱nī̱tī no̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro na̍yatu vi̱dvān   a̱rya̱mā de̱vaiḥ sa̱joṣā̍ḥ
English: may varuṇa with guidance straight and mitra lead us he who knows  and aryaman in accord with gods

Sanskrit: te hi vasvo̱ vasa̍vānā̱s te apra̍mūrā̱ maho̍bhiḥ   vra̱tā ra̍kṣante vi̱śvāhā̍
English: for they are dealers forth of wealth and not deluded with their might  guard evermore the holy laws

Sanskrit: te a̱smabhya̱ṁ śarma̍ yaṁsann a̱mṛtā̱ martye̍bhyaḥ   bādha̍mānā̱ apa̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: shelter may they vouchsafe to us immortal gods to mortal men  chasing our enemies away

Sanskrit: vi na̍ḥ pa̱thaḥ su̍vi̱tāya̍ ci̱yantv indro̍ ma̱ruta̍ḥ   pū̱ṣā bhago̱ vandyā̍saḥ
English: may they mark out our paths to bliss indra the maruts pūṣan  and bhaga the gods to be adored

Sanskrit: u̱ta no̱ dhiyo̱ goa̍grā̱ḥ pūṣa̱n viṣṇa̱v eva̍yāvaḥ   kartā̍ naḥ svasti̱mata̍ḥ
English: yea pūṣan viṣṇu ye who run your course enrich our hymns with kine;  bless us with all prosperity

Sanskrit: madhu̱ vātā̍ ṛtāya̱te madhu̍ kṣaranti̱ sindha̍vaḥ   mādhvī̍r naḥ sa̱ntv oṣa̍dhīḥ
English: the winds waft sweets the rivers pour sweets for the man who keeps the law  so may the plants be sweet for us

Sanskrit: madhu̱ nakta̍m u̱toṣaso̱ madhu̍ma̱t pārthi̍va̱ṁ raja̍ḥ   madhu̱ dyaur a̍stu naḥ pi̱tā
English: sweet be the night and sweet the dawns sweet the terrestrial atmosphere;  sweet be our father heaven to us

Sanskrit: madhu̍mān no̱ vana̱spati̱r madhu̍mām̐ astu̱ sūrya̍ḥ   mādhvī̱r gāvo̍ bhavantu naḥ
English: may the tall tree be full of sweets for us and full of sweets the sun  may our milchkine be sweet for us

Sanskrit: śaṁ no̍ mi̱traḥ śaṁ varu̍ṇa̱ḥ śaṁ no̍ bhavatv arya̱mā   śaṁ na̱ indro̱ bṛha̱spati̱ḥ śaṁ no̱ viṣṇu̍r urukra̱maḥ
English: be mitra gracious unto us and varuṇa and aryaman  indra bṛhaspati be kind and viṣṇu of the mighty stride

Sanskrit: ā no̍ bha̱drāḥ krata̍vo yantu vi̱śvato 'da̍bdhāso̱ apa̍rītāsa u̱dbhida̍ḥ   de̱vā no̱ yathā̱ sada̱m id vṛ̱dhe asa̱nn aprā̍yuvo rakṣi̱tāro̍ di̱vedi̍ve
English: may powers auspicious come to us from every side never deceived unhindered and victorious  that the gods ever may be with us for our gain our guardians day by day unceasing in their care

Sanskrit: de̱vānā̍m bha̱drā su̍ma̱tir ṛ̍jūya̱tāṁ de̱vānā̍ṁ rā̱tir a̱bhi no̱ ni va̍rtatām   de̱vānā̍ṁ sa̱khyam upa̍ sedimā va̱yaṁ de̱vā na̱ āyu̱ḥ pra ti̍rantu jī̱vase̍
English: may the auspicious favour of the gods be ours on us descend the bounty of the righteous gods  the friendship of the gods have we devoutly sought so may the gods extend our life that we may live

Sanskrit: tān pūrva̍yā ni̱vidā̍ hūmahe va̱yam bhaga̍m mi̱tram adi̍ti̱ṁ dakṣa̍m a̱sridha̍m   a̱rya̱maṇa̱ṁ varu̍ṇa̱ṁ soma̍m a̱śvinā̱ sara̍svatī naḥ su̱bhagā̱ maya̍s karat
English: we call them hither with a hymn of olden time bhaga the friendly dakṣa mitra aditi  aryaman varuṇa soma the aśvins may sarasvatī auspicious grant felicity

Sanskrit: tan no̱ vāto̍ mayo̱bhu vā̍tu bheṣa̱jaṁ tan mā̱tā pṛ̍thi̱vī tat pi̱tā dyauḥ   tad grāvā̍ṇaḥ soma̱suto̍ mayo̱bhuva̱s tad a̍śvinā śṛṇutaṁ dhiṣṇyā yu̱vam
English: may the wind waft to us that pleasant medicine may earth our mother give it and our father heaven  and the joygiving stones that press the soma's juice aśvins may ye for whom our spirits long hear this

Sanskrit: tam īśā̍na̱ṁ jaga̍tas ta̱sthuṣa̱s pati̍ṁ dhiyaṁji̱nvam ava̍se hūmahe va̱yam   pū̱ṣā no̱ yathā̱ veda̍sā̱m asa̍d vṛ̱dhe ra̍kṣi̱tā pā̱yur ada̍bdhaḥ sva̱staye̍
English: him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme the lord of all that stands or moves inspirer of the soul  that pūṣan may promote the increase of our wealth our keeper and our guard infallible for our good

Sanskrit: sva̱sti na̱ indro̍ vṛ̱ddhaśra̍vāḥ sva̱sti na̍ḥ pū̱ṣā vi̱śvave̍dāḥ   sva̱sti na̱s tārkṣyo̱ ari̍ṣṭanemiḥ sva̱sti no̱ bṛha̱spati̍r dadhātu
English: illustrious far and wide may indra prosper us may pūṣan prosper us the master of all wealth  may tārkṣya with uninjured fellies prosper us bṛhaspati vouchsafe to us prosperity

Sanskrit: pṛṣa̍daśvā ma̱ruta̱ḥ pṛśni̍mātaraḥ śubha̱ṁyāvā̍no vi̱dathe̍ṣu̱ jagma̍yaḥ   a̱gni̱ji̱hvā mana̍va̱ḥ sūra̍cakṣaso̱ viśve̍ no de̱vā ava̱sā ga̍mann i̱ha
English: the maruts sons of pṛśni borne by spotted steeds moving in glory oft visiting holy rites  sages whose tongue is agni brilliant as the sunhither let all the gods for our protection come

Sanskrit: bha̱draṁ karṇe̍bhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bha̱dram pa̍śyemā̱kṣabhi̍r yajatrāḥ   sthi̱rair aṅgai̍s tuṣṭu̱vāṁsa̍s ta̱nūbhi̱r vy a̍śema de̱vahi̍ta̱ṁ yad āyu̍ḥ
English: gods may we with our ears listen to what is good and with our eyes see what is good ye holy ones  with limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the term of life appointed by the gods

Sanskrit: śa̱tam in nu śa̱rado̱ anti̍ devā̱ yatrā̍ naś ca̱krā ja̱rasa̍ṁ ta̱nūnā̍m   pu̱trāso̱ yatra̍ pi̱taro̱ bhava̍nti̱ mā no̍ ma̱dhyā rī̍riṣa̱tāyu̱r ganto̍ḥ
English: a hundred autumns stand before us o ye gods within whose space ye bring our bodies to decay;  within whose space our sons become fathers in turn break ye not in the midst our course of fleeting life

Sanskrit: adi̍ti̱r dyaur adi̍tir a̱ntari̍kṣa̱m adi̍tir mā̱tā sa pi̱tā sa pu̱traḥ   viśve̍ de̱vā adi̍ti̱ḥ pañca̱ janā̱ adi̍tir jā̱tam adi̍ti̱r jani̍tvam
English: aditi is the heaven aditi is midair aditi is the mother and the sire and son  aditi is all gods aditi fiveclassed men aditi all that hath been born and shall be born

Sanskrit: ā vi̱dyunma̍dbhir marutaḥ sva̱rkai rathe̍bhir yāta ṛṣṭi̱madbhi̱r aśva̍parṇaiḥ   ā varṣi̍ṣṭhayā na i̱ṣā vayo̱ na pa̍ptatā sumāyāḥ
English: come hither maruts on your lightning laden cars sounding with sweet songs armed with lances winged with steeds  fly unto us with noblest food like birds o ye of mighty power

Sanskrit: te̍ 'ru̱ṇebhi̱r vara̱m ā pi̱śaṅgai̍ḥ śu̱bhe kaṁ yā̍nti ratha̱tūrbhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ   ru̱kmo na ci̱traḥ svadhi̍tīvān pa̱vyā ratha̍sya jaṅghananta̱ bhūma̍
English: with their redhued or haply tawny coursers which speed their chariots on they come for glory  brilliant like gold is he who holds the thunder earth have they smitten with the chariot's felly

Sanskrit: śri̱ye kaṁ vo̱ adhi̍ ta̱nūṣu̱ vāśī̍r me̱dhā vanā̱ na kṛ̍ṇavanta ū̱rdhvā   yu̱ṣmabhya̱ṁ kam ma̍rutaḥ sujātās tuvidyu̱mnāso̍ dhanayante̱ adri̍m
English: for beauty ye have swords upon your bodies as they stir woods so may they stir our spirits  for your sake o ye maruts very mighty and wellborn have they set the stone in motion

Sanskrit: ahā̍ni̱ gṛdhrā̱ḥ pary ā va̱ āgu̍r i̱māṁ dhiya̍ṁ vārkā̱ryāṁ ca̍ de̱vīm   brahma̍ kṛ̱ṇvanto̱ gota̍māso a̱rkair ū̱rdhvaṁ nu̍nudra utsa̱dhim piba̍dhyai
English: the days went round you and came back o yearners back to this prayer and to this solemn worship  the gotamas making their prayer with singing have pushed the well's lid up to drink the water

Sanskrit: e̱tat tyan na yoja̍nam aceti sa̱svar ha̱ yan ma̍ruto̱ gota̍mo vaḥ   paśya̱n hira̍ṇyacakrā̱n ayo̍daṁṣṭrān vi̱dhāva̍to va̱rāhū̍n
English: no hymn way ever known like this aforetime which gotama sang forth for you o maruts  what time upon your golden wheels he saw you wild boars rushing about with tusks of iron

Sanskrit: e̱ṣā syā vo̍ maruto 'nubha̱rtrī prati̍ ṣṭobhati vā̱ghato̱ na vāṇī̍   asto̍bhaya̱d vṛthā̍sā̱m anu̍ sva̱dhāṁ gabha̍styoḥ
English: to you this freshening draught of soma rusheth o maruts like the voice of one who prayeth  it rusheth freely from our hands as these libations wont to flow

Sanskrit: pratva̍kṣasa̱ḥ prata̍vaso vira̱pśino 'nā̍natā̱ avi̍thurā ṛjī̱ṣiṇa̍ḥ   juṣṭa̍tamāso̱ nṛta̍māso a̱ñjibhi̱r vy ā̍najre̱ ke ci̍d u̱srā i̍va̱ stṛbhi̍ḥ
English: loud singers never humbled active full of strength immovable impetuous manliest bestbeloved  they have displayed themselves with glittering ornaments a few in number only like the heavens with stars

Sanskrit: u̱pa̱hva̱reṣu̱ yad aci̍dhvaṁ ya̱yiṁ vaya̍ iva maruta̱ḥ kena̍ cit pa̱thā   ścota̍nti̱ kośā̱ upa̍ vo̱ rathe̱ṣv ā ghṛ̱tam u̍kṣatā̱ madhu̍varṇa̱m arca̍te
English: when maruts on the steeps ye pile the moving cloud ye are like birds on whatsoever path it be  clouds everywhere shed forth the rain upon your cars drop fatness honeyhued for him who sings your praise

Sanskrit: praiṣā̱m ajme̍ṣu vithu̱reva̍ rejate̱ bhūmi̱r yāme̍ṣu̱ yad dha̍ yu̱ñjate̍ śu̱bhe   te krī̱ḻayo̱ dhuna̍yo̱ bhrāja̍dṛṣṭayaḥ sva̱yam ma̍hi̱tvam pa̍nayanta̱ dhūta̍yaḥ
English: earth at their racings trembles as if weak and worn when on their ways they yoke their cars for victory  they sportive loudly roaring armed with glittering spears shakers of all themselves admire their mightiness

Sanskrit: sa hi sva̱sṛt pṛṣa̍daśvo̱ yuvā̍ ga̱ṇo̱3̱̍ 'yā ī̍śā̱nas tavi̍ṣībhi̱r āvṛ̍taḥ   asi̍ sa̱tya ṛ̍ṇa̱yāvāne̍dyo̱ 'syā dhi̱yaḥ prā̍vi̱tāthā̱ vṛṣā̍ ga̱ṇaḥ
English: selfmoving is that youthful band with spotted steeds; thus it hath lordly sway endued with power and might  truthful art thou and blameless searcher out of sin so thou strong host wilt be protector of this prayer

Sanskrit: pi̱tuḥ pra̱tnasya̱ janma̍nā vadāmasi̱ soma̍sya ji̱hvā pra ji̍gāti̱ cakṣa̍sā   yad ī̱m indra̱ṁ śamy ṛkvā̍ṇa̱ āśa̱tād in nāmā̍ni ya̱jñiyā̍ni dadhire
English: we speak by our descent from our primeval sire; our tongue when we behold the soma stirs itself  when shouting they had joined indra in toil of fight then only they obtained their sacrificial names

Sanskrit: śri̱yase̱ kam bhā̱nubhi̱ḥ sam mi̍mikṣire̱ te ra̱śmibhi̱s ta ṛkva̍bhiḥ sukhā̱daya̍ḥ   te vāśī̍manta i̱ṣmiṇo̱ abhī̍ravo vi̱dre pri̱yasya̱ māru̍tasya̱ dhāmna̍ḥ
English: splendours they gained for glory they who wear bright rings; rays they obtained and men to celebrate their praise  armed with their swords impetuous and fearing naught they have possessed the maruts own beloved home

Sanskrit: maru̍to̱ yasya̱ hi kṣaye̍ pā̱thā di̱vo vi̍mahasaḥ   sa su̍go̱pāta̍mo̱ jana̍ḥ
English: the best of guardians hath that man within whose dwelling place ye drink  o maruts giants of the sky

Sanskrit: ya̱jñair vā̍ yajñavāhaso̱ vipra̍sya vā matī̱nām   maru̍taḥ śṛṇu̱tā hava̍m
English: honoured with sacrifice or with the worship of the sages hymns  o maruts listen to the call

Sanskrit: u̱ta vā̱ yasya̍ vā̱jino 'nu̱ vipra̱m ata̍kṣata   sa gantā̱ goma̍ti vra̱je
English: yea the strong man to whom ye have vouchsafed to give a sage shall move  into a stable rich in kine

Sanskrit: a̱sya vī̱rasya̍ ba̱rhiṣi̍ su̱taḥ somo̱ divi̍ṣṭiṣu   u̱ktham mada̍ś ca śasyate
English: upon this hero's sacred grass soma is poured in daily rites  praise and delight are sung aloud

Sanskrit: a̱sya śro̍ṣa̱ntv ā bhuvo̱ viśvā̱ yaś ca̍rṣa̱ṇīr a̱bhi   sūra̍ṁ cit sa̱sruṣī̱r iṣa̍ḥ
English: let the strong maruts hear him him surpassing all men strength be his  that reaches even to the sun

Sanskrit: pū̱rvībhi̱r hi da̍dāśi̱ma śa̱radbhi̍r maruto va̱yam   avo̍bhiś carṣaṇī̱nām
English: for through the swift gods loving help in many an autumn maruts we  have offered up our sacrifice

Sanskrit: su̱bhaga̱ḥ sa pra̍yajyavo̱ maru̍to astu̱ martya̍ḥ   yasya̱ prayā̍ṁsi̱ parṣa̍tha
English: fortunate shall that mortal be o maruts most adorable  whose offerings ye bear away

Sanskrit: śa̱śa̱mā̱nasya̍ vā nara̱ḥ sveda̍sya satyaśavasaḥ   vi̱dā kāma̍sya̱ vena̍taḥ
English: o heroes truly strong ye know the toil of him who sings your praise  the heart's desire of him who loves

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ tat sa̍tyaśavasa ā̱viṣ ka̍rta mahitva̱nā   vidhya̍tā vi̱dyutā̱ rakṣa̍ḥ
English: o ye of true strength make this thing manifest by your greatness strike  the demon with your thunderbolt

Sanskrit: gūha̍tā̱ guhya̱ṁ tamo̱ vi yā̍ta̱ viśva̍m a̱triṇa̍m   jyoti̍ṣ kartā̱ yad u̱śmasi̍
English: conceal the horrid darkness drive far from us each devouring fiend  create the light for which we long

Sanskrit: pra ye śumbha̍nte̱ jana̍yo̱ na sapta̍yo̱ yāma̍n ru̱drasya̍ sū̱nava̍ḥ su̱daṁsa̍saḥ   roda̍sī̱ hi ma̱ruta̍ś cakri̱re vṛ̱dhe mada̍nti vī̱rā vi̱dathe̍ṣu̱ ghṛṣva̍yaḥ
English: they who are glancing forth like women on their way doers of mighty deeds swift racers rudra's sons  the maruts have made heaven and earth increase and grow in sacrifices they delight the strong and wild

Sanskrit: ta u̍kṣi̱tāso̍ mahi̱māna̍m āśata di̱vi ru̱drāso̱ adhi̍ cakrire̱ sada̍ḥ   arca̍nto a̱rkaṁ ja̱naya̍nta indri̱yam adhi̱ śriyo̍ dadhire̱ pṛśni̍mātaraḥ
English: grown to their perfect strength greatness have they attained; the rudras have established their abode in heaven  singing their song of praise and generating might they have put glory on the sons whom pṛśni bare

Sanskrit: gomā̍taro̱ yac chu̱bhaya̍nte a̱ñjibhi̍s ta̱nūṣu̍ śu̱bhrā da̍dhire vi̱rukma̍taḥ   bādha̍nte̱ viśva̍m abhimā̱tina̱m apa̱ vartmā̍ny eṣā̱m anu̍ rīyate ghṛ̱tam
English: when children of the cow they shine in bright attire and on their fair limbs lay their golden ornaments  they drive away each adversary from their path and following their traces fatness floweth down

Sanskrit: vi ye bhrāja̍nte̱ suma̍khāsa ṛ̱ṣṭibhi̍ḥ pracyā̱vaya̍nto̱ acyu̍tā ci̱d oja̍sā   ma̱no̱juvo̱ yan ma̍ruto̱ rathe̱ṣv ā vṛṣa̍vrātāsa̱ḥ pṛṣa̍tī̱r ayu̍gdhvam
English: when mighty warriors ye who glitter with your spears oerthrowing with your strength een what is neer oerthrown  when o ye maruts ye the host that send the rain had harnessed to your cars the thoughtfleet spotted deer

Sanskrit: pra yad rathe̍ṣu̱ pṛṣa̍tī̱r ayu̍gdhva̱ṁ vāje̱ adri̍m maruto ra̱ṁhaya̍ntaḥ   u̱tāru̱ṣasya̱ vi ṣya̍nti̱ dhārā̱ś carme̍vo̱dabhi̱r vy u̍ndanti̱ bhūma̍
English: when ye have harnessed to your cars the spotted deer urging the thunderbolt o maruts to the fray  forth rush the torrents of the dark red stormy cloud and moisten like a skin the earth with waterfloods

Sanskrit: ā vo̍ vahantu̱ sapta̍yo raghu̱ṣyado̍ raghu̱patvā̍na̱ḥ pra ji̍gāta bā̱hubhi̍ḥ   sīda̱tā ba̱rhir u̱ru va̱ḥ sada̍s kṛ̱tam mā̱daya̍dhvam maruto̱ madhvo̱ andha̍saḥ
English: let your swiftgliding coursers bear you hitherward with their fleet pinions come ye forward with your arms  sit on the grass; a wide seat hath been made for you delight yourselves o maruts in the pleasant food

Sanskrit: te̍ 'vardhanta̱ svata̍vaso mahitva̱nā nāka̍ṁ ta̱sthur u̱ru ca̍krire̱ sada̍ḥ   viṣṇu̱r yad dhāva̱d vṛṣa̍ṇam mada̱cyuta̱ṁ vayo̱ na sī̍da̱nn adhi̍ ba̱rhiṣi̍ pri̱ye
English: strong in their native strength to greatness have they grown stepped to the firmament and made their dwelling wide  when viṣṇu saved the soma bringing wild delight the maruts sate like birds on their dear holy grass

Sanskrit: śūrā̍ i̱ved yuyu̍dhayo̱ na jagma̍yaḥ śrava̱syavo̱ na pṛta̍nāsu yetire   bhaya̍nte̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nā ma̱rudbhyo̱ rājā̍na iva tve̱ṣasa̍ṁdṛśo̱ nara̍ḥ
English: in sooth like heroes fain for fight they rush about like combatants fameseeking have they striven in war  before the maruts every creature is afraid the men are like to kings terrible to behold

Sanskrit: tvaṣṭā̱ yad vajra̱ṁ sukṛ̍taṁ hira̱ṇyaya̍ṁ sa̱hasra̍bhṛṣṭi̱ṁ svapā̱ ava̍rtayat   dha̱tta indro̱ nary apā̍ṁsi̱ karta̱ve 'ha̍n vṛ̱traṁ nir a̱pām au̍bjad arṇa̱vam
English: when tvaṣṭar deft of hand had turned the thunderbolt golden with thousand edges fashioned more skilfully  indra received it to perform heroic deeds vṛtra he slew and forced the flood of water forth

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvaṁ nu̍nudre 'va̱taṁ ta oja̍sā dādṛhā̱ṇaṁ ci̍d bibhidu̱r vi parva̍tam   dhama̍nto vā̱ṇam ma̱ruta̍ḥ su̱dāna̍vo̱ made̱ soma̍sya̱ raṇyā̍ni cakrire
English: they with their vigorous strength pushed the well up on high and clove the cloud in twain though it was passing strong  the maruts bounteous givers sending forth their voice in the wild joy of soma wrought their glorious deeds

Sanskrit: ji̱hmaṁ nu̍nudre 'va̱taṁ tayā̍ di̱śāsi̍ñca̱nn utsa̱ṁ gota̍māya tṛ̱ṣṇaje̍   ā ga̍cchantī̱m ava̍sā ci̱trabhā̍nava̱ḥ kāma̱ṁ vipra̍sya tarpayanta̱ dhāma̍bhiḥ
English: they drave the cloud transverse directed hitherward and poured the fountain forth for thirsting gotama  shining with varied light they come to him with help they with their might fulfilled the longing of the sage

Sanskrit: yā va̱ḥ śarma̍ śaśamā̱nāya̱ santi̍ tri̱dhātū̍ni dā̱śuṣe̍ yaccha̱tādhi̍   a̱smabhya̱ṁ tāni̍ maruto̱ vi ya̍nta ra̱yiṁ no̍ dhatta vṛṣaṇaḥ su̱vīra̍m
English: the shelters which ye have for him who lauds you bestow them threefold on the man who offers  extend the same boons unto us ye maruts give us o heroes wealth with noble offspring

Sanskrit: asā̍vi̱ soma̍ indra te̱ śavi̍ṣṭha dhṛṣṇa̱v ā ga̍hi   ā tvā̍ pṛṇaktv indri̱yaṁ raja̱ḥ sūryo̱ na ra̱śmibhi̍ḥ
English: the soma hath been pressed for thee o indra; mightiest bold one come  may indravigour fill thee full as the sun fills midair with rays

Sanskrit: indra̱m id dharī̍ vaha̱to 'pra̍tidhṛṣṭaśavasam   ṛṣī̍ṇāṁ ca stu̱tīr upa̍ ya̱jñaṁ ca̱ mānu̍ṣāṇām
English: his pair of tawny coursers bring indra of unresisted might  hither to ṛṣis songs of praise and sacrifice performed by men

Sanskrit: ā ti̍ṣṭha vṛtraha̱n ratha̍ṁ yu̱ktā te̱ brahma̍ṇā̱ harī̍   a̱rvā̱cīna̱ṁ su te̱ mano̱ grāvā̍ kṛṇotu va̱gnunā̍
English: slayer of vṛtra mount thy car; thy bay steeds have been yoked by prayer  may with its voice the pressingstone draw thine attention hitherward

Sanskrit: i̱mam i̍ndra su̱tam pi̍ba̱ jyeṣṭha̱m ama̍rtya̱m mada̍m   śu̱krasya̍ tvā̱bhy a̍kṣara̱n dhārā̍ ṛ̱tasya̱ sāda̍ne
English: this poured libation indra drink immortal gladdening excellent  streams of the bright have flowed to thee here at the seat of holy law

Sanskrit: indrā̍ya nū̱nam a̍rcato̱kthāni̍ ca bravītana   su̱tā a̍matsu̱r inda̍vo̱ jyeṣṭha̍ṁ namasyatā̱ saha̍ḥ
English: sing glory now to indra say to him your solemn eulogies  the drops poured forth have made him glad pay reverence to his might supreme

Sanskrit: naki̱ṣ ṭvad ra̱thīta̍ro̱ harī̱ yad i̍ndra̱ yaccha̍se   naki̱ṣ ṭvānu̍ ma̱jmanā̱ naki̱ḥ svaśva̍ ānaśe
English: when indra thou dost yoke thy steeds there is no better charioteer  none hath surpassed thee in thy might none with good steeds oertaken thee

Sanskrit: ya eka̱ id vi̱daya̍te̱ vasu̱ martā̍ya dā̱śuṣe̍   īśā̍no̱ apra̍tiṣkuta̱ indro̍ a̱ṅga
English: he who alone bestoweth on mortal man who offereth gifts  the ruler of resistless power is indra sure

Sanskrit: ka̱dā marta̍m arā̱dhasa̍m pa̱dā kṣumpa̍m iva sphurat   ka̱dā na̍ḥ śuśrava̱d gira̱ indro̍ a̱ṅga
English: when will he trample like a weed the man who hath no gift for him?  when verily will indra hear our songs of praise?

Sanskrit: yaś ci̱d dhi tvā̍ ba̱hubhya̱ ā su̱tāvā̍m̐ ā̱vivā̍sati   u̱graṁ tat pa̍tyate̱ śava̱ indro̍ a̱ṅga
English: he who with soma juice prepared amid the many honours thee  verily indra gains thereby tremendous might

Sanskrit: svā̱dor i̱tthā vi̍ṣū̱vato̱ madhva̍ḥ pibanti gau̱rya̍ḥ   yā indre̍ṇa sa̱yāva̍rī̱r vṛṣṇā̱ mada̍nti śo̱bhase̱ vasvī̱r anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: the juice of soma thus diffused sweet to the taste the bright cows drink  who for the sake of splendour close to mighty indra's side rejoice good in their own supremacy

Sanskrit: tā a̍sya pṛśanā̱yuva̱ḥ soma̍ṁ śrīṇanti̱ pṛśna̍yaḥ   pri̱yā indra̍sya dhe̱navo̱ vajra̍ṁ hinvanti̱ sāya̍ka̱ṁ vasvī̱r anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: craving his touch the dappled kine mingle the soma with their milk  the milchkine dear to indra send forth his deathdealing thunderbolt good in their own supremacy

Sanskrit: tā a̍sya̱ nama̍sā̱ saha̍ḥ sapa̱ryanti̱ prace̍tasaḥ   vra̱tāny a̍sya saścire pu̱rūṇi̍ pū̱rvaci̍ttaye̱ vasvī̱r anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: with veneration passing wise honouring his victorious might  they follow close his many laws to win them due preeminence good in their  own supremacy

Sanskrit: indro̍ dadhī̱co a̱sthabhi̍r vṛ̱trāṇy apra̍tiṣkutaḥ   ja̱ghāna̍ nava̱tīr nava̍
English: with bones of dadhyach for his arms indra resistless in attack  struck nineandninety vṛtras dead

Sanskrit: i̱cchann aśva̍sya̱ yac chira̱ḥ parva̍te̱ṣv apa̍śritam   tad vi̍dac charya̱ṇāva̍ti
English: he searching for the horse's head removed among the mountains found  at śaryaṇāvān what he sought

Sanskrit: atrāha̱ gor a̍manvata̱ nāma̱ tvaṣṭu̍r apī̱cya̍m   i̱tthā ca̱ndrama̍so gṛ̱he
English: then verily they recognized the essential form of tvaṣṭar's bull  here in the mansion of the moon

Sanskrit: ko a̱dya yu̍ṅkte dhu̱ri gā ṛ̱tasya̱ śimī̍vato bhā̱mino̍ durhṛṇā̱yūn   ā̱sanni̍ṣūn hṛ̱tsvaso̍ mayo̱bhūn ya e̍ṣām bhṛ̱tyām ṛ̱ṇadha̱t sa jī̍vāt
English: who yokes today unto the pole of order the strong and passionate steers of checkless spirit  with shaftarmed mouths heartpiercing healthbestowing?  long shall he live who richly pays their service

Sanskrit: ka ī̍ṣate tu̱jyate̱ ko bi̍bhāya̱ ko ma̍ṁsate̱ santa̱m indra̱ṁ ko anti̍   kas to̱kāya̱ ka ibhā̍yo̱ta rā̱ye 'dhi̍ bravat ta̱nve̱3̱̍ ko janā̍ya
English: who fleeth forth? who suffereth? who feareth? who knoweth indra present indra near us?  who sendeth benediction on his offspring his household wealth and person and the people?

Sanskrit: ko a̱gnim ī̍ṭṭe ha̱viṣā̍ ghṛ̱tena̍ sru̱cā ya̍jātā ṛ̱tubhi̍r dhru̱vebhi̍ḥ   kasmai̍ de̱vā ā va̍hān ā̱śu homa̱ ko ma̍ṁsate vī̱tiho̍traḥ sude̱vaḥ
English: who with poured oil and offering honours agni with ladle worships at appointed seasons?  to whom to the gods bring oblation quickly? what offerer godfavoured knows him thoroughly?

Sanskrit: tvam a̱ṅga pra śa̍ṁsiṣo de̱vaḥ śa̍viṣṭha̱ martya̍m   na tvad a̱nyo ma̍ghavann asti marḍi̱tendra̱ bravī̍mi te̱ vaca̍ḥ
English: thou as a god o mightiest verily blessest mortal man  o maghavan there is no comforter but thou indra i speak my words to thee

Sanskrit: mā te̱ rādhā̍ṁsi̱ mā ta̍ ū̱tayo̍ vaso̱ 'smān kadā̍ ca̱nā da̍bhan   viśvā̍ ca na upamimī̱hi mā̍nuṣa̱ vasū̍ni carṣa̱ṇibhya̱ ā
English: let not thy bounteous gifts let not thy saving help fail us good lord at any time;  and measure out to us thou lover of mankind all riches hitherward from men

Sanskrit: aśvā̍vati pratha̱mo goṣu̍ gacchati suprā̱vīr i̍ndra̱ martya̱s tavo̱tibhi̍ḥ   tam it pṛ̍ṇakṣi̱ vasu̍nā̱ bhavī̍yasā̱ sindhu̱m āpo̱ yathā̱bhito̱ vice̍tasaḥ
English: indra the mortal man well guarded by thine aid goes foremost in the wealth of horses and of kine  with amplest wealth thou fillest him as round about the waters clearly seen afar fill sindhu full

Sanskrit: āpo̱ na de̱vīr upa̍ yanti ho̱triya̍m a̱vaḥ pa̍śyanti̱ vita̍ta̱ṁ yathā̱ raja̍ḥ   prā̱cair de̱vāsa̱ḥ pra ṇa̍yanti deva̱yum bra̍hma̱priya̍ṁ joṣayante va̱rā i̍va
English: the heavenly waters come not nigh the priestly bowl they but look down and see how far midair is spread  the deities conduct the pious man to them like suitors they delight in him who loveth prayer

Sanskrit: adhi̱ dvayo̍r adadhā u̱kthya1̱̍ṁ vaco̍ ya̱tasru̍cā mithu̱nā yā sa̍pa̱ryata̍ḥ   asa̍ṁyatto vra̱te te̍ kṣeti̱ puṣya̍ti bha̱drā śa̱ktir yaja̍mānāya sunva̱te
English: praiseworthy blessing hast thou laid upon the pair who with uplifted ladle serve thee man and wife  unchecked he dwells and prospers in thy law thy power brings blessing to the sacrificer pouring gifts

Sanskrit: ād aṅgi̍rāḥ pratha̱maṁ da̍dhire̱ vaya̍ i̱ddhāgna̍ya̱ḥ śamyā̱ ye su̍kṛ̱tyayā̍   sarva̍m pa̱ṇeḥ sam a̍vindanta̱ bhoja̍na̱m aśvā̍vanta̱ṁ goma̍nta̱m ā pa̱śuṁ nara̍ḥ
English: first the aṅgirases won themselves vital power whose fires were kindled through good deeds and sacrifice  the men together found the paṇi's hoarded wealth the cattle and the wealth in horses and in kine

Sanskrit: ya̱jñair atha̍rvā pratha̱maḥ pa̱thas ta̍te̱ tata̱ḥ sūryo̍ vrata̱pā ve̱na āja̍ni   ā gā ā̍jad u̱śanā̍ kā̱vyaḥ sacā̍ ya̱masya̍ jā̱tam a̱mṛta̍ṁ yajāmahe
English: atharvan first by sacrifices laid the paths then guardian of the law sprang up the loving sun  uśanā kāvya straightway hither drove the kine let us with offerings honour yama's deathless birth

Sanskrit: ba̱rhir vā̱ yat sva̍pa̱tyāya̍ vṛ̱jyate̱ 'rko vā̱ śloka̍m ā̱ghoṣa̍te di̱vi   grāvā̱ yatra̱ vada̍ti kā̱rur u̱kthya1̱̍s tasyed indro̍ abhipi̱tveṣu̍ raṇyati
English: when sacred grass is trimmed to aid the auspicious work or the hymn makes its voice of praise sound to the sky  where the stone rings as twere a singer skilled in laudindra in truth delights when these come near to him

Sanskrit: indro̱ madā̍ya vāvṛdhe̱ śava̍se vṛtra̱hā nṛbhi̍ḥ   tam in ma̱hatsv ā̱jiṣū̱tem arbhe̍ havāmahe̱ sa vāje̍ṣu̱ pra no̍ 'viṣat
English: the men have lifted indra up the vṛtra slayer to joy and strength  him verily we invocate in battles whether great or small be he our aid in deeds of might

Sanskrit: asi̱ hi vī̍ra̱ senyo 'si̱ bhūri̍ parāda̱diḥ   asi̍ da̱bhrasya̍ cid vṛ̱dho yaja̍mānāya śikṣasi sunva̱te bhūri̍ te̱ vasu̍
English: thou hero art a warrior thou art giver of abundant spoil  strengthening een the feeble thou aidest the sacrificer thou givest the offerer ample wealth

Sanskrit: yad u̱dīra̍ta ā̱jayo̍ dhṛ̱ṣṇave̍ dhīyate̱ dhanā̍   yu̱kṣvā ma̍da̱cyutā̱ harī̱ kaṁ hana̱ḥ kaṁ vasau̍ dadho̱ 'smām̐ i̍ndra̱ vasau̍ dadhaḥ
English: when war and battles are on foot booty is laid before the bold  yoke thou thy wildlyrushing bays whom wilt thou slay and whom enrich? do thou o indra make us rich

Sanskrit: kratvā̍ ma̱hām̐ a̍nuṣva̱dham bhī̱ma ā vā̍vṛdhe̱ śava̍ḥ   śri̱ya ṛ̱ṣva u̍pā̱kayo̱r ni śi̱prī hari̍vān dadhe̱ hasta̍yo̱r vajra̍m āya̱sam
English: mighty through wisdom as he lists terrible he hath waxed in strength  lord of bay steeds strongjawed sublime he in joined hands for glory's sake hath grasped his iron thunderbolt

Sanskrit: ā pa̍prau̱ pārthi̍va̱ṁ rajo̍ badba̱dhe ro̍ca̱nā di̱vi   na tvāvā̍m̐ indra̱ kaś ca̱na na jā̱to na ja̍niṣya̱te 'ti̱ viśva̍ṁ vavakṣitha
English: he filled the earthly atmosphere and pressed against the lights in heaven  none like thee ever hath been born none indra will be born like thee thou hast waxed mighty over all

Sanskrit: yo a̱ryo ma̍rta̱bhoja̍nam parā̱dadā̍ti dā̱śuṣe̍   indro̍ a̱smabhya̍ṁ śikṣatu̱ vi bha̍jā̱ bhūri̍ te̱ vasu̍ bhakṣī̱ya tava̱ rādha̍saḥ
English: may he who to the offerer gives the foeman's mansustaining food  may indra lend his aid to us deal forthabundant is thy wealththat in thy bounty i may share

Sanskrit: made̍made̱ hi no̍ da̱dir yū̱thā gavā̍m ṛju̱kratu̍ḥ   saṁ gṛ̍bhāya pu̱rū śa̱tobha̍yāha̱styā vasu̍ śiśī̱hi rā̱ya ā bha̍ra
English: he righteoushearted at each time of rapture gives us herds of kine  gather in both thy hands for us treasures of many hundred sorts sharpen thou us and bring us wealth

Sanskrit: mā̱daya̍sva su̱te sacā̱ śava̍se śūra̱ rādha̍se   vi̱dmā hi tvā̍ purū̱vasu̱m upa̱ kāmā̍n sasṛ̱jmahe 'thā̍ no 'vi̱tā bha̍va
English: refresh thee hero with the juice outpoured for bounty and for strength  we know thee lord of ample store to thee have sent our hearts' desires be therefore our protector thou

Sanskrit: e̱te ta̍ indra ja̱ntavo̱ viśva̍m puṣyanti̱ vārya̍m   a̱ntar hi khyo janā̍nām a̱ryo vedo̱ adā̍śuṣā̱ṁ teṣā̍ṁ no̱ veda̱ ā bha̍ra
English: these people indra keep for thee all that is worthy of thy choice  discover thou as lord the wealth of men who offer up no gifts bring thou to us this wealth of theirs

Sanskrit: upo̱ ṣu śṛ̍ṇu̱hī giro̱ magha̍va̱n māta̍thā iva   ya̱dā na̍ḥ sū̱nṛtā̍vata̱ḥ kara̱ ād a̱rthayā̍sa̱ id yojā̱ nv i̍ndra te̱ harī̍
English: graciously listen to our songs maghavan be not negligent  as thou hast made us full of joy and lettest us solicit thee now indra yoke thy two bay steeds

Sanskrit: akṣa̱nn amī̍madanta̱ hy ava̍ pri̱yā a̍dhūṣata   asto̍ṣata̱ svabhā̍navo̱ viprā̱ navi̍ṣṭhayā ma̱tī yojā̱ nv i̍ndra te̱ harī̍
English: well have they eaten and rejoiced; the friends have risen and passed away  the sages luminous in themselves have praised thee with their latest hymn now indra yoke thy two bay steeds

Sanskrit: su̱sa̱ṁdṛśa̍ṁ tvā va̱yam magha̍van vandiṣī̱mahi̍   pra nū̱nam pū̱rṇava̍ndhuraḥ stu̱to yā̍hi̱ vaśā̱m̐ anu̱ yojā̱ nv i̍ndra te̱ harī̍
English: maghavan we will reverence thee who art so fair to look upon  thus praised according to our wish come now with richly laden car now indra yoke thy two bay steeds

Sanskrit: sa ghā̱ taṁ vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ ratha̱m adhi̍ tiṣṭhāti go̱vida̍m   yaḥ pātra̍ṁ hāriyoja̱nam pū̱rṇam i̍ndra̱ cike̍tati̱ yojā̱ nv i̍ndra te̱ harī̍
English: he will in very truth ascend the powerful car that finds the kine  who thinks upon the wellfilled bowl the tawny coursers' harnesser now indra yoke thy two bay steeds

Sanskrit: yu̱ktas te̍ astu̱ dakṣi̍ṇa u̱ta sa̱vyaḥ śa̍takrato   tena̍ jā̱yām upa̍ pri̱yām ma̍ndā̱no yā̱hy andha̍so̱ yojā̱ nv i̍ndra te̱ harī̍
English: let lord of hundred powers thy steeds be harnessed on the right and left  therewith in rapture of the juice draw near to thy beloved spouse now indra yoke thy two bay steeds

Sanskrit: yu̱najmi̍ te̱ brahma̍ṇā ke̱śinā̱ harī̱ upa̱ pra yā̍hi dadhi̱ṣe gabha̍styoḥ   ut tvā̍ su̱tāso̍ rabha̱sā a̍mandiṣuḥ pūṣa̱ṇvān va̍jri̱n sam u̱ patnyā̍madaḥ
English: with holy prayer i yoke thy longmaned pair of bays come hitherward; thou holdest them in both thy hands  the stirring draughts of juice outpoured have made thee glad thou thunderer hast rejoiced with pūṣan and thy spouse

Sanskrit: i̱tthā hi soma̱ in made̍ bra̱hmā ca̱kāra̱ vardha̍nam   śavi̍ṣṭha vajri̱nn oja̍sā pṛthi̱vyā niḥ śa̍śā̱ ahi̱m arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: thus in the soma in wild joy the brahman hath exalted thee  thou mightiest thunderarmed hast driven by force the dragon from the earth lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: sa tvā̍mada̱d vṛṣā̱ mada̱ḥ soma̍ḥ śye̱nābhṛ̍taḥ su̱taḥ   yenā̍ vṛ̱traṁ nir a̱dbhyo ja̱ghantha̍ vajri̱nn oja̱sārca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: the mighty flowing somadraught brought by the hawk hath gladdened thee  that in thy strength o thunderer thou hast struck down vṛtra from the floods lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: prehy a̱bhī̍hi dhṛṣṇu̱hi na te̱ vajro̱ ni ya̍ṁsate   indra̍ nṛ̱mṇaṁ hi te̱ śavo̱ hano̍ vṛ̱traṁ jayā̍ a̱po 'rca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: go forward meet the foe be bold; thy bolt of thunder is not checked  manliness indra is thy might stay vṛtra make the waters thine lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: nir i̍ndra̱ bhūmyā̱ adhi̍ vṛ̱traṁ ja̍ghantha̱ nir di̱vaḥ   sṛ̱jā ma̱rutva̍tī̱r ava̍ jī̱vadha̍nyā i̱mā a̱po 'rca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: thou smotest vṛtra from the earth smotest him indra from the sky  let these lifefostering waters flow attended by the marut host lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: indro̍ vṛ̱trasya̱ dodha̍ta̱ḥ sānu̱ṁ vajre̍ṇa hīḻi̱taḥ   a̱bhi̱kramyāva̍ jighnate̱ 'paḥ sarmā̍ya co̱daya̱nn arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: the wrathful indra with his bolt of thunder rushing on the foe  smote fierce on trembling vṛtra's back and loosed the waters free to run lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: adhi̱ sānau̱ ni ji̍ghnate̱ vajre̍ṇa śa̱tapa̍rvaṇā   ma̱ndā̱na indro̱ andha̍sa̱ḥ sakhi̍bhyo gā̱tum i̍ccha̱ty arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: with hundredjointed thunderbolt indra hath struck him on the back  and while rejoicing in the juice seeketh prosperity for friends lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: indra̱ tubhya̱m id a̍dri̱vo 'nu̍ttaṁ vajrin vī̱rya̍m   yad dha̱ tyam mā̱yina̍m mṛ̱gaṁ tam u̱ tvam mā̱yayā̍vadhī̱r arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: indra unconquered might is thine thunderer caster of the stone;  for thou with thy surpassing power smotest to death the guileful beast lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: vi te̱ vajrā̍so asthiran nava̱tiṁ nā̱vyā̱3̱̍ anu̍   ma̱hat ta̍ indra vī̱rya̍m bā̱hvos te̱ bala̍ṁ hi̱tam arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: far over ninety spacious floods thy thunderbolts were cast abroad  great indra is thy hero might and strength is seated in thine arms lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: sa̱hasra̍ṁ sā̱kam a̍rcata̱ pari̍ ṣṭobhata viṁśa̱tiḥ   śa̱taina̱m anv a̍nonavu̱r indrā̍ya̱ brahmodya̍ta̱m arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: laud him a thousand all at once shout twenty forth the hymn of praise  hundreds have sung aloud to him to indra hath the prayer been raised lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: indro̍ vṛ̱trasya̱ tavi̍ṣī̱ṁ nir a̍ha̱n saha̍sā̱ saha̍ḥ   ma̱hat tad a̍sya̱ pauṁsya̍ṁ vṛ̱traṁ ja̍gha̱nvām̐ a̍sṛja̱d arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: indra hath smitten down the power of vṛtramight with stronger might  this was his manly exploit he slew vṛtra and let loose the floods lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: i̱me ci̱t tava̍ ma̱nyave̱ vepe̍te bhi̱yasā̍ ma̱hī   yad i̍ndra vajri̱nn oja̍sā vṛ̱tram ma̱rutvā̱m̐ ava̍dhī̱r arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: yea even this great pair of worlds trembled in terror at thy wrath  when indra thunderer marutgirt thou slewest vṛtra in thy strength lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: na vepa̍sā̱ na ta̍nya̱tendra̍ṁ vṛ̱tro vi bī̍bhayat   a̱bhy e̍na̱ṁ vajra̍ āya̱saḥ sa̱hasra̍bhṛṣṭir āya̱tārca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: but vṛtra scared not indra with his shaking or his thunder roar  on him that iron thunderbolt fell fiercely with its thousand points lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: yad vṛ̱traṁ tava̍ cā̱śani̱ṁ vajre̍ṇa sa̱mayo̍dhayaḥ   ahi̍m indra̱ jighā̍ṁsato di̱vi te̍ badbadhe̱ śavo 'rca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: when with the thunder thou didst make thy dart and vṛtra meet in war  thy might o indra fain to slay the dragon was set firm in heaven lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: a̱bhi̱ṣṭa̱ne te̍ adrivo̱ yat sthā jaga̍c ca rejate   tvaṣṭā̍ ci̱t tava̍ ma̱nyava̱ indra̍ vevi̱jyate̍ bhi̱yārca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: when at thy shout o thunderarmed each thing both fixed and moving shook  een tvaṣṭar trembled at thy wrath and quaked with fear because of thee lauding thine own imperial sway

Sanskrit: na̱hi nu yād a̍dhī̱masīndra̱ṁ ko vī̱ryā̍ pa̱raḥ   tasmi̍n nṛ̱mṇam u̱ta kratu̍ṁ de̱vā ojā̍ṁsi̱ saṁ da̍dhu̱r arca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: there is not in our knowledge one who passeth indra in his strength  in him the deities have stored manliness insight power and might lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: yām atha̍rvā̱ manu̍ṣ pi̱tā da̱dhyaṅ dhiya̱m atna̍ta   tasmi̱n brahmā̍ṇi pū̱rvathendra̍ u̱kthā sam a̍gma̱tārca̱nn anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m
English: still as of old whatever rite atharvan manus sire of all  dadhyach performed their prayer and praise united in that indra meet lauding his own imperial sway

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyakeśo̱ raja̍so visā̱re 'hi̱r dhuni̱r vāta̍ iva̱ dhrajī̍mān   śuci̍bhrājā u̱ṣaso̱ nave̍dā̱ yaśa̍svatīr apa̱syuvo̱ na sa̱tyāḥ
English: he in midair's expanse hath golden tresses; a raging serpent like the rushing tempest  purely refulgent knowing well the morning; like honourable dames true active workers

Sanskrit: ā te̍ supa̱rṇā a̍minanta̱m̐ evai̍ḥ kṛ̱ṣṇo no̍nāva vṛṣa̱bho yadī̱dam   śi̱vābhi̱r na smaya̍mānābhi̱r āgā̱t pata̍nti̱ miha̍ḥ sta̱naya̍nty a̱bhrā
English: thy wellwinged flashes strengthen in their manner when the black bull hath bellowed round about us  with drops that bless and seem to smile he cometh the waters fall the clouds utter their thunder

Sanskrit: yad ī̍m ṛ̱tasya̱ paya̍sā̱ piyā̍no̱ naya̍nn ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱thibhī̱ raji̍ṣṭhaiḥ   a̱rya̱mā mi̱tro varu̍ṇa̱ḥ pari̍jmā̱ tvaca̍m pṛñca̱nty upa̍rasya̱ yonau̍
English: when he comes streaming with the milk of worship conducting by directest paths of order  aryaman mitra varuṇa parijman fill the hide full where lies the nether pressstone

Sanskrit: agne̱ vāja̍sya̱ goma̍ta̱ īśā̍naḥ sahaso yaho   a̱sme dhe̍hi jātavedo̱ mahi̱ śrava̍ḥ
English: o agni thou who art the lord of wealth in kine thou son of strength  vouchsafe to us o jātavedas high renown

Sanskrit: sa i̍dhā̱no vasu̍ṣ ka̱vir a̱gnir ī̱ḻenyo̍ gi̱rā   re̱vad a̱smabhya̍m purvaṇīka dīdihi
English: he agni kindled good and wise must be exalted in our song  shine thou of many forms shine radiantly on us

Sanskrit: kṣa̱po rā̍jann u̱ta tmanāgne̱ vasto̍r u̱toṣasa̍ḥ   sa ti̍gmajambha ra̱kṣaso̍ daha̱ prati̍
English: o agni shining of thyself by night and when the morning breaks  burn thou whose teeth are sharp against the rākṣasas

Sanskrit: avā̍ no agna ū̱tibhi̍r gāya̱trasya̱ prabha̍rmaṇi   viśvā̍su dhī̱ṣu va̍ndya
English: adorable in all our rites favour us agni with thine aid  when the great hymn is chanted forth

Sanskrit: ā no̍ agne ra̱yim bha̍ra satrā̱sāha̱ṁ vare̍ṇyam   viśvā̍su pṛ̱tsu du̱ṣṭara̍m
English: bring to us everconquering wealth wealth agni worthy of our choice  in all our frays invincible

Sanskrit: ā no̍ agne suce̱tunā̍ ra̱yiṁ vi̱śvāyu̍poṣasam   mā̱rḍī̱kaṁ dhe̍hi jī̱vase̍
English: give us o agni through thy grace wealth that supporteth all our life  thy favour so that we may live

Sanskrit: pra pū̱tās ti̱gmaśo̍ciṣe̱ vāco̍ gotamā̱gnaye̍   bhara̍sva sumna̱yur gira̍ḥ
English: o gotama desiring bliss present thy songs composed with care  to agni of the pointed flames

Sanskrit: yo no̍ agne 'bhi̱dāsa̱ty anti̍ dū̱re pa̍dī̱ṣṭa saḥ   a̱smāka̱m id vṛ̱dhe bha̍va
English: may the man fall o agni who near or afar assaileth us  do thou increase and prosper us

Sanskrit: sa̱ha̱srā̱kṣo vica̍rṣaṇir a̱gnī rakṣā̍ṁsi sedhati   hotā̍ gṛṇīta u̱kthya̍ḥ
English: keen and swift agni thousandeyed chaseth the rākṣasas afar  he singeth herald meet for lauds

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tvā̱ gota̍mā gi̱rā jāta̍vedo̱ vica̍rṣaṇe   dyu̱mnair a̱bhi pra ṇo̍numaḥ
English: o jātavedas keen and swift we gotamas with sacred song exalt thee for thy glories' sake

Sanskrit: tam u̍ tvā̱ gota̍mo gi̱rā rā̱yaskā̍mo duvasyati   dyu̱mnair a̱bhi pra ṇo̍numaḥ
English: thee as thou art desiring wealth gotama worships with his song  we laud thee for thy glories' sake

Sanskrit: tam u̍ tvā vāja̱sāta̍mam aṅgira̱svad dha̍vāmahe   dyu̱mnair a̱bhi pra ṇo̍numaḥ
English: as such like aṅgiras we call on thee best winner of the spoil  we laud thee for thy glories' sake

Sanskrit: tam u̍ tvā vṛtra̱hanta̍ma̱ṁ yo dasyū̍m̐r avadhūnu̱ṣe   dyu̱mnair a̱bhi pra ṇo̍numaḥ
English: thee best of vṛtraslayers thee who shakest off our dasyu foes  we laud thee for thy glories' sake

Sanskrit: avo̍cāma̱ rahū̍gaṇā a̱gnaye̱ madhu̍ma̱d vaca̍ḥ   dyu̱mnair a̱bhi pra ṇo̍numaḥ
English: a pleasant song to agni we sons of rahūgaṅa have sung  we laud thee for thy glories' sake

Sanskrit: ka̱thā dā̍śemā̱gnaye̱ kāsmai̍ de̱vaju̍ṣṭocyate bhā̱mine̱ gīḥ   yo martye̍ṣv a̱mṛta̍ ṛ̱tāvā̱ hotā̱ yaji̍ṣṭha̱ it kṛ̱ṇoti̍ de̱vān
English: how shall we pay oblation unto agni? what hymn godloved is said to him refulgent?  who deathless true to law mid men a herald bringeth the gods as best of sacrificers?

Sanskrit: yo a̍dhva̱reṣu̱ śaṁta̍ma ṛ̱tāvā̱ hotā̱ tam ū̱ namo̍bhi̱r ā kṛ̍ṇudhvam   a̱gnir yad ver martā̍ya de̱vān sa cā̱ bodhā̍ti̱ mana̍sā yajāti
English: bring him with reverence hither most propitious in sacrifices true to law the herald;  for agni when he seeks the gods for mortals knows them full well and worships them in spirit

Sanskrit: sa hi kratu̱ḥ sa marya̱ḥ sa sā̱dhur mi̱tro na bhū̱d adbhu̍tasya ra̱thīḥ   tam medhe̍ṣu pratha̱maṁ de̍va̱yantī̱r viśa̱ upa̍ bruvate da̱smam ārī̍ḥ
English: for he is mental power a man and perfect; he is the bringer friendlike of the wondrous  the pious āryan tribes at sacrifices address them first to him who doeth marvels

Sanskrit: sa no̍ nṛ̱ṇāṁ nṛta̍mo ri̱śādā̍ a̱gnir giro 'va̍sā vetu dhī̱tim   tanā̍ ca̱ ye ma̱ghavā̍na̱ḥ śavi̍ṣṭhā̱ vāja̍prasūtā i̱ṣaya̍nta̱ manma̍
English: may agni foedestroyer manliest hero accept with love our hymns and our devotion  so may the liberal lords whose strength is strongest urged by their riches stir our thoughts with vigour

Sanskrit: e̱vāgnir gota̍mebhir ṛ̱tāvā̱ vipre̍bhir astoṣṭa jā̱tave̍dāḥ   sa e̍ṣu dyu̱mnam pī̍paya̱t sa vāja̱ṁ sa pu̱ṣṭiṁ yā̍ti̱ joṣa̱m ā ci̍ki̱tvān
English: thus agni jātavedas true to order hath by the priestly gotamas been lauded  may he augment in them splendour and vigour observant as he lists he gathers increase

Sanskrit: kā ta̱ upe̍ti̱r mana̍so̱ varā̍ya̱ bhuva̍d agne̱ śaṁta̍mā̱ kā ma̍nī̱ṣā   ko vā̍ ya̱jñaiḥ pari̱ dakṣa̍ṁ ta āpa̱ kena̍ vā te̱ mana̍sā dāśema
English: how may the mind draw nigh to please thee agni? what hymn of praise shall bring us greatest blessing?  or who hath gained thy power by sacrifices? or with what mind shall we bring thee oblations?

Sanskrit: ehy a̍gna i̱ha hotā̱ ni ṣī̱dāda̍bdha̱ḥ su pu̍rae̱tā bha̍vā naḥ   ava̍tāṁ tvā̱ roda̍sī viśvami̱nve yajā̍ ma̱he sau̍mana̱sāya̍ de̱vān
English: come hither agni; sit thee down as hotar; be thou who never wast deceived our leader  may heaven and earth the allpervading love thee worship the gods to win for us their favour

Sanskrit: pra su viśvā̍n ra̱kṣaso̱ dhakṣy a̍gne̱ bhavā̍ ya̱jñānā̍m abhiśasti̱pāvā̍   athā va̍ha̱ soma̍pati̱ṁ hari̍bhyām āti̱thyam a̍smai cakṛmā su̱dāvne̍
English: burn thou up all the rākṣasas o agni; ward thou off curses from our sacrifices  bring hither with his bays the lord of soma here is glad welcome for the bounteous giver

Sanskrit: pra̱jāva̍tā̱ vaca̍sā̱ vahni̍r ā̱sā ca̍ hu̱ve ni ca̍ satsī̱ha de̱vaiḥ   veṣi̍ ho̱tram u̱ta po̱traṁ ya̍jatra bo̱dhi pra̍yantar janita̱r vasū̍nām
English: thou priest with lip and voice that bring us children hast been invoked here with the gods be seated  thine is the task of cleanser and presenter waken us wealthbestower and producer

Sanskrit: yathā̱ vipra̍sya̱ manu̍ṣo ha̱virbhi̍r de̱vām̐ aya̍jaḥ ka̱vibhi̍ḥ ka̱viḥ san   e̱vā ho̍taḥ satyatara̱ tvam a̱dyāgne̍ ma̱ndrayā̍ ju̱hvā̍ yajasva
English: as with oblations of the priestly manus thou worshippedst the gods a sage with sages  so now o truthfullest invoker agni worship this day with joybestowing ladle

Sanskrit: ju̱ṣasva̍ sa̱pratha̍stama̱ṁ vaco̍ de̱vapsa̍rastamam   ha̱vyā juhvā̍na ā̱sani̍
English: accept our loudestsounding hymn food most delightful to the gods  pouring our offerings in thy mouth

Sanskrit: athā̍ te aṅgirasta̱māgne̍ vedhastama pri̱yam   vo̱cema̱ brahma̍ sāna̱si
English: now agni will we say to thee o wisest and best aṅgiras  our precious muchavailing prayer

Sanskrit: kas te̍ jā̱mir janā̍nā̱m agne̱ ko dā̱śva̍dhvaraḥ   ko ha̱ kasmi̍nn asi śri̱taḥ
English: who agni is thy kin of men? who is thy worthy worshipper?  on whom dependent? who art thou?

Sanskrit: tvaṁ jā̱mir janā̍nā̱m agne̍ mi̱tro a̍si pri̱yaḥ   sakhā̱ sakhi̍bhya̱ īḍya̍ḥ
English: the kinsman agni of mankind their well beloved friend art thou  a friend whom friends may supplicate

Sanskrit: yajā̍ no mi̱trāvaru̍ṇā̱ yajā̍ de̱vām̐ ṛ̱tam bṛ̱hat   agne̱ yakṣi̱ svaṁ dama̍m
English: bring to us mitra varuṇa bring the gods to mighty sacrifice  bring them o agni to thine home

Sanskrit: u̱pa̱pra̱yanto̍ adhva̱ram mantra̍ṁ vocemā̱gnaye̍   ā̱re a̱sme ca̍ śṛṇva̱te
English: as forth to sacrifice we go a hymn to a hymn let us say  who hears us even when afar;

Sanskrit: yaḥ snīhi̍tīṣu pū̱rvyaḥ sa̍ṁjagmā̱nāsu̍ kṛ̱ṣṭiṣu̍   ara̍kṣad dā̱śuṣe̱ gaya̍m
English: who from of old in carnage when the people gathered hath preserved  his household for the worshipper

Sanskrit: u̱ta bru̍vantu ja̱ntava̱ ud a̱gnir vṛ̍tra̱hāja̍ni   dha̱na̱ṁja̱yo raṇe̍raṇe
English: and let men say agni is born een he who slayeth vṛtra he  who winneth wealth in every fight

Sanskrit: yasya̍ dū̱to asi̱ kṣaye̱ veṣi̍ ha̱vyāni̍ vī̱taye̍   da̱smat kṛ̱ṇoṣy a̍dhva̱ram
English: him in whose house an envoy thou lovest to taste his offered gifts  and strengthenest his sacrifice

Sanskrit: tam it su̍ha̱vyam a̍ṅgiraḥ sude̱vaṁ sa̍haso yaho   janā̍ āhuḥ suba̱rhiṣa̍m
English: him aṅgiras thou son of strength all men call happy in his god  his offerings and his sacred grass

English: thee such in settlements secure o agni our men serve ever kindled in each dwelling  on him have they laid splendour in abundance dear to all men bearer be he of riches

English: may we and those who worship be the mortals whom thou o agni leadest on to riches  thou hast filled earth and heaven and air's midregion and followest the whole world like a shadow

English: the gods infallible all searching found not him the dear babe who still is round about us  worn weary following his track devoted they reached the lovely highest home of agni

English: because with holy oil the pure ones agni served thee the very pure three autumn seasons  therefore they won them holy names for worship and nobly born they dignified their bodies

English: making them known to spacious earth and heaven the holy ones revealed the powers of rudra  the mortal band discerning in the distance found agni standing in the loftiest station

English: nigh they approached oneminded with their spouses kneeling to him adorable paid worship  friend finding in his own friend's eye protection they made their own the bodies which they chastened

Sanskrit: triḥ sa̱pta yad guhyā̍ni̱ tve it pa̱dāvi̍da̱n nihi̍tā ya̱jñiyā̍saḥ   tebhī̍ rakṣante a̱mṛta̍ṁ sa̱joṣā̍ḥ pa̱śūñ ca̍ sthā̱tṝñ ca̱ratha̍ṁ ca pāhi
English: soon as the holy beings had discovered the thriceseven mystic things contained within thee  with these oneminded they preserve the amṛta guard thou the life of all their plants and cattle

English: when gods immortal made both eyes of heaven they gave to him the gift of beauteous glory  now they flow forth like rivers set in motion they knew the red steeds coming down o agni

English: agni is lord of riches for the man who serves him readily with sacred songs  protect these beings thou with careful thought knowing the races both of gods and men

Sanskrit: śrī̱ṇann upa̍ sthā̱d diva̍m bhura̱ṇyuḥ sthā̱tuś ca̱ratha̍m a̱ktūn vy ū̍rṇot
English: commingling restless he ascends the sky unveiling nights and all that stands or moves  as he the sole god is preeminent in greatness among all these other gods

Sanskrit: pari̱ yad e̍ṣā̱m eko̱ viśve̍ṣā̱m bhuva̍d de̱vo de̱vānā̍m mahi̱tvā
English: all men are joyful in thy power o god that living from the dry wood thou art born  all truly share thy godhead while they keep in their accustomed ways eternal law

Sanskrit: ād it te̱ viśve̱ kratu̍ṁ juṣanta̱ śuṣkā̱d yad de̍va jī̱vo jani̍ṣṭhāḥ
English: strong is the thought of law the law's behest; all works have they performed; he quickens all  whoso will bring oblation gifts to thee to him bethinking thee vouchsafe thou wealth

English: seated as priest with manu's progeny of all these treasures he alone is lord  men yearn for children to prolong their line and are not disappointed in their hope

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tasya̱ preṣā̍ ṛ̱tasya̍ dhī̱tir vi̱śvāyu̱r viśve̱ apā̍ṁsi cakruḥ
English: eagerly they who hear his word fulfil his wish as sons obey their sire's behest  he rich in food unbars his wealth like doors he the housefriend hath decked heaven's vault with stars

Sanskrit: vane̍ṣu jā̱yur marte̍ṣu mi̱tro vṛ̍ṇī̱te śru̱ṣṭiṁ rāje̍vāju̱ryam
English: victorious in the wood friend among men ever he claims obedience as a king  gracious like peace blessing like mental power priest was he offeringbearer full of thought

Sanskrit: kṣemo̱ na sā̱dhuḥ kratu̱r na bha̱dro bhuva̍t svā̱dhīr hotā̍ havya̱vāṭ
English: he bearing in his hand all manly might crouched in the cavern struck the gods with fear  men filled with understanding find him there when they have sting prayers formed within their heart

Sanskrit: haste̱ dadhā̍no nṛ̱mṇā viśvā̱ny ame̍ de̱vān dhā̱d guhā̍ ni̱ṣīda̍n
English: he like the unborn holds the broad earth up; and with effective utterance fixed the sky  o agni guard the spots which cattle love thou life of all hast gone from lair to lair

Sanskrit: vi̱dantī̱m atra̱ naro̍ dhiya̱ṁdhā hṛ̱dā yat ta̱ṣṭān mantrā̱m̐ aśa̍ṁsan
English: whoso hath known him dwelling in his lair and hath approached the stream of holy law  they who release him paying sacred ritestruly to such doth he announce great wealth

Sanskrit: a̱jo na kṣāṁ dā̱dhāra̍ pṛthi̱vīṁ ta̱stambha̱ dyām mantre̍bhiḥ sa̱tyaiḥ
English: he who grows mightily in herbs within each fruitful mother and each babe she bears  wise life of all men in the waters homefor him have sages built as twere a seat

Sanskrit: ra̱yir na ci̱trā sūro̱ na sa̱ṁdṛg āyu̱r na prā̱ṇo nityo̱ na sū̱nuḥ
English: like the sun's glance like wealth of varied sort like breath which is the life like one's own son  like a swift bird a cow who yields her milk pure and refulgent to the wood he speeds

Sanskrit: takvā̱ na bhūrṇi̱r vanā̍ siṣakti̱ payo̱ na dhe̱nuḥ śuci̍r vi̱bhāvā̍
English: he offers safety like a pleasant home like ripened corn the conqueror of men  like a seer lauding famed among the folk; like a steed friendly he vouchsafes us power

Sanskrit: dā̱dhāra̱ kṣema̱m oko̱ na ra̱ṇvo yavo̱ na pa̱kvo jetā̱ janā̍nām
English: with flame insatiate like eternal might; caring for each one like a dame at home;  bright when he shines forth whitish mid the folk like a car golddecked thundering to the fight

Sanskrit: ṛṣi̱r na stubhvā̍ vi̱kṣu pra̍śa̱sto vā̱jī na prī̱to vayo̍ dadhāti
English: he strikes with terror like a dart shot forth een like an archer's arrow tipped with flame;  master of present and of future life the maidens lover and the matrons lord

Sanskrit: du̱roka̍śoci̱ḥ kratu̱r na nityo̍ jā̱yeva̱ yonā̱v ara̱ṁ viśva̍smai
English: to him lead all your ways may we attain the kindled god as cows their home at eve  he drives the flames below as floods their swell the rays rise up to the fair place of heaven

Sanskrit: pa̱śvā na tā̱yuṁ guhā̱ cata̍nta̱ṁ namo̍ yujā̱naṁ namo̱ vaha̍ntam
English: oneminded wise they tracked thee like a thief lurking in dark cave with a stolen cow  thee claiming worship bearing it to gods there nigh to thee sate all the holy ones

Sanskrit: sa̱joṣā̱ dhīrā̍ḥ pa̱dair anu̍ gma̱nn upa̍ tvā sīda̱n viśve̱ yaja̍trāḥ
English: the gods approached the ways of holy law; there was a gathering vast as heaven itself  the waters feed with praise the growing babe born nobly in the womb the seat of law

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tasya̍ de̱vā anu̍ vra̱tā gu̱r bhuva̱t pari̍ṣṭi̱r dyaur na bhūma̍
English: like grateful food like some wide dwelling place like a fruitbearing hill a wholesome stream  like a steed urged to run in swift career rushing like sindhu who may check his course?

Sanskrit: vardha̍ntī̱m āpa̍ḥ pa̱nvā suśi̍śvim ṛ̱tasya̱ yonā̱ garbhe̱ sujā̍tam
English: kin as a brother to his sister floods he eats the woods as a king eats the rich  when through the forest urged by wind he spreads verily agni shears the hair of earth

Sanskrit: pu̱ṣṭir na ra̱ṇvā kṣi̱tir na pṛ̱thvī gi̱rir na bhujma̱ kṣodo̱ na śa̱mbhu
English: like a swan sitting in the floods he pants wisest in mind mid men he wakes at morn  a sage like soma sprung from law he grew like some young creature mighty shining far

Sanskrit: tvam ma̱hām̐ i̍ndra̱ yo ha̱ śuṣmai̱r dyāvā̍ jajñā̱naḥ pṛ̍thi̱vī ame̍ dhāḥ   yad dha̍ te̱ viśvā̍ gi̱raya̍ś ci̱d abhvā̍ bhi̱yā dṛ̱ḻhāsa̍ḥ ki̱raṇā̱ naija̍n
English: thou art the mighty one; when born o indra with power thou terrifiedst earth and heaven;  when in their fear of thee all firmset mountains and monstrous creatures shook like dust before thee

Sanskrit: ā yad dharī̍ indra̱ vivra̍tā̱ ver ā te̱ vajra̍ṁ jari̱tā bā̱hvor dhā̍t   yenā̍viharyatakrato a̱mitrā̱n pura̍ i̱ṣṇāsi̍ puruhūta pū̱rvīḥ
English: when thy two wandering bays thou drawest hither thy praiser laid within thine arms the thunder  wherewith o muchinvoked in will resistless thou smitest foemen down and many a castle

Sanskrit: tvaṁ sa̱tya i̍ndra dhṛ̱ṣṇur e̱tān tvam ṛ̍bhu̱kṣā narya̱s tvaṁ ṣāṭ   tvaṁ śuṣṇa̍ṁ vṛ̱jane̍ pṛ̱kṣa ā̱ṇau yūne̱ kutsā̍ya dyu̱mate̱ sacā̍han
English: faithful art thou these thou defiest indra; thou art the ṛbhus' lord heroic victor  thou by his side for young and glorious kutsa with steed and car in battle slewest śuṣṇa

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ha̱ tyad i̍ndra codī̱ḥ sakhā̍ vṛ̱traṁ yad va̍jrin vṛṣakarmann u̱bhnāḥ   yad dha̍ śūra vṛṣamaṇaḥ parā̱cair vi dasyū̱m̐r yonā̱v akṛ̍to vṛthā̱ṣāṭ
English: that as a friend thou furtheredst o indra when thunderer strong in act thou crushedst vṛtra;  when hero thou greatsouled with easy conquest didst rend the dasyus in their  distant dwelling

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ha̱ tyad i̱ndrāri̍ṣaṇyan dṛ̱ḻhasya̍ ci̱n martā̍nā̱m aju̍ṣṭau   vy a1̱̍smad ā kāṣṭhā̱ arva̍te var gha̱neva̍ vajriñ chnathihy a̱mitrā̍n
English: this doest thou and art not harmed o indra een in the anger of the strongest mortal  lay thou the racecourse open for our horses as with a club slay thunderarmed! our foemen

Sanskrit: tvāṁ ha̱ tyad i̱ndrārṇa̍sātau̱ sva̍rmīḻhe̱ nara̍ ā̱jā ha̍vante   tava̍ svadhāva i̱yam ā sa̍ma̱rya ū̱tir vāje̍ṣv ata̱sāyyā̍ bhūt
English: hence men invoke thee indra in the tumult of battle in the lightbestowing conflict  this aid of thine o godlike one was ever to be implored in deeds of might in combat

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ha̱ tyad i̍ndra sa̱pta yudhya̱n puro̍ vajrin puru̱kutsā̍ya dardaḥ   ba̱rhir na yat su̱dāse̱ vṛthā̱ varg a̱ṁho rā̍ja̱n vari̍vaḥ pū̱rave̍ kaḥ
English: warring for purukutsa thou o indra thunderarmed! breakest down the seven castles;  easily for sudās like grass didst rend them and out of need king broughtest gain to pūru

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tyāṁ na̍ indra deva ci̱trām iṣa̱m āpo̱ na pī̍paya̱ḥ pari̍jman   yayā̍ śūra̱ praty a̱smabhya̱ṁ yaṁsi̱ tmana̱m ūrja̱ṁ na vi̱śvadha̱ kṣara̍dhyai
English: o indra god who movest round about us feed us with varied food plenteous as water  food wherewithal o hero thou bestowest vigour itself to flow to us for ever

Sanskrit: akā̍ri ta indra̱ gota̍mebhi̱r brahmā̱ṇy oktā̱ nama̍sā̱ hari̍bhyām   su̱peśa̍sa̱ṁ vāja̱m ā bha̍rā naḥ prā̱tar ma̱kṣū dhi̱yāva̍sur jagamyāt
English: prayers have been made by gotamas o indra addressed to thee with laud for thy bay horses  bring us in noble shape abundant riches may he enriched with prayer come soon and early

Sanskrit: pra ma̍nmahe śavasā̱nāya̍ śū̱ṣam ā̍ṅgū̱ṣaṁ girva̍ṇase aṅgira̱svat   su̱vṛ̱ktibhi̍ḥ stuva̱ta ṛ̍gmi̱yāyārcā̍mā̱rkaṁ nare̱ viśru̍tāya
English: like aṅgiras a gladdening laud we ponder to him who loveth song exceeding mighty  let us sing glory to the farfamed hero who must be praised with fair hymns by the singer

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ ma̱he mahi̱ namo̍ bharadhvam āṅgū̱ṣya̍ṁ śavasā̱nāya̱ sāma̍   yenā̍ na̱ḥ pūrve̍ pi̱tara̍ḥ pada̱jñā arca̍nto̱ aṅgi̍raso̱ gā avi̍ndan
English: unto the great bring ye great adoration a chant with praise to him exceeding mighty  through whom our sires aṅgirases singing praises and knowing well the places found the cattle

Sanskrit: indra̱syāṅgi̍rasāṁ ce̱ṣṭau vi̱dat sa̱ramā̱ tana̍yāya dhā̱sim   bṛha̱spati̍r bhi̱nad adri̍ṁ vi̱dad gāḥ sam u̱sriyā̍bhir vāvaśanta̱ nara̍ḥ
English: when indra and the aṅgirases desired it saramā found provision for her offspring  bṛhaspati cleft the mountain found the cattle the heroes shouted with the kine in triumph

Sanskrit: sa su̱ṣṭubhā̱ sa stu̱bhā sa̱pta viprai̍ḥ sva̱reṇādri̍ṁ sva̱ryo̱3̱̍ nava̍gvaiḥ   sa̱ra̱ṇyubhi̍ḥ phali̱gam i̍ndra śakra va̱laṁ rave̍ṇa darayo̱ daśa̍gvaiḥ
English: mid shout loud shout and roar with the navagvas seven singers hast thou heavenly rent the mountain;  thou hast with speeders with daśagvas indra śakra with thunder rent obstructive vala

Sanskrit: gṛ̱ṇā̱no aṅgi̍robhir dasma̱ vi va̍r u̱ṣasā̱ sūrye̍ṇa̱ gobhi̱r andha̍ḥ   vi bhūmyā̍ aprathaya indra̱ sānu̍ di̱vo raja̱ upa̍ram astabhāyaḥ
English: praised by aṅgirases thou foedestroyer hast with the dawn sun rays dispelled the darkness  thou indra hast spread out the earth's high ridges and firmly fixed the region under heaven

Sanskrit: tad u̱ praya̍kṣatamam asya̱ karma̍ da̱smasya̱ cāru̍tamam asti̱ daṁsa̍ḥ   u̱pa̱hva̱re yad upa̍rā̱ api̍nva̱n madhva̍rṇaso na̱dya1̱̍ś cata̍sraḥ
English: this is the deed most worthy of all honour the fairest marvel of the wonderworker  that nigh where heaven bends down he made four rivers flow full with waves that carry down sweet water

Sanskrit: dvi̱tā vi va̍vre sa̱najā̱ sanī̍ḻe a̱yāsya̱ḥ stava̍mānebhir a̱rkaiḥ   bhago̱ na mene̍ para̱me vyo̍ma̱nn adhā̍raya̱d roda̍sī su̱daṁsā̍ḥ
English: unwearied won with lauding hymns he parted of old the ancient pair united ever  in highest sky like bhaga he the doer of marvels set both dames and earth and heaven

Sanskrit: sa̱nād diva̱m pari̱ bhūmā̱ virū̍pe puna̱rbhuvā̍ yuva̱tī svebhi̱r evai̍ḥ   kṛ̱ṣṇebhi̍r a̱ktoṣā ruśa̍dbhi̱r vapu̍rbhi̱r ā ca̍rato a̱nyānyā̍
English: still born afresh young dames each in her manner unlike in hue the pair in alternation  round heaven and earth from ancient time have travelled night with her dark limbs dawn with limbs of splendour

Sanskrit: sane̍mi sa̱khyaṁ sva̍pa̱syamā̍naḥ sū̱nur dā̍dhāra̱ śava̍sā su̱daṁsā̍ḥ   ā̱māsu̍ cid dadhiṣe pa̱kvam a̱ntaḥ paya̍ḥ kṛ̱ṣṇāsu̱ ruśa̱d rohi̍ṇīṣu
English: rich in good actions skilled in operation the son with might maintains his perfect friendship  thou in the raw cows black of hue or ruddy storest the ripe milk glossy white in colour

Sanskrit: sa̱nāt sanī̍ḻā a̱vanī̍r avā̱tā vra̱tā ra̍kṣante a̱mṛtā̱ḥ saho̍bhiḥ   pu̱rū sa̱hasrā̱ jana̍yo̱ na patnī̍r duva̱syanti̱ svasā̍ro̱ ahra̍yāṇam
English: their paths of old connected rest uninjured; they with great might preserve the immortal statutes  for many thousand holy works the sisters wait on the haughty lord like wives and matrons

Sanskrit: sa̱nā̱yuvo̱ nama̍sā̱ navyo̍ a̱rkair va̍sū̱yavo̍ ma̱tayo̍ dasma dadruḥ   pati̱ṁ na patnī̍r uśa̱tīr u̱śanta̍ṁ spṛ̱śanti̍ tvā śavasāvan manī̱ṣāḥ
English: thoughts ancient seeking wealth with adoration with newest lauds have sped to thee o mighty  as yearning wives cleave to their yearning husband so cleave our hymns to thee o lord most potent

Sanskrit: sa̱nād e̱va tava̱ rāyo̱ gabha̍stau̱ na kṣīya̍nte̱ nopa̍ dasyanti dasma   dyu̱mām̐ a̍si̱ kratu̍mām̐ indra̱ dhīra̱ḥ śikṣā̍ śacīva̱s tava̍ na̱ḥ śacī̍bhiḥ
English: strong god the riches which thy hands have holden from days of old have perished not nor wasted  splendid art thou o indra wise unbending strengthen us with might o lord of power

Sanskrit: sa̱nā̱ya̱te gota̍ma indra̱ navya̱m ata̍kṣa̱d brahma̍ hari̱yoja̍nāya   su̱nī̱thāya̍ naḥ śavasāna no̱dhāḥ prā̱tar ma̱kṣū dhi̱yāva̍sur jagamyāt
English: o mighty indra gotama's son nodhas hath fashioned this new prayer to thee eternal  sure leader yoker of the tawny coursers may he enriched with prayer come soon and early

Sanskrit: vṛṣṇe̱ śardhā̍ya̱ suma̍khāya ve̱dhase̱ nodha̍ḥ suvṛ̱ktim pra bha̍rā ma̱rudbhya̍ḥ   a̱po na dhīro̱ mana̍sā su̱hastyo̱ gira̱ḥ sam a̍ñje vi̱dathe̍ṣv ā̱bhuva̍ḥ
English: bring for the manly host wise and majestical o nodhas for the maruts bring thou a pure gift  i deck my songs as one defthanded wise in mind prepares the water that hath power in solemn rites

Sanskrit: te ja̍jñire di̱va ṛ̱ṣvāsa̍ u̱kṣaṇo̍ ru̱drasya̱ maryā̱ asu̍rā are̱pasa̍ḥ   pā̱va̱kāsa̱ḥ śuca̍ya̱ḥ sūryā̍ iva̱ satvā̍no̱ na dra̱psino̍ gho̱rava̍rpasaḥ
English: they spring to birth the lofty ones the bulls of heaven divine the youths of rudra free from spot and stain;  the purifiers shining brightly even as suns awful of form like giants scattering raindrops down

Sanskrit: yuvā̍no ru̱drā a̱jarā̍ abho̱gghano̍ vava̱kṣur adhri̍gāva̱ḥ parva̍tā iva   dṛ̱ḻhā ci̱d viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ pārthi̍vā̱ pra cyā̍vayanti di̱vyāni̍ ma̱jmanā̍
English: young rudras demonslayers never growing old they have waxed even as mountains irresistible  they make all beings tremble with their mighty strength even the very strongest both of earth and heaven

Sanskrit: ci̱trair a̱ñjibhi̱r vapu̍ṣe̱ vy a̍ñjate̱ vakṣa̍ḥsu ru̱kmām̐ adhi̍ yetire śu̱bhe   aṁse̍ṣv eṣā̱ṁ ni mi̍mṛkṣur ṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ sā̱kaṁ ja̍jñire sva̱dhayā̍ di̱vo nara̍ḥ
English: with glittering ornaments they deck them forth for show; for beauty on their breasts they bind their chains of gold  the lances on their shoulders pound to pieces; they were born together of themselves the men of heaven

Sanskrit: ī̱śā̱na̱kṛto̱ dhuna̍yo ri̱śāda̍so̱ vātā̍n vi̱dyuta̱s tavi̍ṣībhir akrata   du̱hanty ūdha̍r di̱vyāni̱ dhūta̍yo̱ bhūmi̍m pinvanti̱ paya̍sā̱ pari̍jrayaḥ
English: loud roarers giving strength devourers of the foe they make the winds they make the lightnings with their powers  the restless shakers drain the udders of the sky and ever wandering round fill the earth full with milk

Sanskrit: pinva̍nty a̱po ma̱ruta̍ḥ su̱dāna̍va̱ḥ payo̍ ghṛ̱tava̍d vi̱dathe̍ṣv ā̱bhuva̍ḥ   atya̱ṁ na mi̱he vi na̍yanti vā̱jina̱m utsa̍ṁ duhanti sta̱naya̍nta̱m akṣi̍tam
English: the bounteous maruts with the fatness dropping milk fill full the waters which avail in solemn rites  they lead as twere the strong horse forth that it may rain they milk the thundering the neverfailing spring

Sanskrit: ma̱hi̱ṣāso̍ mā̱yina̍ś ci̱trabhā̍navo gi̱rayo̱ na svata̍vaso raghu̱ṣyada̍ḥ   mṛ̱gā i̍va ha̱stina̍ḥ khādathā̱ vanā̱ yad āru̍ṇīṣu̱ tavi̍ṣī̱r ayu̍gdhvam
English: mighty with wondrous power and marvellously bright selfstrong like mountains ye glide swiftly on your way  like the wild elephants ye eat the forests up when ye assume your strength among the bright red flames

Sanskrit: si̱ṁhā i̍va nānadati̱ prace̍tasaḥ pi̱śā i̍va su̱piśo̍ vi̱śvave̍dasaḥ   kṣapo̱ jinva̍nta̱ḥ pṛṣa̍tībhir ṛ̱ṣṭibhi̱ḥ sam it sa̱bādha̱ḥ śava̱sāhi̍manyavaḥ
English: exceeding wise they roar like lions mightily they allpossessing are beauteous as antelopes;  stirring the darkness with lances and spotted deer combined as priests with serpents' fury through their might

Sanskrit: roda̍sī̱ ā va̍datā gaṇaśriyo̱ nṛṣā̍caḥ śūrā̱ḥ śava̱sāhi̍manyavaḥ   ā va̱ndhure̍ṣv a̱mati̱r na da̍rśa̱tā vi̱dyun na ta̍sthau maruto̱ rathe̍ṣu vaḥ
English: heroes who march in companies befriending man with serpents' ire through strength ye greet the earth and heaven  upon the seats o maruts of your chariots upon the cars stands lightning visible as light

Sanskrit: vi̱śvave̍daso ra̱yibhi̱ḥ samo̍kasa̱ḥ sammi̍ślāsa̱s tavi̍ṣībhir vira̱pśina̍ḥ   astā̍ra̱ iṣu̍ṁ dadhire̱ gabha̍styor ana̱ntaśu̍ṣmā̱ vṛṣa̍khādayo̱ nara̍ḥ
English: lords of all riches dwelling in the home of wealth endowed with mighty vigour singers loud of voice  heroes of powers infinite armed with strong men's rings the archers they have laid the arrow on their arms

Sanskrit: hi̱ra̱ṇyaye̍bhiḥ pa̱vibhi̍ḥ payo̱vṛdha̱ ujji̍ghnanta āpa̱thyo̱3̱̍ na parva̍tān   ma̱khā a̱yāsa̍ḥ sva̱sṛto̍ dhruva̱cyuto̍ dudhra̱kṛto̍ ma̱ruto̱ bhrāja̍dṛṣṭayaḥ
English: they who with golden fellies make the rain increase drive forward the big clouds like wanderers on the way  selfmoving brisk unwearied they oerthrow the firm; the maruts with bright lances make all things to reel

Sanskrit: ghṛṣu̍m pāva̱kaṁ va̱nina̱ṁ vica̍rṣaṇiṁ ru̱drasya̍ sū̱nuṁ ha̱vasā̍ gṛṇīmasi   ra̱ja̱stura̍ṁ ta̱vasa̱m māru̍taṁ ga̱ṇam ṛ̍jī̱ṣiṇa̱ṁ vṛṣa̍ṇaṁ saścata śri̱ye
English: the progeny of rudra we invoke with prayer the brisk the bright the worshipful the active ones  to the strong band of maruts cleave for happiness the chasers of the sky impetuous vigorous

Sanskrit: pra nū sa marta̱ḥ śava̍sā̱ janā̱m̐ ati̍ ta̱sthau va̍ ū̱tī ma̍ruto̱ yam āva̍ta   arva̍dbhi̱r vāja̍m bharate̱ dhanā̱ nṛbhi̍r ā̱pṛcchya̱ṁ kratu̱m ā kṣe̍ti̱ puṣya̍ti
English: maruts the man whom ye have guarded with your help he verily in strength surpasseth all mankind  spoil with his steeds he gaineth treasure with his men; he winneth honourable strength and prospereth

Sanskrit: ca̱rkṛtya̍m marutaḥ pṛ̱tsu du̱ṣṭara̍ṁ dyu̱manta̱ṁ śuṣma̍m ma̱ghava̍tsu dhattana   dha̱na̱spṛta̍m u̱kthya̍ṁ vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇiṁ to̱kam pu̍ṣyema̱ tana̍yaṁ śa̱taṁ himā̍ḥ
English: o maruts to the worshippers give glorious strength invincible in battle brilliant bringing wealth  praiseworthy known to all men may we foster well during a hundred winters son and progeny

Sanskrit: nū ṣṭhi̱ram ma̍ruto vī̱rava̍ntam ṛtī̱ṣāha̍ṁ ra̱yim a̱smāsu̍ dhatta   sa̱ha̱sriṇa̍ṁ śa̱tina̍ṁ śūśu̱vāṁsa̍m prā̱tar ma̱kṣū dhi̱yāva̍sur jagamyāt
English: will ye then o ye maruts grant us riches durable rich in men defying onslaught  a hundred thousandfold ever increasing? may he enriched with prayer come soon and early

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ pra ta̱vase̍ tu̱rāya̱ prayo̱ na ha̍rmi̱ stoma̱m māhi̍nāya   ṛcī̍ṣamā̱yādhri̍gava̱ oha̱m indrā̍ya̱ brahmā̍ṇi rā̱tata̍mā
English: even to him swift strong and high exalted i bring my song of praise as dainty viands  my thought to him resistless praisedeserving prayers offered most especially to indra

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ praya̍ iva̱ pra ya̍ṁsi̱ bharā̍my āṅgū̱ṣam bādhe̍ suvṛ̱kti   indrā̍ya hṛ̱dā mana̍sā manī̱ṣā pra̱tnāya̱ patye̱ dhiyo̍ marjayanta
English: praise like oblation i present and utter aloud my song my fair hymn to the victor  for indra who is lord of old the singers have decked their lauds with heart and mind and spirit

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ tyam u̍pa̱maṁ sva̱rṣām bharā̍my āṅgū̱ṣam ā̱sye̍na   maṁhi̍ṣṭha̱m accho̍ktibhir matī̱nāṁ su̍vṛ̱ktibhi̍ḥ sū̱riṁ vā̍vṛ̱dhadhyai̍
English: to him then with my lips mine adoration winning heaven's light most excellent i offer  to magnify with songs of invocation and with fair hymns the lord most bounteous giver

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ stoma̱ṁ saṁ hi̍nomi̱ ratha̱ṁ na taṣṭe̍va̱ tatsi̍nāya   gira̍ś ca̱ girvā̍hase suvṛ̱ktīndrā̍ya viśvami̱nvam medhi̍rāya
English: even for him i frame a laud as fashions the wright a chariot for the man who needs it  praises to him who gladly hears our praises a hymn wellformed allmoving to wise indra

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ sapti̍m iva śrava̱syendrā̍yā̱rkaṁ ju̱hvā̱3̱̍ sam a̍ñje   vī̱raṁ dā̱nauka̍saṁ va̱ndadhyai̍ pu̱rāṁ gū̱rtaśra̍vasaṁ da̱rmāṇa̍m
English: so with my tongue i deck to please that indra my hymn as twere a horse through love of glory  to reverence the hero bounteous giver famed far and wide destroyer of the castles

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ tvaṣṭā̍ takṣa̱d vajra̱ṁ svapa̍stamaṁ sva̱rya1̱̍ṁ raṇā̍ya   vṛ̱trasya̍ cid vi̱dad yena̱ marma̍ tu̱jann īśā̍nas tuja̱tā ki̍ye̱dhāḥ
English: even for him hath tvaṣṭar forged the thunder most deftly wrought celestial for the battle  wherewith he reached the vital parts of vṛtra strikingthe vast the mighty with the striker

Sanskrit: a̱syed u̍ mā̱tuḥ sava̍neṣu sa̱dyo ma̱haḥ pi̱tum pa̍pi̱vāñ cārv annā̍   mu̱ṣā̱yad viṣṇu̍ḥ paca̱taṁ sahī̍yā̱n vidhya̍d varā̱haṁ ti̱ro adri̱m astā̍
English: as soon as at libations of his mother great viṣṇu had drunk up the draught he plundered  the dainty cates the cooked mess; but one stronger transfixed the wild boar shooting through the mountain

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ gnāś ci̍d de̱vapa̍tnī̱r indrā̍yā̱rkam a̍hi̱hatya̍ ūvuḥ   pari̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī ja̍bhra u̱rvī nāsya̱ te ma̍hi̱māna̱m pari̍ ṣṭaḥ
English: to him to indra when he slew the dragon the dames too consorts of the gods wove praises  the mighty heaven and earth hath he encompassed thy greatness heaven and earth combined exceed not

Sanskrit: a̱syed e̱va pra ri̍rice mahi̱tvaṁ di̱vas pṛ̍thi̱vyāḥ pary a̱ntari̍kṣāt   sva̱rāḻ indro̱ dama̱ ā vi̱śvagū̍rtaḥ sva̱rir ama̍tro vavakṣe̱ raṇā̍ya
English: yea of a truth his magnitude surpasseth the magnitude of earth midair and heaven  indra approved by all men selfresplendent waxed in his home loudvoiced and strong for battle

Sanskrit: a̱syed e̱va śava̍sā śu̱ṣanta̱ṁ vi vṛ̍śca̱d vajre̍ṇa vṛ̱tram indra̍ḥ   gā na vrā̱ṇā a̱vanī̍r amuñcad a̱bhi śravo̍ dā̱vane̱ sace̍tāḥ
English: through his own strength indra with bolt of thunder cut piecemeal vṛtra drier up of waters  he let the floods go free like cows imprisoned for glory with a heart inclined to bounty

Sanskrit: a̱syed u̍ tve̱ṣasā̍ ranta̱ sindha̍va̱ḥ pari̱ yad vajre̍ṇa sī̱m aya̍cchat   ī̱śā̱na̱kṛd dā̱śuṣe̍ daśa̱syan tu̱rvīta̍ye gā̱dhaṁ tu̱rvaṇi̍ḥ kaḥ
English: the rivers played through his impetuous splendour since with his bolt he compassed them on all sides  using his might and favouring him who worshipped he made a ford victorious for turvīti

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ pra bha̍rā̱ tūtu̍jāno vṛ̱trāya̱ vajra̱m īśā̍naḥ kiye̱dhāḥ   gor na parva̱ vi ra̍dā tira̱śceṣya̱nn arṇā̍ṁsy a̱pāṁ ca̱radhyai̍
English: vast with thine ample power with eager movement against this vṛtra cast thy bolt of thunder  rend thou his joints as of an ox dissevered with bolt oblique that floods of rain may follow

Sanskrit: a̱syed u̱ pra brū̍hi pū̱rvyāṇi̍ tu̱rasya̱ karmā̍ṇi̱ navya̍ u̱kthaiḥ   yu̱dhe yad i̍ṣṇā̱na āyu̍dhāny ṛghā̱yamā̍ṇo niri̱ṇāti̱ śatrū̍n
English: sing with new lauds his exploits wrought aforetime the deeds of him yea him who moveth swiftly  when hurling forth his weapons in the battle he with impetuous wrath lays low the foemen

Sanskrit: a̱syed u̍ bhi̱yā gi̱raya̍ś ca dṛ̱ḻhā dyāvā̍ ca̱ bhūmā̍ ja̱nuṣa̍s tujete   upo̍ ve̱nasya̱ jogu̍vāna o̱ṇiṁ sa̱dyo bhu̍vad vī̱ryā̍ya no̱dhāḥ
English: when he yea he comes forth the firm set mountains and the whole heaven and earth tremble for terror  may nodhas ever praising the protection of that dear friend gain quickly strength heroic

Sanskrit: a̱smā id u̱ tyad anu̍ dāyy eṣā̱m eko̱ yad va̱vne bhūre̱r īśā̍naḥ   praita̍śa̱ṁ sūrye̍ paspṛdhā̱naṁ sauva̍śvye̱ suṣvi̍m āva̱d indra̍ḥ
