English: now unto him of these things hath been given what he who rules alone oer much electeth  indra hath helped etaśa somapresser contending in the race of steeds with sūrya

Sanskrit: e̱vā te̍ hāriyojanā suvṛ̱ktīndra̱ brahmā̍ṇi̱ gota̍māso akran   aiṣu̍ vi̱śvape̍śasa̱ṁ dhiya̍ṁ dhāḥ prā̱tar ma̱kṣū dhi̱yāva̍sur jagamyāt
English: thus to thee indra yoker of bay coursers the gotamas have brought their prayers to please thee  bestow upon them thought decked with all beauty may he enriched with prayer come soon and early

Sanskrit: vahni̍ṁ ya̱śasa̍ṁ vi̱datha̍sya ke̱tuṁ su̍prā̱vya̍ṁ dū̱taṁ sa̱dyoa̍rtham   dvi̱janmā̍naṁ ra̱yim i̍va praśa̱staṁ rā̱tim bha̍ra̱d bhṛga̍ve māta̱riśvā̍
English: as twere some goodly treasure mātariśvan brought as a gift the glorious priest to bhṛgu  banner of sacrifice the good protector child of two births the swiftly moving envoy

Sanskrit: a̱sya śāsu̍r u̱bhayā̍saḥ sacante ha̱viṣma̍nta u̱śijo̱ ye ca̱ martā̍ḥ   di̱vaś ci̱t pūrvo̱ ny a̍sādi̱ hotā̱pṛcchyo̍ vi̱śpati̍r vi̱kṣu ve̱dhāḥ
English: both gods and men obey this ruler's order gods who are worshipped men who yearn and worship  as priest he takes his seat ere break of morning houselord adorable with men ordainer

Sanskrit: taṁ navya̍sī hṛ̱da ā jāya̍mānam a̱smat su̍kī̱rtir madhu̍jihvam aśyāḥ   yam ṛ̱tvijo̍ vṛ̱jane̱ mānu̍ṣāsa̱ḥ praya̍svanta ā̱yavo̱ jīja̍nanta
English: may our fair praise heartborn most recent reach him whose tongue een at his birth is sweet as honey;  whom mortal priests men with their strong endeavour supplied with dainty viands have created

Sanskrit: u̱śik pā̍va̱ko vasu̱r mānu̍ṣeṣu̱ vare̍ṇyo̱ hotā̍dhāyi vi̱kṣu   damū̍nā gṛ̱hapa̍ti̱r dama̱ ām̐ a̱gnir bhu̍vad rayi̱patī̍ rayī̱ṇām
English: good to mankind the yearning purifier hath among men been placed as priest choiceworthy  may agni be our friend lord of the household protector of the riches in the dwelling

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̍ va̱yam pati̍m agne rayī̱ṇām pra śa̍ṁsāmo ma̱tibhi̱r gota̍māsaḥ   ā̱śuṁ na vā̍jambha̱ram ma̱rjaya̍ntaḥ prā̱tar ma̱kṣū dhi̱yāva̍sur jagamyāt
English: as such we gotamas with hymns extol thee o agni as the guardian lord of riches  decking thee like a horse the swift prizewinner may he enriched with prayer come soon and early

Sanskrit: va̱yā id a̍gne a̱gnaya̍s te a̱nye tve viśve̍ a̱mṛtā̍ mādayante   vaiśvā̍nara̱ nābhi̍r asi kṣitī̱nāṁ sthūṇe̍va̱ janā̍m̐ upa̱mid ya̍yantha
English: the other fires are verily thy branches; the immortals all rejoice in thee o agni  centre art thou vaiśvānara of the people sustaining men like a deepfounded pillar

Sanskrit: mū̱rdhā di̱vo nābhi̍r a̱gniḥ pṛ̍thi̱vyā athā̍bhavad ara̱tī roda̍syoḥ   taṁ tvā̍ de̱vāso̍ 'janayanta de̱vaṁ vaiśvā̍nara̱ jyoti̱r id āryā̍ya
English: the forehead of the sky earth's centre agni became the messenger of earth and heaven  vaiśvānara the deities produced thee a god to be a light unto the ārya

Sanskrit: ā sūrye̱ na ra̱śmayo̍ dhru̱vāso̍ vaiśvāna̱re da̍dhire̱ 'gnā vasū̍ni   yā parva̍te̱ṣv oṣa̍dhīṣv a̱psu yā mānu̍ṣe̱ṣv asi̱ tasya̱ rājā̍
English: as in the sun firm rays are set for ever treasures are in vaiśvānara in agni  of all the riches in the hills the waters the herbs among mankind thou art the sovran

Sanskrit: bṛ̱ha̱tī i̍va sū̱nave̱ roda̍sī̱ giro̱ hotā̍ manu̱ṣyo̱3̱̍ na dakṣa̍ḥ   sva̍rvate sa̱tyaśu̍ṣmāya pū̱rvīr vai̍śvāna̱rāya̱ nṛta̍māya ya̱hvīḥ
English: as the great worldhalves so are their son's praises; skilled as a man to act is he the herald  vaiśvānara celestial truly mighty most manly one hath many a youthful consort

Sanskrit: di̱vaś ci̍t te bṛha̱to jā̍tavedo̱ vaiśvā̍nara̱ pra ri̍rice mahi̱tvam   rājā̍ kṛṣṭī̱nām a̍si̱ mānu̍ṣīṇāṁ yu̱dhā de̱vebhyo̱ vari̍vaś cakartha
English: even the lofty heaven o jātavedas vaiśvānara hath not attained thy greatness  thou art the king of lands where men are settled thou hast brought comfort to the gods in battle

Sanskrit: pra nū ma̍hi̱tvaṁ vṛ̍ṣa̱bhasya̍ voca̱ṁ yam pū̱ravo̍ vṛtra̱haṇa̱ṁ saca̍nte   vai̱śvā̱na̱ro dasyu̍m a̱gnir ja̍gha̱nvām̐ adhū̍no̱t kāṣṭhā̱ ava̱ śamba̍ram bhet
English: now will i tell the greatness of the hero whom pūru's sons follow as vṛtra's slayer  agni vaiśvānara struck down the dasyu cleave śambara through and shattered down his fences

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱ro ma̍hi̱mnā vi̱śvakṛ̍ṣṭir bha̱radvā̍jeṣu yaja̱to vi̱bhāvā̍   śā̱ta̱va̱ne̱ye śa̱tinī̍bhir a̱gniḥ pu̍ruṇī̱the ja̍rate sū̱nṛtā̍vān
English: vaiśvānara dwelling by his might with all men farshining holy mid the bharadvājas  is lauded excellent with hundred praises by purūṇītha son of śatavani

Sanskrit: nū ci̍t saho̱jā a̱mṛto̱ ni tu̍ndate̱ hotā̱ yad dū̱to abha̍vad vi̱vasva̍taḥ   vi sādhi̍ṣṭhebhiḥ pa̱thibhī̱ rajo̍ mama̱ ā de̱vatā̍tā ha̱viṣā̍ vivāsati
English: neer waxeth faint the immortal son of strength since he the herald hath become vivasvān's messenger  on paths most excellent he measured out midair he with oblation calls to service of the gods

Sanskrit: ā svam adma̍ yu̱vamā̍no a̱jara̍s tṛ̱ṣv a̍vi̱ṣyann a̍ta̱seṣu̍ tiṣṭhati   atyo̱ na pṛ̱ṣṭham pru̍ṣi̱tasya̍ rocate di̱vo na sānu̍ sta̱naya̍nn acikradat
English: never decaying seizing his appropriate food rapidly eagerly through the dry wood he spreads  his back as he is sprinkled glistens like a horse loud hath he roared and shouted like the heights of heaven?

Sanskrit: krā̱ṇā ru̱drebhi̱r vasu̍bhiḥ pu̱rohi̍to̱ hotā̱ niṣa̍tto rayi̱ṣāḻ ama̍rtyaḥ   ratho̱ na vi̱kṣv ṛ̍ñjasā̱na ā̱yuṣu̱ vy ā̍nu̱ṣag vāryā̍ de̱va ṛ̍ṇvati
English: set high in place oer all that vasus rudras do immortal lord of riches seated as high priest;  hastening like a car to men to those who live the god without delay gives boons to be desired

Sanskrit: vi vāta̍jūto ata̱seṣu̍ tiṣṭhate̱ vṛthā̍ ju̱hūbhi̱ḥ sṛṇyā̍ tuvi̱ṣvaṇi̍ḥ   tṛ̱ṣu yad a̍gne va̱nino̍ vṛṣā̱yase̍ kṛ̱ṣṇaṁ ta̱ ema̱ ruśa̍dūrme ajara
English: urged by the wind be spreads through dry wood as he lists armed with his tongues for sickles with a mighty roar  black is thy path agni changeless with glittering waves! when like a bull thou rushest eager to the trees

Sanskrit: tapu̍rjambho̱ vana̱ ā vāta̍codito yū̱the na sā̱hvām̐ ava̍ vāti̱ vaṁsa̍gaḥ   a̱bhi̱vraja̱nn akṣi̍ta̱m pāja̍sā̱ raja̍ḥ sthā̱tuś ca̱ratha̍m bhayate pata̱triṇa̍ḥ
English: with teeth of flame winddriven through the wood he speeds triumphant like a bull among the herd of cows  with bright strength roaming to the everlasting air things fixed things moving quake before him as he flies

Sanskrit: da̱dhuṣ ṭvā̱ bhṛga̍vo̱ mānu̍ṣe̱ṣv ā ra̱yiṁ na cāru̍ṁ su̱hava̱ṁ jane̍bhyaḥ   hotā̍ram agne̱ ati̍thi̱ṁ vare̍ṇyam mi̱traṁ na śeva̍ṁ di̱vyāya̱ janma̍ne
English: the bhṛgus established thee among mankind for men like as a treasure beauteous easy to invoke;  thee agni as a herald and choiceworthy guest as an auspicious friend to the celestial race

Sanskrit: hotā̍raṁ sa̱pta ju̱hvo̱3̱̍ yaji̍ṣṭha̱ṁ yaṁ vā̱ghato̍ vṛ̱ṇate̍ adhva̱reṣu̍   a̱gniṁ viśve̍ṣām ara̱tiṁ vasū̍nāṁ sapa̱ryāmi̱ praya̍sā̱ yāmi̱ ratna̍m
English: agni the seven tongues' deftest sacrificer him whom the priests elect at solemn worship  the herald messenger of all the vasus i serve with dainty food i ask for riches

Sanskrit: acchi̍drā sūno sahaso no a̱dya sto̱tṛbhyo̍ mitramaha̱ḥ śarma̍ yaccha   agne̍ gṛ̱ṇanta̱m aṁha̍sa uru̱ṣyorjo̍ napāt pū̱rbhir āya̍sībhiḥ
English: grant son of strength thou rich in friends a refuge without a flaw this day to us thy praisers  o agni son of strength with forts of iron preserve thou from distress the man who lauds thee

Sanskrit: bhavā̱ varū̍thaṁ gṛṇa̱te vi̍bhāvo̱ bhavā̍ maghavan ma̱ghava̍dbhya̱ḥ śarma̍   u̱ru̱ṣyāgne̱ aṁha̍so gṛ̱ṇanta̍m prā̱tar ma̱kṣū dhi̱yāva̍sur jagamyāt
English: be thou a refuge bright one to the singer a shelter bounteous lord to those who worship  preserve the singer from distress o agni may he enriched with prayer come soon and early

Sanskrit: pra maṁhi̍ṣṭhāya bṛha̱te bṛ̱hadra̍ye sa̱tyaśu̍ṣmāya ta̱vase̍ ma̱tim bha̍re   a̱pām i̍va prava̱ṇe yasya̍ du̱rdhara̱ṁ rādho̍ vi̱śvāyu̱ śava̍se̱ apā̍vṛtam
English: to him most liberal lofty lord of lofty wealth verily powerful and strong i bring my hymn  whose checkless bounty as of waters down a slope is spread abroad for all that live to give them strength

Sanskrit: adha̍ te̱ viśva̱m anu̍ hāsad i̱ṣṭaya̱ āpo̍ ni̱mneva̱ sava̍nā ha̱viṣma̍taḥ   yat parva̍te̱ na sa̱maśī̍ta harya̱ta indra̍sya̱ vajra̱ḥ śnathi̍tā hira̱ṇyaya̍ḥ
English: now all this world for worship shall come after theethe offerer's libations like floods to the depth  when the wellloved one seems to rest upon the hill the thunderbolt of indra shatterer wrought of gold

Sanskrit: a̱smai bhī̱māya̱ nama̍sā̱ sam a̍dhva̱ra uṣo̱ na śu̍bhra̱ ā bha̍rā̱ panī̍yase   yasya̱ dhāma̱ śrava̍se̱ nāme̍ndri̱yaṁ jyoti̱r akā̍ri ha̱rito̱ nāya̍se
English: to him the terrible most meet for lofty praise like bright dawn now bring gifts with reverence in this rite  whose being for renown yea indrapower and light have been created like bay steeds to move with speed

Sanskrit: i̱me ta̍ indra̱ te va̱yam pu̍ruṣṭuta̱ ye tvā̱rabhya̱ carā̍masi prabhūvaso   na̱hi tvad a̱nyo gi̍rvaṇo̱ gira̱ḥ sagha̍t kṣo̱ṇīr i̍va̱ prati̍ no harya̱ tad vaca̍ḥ
English: thine indra praised by many excellently rich! are we who trusting in thy help draw near to thee  lover of praise none else but thou receives our laud as earth loves all her creatures love thou this our hymn

Sanskrit: bhūri̍ ta indra vī̱rya1̱̍ṁ tava̍ smasy a̱sya sto̱tur ma̍ghava̱n kāma̱m ā pṛ̍ṇa   anu̍ te̱ dyaur bṛ̍ha̱tī vī̱rya̍m mama i̱yaṁ ca̍ te pṛthi̱vī ne̍ma̱ oja̍se
English: great is thy power o indra we are thine fulfil o maghavan the wish of this thy worshipper  after thee lofty heaven hath measured out its strength to thee and to thy power this earth hath bowed itself

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tam i̍ndra̱ parva̍tam ma̱hām u̱ruṁ vajre̍ṇa vajrin parva̱śaś ca̍kartitha   avā̍sṛjo̱ nivṛ̍tā̱ḥ sarta̱vā a̱paḥ sa̱trā viśva̍ṁ dadhiṣe̱ keva̍la̱ṁ saha̍ḥ
English: thou who hast thunder for thy weapon with thy bolt hast shattered into pieces this broad massive cloud  thou hast sent down the obstructed floods that they may flow thou hast thine own for ever all victorious might

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa pra pū̱rvīr ava̱ tasya̍ ca̱mriṣo 'tyo̱ na yoṣā̱m ud a̍yaṁsta bhu̱rvaṇi̍ḥ   dakṣa̍m ma̱he pā̍yayate hira̱ṇyaya̱ṁ ratha̍m ā̱vṛtyā̱ hari̍yoga̱m ṛbhva̍sam
English: for this man's full libations held in ladles he hath roused him eager as a horse to meet the mare  he stays his golden car yoked with bay horses swift and drinks the soma juice which strengthens for great deeds

Sanskrit: taṁ gū̱rtayo̍ nema̱nniṣa̱ḥ parī̍ṇasaḥ samu̱draṁ na sa̱ṁcara̍ṇe sani̱ṣyava̍ḥ   pati̱ṁ dakṣa̍sya vi̱datha̍sya̱ nū saho̍ gi̱riṁ na ve̱nā adhi̍ roha̱ teja̍sā
English: to him the guidancefollowing songs of praise flow full as those who seek gain go in company to the flood  to him the lord of power the holy synod's might as to a hill with speed ascend the loving ones

Sanskrit: sa tu̱rvaṇi̍r ma̱hām̐ a̍re̱ṇu pauṁsye̍ gi̱rer bhṛ̱ṣṭir na bhrā̍jate tu̱jā śava̍ḥ   yena̱ śuṣṇa̍m mā̱yina̍m āya̱so made̍ du̱dhra ā̱bhūṣu̍ rā̱maya̱n ni dāma̍ni
English: victorious great is he; in manly battle shines unstained with dust his might as shines a mountain peak;  wherewith the iron one fierce een against the strong in rapture fettered wily śushṇa fast in bonds

Sanskrit: de̱vī yadi̱ tavi̍ṣī̱ tvāvṛ̍dho̱taya̱ indra̱ṁ siṣa̍kty u̱ṣasa̱ṁ na sūrya̍ḥ   yo dhṛ̱ṣṇunā̱ śava̍sā̱ bādha̍te̱ tama̱ iya̍rti re̱ṇum bṛ̱had a̍rhari̱ṣvaṇi̍ḥ
English: when strength the goddess made more strong for help by thee waits upon indra as the sun attends the dawn  then he who with his might unflinching kills the gloom stirs up the dust aloft with joy and triumphing

Sanskrit: vi yat ti̱ro dha̱ruṇa̱m acyu̍ta̱ṁ rajo 'ti̍ṣṭhipo di̱va ātā̍su ba̱rhaṇā̍   sva̍rmīḻhe̱ yan mada̍ indra̱ harṣyāha̍n vṛ̱traṁ nir a̱pām au̍bjo arṇa̱vam
English: when thou with might upon the framework of the heaven didst fix across air's region firmly unremoved  in the lightwinning war indra in rapturous joy thou smotest vṛtra dead and broughtest floods of rain

Sanskrit: tvaṁ di̱vo dha̱ruṇa̍ṁ dhiṣa̱ oja̍sā pṛthi̱vyā i̍ndra̱ sada̍neṣu̱ māhi̍naḥ   tvaṁ su̱tasya̱ made̍ ariṇā a̱po vi vṛ̱trasya̍ sa̱mayā̍ pā̱ṣyā̍rujaḥ
English: thou with thy might didst grasp the holderup of heaven thou who art mighty also in the seats of earth  thou gladdened by the juice hast set the waters free and broken vṛtra's stony fences through and through

Sanskrit: di̱vaś ci̍d asya vari̱mā vi pa̍pratha̱ indra̱ṁ na ma̱hnā pṛ̍thi̱vī ca̱na prati̍   bhī̱mas tuvi̍ṣmāñ carṣa̱ṇibhya̍ āta̱paḥ śiśī̍te̱ vajra̱ṁ teja̍se̱ na vaṁsa̍gaḥ
English: though een this heaven's wide space and earth have spread them out nor heaven nor earth may be in greatness indra's match  awful and very mighty causing woe to men he whets his thunderbolt for sharpness as a bull

Sanskrit: so a̍rṇa̱vo na na̱dya̍ḥ samu̱driya̱ḥ prati̍ gṛbhṇāti̱ viśri̍tā̱ varī̍mabhiḥ   indra̱ḥ soma̍sya pī̱taye̍ vṛṣāyate sa̱nāt sa yu̱dhma oja̍sā panasyate
English: like as the watery ocean so doth he receive the rivers spread on all sides in their ample width  he bears him like a bull to drink of soma juice and will as warrior from of old be praised for might

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tam i̍ndra̱ parva̍ta̱ṁ na bhoja̍se ma̱ho nṛ̱mṇasya̱ dharma̍ṇām irajyasi   pra vī̱rye̍ṇa de̱vatāti̍ cekite̱ viśva̍smā u̱graḥ karma̍ṇe pu̱rohi̍taḥ
English: thou swayest indra all kinds of great manly power so as to bend ast were even that famed mountain down  foremost among the gods is he through hero might set in the van the strong one for each arduous deed

Sanskrit: sa id vane̍ nama̱syubhi̍r vacasyate̱ cāru̱ jane̍ṣu prabruvā̱ṇa i̍ndri̱yam   vṛṣā̱ chandu̍r bhavati harya̱to vṛṣā̱ kṣeme̍ṇa̱ dhenā̍m ma̱ghavā̱ yad inva̍ti
English: he only in the wood is praised by worshippers when he shows forth to men his own fair indrapower  a friendly bull is he a bull to be desired when maghavan auspiciously sends forth his voice

Sanskrit: sa in ma̱hāni̍ sami̱thāni̍ ma̱jmanā̍ kṛ̱ṇoti̍ yu̱dhma oja̍sā̱ jane̍bhyaḥ   adhā̍ ca̱na śrad da̍dhati̱ tviṣī̍mata̱ indrā̍ya̱ vajra̍ṁ ni̱ghani̍ghnate va̱dham
English: yet verily the warrior in his vigorous strength stirreth up with his might great battles for mankind;  and men have faith in indra the resplendent one what time he hurleth down his bolt his dart of death

Sanskrit: sa hi śra̍va̱syuḥ sada̍nāni kṛ̱trimā̍ kṣma̱yā vṛ̍dhā̱na oja̍sā vinā̱śaya̍n   jyotī̍ṁṣi kṛ̱ṇvann a̍vṛ̱kāṇi̱ yajya̱ve 'va̍ su̱kratu̱ḥ sarta̱vā a̱paḥ sṛ̍jat
English: though fain for glory and with strength increased on earth he with great might destroys the dwellings made with art  he makes the lights of heaven shine forth secure he bids exceeding wise the floods flow for his worshipper

Sanskrit: dā̱nāya̱ mana̍ḥ somapāvann astu te̱ 'rvāñcā̱ harī̍ vandanaśru̱d ā kṛ̍dhi   yami̍ṣṭhāsa̱ḥ sāra̍thayo̱ ya i̍ndra te̱ na tvā̱ ketā̱ ā da̍bhnuvanti̱ bhūrṇa̍yaḥ
English: drinker of soma let thy heart incline to give; bring thy bays hitherward o thou who hearest praise  those charioteers of thine best skilled to draw the rein the rapid sunbeams indra lead thee not astray

Sanskrit: apra̍kṣita̱ṁ vasu̍ bibharṣi̱ hasta̍yo̱r aṣā̍ḻha̱ṁ saha̍s ta̱nvi̍ śru̱to da̍dhe   āvṛ̍tāso 'va̱tāso̱ na ka̱rtṛbhi̍s ta̱nūṣu̍ te̱ krata̍va indra̱ bhūra̍yaḥ
English: thou bearest in both hands treasure that never fails; the famed one in his body holds unvanquished might  o indra in thy members many powers abide like wells surrounded by the ministering priests

Sanskrit: mā no̍ a̱smin ma̍ghavan pṛ̱tsv aṁha̍si na̱hi te̱ anta̱ḥ śava̍saḥ parī̱ṇaśe̍   akra̍ndayo na̱dyo̱3̱̍ roru̍va̱d vanā̍ ka̱thā na kṣo̱ṇīr bhi̱yasā̱ sam ā̍rata
English: urge us not maghavan to this distressful fight for none may comprehend the limit of thy strength  thou with fierce shout hast made the woods and rivers roar did not men run in crowds together in their fear?

Sanskrit: arcā̍ śa̱krāya̍ śā̱kine̱ śacī̍vate śṛ̱ṇvanta̱m indra̍m ma̱haya̍nn a̱bhi ṣṭu̍hi   yo dhṛ̱ṣṇunā̱ śava̍sā̱ roda̍sī u̱bhe vṛṣā̍ vṛṣa̱tvā vṛ̍ṣa̱bho nyṛ̱ñjate̍
English: sing hymns of praise to śakra lord of power and might; laud thou and magnify indra who heareth thee  who with his daring might a bull exceeding strong in strength maketh him master of the heaven and earth

Sanskrit: arcā̍ di̱ve bṛ̍ha̱te śū̱ṣya1̱̍ṁ vaca̱ḥ svakṣa̍tra̱ṁ yasya̍ dhṛṣa̱to dhṛ̱ṣan mana̍ḥ   bṛ̱hacchra̍vā̱ asu̍ro ba̱rhaṇā̍ kṛ̱taḥ pu̱ro hari̍bhyāṁ vṛṣa̱bho ratho̱ hi ṣaḥ
English: sing forth to lofty dyaus a strengthbestowing song the bold whose resolute mind hath independent sway  high glory hath the asura compact of strength drawn on by two bay steeds a bull a car is he

Sanskrit: tvaṁ di̱vo bṛ̍ha̱taḥ sānu̍ kopa̱yo 'va̱ tmanā̍ dhṛṣa̱tā śamba̍ram bhinat   yan mā̱yino̍ vra̱ndino̍ ma̱ndinā̍ dhṛ̱ṣac chi̱tāṁ gabha̍stim a̱śani̍m pṛta̱nyasi̍
English: the ridges of the lofty heaven thou madest shake; thou daring of thyself smotest through śambara  when bold with gladdening juice thou warredst with thy bolt sharp and twoedged against the banded sorcerers

Sanskrit: ni yad vṛ̱ṇakṣi̍ śvasa̱nasya̍ mū̱rdhani̱ śuṣṇa̍sya cid vra̱ndino̱ roru̍va̱d vanā̍   prā̱cīne̍na̱ mana̍sā ba̱rhaṇā̍vatā̱ yad a̱dyā ci̍t kṛ̱ṇava̱ḥ kas tvā̱ pari̍
English: when with a roar that fills the woods thou forcest down on wind's head the stores which śuṣṇa kept confined  who shall have power to stay thee firm and eagersouled from doing still this day what thou of old hast done?

Sanskrit: tvam ā̍vitha̱ narya̍ṁ tu̱rvaśa̱ṁ yadu̱ṁ tvaṁ tu̱rvīti̍ṁ va̱yya̍ṁ śatakrato   tvaṁ ratha̱m eta̍śa̱ṁ kṛtvye̱ dhane̱ tvam puro̍ nava̱tiṁ da̍mbhayo̱ nava̍
English: thou helpest narya turvaśa and yadu and vayya's son turvīti śatakratu!  thou helpest horse and car in final battle thou breakest down the nineandninety castles

Sanskrit: sa ghā̱ rājā̱ satpa̍tiḥ śūśuva̱j jano̍ rā̱taha̍vya̱ḥ prati̱ yaḥ śāsa̱m inva̍ti   u̱kthā vā̱ yo a̍bhigṛ̱ṇāti̱ rādha̍sā̱ dānu̍r asmā̱ upa̍rā pinvate di̱vaḥ
English: a herolord is he king of a mighty folk who offers free oblations and promotes the law  who with a bounteous guerdon welcomes hymns of praise for him flows down the abundant stream below the sky

Sanskrit: asa̍maṁ kṣa̱tram asa̍mā manī̱ṣā pra so̍ma̱pā apa̍sā santu̱ neme̍   ye ta̍ indra da̱duṣo̍ va̱rdhaya̍nti̱ mahi̍ kṣa̱traṁ sthavi̍ra̱ṁ vṛṣṇya̍ṁ ca
English: his power is matchless matchless is his wisdom; chief through their work be some who drink the soma  those indra who increase the lordly power the firm heroic strength of thee the giver

Sanskrit: tubhyed e̱te ba̍hu̱lā adri̍dugdhāś camū̱ṣada̍ś cama̱sā i̍ndra̱pānā̍ḥ   vy a̍śnuhi ta̱rpayā̱ kāma̍m eṣā̱m athā̱ mano̍ vasu̱deyā̍ya kṛṣva
English: therefore for thee are these abundant beakers indra's drink stonepressed juices held in ladles  quaff them and satisfy therewith thy longing; then fix thy mind upon bestowing treasure

Sanskrit: a̱pām a̍tiṣṭhad dha̱ruṇa̍hvara̱ṁ tamo̱ 'ntar vṛ̱trasya̍ ja̱ṭhare̍ṣu̱ parva̍taḥ   a̱bhīm indro̍ na̱dyo̍ va̱vriṇā̍ hi̱tā viśvā̍ anu̱ṣṭhāḥ pra̍va̱ṇeṣu̍ jighnate
English: there darkness stood the vault that stayed the waters flow in vṛtra's hollow side the raincloud lay concealed  but indra smote the rivers which the obstructer stayed flood following after flood down steep declivities

Sanskrit: sa śevṛ̍dha̱m adhi̍ dhā dyu̱mnam a̱sme mahi̍ kṣa̱traṁ ja̍nā̱ṣāḻ i̍ndra̱ tavya̍m   rakṣā̍ ca no ma̱ghona̍ḥ pā̱hi sū̱rīn rā̱ye ca̍ naḥ svapa̱tyā i̱ṣe dhā̍ḥ
English: so give us indra blissincreasing glory give us great sway and strength that conquers people  preserve our wealthy patrons save our princes; vouchsafe us wealth and food with noble offspring

Sanskrit: ny ū̱3̱̍ ṣu vāca̱m pra ma̱he bha̍rāmahe̱ gira̱ indrā̍ya̱ sada̍ne vi̱vasva̍taḥ   nū ci̱d dhi ratna̍ṁ sasa̱tām i̱vāvi̍da̱n na du̍ṣṭu̱tir dra̍viṇo̱deṣu̍ śasyate
English: we will present fair praise unto the mighty one our hymns to indra in vivasvān's dwellingplace;  for he hath neer found wealth in those who seem to sleep those who give wealth to men accept no paltry praise

Sanskrit: du̱ro aśva̍sya du̱ra i̍ndra̱ gor a̍si du̱ro yava̍sya̱ vasu̍na i̱nas pati̍ḥ   śi̱kṣā̱na̱raḥ pra̱divo̱ akā̍makarśana̱ḥ sakhā̱ sakhi̍bhya̱s tam i̱daṁ gṛ̍ṇīmasi
English: giver of horses indra giver thou of kine giver of barley thou art lord and guard of wealth  man's helper from of old not disappointing hope friend of our friends to thee as such we sing this praise

Sanskrit: śacī̍va indra purukṛd dyumattama̱ taved i̱dam a̱bhita̍ś cekite̱ vasu̍   ata̍ḥ sa̱ṁgṛbhyā̍bhibhūta̱ ā bha̍ra̱ mā tvā̍ya̱to ja̍ri̱tuḥ kāma̍m ūnayīḥ
English: indra most splendid powerful rich in mighty deeds this treasure spread around is known to be thine own  gather therefrom o conqueror and bring to us fail not the hope of him who loves and sings to thee

Sanskrit: e̱bhir dyubhi̍ḥ su̱manā̍ e̱bhir indu̍bhir nirundhā̱no ama̍ti̱ṁ gobhi̍r a̱śvinā̍   indre̍ṇa̱ dasyu̍ṁ da̱raya̍nta̱ indu̍bhir yu̱tadve̍ṣasa̱ḥ sam i̱ṣā ra̍bhemahi
English: well pleased with these bright flames and with these soma drops take thou away our poverty with seeds and kine  with indra scattering the dasyu through these drops freed from their hate may we obtain abundant food

Sanskrit: sam i̍ndra rā̱yā sam i̱ṣā ra̍bhemahi̱ saṁ vāje̍bhiḥ puruśca̱ndrair a̱bhidyu̍bhiḥ   saṁ de̱vyā prama̍tyā vī̱raśu̍ṣmayā̱ goa̍gra̱yāśvā̍vatyā rabhemahi
English: let us obtain o indra plenteous wealth and food with strength exceeding glorious shining to the sky  may we obtain the goddess providence the strength of heroes special source of cattle rich in steeds

Sanskrit: te tvā̱ madā̍ amada̱n tāni̱ vṛṣṇyā̱ te somā̍so vṛtra̱hatye̍ṣu satpate   yat kā̱rave̱ daśa̍ vṛ̱trāṇy a̍pra̱ti ba̱rhiṣma̍te̱ ni sa̱hasrā̍ṇi ba̱rhaya̍ḥ
English: these our libations strengthinspiring soma draughts gladdened thee in the fight with vṛtra hero lord  what time thou slewest for the singer with trimmed grass ten thousand vṛtras thou resistless in thy might

Sanskrit: yu̱dhā yudha̱m upa̱ ghed e̍ṣi dhṛṣṇu̱yā pu̱rā pura̱ṁ sam i̱daṁ ha̱ṁsy oja̍sā   namyā̱ yad i̍ndra̱ sakhyā̍ parā̱vati̍ niba̱rhayo̱ namu̍ci̱ṁ nāma̍ mā̱yina̍m
English: thou goest on from fight to fight intrepidly destroying castle after castle here with strength  thou indra with thy friend who makes the foe bow down slewest from far away the guileful namuci

Sanskrit: tvaṁ kara̍ñjam u̱ta pa̱rṇaya̍ṁ vadhī̱s teji̍ṣṭhayātithi̱gvasya̍ varta̱nī   tvaṁ śa̱tā vaṅgṛ̍dasyābhina̱t puro̍ 'nānu̱daḥ pari̍ṣūtā ṛ̱jiśva̍nā
English: thou hast struck down in death karañja parṇaya in atithigva's very glorious going forth  unyielding when ṛjiśvan compassed them with siege thou hast destroyed the hundred forts of vaṅgṛida

Sanskrit: tvam e̱tāñ ja̍na̱rājño̱ dvir daśā̍ba̱ndhunā̍ su̱śrava̍sopaja̱gmuṣa̍ḥ   ṣa̱ṣṭiṁ sa̱hasrā̍ nava̱tiṁ nava̍ śru̱to ni ca̱kreṇa̱ rathyā̍ du̱ṣpadā̍vṛṇak
English: with alloutstripping chariotwheel o indra thou farfamed hast overthrown the twice ten kings of men  with sixty thousand nineandninety followers who came in arms to fight with friendless suśravas

Sanskrit: tvam ā̍vitha su̱śrava̍sa̱ṁ tavo̱tibhi̱s tava̱ trāma̍bhir indra̱ tūrva̍yāṇam   tvam a̍smai̱ kutsa̍m atithi̱gvam ā̱yum ma̱he rājñe̱ yūne̍ arandhanāyaḥ
English: thou hast protected suśravas with succour and tūrvayāṇa with thine aid o indra  thou madest kutsa atithigva āyu subject unto this king the young the mighty

Sanskrit: ya u̱dṛcī̍ndra de̱vago̍pā̱ḥ sakhā̍yas te śi̱vata̍mā̱ asā̍ma   tvāṁ sto̍ṣāma̱ tvayā̍ su̱vīrā̱ drāghī̍ya̱ āyu̍ḥ prata̱raṁ dadhā̍nāḥ
English: may we protected by the gods hereafter remain thy very prosperous friends o indra  thee we extol enjoying through thy favour life long and joyful and with store of heroes

Sanskrit: tyaṁ su me̱ṣam ma̍hayā sva̱rvida̍ṁ śa̱taṁ yasya̍ su̱bhva̍ḥ sā̱kam īra̍te   atya̱ṁ na vāja̍ṁ havana̱syada̱ṁ ratha̱m endra̍ṁ vavṛtyā̱m ava̍se suvṛ̱ktibhi̍ḥ
English: i glorify that ram who finds the light of heaven whose hundred noblynatured ones go forth with him  with hymns may i turn hither indra to mine aidthe car which like a strong steed hasteth to the call

Sanskrit: sa parva̍to̱ na dha̱ruṇe̱ṣv acyu̍taḥ sa̱hasra̍mūti̱s tavi̍ṣīṣu vāvṛdhe   indro̱ yad vṛ̱tram ava̍dhīn nadī̱vṛta̍m u̱bjann arṇā̍ṁsi̱ jarhṛ̍ṣāṇo̱ andha̍sā
English: like as a mountain on firm basis unremoved he thousandfold protector waxed in mighty strength  when indra joying in the draughts of soma juice forced the clouds slaying vṛtra stayer of their flow

Sanskrit: sa hi dva̱ro dva̱riṣu̍ va̱vra ūdha̍ni ca̱ndrabu̍dhno̱ mada̍vṛddho manī̱ṣibhi̍ḥ   indra̱ṁ tam a̍hve svapa̱syayā̍ dhi̱yā maṁhi̍ṣṭharāti̱ṁ sa hi papri̱r andha̍saḥ
English: for he stays een the stayers spread oer laden cloud rooted in light strengthened in rapture by the wise  indra with thought with skilled activity i call most liberal giver for he sates him with the juice

Sanskrit: ā yam pṛ̱ṇanti̍ di̱vi sadma̍barhiṣaḥ samu̱draṁ na su̱bhva1̱̍ḥ svā a̱bhiṣṭa̍yaḥ   taṁ vṛ̍tra̱hatye̱ anu̍ tasthur ū̱taya̱ḥ śuṣmā̱ indra̍m avā̱tā ahru̍tapsavaḥ
English: whom those that flow in heaven on sacred grass his own assistants noblynatured fill full like the sea  beside that indra when he smote down vṛtra stood his helpers straight in form mighty invincible

Sanskrit: a̱bhi svavṛ̍ṣṭi̱m made̍ asya̱ yudhya̍to ra̱ghvīr i̍va prava̱ṇe sa̍srur ū̱taya̍ḥ   indro̱ yad va̱jrī dhṛ̱ṣamā̍ṇo̱ andha̍sā bhi̱nad va̱lasya̍ pari̱dhīm̐r i̍va tri̱taḥ
English: to him as in wild joy he fought with him who stayed the rain his helpers sped like swift streams down a slope  when indra thunderarmed made bold by soma draughts as tṛta cleaveth vala's fences cleft him through

Sanskrit: parī̍ṁ ghṛ̱ṇā ca̍rati titvi̱ṣe śavo̱ 'po vṛ̱tvī raja̍so bu̱dhnam āśa̍yat   vṛ̱trasya̱ yat pra̍va̱ṇe du̱rgṛbhi̍śvano nija̱ghantha̱ hanvo̍r indra tanya̱tum
English: splendour encompassed thee forth shone thy warrior might the rainobstructer lay in midair's lowest deep  what time o indra thou didst cast thy thunder down upon the jaws of vṛitra hard to be restrained

Sanskrit: hra̱daṁ na hi tvā̍ nyṛ̱ṣanty ū̱rmayo̱ brahmā̍ṇīndra̱ tava̱ yāni̱ vardha̍nā   tvaṣṭā̍ cit te̱ yujya̍ṁ vāvṛdhe̱ śava̍s ta̱takṣa̱ vajra̍m a̱bhibhū̍tyojasam
English: the hymns which magnify thee indra reach to thee even as waterbrooks flow down and fill the lake  tvaṣṭar gave yet more force to thine appropriate strength and forged thy thunderbolt of overpowering might

Sanskrit: ja̱gha̱nvām̐ u̱ hari̍bhiḥ sambhṛtakrata̱v indra̍ vṛ̱tram manu̍ṣe gātu̱yann a̱paḥ   aya̍cchathā bā̱hvor vajra̍m āya̱sam adhā̍rayo di̱vy ā sūrya̍ṁ dṛ̱śe
English: when indra thou whose power is linked with thy bay steeds hadst smitten vṛtra causing floods to flow for man  thou heldst in thine arms the metal thunderbolt and settest in the heaven the sun for all to see

Sanskrit: bṛ̱hat svaśca̍ndra̱m ama̍va̱d yad u̱kthya1̱̍m akṛ̍ṇvata bhi̱yasā̱ roha̍ṇaṁ di̱vaḥ   yan mānu̍ṣapradhanā̱ indra̍m ū̱taya̱ḥ sva̍r nṛ̱ṣāco̍ ma̱ruto 'ma̍da̱nn anu̍
English: in fear they raised the lofty selfresplendent hymn praise giving and effectual leading up to heaven  when indra's helpers fighting for the good of men the maruts faithful to mankind joyed in the light

Sanskrit: dyauś ci̍d a̱syāma̍vā̱m̐ ahe̍ḥ sva̱nād ayo̍yavīd bhi̱yasā̱ vajra̍ indra te   vṛ̱trasya̱ yad ba̍dbadhā̱nasya̍ rodasī̱ made̍ su̱tasya̱ śava̱sābhi̍na̱c chira̍ḥ
English: then heaven himself the mighty at that dragon's roar reeled back in terror when indra thy thunderbolt  in the wild joy of soma had struck off with might the head of vṛtra tyrant of the earth and heaven

Sanskrit: yad in nv i̍ndra pṛthi̱vī daśa̍bhuji̱r ahā̍ni̱ viśvā̍ ta̱tana̍nta kṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ   atrāha̍ te maghava̱n viśru̍ta̱ṁ saho̱ dyām anu̱ śava̍sā ba̱rhaṇā̍ bhuvat
English: o indra were this earth extended forth tenfold and men who dwell therein multiplied day by day  still here thy conquering might maghavan would be famed it hath waxed vast as heaven in majesty and power

Sanskrit: tvam a̱sya pā̱re raja̍so̱ vyo̍mana̱ḥ svabhū̍tyojā̱ ava̍se dhṛṣanmanaḥ   ca̱kṛ̱ṣe bhūmi̍m prati̱māna̱m oja̍so̱ 'paḥ sva̍ḥ pari̱bhūr e̱ṣy ā diva̍m
English: thou bold of heart in thine own native might for help upon the limit of this midair and of heaven  hast made the earth to be the pattern of thy strength embracing flood and light thou reachest to the sky

Sanskrit: tvam bhu̍vaḥ prati̱māna̍m pṛthi̱vyā ṛ̱ṣvavī̍rasya bṛha̱taḥ pati̍r bhūḥ   viśva̱m āprā̍ a̱ntari̍kṣam mahi̱tvā sa̱tyam a̱ddhā naki̍r a̱nyas tvāvā̍n
English: thou art the counterpart of earth the master of lofty heaven with all its mighty heroes  thou hast filled all the region with thy greatness yea of a truth there is none other like thee

Sanskrit: na yasya̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī anu̱ vyaco̱ na sindha̍vo̱ raja̍so̱ anta̍m āna̱śuḥ   nota svavṛ̍ṣṭi̱m made̍ asya̱ yudhya̍ta̱ eko̍ a̱nyac ca̍kṛṣe̱ viśva̍m ānu̱ṣak
English: whose amplitude the heaven and earth have not attained whose bounds the waters of midair have never reached  not when in joy he fights the stayer of the rain thou and none else hast made all things in order due

Sanskrit: ārca̱nn atra̍ ma̱ruta̱ḥ sasmi̍nn ā̱jau viśve̍ de̱vāso̍ amada̱nn anu̍ tvā   vṛ̱trasya̱ yad bhṛ̍ṣṭi̱matā̍ va̱dhena̱ ni tvam i̍ndra̱ praty ā̱naṁ ja̱ghantha̍
English: the maruts sang thy praise in this encounter and in thee all the deities delighted  what time thou indra with thy spiky weapon thy deadly bolt smotest the face of vṛtra

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tyam me̱ṣam pu̍ruhū̱tam ṛ̱gmiya̱m indra̍ṁ gī̱rbhir ma̍datā̱ vasvo̍ arṇa̱vam   yasya̱ dyāvo̱ na vi̱cara̍nti̱ mānu̍ṣā bhu̱je maṁhi̍ṣṭham a̱bhi vipra̍m arcata
English: make glad with songs that ram whom many men invoke worthy of songs of praise indra the sea of wealth;  whose gracious deeds for men spread like the heavens abroad sing praise to him the sage most liberal for our good

Sanskrit: a̱bhīm a̍vanvan svabhi̱ṣṭim ū̱tayo̍ 'ntarikṣa̱prāṁ tavi̍ṣībhi̱r āvṛ̍tam   indra̱ṁ dakṣā̍sa ṛ̱bhavo̍ mada̱cyuta̍ṁ śa̱takra̍tu̱ṁ java̍nī sū̱nṛtāru̍hat
English: as aids the skilful ṛbhus yearned to indra strong to save who fills midair encompassed round with might  rushing in rapture; and oer śatakratu came the gladdening shout that urged him on to victory

Sanskrit: tvaṁ go̱tram aṅgi̍robhyo 'vṛṇo̱r apo̱tātra̍ye śa̱tadu̍reṣu gātu̱vit   sa̱sena̍ cid vima̱dāyā̍vaho̱ vasv ā̱jāv adri̍ṁ vāvasā̱nasya̍ na̱rtaya̍n
English: thou hast disclosed the kine's stall for the aṅgirases and made a way for atri by a hundred doors  on vimada thou hast bestowed both food and wealth making thy bolt dance in the sacrificer's fight

Sanskrit: tvam a̱pām a̍pi̱dhānā̍vṛṇo̱r apādhā̍raya̱ḥ parva̍te̱ dānu̍ma̱d vasu̍   vṛ̱traṁ yad i̍ndra̱ śava̱sāva̍dhī̱r ahi̱m ād it sūrya̍ṁ di̱vy āro̍hayo dṛ̱śe
English: thou hast unclosed the prisons of the waters; thou hast in the mountain seized the treasure rich in gifts  when thou hadst slain with might the dragon vṛtra thou indra didst raise the sun in heaven for all to see

Sanskrit: tvam mā̱yābhi̱r apa̍ mā̱yino̍ 'dhamaḥ sva̱dhābhi̱r ye adhi̱ śuptā̱v aju̍hvata   tvam pipro̍r nṛmaṇa̱ḥ prāru̍ja̱ḥ pura̱ḥ pra ṛ̱jiśvā̍naṁ dasyu̱hatye̍ṣv āvitha
English: with wondrous might thou blewest enchanter fiends away with powers celestial those who called on thee in jest  thou herohearted hast broken down pipru's forts and helped ṛjiśvan when the dasyus were struck dead

Sanskrit: tvaṁ kutsa̍ṁ śuṣṇa̱hatye̍ṣv āvi̱thāra̍ndhayo 'tithi̱gvāya̱ śamba̍ram   ma̱hānta̍ṁ cid arbu̱daṁ ni kra̍mīḥ pa̱dā sa̱nād e̱va da̍syu̱hatyā̍ya jajñiṣe
English: thou savedst kutsa when śuṣṇa was smitten down; to atithigva gavest śambara for a prey  een mighty arbuda thou troddest under foot thou from of old wast born to strike the dasyus dead

Sanskrit: tve viśvā̱ tavi̍ṣī sa̱dhrya̍g ghi̱tā tava̱ rādha̍ḥ somapī̱thāya̍ harṣate   tava̱ vajra̍ś cikite bā̱hvor hi̱to vṛ̱ścā śatro̱r ava̱ viśvā̍ni̱ vṛṣṇyā̍
English: all power and might is closely gathered up in thee; thy bounteous spirit joys in drinking soma juice  known is the thunderbolt that lies within thine arms rend off therewith all manly prowess of our foe

Sanskrit: vi jā̍nī̱hy āryā̱n ye ca̱ dasya̍vo ba̱rhiṣma̍te randhayā̱ śāsa̍d avra̱tān   śākī̍ bhava̱ yaja̍mānasya codi̱tā viśvet tā te̍ sadha̱māde̍ṣu cākana
English: discern thou well āryas and dasyus; punishing the lawless give them up to him whose grass is strewn  be thou the sacrificer's strong encourager all these thy deeds are my delight at festivals

Sanskrit: anu̍vratāya ra̱ndhaya̱nn apa̍vratān ā̱bhūbhi̱r indra̍ḥ śna̱thaya̱nn anā̍bhuvaḥ   vṛ̱ddhasya̍ ci̱d vardha̍to̱ dyām ina̍kṣata̱ḥ stavā̍no va̱mro vi ja̍ghāna sa̱ṁdiha̍ḥ
English: indra gives up the lawless to the pious man destroying by the strong ones those who have no strength  vamra when glorified destroyed the gathered piles of the still waxing great one who would reach the heaven

Sanskrit: takṣa̱d yat ta̍ u̱śanā̱ saha̍sā̱ saho̱ vi roda̍sī ma̱jmanā̍ bādhate̱ śava̍ḥ   ā tvā̱ vāta̍sya nṛmaṇo mano̱yuja̱ ā pūrya̍māṇam avahann a̱bhi śrava̍ḥ
English: the might which uśanā hath formed for thee with might rends in its greatness and with strength both worlds apart  o herosouled the steeds of vāta yoked by thought have carried thee to fame while thou art filled with power

Sanskrit: mandi̍ṣṭa̱ yad u̱śane̍ kā̱vye sacā̱m̐ indro̍ va̱ṅkū va̍ṅku̱tarādhi̍ tiṣṭhati   u̱gro ya̱yiṁ nir a̱paḥ srota̍sāsṛja̱d vi śuṣṇa̍sya dṛṁhi̱tā ai̍raya̱t pura̍ḥ
English: when indra hath rejoiced with kāvya uśanā he mounts his steeds who swerve wider and wider yet  the strong hath loosed his bolt with the swift rush of rain and he hath rent in pieces śuṣṇa's firmbuilt forts

Sanskrit: ā smā̱ ratha̍ṁ vṛṣa̱pāṇe̍ṣu tiṣṭhasi śāryā̱tasya̱ prabhṛ̍tā̱ yeṣu̱ manda̍se   indra̱ yathā̍ su̱taso̍meṣu cā̱kano̍ 'na̱rvāṇa̱ṁ śloka̱m ā ro̍hase di̱vi
English: thou mountest on thy car amid strong soma draughts śāryāta brought thee those in which thou hast delight  indra when thou art pleased with men whose soma flows thou risest to unchallenged glory in the sky

Sanskrit: ada̍dā̱ arbhā̍m maha̱te va̍ca̱syave̍ ka̱kṣīva̍te vṛca̱yām i̍ndra sunva̱te   menā̍bhavo vṛṣaṇa̱śvasya̍ sukrato̱ viśvet tā te̱ sava̍neṣu pra̱vācyā̍
English: to old kakṣīvān somapresser skilled in song o indra thou didst give the youthful vṛcayā  thou very wise wast menā vrsanśva's child those deeds of thine must all be told at soma feasts

Sanskrit: indro̍ aśrāyi su̱dhyo̍ nire̱ke pa̱jreṣu̱ stomo̱ duryo̱ na yūpa̍ḥ   a̱śva̱yur ga̱vyū ra̍tha̱yur va̍sū̱yur indra̱ id rā̱yaḥ kṣa̍yati praya̱ntā
English: the good man's refuge in his need is indra firm as a doorpost praised among the pajras  indra alone is lord of wealth the giver lover of riches chariots kine and horses

Sanskrit: i̱daṁ namo̍ vṛṣa̱bhāya̍ sva̱rāje̍ sa̱tyaśu̍ṣmāya ta̱vase̍ 'vāci   a̱sminn i̍ndra vṛ̱jane̱ sarva̍vīrā̱ḥ smat sū̱ribhi̱s tava̱ śarma̍n syāma
English: to him the mighty one the selfresplendent verily strong and great this praise is uttered  may we and all the heroes with the princes be in this fray o indra in thy keeping

Sanskrit: ud u̱ tyaṁ jā̱tave̍dasaṁ de̱vaṁ va̍hanti ke̱tava̍ḥ   dṛ̱śe viśvā̍ya̱ sūrya̍m
English: his bright rays bear him up aloft the god who knoweth all that lives  sūrya that all may look on him

Sanskrit: apa̱ tye tā̱yavo̍ yathā̱ nakṣa̍trā yanty a̱ktubhi̍ḥ   sūrā̍ya vi̱śvaca̍kṣase
English: the constellations pass away like thieves together with their beams  before the allbeholding sun

Sanskrit: adṛ̍śram asya ke̱tavo̱ vi ra̱śmayo̱ janā̱m̐ anu̍   bhrāja̍nto a̱gnayo̍ yathā
English: his herald rays are seen afar refulgent oer the world of men  like flames of fire that burn and blaze

Sanskrit: ta̱raṇi̍r vi̱śvada̍rśato jyoti̱ṣkṛd a̍si sūrya   viśva̱m ā bhā̍si roca̱nam
English: swift and all beautiful art thou o sūrya maker of the light  illuming all the radiant realm

Sanskrit: pra̱tyaṅ de̱vānā̱ṁ viśa̍ḥ pra̱tyaṅṅ ud e̍ṣi̱ mānu̍ṣān   pra̱tyaṅ viśva̱ṁ sva̍r dṛ̱śe
English: thou goest to the hosts of gods thou comest hither to mankind  hither all light to be beheld

Sanskrit: yenā̍ pāvaka̱ cakṣa̍sā bhura̱ṇyanta̱ṁ janā̱m̐ anu̍   tvaṁ va̍ruṇa̱ paśya̍si
English: with that same eye of thine wherewith thou lookest brilliant varuṇa  upon the busy race of men

Sanskrit: vi dyām e̍ṣi̱ raja̍s pṛ̱thv ahā̱ mimā̍no a̱ktubhi̍ḥ   paśya̱ñ janmā̍ni sūrya
English: traversing sky and wide midair thou metest with thy beams our days  sun seeing all things that have birth

Sanskrit: sa̱pta tvā̍ ha̱rito̱ rathe̱ vaha̍nti deva sūrya   śo̱ciṣke̍śaṁ vicakṣaṇa
English: seven bay steeds harnessed to thy car bear thee o thou farseeing one  god sūrya with the radiant hair

Sanskrit: ayu̍kta sa̱pta śu̱ndhyuva̱ḥ sūro̱ ratha̍sya na̱ptya̍ḥ   tābhi̍r yāti̱ svayu̍ktibhiḥ
English: sūrya hath yoked the pure bright seven the daughters of the car; with these  his own dear team he goeth forth

Sanskrit: ud va̱yaṁ tama̍sa̱s pari̱ jyoti̱ṣ paśya̍nta̱ utta̍ram   de̱vaṁ de̍va̱trā sūrya̱m aga̍nma̱ jyoti̍r utta̱mam
English: looking upon the loftier light above the darkness we have come  to sūrya god among the gods the light that is most excellent

Sanskrit: u̱dyann a̱dya mi̍tramaha ā̱roha̱nn utta̍rā̱ṁ diva̍m   hṛ̱dro̱gam mama̍ sūrya hari̱māṇa̍ṁ ca nāśaya
English: rising this day o rich in friends ascending to the loftier heaven  sūrya remove my heart's disease take from me this my yellow hue

Sanskrit: śuke̍ṣu me hari̱māṇa̍ṁ ropa̱ṇākā̍su dadhmasi   atho̍ hāridra̱veṣu̍ me hari̱māṇa̱ṁ ni da̍dhmasi
English: to parrots and to starlings let us give away my yellowness  or this my yellowness let us transfer to haritāla trees

Sanskrit: ud a̍gād a̱yam ā̍di̱tyo viśve̍na̱ saha̍sā sa̱ha   dvi̱ṣanta̱m mahya̍ṁ ra̱ndhaya̱n mo a̱haṁ dvi̍ṣa̱te ra̍dham
English: with all his conquering vigour this āditya hath gone up on high  giving my foe into mine hand let me not be my foeman's prey

Sanskrit: uṣo̍ bha̱drebhi̱r ā ga̍hi di̱vaś ci̍d roca̱nād adhi̍   vaha̍ntv aru̱ṇapsa̍va̱ upa̍ tvā so̱mino̍ gṛ̱ham
English: e'en from above the sky's bright realm come uṣas by auspicious ways  let red steeds bear thee to the house of him who pours the soma juice

Sanskrit: su̱peśa̍saṁ su̱khaṁ ratha̱ṁ yam a̱dhyasthā̍ uṣa̱s tvam   tenā̍ su̱śrava̍sa̱ṁ jana̱m prāvā̱dya du̍hitar divaḥ
English: the chariot which thou mountest fair of shape o uṣas light to move  therewith o daughter of the sky aid men of noble fame today

Sanskrit: vaya̍ś cit te pata̱triṇo̍ dvi̱pac catu̍ṣpad arjuni   uṣa̱ḥ prāra̍nn ṛ̱tūm̐r anu̍ di̱vo ante̍bhya̱s pari̍
English: bright uṣas when thy times return all quadrupeds and bipeds stir  and round about flock winged birds from all the boundaries of heaven

Sanskrit: vyu̱cchantī̱ hi ra̱śmibhi̱r viśva̍m ā̱bhāsi̍ roca̱nam   tāṁ tvām u̍ṣar vasū̱yavo̍ gī̱rbhiḥ kaṇvā̍ ahūṣata
English: thou dawning with thy beams of light illumest all the radiant realm  thee as thou art the kaṇvas fain for wealth have called with sacred songs

Sanskrit: sa̱ha vā̱mena̍ na uṣo̱ vy u̍cchā duhitar divaḥ   sa̱ha dyu̱mnena̍ bṛha̱tā vi̍bhāvari rā̱yā de̍vi̱ dāsva̍tī
English: dawn on us with prosperity o uṣas daughter of the sky  dawn with great glory goddess lady of the light dawn thou with riches bounteous one

Sanskrit: aśvā̍vatī̱r goma̍tīr viśvasu̱vido̱ bhūri̍ cyavanta̱ vasta̍ve   ud ī̍raya̱ prati̍ mā sū̱nṛtā̍ uṣa̱ś coda̱ rādho̍ ma̱ghonā̍m
English: they bringing steeds and kine boongivers of all wealth have oft sped forth to lighten us  o uṣas waken up for me the sounds of joy send us the riches of the great

Sanskrit: u̱vāso̱ṣā u̱cchāc ca̱ nu de̱vī jī̱rā rathā̍nām   ye a̍syā ā̱cara̍ṇeṣu dadhri̱re sa̍mu̱dre na śra̍va̱syava̍ḥ
English: uṣas hath dawned and now shall dawn the goddess driver forth of cars  which as she cometh nigh have fixed their thought on her like gloryseekers on the flood

Sanskrit: uṣo̱ ye te̱ pra yāme̍ṣu yu̱ñjate̱ mano̍ dā̱nāya̍ sū̱raya̍ḥ   atrāha̱ tat kaṇva̍ eṣā̱ṁ kaṇva̍tamo̱ nāma̍ gṛṇāti nṛ̱ṇām
English: here kaṇva chief of kaṇva's race sings forth aloud the glories of the heroes names  the princes who o uṣas as thou comest near direct their thoughts to liberal gifts

Sanskrit: ā ghā̱ yoṣe̍va sū̱nary u̱ṣā yā̍ti prabhuñja̱tī   ja̱raya̍ntī̱ vṛja̍nam pa̱dvad ī̍yata̱ ut pā̍tayati pa̱kṣiṇa̍ḥ
English: like a good matron uṣas comes carefully tending everything  rousing all life she stirs all creatures that have feet and makes the birds of air fly up

Sanskrit: vi yā sṛ̱jati̱ sama̍na̱ṁ vy a1̱̍rthina̍ḥ pa̱daṁ na ve̱ty oda̍tī   vayo̱ naki̍ṣ ṭe papti̱vāṁsa̍ āsate̱ vyu̍ṣṭau vājinīvati
English: she sends the busy forth each man to his pursuit delay she knows not as she springs  o rich in opulence after thy dawning birds that have flown forth no longer rest

Sanskrit: e̱ṣāyu̍kta parā̱vata̱ḥ sūrya̍syo̱daya̍nā̱d adhi̍   śa̱taṁ rathe̍bhiḥ su̱bhago̱ṣā i̱yaṁ vi yā̍ty a̱bhi mānu̍ṣān
English: this dawn hath yoked her steeds afar beyond the rising of the sun  borne on a hundred chariots she auspicious dawn advances on her way to men

Sanskrit: viśva̍m asyā nānāma̱ cakṣa̍se̱ jaga̱j jyoti̍ṣ kṛṇoti sū̱narī̍   apa̱ dveṣo̍ ma̱ghonī̍ duhi̱tā di̱va u̱ṣā u̍ccha̱d apa̱ sridha̍ḥ
English: to meet her glance all living creatures bend them down excellent one she makes the light  uṣas the daughter of the sky the opulent shines foes and enmities away

Sanskrit: uṣa̱ ā bhā̍hi bhā̱nunā̍ ca̱ndreṇa̍ duhitar divaḥ   ā̱vaha̍ntī̱ bhūry a̱smabhya̱ṁ saubha̍gaṁ vyu̱cchantī̱ divi̍ṣṭiṣu
English: shine on us with thy radiant light o uṣas daughter of the sky  bringing to us great store of high felicity and beaming on our solemn rites

Sanskrit: viśva̍sya̱ hi prāṇa̍na̱ṁ jīva̍na̱ṁ tve vi yad u̱cchasi̍ sūnari   sā no̱ rathe̍na bṛha̱tā vi̍bhāvari śru̱dhi ci̍trāmaghe̱ hava̍m
English: for in thee is each living creature's breath and life when excellent! thou dawnest forth  borne on thy lofty car o lady of the light hear thou of wondrous wealth our call

Sanskrit: uṣo̱ vāja̱ṁ hi vaṁsva̱ yaś ci̱tro mānu̍ṣe̱ jane̍   tenā va̍ha su̱kṛto̍ adhva̱rām̐ upa̱ ye tvā̍ gṛ̱ṇanti̱ vahna̍yaḥ
English: o uṣas win thyself the strength which among men is wonderful  bring thou thereby the pious unto holy rites those who as priests sing praise to thee

Sanskrit: viśvā̍n de̱vām̐ ā va̍ha̱ soma̍pītaye̱ 'ntari̍kṣād uṣa̱s tvam   sāsmāsu̍ dhā̱ goma̱d aśvā̍vad u̱kthya1̱̍m uṣo̱ vāja̍ṁ su̱vīrya̍m
English: bring from the firmament o uṣas all the gods that they may drink our soma juice  and being what thou art vouchsafe us kine and steeds strength meet for praise and hero might

Sanskrit: yasyā̱ ruśa̍nto a̱rcaya̱ḥ prati̍ bha̱drā adṛ̍kṣata   sā no̍ ra̱yiṁ vi̱śvavā̍raṁ su̱peśa̍sam u̱ṣā da̍dātu̱ sugmya̍m
English: may uṣas whose auspicious rays are seen resplendent round about  grant us great riches fair in form of all good things wealth which light labour may attain

Sanskrit: ye ci̱d dhi tvām ṛṣa̍ya̱ḥ pūrva̍ ū̱taye̍ juhū̱re 'va̍se mahi   sā na̱ḥ stomā̍m̐ a̱bhi gṛ̍ṇīhi̱ rādha̱soṣa̍ḥ śu̱kreṇa̍ śo̱ciṣā̍
English: mighty one whom the ṛṣis of old time invoked for their protection and their help  o uṣas graciously answer our songs of praise with bounty and with brilliant light

Sanskrit: uṣo̱ yad a̱dya bhā̱nunā̱ vi dvārā̍v ṛ̱ṇavo̍ di̱vaḥ   pra no̍ yacchatād avṛ̱kam pṛ̱thu ccha̱rdiḥ pra de̍vi̱ goma̍tī̱r iṣa̍ḥ
English: uṣas as thou with light to day hast opened the twin doors of heaven  so grant thou us a dwelling wide and free from foes o goddess give us food with kine

Sanskrit: saṁ no̍ rā̱yā bṛ̍ha̱tā vi̱śvape̍śasā mimi̱kṣvā sam iḻā̍bhi̱r ā   saṁ dyu̱mnena̍ viśva̱turo̍ṣo mahi̱ saṁ vājai̍r vājinīvati
English: bring us to wealth abundant sent in every shape to plentiful refreshing food  to allsubduing splendour uṣas mighty one to strength thou rich in spoil and wealth

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ vā̱m madhu̍mattamaḥ su̱taḥ soma̍ ṛtāvṛdhā   tam a̍śvinā pibataṁ ti̱roa̍hnyaṁ dha̱ttaṁ ratnā̍ni dā̱śuṣe̍
English: aśvins for you who strengthen law this sweetest soma hath been shed  drink this expressed ere yesterday and give riches to him who offers it

Sanskrit: tri̱va̱ndhu̱reṇa̍ tri̱vṛtā̍ su̱peśa̍sā̱ rathe̱nā yā̍tam aśvinā   kaṇvā̍so vā̱m brahma̍ kṛṇvanty adhva̱re teṣā̱ṁ su śṛ̍ṇuta̱ṁ hava̍m
English: come o ye aśvins mounted on your triple car threeseated beautiful of form  to you at sacrifice the kaṇvas send the prayer graciously listen to their call

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā̱ madhu̍mattamam pā̱taṁ soma̍m ṛtāvṛdhā   athā̱dya da̍srā̱ vasu̱ bibhra̍tā̱ rathe̍ dā̱śvāṁsa̱m upa̍ gacchatam
English: o aśvins ye who strengthen law drink ye this sweetest soma juice  borne on your wealthfraught car come ye this day to him who offers ye of wondrous deeds

Sanskrit: tri̱ṣa̱dha̱sthe ba̱rhiṣi̍ viśvavedasā̱ madhvā̍ ya̱jñam mi̍mikṣatam   kaṇvā̍so vāṁ su̱taso̍mā a̱bhidya̍vo yu̱vāṁ ha̍vante aśvinā
English: omniscient aśvins on the thriceheaped grass bedew with the sweet juice the sacrifice  the sons of kaṇva striving heavenward call on you with draughts of soma juice outpoured

Sanskrit: yābhi̱ḥ kaṇva̍m a̱bhiṣṭi̍bhi̱ḥ prāva̍taṁ yu̱vam a̍śvinā   tābhi̱ḥ ṣv a1̱̍smām̐ a̍vataṁ śubhas patī pā̱taṁ soma̍m ṛtāvṛdhā
English: o aśvins with those aids wherewith ye guarded kaṇva carefully  keep us o lords of splendour drink the soma juice ye strengtheners of holy law

Sanskrit: su̱dāse̍ dasrā̱ vasu̱ bibhra̍tā̱ rathe̱ pṛkṣo̍ vahatam aśvinā   ra̱yiṁ sa̍mu̱drād u̱ta vā̍ di̱vas pary a̱sme dha̍ttam puru̱spṛha̍m
English: o mighty ones ye gave sudās abundant food brought on your treasureladen car;  so now vouchsafe to us the wealth which many crave either from heaven or from the sea

Sanskrit: yan nā̍satyā parā̱vati̱ yad vā̱ stho adhi̍ tu̱rvaśe̍   ato̱ rathe̍na su̱vṛtā̍ na̱ ā ga̍taṁ sā̱kaṁ sūrya̍sya ra̱śmibhi̍ḥ
English: nāsatyas whether ye be far away or close to turvaśa  borne on your lightlyrolling chariot come to us together with the sunbeams come

Sanskrit: a̱rvāñcā̍ vā̱ṁ sapta̍yo 'dhvara̱śriyo̱ vaha̍ntu̱ sava̱ned upa̍   iṣa̍m pṛ̱ñcantā̍ su̱kṛte̍ su̱dāna̍va̱ ā ba̱rhiḥ sī̍dataṁ narā
English: so let your coursers ornaments of sacrifice bring you to our libations here  bestowing food on him who acts and gives aright sit chiefs upon the sacred grass

Sanskrit: tena̍ nāsa̱tyā ga̍ta̱ṁ rathe̍na̱ sūrya̍tvacā   yena̱ śaśva̍d ū̱hathu̍r dā̱śuṣe̱ vasu̱ madhva̱ḥ soma̍sya pī̱taye̍
English: come o nāsatyas on your car decked with a sunbright canopy  whereon ye ever bring wealth to the worshipper to drink the soma's pleasant juice

Sanskrit: u̱kthebhi̍r a̱rvāg ava̍se purū̱vasū̍ a̱rkaiś ca̱ ni hva̍yāmahe   śaśva̱t kaṇvā̍nā̱ṁ sada̍si pri̱ye hi ka̱ṁ soma̍m pa̱pathu̍r aśvinā
English: with lauds and songs of praise we call them down to us that they most rich may succour us;  for ye have ever in the kaṇvas' wellloved house o aśvins drunk the soma juice

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne̱ vasū̍m̐r i̱ha ru̱drām̐ ā̍di̱tyām̐ u̱ta   yajā̍ svadhva̱raṁ jana̱m manu̍jātaṁ ghṛta̱pruṣa̍m
English: worship the vasus agni! here the rudras the ādityas all  who spring from manu those who know fair rites who pour their blessings down

Sanskrit: śru̱ṣṭī̱vāno̱ hi dā̱śuṣe̍ de̱vā a̍gne̱ vice̍tasaḥ   tān ro̍hidaśva girvaṇa̱s traya̍striṁśata̱m ā va̍ha
English: agni the gods who understand give ear unto the worshipper  lord of red steeds who lovest song bring thou those threeandthirty gods

Sanskrit: pri̱ya̱me̱dha̱vad a̍tri̱vaj jāta̍vedo virūpa̱vat   a̱ṅgi̱ra̱svan ma̍hivrata̱ praska̍ṇvasya śrudhī̱ hava̍m
English: o jātavedas great in act hearken thou to praskaṇva's call  as priyamedha erst was heard atri virūpa aṅgiras

Sanskrit: mahi̍kerava ū̱taye̍ pri̱yame̍dhā ahūṣata   rāja̍ntam adhva̱rāṇā̍m a̱gniṁ śu̱kreṇa̍ śo̱ciṣā̍
English: the sons of priyamedha skilled in lofty praise have called for help  on agni who with fulgent flame is ruler of all holy rites

Sanskrit: ghṛtā̍havana santye̱mā u̱ ṣu śru̍dhī̱ gira̍ḥ   yābhi̱ḥ kaṇva̍sya sū̱navo̱ hava̱nte 'va̍se tvā
English: hear thou invoked with holy oil bountiful giver of rewards  these eulogies whereby the sons of kaṇva call thee to their aid

Sanskrit: tvāṁ ci̍traśravastama̱ hava̍nte vi̱kṣu ja̱ntava̍ḥ   śo̱ciṣke̍śam purupri̱yāgne̍ ha̱vyāya̱ voḻha̍ve
English: o agni loved by many thou of fame most wondrous in their homes  men call on thee whose hair is flame to be the bearer of their gifts

Sanskrit: ni tvā̱ hotā̍ram ṛ̱tvija̍ṁ dadhi̱re va̍su̱vitta̍mam   śrutka̍rṇaṁ sa̱pratha̍stama̱ṁ viprā̍ agne̱ divi̍ṣṭiṣu
English: thee agni best to find out wealth most widely famous quick to hear  singers have stablished in their rites herald and ministering priest

Sanskrit: ā tvā̱ viprā̍ acucyavuḥ su̱taso̍mā a̱bhi praya̍ḥ   bṛ̱had bhā bibhra̍to ha̱vir agne̱ martā̍ya dā̱śuṣe̍
English: singers with soma pressed have made thee agni hasten to the feast  great light to mortal worshipper what time they bring the sacred gift

Sanskrit: prā̱ta̱ryāvṇa̍ḥ sahaskṛta soma̱peyā̍ya santya   i̱hādya daivya̱ṁ jana̍m ba̱rhir ā sā̍dayā vaso
English: good bounteous son of strength this day seat here on sacred grass the gods  who come at early morn the host of heaven to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: a̱rvāñca̱ṁ daivya̱ṁ jana̱m agne̱ yakṣva̱ sahū̍tibhiḥ   a̱yaṁ soma̍ḥ sudānava̱s tam pā̍ta ti̱roa̍hnyam
English: bring with joint invocations thou o agni the celestial host  here stands the soma bounteous gods drink this expressed ere yesterday

Sanskrit: agne̱ viva̍svad u̱ṣasa̍ś ci̱traṁ rādho̍ amartya   ā dā̱śuṣe̍ jātavedo vahā̱ tvam a̱dyā de̱vām̐ u̍ṣa̱rbudha̍ḥ
English: immortal jātavedas thou manyhued fulgent gift of dawn  agni this day to him who pays oblations bring the gods who waken with the morn

Sanskrit: juṣṭo̱ hi dū̱to asi̍ havya̱vāha̱no 'gne̍ ra̱thīr a̍dhva̱rāṇā̍m   sa̱jūr a̱śvibhyā̍m u̱ṣasā̍ su̱vīrya̍m a̱sme dhe̍hi̱ śravo̍ bṛ̱hat
English: for thou art offeringbearer and loved messenger the charioteer of sacrifice  accordant with the aśvins and with dawn grant us heroic strength and lofty fame

Sanskrit: a̱dyā dū̱taṁ vṛ̍ṇīmahe̱ vasu̍m a̱gnim pu̍rupri̱yam   dhū̱make̍tu̱m bhāṛ̍jīka̱ṁ vyu̍ṣṭiṣu ya̱jñānā̍m adhvara̱śriya̍m
English: as messenger we choose today agni the good whom many love  smokebannered spreader of the light at break of day glory of sacrificial rites

Sanskrit: śreṣṭha̱ṁ yavi̍ṣṭha̱m ati̍thi̱ṁ svā̍huta̱ṁ juṣṭa̱ṁ janā̍ya dā̱śuṣe̍   de̱vām̐ acchā̱ yāta̍ve jā̱tave̍dasam a̱gnim ī̍ḻe̱ vyu̍ṣṭiṣu
English: him noblest and most youthful richly worshipped guest dear to the men who offer gifts  him agni jātavedas i beseech at dawn that he may bring the gods to us

Sanskrit: sta̱vi̱ṣyāmi̱ tvām a̱haṁ viśva̍syāmṛta bhojana   agne̍ trā̱tāra̍m a̱mṛta̍m miyedhya̱ yaji̍ṣṭhaṁ havyavāhana
English: thee agni will i glorify deathless nourisher of the world  immortal offeringbearer meet for sacred food preserver best at sacrifice

Sanskrit: su̱śaṁso̍ bodhi gṛṇa̱te ya̍viṣṭhya̱ madhu̍jihva̱ḥ svā̍hutaḥ   praska̍ṇvasya prati̱rann āyu̍r jī̱vase̍ nama̱syā daivya̱ṁ jana̍m
English: tell good things to thy praiser o most youthful god as richly worshipped honeytongued  and granting to praskaṇva lengthened days of life show honour to the heavenly host

Sanskrit: hotā̍raṁ vi̱śvave̍dasa̱ṁ saṁ hi tvā̱ viśa̍ i̱ndhate̍   sa ā va̍ha puruhūta̱ prace̍ta̱so 'gne̍ de̱vām̐ i̱ha dra̱vat
English: for the men agni kindle thee as all possessor and as priest;  so agni muchinvoked bring hither with all speed the gods the excellently wise

Sanskrit: sa̱vi̱tāra̍m u̱ṣasa̍m a̱śvinā̱ bhaga̍m a̱gniṁ vyu̍ṣṭiṣu̱ kṣapa̍ḥ   kaṇvā̍sas tvā su̱taso̍māsa indhate havya̱vāha̍ṁ svadhvara
English: at dawn of day at night uṣas and savitar the aśvins bhaga agni's self  skilled in fair rites with soma poured the kaṇvas light thee the oblationwafting god

Sanskrit: pati̱r hy a̍dhva̱rāṇā̱m agne̍ dū̱to vi̱śām asi̍   u̱ṣa̱rbudha̱ ā va̍ha̱ soma̍pītaye de̱vām̐ a̱dya sva̱rdṛśa̍ḥ
English: for agni lord of sacrifice and messenger of men art thou  bring thou the gods who wake at dawn who see the light this day to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: agne̱ pūrvā̱ anū̱ṣaso̍ vibhāvaso dī̱detha̍ vi̱śvada̍rśataḥ   asi̱ grāme̍ṣv avi̱tā pu̱rohi̱to 'si̍ ya̱jñeṣu̱ mānu̍ṣaḥ
English: thou shonest forth o agni after former dawns all visible o rich in light  thou art our help in battlestrife the friend of man the great high priest in sacrifice

Sanskrit: ni tvā̍ ya̱jñasya̱ sādha̍na̱m agne̱ hotā̍ram ṛ̱tvija̍m   ma̱nu̱ṣvad de̍va dhīmahi̱ prace̍tasaṁ jī̱raṁ dū̱tam ama̍rtyam
English: like manu we will stablish thee agni performer of the rite  invoker ministering priest exceeding wise the swift immortal messenger

Sanskrit: yad de̱vānā̍m mitramahaḥ pu̱rohi̱to 'nta̍ro̱ yāsi̍ dū̱tya̍m   sindho̍r iva̱ prasva̍nitāsa ū̱rmayo̱ 'gner bhrā̍jante a̱rcaya̍ḥ
English: when as the gods high priest by many loved thou dost their mission as their nearest friend  then like the farresounding billows of the flood thy flames o agni roar aloud

Sanskrit: śru̱dhi śru̍tkarṇa̱ vahni̍bhir de̱vair a̍gne sa̱yāva̍bhiḥ   ā sī̍dantu ba̱rhiṣi̍ mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā prā̍ta̱ryāvā̍ṇo adhva̱ram
English: hear agni who hast ears to hear with all thy train of escort gods;  let mitra aryaman seeking betimes our rite seat them upon the sacred grass

Sanskrit: śṛ̱ṇvantu̱ stoma̍m ma̱ruta̍ḥ su̱dāna̍vo 'gniji̱hvā ṛ̍tā̱vṛdha̍ḥ   piba̍tu̱ soma̱ṁ varu̍ṇo dhṛ̱tavra̍to̱ 'śvibhyā̍m u̱ṣasā̍ sa̱jūḥ
English: let those who strengthen law who bountifully give the lifetongued maruts hear our praise  may lawsupporting varuṇa with the aśvins twain and uṣas drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: e̱ṣo u̱ṣā apū̍rvyā̱ vy u̍cchati pri̱yā di̱vaḥ   stu̱ṣe vā̍m aśvinā bṛ̱hat
English: now morning with her earliest light shines forth dear daughter of the sky  high aśvins i extol your praise

Sanskrit: yā da̱srā sindhu̍mātarā mano̱tarā̍ rayī̱ṇām   dhi̱yā de̱vā va̍su̱vidā̍
English: sons of the sea mighty to save discoverers of riches ye  gods with deep thought who find out wealth

Sanskrit: va̱cyante̍ vāṁ kaku̱hāso̍ jū̱rṇāyā̱m adhi̍ vi̱ṣṭapi̍   yad vā̱ṁ ratho̱ vibhi̱ṣ patā̍t
English: your giant coursers hasten on over the region all in flames   when your car flies with winged steeds

Sanskrit: ha̱viṣā̍ jā̱ro a̱pām pipa̍rti̱ papu̍rir narā   pi̱tā kuṭa̍sya carṣa̱ṇiḥ
English: he liberal lover of the flood lord of the house the vigilant  chiefs! with oblations feeds you full

Sanskrit: ā̱dā̱ro vā̍m matī̱nāṁ nāsa̍tyā matavacasā   pā̱taṁ soma̍sya dhṛṣṇu̱yā
English: ye have regard unto our hymns nāsatyas thinking of our words  drink boldly of the soma juice

Sanskrit: yā na̱ḥ pīpa̍rad aśvinā̱ jyoti̍ṣmatī̱ tama̍s ti̱raḥ   tām a̱sme rā̍sāthā̱m iṣa̍m
English: vouchsafe to us o aśvin pair such strength as with attendant light  may through the darkness carry us

Sanskrit: ā no̍ nā̱vā ma̍tī̱nāṁ yā̱tam pā̱rāya̱ ganta̍ve   yu̱ñjāthā̍m aśvinā̱ ratha̍m
English: come in the ship of these our hymns to bear you to the hither shore  o aśvins harness ye the car

Sanskrit: a̱ritra̍ṁ vāṁ di̱vas pṛ̱thu tī̱rthe sindhū̍nā̱ṁ ratha̍ḥ   dhi̱yā yu̍yujra̱ inda̍vaḥ
English: the heaven's wide vessel is your own on the flood's shore your chariot waits  drops with the hymn have been prepared

Sanskrit: di̱vas ka̍ṇvāsa̱ inda̍vo̱ vasu̱ sindhū̍nām pa̱de   svaṁ va̱vriṁ kuha̍ dhitsathaḥ
English: kaṇvas the drops are in the heaven; the wealth is at the waters' place  where will ye manifest your form?

Sanskrit: abhū̍d u̱ bhā u̍ a̱ṁśave̱ hira̍ṇya̱m prati̱ sūrya̍ḥ   vy a̍khyaj ji̱hvayāsi̍taḥ
English: light came to lighten up the branch the sun appeared as it were gold  and with its tongue shone forth the dark

Sanskrit: abhū̍d u pā̱ram eta̍ve̱ panthā̍ ṛ̱tasya̍ sādhu̱yā   ada̍rśi̱ vi sru̱tir di̱vaḥ
English: the path of sacrifice was made to travel to the farther goal  the road of heaven was manifest

Sanskrit: tatta̱d id a̱śvino̱r avo̍ jari̱tā prati̍ bhūṣati   made̱ soma̍sya̱ pipra̍toḥ
English: the singer of their praise awaits whatever grace the aśvins give  who save when soma gladdens them

Sanskrit: vā̱va̱sā̱nā vi̱vasva̍ti̱ soma̍sya pī̱tyā gi̱rā   ma̱nu̱ṣvac cha̍mbhū̱ ā ga̍tam
English: ye dwellers with vivasvān come auspicious as to manu erst;  come to the soma and our praise

Sanskrit: yu̱vor u̱ṣā anu̱ śriya̱m pari̍jmanor u̱pāca̍rat   ṛ̱tā va̍natho a̱ktubhi̍ḥ
English: o circumambient aśvins dawn follows the brightness of your way  approve with beams our solemn rites

Sanskrit: u̱bhā pi̍batam aśvino̱bhā na̱ḥ śarma̍ yacchatam   a̱vi̱dri̱yābhi̍r ū̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: drink ye of our libations grant protection o ye aśvins twain  with aids which none may interrupt

Sanskrit: sam pū̍ṣa̱nn adhva̍nas tira̱ vy aṁho̍ vimuco napāt   sakṣvā̍ deva̱ pra ṇa̍s pu̱raḥ
English: shorten our ways o pūṣan move aside obstruction in the path  go close before us cloudborn god

Sanskrit: yo na̍ḥ pūṣann a̱gho vṛko̍ du̱ḥśeva̍ ā̱dide̍śati   apa̍ sma̱ tam pa̱tho ja̍hi
English: drive pūṣan from our road the wolf the wicked inauspicious wolf  who lies in wait to injure us

Sanskrit: apa̱ tyam pa̍ripa̱nthina̍m muṣī̱vāṇa̍ṁ hura̱ścita̍m   dū̱ram adhi̍ sru̱ter a̍ja
English: who lurks about the path we take the robber with a guileful heart  far from the road chase him away

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tasya̍ dvayā̱vino̱ 'ghaśa̍ṁsasya̱ kasya̍ cit   pa̱dābhi ti̍ṣṭha̱ tapu̍ṣim
English: tread with thy foot and trample out the firebrand of the wicked one  the doubletongued whoeer he be

Sanskrit: ā tat te̍ dasra mantuma̱ḥ pūṣa̱nn avo̍ vṛṇīmahe   yena̍ pi̱tṝn aco̍dayaḥ
English: wise pūṣan wonderworker we claim of thee now the aid wherewith  thou furtheredst our sires of old

Sanskrit: adhā̍ no viśvasaubhaga̱ hira̍ṇyavāśīmattama   dhanā̍ni su̱ṣaṇā̍ kṛdhi
English: so lord of all prosperity best wielder of the golden sword  make riches easy to be won

Sanskrit: ati̍ naḥ sa̱ścato̍ naya su̱gā na̍ḥ su̱pathā̍ kṛṇu   pūṣa̍nn i̱ha kratu̍ṁ vidaḥ
English: past all pursuers lead us make pleasant our path and fair to tread  o pūṣan find thou power for this

Sanskrit: a̱bhi sū̱yava̍saṁ naya̱ na na̍vajvā̱ro adhva̍ne   pūṣa̍nn i̱ha kratu̍ṁ vidaḥ
English: lead us to meadows rich in grass send on our way no early heat  o pūṣan find thou power for this

Sanskrit: śa̱gdhi pū̱rdhi pra ya̍ṁsi ca śiśī̱hi prāsy u̱dara̍m   pūṣa̍nn i̱ha kratu̍ṁ vidaḥ
English: be gracious to us fill us full give feed us and invigorate  o pūṣan find thou power for this

Sanskrit: na pū̱ṣaṇa̍m methāmasi sū̱ktair a̱bhi gṛ̍ṇīmasi   vasū̍ni da̱smam ī̍mahe
English: no blame have we for pūṣan; him we magnify with songs of praise  we seek the mighty one for wealth

Sanskrit: kad ru̱drāya̱ prace̍tase mī̱ḻhuṣṭa̍māya̱ tavya̍se   vo̱cema̱ śaṁta̍maṁ hṛ̱de
English: what shall we sing to rudra strong most bounteous excellently wise  that shall be dearest to his heart?

Sanskrit: yathā̍ no̱ adi̍ti̱ḥ kara̱t paśve̱ nṛbhyo̱ yathā̱ gave̍   yathā̍ to̱kāya̍ ru̱driya̍m
English: that aditi may grant the grace of rudra to our folk our kine  our cattle and our progeny;

Sanskrit: yathā̍ no mi̱tro varu̍ṇo̱ yathā̍ ru̱draś cike̍tati   yathā̱ viśve̍ sa̱joṣa̍saḥ
English: that mitra and that varuṇa that rudra may remember us  yea all the gods with one accord

Sanskrit: gā̱thapa̍tim me̱dhapa̍tiṁ ru̱draṁ jalā̍ṣabheṣajam   tac cha̱ṁyoḥ su̱mnam ī̍mahe
English: to rudra lord of sacrifice of hymns and balmy medicines  we pray for joy and health and strength

Sanskrit: yaḥ śu̱kra i̍va̱ sūryo̱ hira̍ṇyam iva̱ roca̍te   śreṣṭho̍ de̱vānā̱ṁ vasu̍ḥ
English: he shines in splendour like the sun refulgent as bright gold is he  the good the best among the gods

Sanskrit: śaṁ na̍ḥ kara̱ty arva̍te su̱gam me̱ṣāya̍ me̱ṣye̍   nṛbhyo̱ nāri̍bhyo̱ gave̍
English: may he grant health into our steeds wellbeing to our rams and ewes  to men to women and to kine

Sanskrit: a̱sme so̍ma̱ śriya̱m adhi̱ ni dhe̍hi śa̱tasya̍ nṛ̱ṇām   mahi̱ śrava̍s tuvinṛ̱mṇam
English: o soma set thou upon us the glory of a hundred men  the great renown of mighty chiefs

Sanskrit: mā na̍ḥ somapari̱bādho̱ mārā̍tayo juhuranta   ā na̍ indo̱ vāje̍ bhaja
English: let not malignities nor those who trouble soma hinder us  indu give us a share of strength

Sanskrit: yās te̍ pra̱jā a̱mṛta̍sya̱ para̍smi̱n dhāma̍nn ṛ̱tasya̍   mū̱rdhā nābhā̍ soma vena ā̱bhūṣa̍ntīḥ soma vedaḥ
English: soma! head central point love these; soma! know these as serving thee  children of thee immortal at the highest place of holy law

Sanskrit: yaṁ rakṣa̍nti̱ prace̍taso̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā   nū ci̱t sa da̍bhyate̱ jana̍ḥ
English: neer is he injured whom the gods varuṇa mitra aryaman  the excellently wise protect

Sanskrit: yam bā̱hute̍va̱ pipra̍ti̱ pānti̱ martya̍ṁ ri̱ṣaḥ   ari̍ṣṭa̱ḥ sarva̍ edhate
English: he prospers ever free from scathe whom they as with full hands enrich  whom they preserve from every foe

Sanskrit: vi du̱rgā vi dviṣa̍ḥ pu̱ro ghnanti̱ rājā̍na eṣām   naya̍nti duri̱tā ti̱raḥ
English: the kings drive far away from him his troubles and his enemies  and lead him safely oer distress

Sanskrit: su̱gaḥ panthā̍ anṛkṣa̱ra ādi̍tyāsa ṛ̱taṁ ya̱te   nātrā̍vakhā̱do a̍sti vaḥ
English: thornless ādityas is the path easy for him who seeks the law  with him is naught to anger you

Sanskrit: yaṁ ya̱jñaṁ naya̍thā nara̱ ādi̍tyā ṛ̱junā̍ pa̱thā   pra va̱ḥ sa dhī̱taye̍ naśat
English: what sacrifice ādityas ye heroes guide by the path direct  may that come nigh unto your thought

Sanskrit: sa ratna̱m martyo̱ vasu̱ viśva̍ṁ to̱kam u̱ta tmanā̍   acchā̍ gaccha̱ty astṛ̍taḥ
English: that mortal ever unsubdued gains wealth and every precious thing  and children also of his own

Sanskrit: ka̱thā rā̍dhāma sakhāya̱ḥ stoma̍m mi̱trasyā̍rya̱mṇaḥ   mahi̱ psaro̱ varu̍ṇasya
English: how my friends shall we prepare aryaman's and mitra's laud  glorious food of varuṇa?

Sanskrit: mā vo̱ ghnanta̱m mā śapa̍nta̱m prati̍ voce deva̱yanta̍m   su̱mnair id va̱ ā vi̍vāse
English: i point not out to you a man who strikes the pious or reviles  only with hymns i call you nigh

Sanskrit: ca̱tura̍ś ci̱d dada̍mānād bibhī̱yād ā nidhā̍toḥ   na du̍ru̱ktāya̍ spṛhayet
English: let him not love to speak ill words but fear the one who holds all four  within his hand until they fall

Sanskrit: ut ti̍ṣṭha brahmaṇas pate deva̱yanta̍s tvemahe   upa̱ pra ya̍ntu ma̱ruta̍ḥ su̱dāna̍va̱ indra̍ prā̱śūr bha̍vā̱ sacā̍
English: o brahmaṇaspati stand up godserving men we pray to thee  may they who give good gifts the maruts come to us indra most swift be thou with them

Sanskrit: tvām id dhi sa̍hasas putra̱ martya̍ upabrū̱te dhane̍ hi̱te   su̱vīrya̍m maruta̱ ā svaśvya̱ṁ dadhī̍ta̱ yo va̍ āca̱ke
English: o son of strength each mortal calls to thee for aid when spoil of battle waits for him  o maruts may this man who loves you well obtain wealth of good steeds and hero might

Sanskrit: praitu̱ brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̱ḥ pra de̱vy e̍tu sū̱nṛtā̍   acchā̍ vī̱raṁ narya̍m pa̱ṅktirā̍dhasaṁ de̱vā ya̱jñaṁ na̍yantu naḥ
English: may brahmaṇaspati draw nigh may sūnṛtā the goddess come  and gods bring to this rite which gives the fivefold gift the hero lover of mankind

Sanskrit: yo vā̱ghate̱ dadā̍ti sū̱nara̱ṁ vasu̱ sa dha̍tte̱ akṣi̍ti̱ śrava̍ḥ   tasmā̱ iḻā̍ṁ su̱vīrā̱m ā ya̍jāmahe su̱pratū̍rtim ane̱hasa̍m
English: he who bestows a noble guerdon on the priest wins fame that never shall decay  for him we offer sacred herogiving food peerless and conquering easily

Sanskrit: pra nū̱nam brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̱r mantra̍ṁ vadaty u̱kthya̍m   yasmi̱nn indro̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā de̱vā okā̍ṁsi cakri̱re
English: now brahmaṇaspati speaks forth aloud the solemn hymn of praise  wherein indra and varuṇa mitra aryaman the gods have made their dwelling place

Sanskrit: tam id vo̍cemā vi̱dathe̍ṣu śa̱mbhuva̱m mantra̍ṁ devā ane̱hasa̍m   i̱māṁ ca̱ vāca̍m prati̱harya̍thā naro̱ viśved vā̱mā vo̍ aśnavat
English: may we in holy synods gods! recite that hymn peerless that brings felicity  if you o heroes graciously accept this word may it obtain all bliss from you

Sanskrit: ko de̍va̱yanta̍m aśnava̱j jana̱ṁ ko vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣam   prapra̍ dā̱śvān pa̱styā̍bhir asthitānta̱rvāva̱t kṣaya̍ṁ dadhe
English: who shall approach the pious? who the man whose sacred grass is trimmed?  the offerer with his folk advances more and more he fills his house with precious things

Sanskrit: upa̍ kṣa̱tram pṛ̍ñcī̱ta hanti̱ rāja̍bhir bha̱ye ci̍t sukṣi̱tiṁ da̍dhe   nāsya̍ va̱rtā na ta̍ru̱tā ma̍hādha̱ne nārbhe̍ asti va̱jriṇa̍ḥ
English: he amplifies his lordly might with kings he slays een mid alarms he dwells secure  in great or lesser fight none checks him none subduesthe wielder of the thunderbolt

Sanskrit: pra yad i̱tthā pa̍rā̱vata̍ḥ śo̱cir na māna̱m asya̍tha   kasya̱ kratvā̍ maruta̱ḥ kasya̱ varpa̍sā̱ kaṁ yā̍tha̱ kaṁ ha̍ dhūtayaḥ
English: when thus like flame from far away maruts ye cast your measure forth  to whom go ye to whom o shakers of the earth moved by whose wisdom whose design?

Sanskrit: sthi̱rā va̍ḥ sa̱ntv āyu̍dhā parā̱ṇude̍ vī̱ḻū u̱ta pra̍ti̱ṣkabhe̍   yu̱ṣmāka̍m astu̱ tavi̍ṣī̱ panī̍yasī̱ mā martya̍sya mā̱yina̍ḥ
English: strong let your weapons be to drive away your foes firm for resistance let them be  yea passing glorious must be your warrior might not as a guileful mortal's strength

Sanskrit: parā̍ ha̱ yat sthi̱raṁ ha̱tha naro̍ va̱rtaya̍thā gu̱ru   vi yā̍thana va̱nina̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyā vy āśā̱ḥ parva̍tānām
English: when what is strong ye overthrow and whirl about each ponderous thing  heroes your course is through the forest trees of earth and through the fissures of the rocks

Sanskrit: na̱hi va̱ḥ śatru̍r vivi̱de adhi̱ dyavi̱ na bhūmyā̍ṁ riśādasaḥ   yu̱ṣmāka̍m astu̱ tavi̍ṣī̱ tanā̍ yu̱jā rudrā̍so̱ nū ci̍d ā̱dhṛṣe̍
English: consumers of your foes no enemy of yours is found in heaven or on the earth  ye rudras may the strength held in this bond be yours to bid defiance even now

Sanskrit: pra ve̍payanti̱ parva̍tā̱n vi vi̍ñcanti̱ vana̱spatī̍n   pro ā̍rata maruto du̱rmadā̍ iva̱ devā̍sa̱ḥ sarva̍yā vi̱śā
English: they make the mountains rock and reel they rend the forestkings apart  onward ye maruts drive like creatures drunk with wine ye gods with all your company

Sanskrit: upo̱ rathe̍ṣu̱ pṛṣa̍tīr ayugdhva̱m praṣṭi̍r vahati̱ rohi̍taḥ   ā vo̱ yāmā̍ya pṛthi̱vī ci̍d aśro̱d abī̍bhayanta̱ mānu̍ṣāḥ
English: ye to your chariot have yoked the spotted deer a red deer as a leader draws  even the earth herself listened as ye came near and men were sorely terrified

Sanskrit: ā vo̍ ma̱kṣū tanā̍ya̱ kaṁ rudrā̱ avo̍ vṛṇīmahe   gantā̍ nū̱naṁ no 'va̍sā̱ yathā̍ pu̱retthā kaṇvā̍ya bi̱bhyuṣe̍
English: o rudras quickly we desire your succour for this work of ours  come to us with your aid as in the days of old so now for frightened kaṇva's sake

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmeṣi̍to maruto̱ martye̍ṣita̱ ā yo no̱ abhva̱ īṣa̍te   vi taṁ yu̍yota̱ śava̍sā̱ vy oja̍sā̱ vi yu̱ṣmākā̍bhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: should any monstrous foe o maruts sent by you or sent by mortals threaten us  tear ye him from us with your power and with your might and with the succours that are yours

Sanskrit: asā̍mi̱ hi pra̍yajyava̱ḥ kaṇva̍ṁ da̱da pra̍cetasaḥ   asā̍mibhir maruta̱ ā na̍ ū̱tibhi̱r gantā̍ vṛ̱ṣṭiṁ na vi̱dyuta̍ḥ
English: for ye the worshipful and wise have guarded kaṇva perfectly  o maruts come to us with full protecting help as lightning flashes seek the rain

Sanskrit: asā̱my ojo̍ bibhṛthā sudāna̱vo 'sā̍mi dhūtaya̱ḥ śava̍ḥ   ṛ̱ṣi̱dviṣe̍ marutaḥ parima̱nyava̱ iṣu̱ṁ na sṛ̍jata̱ dviṣa̍m
English: whole strength have ye o bounteous ones; perfect earthshakers is your might  maruts against the poet's wrathful enemy send ye an enemy like a dart

Sanskrit: kad dha̍ nū̱naṁ ka̍dhapriyaḥ pi̱tā pu̱traṁ na hasta̍yoḥ   da̱dhi̱dhve vṛ̍ktabarhiṣaḥ
English: what now? when will ye take us by both hands as a dear sire his son  gods for whom sacred grass is clipped?

Sanskrit: kva̍ nū̱naṁ kad vo̱ artha̱ṁ gantā̍ di̱vo na pṛ̍thi̱vyāḥ   kva̍ vo̱ gāvo̱ na ra̍ṇyanti
English: now whither? to what goal of yours go ye in heaven and not on earth?  where do your cows disport themselves?

Sanskrit: kva̍ vaḥ su̱mnā navyā̍ṁsi̱ maru̍ta̱ḥ kva̍ suvi̱tā   kvo̱3̱̍ viśvā̍ni̱ saubha̍gā
English: where are your newest favours shown? where maruts your prosperity?  where all your high felicities?

Sanskrit: yad yū̱yam pṛ̍śnimātaro̱ martā̍sa̱ḥ syāta̍na   sto̱tā vo̍ a̱mṛta̍ḥ syāt
English: if o ye maruts ye the sons whom pṛśni bore were mortal and  immortal he who sings your praise

Sanskrit: mā vo̍ mṛ̱go na yava̍se jari̱tā bhū̱d ajo̍ṣyaḥ   pa̱thā ya̱masya̍ gā̱d upa̍
English: then never were your praiser loathed like a wild beast in pastureland  nor should he go on yama's path

Sanskrit: mo ṣu ṇa̱ḥ parā̍parā̱ nirṛ̍tir du̱rhaṇā̍ vadhīt   pa̱dī̱ṣṭa tṛṣṇa̍yā sa̱ha
English: let not destructive plague on plague hard to be conquered strike its down  let each with drought depart from us

Sanskrit: sa̱tyaṁ tve̱ṣā ama̍vanto̱ dhanva̍ñ ci̱d ā ru̱driyā̍saḥ   miha̍ṁ kṛṇvanty avā̱tām
English: truly they the fierce and mighty sons of rudra send their windless  rain een on the desert places

Sanskrit: vā̱śreva̍ vi̱dyun mi̍māti va̱tsaṁ na mā̱tā si̍ṣakti   yad e̍ṣāṁ vṛ̱ṣṭir asa̍rji
English: like a cow the lightning lows and follows motherlike her youngling  when their rainflood hath been loosened

Sanskrit: divā̍ ci̱t tama̍ḥ kṛṇvanti pa̱rjanye̍nodavā̱hena̍   yat pṛ̍thi̱vīṁ vyu̱ndanti̍
English: when they inundate the earth they spread forth darkness een in day time  with the waterladen raincloud

Sanskrit: adha̍ sva̱nān ma̱rutā̱ṁ viśva̱m ā sadma̱ pārthi̍vam   are̍janta̱ pra mānu̍ṣāḥ
English: o maruts at your voice's sound this earthly habitation shakes  and each man reels who dwells therein

Sanskrit: maru̍to vīḻupā̱ṇibhi̍ś ci̱trā rodha̍svatī̱r anu̍   yā̱tem akhi̍drayāmabhiḥ
English: o maruts with your stronghoofed steeds unhindered in their courses haste  along the bright embanked streams

Sanskrit: sthi̱rā va̍ḥ santu ne̱mayo̱ rathā̱ aśvā̍sa eṣām   susa̍ṁskṛtā a̱bhīśa̍vaḥ
English: firm be the fellies of your wheels steady your horses and your cars  and may your reins be fashioned well

Sanskrit: acchā̍ vadā̱ tanā̍ gi̱rā ja̱rāyai̱ brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̍m   a̱gnim mi̱traṁ na da̍rśa̱tam
English: invite thou hither with this song for praise agni the lord of prayer  him who is fair as mitra is

Sanskrit: mi̱mī̱hi śloka̍m ā̱sye̍ pa̱rjanya̍ iva tatanaḥ   gāya̍ gāya̱tram u̱kthya̍m
English: form in thy mouth the hymn of praise expand thee like a rainy cloud  sing forth the measured eulogy

Sanskrit: vanda̍sva̱ māru̍taṁ ga̱ṇaṁ tve̱ṣam pa̍na̱syum a̱rkiṇa̍m   a̱sme vṛ̱ddhā a̍sann i̱ha
English: sing glory to the marut host praiseworthy tuneful vigorous  here let the strong ones dwell with us

Sanskrit: krī̱ḻaṁ va̱ḥ śardho̱ māru̍tam ana̱rvāṇa̍ṁ rathe̱śubha̍m   kaṇvā̍ a̱bhi pra gā̍yata
English: sing forth o kaṇvas to your band of maruts unassailable  sporting resplendent on their car

Sanskrit: ye pṛṣa̍tībhir ṛ̱ṣṭibhi̍ḥ sā̱kaṁ vāśī̍bhir a̱ñjibhi̍ḥ   ajā̍yanta̱ svabhā̍navaḥ
English: they who selfluminous were born together with the spotted deer  spears swords and glittering ornaments

Sanskrit: i̱heva̍ śṛṇva eṣā̱ṁ kaśā̱ haste̍ṣu̱ yad vadā̍n   ni yāma̍ñ ci̱tram ṛ̍ñjate
English: one hears as though twere close at hand the cracking of the whips they hold  they gather glory on their way

Sanskrit: pra va̱ḥ śardhā̍ya̱ ghṛṣva̍ye tve̱ṣadyu̍mnāya śu̱ṣmiṇe̍   de̱vatta̱m brahma̍ gāyata
English: now sing ye forth the godgiven hymn to your exultant marut host  the fiercelyvigorous the strong

Sanskrit: pra śa̍ṁsā̱ goṣv aghnya̍ṁ krī̱ḻaṁ yac chardho̱ māru̍tam   jambhe̱ rasa̍sya vāvṛdhe
English: praise ye the bull among the cows; for tis the maruts sportive band  it strengthened as it drank the rain

Sanskrit: ko vo̱ varṣi̍ṣṭha̱ ā na̍ro di̱vaś ca̱ gmaś ca̍ dhūtayaḥ   yat sī̱m anta̱ṁ na dhū̍nu̱tha
English: who is your mightiest heroes when o shakers of the earth and heaven  ye shake them like a garment's hem?

Sanskrit: ni vo̱ yāmā̍ya̱ mānu̍ṣo da̱dhra u̱grāya̍ ma̱nyave̍   jihī̍ta̱ parva̍to gi̱riḥ
English: at your approach man holds him down before the fury of your wrath  the ruggedjointed mountain yields

Sanskrit: yeṣā̱m ajme̍ṣu pṛthi̱vī ju̍ju̱rvām̐ i̍va vi̱śpati̍ḥ   bhi̱yā yāme̍ṣu̱ reja̍te
English: they at whose racings forth the earth like an ageweakened lord of men  trembles in terror on their ways

Sanskrit: sthi̱raṁ hi jāna̍m eṣā̱ṁ vayo̍ mā̱tur nire̍tave   yat sī̱m anu̍ dvi̱tā śava̍ḥ
English: strong is their birth vigour have they to issue from their mother; strength  yea even twice enough is theirs

Sanskrit: ud u̱ tye sū̱navo̱ gira̱ḥ kāṣṭhā̱ ajme̍ṣv atnata   vā̱śrā a̍bhi̱jñu yāta̍ve
English: and these the sons the singers in their racings have enlarged the bounds  so that the kine must walk kneedeep

Sanskrit: tyaṁ ci̍d ghā dī̱rgham pṛ̱thum mi̱ho napā̍ta̱m amṛ̍dhram   pra cyā̍vayanti̱ yāma̍bhiḥ
English: before them on the ways they go they drop this offspring of the cloud  long broad and inexhaustible

Sanskrit: maru̍to̱ yad dha̍ vo̱ bala̱ṁ janā̍m̐ acucyavītana   gi̱rīm̐r a̍cucyavītana
English: o maruts as your strength is great so have ye cast men down on earth  so have ye made the mountains fall

Sanskrit: yad dha̱ yānti̍ ma̱ruta̱ḥ saṁ ha̍ bruva̱te 'dhva̱nn ā   śṛ̱ṇoti̱ kaś ci̍d eṣām
English: the while the maruts pass along they talk together on the way  doth any hear them as they speak?

Sanskrit: pra yā̍ta̱ śībha̍m ā̱śubhi̱ḥ santi̱ kaṇve̍ṣu vo̱ duva̍ḥ   tatro̱ ṣu mā̍dayādhvai
English: come quick with swift steeds for ye have worshippers among kaṇva's sons  may you rejoice among them well

Sanskrit: asti̱ hi ṣmā̱ madā̍ya va̱ḥ smasi̍ ṣmā va̱yam e̍ṣām   viśva̍ṁ ci̱d āyu̍r jī̱vase̍
English: all is prepared for your delight we are their servants evermore  to live as long as life may last

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ ya̱hvam pu̍rū̱ṇāṁ vi̱śāṁ de̍vaya̱tīnā̍m   a̱gniṁ sū̱ktebhi̱r vaco̍bhir īmahe̱ yaṁ sī̱m id a̱nya īḻa̍te
English: with words sent forth in holy hymns agni we supplicate the lord  of many families who duly serve the gods yea him whom others also praise

Sanskrit: janā̍so a̱gniṁ da̍dhire saho̱vṛdha̍ṁ ha̱viṣma̍nto vidhema te   sa tvaṁ no̍ a̱dya su̱manā̍ i̱hāvi̱tā bhavā̱ vāje̍ṣu santya
English: men have won agni him who makes their strength abound we with oblations worship thee  our graciousminded helper in our deeds of might be thou o excellent this day

Sanskrit: pra tvā̍ dū̱taṁ vṛ̍ṇīmahe̱ hotā̍raṁ vi̱śvave̍dasam   ma̱has te̍ sa̱to vi ca̍ranty a̱rcayo̍ di̱vi spṛ̍śanti bhā̱nava̍ḥ
English: thee for our messenger we choose thee the omniscient for our priest  the flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around thy splendour reaches to the sky

Sanskrit: de̱vāsa̍s tvā̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā saṁ dū̱tam pra̱tnam i̍ndhate   viśva̱ṁ so a̍gne jayati̱ tvayā̱ dhana̱ṁ yas te̍ da̱dāśa̱ martya̍ḥ
English: the gods enkindle thee their ancient messengervaruṇa mitra aryaman  that mortal man o agni gains through thee all wealth who hath poured offerings unto thee

Sanskrit: ma̱ndro hotā̍ gṛ̱hapa̍ti̱r agne̍ dū̱to vi̱śām a̍si   tve viśvā̱ saṁga̍tāni vra̱tā dhru̱vā yāni̍ de̱vā akṛ̍ṇvata
English: thou agni art a cheering priest lord of the house men's messenger  all constant high decrees established by the gods gathered together meet in thee

Sanskrit: tve id a̍gne su̱bhage̍ yaviṣṭhya̱ viśva̱m ā hū̍yate ha̱viḥ   sa tvaṁ no̍ a̱dya su̱manā̍ u̱tāpa̱raṁ yakṣi̍ de̱vān su̱vīryā̍
English: in thee the auspicious one o agni youthfullest each sacred gift is offered up  this day and after gracious worship thou our gods that we may have heroic sons

Sanskrit: taṁ ghe̍m i̱tthā na̍ma̱svina̱ upa̍ sva̱rāja̍m āsate   hotrā̍bhir a̱gnim manu̍ṣa̱ḥ sam i̍ndhate titi̱rvāṁso̱ ati̱ sridha̍ḥ
English: to him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout  men kindle agni with their sacrificial gifts victorious oer the enemies

Sanskrit: ghnanto̍ vṛ̱tram a̍tara̱n roda̍sī a̱pa u̱ru kṣayā̍ya cakrire   bhuva̱t kaṇve̱ vṛṣā̍ dyu̱mny āhu̍ta̱ḥ kranda̱d aśvo̱ gavi̍ṣṭiṣu
English: vṛtra they smote and slew and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode  the glorious bull invoked hath stood at kaṇva's side loud neighed the steed in frays for kine

Sanskrit: saṁ sī̍dasva ma̱hām̐ a̍si̱ śoca̍sva deva̱vīta̍maḥ   vi dhū̱mam a̍gne aru̱ṣam mi̍yedhya sṛ̱ja pra̍śasta darśa̱tam
English: seat thee for thou art mighty; shine best entertainer of the gods  worthy of sacred food praised agni! loose the smoke ruddy and beautiful to see

Sanskrit: yaṁ tvā̍ de̱vāso̱ mana̍ve da̱dhur i̱ha yaji̍ṣṭhaṁ havyavāhana   yaṁ kaṇvo̱ medhyā̍tithir dhana̱spṛta̱ṁ yaṁ vṛṣā̱ yam u̍pastu̱taḥ
English: bearer of offerings whom best sacrificing priest the gods for manu's sake ordained;  whom kaṇva whom medhyātithi made the source of wealth and vṛṣan and upastuta

Sanskrit: yam a̱gnim medhyā̍tithi̱ḥ kaṇva̍ ī̱dha ṛ̱tād adhi̍   tasya̱ preṣo̍ dīdiyu̱s tam i̱mā ṛca̱s tam a̱gniṁ va̍rdhayāmasi
English: him agni whom medhyātithi whom kaṇva kindled for his rite  him these our songs of praise him agni we extol his powers shine out preeminent

Sanskrit: rā̱yas pū̍rdhi svadhā̱vo 'sti̱ hi te 'gne̍ de̱veṣv āpya̍m   tvaṁ vāja̍sya̱ śrutya̍sya rājasi̱ sa no̍ mṛḻa ma̱hām̐ a̍si
English: make our wealth perfect thou o agni lord divine for thou hast kinship with the gods  thou rulest as a king oer widelyfamous strength be good to us for thou art great

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhva ū̱ ṣu ṇa̍ ū̱taye̱ tiṣṭhā̍ de̱vo na sa̍vi̱tā   ū̱rdhvo vāja̍sya̱ sani̍tā̱ yad a̱ñjibhi̍r vā̱ghadbhi̍r vi̱hvayā̍mahe
English: stand up erect to lend us aid stand up like savitar the god  erect as strengthbestower we call aloud with unguents and with priests on thee

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvo na̍ḥ pā̱hy aṁha̍so̱ ni ke̱tunā̱ viśva̱ṁ sam a̱triṇa̍ṁ daha   kṛ̱dhī na̍ ū̱rdhvāñ ca̱rathā̍ya jī̱vase̍ vi̱dā de̱veṣu̍ no̱ duva̍ḥ
English: erect preserve us from sore trouble; with thy flame burn thou each ravening demon dead  raise thou us up that we may walk and live so thou shalt find our worship mid the gods

Sanskrit: pā̱hi no̍ agne ra̱kṣasa̍ḥ pā̱hi dhū̱rter arā̍vṇaḥ   pā̱hi rīṣa̍ta u̱ta vā̱ jighā̍ṁsato̱ bṛha̍dbhāno̱ yavi̍ṣṭhya
English: preserve us agni from the fiend preserve us from malicious wrong  save us from him who fain would injure us or slay most youthful thou with lofty light

Sanskrit: gha̱neva̱ viṣva̱g vi ja̱hy arā̍vṇa̱s tapu̍rjambha̱ yo a̍sma̱dhruk   yo martya̱ḥ śiśī̍te̱ aty a̱ktubhi̱r mā na̱ḥ sa ri̱pur ī̍śata
English: smite down as with a club thou who hast fire for teeth smite thou the wicked right and left  let not the man who plots against us in the night nor any foe prevail oer us

Sanskrit: a̱gnir va̍vne su̱vīrya̍m a̱gniḥ kaṇvā̍ya̱ saubha̍gam   a̱gniḥ prāva̍n mi̱trota medhyā̍tithim a̱gniḥ sā̱tā u̍pastu̱tam
English: agni hath given heroic might to kaṇva and felicity  agni hath helped our friends hath helped medhyātithi hath helped upastuta to win

Sanskrit: a̱gninā̍ tu̱rvaśa̱ṁ yadu̍m parā̱vata̍ u̱grāde̍vaṁ havāmahe   a̱gnir na̍ya̱n nava̍vāstvam bṛ̱hadra̍thaṁ tu̱rvīti̱ṁ dasya̍ve̱ saha̍ḥ
English: we call on ugradeva yadu turvaśa by means of agni from afar;  agni bring navavāstva and bṛhadratha turvīti to subdue the foe

Sanskrit: ni tvām a̍gne̱ manu̍r dadhe̱ jyoti̱r janā̍ya̱ śaśva̍te   dī̱detha̱ kaṇva̍ ṛ̱tajā̍ta ukṣi̱to yaṁ na̍ma̱syanti̍ kṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ
English: manu hath stablished thee a light agni for all the race of men  sprung from the law oilfed for kaṇva hast thou blazed thou whom the people reverence

Sanskrit: tve̱ṣāso̍ a̱gner ama̍vanto a̱rcayo̍ bhī̱māso̱ na pratī̍taye   ra̱kṣa̱svina̱ḥ sada̱m id yā̍tu̱māva̍to̱ viśva̱ṁ sam a̱triṇa̍ṁ daha
English: the flames of agni full of splendour and of might are fearful not to be approached  consume for ever all demons and sorcerers consume thou each devouring fiend

Sanskrit: hvayā̍my a̱gnim pra̍tha̱maṁ sva̱staye̱ hvayā̍mi mi̱trāvaru̍ṇāv i̱hāva̍se   hvayā̍mi̱ rātrī̱ṁ jaga̍to ni̱veśa̍nī̱ṁ hvayā̍mi de̱vaṁ sa̍vi̱tāra̍m ū̱taye̍
English: agni i first invoke for our prosperity; i call on mitra varuṇa to aid us here  i call on night who gives rest to all moving life; i call on savitar the god to lend us help

Sanskrit: ā kṛ̱ṣṇena̱ raja̍sā̱ varta̍māno nive̱śaya̍nn a̱mṛta̱m martya̍ṁ ca   hi̱ra̱ṇyaye̍na savi̱tā rathe̱nā de̱vo yā̍ti̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ paśya̍n
English: throughout the dusky firmament advancing laying to rest the immortal and the mortal  borne in his golden chariot he cometh savitar god who looks on every creature

Sanskrit: yāti̍ de̱vaḥ pra̱vatā̱ yāty u̱dvatā̱ yāti̍ śu̱bhrābhyā̍ṁ yaja̱to hari̍bhyām   ā de̱vo yā̍ti savi̱tā pa̍rā̱vato 'pa̱ viśvā̍ duri̱tā bādha̍mānaḥ
English: the god moves by the upward path the downward; with two bright bays adorable he journeys  savitar comes the god from the far distance and chases from us all distress and sorrow

Sanskrit: a̱bhīvṛ̍ta̱ṁ kṛśa̍nair vi̱śvarū̍pa̱ṁ hira̍ṇyaśamyaṁ yaja̱to bṛ̱hanta̍m   āsthā̱d ratha̍ṁ savi̱tā ci̱trabhā̍nuḥ kṛ̱ṣṇā rajā̍ṁsi̱ tavi̍ṣī̱ṁ dadhā̍naḥ
English: his chariot decked with pearl of various colours lofty with golden pole the god hath mounted  the manyrayed one savitar the holy bound bearing power and might for darksome regions

Sanskrit: vi janā̍ñ chyā̱vāḥ śi̍ti̱pādo̍ akhya̱n ratha̱ṁ hira̍ṇyapraüga̱ṁ vaha̍ntaḥ   śaśva̱d viśa̍ḥ savi̱tur daivya̍syo̱pasthe̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni tasthuḥ
