English: drawing the goldyoked car his bays whitefooted have manifested light to all the peoples  held in the lap of savitar divine one all men all beings have their place for ever

Sanskrit: ti̱sro dyāva̍ḥ savi̱tur dvā u̱pasthā̱m̐ ekā̍ ya̱masya̱ bhuva̍ne virā̱ṣāṭ   ā̱ṇiṁ na rathya̍m a̱mṛtādhi̍ tasthur i̱ha bra̍vītu̱ ya u̱ tac cike̍tat
English: three heavens there are; two savitar's adjacent in yama's world is one the home of heroes  as on a linchpin firm rest things immortal he who hath known it let him here declare it

Sanskrit: vi su̍pa̱rṇo a̱ntari̍kṣāṇy akhyad gabhī̱rave̍pā̱ asu̍raḥ sunī̱thaḥ   kve̱3̱̍dānī̱ṁ sūrya̱ḥ kaś ci̍keta kata̱māṁ dyāṁ ra̱śmir a̱syā ta̍tāna
English: he strong of wing hath lightened up the regions deepquivering asura the gentle leader  where now is sūrya where is one to tell us to what celestial sphere his ray hath wandered?

Sanskrit: a̱ṣṭau vy a̍khyat ka̱kubha̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyās trī dhanva̱ yoja̍nā sa̱pta sindhū̍n   hi̱ra̱ṇyā̱kṣaḥ sa̍vi̱tā de̱va āgā̱d dadha̱d ratnā̍ dā̱śuṣe̱ vāryā̍ṇi
English: the earth's eight points his brightness hath illumined three desert regions and the seven rivers  god savitar the goldeyed hath come hither giving choice treasures unto him who worships

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyapāṇiḥ savi̱tā vica̍rṣaṇir u̱bhe dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī a̱ntar ī̍yate   apāmī̍vā̱m bādha̍te̱ veti̱ sūrya̍m a̱bhi kṛ̱ṣṇena̱ raja̍sā̱ dyām ṛ̍ṇoti
English: the goldenhanded savitar farseeing goes on his way between the earth and heaven  drives away sickness bids the sun approach us and spreads the bright sky through the darksome region

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyahasto̱ asu̍raḥ sunī̱thaḥ su̍mṛḻī̱kaḥ svavā̍m̐ yātv a̱rvāṅ   a̱pa̱sedha̍n ra̱kṣaso̍ yātu̱dhānā̱n asthā̍d de̱vaḥ pra̍tido̱ṣaṁ gṛ̍ṇā̱naḥ
English: may he goldhanded asura kind leader come hither to us with his help and favour  driving off rākṣasas and yātudhānas the god is present praised in hymns at evening

Sanskrit: ye te̱ panthā̍ḥ savitaḥ pū̱rvyāso̍ 're̱ṇava̱ḥ sukṛ̍tā a̱ntari̍kṣe   tebhi̍r no a̱dya pa̱thibhi̍ḥ su̱gebhī̱ rakṣā̍ ca no̱ adhi̍ ca brūhi deva
English: o savitar thine ancient dustless pathways are well established in the air's midregion  o god come by those paths so fair to travel preserve thou us from harm this day and bless us

Sanskrit: triś ci̍n no a̱dyā bha̍vataṁ navedasā vi̱bhur vā̱ṁ yāma̍ u̱ta rā̱tir a̍śvinā   yu̱vor hi ya̱ntraṁ hi̱myeva̱ vāsa̍so 'bhyāya̱ṁsenyā̍ bhavatam manī̱ṣibhi̍ḥ
English: ye who observe this day be with us even thrice farstretching is you bounty aśvins and your course  to you as to a cloak in winter we cleave close you are to be drawn nigh unto us by the wise

Sanskrit: traya̍ḥ pa̱vayo̍ madhu̱vāha̍ne̱ rathe̱ soma̍sya ve̱nām anu̱ viśva̱ id vi̍duḥ   traya̍ḥ ska̱mbhāsa̍ḥ skabhi̱tāsa̍ ā̱rabhe̱ trir nakta̍ṁ yā̱thas trir v a̍śvinā̱ divā̍
English: three are the fellies in your honeybearing car that travels after soma's loved one as all know  three are the pillars set upon it for support thrice journey ye by night o aśvins thrice by day

Sanskrit: sa̱mā̱ne aha̱n trir a̍vadyagohanā̱ trir a̱dya ya̱jñam madhu̍nā mimikṣatam   trir vāja̍vatī̱r iṣo̍ aśvinā yu̱vaṁ do̱ṣā a̱smabhya̍m u̱ṣasa̍ś ca pinvatam
English: thrice in the selfsame day ye gods who banish want sprinkle ye thrice today our sacrifice with meath;  and thrice vouchsafe us store of food with plenteous strength at evening o ye aśvins and at break of day

Sanskrit: trir va̱rtir yā̍ta̱ṁ trir anu̍vrate ja̱ne triḥ su̍prā̱vye̍ tre̱dheva̍ śikṣatam   trir nā̱ndya̍ṁ vahatam aśvinā yu̱vaṁ triḥ pṛkṣo̍ a̱sme a̱kṣare̍va pinvatam
English: thrice come ye to our home thrice to the righteous folk thrice triply aid the man who well deserves your help  thrice o ye aśvins bring us what shall make us glad; thrice send us store of food as nevermore to fail

Sanskrit: trir no̍ ra̱yiṁ va̍hatam aśvinā yu̱vaṁ trir de̱vatā̍tā̱ trir u̱tāva̍ta̱ṁ dhiya̍ḥ   triḥ sau̍bhaga̱tvaṁ trir u̱ta śravā̍ṁsi nas tri̱ṣṭhaṁ vā̱ṁ sūre̍ duhi̱tā ru̍ha̱d ratha̍m
English: thrice o ye aśvins bring to us abundant wealth thrice in the gods assembly thrice assist our thoughts  thrice grant ye us prosperity thrice grant us fame; for the sun's daughter hath mounted your threewheeled car

Sanskrit: trir no̍ aśvinā di̱vyāni̍ bheṣa̱jā triḥ pārthi̍vāni̱ trir u̍ dattam a̱dbhyaḥ   o̱māna̍ṁ śa̱ṁyor mama̍kāya sū̱nave̍ tri̱dhātu̱ śarma̍ vahataṁ śubhas patī
English: thrice aśvins grant to us the heavenly medicines thrice those of earth and thrice those that the waters hold  favour and health and strength bestow upon my son; triple protection lords of splendour grant to him

Sanskrit: trir no̍ aśvinā yaja̱tā di̱vedi̍ve̱ pari̍ tri̱dhātu̍ pṛthi̱vīm a̍śāyatam   ti̱sro nā̍satyā rathyā parā̱vata̍ ā̱tmeva̱ vāta̱ḥ svasa̍rāṇi gacchatam
English: thrice are ye to be worshipped day by day by us thrice o ye aśvins ye travel around the earth  carborne from far away o ye nāsatyas come like vital air to bodies come ye to the three

Sanskrit: trir a̍śvinā̱ sindhu̍bhiḥ sa̱ptamā̍tṛbhi̱s traya̍ āhā̱vās tre̱dhā ha̱viṣ kṛ̱tam   ti̱sraḥ pṛ̍thi̱vīr u̱pari̍ pra̱vā di̱vo nāka̍ṁ rakṣethe̱ dyubhi̍r a̱ktubhi̍r hi̱tam
English: thrice o ye aśvins with the seven mother streams; three are the jars the triple offering is prepared  three are the worlds and moving on above the sky ye guard the firmset vault of heaven through days and nights

Sanskrit: kva1̱̍ trī ca̱krā tri̱vṛto̱ ratha̍sya̱ kva1̱̍ trayo̍ va̱ndhuro̱ ye sanī̍ḻāḥ   ka̱dā yogo̍ vā̱jino̱ rāsa̍bhasya̱ yena̍ ya̱jñaṁ nā̍satyopayā̱thaḥ
English: where are the three wheels of your triple chariot where are the three seats thereto firmly fastened?  when will ye yoke the mighty ass that draws it to bring you to our sacrifice nāsatyas?

Sanskrit: ā nā̍satyā̱ gaccha̍taṁ hū̱yate̍ ha̱vir madhva̍ḥ pibatam madhu̱pebhi̍r ā̱sabhi̍ḥ   yu̱vor hi pūrva̍ṁ savi̱toṣaso̱ ratha̍m ṛ̱tāya̍ ci̱traṁ ghṛ̱tava̍nta̱m iṣya̍ti
English: nāsatyas come the sacred gift is offered up; drink the sweet juice with lips that know the sweetness well  savitar sends before the dawn of day your car fraught with oil variouscoloured to our sacrifice

Sanskrit: ā nā̍satyā tri̱bhir e̍kāda̱śair i̱ha de̱vebhi̍r yātam madhu̱peya̍m aśvinā   prāyu̱s tāri̍ṣṭa̱ṁ nī rapā̍ṁsi mṛkṣata̱ṁ sedha̍ta̱ṁ dveṣo̱ bhava̍taṁ sacā̱bhuvā̍
English: come o nāsatyas with the thriceeleven gods; come o ye aśvins to the drinking of the meath  make long our days of life and wipe out all our sins ward off our enemies; be with us evermore

Sanskrit: ā no̍ aśvinā tri̱vṛtā̱ rathe̍nā̱rvāñca̍ṁ ra̱yiṁ va̍hataṁ su̱vīra̍m   śṛ̱ṇvantā̍ vā̱m ava̍se johavīmi vṛ̱dhe ca̍ no bhavata̱ṁ vāja̍sātau
English: borne in your triple car o aśvins bring us present prosperity with noble offspring  i cry to you who hear me for protection be ye our helpers where men win the booty

Sanskrit: etāyā̱mopa̍ ga̱vyanta̱ indra̍m a̱smāka̱ṁ su prama̍tiṁ vāvṛdhāti   a̱nā̱mṛ̱ṇaḥ ku̱vid ād a̱sya rā̱yo gavā̱ṁ keta̱m para̍m ā̱varja̍te naḥ
English: come fain for booty let us seek to indra yet more shall he increase his care that guides us  will not the indestructible endow us with perfect knowledge of this wealth of cattle?

Sanskrit: uped a̱haṁ dha̍na̱dām apra̍tīta̱ṁ juṣṭā̱ṁ na śye̱no va̍sa̱tim pa̍tāmi   indra̍ṁ nama̱syann u̍pa̱mebhi̍r a̱rkair yaḥ sto̱tṛbhyo̱ havyo̱ asti̱ yāma̍n
English: i fly to him invisible wealthgiver as flies the falcon to his cherished eyrie  with fairest hymns of praise adoring indra whom those who laud him must invoke in battle

Sanskrit: ni sarva̍sena iṣu̱dhīm̐r a̍sakta̱ sam a̱ryo gā a̍jati̱ yasya̱ vaṣṭi̍   co̱ṣkū̱yamā̍ṇa indra̱ bhūri̍ vā̱mam mā pa̱ṇir bhū̍r a̱smad adhi̍ pravṛddha
English: mid all his host he bindeth on the quiver he driveth cattle from what foe he pleaseth  gathering up great store of riches indra be thou no trafficker with us most mighty

Sanskrit: vadhī̱r hi dasyu̍ṁ dha̱nina̍ṁ gha̱nena̱m̐ eka̱ś cara̍nn upaśā̱kebhi̍r indra   dhano̱r adhi̍ viṣu̱ṇak te vy ā̍ya̱nn aya̍jvānaḥ sana̱kāḥ preti̍m īyuḥ
English: thou slewest with thy bolt the wealthy dasyu alone yet going with thy helpers indra!  far from the floor of heaven in all directions the ancient riteless ones fled to destruction

Sanskrit: parā̍ cic chī̱rṣā va̍vṛju̱s ta i̱ndrāya̍jvāno̱ yajva̍bhi̱ḥ spardha̍mānāḥ   pra yad di̱vo ha̍rivaḥ sthātar ugra̱ nir a̍vra̱tām̐ a̍dhamo̱ roda̍syoḥ
English: fighting with pious worshippers the riteless turned and fled indra! with averted faces  when thou fierce lord of the bay steeds the stayer blewest from earth and heaven and sky the godless

Sanskrit: ayu̍yutsann anava̱dyasya̱ senā̱m ayā̍tayanta kṣi̱tayo̱ nava̍gvāḥ   vṛ̱ṣā̱yudho̱ na vadhra̍yo̱ nira̍ṣṭāḥ pra̱vadbhi̱r indrā̍c ci̱taya̍nta āyan
English: they met in fight the army of the blameless then the navagvas put forth all their power  they like emasculates with men contending fled conscious by steep paths from indra scattered

Sanskrit: tvam e̱tān ru̍da̱to jakṣa̍ta̱ś cāyo̍dhayo̱ raja̍sa indra pā̱re   avā̍daho di̱va ā dasyu̍m u̱ccā pra su̍nva̱taḥ stu̍va̱taḥ śaṁsa̍m āvaḥ
English: whether they weep or laugh thou hast oerthrown them o indra on the sky's extremest limit  the dasyu thou hast burned from heaven and welcomed the prayer of him who pours the juice and lauds thee

Sanskrit: ca̱krā̱ṇāsa̍ḥ parī̱ṇaha̍m pṛthi̱vyā hira̍ṇyena ma̱ṇinā̱ śumbha̍mānāḥ   na hi̍nvā̱nāsa̍s titiru̱s ta indra̱m pari̱ spaśo̍ adadhā̱t sūrye̍ṇa
English: adorned with their array of gold and jewels they oer the earth a covering veil extended  although they hastened they oercame not indra their spies he compassed with the sun of morning

Sanskrit: pari̱ yad i̍ndra̱ roda̍sī u̱bhe abu̍bhojīr mahi̱nā vi̱śvata̍ḥ sīm   ama̍nyamānām̐ a̱bhi manya̍mānai̱r nir bra̱hmabhi̍r adhamo̱ dasyu̍m indra
English: as thou enjoyest heaven and earth o indra on every side surrounded with thy greatness  so thou with priests hast blown away the dasyu and those who worship not with those who worship

Sanskrit: na ye di̱vaḥ pṛ̍thi̱vyā anta̍m ā̱pur na mā̱yābhi̍r dhana̱dām pa̱ryabhū̍van   yuja̱ṁ vajra̍ṁ vṛṣa̱bhaś ca̍kra̱ indro̱ nir jyoti̍ṣā̱ tama̍so̱ gā a̍dukṣat
English: they who pervaded earth's extremest limit subdued not with their charms the wealthbestower  indra the bull made his ally the thunder and with its light milked cows from out the darkness

Sanskrit: anu̍ sva̱dhām a̍kṣara̱nn āpo̍ a̱syāva̍rdhata̱ madhya̱ ā nā̱vyā̍nām   sa̱dhrī̱cīne̍na̱ mana̍sā̱ tam indra̱ oji̍ṣṭhena̱ hanma̍nāhann a̱bhi dyūn
English: the waters flowed according to their nature; he raid the navigable streams waxed mighty  then indra with his spirit concentrated smote him for ever with his strongest weapon

Sanskrit: ny ā̍vidhyad ilī̱biśa̍sya dṛ̱ḻhā vi śṛ̱ṅgiṇa̍m abhina̱c chuṣṇa̱m indra̍ḥ   yāva̱t taro̍ maghava̱n yāva̱d ojo̱ vajre̍ṇa̱ śatru̍m avadhīḥ pṛta̱nyum
English: indra broke through ilībiśa's strong castles and śuṣṇa with his horn he cut to pieces  thou maghavan for all his might and swiftness slewest thy fighting foeman with thy thunder

Sanskrit: a̱bhi si̱dhmo a̍jigād asya̱ śatrū̱n vi ti̱gmena̍ vṛṣa̱bheṇā̱ puro̍ 'bhet   saṁ vajre̍ṇāsṛjad vṛ̱tram indra̱ḥ pra svām ma̱tim a̍tira̱c chāśa̍dānaḥ
English: fierce on his enemies fell indra's weapon with his sharp bull he rent their forts in pieces  he with his thunderbolt dealt blows on vṛtra; and conquered executing all his purpose

Sanskrit: āva̱ḥ kutsa̍m indra̱ yasmi̍ñ cā̱kan prāvo̱ yudhya̍ntaṁ vṛṣa̱bhaṁ daśa̍dyum   śa̱phacyu̍to re̱ṇur na̍kṣata̱ dyām uc chvai̍tre̱yo nṛ̱ṣāhyā̍ya tasthau
English: indra thou helpest kutsa whom thou lovedst and guardedst brave daśadyu when he battled  the dust of trampling horses rose to heaven and śvitrā's son stood up again for conquest

Sanskrit: āva̱ḥ śama̍ṁ vṛṣa̱bhaṁ tugryā̍su kṣetraje̱ṣe ma̍ghava̱ñ chvitrya̱ṁ gām   jyok ci̱d atra̍ tasthi̱vāṁso̍ akrañ chatrūya̱tām adha̍rā̱ veda̍nākaḥ
English: śvitrā's mild steer o maghavan thou helpest in combat for the land mid tugra's houses  long stood they there before the task was ended thou wast the master of the foemen's treasure

Sanskrit: indra̍sya̱ nu vī̱ryā̍ṇi̱ pra vo̍ca̱ṁ yāni̍ ca̱kāra̍ pratha̱māni̍ va̱jrī   aha̱nn ahi̱m anv a̱pas ta̍tarda̱ pra va̱kṣaṇā̍ abhina̱t parva̍tānām
English: i will declare the manly deeds of indra the first that he achieved the thunderwielder  he slew the dragon then disclosed the waters and cleft the channels of the mountain torrents

Sanskrit: aha̱nn ahi̱m parva̍te śiśriyā̱ṇaṁ tvaṣṭā̍smai̱ vajra̍ṁ sva̱rya̍ṁ tatakṣa   vā̱śrā i̍va dhe̱nava̱ḥ syanda̍mānā̱ añja̍ḥ samu̱dram ava̍ jagmu̱r āpa̍ḥ
English: he slew the dragon lying on the mountain his heavenly bolt of thunder tvaṣṭar fashioned  like lowing kine in rapid flow descending the waters glided downward to the ocean

Sanskrit: vṛ̱ṣā̱yamā̍ṇo 'vṛṇīta̱ soma̱ṁ trika̍drukeṣv apibat su̱tasya̍   ā sāya̍kam ma̱ghavā̍datta̱ vajra̱m aha̍nn enam prathama̱jām ahī̍nām
English: impetuous as a bull he chose the soma and in three sacred beakers drank the juices  maghavan grasped the thunder for his weapon and smote to death this firstborn of the dragons

Sanskrit: yad i̱ndrāha̍n prathama̱jām ahī̍nā̱m ān mā̱yinā̱m ami̍nā̱ḥ prota mā̱yāḥ   āt sūrya̍ṁ ja̱naya̱n dyām u̱ṣāsa̍ṁ tā̱dītnā̱ śatru̱ṁ na kilā̍ vivitse
English: when indra thou hadst slain the dragon's firstborn and overcome the charms of the enchanters  then giving life to sun and dawn and heaven thou foundest not one foe to stand against thee

Sanskrit: aha̍n vṛ̱traṁ vṛ̍tra̱tara̱ṁ vya̍ṁsa̱m indro̱ vajre̍ṇa maha̱tā va̱dhena̍   skandhā̍ṁsīva̱ kuli̍śenā̱ vivṛ̱kṇāhi̍ḥ śayata upa̱pṛk pṛ̍thi̱vyāḥ
English: indra with his own great and deadly thunder smote into pieces vṛtra worst of vṛtras  as trunks of trees what time the axe hath felled them low on the earth so lies the prostrate dragon

Sanskrit: a̱yo̱ddheva̍ du̱rmada̱ ā hi ju̱hve ma̍hāvī̱raṁ tu̍vibā̱dham ṛ̍jī̱ṣam   nātā̍rīd asya̱ samṛ̍tiṁ va̱dhānā̱ṁ saṁ ru̱jānā̍ḥ pipiṣa̱ indra̍śatruḥ
English: he like a mad weak warrior challenged indra the great impetuous manyslaying hero  he brooking not the clashing of the weapons crushedindra's foethe shattered forts in falling

Sanskrit: a̱pād a̍ha̱sto a̍pṛtanya̱d indra̱m āsya̱ vajra̱m adhi̱ sānau̍ jaghāna   vṛṣṇo̱ vadhri̍ḥ prati̱māna̱m bubhū̍ṣan puru̱trā vṛ̱tro a̍śaya̱d vya̍staḥ
English: footless and handless still he challenged indra who smote him with his bolt between the shoulders  emasculate yet claiming manly vigour thus vṛtra lay with scattered limbs dissevered

Sanskrit: na̱daṁ na bhi̱nnam a̍mu̱yā śayā̍na̱m mano̱ ruhā̍ṇā̱ ati̍ ya̱nty āpa̍ḥ   yāś ci̍d vṛ̱tro ma̍hi̱nā pa̱ryati̍ṣṭha̱t tāsā̱m ahi̍ḥ patsuta̱ḥśīr ba̍bhūva
English: there as he lies like a bankbursting river the waters taking courage flow above him  the dragon lies beneath the feet of torrents which vṛtra with his greatness had encompassed

Sanskrit: nī̱cāva̍yā abhavad vṛ̱trapu̱trendro̍ asyā̱ ava̱ vadha̍r jabhāra   utta̍rā̱ sūr adha̍raḥ pu̱tra ā̍sī̱d dānu̍ḥ śaye sa̱hava̍tsā̱ na dhe̱nuḥ
English: then humbled was the strength of vṛtra's mother indra hath cast his deadly bolt against her  the mother was above the son was under and like a cow beside her calf lay danu

Sanskrit: ati̍ṣṭhantīnām aniveśa̱nānā̱ṁ kāṣṭhā̍nā̱m madhye̱ nihi̍ta̱ṁ śarī̍ram   vṛ̱trasya̍ ni̱ṇyaṁ vi ca̍ra̱nty āpo̍ dī̱rghaṁ tama̱ āśa̍ya̱d indra̍śatruḥ
English: rolled in the midst of neverceasing currents flowing without a rest for ever onward  the waters bear off vṛtra's nameless body the foe of indra sank to during darkness

Sanskrit: dā̱sapa̍tnī̱r ahi̍gopā atiṣṭha̱n niru̍ddhā̱ āpa̍ḥ pa̱ṇine̍va̱ gāva̍ḥ   a̱pām bila̱m api̍hita̱ṁ yad āsī̍d vṛ̱traṁ ja̍gha̱nvām̐ apa̱ tad va̍vāra
English: guarded by ahi stood the thralls of dāsas the waters stayed like kine held by the robber  but he when he had smitten vṛtra opened the cave wherein the floods had been imprisoned

Sanskrit: aśvyo̱ vāro̍ abhava̱s tad i̍ndra sṛ̱ke yat tvā̍ pra̱tyaha̍n de̱va eka̍ḥ   aja̍yo̱ gā aja̍yaḥ śūra̱ soma̱m avā̍sṛja̱ḥ sarta̍ve sa̱pta sindhū̍n
English: a horse's tail wast thou when he o indra smote on thy bolt; thou god without a second  thou hast won back the kine hast won the soma; thou hast let loose to flow the seven rivers

Sanskrit: nāsmai̍ vi̱dyun na ta̍nya̱tuḥ si̍ṣedha̱ na yām miha̱m aki̍rad dhrā̱duni̍ṁ ca   indra̍ś ca̱ yad yu̍yu̱dhāte̱ ahi̍ś co̱tāpa̱rībhyo̍ ma̱ghavā̱ vi ji̍gye
English: nothing availed him lightning nothing thunder hailstorm or mist which had spread around him  when indra and the dragon strove in battle maghavan gained the victory for ever

Sanskrit: ahe̍r yā̱tāra̱ṁ kam a̍paśya indra hṛ̱di yat te̍ ja̱ghnuṣo̱ bhīr aga̍cchat   nava̍ ca̱ yan na̍va̱tiṁ ca̱ srava̍ntīḥ śye̱no na bhī̱to ata̍ro̱ rajā̍ṁsi
English: whom sawest thou to avenge the dragon indra that fear possessed thy heart when thou hadst slain him;  that like a hawk affrighted through the regions thou crossedst nineandninety flowing rivers?

Sanskrit: indro̍ yā̱to 'va̍sitasya̱ rājā̱ śama̍sya ca śṛ̱ṅgiṇo̱ vajra̍bāhuḥ   sed u̱ rājā̍ kṣayati carṣaṇī̱nām a̱rān na ne̱miḥ pari̱ tā ba̍bhūva
English: indra is king of all that moves and moves not of creatures tame and horned the thunderwielder  over all living men he rules as sovran containing all as spokes within the felly

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne pratha̱mo aṅgi̍rā̱ ṛṣi̍r de̱vo de̱vānā̍m abhavaḥ śi̱vaḥ sakhā̍   tava̍ vra̱te ka̱vayo̍ vidma̱nāpa̱so 'jā̍yanta ma̱ruto̱ bhrāja̍dṛṣṭayaḥ
English: thou agni wast the earliest aṅgiras a seer; thou wast a god thyself the gods auspicious friend  after thy holy ordinance the maruts sage active through wisdom with their glittering spears were born

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne pratha̱mo aṅgi̍rastamaḥ ka̱vir de̱vānā̱m pari̍ bhūṣasi vra̱tam   vi̱bhur viśva̍smai̱ bhuva̍nāya̱ medhi̍ro dvimā̱tā śa̱yuḥ ka̍ti̱dhā ci̍d ā̱yave̍
English: o agni thou the best and earliest aṅgiras fulfillest as a sage the holy law of gods  sprung from two mothers wise through all existence spread resting in many a place for sake of living man

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne pratha̱mo mā̍ta̱riśva̍na ā̱vir bha̍va sukratū̱yā vi̱vasva̍te   are̍jetā̱ṁ roda̍sī hotṛ̱vūrye 'sa̍ghnor bhā̱ram aya̍jo ma̱ho va̍so
English: to mātariśvan first thou agni wast disclosed and to vivasvān through thy noble inward power  heaven and earth vasu! shook at the choosing of the priest the burthen thou didst bear didst worship mighty gods

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne̱ mana̍ve̱ dyām a̍vāśayaḥ purū̱rava̍se su̱kṛte̍ su̱kṛtta̍raḥ   śvā̱treṇa̱ yat pi̱tror mucya̍se̱ pary ā tvā̱ pūrva̍m anaya̱nn āpa̍ra̱m puna̍ḥ
English: agni thou madest heaven to thunder for mankind; thou yet more pious for pious purūravas  when thou art rapidly freed from thy parents first eastward they bear thee round and after to the west

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne vṛṣa̱bhaḥ pu̍ṣṭi̱vardha̍na̱ udya̍tasruce bhavasi śra̱vāyya̍ḥ   ya āhu̍ti̱m pari̱ vedā̱ vaṣa̍ṭkṛti̱m ekā̍yu̱r agre̱ viśa̍ ā̱vivā̍sasi
English: thou agni art a bull who makes our store increase to be invoked by him who lifts the ladle up  well knowing the oblation with the hallowing word uniting all who live thou lightenest first our folk

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne vṛji̱nava̍rtani̱ṁ nara̱ṁ sakma̍n piparṣi vi̱dathe̍ vicarṣaṇe   yaḥ śūra̍sātā̱ pari̍takmye̱ dhane̍ da̱bhrebhi̍ś ci̱t samṛ̍tā̱ haṁsi̱ bhūya̍saḥ
English: agni thou savest in the synod when pursued een him farseeing one! who walks in evil ways  thou when the heroes fight for spoil which men rush round slayest in war the many by the hands of few

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tam a̍gne amṛta̱tva u̍tta̱me marta̍ṁ dadhāsi̱ śrava̍se di̱vedi̍ve   yas tā̍tṛṣā̱ṇa u̱bhayā̍ya̱ janma̍ne̱ maya̍ḥ kṛ̱ṇoṣi̱ praya̱ ā ca̍ sū̱raye̍
English: for glory agni day by day thou liftest up the mortal man to highest immortality  even thou who yearning for both races givest them great bliss and to the prince grantest abundant food

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ agne sa̱naye̱ dhanā̍nāṁ ya̱śasa̍ṁ kā̱ruṁ kṛ̍ṇuhi̱ stavā̍naḥ   ṛ̱dhyāma̱ karmā̱pasā̱ nave̍na de̱vair dyā̍vāpṛthivī̱ prāva̍taṁ naḥ
English: o agni highly lauded make our singer famous that he may win us store of riches  may we improve the rite with new performance o earth and heaven with all the gods protect us

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ agne pi̱tror u̱pastha̱ ā de̱vo de̱veṣv a̍navadya̱ jāgṛ̍viḥ   ta̱nū̱kṛd bo̍dhi̱ prama̍tiś ca kā̱rave̱ tvaṁ ka̍lyāṇa̱ vasu̱ viśva̱m opi̍ṣe
English: o blameless agni lying in thy parents' lap a god among the gods be watchful for our good  former of bodies be the singer's providence all good things hast thou sown for him auspicious one!

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne̱ prama̍ti̱s tvam pi̱tāsi̍ na̱s tvaṁ va̍ya̱skṛt tava̍ jā̱mayo̍ va̱yam   saṁ tvā̱ rāya̍ḥ śa̱tina̱ḥ saṁ sa̍ha̱sriṇa̍ḥ su̱vīra̍ṁ yanti vrata̱pām a̍dābhya
English: agni thou art our providence our father thou we are thy brethren and thou art our spring of life  in thee rich in good heroes guard of high decrees meet hundred thousand treasures o infallible!

Sanskrit: tvām a̍gne pratha̱mam ā̱yum ā̱yave̍ de̱vā a̍kṛṇva̱n nahu̍ṣasya vi̱śpati̍m   iḻā̍m akṛṇva̱n manu̍ṣasya̱ śāsa̍nīm pi̱tur yat pu̱tro mama̍kasya̱ jāya̍te
English: thee agni have the gods made the first living one for living man lord of the house of nahuṣa  iḷā they made the teacher of the sons of men what time a son was born to the father of my race

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ agne̱ tava̍ deva pā̱yubhi̍r ma̱ghono̍ rakṣa ta̱nva̍ś ca vandya   trā̱tā to̱kasya̱ tana̍ye̱ gavā̍m a̱sy ani̍meṣa̱ṁ rakṣa̍māṇa̱s tava̍ vra̱te
English: worthy to be revered o agni god preserve our wealthy patrons with thy succours and ourselves  guard of our seed art thou aiding our cows to bear incessantly protecting in thy holy way

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne̱ yajya̍ve pā̱yur anta̍ro 'niṣa̱ṅgāya̍ catura̱kṣa i̍dhyase   yo rā̱taha̍vyo 'vṛ̱kāya̱ dhāya̍se kī̱reś ci̱n mantra̱m mana̍sā va̱noṣi̱ tam
English: agni thou art a guard close to the pious man; kindled art thou foureyed! for him who is unarmed  with fond heart thou acceptest een the poor man's prayer when he hath brought his gift to gain security

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gna uru̱śaṁsā̍ya vā̱ghate̍ spā̱rhaṁ yad rekṇa̍ḥ para̱maṁ va̱noṣi̱ tat   ā̱dhrasya̍ ci̱t prama̍tir ucyase pi̱tā pra pāka̱ṁ śāssi̱ pra diśo̍ vi̱duṣṭa̍raḥ
English: thou agni gainest for the loudlypraising priest the highest wealth the object of a man's desire  thou art called father caring even for the weak and wisest to the simple one thou teachest lore

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne̱ praya̍tadakṣiṇa̱ṁ nara̱ṁ varme̍va syū̱tam pari̍ pāsi vi̱śvata̍ḥ   svā̱du̱kṣadmā̱ yo va̍sa̱tau syo̍na̱kṛj jī̍vayā̱jaṁ yaja̍te̱ sopa̱mā di̱vaḥ
English: agni the man who giveth guerdon to the priests like wellsewn armour thou guardest on every side  he who with grateful food shows kindness in his house an offerer to the living is the type of heaven

Sanskrit: i̱mām a̍gne śa̱raṇi̍m mīmṛṣo na i̱mam adhvā̍na̱ṁ yam agā̍ma dū̱rāt   ā̱piḥ pi̱tā prama̍tiḥ so̱myānā̱m bhṛmi̍r asy ṛṣi̱kṛn martyā̍nām
English: pardon we pray this sin of ours o agnithe path which we have trodden widely straying  dear friend and father caring for the pious who speedest nigh and who inspirest mortals

Sanskrit: ma̱nu̱ṣvad a̍gne aṅgira̱svad a̍ṅgiro yayāti̱vat sada̍ne pūrva̱vac chu̍ce   accha̍ yā̱hy ā va̍hā̱ daivya̱ṁ jana̱m ā sā̍daya ba̱rhiṣi̱ yakṣi̍ ca pri̱yam
English: as erst to manus to yayāti aṅgiras so aṅgiras! pure agni! come thou to our hall  bring hither the celestial host and seat them here upon the sacred grass and offer what they love

Sanskrit: e̱tenā̍gne̱ brahma̍ṇā vāvṛdhasva̱ śaktī̍ vā̱ yat te̍ cakṛ̱mā vi̱dā vā̍   u̱ta pra ṇe̍ṣy a̱bhi vasyo̍ a̱smān saṁ na̍ḥ sṛja suma̱tyā vāja̍vatyā
English: by this our prayer be thou o agni strengthened prayer made by us after our power and knowledge  lead thou us therefore to increasing riches; endow us with thy strengthbestowing favour

Sanskrit: ā va̱ indra̱ṁ krivi̍ṁ yathā vāja̱yanta̍ḥ śa̱takra̍tum   maṁhi̍ṣṭhaṁ siñca̱ indu̍bhiḥ
English: we seeking strength with somadrops fill full your indra like a well  most liberal lord of hundred powers

Sanskrit: śa̱taṁ vā̱ yaḥ śucī̍nāṁ sa̱hasra̍ṁ vā̱ samā̍śirām   ed u̍ ni̱mnaṁ na rī̍yate
English: who lets a hundred of the pure a thousand of the milkblent draughts  flow even as down a depth to him;

Sanskrit: saṁ yan madā̍ya śu̱ṣmiṇa̍ e̱nā hy a̍syo̱dare̍   sa̱mu̱dro na vyaco̍ da̱dhe
English: when for the strong the rapturous joy he in this manner hath made room  within his belly like the sea

Sanskrit: a̱yam u̍ te̱ sam a̍tasi ka̱pota̍ iva garbha̱dhim   vaca̱s tac ci̍n na ohase
English: this is thine own thou drawest near as turns a pigeon to his mate  thou carest too for this our prayer

Sanskrit: sto̱traṁ rā̍dhānām pate̱ girvā̍ho vīra̱ yasya̍ te   vibhū̍tir astu sū̱nṛtā̍
English: o hero lord of bounties praised in hymns may power and joyfulness  be his who sings the laud to thee

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvas ti̍ṣṭhā na ū̱taye̱ 'smin vāje̍ śatakrato   sam a̱nyeṣu̍ bravāvahai
English: lord of a hundred powers stand up to lend us succour in this fight  in others too let us agree

Sanskrit: yoge̍yoge ta̱vasta̍ra̱ṁ vāje̍vāje havāmahe   sakhā̍ya̱ indra̍m ū̱taye̍
English: in every need in every fray we call as friends to succour us  indra the mightiest of all

Sanskrit: ā ghā̍ gama̱d yadi̱ śrava̍t saha̱sriṇī̍bhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ   vāje̍bhi̱r upa̍ no̱ hava̍m
English: if he will hear us let him come with succour of a thousand kinds  and all that strengthens to our call

Sanskrit: anu̍ pra̱tnasyauka̍so hu̱ve tu̍vipra̱tiṁ nara̍m   yaṁ te̱ pūrva̍m pi̱tā hu̱ve
English: i call him mighty to resist the hero of our ancient home  thee whom my sire invoked of old

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̍ va̱yaṁ vi̍śvavā̱rā śā̍smahe puruhūta   sakhe̍ vaso jari̱tṛbhya̍ḥ
English: we pray to thee o muchinvoked rich in all precious gifts o friend  kind god to those who sing thy praise

Sanskrit: a̱smāka̍ṁ śi̱priṇī̍nā̱ṁ soma̍pāḥ soma̱pāvnā̍m   sakhe̍ vajri̱n sakhī̍nām
English: o somadrinker thunderarmed friend of our lovelyfeatured dames  and of our somadrinking friends

Sanskrit: tathā̱ tad a̍stu somapā̱ḥ sakhe̍ vajri̱n tathā̍ kṛṇu   yathā̍ ta u̱śmasī̱ṣṭaye̍
English: thus somadrinker may it be; thus friend who wieldest thunder act  to aid each wish as we desire

Sanskrit: re̱vatī̍r naḥ sadha̱māda̱ indre̍ santu tu̱vivā̍jāḥ   kṣu̱manto̱ yābhi̱r made̍ma
English: with indra splendid feasts be ours rich in all strengthening things wherewith  wealthy in food we may rejoice

Sanskrit: ā gha̱ tvāvā̱n tmanā̱ptaḥ sto̱tṛbhyo̍ dhṛṣṇav iyā̱naḥ   ṛ̱ṇor akṣa̱ṁ na ca̱kryo̍ḥ
English: like thee thyself the singers' friend thou movest as it were besought  bold one the axle of the car

Sanskrit: ā yad duva̍ḥ śatakrata̱v ā kāma̍ṁ jaritṝ̱ṇām   ṛ̱ṇor akṣa̱ṁ na śacī̍bhiḥ
English: that śatakratu thou to grace and please thy praisers as it were  stirrest the axle with thy strength

Sanskrit: śaśva̱d indra̱ḥ popru̍thadbhir jigāya̱ nāna̍dadbhi̱ḥ śāśva̍sadbhi̱r dhanā̍ni   sa no̍ hiraṇyara̱thaṁ da̱ṁsanā̍vā̱n sa na̍ḥ sani̱tā sa̱naye̱ sa no̍ 'dāt
English: with champing neighing loudlysnorting horses indra hath ever won himself great treasures  a car of gold hath he whose deeds are wondrous received from us and let us too receive it

Sanskrit: āśvi̍nā̱v aśvā̍vatye̱ṣā yā̍ta̱ṁ śavī̍rayā   goma̍d dasrā̱ hira̍ṇyavat
English: come aśvins with enduring strength wealthy in horses and in kine  and gold o ye of wondrous deeds

Sanskrit: sa̱mā̱nayo̍jano̱ hi vā̱ṁ ratho̍ dasrā̱v ama̍rtyaḥ   sa̱mu̱dre a̍śvi̱neya̍te
English: your chariot yoked for both alike immortal ye of mighty acts  travels o aśvins in the sea

Sanskrit: ny a1̱̍ghnyasya̍ mū̱rdhani̍ ca̱kraṁ ratha̍sya yemathuḥ   pari̱ dyām a̱nyad ī̍yate
English: high on the forehead of the bull one chariot wheel ye ever keep  the other round the sky revolves

Sanskrit: kas ta̍ uṣaḥ kadhapriye bhu̱je marto̍ amartye   kaṁ na̍kṣase vibhāvari
English: what mortal o immortal dawn enjoyeth thee? where lovest thou?  to whom o radiant dost thou go?

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ hi te̱ ama̍nma̱hy āntā̱d ā pa̍rā̱kāt   aśve̱ na ci̍tre aruṣi
English: for we have had thee in our thoughts whether anear or far away  redhued and like a dappled mare

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tyebhi̱r ā ga̍hi̱ vāje̍bhir duhitar divaḥ   a̱sme ra̱yiṁ ni dhā̍raya
English: hither o daughter of the sky come thou with these thy strengthenings  and send thou riches down to us

Sanskrit: yac ci̱d dhi sa̍tya somapā anāśa̱stā i̍va̱ smasi̍   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: o soma drinker ever true utterly hopeless though we be  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: śipri̍n vājānām pate̱ śacī̍va̱s tava̍ da̱ṁsanā̍   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: o lord of strength whose jaws are strong great deeds are thine the powerful  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: ni ṣvā̍payā mithū̱dṛśā̍ sa̱stām abu̍dhyamāne   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: lull thou asleep to wake no more the pair who on each other look  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: sa̱santu̱ tyā arā̍tayo̱ bodha̍ntu śūra rā̱taya̍ḥ   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: hero let hostile spirits sleep and every gentler genius wake  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: sam i̍ndra garda̱bham mṛ̍ṇa nu̱vanta̍m pā̱payā̍mu̱yā   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: destroy this ass o indra who in tones discordant brays to thee  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: patā̍ti kuṇḍṛ̱ṇācyā̍ dū̱raṁ vāto̱ vanā̱d adhi̍   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: far distant on the forest fall the tempest in a circling course!  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: sarva̍m parikro̱śaṁ ja̍hi ja̱mbhayā̍ kṛkadā̱śva̍m   ā tū na̍ indra śaṁsaya̱ goṣv aśve̍ṣu śu̱bhriṣu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṣu tuvīmagha
English: slay each reviler and destroy him who in secret injures us  do thou o indra give us hope of beauteous horses and of kine  in thousands o most wealthy one

Sanskrit: yatra̱ grāvā̍ pṛ̱thubu̍dhna ū̱rdhvo bhava̍ti̱ sota̍ve   u̱lūkha̍lasutānā̱m aved v i̍ndra jalgulaḥ
English: there where the broadbased stone raised on high to press the juices out  o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds

Sanskrit: yatra̱ dvāv i̍va ja̱ghanā̍dhiṣava̱ṇyā̍ kṛ̱tā   u̱lūkha̍lasutānā̱m aved v i̍ndra jalgulaḥ
English: where like broad hips to hold the juice the platters of the press are laid  o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds

Sanskrit: yatra̱ nāry a̍pacya̱vam u̍pacya̱vaṁ ca̱ śikṣa̍te   u̱lūkha̍lasutānā̱m aved v i̍ndra jalgulaḥ
English: there where the woman marks and leans the pestle's constant rise and fall  o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds

Sanskrit: yatra̱ manthā̍ṁ viba̱dhnate̍ ra̱śmīn yami̍ta̱vā i̍va   u̱lūkha̍lasutānā̱m aved v i̍ndra jalgulaḥ
English: where as with reins to guide a horse they bind the churningstaff with cords  o indra drink with eager thirst the droppings which the mortar sheds

Sanskrit: yac ci̱d dhi tvaṁ gṛ̱hegṛ̍ha̱ ulū̍khalaka yu̱jyase̍   i̱ha dyu̱matta̍maṁ vada̱ jaya̍tām iva dundu̱bhiḥ
English: if of a truth in every house o mortar thou art set for work  here give thou forth thy clearest sound loud as the drum of conquerors

Sanskrit: u̱ta sma̍ te vanaspate̱ vāto̱ vi vā̱ty agra̱m it   atho̱ indrā̍ya̱ pāta̍ve su̱nu soma̍m ulūkhala
English: o sovran of the forest as the wind blows soft in front of thee  mortar for indra press thou forth the soma juice that he may drink

Sanskrit: ā̱ya̱jī vā̍ja̱sāta̍mā̱ tā hy u1̱̍ccā vi̍jarbhṛ̱taḥ   harī̍ i̱vāndhā̍ṁsi̱ bapsa̍tā
English: best strengthgivers ye stretch wide jaws o sacrificial implements  like two bay horses champing herbs

Sanskrit: tā no̍ a̱dya va̍naspatī ṛ̱ṣvāv ṛ̱ṣvebhi̍ḥ so̱tṛbhi̍ḥ   indrā̍ya̱ madhu̍mat sutam
English: ye sovrans of the forest both swift with swift pressers press today  sweet soma juice for indra's drink

Sanskrit: uc chi̱ṣṭaṁ ca̱mvo̍r bhara̱ soma̍m pa̱vitra̱ ā sṛ̍ja   ni dhe̍hi̱ gor adhi̍ tva̱ci
English: take up in beakers what remains the soma on the filter pour  and on the oxhide set the dregs

Sanskrit: kasya̍ nū̱naṁ ka̍ta̱masyā̱mṛtā̍nā̱m manā̍mahe̱ cāru̍ de̱vasya̱ nāma̍   ko no̍ ma̱hyā adi̍taye̱ puna̍r dāt pi̱tara̍ṁ ca dṛ̱śeya̍m mā̱tara̍ṁ ca
English: who now is he what god among immortals of whose auspicious name we may bethink us?  who shall to mighty aditi restore us that i may see my father and my mother?

Sanskrit: a̱gner va̱yam pra̍tha̱masyā̱mṛtā̍nā̱m manā̍mahe̱ cāru̍ de̱vasya̱ nāma̍   sa no̍ ma̱hyā adi̍taye̱ puna̍r dāt pi̱tara̍ṁ ca dṛ̱śeya̍m mā̱tara̍ṁ ca
English: agni the god the first among the immortalsof his auspicious name let us bethink us  he shall to mighty aditi restore us that i may see my father and my mother

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tvā̍ deva savita̱r īśā̍na̱ṁ vāryā̍ṇām   sadā̍van bhā̱gam ī̍mahe
English: to thee o savitar the lord of precious things who helpest us  continually for our share we come

English: wealth highly lauded ere reproach hath fallen on it which is laid  free from all hatred in thy hands

Sanskrit: bhaga̍bhaktasya te va̱yam ud a̍śema̱ tavāva̍sā   mū̱rdhāna̍ṁ rā̱ya ā̱rabhe̍

English: neer have those birds that fly through air attained to thy high dominion or thy might or spirit;  nor these the waters that flow on for ever nor hills abaters of the wind's wild fury

English: varuṇa king of hallowed might sustaineth erect the tree's stem in the baseless region  its rays whose root is high above stream downward deep may they sink within us and be hidden

English: king varuṇa hath made a spacious pathway a pathway for the sun wherein to travel  where no way was he made him set his footstep and warned afar whateer afflicts the spirit

Sanskrit: śa̱taṁ te̍ rājan bhi̱ṣaja̍ḥ sa̱hasra̍m u̱rvī ga̍bhī̱rā su̍ma̱tiṣ ṭe̍ astu   bādha̍sva dū̱re nirṛ̍tim parā̱caiḥ kṛ̱taṁ ci̱d ena̱ḥ pra mu̍mugdhy a̱smat
English: a hundred balms are thine o king a thousand; deep and widereaching also be thy favours  far from us far away drive thou destruction put from us een the sin we have committed

Sanskrit: a̱mī ya ṛkṣā̱ nihi̍tāsa u̱ccā nakta̱ṁ dadṛ̍śre̱ kuha̍ ci̱d dive̍yuḥ   ada̍bdhāni̱ varu̍ṇasya vra̱tāni̍ vi̱cāka̍śac ca̱ndramā̱ nakta̍m eti
English: whither by day depart the constellations that shine at night set high in heaven above us?  varuṇa's holy laws remain unweakened and through the night the moon moves on in splendor

Sanskrit: tat tvā̍ yāmi̱ brahma̍ṇā̱ vanda̍māna̱s tad ā śā̍ste̱ yaja̍māno ha̱virbhi̍ḥ   ahe̍ḻamāno varuṇe̱ha bo̱dhy uru̍śaṁsa̱ mā na̱ āyu̱ḥ pra mo̍ṣīḥ
English: i ask this of thee with my prayer adoring; thy worshipper craves this with his oblation  varuṇa stay thou here and be not angry; steal not our life from us o thou wideruler

Sanskrit: tad in nakta̱ṁ tad divā̱ mahya̍m āhu̱s tad a̱yaṁ keto̍ hṛ̱da ā vi ca̍ṣṭe   śuna̱ḥśepo̱ yam ahva̍d gṛbhī̱taḥ so a̱smān rājā̱ varu̍ṇo mumoktu
English: nightly and daily this one thing they tell me this too the thought of mine own heart repeateth  may he to whom prayed fettered śunaḥśepa may he the sovran varuṇa release us

Sanskrit: śuna̱ḥśepo̱ hy ahva̍d gṛbhī̱tas tri̱ṣv ā̍di̱tyaṁ dru̍pa̱deṣu̍ ba̱ddhaḥ   avai̍na̱ṁ rājā̱ varu̍ṇaḥ sasṛjyād vi̱dvām̐ ada̍bdho̱ vi mu̍moktu̱ pāśā̍n
English: bound to three pillars captured śunaḥśepa thus to the āditya made his supplication  him may the sovran varuṇa deliver wise neer deceived loosen the bonds that bind him

English: with bending down oblations sacrifices o varuṇa we deprecate thine anger  wise asura thou king of wide dominion loosen the bonds of sins by us committed

Sanskrit: ud u̍tta̱maṁ va̍ruṇa̱ pāśa̍m a̱smad avā̍dha̱maṁ vi ma̍dhya̱maṁ śra̍thāya   athā̍ va̱yam ā̍ditya vra̱te tavānā̍gaso̱ adi̍taye syāma
English: loosen the bonds o varuṇa that hold me loosen the bonds above between and under  so in thy holy law may we made sinless belong to aditi o thou āditya

Sanskrit: aśva̱ṁ na tvā̱ vāra̍vantaṁ va̱ndadhyā̍ a̱gniṁ namo̍bhiḥ   sa̱mrāja̍ntam adhva̱rāṇā̍m
English: with worship will i glorify thee agni like a longtailed steed  imperial lord of sacred rites

Sanskrit: sa ghā̍ naḥ sū̱nuḥ śava̍sā pṛ̱thupra̍gāmā su̱śeva̍ḥ   mī̱ḍhvām̐ a̱smāka̍m babhūyāt
English: may the farstriding son of strength bringer of great felicity  who pours his gifts like rain be ours

Sanskrit: sa no̍ dū̱rāc cā̱sāc ca̱ ni martyā̍d aghā̱yoḥ   pā̱hi sada̱m id vi̱śvāyu̍ḥ

Sanskrit: i̱mam ū̱ ṣu tvam a̱smāka̍ṁ sa̱niṁ gā̍ya̱traṁ navyā̍ṁsam   agne̍ de̱veṣu̱ pra vo̍caḥ
English: o agni graciously announce this our oblation to the gods  and this our newest song of praise

Sanskrit: ā no̍ bhaja para̱meṣv ā vāje̍ṣu madhya̱meṣu̍   śikṣā̱ vasvo̱ anta̍masya
English: give us a share of strength most high a share of strength that is below  a share of strength that is between

Sanskrit: vi̱bha̱ktāsi̍ citrabhāno̱ sindho̍r ū̱rmā u̍pā̱ka ā   sa̱dyo dā̱śuṣe̍ kṣarasi
English: thou dealest gifts resplendent one; nigh as with waves of sindhu thou  swift streamest to the worshipper

English: that man is lord of endless strength whom thou protectest in the fight  agni or urgest to the fray

Sanskrit: naki̍r asya sahantya parye̱tā kaya̍sya cit   vājo̍ asti śra̱vāyya̍ḥ
English: him whosoever he may be no man may vanquish mighty one  nay very glorious power is his

Sanskrit: sa vāja̍ṁ vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇi̱r arva̍dbhir astu̱ taru̍tā   vipre̍bhir astu̱ sani̍tā

Sanskrit: jarā̍bodha̱ tad vi̍viḍḍhi vi̱śevi̍śe ya̱jñiyā̍ya   stoma̍ṁ ru̱drāya̱ dṛśī̍kam
English: help thou who knowest lauds this work this eulogy to rudra him  adorable in every house

Sanskrit: sa re̱vām̐ i̍va vi̱śpati̱r daivya̍ḥ ke̱tuḥ śṛ̍ṇotu naḥ   u̱kthair a̱gnir bṛ̱hadbhā̍nuḥ
English: like some rich lord of men may he agni the banner of the gods  refulgent hear us through our lauds

Sanskrit: namo̍ ma̱hadbhyo̱ namo̍ arbha̱kebhyo̱ namo̱ yuva̍bhyo̱ nama̍ āśi̱nebhya̍ḥ   yajā̍ma de̱vān yadi̍ śa̱knavā̍ma̱ mā jyāya̍sa̱ḥ śaṁsa̱m ā vṛ̍kṣi devāḥ

English: varuṇa true to holy law sits down among his people; he  most wise sits there to govern all

Sanskrit: ato̱ viśvā̱ny adbhu̍tā ciki̱tvām̐ a̱bhi pa̍śyati   kṛ̱tāni̱ yā ca̱ kartvā̍

English: mitra and varuṇa renowned as gods of consecrated might  we call to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: pū̱ṣā rājā̍na̱m āghṛ̍ṇi̱r apa̍gūḻha̱ṁ guhā̍ hi̱tam   avi̍ndac ci̱traba̍rhiṣam
English: pūṣan the bright has found the king concealed and hidden in a cave  who rests on grass of many hues

Sanskrit: u̱to sa mahya̱m indu̍bhi̱ḥ ṣaḍ yu̱ktām̐ a̍nu̱seṣi̍dhat   gobhi̱r yava̱ṁ na ca̍rkṛṣat

Sanskrit: a̱po de̱vīr upa̍ hvaye̱ yatra̱ gāva̱ḥ piba̍nti naḥ   sindhu̍bhya̱ḥ kartva̍ṁ ha̱viḥ

Sanskrit: harī̱ nu ta̍ indra vā̱jaya̍ntā ghṛta̱ścuta̍ṁ svā̱ram a̍svārṣṭām   vi sa̍ma̱nā bhūmi̍r aprathi̱ṣṭāra̍ṁsta̱ parva̍taś cit sari̱ṣyan
English: indra thy bay steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness  the earth hath spread herself in all her fulness the cloud that was about to move hath rested

Sanskrit: ni parva̍taḥ sā̱dy apra̍yuccha̱n sam mā̱tṛbhi̍r vāvaśā̱no a̍krān   dū̱re pā̱re vāṇī̍ṁ va̱rdhaya̍nta̱ indre̍ṣitāṁ dha̱mani̍m papratha̱n ni
English: down never ceasing hath the raincloud settled bellowing it hath wandered with the mothers  swelling the roar in the far distant limits they have spread wide the blast sent forth by indra

Sanskrit: indro̍ ma̱hāṁ sindhu̍m ā̱śayā̍nam māyā̱vina̍ṁ vṛ̱tram a̍sphura̱n niḥ   are̍jetā̱ṁ roda̍sī bhiyā̱ne kani̍kradato̱ vṛṣṇo̍ asya̱ vajrā̍t
English: indra hath hurled down the magician vṛtra who lay beleaguering the mighty river  then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong hero's thunder when he bellowed

Sanskrit: aro̍ravī̱d vṛṣṇo̍ asya̱ vajro 'mā̍nuṣa̱ṁ yan mānu̍ṣo ni̱jūrvā̍t   ni mā̱yino̍ dāna̱vasya̍ mā̱yā apā̍dayat papi̱vān su̱tasya̍
English: loud roared the mighty hero's bolt of thunder when he the friend of man burnt up the monster  and having drunk his fill of flowing soma baffled the guileful dānava's devices

Sanskrit: pibā̍pi̱bed i̍ndra śūra̱ soma̱m manda̍ntu tvā ma̱ndina̍ḥ su̱tāsa̍ḥ   pṛ̱ṇanta̍s te ku̱kṣī va̍rdhayantv i̱tthā su̱taḥ pau̱ra indra̍m āva
English: drink thou o hero indra drink the soma; let the joygiving juices make thee joyful  they filling both thy flanks shall swell thy vigour the juice that satisfies hath helped indra

Sanskrit: tve i̱ndrāpy a̍bhūma̱ viprā̱ dhiya̍ṁ vanema ṛta̱yā sapa̍ntaḥ   a̱va̱syavo̍ dhīmahi̱ praśa̍stiṁ sa̱dyas te̍ rā̱yo dā̱vane̍ syāma
English: singers have we become with thee o indra may we serve duly and prepare devotion  seeking thy help we meditate thy praises may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches

Sanskrit: syāma̱ te ta̍ indra̱ ye ta̍ ū̱tī a̍va̱syava̱ ūrja̍ṁ va̱rdhaya̍ntaḥ   śu̱ṣminta̍ma̱ṁ yaṁ cā̱kanā̍ma devā̱sme ra̱yiṁ rā̍si vī̱rava̍ntam
English: may we be thine such by thy help o indra as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour  give us thou god the riches that we long for most powerful with stare of noble children

Sanskrit: rāsi̱ kṣaya̱ṁ rāsi̍ mi̱tram a̱sme rāsi̱ śardha̍ indra̱ māru̍taṁ naḥ   sa̱joṣa̍so̱ ye ca̍ mandasā̱nāḥ pra vā̱yava̍ḥ pā̱nty agra̍ṇītim
English: give us a friend give us an habitation; indra give us the company of maruts  and those whose minds accord with theirs the vāyus who drink the first libation of the soma

Sanskrit: vyantv in nu yeṣu̍ mandasā̱nas tṛ̱pat soma̍m pāhi dra̱hyad i̍ndra   a̱smān su pṛ̱tsv ā ta̍ru̱trāva̍rdhayo̱ dyām bṛ̱hadbhi̍r a̱rkaiḥ
English: let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted indra drink soma for thy strength and gladness  thou hast exalted us to heaven preserver in battles through the lofty hymns that praise thee

Sanskrit: bṛ̱hanta̱ in nu ye te̍ tarutro̱kthebhi̍r vā su̱mnam ā̱vivā̍sān   stṛ̱ṇā̱nāso̍ ba̱rhiḥ pa̱styā̍va̱t tvotā̱ id i̍ndra̱ vāja̍m agman
English: great verily are they o thou protector who by their songs of praise have won the blessing  they who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling helped by thee have got them strength o indra

Sanskrit: u̱greṣv in nu śū̍ra mandasā̱nas trika̍drukeṣu pāhi̱ soma̍m indra   pra̱dodhu̍va̱c chmaśru̍ṣu prīṇā̱no yā̱hi hari̍bhyāṁ su̱tasya̍ pī̱tim
English: upon the great trikadruka days hero rejoicing thee o indra drink the soma  come with bay steeds to drink of libation shaking the drops from out thy beard contented

Sanskrit: dhi̱ṣvā śava̍ḥ śūra̱ yena̍ vṛ̱tram a̱vābhi̍na̱d dānu̍m aurṇavā̱bham   apā̍vṛṇo̱r jyoti̱r āryā̍ya̱ ni sa̍vya̱taḥ sā̍di̱ dasyu̍r indra
English: hero assume the might wherewith thou clavest vṛtra piecemeal the dānava aurṇavābha  thou hast disclosed the light to light the ārya on thy left hand o indra sank the dasyu

Sanskrit: sane̍ma̱ ye ta̍ ū̱tibhi̱s tara̍nto̱ viśvā̱ḥ spṛdha̱ ārye̍ṇa̱ dasyū̍n   a̱smabhya̱ṁ tat tvā̱ṣṭraṁ vi̱śvarū̍pa̱m ara̍ndhayaḥ sā̱khyasya̍ tri̱tāya̍
English: may we gain wealth subduing with thy succour and with the ārya all our foes the dasyus  our gain was that to tṛta of our party thou gavest up tvaṣṭar's son viśvarūpa

Sanskrit: a̱sya su̍vā̱nasya̍ ma̱ndina̍s tri̱tasya̱ ny arbu̍daṁ vāvṛdhā̱no a̍staḥ   ava̍rtaya̱t sūryo̱ na ca̱kram bhi̱nad va̱lam indro̱ aṅgi̍rasvān
English: he cast down arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by tṛta  indra sent forth his whirling wheel like sūrya and aided by the aṅgirases rent vala

Sanskrit: nū̱naṁ sā te̱ prati̱ vara̍ṁ jari̱tre du̍hī̱yad i̍ndra̱ dakṣi̍ṇā ma̱ghonī̍   śikṣā̍ sto̱tṛbhyo̱ māti̍ dha̱g bhago̍ no bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: now let that wealthy cow of thine o indra yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee  give to thy praisers let not fortune fail us loud may we speak with brave men in the assembly

Sanskrit: yo jā̱ta e̱va pra̍tha̱mo mana̍svān de̱vo de̱vān kratu̍nā pa̱ryabhū̍ṣat   yasya̱ śuṣmā̱d roda̍sī̱ abhya̍setāṁ nṛ̱mṇasya̍ ma̱hnā sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: he who just born chief god of lofty spirit by power and might became the gods protector  before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yaḥ pṛ̍thi̱vīṁ vyatha̍mānā̱m adṛ̍ṁha̱d yaḥ parva̍tā̱n praku̍pitā̱m̐ ara̍mṇāt   yo a̱ntari̍kṣaṁ vima̱me varī̍yo̱ yo dyām asta̍bhnā̱t sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: he who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered and set at rest the agitated mountains  who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support he men is indra

Sanskrit: yo ha̱tvāhi̱m ari̍ṇāt sa̱pta sindhū̱n yo gā u̱dāja̍d apa̱dhā va̱lasya̍   yo aśma̍nor a̱ntar a̱gniṁ ja̱jāna̍ sa̱ṁvṛk sa̱matsu̱ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: who slew the dragon freed the seven rivers and drove the kine forth from the cave of vala  begat the fire between two stones the spoiler in warriors battle he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yene̱mā viśvā̱ cyava̍nā kṛ̱tāni̱ yo dāsa̱ṁ varṇa̱m adha̍ra̱ṁ guhāka̍ḥ   śva̱ghnīva̱ yo ji̍gī̱vām̐l la̱kṣam āda̍d a̱ryaḥ pu̱ṣṭāni̱ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: by whom this universe was made to tremble who chased away the humbled brood of demons  who like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yaṁ smā̍ pṛ̱cchanti̱ kuha̱ seti̍ gho̱ram u̱tem ā̍hu̱r naiṣo a̱stīty e̍nam   so a̱ryaḥ pu̱ṣṭīr vija̍ i̱vā mi̍nāti̱ śrad a̍smai dhatta̱ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: of whom the terrible they ask where is he? or verily they say of him he is not  he sweeps away like birds the foe's possessions have faith in him for he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yo ra̱dhrasya̍ codi̱tā yaḥ kṛ̱śasya̱ yo bra̱hmaṇo̱ nādha̍mānasya kī̱reḥ   yu̱ktagrā̍vṇo̱ yo̍ 'vi̱tā su̍śi̱praḥ su̱taso̍masya̱ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: stirrer to action of the poor and lowly of priest of suppliant who sings his praises;  who fairfaced favours him who presses soma with stones made ready he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yasyāśvā̍saḥ pra̱diśi̱ yasya̱ gāvo̱ yasya̱ grāmā̱ yasya̱ viśve̱ rathā̍saḥ   yaḥ sūrya̱ṁ ya u̱ṣasa̍ṁ ja̱jāna̱ yo a̱pāṁ ne̱tā sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: he under whose supreme control are horses all chariots and the villages and cattle;  he who gave being to the sun and morning who leads the waters he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yaṁ kranda̍sī saṁya̱tī vi̱hvaye̍te̱ pare 'va̍ra u̱bhayā̍ a̱mitrā̍ḥ   sa̱mā̱naṁ ci̱d ratha̍m ātasthi̱vāṁsā̱ nānā̍ havete̱ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: to whom two armies cry in close encounter both enemies the stronger and the weaker;  whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted each for himself he o ye men is indra

Sanskrit: yasmā̱n na ṛ̱te vi̱jaya̍nte̱ janā̍so̱ yaṁ yudhya̍mānā̱ ava̍se̱ hava̍nte   yo viśva̍sya prati̱māna̍m ba̱bhūva̱ yo a̍cyuta̱cyut sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: without whose help our people never conquer; whom battling they invoke to give them succour;  he of whom all this world is but the copy who shakes things moveless he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yaḥ śaśva̍to̱ mahy eno̱ dadhā̍nā̱n ama̍nyamānā̱ñ charvā̍ ja̱ghāna̍   yaḥ śardha̍te̱ nānu̱dadā̍ti śṛ̱dhyāṁ yo dasyo̍r ha̱ntā sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: he who hath smitten ere they knew their danger with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners;  who pardons not his boldness who provokes him who slays the dasyu he o men is indra

Sanskrit: yaḥ śamba̍ra̱m parva̍teṣu kṣi̱yanta̍ṁ catvāri̱ṁśyāṁ śa̱rady a̱nvavi̍ndat   o̱jā̱yamā̍na̱ṁ yo ahi̍ṁ ja̱ghāna̱ dānu̱ṁ śayā̍na̱ṁ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: he who discovered in the fortieth autumn śambara as he dwelt among the mountains;  who slew the dragon putting forth his vigour the demon lying there he men is indra

Sanskrit: yaḥ sa̱ptara̍śmir vṛṣa̱bhas tuvi̍ṣmān a̱vāsṛ̍ja̱t sarta̍ve sa̱pta sindhū̍n   yo rau̍hi̱ṇam asphu̍ra̱d vajra̍bāhu̱r dyām ā̱roha̍nta̱ṁ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: who with seven guiding reins the bull the mighty set free the seven great floods to flow at pleasure;  who thunderarmed rent rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven he o ye men is indra

Sanskrit: dyāvā̍ cid asmai pṛthi̱vī na̍mete̱ śuṣmā̍c cid asya̱ parva̍tā bhayante   yaḥ so̍ma̱pā ni̍ci̱to vajra̍bāhu̱r yo vajra̍hasta̱ḥ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: even the heaven and earth bow down before him before his very breath the mountains tremble  known as the somadrinker armed with thunder who wields the bolt he o ye men is indra

Sanskrit: yaḥ su̱nvanta̱m ava̍ti̱ yaḥ paca̍nta̱ṁ yaḥ śaṁsa̍nta̱ṁ yaḥ śa̍śamā̱nam ū̱tī   yasya̱ brahma̱ vardha̍na̱ṁ yasya̱ somo̱ yasye̱daṁ rādha̱ḥ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ḥ
English: who aids with favour him who pours the soma and him who brews it sacrificer singer  whom prayer exalts and pouring forth of soma and this our gift he o ye men is indra

Sanskrit: yaḥ su̍nva̱te paca̍te du̱dhra ā ci̱d vāja̱ṁ darda̍rṣi̱ sa kilā̍si sa̱tyaḥ   va̱yaṁ ta̍ indra vi̱śvaha̍ pri̱yāsa̍ḥ su̱vīrā̍so vi̱datha̱m ā va̍dema
English: thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation  so may we evermore thy friends o indra speak loudly to the synod with our heroes

Sanskrit: pra va̍ḥ sa̱tāṁ jyeṣṭha̍tamāya suṣṭu̱tim a̱gnāv i̍va samidhā̱ne ha̱vir bha̍re   indra̍m aju̱ryaṁ ja̱raya̍ntam ukṣi̱taṁ sa̱nād yuvā̍na̱m ava̍se havāmahe
English: to him your own the best among the good i bring eulogy like oblation in the kindled fire  we invocate for help indra untouched by eld who maketh all decay strengthened for ever young

Sanskrit: yasmā̱d indrā̍d bṛha̱taḥ kiṁ ca̱nem ṛ̱te viśvā̍ny asmi̱n sambhṛ̱tādhi̍ vī̱ryā̍   ja̱ṭhare̱ soma̍ṁ ta̱nvī̱3̱̍ saho̱ maho̱ haste̱ vajra̱m bhara̍ti śī̱rṣaṇi̱ kratu̍m
English: without whom naught exists indra the lofty one; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined  the soma is within him in his frame vast strength the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head

Sanskrit: na kṣo̱ṇībhyā̍m pari̱bhve̍ ta indri̱yaṁ na sa̍mu̱draiḥ parva̍tair indra te̱ ratha̍ḥ   na te̱ vajra̱m anv a̍śnoti̱ kaś ca̱na yad ā̱śubhi̱ḥ pata̍si̱ yoja̍nā pu̱ru
English: not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas  none cometh near o indra to thy thunderbolt when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league

Sanskrit: viśve̱ hy a̍smai yaja̱tāya̍ dhṛ̱ṣṇave̱ kratu̱m bhara̍nti vṛṣa̱bhāya̱ saśca̍te   vṛṣā̍ yajasva ha̱viṣā̍ vi̱duṣṭa̍ra̱ḥ pibe̍ndra̱ soma̍ṁ vṛṣa̱bheṇa̍ bhā̱nunā̍
English: for all men bring their will to him the resolute to him the holy one to him the strong they cleave  pay worship with oblation strong and passing wise drink thou the soma indra through the mighty blaze

Sanskrit: vṛṣṇa̱ḥ kośa̍ḥ pavate̱ madhva̍ ū̱rmir vṛ̍ṣa̱bhānnā̍ya vṛṣa̱bhāya̱ pāta̍ve   vṛṣa̍ṇādhva̱ryū vṛ̍ṣa̱bhāso̱ adra̍yo̱ vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ soma̍ṁ vṛṣa̱bhāya̍ suṣvati
English: the vessel of the strong flows forth the flood of meath unto the strong who feeds upon the strong for drink  strong are the two adhvaryus strong are both the stones they press the soma that is strong for him the strong

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̍ te̱ vajra̍ u̱ta te̱ vṛṣā̱ ratho̱ vṛṣa̍ṇā̱ harī̍ vṛṣa̱bhāṇy āyu̍dhā   vṛṣṇo̱ mada̍sya vṛṣabha̱ tvam ī̍śiṣa̱ indra̱ soma̍sya vṛṣa̱bhasya̍ tṛpṇuhi
English: strong is thy thunderbolt yea and thy car is strong; strong are thy bay steeds and thy weapons powerful  thou indra bull art lord of the strong gladdening drink with the strong soma indra satisfy thyself

Sanskrit: pra te̱ nāva̱ṁ na sama̍ne vaca̱syuva̱m brahma̍ṇā yāmi̱ sava̍neṣu̱ dādhṛ̍ṣiḥ   ku̱vin no̍ a̱sya vaca̍so ni̱bodhi̍ṣa̱d indra̱m utsa̱ṁ na vasu̍naḥ sicāmahe
English: i bold by prayer come near thee in thy sacred rites thee like a saving ship thee shouting in the war  verily he will hear and mark this word of ours we will pour indra forth as twere a spring of wealth

Sanskrit: pu̱rā sa̍mbā̱dhād a̱bhy ā va̍vṛtsva no dhe̱nur na va̱tsaṁ yava̍sasya pi̱pyuṣī̍   sa̱kṛt su te̍ suma̱tibhi̍ḥ śatakrato̱ sam patnī̍bhi̱r na vṛṣa̍ṇo nasīmahi
English: turn thee unto us ere calamity come nigh as a cow full of pasture turns her to her calf  lord of a hundred powers may we once firmly cling to thy fair favours even as husbands to their wives

Sanskrit: nū̱naṁ sā te̱ prati̱ vara̍ṁ jari̱tre du̍hī̱yad i̍ndra̱ dakṣi̍ṇā ma̱ghonī̍   śikṣā̍ sto̱tṛbhyo̱ māti̍ dha̱g bhago̍ no bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: now let that wealthy cow of thine o indra yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee  give to thy praisers let not fortune fail us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: pra ghā̱ nv a̍sya maha̱to ma̱hāni̍ sa̱tyā sa̱tyasya̱ kara̍ṇāni vocam   trika̍drukeṣv apibat su̱tasyā̱sya made̱ ahi̱m indro̍ jaghāna
English: now verily will i declare the exploits mighty and true of him the true and mighty  in the trikadrukas he drank the soma then in its rapture indra slew the dragon

Sanskrit: a̱va̱ṁśe dyām a̍stabhāyad bṛ̱hanta̱m ā roda̍sī apṛṇad a̱ntari̍kṣam   sa dhā̍rayat pṛthi̱vīm pa̱pratha̍c ca̱ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: high heaven unsupported in space he stablished he filled the two worlds and the air's midregion  earth he upheld and gave it wide expansion these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: sadme̍va̱ prāco̱ vi mi̍māya̱ mānai̱r vajre̍ṇa̱ khāny a̍tṛṇan na̱dīnā̍m   vṛthā̍sṛjat pa̱thibhi̍r dīrghayā̱thaiḥ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: from front as twere a house he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers  and made them flow at ease by paths farreaching these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: sa pra̍vo̱ḻhṝn pa̍ri̱gatyā̍ da̱bhīte̱r viśva̍m adhā̱g āyu̍dham i̱ddhe a̱gnau   saṁ gobhi̱r aśvai̍r asṛja̱d rathe̍bhi̱ḥ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: compassing those who bore away dabhīti in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons  and made him rich with kine and cars and horses these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: sa ī̍m ma̱hīṁ dhuni̱m eto̍r aramṇā̱t so a̍snā̱tṝn a̍pārayat sva̱sti   ta u̱tsnāya̍ ra̱yim a̱bhi pra ta̍sthu̱ḥ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: the mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing and carried those who swam not safely over  they having crossed the stream attained to riches these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: soda̍ñca̱ṁ sindhu̍m ariṇān mahi̱tvā vajre̱ṇāna̍ u̱ṣasa̱ḥ sam pi̍peṣa   a̱ja̱vaso̍ ja̱vinī̍bhir vivṛ̱ścan soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: with mighty power he made the stream flow upward crushed with his thunderbolt the car of uṣas  rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: sa vi̱dvām̐ a̍pago̱haṁ ka̱nīnā̍m ā̱vir bhava̱nn ud a̍tiṣṭhat parā̱vṛk   prati̍ śro̱ṇaḥ sthā̱d vy a1̱̍nag a̍caṣṭa̱ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding the outcast showed himself and stood before them  the cripple stood erect the blind beheld them these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: bhi̱nad va̱lam aṅgi̍robhir gṛṇā̱no vi parva̍tasya dṛṁhi̱tāny ai̍rat   ri̱ṇag rodhā̍ṁsi kṛ̱trimā̍ṇy eṣā̱ṁ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: praised by the aṅgirases he slaughtered vala and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain  he tore away their deftlybuilt defences these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: svapne̍nā̱bhyupyā̱ cumu̍ri̱ṁ dhuni̍ṁ ca ja̱ghantha̱ dasyu̱m pra da̱bhīti̍m āvaḥ   ra̱mbhī ci̱d atra̍ vivide̱ hira̍ṇya̱ṁ soma̍sya̱ tā mada̱ indra̍ś cakāra
English: thou with sleep whelming cumuri and dhuni slewest the dasyu keptest safe dabhīti  there the staffbearer found the golden treasure these things did indra in the soma's rapture

Sanskrit: nū̱naṁ sā te̱ prati̱ vara̍ṁ jari̱tre du̍hī̱yad i̍ndra̱ dakṣi̍ṇā ma̱ghonī̍   śikṣā̍ sto̱tṛbhyo̱ māti̍ dha̱g bhago̍ no bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: now let that wealthy cow of thine o indra  yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee  give to thy praisers let not fortune fail us loud may we speak with brave men in assembly

Sanskrit: vā̱ja̱yann i̍va̱ nū rathā̱n yogā̍m̐ a̱gner upa̍ stuhi   ya̱śasta̍masya mī̱ḻhuṣa̍ḥ
English: now praise as one who strives for strength the harnessing of agni's car  the liberal the most splendid one;

Sanskrit: yaḥ su̍nī̱tho da̍dā̱śuṣe̍ 'ju̱ryo ja̱raya̍nn a̱rim   cāru̍pratīka̱ āhu̍taḥ
English: who guiding worshippers aright withers untouched by age the foe  when worshipped fair to look upon;

Sanskrit: ya u̍ śri̱yā dame̱ṣv ā do̱ṣoṣasi̍ praśa̱syate̍   yasya̍ vra̱taṁ na mīya̍te
English: who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes  whose statute is inviolate;

Sanskrit: ā yaḥ sva1̱̍r ṇa bhā̱nunā̍ ci̱tro vi̱bhāty a̱rciṣā̍   a̱ñjā̱no a̱jarai̍r a̱bhi
English: who shines refulgent like the sun with brilliance and with fiery flame  decked with imperishable sheen

Sanskrit: atri̱m anu̍ sva̱rājya̍m a̱gnim u̱kthāni̍ vāvṛdhuḥ   viśvā̱ adhi̱ śriyo̍ dadhe
English: him atri agni have our songs strengthened according to his sway  all glories hath he made his own

Sanskrit: a̱gner indra̍sya̱ soma̍sya de̱vānā̍m ū̱tibhi̍r va̱yam   ari̍ṣyantaḥ sacemahy a̱bhi ṣyā̍ma pṛtanya̱taḥ
English: may we with agni's indra's help with soma's yea of all the gods  uninjured dwell together still and conquer those who fight with us

Sanskrit: śreṣṭha̍ṁ yaviṣṭha bhāra̱tāgne̍ dyu̱manta̱m ā bha̍ra   vaso̍ puru̱spṛha̍ṁ ra̱yim
English: vasu thou most youthful god bhārata agni bring us wealth  excellent splendid muchdesired

Sanskrit: mā no̱ arā̍tir īśata de̱vasya̱ martya̍sya ca   parṣi̱ tasyā̍ u̱ta dvi̱ṣaḥ
English: let no malignity prevail against us either god's or man's  save us from this and enmity

Sanskrit: viśvā̍ u̱ta tvayā̍ va̱yaṁ dhārā̍ uda̱nyā̍ iva   ati̍ gāhemahi̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: so through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way  as twere through streaming waterfloods

Sanskrit: śuci̍ḥ pāvaka̱ vandyo 'gne̍ bṛ̱had vi ro̍case   tvaṁ ghṛ̱tebhi̱r āhu̍taḥ
English: thou purifier agni high shinest forth bright adorable  when worshipped with the sacred oil

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ asi bhāra̱tāgne̍ va̱śābhi̍r u̱kṣabhi̍ḥ   a̱ṣṭāpa̍dībhi̱r āhu̍taḥ
English: ours art thou agni bhārata honoured by us with barren cows  with bullocks and with kine in calf

Sanskrit: drva̍nnaḥ sa̱rpirā̍sutiḥ pra̱tno hotā̱ vare̍ṇyaḥ   saha̍sas pu̱tro adbhu̍taḥ
English: woodfed bedewed with sacred oil ancient invoker excellent  the son of strength the wonderful

Sanskrit: i̱mām me̍ agne sa̱midha̍m i̱mām u̍pa̱sada̍ṁ vaneḥ   i̱mā u̱ ṣu śru̍dhī̱ gira̍ḥ
English: agni accept this flaming brand this waiting with my prayer on thee  hear graciously these songs of praise

Sanskrit: a̱yā te̍ agne vidhe̱morjo̍ napā̱d aśva̍miṣṭe   e̱nā sū̱ktena̍ sujāta
English: with this hymn let us honour thee seeker of horses son of strength  with this fair hymn thou nobly born

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̍ gī̱rbhir girva̍ṇasaṁ draviṇa̱syuṁ dra̍viṇodaḥ   sa̱pa̱ryema̍ sapa̱ryava̍ḥ
English: as such lover of song with songs wealthlover giver of our wealth!  with reverence let us worship thee

Sanskrit: sa bo̍dhi sū̱rir ma̱ghavā̱ vasu̍pate̱ vasu̍dāvan   yu̱yo̱dhy a1̱̍smad dveṣā̍ṁsi
English: be thou for us a liberal prince giver and lord of precious things  drive those who hate us far away

Sanskrit: sa no̍ vṛ̱ṣṭiṁ di̱vas pari̱ sa no̱ vāja̍m ana̱rvāṇa̍m   sa na̍ḥ saha̱sriṇī̱r iṣa̍ḥ
English: such as thou art give rain from heaven give strength which no man may resist  give food exceeding plentiful

Sanskrit: īḻā̍nāyāva̱syave̱ yavi̍ṣṭha dūta no gi̱rā   yaji̍ṣṭha hota̱r ā ga̍hi
English: to him who lauds thee craving help most youthful envoy! through our song  most holy herald! come thou nigh

Sanskrit: a̱ntar hy a̍gna̱ īya̍se vi̱dvāñ janmo̱bhayā̍ kave   dū̱to janye̍va̱ mitrya̍ḥ
English: between both races agni sage well skilled thou passest to and fro  as envoy friendly to mankind

Sanskrit: sa vi̱dvām̐ ā ca̍ piprayo̱ yakṣi̍ cikitva ānu̱ṣak   ā cā̱smin sa̍tsi ba̱rhiṣi̍
English: befriend us thou as knowing all sage duly worship thou the gods  and seat thee on this sacred grass

Sanskrit: hotā̍janiṣṭa̱ ceta̍naḥ pi̱tā pi̱tṛbhya̍ ū̱taye̍   pra̱yakṣa̱ñ jenya̱ṁ vasu̍ śa̱kema̍ vā̱jino̱ yama̍m
English: herald and teacher was he born a guardian for our patrons help  earner by rites of noble wealth that strong one may we grasp and guide;

Sanskrit: ā yasmi̍n sa̱pta ra̱śmaya̍s ta̱tā ya̱jñasya̍ ne̱tari̍   ma̱nu̱ṣvad daivya̍m aṣṭa̱mam potā̱ viśva̱ṁ tad i̍nvati
English: in whom leader of sacrifice the seven reins far extended meet;  who furthers manlike eighth in place as cleanser all the work divine

Sanskrit: da̱dha̱nve vā̱ yad ī̱m anu̱ voca̱d brahmā̍ṇi̱ ver u̱ tat   pari̱ viśvā̍ni̱ kāvyā̍ ne̱miś ca̱kram i̍vābhavat
English: when swift he follows this behest birdlike he chants the holy prayers  he holds all knowledge in his grasp even as the felly rounds the wheel

Sanskrit: sā̱kaṁ hi śuci̍nā̱ śuci̍ḥ praśā̱stā kratu̱nāja̍ni   vi̱dvām̐ a̍sya vra̱tā dhru̱vā va̱yā i̱vānu̍ rohate
English: together with pure mental power pure as director was he born  skilled in his own unchanging laws he waxes like the growing boughs

Sanskrit: tā a̍sya̱ varṇa̍m ā̱yuvo̱ neṣṭu̍ḥ sacanta dhe̱nava̍ḥ   ku̱vit ti̱sṛbhya̱ ā vara̱ṁ svasā̍ro̱ yā i̱daṁ ya̱yuḥ
English: clothing them in his hues the kine of him the leader wait on him  is he not better than the three the sisters who have come to us?

Sanskrit: yadī̍ mā̱tur upa̱ svasā̍ ghṛ̱tam bhara̱nty asthi̍ta   tāsā̍m adhva̱ryur āga̍tau̱ yavo̍ vṛ̱ṣṭīva̍ modate
English: when laden with the holy oil the   by the mother stands  the priest delights in their approach as corn at coming of the rain

English: for his support let him perform as ministrant his priestly task;  yea song of praise and sacrifice we have bestowed let us obtain

Sanskrit: yathā̍ vi̱dvām̐ ara̱ṁ kara̱d viśve̍bhyo yaja̱tebhya̍ḥ   a̱yam a̍gne̱ tve api̱ yaṁ ya̱jñaṁ ca̍kṛ̱mā va̱yam
English: that so this man well skilled may pay worship to all the holy ones  and agni this our sacrifice which we have here prepared to thee

Sanskrit: hu̱ve va̍ḥ su̱dyotmā̍naṁ suvṛ̱ktiṁ vi̱śām a̱gnim ati̍thiṁ supra̱yasa̍m   mi̱tra i̍va̱ yo di̍dhi̱ṣāyyo̱ bhūd de̱va āde̍ve̱ jane̍ jā̱tave̍dāḥ
English: for you i call the glorious refulgent agni the guest of men rich in oblations  whom all must strive to win even as a lover god among godly people jātavedas

English: bhṛgus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living  over all worlds let agni be the sovran the messenger of gods with rapid coursers

English: may the gṛtsamadas serving in secret through thee o agni overcome their neighbours  rich in good heroes and subduing foemen that vital power give thou to chiefs and singers

English: adored in heart as is thy right o agni serve the gods first today before the mortal  bring thou the marut host ye men do worship to indra seated on the grass eternal

English: wide be the doors the goddesses thrown open easy to pass invoked through adorations  let them unfold expansive everlasting that sanctify the class famed rich in heroes

Sanskrit: sā̱dhv apā̍ṁsi sa̱natā̍ na ukṣi̱te u̱ṣāsā̱naktā̍ va̱yye̍va raṇvi̱te   tantu̍ṁ ta̱taṁ sa̱ṁvaya̍ntī samī̱cī ya̱jñasya̱ peśa̍ḥ su̱dughe̱ paya̍svatī
English: good work for us the glorious night and morning like female weavers waxen from aforetime  yielders of rich milk interweave in concert the longextended thread the web of worship

Sanskrit: daivyā̱ hotā̍rā pratha̱mā vi̱duṣṭa̍ra ṛ̱ju ya̍kṣata̱ḥ sam ṛ̱cā va̱puṣṭa̍rā   de̱vān yaja̍ntāv ṛtu̱thā sam a̍ñjato̱ nābhā̍ pṛthi̱vyā adhi̱ sānu̍ṣu tri̱ṣu
English: let the two heavenly heralds first most wise most fair present oblation duly with the sacred verse  worshipping god at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth

English: sarasvatī who perfects our devotion iḷā divine bhāratī all surpassing  three goddesses with power inherent seated protect this holy grass our flawless refuge!

English: born is the pious hero swift of hearing like gold in hue well formed and full of vigour  may tvaṣṭar lengthen our line and kindred and may they reach the place which gods inhabit

Sanskrit: vana̱spati̍r avasṛ̱jann upa̍ sthād a̱gnir ha̱viḥ sū̍dayāti̱ pra dhī̱bhiḥ   tridhā̱ sama̍ktaṁ nayatu prajā̱nan de̱vebhyo̱ daivya̍ḥ śami̱topa̍ ha̱vyam
English: vanaspati shall stand anear and start us and agni with his arts prepare oblation  let the skilled heavenly immolator forward unto the gods the offering thrice anointed

English: oil has been mixt oil is his habitation in oil he rests oil is his proper province  come as thy wont is o thou steer rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated

Sanskrit: ya̱jñena̍ vardhata jā̱tave̍dasam a̱gniṁ ya̍jadhvaṁ ha̱viṣā̱ tanā̍ gi̱rā   sa̱mi̱dhā̱naṁ su̍pra̱yasa̱ṁ sva̍rṇaraṁ dyu̱kṣaṁ hotā̍raṁ vṛ̱jane̍ṣu dhū̱rṣada̍m
English: with sacrifice exalt agni who knows all life; worship him with oblation and the song of praise  well kindled nobly fed; heaven's lord celestial priest who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done

English: at night and morning agni have they called to thee like milchkine in their stalls lowing to meet their young  as messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men thou lord of precious boons

Sanskrit: taṁ de̱vā bu̱dhne raja̍saḥ su̱daṁsa̍saṁ di̱vaspṛ̍thi̱vyor a̍ra̱tiṁ ny e̍rire   ratha̍m iva̱ vedya̍ṁ śu̱kraśo̍ciṣam a̱gnim mi̱traṁ na kṣi̱tiṣu̍ pra̱śaṁsya̍m

English: him have they set in his own dwelling in the vault like the moon waxing fulgent in the realm of air  bird of the firmament observant with his eyes guard of the place as twere looking to gods and men
