Sanskrit: sa no̍ re̱vat sa̍midhā̱naḥ sva̱staye̍ saṁdada̱svān ra̱yim a̱smāsu̍ dīdihi   ā na̍ḥ kṛṇuṣva suvi̱tāya̱ roda̍sī̱ agne̍ ha̱vyā manu̍ṣo deva vī̱taye̍
English: such as thou art brilliantly kindled for our weal a liberal giver send us riches in thy shine  for our advantage agni god bring heaven and earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man

Sanskrit: dā no̍ agne bṛha̱to dāḥ sa̍ha̱sriṇo̍ du̱ro na vāja̱ṁ śrutyā̱ apā̍ vṛdhi   prācī̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī brahma̍ṇā kṛdhi̱ sva1̱̍r ṇa śu̱kram u̱ṣaso̱ vi di̍dyutaḥ
English: agni give us great wealth give riches thousandfold unclose to us like doors strength that shall bring renown  make heaven and earth propitious through the power of prayer and like the sky's bright sheen let mornings beam on us

Sanskrit: sa i̍dhā̱na u̱ṣaso̱ rāmyā̱ anu̱ sva1̱̍r ṇa dī̍ded aru̱ṣeṇa̍ bhā̱nunā̍   hotrā̍bhir a̱gnir manu̍ṣaḥ svadhva̱ro rājā̍ vi̱śām ati̍thi̱ś cāru̍r ā̱yave̍
English: enkindled night by night at every morning's dawn may he shine forth with red flame like the realm of light  agni adored in beauteous rites with lauds of men fair guest of living man and king of all our folk

Sanskrit: e̱vā no̍ agne a̱mṛte̍ṣu pūrvya̱ dhīṣ pī̍pāya bṛ̱haddi̍veṣu̱ mānu̍ṣā   duhā̍nā dhe̱nur vṛ̱jane̍ṣu kā̱rave̱ tmanā̍ śa̱tina̍m puru̱rūpa̍m i̱ṣaṇi̍
English: song chanted by us men o agni ancient one has swelled unto the deathless gods in lofty heaven  a milchcow yielding to the singer in the rites wealth manifold in hundreds even as he wills

Sanskrit: va̱yam a̍gne̱ arva̍tā vā su̱vīrya̱m brahma̍ṇā vā citayemā̱ janā̱m̐ ati̍   a̱smāka̍ṁ dyu̱mnam adhi̱ pañca̍ kṛ̱ṣṭiṣū̱ccā sva1̱̍r ṇa śu̍śucīta du̱ṣṭara̍m
English: agni may we show forth our valour with the steed or with the power of prayer beyond all other men;  and over the five races let our glory shine high like the realm of light and unsurpassable

Sanskrit: sa no̍ bodhi sahasya pra̱śaṁsyo̱ yasmi̍n sujā̱tā i̱ṣaya̍nta sū̱raya̍ḥ   yam a̍gne ya̱jñam u̍pa̱yanti̍ vā̱jino̱ nitye̍ to̱ke dī̍di̱vāṁsa̱ṁ sve dame̍
English: such conqueror! be to us be worthy of our praise thou for whom princes nobly born exert themselves;  whose sacrifice the strong seek agni when it shines for neverfailing offspring in thine own abode

Sanskrit: u̱bhayā̍so jātavedaḥ syāma te sto̱tāro̍ agne sū̱raya̍ś ca̱ śarma̍ṇi   vasvo̍ rā̱yaḥ pu̍ruśca̱ndrasya̱ bhūya̍saḥ pra̱jāva̍taḥ svapa̱tyasya̍ śagdhi naḥ
English: knower of all that lives o agni may we both singers of praise and chiefs be in thy keeping still  help us to wealth exceeding good and glorious abundant rich in children and their progeny

Sanskrit: ye sto̱tṛbhyo̱ goa̍grā̱m aśva̍peśasa̱m agne̍ rā̱tim u̍pasṛ̱janti̍ sū̱raya̍ḥ   a̱smāñ ca̱ tām̐ś ca̱ pra hi neṣi̱ vasya̱ ā bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: the princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise o agni guerdon graced with kine and steeds  lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss with brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud

Sanskrit: pra̱da̱kṣi̱ṇid a̱bhi gṛ̍ṇanti kā̱ravo̱ vayo̱ vada̍nta ṛtu̱thā śa̱kunta̍yaḥ   u̱bhe vācau̍ vadati sāma̱gā i̍va gāya̱traṁ ca̱ traiṣṭu̍bha̱ṁ cānu̍ rājati
English: here on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise even the winged birds that in due season speak  he like a sāmachanter utters both the notes skilled in the mode of tṛṣṭup and of gāyatrī

Sanskrit: u̱dgā̱teva̍ śakune̱ sāma̍ gāyasi brahmapu̱tra i̍va̱ sava̍neṣu śaṁsasi   vṛṣe̍va vā̱jī śiśu̍matīr a̱pītyā̍ sa̱rvato̍ naḥ śakune bha̱dram ā va̍da vi̱śvato̍ naḥ śakune̱ puṇya̱m ā va̍da
English: thou like the chanterpriest chantest the sāma bird; thou singest at libations like a brahman's son  even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare announce to us good fortune bird on every side proclaim in all directions happy luck o bird

Sanskrit: ā̱vada̱m̐s tvaṁ śa̍kune bha̱dram ā va̍da tū̱ṣṇīm āsī̍naḥ suma̱tiṁ ci̍kiddhi naḥ   yad u̱tpata̱n vada̍si karka̱rir ya̍thā bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: when singing here o bird announce good luck to us and when thou sittest still think on us with kind thoughts

Sanskrit: kani̍kradaj ja̱nuṣa̍m prabruvā̱ṇa iya̍rti̱ vāca̍m ari̱teva̱ nāva̍m   su̱ma̱ṅgala̍ś ca śakune̱ bhavā̍si̱ mā tvā̱ kā ci̍d abhi̱bhā viśvyā̍ vidat
English: telling his race aloud with cries repeated he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman  o bird be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee

Sanskrit: mā tvā̍ śye̱na ud va̍dhī̱n mā su̍pa̱rṇo mā tvā̍ vida̱d iṣu̍mān vī̱ro astā̍   pitryā̱m anu̍ pra̱diśa̱ṁ kani̍kradat suma̱ṅgalo̍ bhadravā̱dī va̍de̱ha
English: let not the falcon kill thee nor the eagle let not the arrowbearing archer reach thee  still crying in the region of the fathers speak here auspicious bearing joyful tidings

Sanskrit: ava̍ kranda dakṣiṇa̱to gṛ̱hāṇā̍ṁ suma̱ṅgalo̍ bhadravā̱dī śa̍kunte   mā na̍ḥ ste̱na ī̍śata̱ māghaśa̍ṁso bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: bringing good tidings bird of happy omen call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings  so that no thief no sinner may oppress us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: vāyo̱ ye te̍ saha̱sriṇo̱ rathā̍sa̱s tebhi̱r ā ga̍hi   ni̱yutvā̱n soma̍pītaye
English: o vāyu come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine  teamborne to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: ni̱yutvā̍n vāya̱v ā ga̍hy a̱yaṁ śu̱kro a̍yāmi te   gantā̍si sunva̱to gṛ̱ham
English: drawn by thy team o vāyu come; to thee is offered this the pure  thou visitest the presser's house

Sanskrit: śu̱krasyā̱dya gavā̍śira̱ indra̍vāyū ni̱yutva̍taḥ   ā yā̍ta̱m piba̍taṁ narā
English: indra and vāyu drawn by teams ye heroes come today and drink  of the bright juice when blent with milk

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ vā̍m mitrāvaruṇā su̱taḥ soma̍ ṛtāvṛdhā   mamed i̱ha śru̍ta̱ṁ hava̍m
English: this soma hath been shed for you lawstrengtheners mitravaruṇa!  listen ye here to this my call

Sanskrit: rājā̍nā̱v ana̍bhidruhā dhru̱ve sada̍sy utta̱me   sa̱hasra̍sthūṇa āsāte
English: both kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home  the thousandpillared firmlybased

Sanskrit: tā sa̱mrājā̍ ghṛ̱tāsu̍tī ādi̱tyā dānu̍na̱s patī̍   sace̍te̱ ana̍vahvaram
English: fed with oblation sovran kings ādityas lords of liberal gifts  they wait on him whose life is true

Sanskrit: goma̍d ū̱ ṣu nā̍sa̱tyāśvā̍vad yātam aśvinā   va̱rtī ru̍drā nṛ̱pāyya̍m
English: with kine nāsatyas and with steeds come aśvins rudras to the house  that will protect its heroes well;

Sanskrit: na yat paro̱ nānta̍ra āda̱dharṣa̍d vṛṣaṇvasū   du̱ḥśaṁso̱ martyo̍ ri̱puḥ
English: such wealthy gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm  yea no malicious mortal foe

Sanskrit: tā na̱ ā vo̍ḻham aśvinā ra̱yim pi̱śaṅga̍saṁdṛśam   dhiṣṇyā̍ varivo̱vida̍m
English: as such o longedfar aśvins lead us on to wealth of varied sort  wealth that shall bring us room and rest

Sanskrit: indro̍ a̱ṅga ma̱had bha̱yam a̱bhī ṣad apa̍ cucyavat   sa hi sthi̱ro vica̍rṣaṇiḥ
English: verily indra conquering all driveth een mighty fear away  for firm is he and swift to act

Sanskrit: indra̍ś ca mṛ̱ḻayā̍ti no̱ na na̍ḥ pa̱ścād a̱ghaṁ na̍śat   bha̱dram bha̍vāti naḥ pu̱raḥ
English: indra be gracious unto us sin shall not reach us afterward  and good shall be before us still

Sanskrit: indra̱ āśā̍bhya̱s pari̱ sarvā̍bhyo̱ abha̍yaṁ karat   jetā̱ śatrū̱n vica̍rṣaṇiḥ
English: from all the regions of the world let indra send security  the foesubduer swift to act

Sanskrit: viśve̍ devāsa̱ ā ga̍ta śṛṇu̱tā ma̍ i̱maṁ hava̍m   edam ba̱rhir ni ṣī̍data
English: o all ye gods come hitherward hear this mine invocation seat  yourselves upon this sacred grass

Sanskrit: tī̱vro vo̱ madhu̍mām̐ a̱yaṁ śu̱naho̍treṣu matsa̱raḥ   e̱tam pi̍bata̱ kāmya̍m
English: among the śunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught  drink ye of this delightsome juice

Sanskrit: indra̍jyeṣṭhā̱ maru̍dgaṇā̱ devā̍sa̱ḥ pūṣa̍rātayaḥ   viśve̱ mama̍ śrutā̱ hava̍m
English: ye   led by indra gods with pūṣan for your bounteousest  hear all of you this call of mine

Sanskrit: ambi̍tame̱ nadī̍tame̱ devi̍tame̱ sara̍svati   a̱pra̱śa̱stā i̍va smasi̱ praśa̍stim amba nas kṛdhi
English: best mother best of rivers best of goddesses sarasvatī we are as twere of no repute and dear mother give thou us renown

Sanskrit: tve viśvā̍ sarasvati śri̱tāyū̍ṁṣi de̱vyām   śu̱naho̍treṣu matsva pra̱jāṁ de̍vi didiḍḍhi naḥ
English: in thee sarasvatī divine all generations have their stay  be glad with śunahotra's sons o goddess grant us progeny

Sanskrit: i̱mā brahma̍ sarasvati ju̱ṣasva̍ vājinīvati   yā te̱ manma̍ gṛtsama̱dā ṛ̍tāvari pri̱yā de̱veṣu̱ juhva̍ti
English: enriched with sacrifice accept sarasvatī these prayers of ours  thoughts which gṛtsamadas beloved of gods bring holy one to thee

Sanskrit: pretā̍ṁ ya̱jñasya̍ śa̱mbhuvā̍ yu̱vām id ā vṛ̍ṇīmahe   a̱gniṁ ca̍ havya̱vāha̍nam
English: ye who bless sacrifice go forth for verily we choose you both  and agni who conveys our gifts

Sanskrit: dyāvā̍ naḥ pṛthi̱vī i̱maṁ si̱dhram a̱dya di̍vi̱spṛśa̍m   ya̱jñaṁ de̱veṣu̍ yacchatām
English: this our effectual sacrifice reaching the sky shall heaven and earth  present unto the gods today

Sanskrit: ā vā̍m u̱pastha̍m adruhā de̱vāḥ sī̍dantu ya̱jñiyā̍ḥ   i̱hādya soma̍pītaye
English: in both your laps ye guileless ones the holy gods shall sit them down  today to drink the soma here

Sanskrit: somā̍pūṣaṇā̱ jana̍nā rayī̱ṇāṁ jana̍nā di̱vo jana̍nā pṛthi̱vyāḥ   jā̱tau viśva̍sya̱ bhuva̍nasya go̱pau de̱vā a̍kṛṇvann a̱mṛta̍sya̱ nābhi̍m
English: soma and pūṣan parents of all riches parents of earth and parents of high heaven  you twain brought forth as the whole world's protectors the gods have made centre of life eternal

Sanskrit: i̱mau de̱vau jāya̍mānau juṣante̱mau tamā̍ṁsi gūhatā̱m aju̍ṣṭā   ā̱bhyām indra̍ḥ pa̱kvam ā̱māsv a̱ntaḥ so̍māpū̱ṣabhyā̍ṁ janad u̱sriyā̍su
English: at birth of these two gods all gods are joyful they have caused darkness which we hate to vanish  with these with soma and with pūṣan india generates ripe warm milk in the raw milchcows

Sanskrit: somā̍pūṣaṇā̱ raja̍so vi̱māna̍ṁ sa̱ptaca̍kra̱ṁ ratha̱m avi̍śvaminvam   vi̱ṣū̱vṛta̱m mana̍sā yu̱jyamā̍na̱ṁ taṁ ji̍nvatho vṛṣaṇā̱ pañca̍raśmim
English: soma and pūṣan urge your chariot hither the sevenwheeled car that measures out the region  that stirs not all that moves to every quarter fivereined and harnessed by the thought ye mighty

Sanskrit: di̱vy a1̱̍nyaḥ sada̍naṁ ca̱kra u̱ccā pṛ̍thi̱vyām a̱nyo adhy a̱ntari̍kṣe   tāv a̱smabhya̍m puru̱vāra̍m puru̱kṣuṁ rā̱yas poṣa̱ṁ vi ṣya̍tā̱ṁ nābhi̍m a̱sme
English: one in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling on earth and in the firmament the other  may they disclose to us great store of treasure muchlonged for rich in food source of enjoyment

Sanskrit: viśvā̍ny a̱nyo bhuva̍nā ja̱jāna̱ viśva̍m a̱nyo a̍bhi̱cakṣā̍ṇa eti   somā̍pūṣaṇā̱v ava̍ta̱ṁ dhiya̍m me yu̱vābhyā̱ṁ viśvā̱ḥ pṛta̍nā jayema
English: one of you twain is parent of all creatures the other journeys onward allbeholding  soma and pūṣan aid my thought with favour with you may we o’ercome in all encounters

Sanskrit: dhiya̍m pū̱ṣā ji̍nvatu viśvami̱nvo ra̱yiṁ somo̍ rayi̱pati̍r dadhātu   ava̍tu de̱vy adi̍tir ana̱rvā bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: may pūṣan stir our thought the allimpelling may soma lord of riches grant us riches  may aditi the perfect goddess aid us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: grāvā̍ṇeva̱ tad id artha̍ṁ jarethe̱ gṛdhre̍va vṛ̱kṣaṁ ni̍dhi̱manta̱m accha̍   bra̱hmāṇe̍va vi̱datha̍ uktha̱śāsā̍ dū̱teva̱ havyā̱ janyā̍ puru̱trā
English: sing like the two pressstones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure;  like two laudsinging brahmans in the assembly like the folk's envoys called in many places

Sanskrit: prā̱ta̱ryāvā̍ṇā ra̱thye̍va vī̱rājeva̍ ya̱mā vara̱m ā sa̍cethe   mene̍ iva ta̱nvā̱3̱̍ śumbha̍māne̱ dampa̍tīva kratu̱vidā̱ jane̍ṣu
English: moving at morning like two carborne heroes like to a pair of goats ye come electing;  like two fair dames embellishing their bodies like a wise married pair among the people

Sanskrit: śṛṅge̍va naḥ pratha̱mā ga̍ntam a̱rvāk cha̱phāv i̍va̱ jarbhu̍rāṇā̱ taro̍bhiḥ   ca̱kra̱vā̱keva̱ prati̱ vasto̍r usrā̱rvāñcā̍ yātaṁ ra̱thye̍va śakrā
English: like to a pair of horns come first to usward like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion;  come like two cakavās in the grey of morning come like two chariot wheels at dawn ye mighty

Sanskrit: nā̱veva̍ naḥ pārayataṁ yu̱geva̱ nabhye̍va na upa̱dhīva̍ pra̱dhīva̍   śvāne̍va no̱ ari̍ṣaṇyā ta̱nūnā̱ṁ khṛga̍leva vi̱srasa̍ḥ pātam a̱smān
English: bear us across the rivers like two vessels save us as ye were yokes naves spokes and fellies  be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us like two crutches that we fall not

Sanskrit: vāte̍vāju̱ryā na̱dye̍va rī̱tir a̱kṣī i̍va̱ cakṣu̱ṣā yā̍tam a̱rvāk   hastā̍v iva ta̱nve̱3̱̍ śambha̍viṣṭhā̱ pāde̍va no nayata̱ṁ vasyo̱ accha̍
English: like two winds ageing not two confluent rivers come with quick vision like two eyes before us  come like two hands most helpful to the body and guide us like two feet to what is precious

Sanskrit: oṣṭhā̍v iva̱ madhv ā̱sne vada̍ntā̱ stanā̍v iva pipyataṁ jī̱vase̍ naḥ   nāse̍va nas ta̱nvo̍ rakṣi̱tārā̱ karṇā̍v iva su̱śrutā̍ bhūtam a̱sme
English: even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey even as two breasts that nourish our existence  like the two nostrils that protect our being be to us as our ears that hear distinctly

Sanskrit: haste̍va śa̱ktim a̱bhi sa̍ṁda̱dī na̱ḥ kṣāme̍va na̱ḥ sam a̍jata̱ṁ rajā̍ṁsi   i̱mā giro̍ aśvinā yuṣma̱yantī̱ḥ kṣṇotre̍ṇeva̱ svadhi̍ti̱ṁ saṁ śi̍śītam
English: like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions  aśvins these hymns that struggle to approach you sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone

Sanskrit: e̱tāni̍ vām aśvinā̱ vardha̍nāni̱ brahma̱ stoma̍ṁ gṛtsama̱dāso̍ akran   tāni̍ narā jujuṣā̱ṇopa̍ yātam bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: these prayers of ours exalting you o aśvins have the gṛtsamadas for a laud made ready  welcome them o ye heroes and come hither loud may we speak with brave men in assembly

Sanskrit: ud u̱ ṣya de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā sa̱vāya̍ śaśvatta̱maṁ tada̍pā̱ vahni̍r asthāt   nū̱naṁ de̱vebhyo̱ vi hi dhāti̱ ratna̱m athābha̍jad vī̱tiho̍traṁ sva̱stau
English: uprisen is savitar this god to quicken priest who neglects not this most constant duty  to the gods verily he gives rich treasure and blesses him who calls them to the banquet

Sanskrit: viśva̍sya̱ hi śru̱ṣṭaye̍ de̱va ū̱rdhvaḥ pra bā̱havā̍ pṛ̱thupā̍ṇi̱ḥ sisa̍rti   āpa̍ś cid asya vra̱ta ā nimṛ̍grā a̱yaṁ ci̱d vāto̍ ramate̱ pari̍jman
English: having gone up on high the god broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him  even the waters bend them to his service even this wind rests in the circling region

Sanskrit: ā̱śubhi̍ś ci̱d yān vi mu̍cāti nū̱nam arī̍rama̱d ata̍mānaṁ ci̱d eto̍ḥ   a̱hyarṣū̍ṇāṁ ci̱n ny a̍yām̐ avi̱ṣyām anu̍ vra̱taṁ sa̍vi̱tur moky āgā̍t
English: though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them e’en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going  he hath checked e’en their haste who glide like serpents night closely followed savitar's dominion

Sanskrit: puna̱ḥ sam a̍vya̱d vita̍ta̱ṁ vaya̍ntī ma̱dhyā karto̱r ny a̍dhā̱c chakma̱ dhīra̍ḥ   ut sa̱ṁhāyā̍sthā̱d vy ṛ1̱̍tūm̐r a̍dardhar a̱rama̍tiḥ savi̱tā de̱va āgā̍t
English: what was spread out she weaves afresh reweaving the skilful leaves his labour halfcompleted  he hath arisen from rest and parted seasons savitar hath approached god holyminded

Sanskrit: nānaukā̍ṁsi̱ duryo̱ viśva̱m āyu̱r vi ti̍ṣṭhate prabha̱vaḥ śoko̍ a̱gneḥ   jyeṣṭha̍m mā̱tā sū̱nave̍ bhā̱gam ādhā̱d anv a̍sya̱ keta̍m iṣi̱taṁ sa̍vi̱trā
English: through various dwellings through entire existence spreads manifest the household light of agni  the mother gives her son the goodliest portion and savitar hath sped to meet his summons

Sanskrit: sa̱māva̍varti̱ viṣṭhi̍to jigī̱ṣur viśve̍ṣā̱ṁ kāma̱ś cara̍tām a̱mābhū̍t   śaśvā̱m̐ apo̱ vikṛ̍taṁ hi̱tvy āgā̱d anu̍ vra̱taṁ sa̍vi̱tur daivya̍sya
English: he comes again unfolded fain for conquest at home was he the love of all things moving  each man hath come leaving his evil doings after the godlike savitar's commandment

Sanskrit: tvayā̍ hi̱tam apya̍m a̱psu bhā̱gaṁ dhanvānv ā mṛ̍ga̱yaso̱ vi ta̍sthuḥ   vanā̍ni̱ vibhyo̱ naki̍r asya̱ tāni̍ vra̱tā de̱vasya̍ savi̱tur mi̍nanti
English: the wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters  the woods are given to the birds these statutes of the god savitar none disobeyeth

Sanskrit: yā̱drā̱dhya1̱̍ṁ varu̍ṇo̱ yoni̱m apya̱m ani̍śitaṁ ni̱miṣi̱ jarbhu̍rāṇaḥ   viśvo̍ mārtā̱ṇḍo vra̱jam ā pa̱śur gā̍t stha̱śo janmā̍ni savi̱tā vy āka̍ḥ
English: with utmost speed in restless haste at sunset varuṇa seeks his watery habitation  then seeks each bird his nest each beast his lodging in due place savitar hath set each creature

Sanskrit: na yasyendro̱ varu̍ṇo̱ na mi̱tro vra̱tam a̍rya̱mā na mi̱nanti̍ ru̱draḥ   nārā̍taya̱s tam i̱daṁ sva̱sti hu̱ve de̱vaṁ sa̍vi̱tāra̱ṁ namo̍bhiḥ
English: him whose high law not varuṇa nor indra not mitra aryaman nor rudra breaketh  nor evilhearted fiends here for my welfare him i invoke god savitar with worship

Sanskrit: bhaga̱ṁ dhiya̍ṁ vā̱jaya̍nta̱ḥ pura̍ṁdhi̱ṁ narā̱śaṁso̱ gnāspati̍r no avyāḥ   ā̱ye vā̱masya̍ saṁga̱the ra̍yī̱ṇām pri̱yā de̱vasya̍ savi̱tuḥ syā̍ma
English: may they who strengthen bliss and thought and wisdom and the dames’ lord and narāśaṁsa aid us  that good may come to us and wealth be gathered may we be savitar the god's beloved

Sanskrit: a̱smabhya̱ṁ tad di̱vo a̱dbhyaḥ pṛ̍thi̱vyās tvayā̍ da̱ttaṁ kāmya̱ṁ rādha̱ ā gā̍t   śaṁ yat sto̱tṛbhya̍ ā̱paye̱ bhavā̍ty uru̱śaṁsā̍ya savitar jari̱tre
English: so come to us our hearts' desire the bounty bestowed by thee from heaven and earth and waters  that it be well with friends and those who praise thee and savitar with the loudlauding singer

Sanskrit: manda̍sva ho̱trād anu̱ joṣa̱m andha̱so 'dhva̍ryava̱ḥ sa pū̱rṇāṁ va̍ṣṭy ā̱sica̍m   tasmā̍ e̱tam bha̍rata tadva̱śo da̱dir ho̱trāt soma̍ṁ draviṇoda̱ḥ piba̍ ṛ̱tubhi̍ḥ
English: enjoy thy fill of meath out of the hotar's cup adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him  bring it him seeking this he gives granter of wealth drink soma with the ṛtus from the hotar's cup

Sanskrit: yam u̱ pūrva̱m ahu̍ve̱ tam i̱daṁ hu̍ve̱ sed u̱ havyo̍ da̱dir yo nāma̱ patya̍te   a̱dhva̱ryubhi̱ḥ prasthi̍taṁ so̱myam madhu̍ po̱trāt soma̍ṁ draviṇoda̱ḥ piba̍ ṛ̱tubhi̍ḥ
English: he whom of old i called on him i call on now he is to be invoked; his name is he who gives  here brought by priests is soma meath granter of wealth drink soma with the ṛtus from the potar's cup

Sanskrit: medya̍ntu te̱ vahna̍yo̱ yebhi̱r īya̱se 'ri̍ṣaṇyan vīḻayasvā vanaspate   ā̱yūyā̍ dhṛṣṇo abhi̱gūryā̱ tvaṁ ne̱ṣṭrāt soma̍ṁ draviṇoda̱ḥ piba̍ ṛ̱tubhi̍ḥ
English: fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on lord of the wood unharming strengthen thou thyself  drawing and seizing bold one thou who grantest wealth drink soma with the ṛtus from the neṣṭar's cup

Sanskrit: apā̍d dho̱trād u̱ta po̱trād a̍matto̱ta ne̱ṣṭrād a̍juṣata̱ prayo̍ hi̱tam   tu̱rīya̱m pātra̱m amṛ̍kta̱m ama̍rtyaṁ draviṇo̱dāḥ pi̍batu drāviṇoda̱saḥ
English: from hotar's cup and potar's he hath drunk and joyed the proffered food hath pleased him from the neṣṭar's bowl  the fourth cup undisturbed immortal let him drink who giveth wealth the cup of the wealthgiving god

Sanskrit: a̱rvāñca̍m a̱dya ya̱yya̍ṁ nṛ̱vāha̍ṇa̱ṁ ratha̍ṁ yuñjāthām i̱ha vā̍ṁ vi̱moca̍nam   pṛ̱ṅktaṁ ha̱vīṁṣi̱ madhu̱nā hi ka̍ṁ ga̱tam athā̱ soma̍m pibataṁ vājinīvasū
English: yoke o ye twain today your herobearing car swiftmoving hitherward your loosingplace is here  mix the oblations then come hither with the meath and drink the soma ye rich in abundant strength

Sanskrit: joṣy a̍gne sa̱midha̱ṁ joṣy āhu̍ti̱ṁ joṣi̱ brahma̱ janya̱ṁ joṣi̍ suṣṭu̱tim   viśve̍bhi̱r viśvā̍m̐ ṛ̱tunā̍ vaso ma̱ha u̱śan de̱vām̐ u̍śa̱taḥ pā̍yayā ha̱viḥ
English: agni accept the fuel and our offered gift accept the prayer of man accept our eulogy  do thou with all with ṛtu o thou excellent fain make the great gods all fain taste the gift we bring

Sanskrit: tubhya̍ṁ hinvā̱no va̍siṣṭa̱ gā a̱po 'dhu̍kṣan sī̱m avi̍bhi̱r adri̍bhi̱r nara̍ḥ   pibe̍ndra̱ svāhā̱ prahu̍ta̱ṁ vaṣa̍ṭkṛtaṁ ho̱trād ā soma̍m pratha̱mo ya īśi̍ṣe
English: water and milk hath he endued sent forth to thee the men have drained him with the filters and the stones  drink indra from the hotar's bowlfirst right is thinesoma hallowed and poured with vaṣaṭ and svāhā

Sanskrit: ya̱jñaiḥ sammi̍ślā̱ḥ pṛṣa̍tībhir ṛ̱ṣṭibhi̱r yāma̍ñ chu̱bhrāso̍ a̱ñjiṣu̍ pri̱yā u̱ta   ā̱sadyā̍ ba̱rhir bha̍ratasya sūnavaḥ po̱trād ā soma̍m pibatā divo naraḥ
English: busied with sacrifice with spotted deer and spears gleaming upon your way with ornaments yea our friends  sitting on sacred grass ye sons of bhārata drink soma from the potar's bowl o men of heaven

Sanskrit: a̱meva̍ naḥ suhavā̱ ā hi ganta̍na̱ ni ba̱rhiṣi̍ sadatanā̱ raṇi̍ṣṭana   athā̍ mandasva jujuṣā̱ṇo andha̍sa̱s tvaṣṭa̍r de̱vebhi̱r jani̍bhiḥ su̱madga̍ṇaḥ
English: come unto us ye swift to listen as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves  and tvaṣṭar wellcontent be joyful in the juice with gods and goddesses in gladsome company

Sanskrit: ā va̍kṣi de̱vām̐ i̱ha vi̍pra̱ yakṣi̍ co̱śan ho̍ta̱r ni ṣa̍dā̱ yoni̍ṣu tri̱ṣu   prati̍ vīhi̱ prasthi̍taṁ so̱myam madhu̱ pibāgnī̍dhrā̱t tava̍ bhā̱gasya̍ tṛpṇuhi
English: bring the gods hither sage and offer sacrifice at the three altars seat thee willingly o priest  accept for thy delight the proffered soma meath drink from the kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa sya te̍ ta̱nvo̍ nṛmṇa̱vardha̍na̱ḥ saha̱ oja̍ḥ pra̱divi̍ bā̱hvor hi̱taḥ   tubhya̍ṁ su̱to ma̍ghava̱n tubhya̱m ābhṛ̍ta̱s tvam a̍sya̱ brāhma̍ṇā̱d ā tṛ̱pat pi̍ba
English: this is the strengthener of thy body's manly might strength victory for all time are placed within thine arms  pressed for thee maghavan it is offered unto thee drink from the chalice of this brahman drink thy fill

Sanskrit: ju̱ṣethā̍ṁ ya̱jñam bodha̍ta̱ṁ hava̍sya me sa̱tto hotā̍ ni̱vida̍ḥ pū̱rvyā anu̍   acchā̱ rājā̍nā̱ nama̍ ety ā̱vṛta̍m praśā̱strād ā pi̍bataṁ so̱myam madhu̍
English: accept the sacrifice; mark both of you my call the priest hath seated him after the ancient texts  my prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the kings drink ye the soma meath from the director's bowl

Sanskrit: upe̍m asṛkṣi vāja̱yur va̍ca̱syāṁ cano̍ dadhīta nā̱dyo giro̍ me   a̱pāṁ napā̍d āśu̱hemā̍ ku̱vit sa su̱peśa̍sas karati̱ joṣi̍ṣa̱d dhi
English: eager for spoil my flow of speech i utter may the floods' child accept my songs with favour  will not the rapid son of waters make them lovely for he it is who shall enjoy them?

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ sv a̍smai hṛ̱da ā suta̍ṣṭa̱m mantra̍ṁ vocema ku̱vid a̍sya̱ veda̍t   a̱pāṁ napā̍d asu̱rya̍sya ma̱hnā viśvā̍ny a̱ryo bhuva̍nā jajāna
English: to him let us address the song wellfashioned forth from the heart shall he not understand it'  the friendly son of waters by the greatness of godhead hath produced all things existing

Sanskrit: sam a̱nyā yanty upa̍ yanty a̱nyāḥ sa̍mā̱nam ū̱rvaṁ na̱dya̍ḥ pṛṇanti   tam ū̱ śuci̱ṁ śuca̍yo dīdi̱vāṁsa̍m a̱pāṁ napā̍ta̱m pari̍ tasthu̱r āpa̍ḥ
English: some floods unite themselves and others join them die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse  on every side the bright floods have encompassed the bright resplendent offspring of the waters

Sanskrit: tam asme̍rā yuva̱tayo̱ yuvā̍nam marmṛ̱jyamā̍nā̱ḥ pari̍ ya̱nty āpa̍ḥ   sa śu̱krebhi̱ḥ śikva̍bhī re̱vad a̱sme dī̱dāyā̍ni̱dhmo ghṛ̱tani̍rṇig a̱psu
English: the neversullen waters youthful maidens carefully decking wait on him the youthful  he with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty unfed with wood in waters oilenveloped

Sanskrit: a̱smai ti̱sro a̍vya̱thyāya̱ nārī̍r de̱vāya̍ de̱vīr di̍dhiṣa̱nty anna̍m   kṛtā̍ i̱vopa̱ hi pra̍sa̱rsre a̱psu sa pī̱yūṣa̍ṁ dhayati pūrva̱sūnā̍m
English: to him three dames are offering food to feed him goddesses to the god whom none may injure  within the waters hath he pressed as hollows and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers

Sanskrit: aśva̱syātra̱ jani̍mā̱sya ca̱ sva̍r dru̱ho ri̱ṣaḥ sa̱mpṛca̍ḥ pāhi sū̱rīn   ā̱māsu̍ pū̱rṣu pa̱ro a̍pramṛ̱ṣyaṁ nārā̍tayo̱ vi na̍śa̱n nānṛ̍tāni
English: here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught  him indestructible dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not

Sanskrit: sva ā dame̍ su̱dughā̱ yasya̍ dhe̱nuḥ sva̱dhām pī̍pāya su̱bhv anna̍m atti   so a̱pāṁ napā̍d ū̱rjaya̍nn a̱psv a1̱̍ntar va̍su̱deyā̍ya vidha̱te vi bhā̍ti
English: he in whose mansion is the teeming milchcow swells the gods nectar and cats noble viands  the son of waters gathering strength in waters shines for his worshipper to give him treasures

Sanskrit: yo a̱psv ā śuci̍nā̱ daivye̍na ṛ̱tāvāja̍sra urvi̱yā vi̱bhāti̍   va̱yā id a̱nyā bhuva̍nāny asya̱ pra jā̍yante vī̱rudha̍ś ca pra̱jābhi̍ḥ
English: he who in waters with his own pure godhead shines widely lawabiding everlasting  the other worlds are verily his branches and plants are born of him with all their offspring

Sanskrit: a̱pāṁ napā̱d ā hy asthā̍d u̱pastha̍ṁ ji̱hmānā̍m ū̱rdhvo vi̱dyuta̱ṁ vasā̍naḥ   tasya̱ jyeṣṭha̍m mahi̱māna̱ṁ vaha̍ntī̱r hira̍ṇyavarṇā̱ḥ pari̍ yanti ya̱hvīḥ
English: the waters son hath risen and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom;  and bearing with them his supremest glory the youthful ones goldcoloured move around him

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyarūpa̱ḥ sa hira̍ṇyasaṁdṛg a̱pāṁ napā̱t sed u̱ hira̍ṇyavarṇaḥ   hi̱ra̱ṇyayā̱t pari̱ yone̍r ni̱ṣadyā̍ hiraṇya̱dā da̍da̱ty anna̍m asmai
English: golden in form is he like gold to look on his colour is like gold the son of waters  when he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him

Sanskrit: tad a̱syānī̍kam u̱ta cāru̱ nāmā̍pī̱cya̍ṁ vardhate̱ naptu̍r a̱pām   yam i̱ndhate̍ yuva̱taya̱ḥ sam i̱tthā hira̍ṇyavarṇaṁ ghṛ̱tam anna̍m asya
English: this the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the waters son increase in secret  whom here the youthful maids together kindle his food is sacred oil of golden colour

Sanskrit: a̱smai ba̍hū̱nām a̍va̱māya̱ sakhye̍ ya̱jñair vi̍dhema̱ nama̍sā ha̱virbhi̍ḥ   saṁ sānu̱ mārjmi̱ didhi̍ṣāmi̱ bilmai̱r dadhā̱my annai̱ḥ pari̍ vanda ṛ̱gbhiḥ
English: him nearest friend of many will we worship with sacrifice and reverence and oblation  i make his back to shine with chips provide him; i offer food and with my songs exalt him

Sanskrit: sa ī̱ṁ vṛṣā̍janaya̱t tāsu̱ garbha̱ṁ sa ī̱ṁ śiśu̍r dhayati̱ taṁ ri̍hanti   so a̱pāṁ napā̱d ana̍bhimlātavarṇo̱ 'nyasye̍ve̱ha ta̱nvā̍ viveṣa
English: the bull hath laid his own lifegerm within them he sucks them as an infant and they kiss him  he son of waters of unfading colour hath entered here as in another's body

Sanskrit: a̱smin pa̱de pa̍ra̱me ta̍sthi̱vāṁsa̍m adhva̱smabhi̍r vi̱śvahā̍ dīdi̱vāṁsa̍m   āpo̱ naptre̍ ghṛ̱tam anna̱ṁ vaha̍ntīḥ sva̱yam atkai̱ḥ pari̍ dīyanti ya̱hvīḥ
English: while here he dwelleth in sublimest station resplendent with the rays that never perish  the waters bearing oil to feed their offspring flow youthful ones in wanderings about him

Sanskrit: ayā̍ṁsam agne sukṣi̱tiṁ janā̱yāyā̍ṁsam u ma̱ghava̍dbhyaḥ suvṛ̱ktim   viśva̱ṁ tad bha̱draṁ yad ava̍nti de̱vā bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: agni i gave good shelter to the people and to the princes goodly preparation  blessed is all that gods regard with favour loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: dhā̱rā̱va̱rā ma̱ruto̍ dhṛ̱ṣṇvo̍jaso mṛ̱gā na bhī̱mās tavi̍ṣībhir a̱rcina̍ḥ   a̱gnayo̱ na śu̍śucā̱nā ṛ̍jī̱ṣiṇo̱ bhṛmi̱ṁ dhama̍nto̱ apa̱ gā a̍vṛṇvata
English: the maruts of resistless might who love the rain resplendent terrible like wild beasts in their strength  glowing like flames of fire impetuous in career blowing the wandering raincloud have disclosed the kine

Sanskrit: dyāvo̱ na stṛbhi̍ś citayanta khā̱dino̱ vy a1̱̍bhriyā̱ na dyu̍tayanta vṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ   ru̱dro yad vo̍ maruto rukmavakṣaso̱ vṛṣāja̍ni̱ pṛśnyā̍ḥ śu̱kra ūdha̍ni
English: they gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars like cloudborn lightnings shine the torrents of their rain  since the strong rudra o maruts with brilliant chests sprang into life for you in pṛśni's radiant lap

Sanskrit: u̱kṣante̱ aśvā̱m̐ atyā̍m̐ ivā̱jiṣu̍ na̱dasya̱ karṇai̍s turayanta ā̱śubhi̍ḥ   hira̍ṇyaśiprā maruto̱ davi̍dhvataḥ pṛ̱kṣaṁ yā̍tha̱ pṛṣa̍tībhiḥ samanyavaḥ
English: they drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way  maruts with helms of gold ye who make all things shake   with your spotted deer oneminded to our food

Sanskrit: pṛ̱kṣe tā viśvā̱ bhuva̍nā vavakṣire mi̱trāya̍ vā̱ sada̱m ā jī̱radā̍navaḥ   pṛṣa̍daśvāso anava̱bhrarā̍dhasa ṛji̱pyāso̱ na va̱yune̍ṣu dhū̱rṣada̍ḥ
English: they have bestowed of mitra all that live to feed they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow;  whose steeds are spotted deer whose riches never fail like horses in full speed bound to the pole in work

Sanskrit: indha̍nvabhir dhe̱nubhī̍ ra̱pśadū̍dhabhir adhva̱smabhi̍ḥ pa̱thibhi̍r bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ   ā ha̱ṁsāso̱ na svasa̍rāṇi gantana̱ madho̱r madā̍ya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ
English: with brightlyflaming kine whose udders swell with milk with glittering lances on your unobstructed paths  o maruts of one mind like swans who seek their nests come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath

Sanskrit: ā no̱ brahmā̍ṇi marutaḥ samanyavo na̱rāṁ na śaṁsa̱ḥ sava̍nāni gantana   aśvā̍m iva pipyata dhe̱num ūdha̍ni̱ kartā̱ dhiya̍ṁ jari̱tre vāja̍peśasam
English: to these our prayers o maruts come unanimous come ye to our libations like the praise of men  make it swell like a mare in udder like a cow and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength

Sanskrit: taṁ no̍ dāta maruto vā̱jina̱ṁ ratha̍ āpā̱nam brahma̍ ci̱taya̍d di̱vedi̍ve   iṣa̍ṁ sto̱tṛbhyo̍ vṛ̱jane̍ṣu kā̱rave̍ sa̱nim me̱dhām ari̍ṣṭaṁ du̱ṣṭara̱ṁ saha̍ḥ
English: give us a steed o maruts mighty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day;  food to your praisers to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom power uninjured unsurpassed

Sanskrit: yad yu̱ñjate̍ ma̱ruto̍ ru̱kmava̍kṣa̱so 'śvā̱n rathe̍ṣu̱ bhaga̱ ā su̱dāna̍vaḥ   dhe̱nur na śiśve̱ svasa̍reṣu pinvate̱ janā̍ya rā̱taha̍viṣe ma̱hīm iṣa̍m
English: when the brightchested maruts lavish of their gifts bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars  then as the milchcow feeds her calf within the stalls they pour forth food for all oblationbringing men

Sanskrit: yo no̍ maruto vṛ̱katā̍ti̱ martyo̍ ri̱pur da̱dhe va̍savo̱ rakṣa̍tā ri̱ṣaḥ   va̱rtaya̍ta̱ tapu̍ṣā ca̱kriyā̱bhi tam ava̍ rudrā a̱śaso̍ hantanā̱ vadha̍ḥ
English: save us o maruts vasus from the injurer the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves  with chariot all aflame compass him round about o rudras cast away the foeman's deadly bolt

Sanskrit: ci̱traṁ tad vo̍ maruto̱ yāma̍ cekite̱ pṛśnyā̱ yad ūdha̱r apy ā̱payo̍ du̱huḥ   yad vā̍ ni̱de nava̍mānasya rudriyās tri̱taṁ jarā̍ya jura̱tām a̍dābhyāḥ
English: wellknown ye maruts is that wondrous course of yours when they milked pṛśni's udder close akin to her  or when to shame the bard who lauded rudra's sons ye o infallible brought trita to decay

Sanskrit: tān vo̍ ma̱ho ma̱ruta̍ eva̱yāvno̱ viṣṇo̍r e̱ṣasya̍ prabhṛ̱the ha̍vāmahe   hira̍ṇyavarṇān kaku̱hān ya̱tasru̍co brahma̱ṇyanta̱ḥ śaṁsya̱ṁ rādha̍ īmahe
English: we call you such great maruts following wonted ways to the oblation paid to viṣṇu speederon  with ladles lifted up with prayer we seek of them preeminent goldenhued the wealth which all extol

Sanskrit: te daśa̍gvāḥ pratha̱mā ya̱jñam ū̍hire̱ te no̍ hinvantū̱ṣaso̱ vyu̍ṣṭiṣu   u̱ṣā na rā̱mīr a̍ru̱ṇair apo̍rṇute ma̱ho jyoti̍ṣā śuca̱tā goa̍rṇasā
English: they the daśagvas first of all brought sacrifice they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us  dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk

Sanskrit: te kṣo̱ṇībhi̍r aru̱ṇebhi̱r nāñjibhī̍ ru̱drā ṛ̱tasya̱ sada̍neṣu vāvṛdhuḥ   ni̱megha̍mānā̱ atye̍na̱ pāja̍sā suśca̱ndraṁ varṇa̍ṁ dadhire su̱peśa̍sam
English: the rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments  they with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue

Sanskrit: tām̐ i̍yā̱no mahi̱ varū̍tham ū̱taya̱ upa̱ ghed e̱nā nama̍sā gṛṇīmasi   tri̱to na yān pañca̱ hotṝ̍n a̱bhiṣṭa̍ya āva̱varta̱d ava̍rāñ ca̱kriyāva̍se
English: soliciting their high protection for our help with this our adoration we sing praise to them  whom for assistance like the five terrestrial priests trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car

Sanskrit: yayā̍ ra̱dhram pā̱raya̱thāty aṁho̱ yayā̍ ni̱do mu̱ñcatha̍ vandi̱tāra̍m   a̱rvācī̱ sā ma̍ruto̱ yā va̍ ū̱tir o ṣu vā̱śreva̍ suma̱tir ji̍gātu
English: so may your favouring help be turned to usward your kindness like a lowing cow approach us  wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning

Sanskrit: ā te̍ pitar marutāṁ su̱mnam e̍tu̱ mā na̱ḥ sūrya̍sya sa̱ṁdṛśo̍ yuyothāḥ   a̱bhi no̍ vī̱ro arva̍ti kṣameta̱ pra jā̍yemahi rudra pra̱jābhi̍ḥ
English: father of maruts let thy bliss approach us exclude us not from looking on the sunlight  gracious to our fleet courser be the hero may we transplant us rudra in our children

Sanskrit: tvāda̍ttebhī rudra̱ śaṁta̍mebhiḥ śa̱taṁ himā̍ aśīya bheṣa̱jebhi̍ḥ   vy a1̱̍smad dveṣo̍ vita̱raṁ vy aṁho̱ vy amī̍vāś cātayasvā̱ viṣū̍cīḥ
English: with the most saving medicines which thou givest rudra may i attain a hundred winters  far from us banish enmity and hatred and to all quarters maladies and trouble

Sanskrit: śreṣṭho̍ jā̱tasya̍ rudra śri̱yāsi̍ ta̱vasta̍mas ta̱vasā̍ṁ vajrabāho   parṣi̍ ṇaḥ pā̱ram aṁha̍saḥ sva̱sti viśvā̍ a̱bhī̍tī̱ rapa̍so yuyodhi
English: chief of all born art thou in glory rudra armed with the thunder mightiest of the mighty  transport us over trouble to wellbeing repel thou from us all assaults of mischief

Sanskrit: mā tvā̍ rudra cukrudhāmā̱ namo̍bhi̱r mā duṣṭu̍tī vṛṣabha̱ mā sahū̍tī   un no̍ vī̱rām̐ a̍rpaya bheṣa̱jebhi̍r bhi̱ṣakta̍maṁ tvā bhi̱ṣajā̍ṁ śṛṇomi
English: let us not anger thee with worship rudra ill praise strong god! or mingled invocation  do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes i hear thee famed as best of all physicians

Sanskrit: havī̍mabhi̱r hava̍te̱ yo ha̱virbhi̱r ava̱ stome̍bhī ru̱draṁ di̍ṣīya   ṛ̱dū̱dara̍ḥ su̱havo̱ mā no̍ a̱syai ba̱bhruḥ su̱śipro̍ rīradhan ma̱nāyai̍
English: may i with praisesongs win that rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations  neer may the tawny god fairchecked and gracious swifthearing yield us to this evil purpose

Sanskrit: un mā̍ mamanda vṛṣa̱bho ma̱rutvā̱n tvakṣī̍yasā̱ vaya̍sā̱ nādha̍mānam   ghṛṇī̍va cchā̱yām a̍ra̱pā a̍śī̱yā vi̍vāseyaṁ ru̱drasya̍ su̱mnam
English: the strong begirt by maruts hath refreshed me with most invigorating food imploring  as he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may i uninjured win the bliss of rudra

Sanskrit: kva1̱̍ sya te̍ rudra mṛḻa̱yāku̱r hasto̱ yo asti̍ bheṣa̱jo jalā̍ṣaḥ   a̱pa̱bha̱rtā rapa̍so̱ daivya̍syā̱bhī nu mā̍ vṛṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ
English: where is that gracious hand of thine o rudra the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort  remover of the woe that gods have sent us? o strong one look thou on me with compassion

Sanskrit: pra ba̱bhrave̍ vṛṣa̱bhāya̍ śvitī̱ce ma̱ho ma̱hīṁ su̍ṣṭu̱tim ī̍rayāmi   na̱ma̱syā ka̍lmalī̱kina̱ṁ namo̍bhir gṛṇī̱masi̍ tve̱ṣaṁ ru̱drasya̱ nāma̍
English: to him the strong great tawny faircomplexioned i utter forth a mighty hymn of praises  we serve the brilliant god with adorations we glorify the splendid name of rudra

Sanskrit: sthi̱rebhi̱r aṅgai̍ḥ puru̱rūpa̍ u̱gro ba̱bhruḥ śu̱krebhi̍ḥ pipiśe̱ hira̍ṇyaiḥ   īśā̍nād a̱sya bhuva̍nasya̱ bhūre̱r na vā u̍ yoṣad ru̱drād a̍su̱rya̍m
English: with firm limbs multiform the strong the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations  the strength of godhead neer departs from rudra him who is sovran of this world the mighty

Sanskrit: arha̍n bibharṣi̱ sāya̍kāni̱ dhanvārha̍n ni̱ṣkaṁ ya̍ja̱taṁ vi̱śvarū̍pam   arha̍nn i̱daṁ da̍yase̱ viśva̱m abhva̱ṁ na vā ojī̍yo rudra̱ tvad a̍sti
English: worthy thou carriest thy bow and arrows worthy thy manyhued and honoured necklace  worthy thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces a mightier than thou there is not rudra

Sanskrit: stu̱hi śru̱taṁ ga̍rta̱sada̱ṁ yuvā̍nam mṛ̱gaṁ na bhī̱mam u̍paha̱tnum u̱gram   mṛ̱ḻā ja̍ri̱tre ru̍dra̱ stavā̍no̱ 'nyaṁ te̍ a̱sman ni va̍pantu̱ senā̍ḥ
English: praise him the chariotborne the young the famous fierce slaying like a dread beast of the forest  o rudra praised be gracious to the singer let thy hosts spare us and smite down another

Sanskrit: ku̱mā̱raś ci̍t pi̱tara̱ṁ vanda̍māna̱m prati̍ nānāma rudropa̱yanta̍m   bhūre̍r dā̱tāra̱ṁ satpa̍tiṁ gṛṇīṣe stu̱tas tvam bhe̍ṣa̱jā rā̍sy a̱sme
English: i bend to thee as thou approachest rudra even as a boy before the sire who greets him  i praise thee bounteous giver lord of heroes give medicines to us as thou art lauded

Sanskrit: yā vo̍ bheṣa̱jā ma̍ruta̱ḥ śucī̍ni̱ yā śaṁta̍mā vṛṣaṇo̱ yā ma̍yo̱bhu   yāni̱ manu̱r avṛ̍ṇītā pi̱tā na̱s tā śaṁ ca̱ yoś ca̍ ru̱drasya̍ vaśmi
English: of your pure medicines o potent maruts those that are wholesomest and healthbestowing  those which our father manu hath selected i crave from rudra for our gain and welfare

Sanskrit: pari̍ ṇo he̱tī ru̱drasya̍ vṛjyā̱ḥ pari̍ tve̱ṣasya̍ durma̱tir ma̱hī gā̍t   ava̍ sthi̱rā ma̱ghava̍dbhyas tanuṣva̱ mīḍhva̍s to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya mṛḻa
English: may rudra's missile turn aside and spare us the great wrath of the impetuous one avoid us  turn bounteous god thy strong bow from our princes and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring

Sanskrit: e̱vā ba̍bhro vṛṣabha cekitāna̱ yathā̍ deva̱ na hṛ̍ṇī̱ṣe na haṁsi̍   ha̱va̱na̱śrun no̍ rudre̱ha bo̍dhi bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: o tawny bull thus showing forth thy nature as neither to be wroth o god nor slay us  here rudra listen to our invocation loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: a̱sya me̍ dyāvāpṛthivī ṛtāya̱to bhū̱tam a̍vi̱trī vaca̍sa̱ḥ siṣā̍sataḥ   yayo̱r āyu̍ḥ prata̱raṁ te i̱dam pu̱ra upa̍stute vasū̱yur vā̍m ma̱ho da̍dhe
English: graciously further o ye heaven and earth this speech striving to win reward of me your worshipper  first rank i give to you immortal high extolled! i fain to win me wealth to you the mighty pair

Sanskrit: mā no̱ guhyā̱ ripa̍ ā̱yor aha̍n dabha̱n mā na̍ ā̱bhyo rī̍radho du̱cchunā̍bhyaḥ   mā no̱ vi yau̍ḥ sa̱khyā vi̱ddhi tasya̍ naḥ sumnāya̱tā mana̍sā̱ tat tve̍mahe
English: let not man's guile annoy us secret or by day give not us up a prey to these calamities  sever not thou our friendship think thereon for us this with a heart that longs for bliss we seek from thee

Sanskrit: ahe̍ḻatā̱ mana̍sā śru̱ṣṭim ā va̍ha̱ duhā̍nāṁ dhe̱num pi̱pyuṣī̍m asa̱ścata̍m   padyā̍bhir ā̱śuṁ vaca̍sā ca vā̱jina̱ṁ tvāṁ hi̍nomi puruhūta vi̱śvahā̍
English: bring hither with benignant mind the willing cow teeming with plenteous milk full inexhaustible  o thou invoked by many day by day i urge thee with my word a charger rapid in his tread

Sanskrit: rā̱kām a̱haṁ su̱havā̍ṁ suṣṭu̱tī hu̍ve śṛ̱ṇotu̍ naḥ su̱bhagā̱ bodha̍tu̱ tmanā̍   sīvya̱tv apa̍ḥ sū̱cyācchi̍dyamānayā̱ dadā̍tu vī̱raṁ śa̱tadā̍yam u̱kthya̍m
English: with eulogy i call on rākā swift to hear may she auspicious hear us and herself observe  with neverbreaking needle may she sew her work and give a hero son most wealthy meet for praise

Sanskrit: yās te̍ rāke suma̱taya̍ḥ su̱peśa̍so̱ yābhi̱r dadā̍si dā̱śuṣe̱ vasū̍ni   tābhi̍r no a̱dya su̱manā̍ u̱pāga̍hi sahasrapo̱ṣaṁ su̍bhage̱ rarā̍ṇā
English: all thy kind thoughts o rākā lovely in their form wherewith thou grantest wealth to him who offers gifts  with these come thou to us this day benevolent o blessed one bestowing food of thousand sorts

Sanskrit: sinī̍vāli̱ pṛthu̍ṣṭuke̱ yā de̱vānā̱m asi̱ svasā̍   ju̱ṣasva̍ ha̱vyam āhu̍tam pra̱jāṁ de̍vi didiḍḍhi naḥ
English: o broadtressed sinīvālī thou who art the sister of the gods  accept the offered sacrifice and goddess grant us progeny

Sanskrit: yā su̍bā̱huḥ sva̍ṅgu̱riḥ su̱ṣūmā̍ bahu̱sūva̍rī   tasyai̍ vi̱śpatnyai̍ ha̱viḥ si̍nīvā̱lyai ju̍hotana
English: with lovely fingers lovely arms prolific mother of many sons  present the sacred gifts to her to sinīvālī queen of men

Sanskrit: yā gu̱ṅgūr yā si̍nīvā̱lī yā rā̱kā yā sara̍svatī   i̱ndrā̱ṇīm a̍hva ū̱taye̍ varuṇā̱nīṁ sva̱staye̍
English: her sinīvālī her gungū her rākā her sarasvatī indrāṇī to mine aid i call and varuṇānī for my weal

Sanskrit: a̱smāka̍m mitrāvaruṇāvata̱ṁ ratha̍m ādi̱tyai ru̱drair vasu̍bhiḥ sacā̱bhuvā̍   pra yad vayo̱ na papta̱n vasma̍na̱s pari̍ śrava̱syavo̱ hṛṣī̍vanto vana̱rṣada̍ḥ
English: help varuṇa and mitra o ye twain allied with vasus rudras and ādityas help our car  that as the wild birds of the forest from their home our horses may fly forth glad eager for renown

Sanskrit: adha̍ smā na̱ ud a̍vatā sajoṣaso̱ ratha̍ṁ devāso a̱bhi vi̱kṣu vā̍ja̱yum   yad ā̱śava̱ḥ padyā̍bhi̱s titra̍to̱ raja̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyāḥ sānau̱ jaṅgha̍nanta pā̱ṇibhi̍ḥ
English: yea now ye gods of one accord speed on our car what time among the folk it seeks an act of might;  when hasting through the region with the stamp of hoofs our swift steeds trample on the ridges of the earth

Sanskrit: u̱ta sya na̱ indro̍ vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇir di̱vaḥ śardhe̍na̱ māru̍tena su̱kratu̍ḥ   anu̱ nu sthā̍ty avṛ̱kābhi̍r ū̱tibhī̱ ratha̍m ma̱he sa̱naye̱ vāja̍sātaye
English: or may our indra here the friend of all mankind coming from heaven most wise girt by the marut host  accompany with aid untroubled by a foe our car to mighty gain to win the meed of strength

Sanskrit: u̱ta sya de̱vo bhuva̍nasya sa̱kṣaṇi̱s tvaṣṭā̱ gnābhi̍ḥ sa̱joṣā̍ jūjuva̱d ratha̍m   iḻā̱ bhago̍ bṛhaddi̱vota roda̍sī pū̱ṣā pura̍ṁdhir a̱śvinā̱v adhā̱ patī̍
English: or may this tvaṣṭar god who rules the world with power oneminded with the goddesses speed forth our car;  iḷā and bhaga the celestial earth and heaven pūṣan purandhi and the aśvins ruling lords

Sanskrit: u̱ta tye de̱vī su̱bhage̍ mithū̱dṛśo̱ṣāsā̱naktā̱ jaga̍tām apī̱juvā̍   stu̱ṣe yad vā̍m pṛthivi̱ navya̍sā̱ vaca̍ḥ sthā̱tuś ca̱ vaya̱s triva̍yā upa̱stire̍
English: or seen alternate those two blessed goddesses morning and night who stir all living things to act  while with my newest song i praise you both o earth that from what moves not ye may spread forth threefold food

Sanskrit: u̱ta va̱ḥ śaṁsa̍m u̱śijā̍m iva śma̱sy ahi̍r bu̱dhnyo̱3̱̍ 'ja eka̍pād u̱ta   tri̱ta ṛ̍bhu̱kṣāḥ sa̍vi̱tā cano̍ dadhe̱ 'pāṁ napā̍d āśu̱hemā̍ dhi̱yā śami̍
English: your blessing as a boon for suppliants we desire the dragon of the deep and ajaekapād  trita ṛbhukṣan savitar shall joy in us and the floods swift child in our worship and our prayer

Sanskrit: e̱tā vo̍ va̱śmy udya̍tā yajatrā̱ ata̍kṣann ā̱yavo̱ navya̍se̱ sam   śra̱va̱syavo̱ vāja̍ṁ cakā̱nāḥ sapti̱r na rathyo̱ aha̍ dhī̱tim a̍śyāḥ
English: these earnest prayers i pray to you ye holy to pay you honour living men have formed them  men fain to win the prize and glory may they win as a carhorse might the goal your notice

Sanskrit: ṛ̱taṁ de̱vāya̍ kṛṇva̱te sa̍vi̱tra indrā̍yāhi̱ghne na ra̍manta̱ āpa̍ḥ   aha̍rahar yāty a̱ktur a̱pāṁ kiyā̱ty ā pra̍tha̱maḥ sarga̍ āsām
English: the streams unceasing flow to indra slayer of ahi savitar god law's fulfiller  day after day goes on the sheen of waters what time hath past since they were first set flowing?

Sanskrit: yo vṛ̱trāya̱ sina̱m atrābha̍riṣya̱t pra taṁ jani̍trī vi̱duṣa̍ uvāca   pa̱tho rada̍ntī̱r anu̱ joṣa̍m asmai di̱vedi̍ve̱ dhuna̍yo ya̱nty artha̍m
English: his motherfor she knewspake and proclaimed him who was about to cast his bolt at vṛtra  cutting their paths according to his pleasure day after day flow to their goal the rivers

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvo hy asthā̱d adhy a̱ntari̱kṣe 'dhā̍ vṛ̱trāya̱ pra va̱dhaṁ ja̍bhāra   miha̱ṁ vasā̍na̱ upa̱ hīm adu̍drot ti̱gmāyu̍dho ajaya̱c chatru̱m indra̍ḥ
English: aloft he stood above the airy region and against vṛtra shot his deadly missile  enveloped in a cloud he rushed upon him indra subdued the foe with sharpened weapons

Sanskrit: bṛha̍spate̱ tapu̱ṣāśne̍va vidhya̱ vṛka̍dvaraso̱ asu̍rasya vī̱rān   yathā̍ ja̱ghantha̍ dhṛṣa̱tā pu̱rā ci̍d e̱vā ja̍hi̱ śatru̍m a̱smāka̍m indra
English: as with a bolt bṛhaspati fiercely flaming pierce thou vṛkadvaras the asura's heroes  even as in time of old with might thou slewest so slay even now our enemy o indra

Sanskrit: ava̍ kṣipa di̱vo aśmā̍nam u̱ccā yena̱ śatru̍m mandasā̱no ni̱jūrvā̍ḥ   to̱kasya̍ sā̱tau tana̍yasya̱ bhūre̍r a̱smām̐ a̱rdhaṁ kṛ̍ṇutād indra̱ gonā̍m
English: cast down from heaven on high thy bolt of thunder wherewith in joy thou smitest dead the foeman  for gain of children make us thine o indra of many children's children and of cattle

Sanskrit: pra hi kratu̍ṁ vṛ̱hatho̱ yaṁ va̍nu̱tho ra̱dhrasya̍ stho̱ yaja̍mānasya co̱dau   indrā̍somā yu̱vam a̱smām̐ a̍viṣṭam a̱smin bha̱yasthe̍ kṛṇutam u lo̱kam
English: whomso ye love his power ye aid and strengthen; ye twain are the rich worshipper's advancers  graciously favour us indra and soma; give us firm standing in this time of danger

Sanskrit: na mā̍ tama̱n na śra̍ma̱n nota ta̍ndra̱n na vo̍cāma̱ mā su̍no̱teti̱ soma̍m   yo me̍ pṛ̱ṇād yo dada̱d yo ni̱bodhā̱d yo mā̍ su̱nvanta̱m upa̱ gobhi̱r āya̍t
English: let it not vex me tire me make me slothful and never let us say press not the soma;  for him who cares for me gives gifts supports me who comes with kine to me who pour libations

Sanskrit: sara̍svati̱ tvam a̱smām̐ a̍viḍḍhi ma̱rutva̍tī dhṛṣa̱tī je̍ṣi̱ śatrū̍n   tyaṁ ci̱c chardha̍ntaṁ taviṣī̱yamā̍ṇa̱m indro̍ hanti vṛṣa̱bhaṁ śaṇḍi̍kānām
English: sarasvatī protect us with the maruts allied thou boldly conquerest our foemen  while indra does to death the daring chieftain of śaṇḍikas exulting in his prowess

Sanskrit: yo na̱ḥ sanu̍tya u̱ta vā̍ jigha̱tnur a̍bhi̱khyāya̱ taṁ ti̍gi̱tena̍ vidhya   bṛha̍spata̱ āyu̍dhair jeṣi̱ śatrū̍n dru̱he rīṣa̍nta̱m pari̍ dhehi rājan
English: him who waylays yea him who would destroy usaim at him pierce him with thy sharpened weapon  bṛhaspati with arms thou slayest foemen o king give up the spoiler to destruction

Sanskrit: a̱smāke̍bhi̱ḥ satva̍bhiḥ śūra̱ śūrai̍r vī̱ryā̍ kṛdhi̱ yāni̍ te̱ kartvā̍ni   jyog a̍bhūva̱nn anu̍dhūpitāso ha̱tvī teṣā̱m ā bha̍rā no̱ vasū̍ni
English: perform o hero with our valiant heroes the deeds heroic which thou hast to finish  long have they been inflated with presumption slay them and bring us hither their possessions

Sanskrit: taṁ va̱ḥ śardha̱m māru̍taṁ sumna̱yur gi̱ropa̍ bruve̱ nama̍sā̱ daivya̱ṁ jana̍m   yathā̍ ra̱yiṁ sarva̍vīra̱ṁ naśā̍mahā apatya̱sāca̱ṁ śrutya̍ṁ di̱vedi̍ve
English: i craving joy address with hymn and homage your heavenly host the company of maruts  that we may gain wealth with full store of heroes each day more famous and with troops of children

Sanskrit: dhṛta̍vratā̱ ādi̍tyā̱ iṣi̍rā ā̱re mat ka̍rta raha̱sūr i̱vāga̍ḥ   śṛ̱ṇva̱to vo̱ varu̍ṇa̱ mitra̱ devā̍ bha̱drasya̍ vi̱dvām̐ ava̍se huve vaḥ
English: upholders of the law ye strong ādityas remove my sin like her who bears in secret  you varuṇa mitra and all gods who listen i call to help me i who know your goodness

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ de̍vā̱ḥ prama̍tir yū̱yam ojo̍ yū̱yaṁ dveṣā̍ṁsi sanu̱tar yu̍yota   a̱bhi̱kṣa̱ttāro̍ a̱bhi ca̱ kṣama̍dhvam a̱dyā ca̍ no mṛ̱ḻaya̍tāpa̱raṁ ca̍
English: ye gods are providence and ye are power remove ye utterly all those who hate us  as givers of good things deal with us kindly this day be gracious to us and hereafter

Sanskrit: kim ū̱ nu va̍ḥ kṛṇavā̱māpa̍reṇa̱ kiṁ sane̍na vasava̱ āpye̍na   yū̱yaṁ no̍ mitrāvaruṇādite ca sva̱stim i̍ndrāmaruto dadhāta
English: what service may we do you with our future what service vasus with our ancient friendship?  o aditi and varuṇa and mitra indra and maruts make us well and happy

Sanskrit: ha̱ye de̍vā yū̱yam id ā̱paya̍ḥ stha̱ te mṛ̍ḻata̱ nādha̍mānāya̱ mahya̍m   mā vo̱ ratho̍ madhyama̱vāḻ ṛ̱te bhū̱n mā yu̱ṣmāva̍tsv ā̱piṣu̍ śramiṣma
English: ye o ye gods are verily our kinsmen as such be kind to me who now implore you  let not your car come slowly to our worship of kinsmen such as you neer let us weary

Sanskrit: pra va̱ eko̍ mimaya̱ bhūry āgo̱ yan mā̍ pi̱teva̍ kita̱vaṁ śa̍śā̱sa   ā̱re pāśā̍ ā̱re a̱ghāni̍ devā̱ mā mādhi̍ pu̱tre vim i̍va grabhīṣṭa
English: i singly have sinned many a sin against you and ye chastised me as a sire the gambler  far be your nets far gods be mine offences seize me not like a bird upon her offspring

Sanskrit: a̱rvāñco̍ a̱dyā bha̍vatā yajatrā̱ ā vo̱ hārdi̱ bhaya̍māno vyayeyam   trādhva̍ṁ no devā ni̱juro̱ vṛka̍sya̱ trādhva̍ṁ ka̱rtād a̍va̱pado̍ yajatrāḥ
English: turn yourselves hitherward this day ye holy that fearing in my heart i may approach you  protect us god; let not the wolf destroy us save us ye holy from the pit and falling

Sanskrit: māham ma̱ghono̍ varuṇa pri̱yasya̍ bhūri̱dāvna̱ ā vi̍da̱ṁ śūna̍m ā̱peḥ   mā rā̱yo rā̍jan su̱yamā̱d ava̍ sthām bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: may i not live o varuṇa to witness my wealthy liberal dear friend's destitution  king may i never lack wellordered riches loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: i̱daṁ ka̱ver ā̍di̱tyasya̍ sva̱rājo̱ viśvā̍ni̱ sānty a̱bhy a̍stu ma̱hnā   ati̱ yo ma̱ndro ya̱jathā̍ya de̱vaḥ su̍kī̱rtim bhi̍kṣe̱ varu̍ṇasya̱ bhūre̍ḥ
English: beg renown of varuṇa the mighty the god exceeding kind to him who worships

Sanskrit: tava̍ vra̱te su̱bhagā̍saḥ syāma svā̱dhyo̍ varuṇa tuṣṭu̱vāṁsa̍ḥ   u̱pāya̍na u̱ṣasā̱ṁ goma̍tīnām a̱gnayo̱ na jara̍māṇā̱ anu̱ dyūn
English: having extolled thee varuṇa with thoughtful care may we have high fortune in thy service  singing thy praises like the fires at coming day after day of mornings rich in cattle

Sanskrit: tava̍ syāma puru̱vīra̍sya̱ śarma̍nn uru̱śaṁsa̍sya varuṇa praṇetaḥ   yū̱yaṁ na̍ḥ putrā aditer adabdhā a̱bhi kṣa̍madhva̱ṁ yujyā̍ya devāḥ
English: may we be in thy keeping o thou leader wideruling varuṇa lord of many heroes  o sons of aditi for ever faithful pardon us gods admit us to your friendship

Sanskrit: pra sī̍m ādi̱tyo a̍sṛjad vidha̱rtām̐ ṛ̱taṁ sindha̍vo̱ varu̍ṇasya yanti   na śrā̍myanti̱ na vi mu̍canty e̱te vayo̱ na pa̍ptū raghu̱yā pari̍jman
English: he made them flow the āditya the sustainer the rivers run by varuṇa's commandment  these feel no weariness nor cease from flowing swift have they flown like birds in air around us

Sanskrit: vi mac chra̍thāya raśa̱nām i̱vāga̍ ṛ̱dhyāma̍ te varuṇa̱ khām ṛ̱tasya̍   mā tantu̍ś chedi̱ vaya̍to̱ dhiya̍m me̱ mā mātrā̍ śāry a̱pasa̍ḥ pu̱ra ṛ̱toḥ

English: o mighty varuṇa now and hereafter even as of old will we speak forth our worship  for in thyself invincible god thy statutes neer to be moved are fixed as on a mountain

English: may i not live o varuṇa to witness my wealthy liberal dear friend's destitution  king may i never lack wellordered riches loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

English: the righteous singer shall oercome his enemies and he who serves the gods subdue the godless man  the zealous man shall vanquish the invincible the worshipper share the food of him who worships not

English: these hymns that drop down fatness with the ladle i ever offer to the kings ādityas  may mitra aryaman and bhaga hear us the mighty varuṇa dakṣa and aṁśa

English: may i ādityas share m this your favour which aryaman brings profit een in danger  under your guidance varuṇa and mitra round troubles may i pass like rugged places

English: with his swift bow strung truly brahmaṇaspati reaches the mark whateer it be that he desires  excellent are the arrows wherewithal he shoots keeneyed to look on men and springing from his ear

Sanskrit: sa sa̍ṁna̱yaḥ sa vi̍na̱yaḥ pu̱rohi̍ta̱ḥ sa suṣṭu̍ta̱ḥ sa yu̱dhi brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̍ḥ   cā̱kṣmo yad vāja̱m bhara̍te ma̱tī dhanād it sūrya̍s tapati tapya̱tur vṛthā̍

English: thou who in every way supreme in earthly power rejoicing by thy mighty strength hast waxen great  he is the god spread forth in breadth against the gods he brahmaṇaspati encompasseth this all

English: from you twain maghavans all truth proceedeth even the waters break not your commandment  come to us brahmaṇaspati and indra to our oblation like yoked steeds to fodder

English: the sacrificial flames most swiftly hear the call the priest of the assembly gaineth wealth for hymns  hating the stern remitting at his will the debt strong in the shock of fight is brahmaṇaspati

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇa̱s pate̍r abhavad yathāva̱śaṁ sa̱tyo ma̱nyur mahi̱ karmā̍ kariṣya̱taḥ   yo gā u̱dāja̱t sa di̱ve vi cā̍bhajan ma̱hīva̍ rī̱tiḥ śava̍sāsara̱t pṛtha̍k
English: the wrath of brahmaṇaspati according to his will had full effect when he would do a mighty deed  the kine he drave forth and distributed to heaven even as a copious flood with strength flows sundry ways

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇas pate su̱yama̍sya vi̱śvahā̍ rā̱yaḥ syā̍ma ra̱thyo̱3̱̍ vaya̍svataḥ   vī̱reṣu̍ vī̱rām̐ upa̍ pṛṅdhi na̱s tvaṁ yad īśā̍no̱ brahma̍ṇā̱ veṣi̍ me̱ hava̍m
English: o brahmaṇaspati may we be evermore masters of wealth wellguided full of vital strength  heroes on heroes send abundantly to us when thou omnipotent through prayer seekest my call

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇas pate̱ tvam a̱sya ya̱ntā sū̱ktasya̍ bodhi̱ tana̍yaṁ ca jinva   viśva̱ṁ tad bha̱draṁ yad ava̍nti de̱vā bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: o brahmaṇaspati be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children  all that the gods regard with love is blessed loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: ga̱ṇānā̍ṁ tvā ga̱ṇapa̍tiṁ havāmahe ka̱viṁ ka̍vī̱nām u̍pa̱maśra̍vastamam   jye̱ṣṭha̱rāja̱m brahma̍ṇām brahmaṇas pata̱ ā na̍ḥ śṛ̱ṇvann ū̱tibhi̍ḥ sīda̱ sāda̍nam
English: we call thee lord and leader of the heavenly hosts the wise among the wise the famousest of all  the king supreme of prayers o brahmaṇaspati hear us with help; sit down in place of sacrifice

Sanskrit: de̱vāś ci̍t te asurya̱ prace̍taso̱ bṛha̍spate ya̱jñiya̍m bhā̱gam ā̍naśuḥ   u̱srā i̍va̱ sūryo̱ jyoti̍ṣā ma̱ho viśve̍ṣā̱m ij ja̍ni̱tā brahma̍ṇām asi
English: bṛhaspati god immortal! verily the gods have gained from thee the wise a share in holy rites  as with great light the sun brings forth the rays of morn so thou alone art father of all sacred prayer

Sanskrit: ā vi̱bādhyā̍ pari̱rāpa̱s tamā̍ṁsi ca̱ jyoti̍ṣmanta̱ṁ ratha̍m ṛ̱tasya̍ tiṣṭhasi   bṛha̍spate bhī̱mam a̍mitra̱dambha̍naṁ rakṣo̱haṇa̍ṁ gotra̱bhida̍ṁ sva̱rvida̍m
English: when thou hast chased away revilers and the gloom thou mountest the refulgent car of sacrifice;  the awful car bṛhaspati that quells the foe slays demons cleaves the stall of kine and finds the light

Sanskrit: su̱nī̱tibhi̍r nayasi̱ trāya̍se̱ jana̱ṁ yas tubhya̱ṁ dāśā̱n na tam aṁho̍ aśnavat   bra̱hma̱dviṣa̱s tapa̍no manyu̱mīr a̍si̱ bṛha̍spate̱ mahi̱ tat te̍ mahitva̱nam
English: thou leadest with good guidance and preservest men; distress oertakes not him who offers gifts to thee  him who hates prayer thou punishest bṛhaspati quelling his wrath herein is thy great mightiness

Sanskrit: na tam aṁho̱ na du̍ri̱taṁ kuta̍ś ca̱na nārā̍tayas titiru̱r na dva̍yā̱vina̍ḥ   viśvā̱ id a̍smād dhva̱raso̱ vi bā̍dhase̱ yaṁ su̍go̱pā rakṣa̍si brahmaṇas pate
English: no sorrow no distress from any side no foes no creatures doubletongued have overcome the man  thou drivest all seductive fiends away from him whom careful guard thou keepest brahmaṇaspati

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ go̱pāḥ pa̍thi̱kṛd vi̍cakṣa̱ṇas tava̍ vra̱tāya̍ ma̱tibhi̍r jarāmahe   bṛha̍spate̱ yo no̍ a̱bhi hvaro̍ da̱dhe svā tam ma̍rmartu du̱cchunā̱ hara̍svatī
English: thou art our keeper wise preparer of our paths we for thy service sing to thee with hymns of praise  bṛhaspati whoever lays a snare for us him may his evil fate precipitate destroy

Sanskrit: u̱ta vā̱ yo no̍ ma̱rcayā̱d anā̍gaso 'rātī̱vā marta̍ḥ sānu̱ko vṛka̍ḥ   bṛha̍spate̱ apa̱ taṁ va̍rtayā pa̱thaḥ su̱gaṁ no̍ a̱syai de̱vavī̍taye kṛdhi
English: him too who threatens us without offence of ours the evilminded arrogant rapacious man  him turn thou from our path away bṛhaspati give us fair access to this banquet of the gods

Sanskrit: trā̱tāra̍ṁ tvā ta̱nūnā̍ṁ havāma̱he 'va̍spartar adhiva̱ktāra̍m asma̱yum   bṛha̍spate deva̱nido̱ ni ba̍rhaya̱ mā du̱revā̱ utta̍raṁ su̱mnam un na̍śan
English: thee as protector of our bodies we invoke thee saviour as the comforter who loveth us  strike o bṛhaspati the gods revilers down and let not the unrighteous come to highest bliss

Sanskrit: tvayā̍ va̱yaṁ su̱vṛdhā̍ brahmaṇas pate spā̱rhā vasu̍ manu̱ṣyā da̍dīmahi   yā no̍ dū̱re ta̱ḻito̱ yā arā̍tayo̱ 'bhi santi̍ ja̱mbhayā̱ tā a̍na̱pnasa̍ḥ
English: through thee kind prosperer o brahmaṇaspati may we obtain the wealth of men which all desire  and all our enemies who near or far away prevail against us crush and leave them destitute

Sanskrit: tvayā̍ va̱yam u̍tta̱maṁ dhī̍mahe̱ vayo̱ bṛha̍spate̱ papri̍ṇā̱ sasni̍nā yu̱jā   mā no̍ du̱ḥśaṁso̍ abhidi̱psur ī̍śata̱ pra su̱śaṁsā̍ ma̱tibhi̍s tāriṣīmahi
English: with thee as our own rich and liberal ally may we bṛhaspati gain highest power of life  let not the guileful wicked man be lord of usstill may we prosper singing goodly hymns of praise

Sanskrit: a̱nā̱nu̱do vṛ̍ṣa̱bho jagmi̍r āha̱vaṁ niṣṭa̍ptā̱ śatru̱m pṛta̍nāsu sāsa̱hiḥ   asi̍ sa̱tya ṛ̍ṇa̱yā bra̍hmaṇas pata u̱grasya̍ cid dami̱tā vī̍ḻuha̱rṣiṇa̍ḥ
English: strong never yielding hastening to the battlecry consumer of the foe victorious in the strife  thou art sin's true avenger brahmaṇaspati who tamest een the fierce the wildly passionate

Sanskrit: ade̍vena̱ mana̍sā̱ yo ri̍ṣa̱ṇyati̍ śā̱sām u̱gro manya̍māno̱ jighā̍ṁsati   bṛha̍spate̱ mā praṇa̱k tasya̍ no va̱dho ni ka̍rma ma̱nyuṁ du̱reva̍sya̱ śardha̍taḥ
English: whoso with mind ungodly seeks to do us harm who deeming him a man of might mid lords would slay  let not his deadly blow reach us bṛhaspati; may we humiliate the strong illdoer's wrath

Sanskrit: bhare̍ṣu̱ havyo̱ nama̍sopa̱sadyo̱ gantā̱ vāje̍ṣu̱ sani̍tā̱ dhana̍ṁdhanam   viśvā̱ id a̱ryo a̍bhidi̱psvo̱3̱̍ mṛdho̱ bṛha̱spati̱r vi va̍varhā̱ rathā̍m̐ iva
English: the mover mid the spoil the winner of all wealth to be invoked in fight and reverently adored  bṛhaspati hath overthrown like cars of war all wicked enemies who fain would injure us

Sanskrit: teji̍ṣṭhayā tapa̱nī ra̱kṣasa̍s tapa̱ ye tvā̍ ni̱de da̍dhi̱re dṛ̱ṣṭavī̍ryam   ā̱vis tat kṛ̍ṣva̱ yad asa̍t ta u̱kthya1̱̍m bṛha̍spate̱ vi pa̍ri̱rāpo̍ ardaya
English: burn up the demons with thy fiercest flaming brand those who have scorned thee in thy manifested might  show forth that power that shall deserve the hymn of praise destroy the evil speakers o bṛhaspati

Sanskrit: bṛha̍spate̱ ati̱ yad a̱ryo arhā̍d dyu̱mad vi̱bhāti̱ kratu̍ma̱j jane̍ṣu   yad dī̱daya̱c chava̍sa ṛtaprajāta̱ tad a̱smāsu̱ dravi̍ṇaṁ dhehi ci̱tram
English: bṛhaspati that which the foe deserves not which shines among the folk effectual splendid  that son of law i which is with might refulgentthat treasure wonderful bestow thou on us

Sanskrit: mā na̍ḥ ste̱nebhyo̱ ye a̱bhi dru̱has pa̱de ni̍rā̱miṇo̍ ri̱pavo 'nne̍ṣu jāgṛ̱dhuḥ   ā de̱vānā̱m oha̍te̱ vi vrayo̍ hṛ̱di bṛha̍spate̱ na pa̱raḥ sāmno̍ viduḥ
English: give us not up to those who foes in ambuscade are greedy for the wealth of him who sits at ease  who cherish in their heart abandonment of gods bṛhaspati no further rest shall they obtain

Sanskrit: viśve̍bhyo̱ hi tvā̱ bhuva̍nebhya̱s pari̱ tvaṣṭāja̍na̱t sāmna̍ḥsāmnaḥ ka̱viḥ   sa ṛ̍ṇa̱cid ṛ̍ṇa̱yā brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̍r dru̱ho ha̱ntā ma̱ha ṛ̱tasya̍ dha̱rtari̍
English: for tvaṣṭar he who knows each sacred song brought thee to life preeminent oer all the things that be  guiltscourger guiltavenger is bṛhaspati who slays the spoiler and upholds the mighty law

Sanskrit: tava̍ śri̱ye vy a̍jihīta̱ parva̍to̱ gavā̍ṁ go̱tram u̱dasṛ̍jo̱ yad a̍ṅgiraḥ   indre̍ṇa yu̱jā tama̍sā̱ parī̍vṛta̱m bṛha̍spate̱ nir a̱pām au̍bjo arṇa̱vam
English: the mountain for thy glory cleft itself apart when aṅgiras! thou openedst the stall of kine  thou o bṛhaspati with indra for ally didst hurl down waterfloods which gloom had compassed round

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇas pate̱ tvam a̱sya ya̱ntā sū̱ktasya̍ bodhi̱ tana̍yaṁ ca jinva   viśva̱ṁ tad bha̱draṁ yad ava̍nti de̱vā bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: o brahmaṇaspati be thou controller of this our hymn and prosper thou our children  all that the gods regard with love is blessed loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: trika̍drukeṣu mahi̱ṣo yavā̍śiraṁ tuvi̱śuṣma̍s tṛ̱pat soma̍m apiba̱d viṣṇu̍nā su̱taṁ yathāva̍śat   sa ī̍m mamāda̱ mahi̱ karma̱ karta̍ve ma̱hām u̱ruṁ saina̍ṁ saścad de̱vo de̱vaṁ sa̱tyam indra̍ṁ sa̱tya indu̍ḥ
English: at the trikadrukas the great and strong hath drunk drink blent with meal with viṣṇu hath he quaffed the poured out soma juice all that he would  that hath so heightened him the great the wide to do his mighty work  so may the god attain the god true indu indra who is true

Sanskrit: adha̱ tviṣī̍mām̐ a̱bhy oja̍sā̱ krivi̍ṁ yu̱dhābha̍va̱d ā roda̍sī apṛṇad asya ma̱jmanā̱ pra vā̍vṛdhe   adha̍ttā̱nyaṁ ja̱ṭhare̱ prem a̍ricyata̱ saina̍ṁ saścad de̱vo de̱vaṁ sa̱tyam indra̍ṁ sa̱tya indu̍ḥ
English: so he resplendent in the battle overcame krivi by might he with his majesty hath filled the earth and heaven and waxen strong  one share of the libation hath he swallowed down one share he left  so may the god attend the god true indu indra who is true

Sanskrit: sā̱kaṁ jā̱taḥ kratu̍nā sā̱kam oja̍sā vavakṣitha sā̱kaṁ vṛ̱ddho vī̱ryai̍ḥ sāsa̱hir mṛdho̱ vica̍rṣaṇiḥ   dātā̱ rādha̍ḥ stuva̱te kāmya̱ṁ vasu̱ saina̍ṁ saścad de̱vo de̱vaṁ sa̱tyam indra̍ṁ sa̱tya indu̍ḥ
English: brought forth together with wisdom and mighty power thou grewest great; with hero deeds subduing the malevolent most swift in act;  giving prosperity and lovely wealth to him who praiseth thee so may the god attend the god true indu indra who is true

Sanskrit: tava̱ tyan narya̍ṁ nṛ̱to 'pa̍ indra pratha̱mam pū̱rvyaṁ di̱vi pra̱vācya̍ṁ kṛ̱tam   yad de̱vasya̱ śava̍sā̱ prāri̍ṇā̱ asu̍ṁ ri̱ṇann a̱paḥ   bhuva̱d viśva̍m a̱bhy āde̍va̱m oja̍sā vi̱dād ūrja̍ṁ śa̱takra̍tur vi̱dād iṣa̍m
English: this indra was thy hero deed dancer thy first and ancient work worthy to be told forth in heaven  what time thou sentest down life with a god's own power freeing the floods  all that is godless may he conquer with his might and lord of hundred powers find for us strength and food

Sanskrit: vi̱śva̱jite̍ dhana̱jite̍ sva̱rjite̍ satrā̱jite̍ nṛ̱jita̍ urvarā̱jite̍   a̱śva̱jite̍ go̱jite̍ a̱bjite̍ bha̱rendrā̍ya̱ soma̍ṁ yaja̱tāya̍ harya̱tam
English: to him the lord of all the lord of wealth of light; him who is lord for ever lord of men and tilth  him who is lord of horses lord of kine of floods to indra to the holy bring sweet soma juice

Sanskrit: a̱bhi̱bhuve̍ 'bhibha̱ṅgāya̍ vanva̱te 'ṣā̍ḻhāya̱ saha̍mānāya ve̱dhase̍   tu̱vi̱graye̱ vahna̍ye du̱ṣṭarī̍tave satrā̱sāhe̱ nama̱ indrā̍ya vocata
English: to him the potent one who conquers and breaks down the victor never vanquished who disposes all  the mightyvoiced the rider unassailable to indra everconquering speak your reverent prayer

Sanskrit: sa̱trā̱sā̱ho ja̍nabha̱kṣo ja̍naṁsa̱haś cyava̍no yu̱dhmo anu̱ joṣa̍m ukṣi̱taḥ   vṛ̱ta̱ṁca̱yaḥ sahu̍rir vi̱kṣv ā̍ri̱ta indra̍sya voca̱m pra kṛ̱tāni̍ vī̱ryā̍
English: still victor loved by mortals ruler over men oerthrower warrior he hath waxen as he would;  hostgatherer triumphant honoured mid the folk indra's heroic deeds will i tell forth to all

Sanskrit: a̱nā̱nu̱do vṛ̍ṣa̱bho dodha̍to va̱dho ga̍mbhī̱ra ṛ̱ṣvo asa̍maṣṭakāvyaḥ   ra̱dhra̱co̱daḥ śnatha̍no vīḻi̱tas pṛ̱thur indra̍ḥ suya̱jña u̱ṣasa̱ḥ sva̍r janat
English: the strong who never yields who slew the furious fiend the deep the vast of wisdom unattainable;  who speeds the good the breakerdown the firm the vastindra whose rites bring joy hath made the light of dawn

Sanskrit: ya̱jñena̍ gā̱tum a̱pturo̍ vividrire̱ dhiyo̍ hinvā̱nā u̱śijo̍ manī̱ṣiṇa̍ḥ   a̱bhi̱svarā̍ ni̱ṣadā̱ gā a̍va̱syava̱ indre̍ hinvā̱nā dravi̍ṇāny āśata
English: by sacrifice the yearning sages sending forth their songs found furtherance from him who speeds the flood  in indra seeking help with worship and with hymn they drew him to themselves and won them kine and wealth

Sanskrit: indra̱ śreṣṭhā̍ni̱ dravi̍ṇāni dhehi̱ citti̱ṁ dakṣa̍sya subhaga̱tvam a̱sme   poṣa̍ṁ rayī̱ṇām ari̍ṣṭiṁ ta̱nūnā̍ṁ svā̱dmāna̍ṁ vā̱caḥ su̍dina̱tvam ahnā̍m
English: indra bestow on us the best of treasures the spirit of ability and fortune;  increase of riches safety of our bodies charm of sweet speech and days of pleasant weather

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ te̱ vaya̍ indra vi̱ddhi ṣu ṇa̱ḥ pra bha̍rāmahe vāja̱yur na ratha̍m   vi̱pa̱nyavo̱ dīdhya̍to manī̱ṣā su̱mnam iya̍kṣanta̱s tvāva̍to̱ nṝn
English: as one brings forth his car when fain for combat so bring we power to theeregard us indra  well skilled in song thoughtful in spirit seeking great bliss from one like thee amid the heroes

Sanskrit: tvaṁ na̍ indra̱ tvābhi̍r ū̱tī tvā̍ya̱to a̍bhiṣṭi̱pāsi̱ janā̍n   tvam i̱no dā̱śuṣo̍ varū̱tetthādhī̍r a̱bhi yo nakṣa̍ti tvā
English: indra thou art our own with thy protection a guardian near to men who love thee truly  active art thou the liberal man's defender his who draws near to thee with right devotion

Sanskrit: sa no̱ yuvendro̍ jo̱hūtra̱ḥ sakhā̍ śi̱vo na̱rām a̍stu pā̱tā   yaḥ śaṁsa̍nta̱ṁ yaḥ śa̍śamā̱nam ū̱tī paca̍ntaṁ ca stu̱vanta̍ṁ ca pra̱ṇeṣa̍t
English: may indra called with solemn invocations the young the friend be men's auspicious keeper  one who will further with his aid the singer the toiler praiser dresser of oblations

Sanskrit: tam u̍ stuṣa̱ indra̱ṁ taṁ gṛ̍ṇīṣe̱ yasmi̍n pu̱rā vā̍vṛ̱dhuḥ śā̍śa̱duś ca̍   sa vasva̱ḥ kāma̍m pīparad iyā̱no bra̍hmaṇya̱to nūta̍nasyā̱yoḥ
English: with laud and song let me extol that indra in whom of old men prospered and were mighty  may he implored fulfil the prayer for plenty of him who worships of the living mortal

Sanskrit: so aṅgi̍rasām u̱cathā̍ juju̱ṣvān brahmā̍ tūto̱d indro̍ gā̱tum i̱ṣṇan   mu̱ṣṇann u̱ṣasa̱ḥ sūrye̍ṇa sta̱vān aśna̍sya cic chiśnathat pū̱rvyāṇi̍
English: he indra whom the aṅgirases' praise delighted strengthened their prayer and made their goings prosper  stealing away the mornings with the sunlight he lauded crushed even aśna's ancient powers

Sanskrit: sa ha̍ śru̱ta indro̱ nāma̍ de̱va ū̱rdhvo bhu̍va̱n manu̍ṣe da̱smata̍maḥ   ava̍ pri̱yam a̍rśasā̱nasya̍ sā̱hvāñ chiro̍ bharad dā̱sasya̍ sva̱dhāvā̍n
English: he verily the god the glorious indra hath raised him up for man best wonderworker  he selfreliant mighty and triumphant brought low the dear head of the wicked dāsa

Sanskrit: sa vṛ̍tra̱hendra̍ḥ kṛ̱ṣṇayo̍nīḥ puraṁda̱ro dāsī̍r airaya̱d vi   aja̍naya̱n mana̍ve̱ kṣām a̱paś ca̍ sa̱trā śaṁsa̱ṁ yaja̍mānasya tūtot
English: indra the vṛtraslayer fortdestroyer scattered the dāsa hosts who dwelt in darkness  for men hath he created earth and waters and ever helped the prayer of him who worships

Sanskrit: tasmai̍ tava̱sya1̱̍m anu̍ dāyi sa̱trendrā̍ya de̱vebhi̱r arṇa̍sātau   prati̱ yad a̍sya̱ vajra̍m bā̱hvor dhur ha̱tvī dasyū̱n pura̱ āya̍sī̱r ni tā̍rīt
English: to him in might the gods have ever yielded to indra in the tumult of the battle  when in his arms they laid the bolt he slaughtered the dasyus and cast down their forts of iron

Sanskrit: nū̱naṁ sā te̱ prati̱ vara̍ṁ jari̱tre du̍hī̱yad i̍ndra̱ dakṣi̍ṇā ma̱ghonī̍   śikṣā̍ sto̱tṛbhyo̱ māti̍ dha̱g bhago̍ no bṛ̱had va̍dema vi̱dathe̍ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: now may that wealthy cow of thine o indra give in return a boon to him who lauds thee  give to thy praisers let not fortune fail us loud may we speak with heroes in assembly

Sanskrit: apā̍yy a̱syāndha̍so̱ madā̍ya̱ manī̍ṣiṇaḥ suvā̱nasya̱ praya̍saḥ   yasmi̱nn indra̍ḥ pra̱divi̍ vāvṛdhā̱na oko̍ da̱dhe bra̍hma̱ṇyanta̍ś ca̱ nara̍ḥ
English: draughts of this sweet juice have been drunk for rapture of the wise somapresser's offered dainty  wherein grown mighty in the days aforetime indra hath found delight and men who worship

Sanskrit: a̱sya ma̍ndā̱no madhvo̱ vajra̍ha̱sto 'hi̱m indro̍ arṇo̱vṛta̱ṁ vi vṛ̍ścat   pra yad vayo̱ na svasa̍rā̱ṇy acchā̱ prayā̍ṁsi ca na̱dīnā̱ṁ cakra̍manta
English: cheered by this meath indra whose hand wields thunder rent piecemeal ahi who barred up the waters  so that the quickening currents of the rivers flowed forth like birds unto their restingplaces

Sanskrit: sa māhi̍na̱ indro̱ arṇo̍ a̱pām praira̍yad ahi̱hācchā̍ samu̱dram   aja̍naya̱t sūrya̍ṁ vi̱dad gā a̱ktunāhnā̍ṁ va̱yunā̍ni sādhat
English: indra this mighty one the dragon's slayer sent forth the flood of waters to the ocean  he gave the sun his life he found the cattle and with the night the works of days completed

Sanskrit: so a̍pra̱tīni̱ mana̍ve pu̱rūṇīndro̍ dāśad dā̱śuṣe̱ hanti̍ vṛ̱tram   sa̱dyo yo nṛbhyo̍ ata̱sāyyo̱ bhūt pa̍spṛdhā̱nebhya̱ḥ sūrya̍sya sā̱tau
English: to him who worshippeth hath indra given many and matchless gifts he slayeth vṛtra  straight was he to be sought with supplications by men who struggled to obtain the sunlight

Sanskrit: sa su̍nva̱ta indra̱ḥ sūrya̱m ā de̱vo ri̍ṇa̱ṅ martyā̍ya sta̱vān   ā yad ra̱yiṁ gu̱hada̍vadyam asmai̱ bhara̱d aṁśa̱ṁ naita̍śo daśa̱syan
English: to him who poured him gifts he gave up sūryaindra the god the mighty to the mortal;  for etaśa with worship brought him riches that keep distress afar as twere his portion
