Sanskrit: de̱vas tvaṣṭā̍ savi̱tā vi̱śvarū̍paḥ pu̱poṣa̍ pra̱jāḥ pu̍ru̱dhā ja̍jāna   i̱mā ca̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāny asya ma̱had de̱vānā̍m asura̱tvam eka̍m
English: tvaṣṭar the god the omniform creator begets and feeds mankind in various manner  his verily arc all these living creatures great is the gods supreme dominion

Sanskrit: ma̱hī sam ai̍rac ca̱mvā̍ samī̱cī u̱bhe te a̍sya̱ vasu̍nā̱ nyṛ̍ṣṭe   śṛ̱ṇve vī̱ro vi̱ndamā̍no̱ vasū̍ni ma̱had de̱vānā̍m asura̱tvam eka̍m
English: the two great meeting bowls hath he united each of the pair is laden with histreasure  the hero is renowned for gathering riches great is the gods supreme and sole dominion

Sanskrit: i̱māṁ ca̍ naḥ pṛthi̱vīṁ vi̱śvadhā̍yā̱ upa̍ kṣeti hi̱tami̍tro̱ na rājā̍   pu̱ra̱ḥsada̍ḥ śarma̱sado̱ na vī̱rā ma̱had de̱vānā̍m asura̱tvam eka̍m
English: yea and on this our earth the allsustainer dwells like a king with noble friends about him  in his protection heroes rest in safety great is the cods' supreme and sole dominion

Sanskrit: ni̱ṣṣidhva̍rīs ta̱ oṣa̍dhīr u̱tāpo̍ ra̱yiṁ ta̍ indra pṛthi̱vī bi̍bharti   sakhā̍yas te vāma̱bhāja̍ḥ syāma ma̱had de̱vānā̍m asura̱tvam eka̍m
English: rich in their gifts for thee are herbs and waters and earth brings all her wealth for thee o indra  may we as friends of thine share goodly treasures great is the gods supreme and sole dominion

Sanskrit: ma̱rutvā̍m̐ indra vṛṣa̱bho raṇā̍ya̱ pibā̱ soma̍m anuṣva̱dham madā̍ya   ā si̍ñcasva ja̱ṭhare̱ madhva̍ ū̱rmiṁ tvaṁ rājā̍si pra̱diva̍ḥ su̱tānā̍m
English: drink indra marutgirt as bull the soma for joy for rapture even as thou listest  pour down the flood of meath within thy belly thou from of old art king of soma juices

Sanskrit: sa̱joṣā̍ indra̱ saga̍ṇo ma̱rudbhi̱ḥ soma̍m piba vṛtra̱hā śū̍ra vi̱dvān   ja̱hi śatrū̱m̐r apa̱ mṛdho̍ nuda̱svāthābha̍yaṁ kṛṇuhi vi̱śvato̍ naḥ
English: indra accordant with the banded maruts drink soma hero as wise vṛtraslayer  slay thou our foemen drive away assailants and make us safe on every side from danger

Sanskrit: u̱ta ṛ̱tubhi̍r ṛtupāḥ pāhi̱ soma̱m indra̍ de̱vebhi̱ḥ sakhi̍bhiḥ su̱taṁ na̍ḥ   yām̐ ābha̍jo ma̱ruto̱ ye tvānv aha̍n vṛ̱tram ada̍dhu̱s tubhya̱m oja̍ḥ
English: and drinker at due seasons drink in season indra with friendly gods our pressedout soma  the maruts following whom thou madest sharers gave thee the victory and thou slewest vṛtra

Sanskrit: ye tvā̍hi̱hatye̍ maghava̱nn ava̍rdha̱n ye śā̍mba̱re ha̍rivo̱ ye gavi̍ṣṭau   ye tvā̍ nū̱nam a̍nu̱mada̍nti̱ viprā̱ḥ pibe̍ndra̱ soma̱ṁ saga̍ṇo ma̱rudbhi̍ḥ
English: drink soma indra banded with the maruts who maghavan strengthened thee at ahi's slaughter  'gainst śambara lord of bays! in winning cattle and now rejoice in thee the holy singers

Sanskrit: ma̱rutva̍ntaṁ vṛṣa̱bhaṁ vā̍vṛdhā̱nam aka̍vāriṁ di̱vyaṁ śā̱sam indra̍m   vi̱śvā̱sāha̱m ava̍se̱ nūta̍nāyo̱graṁ sa̍ho̱dām i̱ha taṁ hu̍vema
English: the bull whose strength hath waxed whom maruts follow freegiving indra the celestial ruler  mighty allconquering the victorygiver him let us call to grant us new protection

Sanskrit: indra̱ḥ svāhā̍ pibatu̱ yasya̱ soma̍ ā̱gatyā̱ tumro̍ vṛṣa̱bho ma̱rutvā̍n   oru̱vyacā̍ḥ pṛṇatām e̱bhir annai̱r āsya̍ ha̱vis ta̱nva1̱̍ḥ kāma̍m ṛdhyāḥ
English: let indra drink allhail! for his is somathe mighty bull come girt by maruts hither  farreaching let him fill him with these viands and let our offering sate his body's longing

Sanskrit: ā te̍ sapa̱ryū ja̱vase̍ yunajmi̱ yayo̱r anu̍ pra̱diva̍ḥ śru̱ṣṭim āva̍ḥ   i̱ha tvā̍ dheyu̱r hara̍yaḥ suśipra̱ pibā̱ tv a1̱̍sya suṣu̍tasya̱ cāro̍ḥ
English: i yoke thy pair of trusty steeds for swiftness whose faithful service from of old thou lovest  here fair of cheek! let thy bay coursers place thee drink of this lovely welleffused libation

Sanskrit: gobhi̍r mimi̱kṣuṁ da̍dhire supā̱ram indra̱ṁ jyaiṣṭhyā̍ya̱ dhāya̍se gṛṇā̱nāḥ   ma̱ndā̱naḥ soma̍m papi̱vām̐ ṛ̍jīṣi̱n sam a̱smabhya̍m puru̱dhā gā i̍ṣaṇya
English: with milk they made indra their good preserver lauding for help and rule the bounteous rainer  impetuous god when thou hast drunk the soma enraptured send us cattle in abundance

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ kāma̍m mandayā̱ gobhi̱r aśvai̍ś ca̱ndrava̍tā̱ rādha̍sā pa̱pratha̍ś ca   sva̱ryavo̍ ma̱tibhi̱s tubhya̱ṁ viprā̱ indrā̍ya̱ vāha̍ḥ kuśi̱kāso̍ akran
English: with kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty still extend it  seeking the light with hymns to thee o indra the kuśikas have brought their gift the singers

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: i̱mam ma̱he vi̍da̱thyā̍ya śū̱ṣaṁ śaśva̱t kṛtva̱ īḍyā̍ya̱ pra ja̍bhruḥ   śṛ̱ṇotu̍ no̱ damye̍bhi̱r anī̍kaiḥ śṛ̱ṇotv a̱gnir di̱vyair aja̍sraḥ
English: to him adorable mighty meet for synods this strengthening hymn unceasing have they offered  may agni hear us with his homely splendours hear us eternal one with heavenly lustre

Sanskrit: mahi̍ ma̱he di̱ve a̍rcā pṛthi̱vyai kāmo̍ ma i̱cchañ ca̍rati prajā̱nan   yayo̍r ha̱ stome̍ vi̱dathe̍ṣu de̱vāḥ sa̍pa̱ryavo̍ mā̱daya̍nte̱ sacā̱yoḥ
English: to mighty heaven and earth i sing forth loudly my wish goes out desirous and well knowing  both at whose laud in synods showing favour the gods rejoice them with the living mortal

Sanskrit: yu̱vor ṛ̱taṁ ro̍dasī sa̱tyam a̍stu ma̱he ṣu ṇa̍ḥ suvi̱tāya̱ pra bhū̍tam   i̱daṁ di̱ve namo̍ agne pṛthi̱vyai sa̍pa̱ryāmi̱ praya̍sā̱ yāmi̱ ratna̍m
English: o heaven and earth may your great law he faithful he ye our leaders for our high advantage  to heaven and earth i offer this my homage with food o agni as i pray for riches

Sanskrit: u̱to hi vā̍m pū̱rvyā ā̍vivi̱dra ṛtā̍varī rodasī satya̱vāca̍ḥ   nara̍ś cid vāṁ sami̱the śūra̍sātau vavandi̱re pṛ̍thivi̱ vevi̍dānāḥ
English: yea holy heaven and earth the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you;  and brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer o earth have known you well and paid you honour

Sanskrit: ko a̱ddhā ve̍da̱ ka i̱ha pra vo̍cad de̱vām̐ acchā̍ pa̱thyā̱3̱̍ kā sam e̍ti   dadṛ̍śra eṣām ava̱mā sadā̍ṁsi̱ pare̍ṣu̱ yā guhye̍ṣu vra̱teṣu̍
English: what pathway leadeth to the gods? who knoweth this of a truth and who will now declare it?  seen are their lowest dwellingplaces only but they are in remote and secret regions

Sanskrit: ka̱vir nṛ̱cakṣā̍ a̱bhi ṣī̍m acaṣṭa ṛ̱tasya̱ yonā̱ vighṛ̍te̱ mada̍ntī   nānā̍ cakrāte̱ sada̍na̱ṁ yathā̱ veḥ sa̍mā̱nena̱ kratu̍nā saṁvidā̱ne
English: the sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed rejoicing in the seat of order  they make a home as for a bird though parted with one same will finding themselves together

Sanskrit: sa̱mā̱nyā viyu̍te dū̱rea̍nte dhru̱ve pa̱de ta̍sthatur jāga̱rūke̍   u̱ta svasā̍rā yuva̱tī bhava̍ntī̱ ād u̍ bruvāte mithu̱nāni̱ nāma̍
English: partners though parted with fardistant limits on one firm place both stand for ever watchful  and being young for evermore as sisters speak to each other names that are united

Sanskrit: viśved e̱te jani̍mā̱ saṁ vi̍vikto ma̱ho de̱vān bibhra̍tī̱ na vya̍thete   eja̍d dhru̱vam pa̍tyate̱ viśva̱m eka̱ṁ cara̍t pata̱tri viṣu̍ṇa̱ṁ vi jā̱tam
English: all living things they part and keep asunder; though bearing up the mighty gods they reel not  one all is lord of what is fixed and moving that walks that flies this multiform creation

Sanskrit: sanā̍ purā̱ṇam adhy e̍my ā̱rān ma̱haḥ pi̱tur ja̍ni̱tur jā̱mi tan na̍ḥ   de̱vāso̱ yatra̍ pani̱tāra̱ evai̍r u̱rau pa̱thi vyu̍te ta̱sthur a̱ntaḥ
English: afar the ancient from of old i ponder our kinship with our mighty sire and father  singing the praise whereof the gods by custom stand on the spacious farextended pathway

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ stoma̍ṁ rodasī̱ pra bra̍vīmy ṛdū̱darā̍ḥ śṛṇavann agniji̱hvāḥ   mi̱traḥ sa̱mrājo̱ varu̍ṇo̱ yuvā̍na ādi̱tyāsa̍ḥ ka̱vaya̍ḥ paprathā̱nāḥ
English: this laud o heaven and earth to you i utter let the kindhearted hear whose tongue is agni  young sovran rulers varuṇa and mitra the wise and very glorious ādityas

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyapāṇiḥ savi̱tā su̍ji̱hvas trir ā di̱vo vi̱dathe̱ patya̍mānaḥ   de̱veṣu̍ ca savita̱ḥ śloka̱m aśre̱r ād a̱smabhya̱m ā su̍va sa̱rvatā̍tim
English: the fairtongued savitar the goldenhanded comes thrice from heaven as lord in our assembly  bear to the gods this song of praise and send us then savitar complete and perfect safety

Sanskrit: su̱kṛt su̍pā̱ṇiḥ svavā̍m̐ ṛ̱tāvā̍ de̱vas tvaṣṭāva̍se̱ tāni̍ no dhāt   pū̱ṣa̱ṇvanta̍ ṛbhavo mādayadhvam ū̱rdhvagrā̍vāṇo adhva̱ram a̍taṣṭa
English: deft worker skifulhanded helpful holy may tvaṣṭar god give us these things to aid us  take your delight ye ṛbhus joined with pūṣan ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted

Sanskrit: vi̱dyudra̍thā ma̱ruta̍ ṛṣṭi̱manto̍ di̱vo maryā̍ ṛ̱tajā̍tā a̱yāsa̍ḥ   sara̍svatī śṛṇavan ya̱jñiyā̍so̱ dhātā̍ ra̱yiṁ sa̱havī̍raṁ turāsaḥ
English: borne on their flashing car the speararmed maruts the nimble youths of heaven the sons of order  the holy and sarasvatī shall hear us ye mighty give us wealth with noble offspring

Sanskrit: viṣṇu̱ṁ stomā̍saḥ puruda̱smam a̱rkā bhaga̍syeva kā̱riṇo̱ yāma̍ni gman   u̱ru̱kra̱maḥ ka̍ku̱ho yasya̍ pū̱rvīr na ma̍rdhanti yuva̱tayo̱ jani̍trīḥ
English: to viṣṇu rich in marvels songs and praises shall go as singers on the road of bhaga  the chieftain of the mighty stride whose mothers the many young dames never disregard him

Sanskrit: indro̱ viśvai̍r vī̱ryai̱3̱̍ḥ patya̍māna u̱bhe ā pa̍prau̱ roda̍sī mahi̱tvā   pu̱ra̱ṁda̱ro vṛ̍tra̱hā dhṛ̱ṣṇuṣe̍ṇaḥ sa̱ṁgṛbhyā̍ na̱ ā bha̍rā̱ bhūri̍ pa̱śvaḥ
English: indra who rules through all his powers heroic hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven  lord of brave hosts fortcrusher vṛtraslayer gather thou up and bring us store of cattle

Sanskrit: nāsa̍tyā me pi̱tarā̍ bandhu̱pṛcchā̍ sajā̱tya̍m a̱śvino̱ś cāru̱ nāma̍   yu̱vaṁ hi stho ra̍yi̱dau no̍ rayī̱ṇāṁ dā̱traṁ ra̍kṣethe̱ aka̍vai̱r ada̍bdhā
English: my sires are the nāsatyas kind tokinsmen the aśvins' kinship is a glorious title  for ye are they who give us store of riches ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous

Sanskrit: ma̱hat tad va̍ḥ kavaya̱ś cāru̱ nāma̱ yad dha̍ devā̱ bhava̍tha̱ viśva̱ indre̍   sakha̍ ṛ̱bhubhi̍ḥ puruhūta pri̱yebhi̍r i̱māṁ dhiya̍ṁ sā̱taye̍ takṣatā naḥ
English: this is ye wise your great and glorious title that all ye deities abide in indra  friend muchinvoked! art thou with thy dear ṛbhus fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage

Sanskrit: a̱rya̱mā ṇo̱ adi̍tir ya̱jñiyā̱so 'da̍bdhāni̱ varu̍ṇasya vra̱tāni̍   yu̱yota̍ no anapa̱tyāni̱ ganto̍ḥ pra̱jāvā̍n naḥ paśu̱mām̐ a̍stu gā̱tuḥ
English: aryaman aditi deserve our worship the laws of varuṇa remain unbroken  the lot of childlessness remove ye from us and let our course be rich in kine and offspring

Sanskrit: de̱vānā̍ṁ dū̱taḥ pu̍ru̱dha prasū̱to 'nā̍gān no vocatu sa̱rvatā̍tā   śṛ̱ṇotu̍ naḥ pṛthi̱vī dyaur u̱tāpa̱ḥ sūryo̱ nakṣa̍trair u̱rv a1̱̍ntari̍kṣam
English: may the gods envoy sent to many a quarter proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety  may earth and heaven the sun the waters hear us and the wide firmament and constellations

Sanskrit: śṛ̱ṇvantu̍ no̱ vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ḥ parva̍tāso dhru̱vakṣe̍māsa̱ iḻa̍yā̱ mada̍ntaḥ   ā̱di̱tyair no̱ adi̍tiḥ śṛṇotu̱ yaccha̍ntu no ma̱ruta̱ḥ śarma̍ bha̱dram
English: hear us the mouatains which distil the raindrops and resting firm rejoice in freshening moisture  may aditi with the ādityas hear us and maruts grant us their auspicious shelter

Sanskrit: sadā̍ su̱gaḥ pi̍tu̱mām̐ a̍stu̱ panthā̱ madhvā̍ devā̱ oṣa̍dhī̱ḥ sam pi̍pṛkta   bhago̍ me agne sa̱khye na mṛ̍dhyā̱ ud rā̱yo a̍śyā̱ṁ sada̍nam puru̱kṣoḥ
English: soft be our path for ever wellprovisioned with pleasant meath o gods the herbs besprinkle  safe be my bliss o agni in thy friendship may i attain the seat of foodful riches

Sanskrit: svada̍sva ha̱vyā sam iṣo̍ didīhy asma̱drya1̱̍k sam mi̍mīhi̱ śravā̍ṁsi   viśvā̍m̐ agne pṛ̱tsu tāñ je̍ṣi̱ śatrū̱n ahā̱ viśvā̍ su̱manā̍ dīdihī naḥ
English: enjoy the offering beam thou strength upon us; combine thou for our good all kinds of glory  conquer in battle agni all those foemen and light us every day with loving kindness

Sanskrit: dhā̱nāva̍ntaṁ kara̱mbhiṇa̍m apū̱pava̍ntam u̱kthina̍m   indra̍ prā̱tar ju̍ṣasva naḥ
English: indra accept at break of day our soma mixt with roasted corn  with groats with cake with eulogies

Sanskrit: pu̱ro̱ḻāśa̍m paca̱tya̍ṁ ju̱ṣasve̱ndrā gu̍rasva ca   tubhya̍ṁ ha̱vyāni̍ sisrate
English: accept o indra and enjoy the welldressed sacrificial cake oblations are poured forth to thee

Sanskrit: pu̱ro̱ḻāśa̍ṁ ca no̱ ghaso̍ jo̱ṣayā̍se̱ gira̍ś ca naḥ   va̱dhū̱yur i̍va̱ yoṣa̍ṇām
English: consume our sacrificial cake accept the songs of praise we sing  as he who woes accepts his bride

Sanskrit: pu̱ro̱ḻāśa̍ṁ sanaśruta prātaḥsā̱ve ju̍ṣasva naḥ   indra̱ kratu̱r hi te̍ bṛ̱han
English: famed from of old accept the cake at our libation poured at dawn  forgreat o indra is thy power

Sanskrit: mādhya̍ṁdinasya̱ sava̍nasya dhā̱nāḥ pu̍ro̱ḻāśa̍m indra kṛṣve̱ha cāru̍m   pra yat sto̱tā ja̍ri̱tā tūrṇya̍rtho vṛṣā̱yamā̍ṇa̱ upa̍ gī̱rbhir īṭṭe̍
English: let roasted corn of our midday libation and sacrificial cake here please thee indra  what time the lauding singer keen of purpose and eager as a bull with hymns implores thee

Sanskrit: tṛ̱tīye̍ dhā̱nāḥ sava̍ne puruṣṭuta puro̱ḻāśa̱m āhu̍tam māmahasva naḥ   ṛ̱bhu̱manta̱ṁ vāja̍vantaṁ tvā kave̱ praya̍svanta̱ upa̍ śikṣema dhī̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: at the third sacrifice o thou whom many praise give glory to the roasted corn and holy cake  with offered viands and with songs may we assist thee sage whom vāja and the ṛbhus wait upon

Sanskrit: pū̱ṣa̱ṇvate̍ te cakṛmā kara̱mbhaṁ hari̍vate̱ harya̍śvāya dhā̱nāḥ   a̱pū̱pam a̍ddhi̱ saga̍ṇo ma̱rudbhi̱ḥ soma̍m piba vṛtra̱hā śū̍ra vi̱dvān
English: the groats have we prepared for thee with pūṣan corn for thee lord of bay steeds with thy horses  eat thou the mealcake banded with the maruts wise hero vṛtraslayer drink the soma

Sanskrit: prati̍ dhā̱nā bha̍rata̱ tūya̍m asmai puro̱ḻāśa̍ṁ vī̱rata̍māya nṛ̱ṇām   di̱vedi̍ve sa̱dṛśī̍r indra̱ tubhya̱ṁ vardha̍ntu tvā soma̱peyā̍ya dhṛṣṇo
English: bring forth the roasted corn to meet him quickly cake for the bravest hero mid the heroes  indra may hymns accordant with thee daily strengthen thee bold one for the draught of soma

Sanskrit: indrā̍parvatā bṛha̱tā rathe̍na vā̱mīr iṣa̱ ā va̍hataṁ su̱vīrā̍ḥ   vī̱taṁ ha̱vyāny a̍dhva̱reṣu̍ devā̱ vardhe̍thāṁ gī̱rbhir iḻa̍yā̱ mada̍ntā
English: on a high car o parvata and indra bring pleasant viands with brave heroes hither  enjoy the gifts gods at our sacrifices wax strong by hymns rejoice in our oblation

Sanskrit: tiṣṭhā̱ su ka̍m maghava̱n mā parā̍ gā̱ḥ soma̍sya̱ nu tvā̱ suṣu̍tasya yakṣi   pi̱tur na pu̱traḥ sica̱m ā ra̍bhe ta̱ indra̱ svādi̍ṣṭhayā gi̱rā śa̍cīvaḥ
English: stay still o maghavan advance no farther a draught of wellpressed soma will i give thee  with sweetest song i grasp o mighty indra thy garment's hem as a child grasps his father's

Sanskrit: śaṁsā̍vādhvaryo̱ prati̍ me gṛṇī̱hīndrā̍ya̱ vāha̍ḥ kṛṇavāva̱ juṣṭa̍m   edam ba̱rhir yaja̍mānasya sī̱dāthā̍ ca bhūd u̱ktham indrā̍ya śa̱stam
English: adhvaryu sing we both; sing thou in answer make we a laud acceptable to indra  upon this sacrificer's grass he seated to indra shall our eulogy be uttered

Sanskrit: jā̱yed asta̍m maghava̱n sed u̱ yoni̱s tad it tvā̍ yu̱ktā hara̍yo vahantu   ya̱dā ka̱dā ca̍ su̱navā̍ma̱ soma̍m a̱gniṣ ṭvā̍ dū̱to dha̍nvā̱ty accha̍
English: a wife o maghavan is home and dwelling so let thy bay steeds yoked convey thee hither  whenever we press out for thee the soma let agni as our herald speed to call thee

Sanskrit: parā̍ yāhi maghava̱nn ā ca̍ yā̱hīndra̍ bhrātar ubha̱yatrā̍ te̱ artha̍m   yatrā̱ ratha̍sya bṛha̱to ni̱dhāna̍ṁ vi̱moca̍naṁ vā̱jino̱ rāsa̍bhasya
English: depart o maghavan;again come hither both there and here thy goat is indra brother  where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in and where thqu loosest thy loudneighing courser

Sanskrit: apā̱ḥ soma̱m asta̍m indra̱ pra yā̍hi kalyā̱ṇīr jā̱yā su̱raṇa̍ṁ gṛ̱he te̍   yatrā̱ ratha̍sya bṛha̱to ni̱dhāna̍ṁ vi̱moca̍naṁ vā̱jino̱ dakṣi̍ṇāvat
English: thou hast drunk soma indra turn thee homeward; thy joy is in thy home thy racious consort;  where thy tall chariot hath a place to rest in and thy strong courser is set free with guerdon

Sanskrit: i̱me bho̱jā aṅgi̍raso̱ virū̍pā di̱vas pu̱trāso̱ asu̍rasya vī̱rāḥ   vi̱śvāmi̍trāya̱ dada̍to ma̱ghāni̍ sahasrasā̱ve pra ti̍ranta̱ āyu̍ḥ
English: bounteous are these aṅgirases virupas the asura's heroes and the sons of heaven  they giving store of wealth to viśvāmitra prolong his life through countless somapressings

Sanskrit: rū̱paṁrū̍pam ma̱ghavā̍ bobhavīti mā̱yāḥ kṛ̍ṇvā̱nas ta̱nva1̱̍m pari̱ svām   trir yad di̱vaḥ pari̍ muhū̱rtam āgā̱t svair mantrai̱r anṛ̍tupā ṛ̱tāvā̍
English: maghavan weareth every shape at pleasure effecting magic changes in his body  holy one drinker out of season coming thrice in a moment through fit prayers from heaven

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ ṛṣi̍r deva̱jā de̱vajū̱to 'sta̍bhnā̱t sindhu̍m arṇa̱vaṁ nṛ̱cakṣā̍ḥ   vi̱śvāmi̍tro̱ yad ava̍hat su̱dāsa̱m apri̍yāyata kuśi̱kebhi̱r indra̍ḥ
English: the mighty sage godborn and godincited who looks on men restrained the billowy river  when viśvāmitra was sudās's escort then indra through the kuśikas grew friendly

Sanskrit: ha̱ṁsā i̍va kṛṇutha̱ śloka̱m adri̍bhi̱r mada̍nto gī̱rbhir a̍dhva̱re su̱te sacā̍   de̱vebhi̍r viprā ṛṣayo nṛcakṣaso̱ vi pi̍badhvaṁ kuśikāḥ so̱myam madhu̍
English: like swans prepare a song of praise with pressingstones glad in your hymns with juice poured forth in sacrifice  ye singers with the gods sages who look on men ye kutikas drink up the soma's savoury meath

English: come forward kuśikas and be attentive; let loose sudās's horse to win him riches  east west and north let the king slay the foeman then at earth's choicest place perform his worship

Sanskrit: ya i̱me roda̍sī u̱bhe a̱ham indra̱m atu̍ṣṭavam   vi̱śvāmi̍trasya rakṣati̱ brahme̱dam bhāra̍ta̱ṁ jana̍m
English: praises to indra have i sung sustainer of this earth and heaven this prayer of viśvāmitra keeps secure the race of bharatas

Sanskrit: vi̱śvāmi̍trā arāsata̱ brahmendrā̍ya va̱jriṇe̍   kara̱d in na̍ḥ su̱rādha̍saḥ
English: the viśvāmitras have sung forth this prayer to indra thunderaimed  so let him make us prosperous

Sanskrit: kiṁ te̍ kṛṇvanti̱ kīka̍ṭeṣu̱ gāvo̱ nāśira̍ṁ du̱hre na ta̍panti gha̱rmam   ā no̍ bhara̱ prama̍gandasya̱ vedo̍ naicāśā̱kham ma̍ghavan randhayā naḥ
English: among the kikatas what do thy cattle? they pour no milky draught they heat no caldron  bring thou to us the wealth of pramaganda;give up to us o maghavan the lowborn

Sanskrit: sa̱sa̱rpa̱rīr ama̍ti̱m bādha̍mānā bṛ̱han mi̍māya ja̱mada̍gnidattā   ā sūrya̍sya duhi̱tā ta̍tāna̱ śravo̍ de̱veṣv a̱mṛta̍m aju̱ryam
English: sasarpari the gift of jamadagnis hath lowed with mighty voice dispelling famine  the daughter of the sun hath spread our glory among the gods imperishable deathless

Sanskrit: sa̱sa̱rpa̱rīr a̍bhara̱t tūya̍m e̱bhyo 'dhi̱ śrava̱ḥ pāñca̍janyāsu kṛ̱ṣṭiṣu̍   sā pa̱kṣyā̱3̱̍ navya̱m āyu̱r dadhā̍nā̱ yām me̍ palastijamada̱gnayo̍ da̱duḥ
English: sasarpari brought glory speedily to these over the generations of the fivefold race;  daughter of paksa she bestows new vital power she whom the ancient jamadagnis gave to me

Sanskrit: sthi̱rau gāvau̍ bhavatāṁ vī̱ḻur akṣo̱ meṣā vi va̍rhi̱ mā yu̱gaṁ vi śā̍ri   indra̍ḥ pāta̱lye̍ dadatā̱ṁ śarī̍to̱r ari̍ṣṭaneme a̱bhi na̍ḥ sacasva
English: strong be the pair of oxen firm the axles let not the pole slip nor the yoke be broken  may indra keep the yokepins from decaying attend us thou whose fellies are uninjured

Sanskrit: bala̍ṁ dhehi ta̱nūṣu̍ no̱ bala̍m indrāna̱ḻutsu̍ naḥ   bala̍ṁ to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya jī̱vase̱ tvaṁ hi ba̍la̱dā asi̍
English: o indra give our bodies strength strength to the bulls who draw the wains  strength to our seed and progeny that they may live for thou art he who giveth strength

Sanskrit: a̱bhi vya̍yasva khadi̱rasya̱ sāra̱m ojo̍ dhehi spanda̱ne śi̱ṁśapā̍yām   akṣa̍ vīḻo vīḻita vī̱ḻaya̍sva̱ mā yāmā̍d a̱smād ava̍ jīhipo naḥ
English: enclose thee in the heart of khayar timber in the car wrought of sinsapa put firmness  show thyself strong o axle fixed and strengthened throw us not from the car whereon we travel

Sanskrit: a̱yam a̱smān vana̱spati̱r mā ca̱ hā mā ca̍ rīriṣat   sva̱sty ā gṛ̱hebhya̱ āva̱sā ā vi̱moca̍nāt
English: let not this sovran of the wood leave us forlorn or injure us  safe may we be until we reach our homes and rest us and unyoke

Sanskrit: indro̱tibhi̍r bahu̱lābhi̍r no a̱dya yā̍cchre̱ṣṭhābhi̍r maghavañ chūra jinva   yo no̱ dveṣṭy adha̍ra̱ḥ sas pa̍dīṣṭa̱ yam u̍ dvi̱ṣmas tam u̍ prā̱ṇo ja̍hātu
English: with various aids this day come to us indra with best aids speed us maghavan thou hero  let him who hatcth us fall headlong downward him whom we hate let vital breath abandon

Sanskrit: pa̱ra̱śuṁ ci̱d vi ta̍pati śimba̱laṁ ci̱d vi vṛ̍ścati   u̱khā ci̍d indra̱ yeṣa̍ntī̱ praya̍stā̱ phena̍m asyati
English: he heats his very axe and then cuts a mere semal blossom off  o indra like a caldron cracked and seething so he pours out foam

English: men notice not the arrow o ye people; they bring the red beast deeming it a bullock  a sluggish steed men run not with the courser nor ever lead an ass before a charger

Sanskrit: i̱ma i̍ndra bhara̱tasya̍ pu̱trā a̍papi̱tvaṁ ci̍kitu̱r na pra̍pi̱tvam   hi̱nvanty aśva̱m ara̍ṇa̱ṁ na nitya̱ṁ jyā̍vāja̱m pari̍ ṇayanty ā̱jau
English: these men the sons of bhārata o indra regard not severance or close connexion  they urge their own steed as it were another's and take him swift as the bow's string to battle

Sanskrit: śaṁsā̍ ma̱hām indra̱ṁ yasmi̱n viśvā̱ ā kṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ soma̱pāḥ kāma̱m avya̍n   yaṁ su̱kratu̍ṁ dhi̱ṣaṇe̍ vibhvata̱ṣṭaṁ gha̱naṁ vṛ̱trāṇā̍ṁ ja̱naya̍nta de̱vāḥ
English: great indra will i laud in whom all people who drink the soma have attained their longing;  whom passing wise gods heaven and earth engendered formed by a master's hand to crush the vṛtras

Sanskrit: yaṁ nu naki̱ḥ pṛta̍nāsu sva̱rāja̍ṁ dvi̱tā tara̍ti̱ nṛta̍maṁ hari̱ṣṭhām   i̱nata̍ma̱ḥ satva̍bhi̱r yo ha̍ śū̱ṣaiḥ pṛ̍thu̱jrayā̍ aminā̱d āyu̱r dasyo̍ḥ
English: whom most heroic borne by tawny coursers verily none subdueth in the battle;  who reaching far most vigorous hath shortened the dasyu's life with warriors bold of spirit

Sanskrit: sa̱hāvā̍ pṛ̱tsu ta̱raṇi̱r nārvā̍ vyāna̱śī roda̍sī me̱hanā̍vān   bhago̱ na kā̱re havyo̍ matī̱nām pi̱teva̱ cāru̍ḥ su̱havo̍ vayo̱dhāḥ
English: victor in fight swift mover like a warhorse pervading both worlds rainer down of blessings  to he invoked in war like bhaga father as twere of hymns fair prompt to hear strengthgiver

Sanskrit: dha̱rtā di̱vo raja̍sas pṛ̱ṣṭa ū̱rdhvo ratho̱ na vā̱yur vasu̍bhir ni̱yutvā̍n   kṣa̱pāṁ va̱stā ja̍ni̱tā sūrya̍sya̱ vibha̍ktā bhā̱gaṁ dhi̱ṣaṇe̍va̱ vāja̍m
English: supporting heaven the high back of the region his car is vāyu with his team of vasus  illumining the nights the sun's creator like dhiṣaṇā he deals forth strength and riches

English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers treasure

Sanskrit: sa̱dyo ha̍ jā̱to vṛ̍ṣa̱bhaḥ ka̱nīna̱ḥ prabha̍rtum āva̱d andha̍saḥ su̱tasya̍   sā̱dhoḥ pi̍ba pratikā̱maṁ yathā̍ te̱ rasā̍śiraḥ pratha̱maṁ so̱myasya̍
English: soon as the young bull sprang into existence he longed to taste the pressedout soma's liquor  drink thou thy fill according to thy longing first of the goodly mixture blent with soma

Sanskrit: yaj jāya̍thā̱s tad aha̍r asya̱ kāme̱ 'ṁśoḥ pī̱yūṣa̍m apibo giri̱ṣṭhām   taṁ te̍ mā̱tā pari̱ yoṣā̱ jani̍trī ma̱haḥ pi̱tur dama̱ āsi̍ñca̱d agre̍
English: that day when thou wast born thou fain to taste it drankest the plant's milk which the mountains nourish  that milk thy mother first the dame who bare thee poured for thee in thy mighty father's dwelling

English: desiring food he came unto his mother and on her breast beheld the pungent soma  wise he moved on keeping aloof the others and wrought great exploits in his varied aspects

Sanskrit: u̱gras tu̍rā̱ṣāḻ a̱bhibhū̍tyojā yathāva̱śaṁ ta̱nva̍ṁ cakra e̱ṣaḥ   tvaṣṭā̍ra̱m indro̍ ja̱nuṣā̍bhi̱bhūyā̱muṣyā̱ soma̍m apibac ca̱mūṣu̍
English: fierce quickly conquering of surpassing vigour he framed his body even as he listed  een from his birthtime indra conquered tvaṣṭar bore off the soma and in beakers drank it

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered;  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: ca̱rṣa̱ṇī̱dhṛta̍m ma̱ghavā̍nam u̱kthya1̱̍m indra̱ṁ giro̍ bṛha̱tīr a̱bhy a̍nūṣata   vā̱vṛ̱dhā̱nam pu̍ruhū̱taṁ su̍vṛ̱ktibhi̱r ama̍rtya̱ṁ jara̍māṇaṁ di̱vedi̍ve
English: high hymns have sounded forth the praise of maghavan supporter of mankind of indra meet for lauds;  him who hath waxen great invoked with beauteous songs immortal one whose praise each day is sung aloud

English: to indra from all sides go forth my songs of praise the lord of hundred powers strong hero like the sea  swift winner of the booty breakerdown of forts faithful and everglorious finder of the light

Sanskrit: ā̱ka̱re vaso̍r jari̱tā pa̍nasyate 'ne̱hasa̱ḥ stubha̱ indro̍ duvasyati   vi̱vasva̍ta̱ḥ sada̍na̱ ā hi pi̍pri̱ye sa̍trā̱sāha̍m abhimāti̱hana̍ṁ stuhi
English: where battle's spoil is piled the singer winneth praise for indra taketh care of matchless worshippers  he in vivasvān's dwelling findeth his delight praise thou the everconquering slayer of the foe

Sanskrit: nṛ̱ṇām u̍ tvā̱ nṛta̍maṁ gī̱rbhir u̱kthair a̱bhi pra vī̱ram a̍rcatā sa̱bādha̍ḥ   saṁ saha̍se purumā̱yo ji̍hīte̱ namo̍ asya pra̱diva̱ eka̍ īśe
English: thee valorous most heroic of the heroes shall the priests glorify with songg and praises  full of all wondrous power he goes to conquest worship is his sole lord from days aforetime

English: abundant are the gifts he gives to mortals for him the earth bears a rich store of treasures  the heavens the growing plants the living waters the forest trees preserve their wealth for indra

English: to thee o indra lord of bays for ever are offered prayers and songs accept them gladly  as kinsman think thou of some fresh assistance; good friend give strength and life to those who praise thee

English: here indra drink thou soma with the maruts as thou didst drink the juice beside śāryāta  under thy guidance in thy keeping hero the singers serve skilled in fair sacrifices

Sanskrit: sa vā̍vaśā̱na i̱ha pā̍hi̱ soma̍m ma̱rudbhi̍r indra̱ sakhi̍bhiḥ su̱taṁ na̍ḥ   jā̱taṁ yat tvā̱ pari̍ de̱vā abhū̍ṣan ma̱he bharā̍ya puruhūta̱ viśve̍
English: so eagerly desirous drink the soma our juice o indra with thy friends the maruts  since at thy birth all deities adorned thee for the great fight o thou invoked of many

English: he was your comrade in your zeal o maruts they rich in noble gifts rejoiced in indra  with them together let the vṛtraslayer drink in his home the worshipper's libation

Sanskrit: i̱daṁ hy anv oja̍sā su̱taṁ rā̍dhānām pate   pibā̱ tv a1̱̍sya gi̍rvaṇaḥ
English: so lord of affluent gifts this juice hath been pressed for thee with strength  drink of it thou who lovest song

Sanskrit: yas te̱ anu̍ sva̱dhām asa̍t su̱te ni ya̍ccha ta̱nva̍m   sa tvā̍ mamattu so̱myam
English: incline thy body to this juice which suits thy godlike nature well  may it cheer thee who lovest it

Sanskrit: pra te̍ aśnotu ku̱kṣyoḥ prendra̱ brahma̍ṇā̱ śira̍ḥ   pra bā̱hū śū̍ra̱ rādha̍se
English: brave indra let it work through both thy flanks and through thy head by prayer  and through thine arms to prosper us

Sanskrit: yu̱dhmasya̍ te vṛṣa̱bhasya̍ sva̱rāja̍ u̱grasya̱ yūna̱ḥ sthavi̍rasya̱ ghṛṣve̍ḥ   ajū̍ryato va̱jriṇo̍ vī̱ryā̱3̱̍ṇīndra̍ śru̱tasya̍ maha̱to ma̱hāni̍
English: of thee the bull the warrior sovran ruler joyous and fierce ancient and ever youthful  the undecaying one who wields the thunder renowned and great great are the exploits indra

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ a̍si mahiṣa̱ vṛṣṇye̍bhir dhana̱spṛd u̍gra̱ saha̍māno a̱nyān   eko̱ viśva̍sya̱ bhuva̍nasya̱ rājā̱ sa yo̱dhayā̍ ca kṣa̱yayā̍ ca̱ janā̍n
English: great art thou mighty lord through manly vigour o fierce one gathering spoil subduing others  thyself alone the universe's sovran so send forth men to combat and to rest them

Sanskrit: pra mātrā̍bhī ririce̱ roca̍māna̱ḥ pra de̱vebhi̍r vi̱śvato̱ apra̍tītaḥ   pra ma̱jmanā̍ di̱va indra̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyāḥ proror ma̱ho a̱ntari̍kṣād ṛjī̱ṣī
English: he hath surpassed all measure in his brightness yea and the gods for none may be his equal  impetuous indra in his might cxccedcth wide vast midair and heaven and earth together

Sanskrit: u̱ruṁ ga̍bhī̱raṁ ja̱nuṣā̱bhy u1̱̍graṁ vi̱śvavya̍casam ava̱tam ma̍tī̱nām   indra̱ṁ somā̍saḥ pra̱divi̍ su̱tāsa̍ḥ samu̱draṁ na sra̱vata̱ ā vi̍śanti
English: to indra even as rivers to the ocean flow forth from days of old the soma juices;  to him wide deep and mighty from his birthtime the well of holy thoughts ailcomprehending

Sanskrit: yaṁ soma̍m indra pṛthi̱vīdyāvā̱ garbha̱ṁ na mā̱tā bi̍bhṛ̱tas tvā̱yā   taṁ te̍ hinvanti̱ tam u̍ te mṛjanty adhva̱ryavo̍ vṛṣabha̱ pāta̱vā u̍
English: the soma indra which the earth and heaven bear for thee as a mother bears her infant  this they send forth to thee this vigorous hero! adhvaryus purify for thee to drink of

Sanskrit: ā ma̱ndrair i̍ndra̱ hari̍bhir yā̱hi ma̱yūra̍romabhiḥ   mā tvā̱ ke ci̱n ni ya̍ma̱n viṁ na pā̱śino 'ti̱ dhanve̍va̱ tām̐ i̍hi
English: come hither indra with bay steeds joyous with tails like peacocks' plumes  let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird pass oer them as oer desert lands

Sanskrit: vṛ̱tra̱khā̱do va̍laṁru̱jaḥ pu̱rāṁ da̱rmo a̱pām a̱jaḥ   sthātā̱ ratha̍sya̱ haryo̍r abhisva̱ra indro̍ dṛ̱ḻhā ci̍d āru̱jaḥ
English: he who slew vṛtra burst the cloud brake the strongholds and drave the floods  indra who mounts his chariot at his bay steeds' cry shatters een things that stand most firm

Sanskrit: ga̱mbhī̱rām̐ u̍da̱dhīm̐r i̍va̱ kratu̍m puṣyasi̱ gā i̍va   pra su̍go̱pā yava̍saṁ dhe̱navo̍ yathā hra̱daṁ ku̱lyā i̍vāśata
English: like pools of water deep and full like kine thou cherishest thy might;  like the milchcows that go wellguarded to the mead like waterbrooks that reach the lake

Sanskrit: ā na̱s tuja̍ṁ ra̱yim bha̱rāṁśa̱ṁ na pra̍tijāna̱te   vṛ̱kṣam pa̱kvam phala̍m a̱ṅkīva̍ dhūnu̱hīndra̍ sa̱mpāra̍ṇa̱ṁ vasu̍
English: bring thou us wealth with power to strike our share 'gainst him who calls it his  shake indra as with hooks the tree for ripened fruit for wealth to satisfy our wish

Sanskrit: sva̱yur i̍ndra sva̱rāḻ a̍si̱ smaddi̍ṣṭi̱ḥ svaya̍śastaraḥ   sa vā̍vṛdhā̱na oja̍sā puruṣṭuta̱ bhavā̍ naḥ su̱śrava̍stamaḥ
English: indra selfruling lord art thou good leader of most glorious fame  so waxen in thy strength o thou whom many praise be thou most swift to hear our call

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ te̍ astu harya̱taḥ soma̱ ā hari̍bhiḥ su̱taḥ   ju̱ṣā̱ṇa i̍ndra̱ hari̍bhir na̱ ā ga̱hy ā ti̍ṣṭha̱ hari̍ta̱ṁ ratha̍m

Sanskrit: su̱yugbhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ su̱vṛtā̱ rathe̍na̱ dasrā̍v i̱maṁ śṛ̍ṇuta̱ṁ śloka̱m adre̍ḥ   kim a̱ṅga vā̱m praty ava̍rti̱ṁ gami̍ṣṭhā̱hur viprā̍so aśvinā purā̱jāḥ
English: with lightlyrolling car and wellyoked horses hear this the pressstone's song ye wonderworkers  have not the sages of old time ye aśvins called you most prompt to come and stay misfortune?

Sanskrit: ā ma̍nyethā̱m ā ga̍ta̱ṁ kac ci̱d evai̱r viśve̱ janā̍so a̱śvinā̍ havante   i̱mā hi vā̱ṁ goṛ̍jīkā̱ madhū̍ni̱ pra mi̱trāso̱ na da̱dur u̱sro agre̍
English: remember us and come to us for ever men as their wont is invocate the aśvins  friends as it were have offered you these juices sweet blent with milk at the first break of morning

Sanskrit: ti̱raḥ pu̱rū ci̍d aśvinā̱ rajā̍ṁsy āṅgū̱ṣo vā̍m maghavānā̱ jane̍ṣu   eha yā̍tam pa̱thibhi̍r deva̱yānai̱r dasrā̍v i̱me vā̍ṁ ni̱dhayo̱ madhū̍nām
English: even through many regions o ye aśvins high praise is yours among mankind ye mighty  come helpers on the paths which gods have travelled here your libations of sweet meath are ready

Sanskrit: pu̱rā̱ṇam oka̍ḥ sa̱khyaṁ śi̱vaṁ vā̍ṁ yu̱vor na̍rā̱ dravi̍ṇaṁ ja̱hnāvyā̍m   puna̍ḥ kṛṇvā̱nāḥ sa̱khyā śi̱vāni̱ madhvā̍ madema sa̱ha nū sa̍mā̱nāḥ
English: ancient your home auspicious is your friendship heroes your wealth is with the house of jahnu  forming again with you auspicious friendship let us rejoice with draughts of meath together

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā vā̱yunā̍ yu̱vaṁ su̍dakṣā ni̱yudbhi̍ṣ ca sa̱joṣa̍sā yuvānā   nāsa̍tyā ti̱roa̍hnyaṁ juṣā̱ṇā soma̍m pibatam a̱sridhā̍ sudānū
English: o aśvins very mighty ones with vāyu and with his steeds oneminded everyouthful  nāsatyas joying in the third day's soma drink it not hostile very bounteous givers

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā̱ pari̍ vā̱m iṣa̍ḥ purū̱cīr ī̱yur gī̱rbhir yata̍mānā̱ amṛ̍dhrāḥ   ratho̍ ha vām ṛta̱jā adri̍jūta̱ḥ pari̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī yā̍ti sa̱dyaḥ
English: aśvins to you are brought abundant viands in rivalry with sacred songs unceasing  sprung from high law your car urged on by pressstones goes round the earth and heaven in one brief moment

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā madhu̱ṣutta̍mo yu̱vāku̱ḥ soma̱s tam pā̍ta̱m ā ga̍taṁ duro̱ṇe   ratho̍ ha vā̱m bhūri̱ varpa̱ḥ kari̍krat su̱tāva̍to niṣkṛ̱tam āga̍miṣṭhaḥ
English: aśvins your soma sheds delicious sweetness drink ye thereof and come unto our dwelling  your car assuming many a shape most often goes to the somapresser's place of meeting

Sanskrit: i̱heha̍ vo̱ mana̍sā ba̱ndhutā̍ nara u̱śijo̍ jagmur a̱bhi tāni̱ veda̍sā   yābhi̍r mā̱yābhi̱ḥ prati̍jūtivarpasa̱ḥ saudha̍nvanā ya̱jñiya̍m bhā̱gam ā̍na̱śa
English: here is your ghostly kinship here o men they came desirous to these holy rites with store of wealth  with wondrous arts whereby with schemes to meet each need ye gained sudhanvan's sons! your share in sacrifice

Sanskrit: yābhi̱ḥ śacī̍bhiś cama̱sām̐ api̍ṁśata̱ yayā̍ dhi̱yā gām ari̍ṇīta̱ carma̍ṇaḥ   yena̱ harī̱ mana̍sā ni̱rata̍kṣata̱ tena̍ deva̱tvam ṛ̍bhava̱ḥ sam ā̍naśa
English: the mighty powers wherewith ye formed the chalices the thought by which ye drew the cow from out the hide  the intellect wherewith ye wrought the two bay steedsthrough these o ṛbhus ye attained divinity

Sanskrit: indra̍sya sa̱khyam ṛ̱bhava̱ḥ sam ā̍naśu̱r mano̱r napā̍to a̱paso̍ dadhanvire   sau̱dha̱nva̱nāso̍ amṛta̱tvam eri̍re vi̱ṣṭvī śamī̍bhiḥ su̱kṛta̍ḥ sukṛ̱tyayā̍
English: friendship with indra have the ṛbhus fully gained grandsons of manu they skilfully urged the work  sudhanvan's children won them everlasting life serving with holy rites pious with noble acts

Sanskrit: indre̍ṇa yātha sa̱ratha̍ṁ su̱te sacā̱m̐ atho̱ vaśā̍nām bhavathā sa̱ha śri̱yā   na va̍ḥ prati̱mai su̍kṛ̱tāni̍ vāghata̱ḥ saudha̍nvanā ṛbhavo vī̱ryā̍ṇi ca
English: in company with indra come ye to the juice then gloriously shall your wishes be fulfilled  not to be paragoned ye priests are your good deeds nor your heroic acts ṛbhus sudhanvan's sons

Sanskrit: indra̍ ṛ̱bhubhi̱r vāja̍vadbhi̱ḥ samu̍kṣitaṁ su̱taṁ soma̱m ā vṛ̍ṣasvā̱ gabha̍styoḥ   dhi̱yeṣi̱to ma̍ghavan dā̱śuṣo̍ gṛ̱he sau̍dhanva̱nebhi̍ḥ sa̱ha ma̍tsvā̱ nṛbhi̍ḥ
English: o indra with the ṛbhus mighty ones pour down the soma juice effused wellblent from both thy hands  maghalan urged by song in the drinkofferer's house rejoice thee with the heroes with sudhanvan's sons

Sanskrit: indra̍ ṛbhu̱mān vāja̍vān matsve̱ha no̱ 'smin sava̍ne̱ śacyā̍ puruṣṭuta   i̱māni̱ tubhya̱ṁ svasa̍rāṇi yemire vra̱tā de̱vānā̱m manu̍ṣaś ca̱ dharma̍bhiḥ
English: with ṛbhu near and vāja indra here exult with saci praised of many in the juice we pour  these homes wherein we dwell have turned themselves to thee devotions to the gods as laws of men ordain

Sanskrit: indra̍ ṛ̱bhubhi̍r vā̱jibhi̍r vā̱jaya̍nn i̱ha stoma̍ṁ jari̱tur upa̍ yāhi ya̱jñiya̍m   śa̱taṁ kete̍bhir iṣi̱rebhi̍r ā̱yave̍ sa̱hasra̍ṇītho adhva̱rasya̱ homa̍ni
English: come with the mighty ṛbhus indra come to us strengthening with thy help the singer's holy praise;  at hundred eager calls come to the living man with thousand arts attend the act of sacrifice

Sanskrit: indra̍m ma̱tir hṛ̱da ā va̱cyamā̱nācchā̱ pati̱ṁ stoma̍taṣṭā jigāti   yā jāgṛ̍vir vi̱dathe̍ śa̱syamā̱nendra̱ yat te̱ jāya̍te vi̱ddhi tasya̍
English: to indra from the heart the hymn proceedeth to him the lord recited built with praises;  the wakening song sung forth in holy synod that which is born for thee o indra notice

Sanskrit: di̱vaś ci̱d ā pū̱rvyā jāya̍mānā̱ vi jāgṛ̍vir vi̱dathe̍ śa̱syamā̍nā   bha̱drā vastrā̱ṇy arju̍nā̱ vasā̍nā̱ seyam a̱sme sa̍na̱jā pitryā̱ dhīḥ
English: born from the heaven een in the days aforetime wakening sting aloud in holy synod  auspicious clad in white and shining raiment this is the ancient hymn of our forefathers

Sanskrit: ya̱mā ci̱d atra̍ yama̱sūr a̍sūta ji̱hvāyā̱ agra̱m pata̱d ā hy asthā̍t   vapū̍ṁṣi jā̱tā mi̍thu̱nā sa̍cete tamo̱hanā̱ tapu̍ṣo bu̱dhna etā̍
English: the mother of the twins hath borne twin children my tongue's tip raised itself and rested silent  killing the darkness at the light's foundation the couple newly born attain their beauty

Sanskrit: naki̍r eṣāṁ nindi̱tā martye̍ṣu̱ ye a̱smāka̍m pi̱taro̱ goṣu̍ yo̱dhāḥ   indra̍ eṣāṁ dṛṁhi̱tā māhi̍nāvā̱n ud go̱trāṇi̍ sasṛje da̱ṁsanā̍vān
English: not one is found among them none of mortals to blame our sires who fought to win the cattle  their strengthener was indra the majestic he spread their stalls of kine the wonderworker

Sanskrit: sakhā̍ ha̱ yatra̱ sakhi̍bhi̱r nava̍gvair abhi̱jñv ā satva̍bhi̱r gā a̍nu̱gman   sa̱tyaṁ tad indro̍ da̱śabhi̱r daśa̍gvai̱ḥ sūrya̍ṁ viveda̱ tama̍si kṣi̱yanta̍m
English: where as a friend with friendly men navagvas with heroes on his knees he sought the cattle  there verily with ten daśagvas indra found the sun lying hidden in the darkness

Sanskrit: indro̱ madhu̱ sambhṛ̍tam u̱sriyā̍yām pa̱dvad vi̍veda śa̱phava̱n name̱ goḥ   guhā̍ hi̱taṁ guhya̍ṁ gū̱ḻham a̱psu haste̍ dadhe̱ dakṣi̍ṇe̱ dakṣi̍ṇāvān
English: indra found meath collected in the milchcow by foot and hoof in the cow's place of pasture  that which lay secret hidden in the waters he held in his right hand the rich rewarder

Sanskrit: jyoti̍r vṛṇīta̱ tama̍so vijā̱nann ā̱re syā̍ma duri̱tād a̱bhīke̍   i̱mā gira̍ḥ somapāḥ somavṛddha ju̱ṣasve̍ndra puru̱tama̍sya kā̱roḥ
English: he took the light discerning it from darkness may we be far removed from all misfortune  these songs o somadrinker cheered by soma indra accept from thy most zealous poet

Sanskrit: jyoti̍r ya̱jñāya̱ roda̍sī̱ anu̍ ṣyād ā̱re syā̍ma duri̱tasya̱ bhūre̍ḥ   bhūri̍ ci̱d dhi tu̍ja̱to martya̍sya supā̱rāso̍ vasavo ba̱rhaṇā̍vat
English: let there be light through both the worlds for worship may we be far from most overwhelming evil  great woe comes even from the hostile mortal piled up; but good at rescue are the vasus

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: mi̱tro janā̍n yātayati bruvā̱ṇo mi̱tro dā̍dhāra pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām   mi̱traḥ kṛ̱ṣṭīr ani̍miṣā̱bhi ca̍ṣṭe mi̱trāya̍ ha̱vyaṁ ghṛ̱tava̍j juhota
English: mitra when speaking stirreth men to labour mitra sustaineth both the earth and heaven  mitra beholdeth men with eyes that close not to mitra bring with holy oil oblation

Sanskrit: pra sa mi̍tra̱ marto̍ astu̱ praya̍svā̱n yas ta̍ āditya̱ śikṣa̍ti vra̱tena̍   na ha̍nyate̱ na jī̍yate̱ tvoto̱ naina̱m aṁho̍ aśno̱ty anti̍to̱ na dū̱rāt
English: foremost be he who brings thee food o mitra who strives to keep thy sacred law āditya  he whom thou helpest neer is slain or conquered on him from near or far falls no affliction

Sanskrit: a̱na̱mī̱vāsa̱ iḻa̍yā̱ mada̍nto mi̱tajña̍vo̱ vari̍ma̱nn ā pṛ̍thi̱vyāḥ   ā̱di̱tyasya̍ vra̱tam u̍pakṣi̱yanto̍ va̱yam mi̱trasya̍ suma̱tau syā̍ma
English: joying in sacred food and free from sickness with knees bent lowly on the earth's broad surface  following closely the āditya's statute may we remain in mitra's gracious favour

Sanskrit: a̱yam mi̱tro na̍ma̱sya̍ḥ su̱śevo̱ rājā̍ sukṣa̱tro a̍janiṣṭa ve̱dhāḥ   tasya̍ va̱yaṁ su̍ma̱tau ya̱jñiya̱syāpi̍ bha̱dre sau̍mana̱se syā̍ma
English: auspicious and adorable this mitra was born with fair dominion king disposer  may we enjoy the grace of him the holy yea rest in his propitious lovingkindness

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ ā̍di̱tyo nama̍sopa̱sadyo̍ yāta̱yajja̍no gṛṇa̱te su̱śeva̍ḥ   tasmā̍ e̱tat panya̍tamāya̱ juṣṭa̍m a̱gnau mi̱trāya̍ ha̱vir ā ju̍hota
English: the great āditya to be served with wor ship who stirreth men is gracious to the singer  to mitra him most highly to be lauded offer in fire oblation that he loveth

Sanskrit: mi̱trasya̍ carṣaṇī̱dhṛto 'vo̍ de̱vasya̍ sāna̱si   dyu̱mnaṁ ci̱traśra̍vastamam
English: the gainful grace of mitra god supporter of the race of man  gives splendour of mostglorious fame

Sanskrit: a̱bhi yo ma̍hi̱nā diva̍m mi̱tro ba̱bhūva̍ sa̱prathā̍ḥ   a̱bhi śravo̍bhiḥ pṛthi̱vīm
English: mitra whose glory spreads afar he who in might surpasses heaven  surpasses earth in his renown

Sanskrit: mi̱trāya̱ pañca̍ yemire̱ janā̍ a̱bhiṣṭi̍śavase   sa de̱vān viśvā̍n bibharti
English: all the five races have repaired to mitra ever strong to aid  for he sustaineth all the gods

Sanskrit: mi̱tro de̱veṣv ā̱yuṣu̱ janā̍ya vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣe   iṣa̍ i̱ṣṭavra̍tā akaḥ
English: mitra to gods to living men to him who strews the holy grass  gives food fulfilling sacred law

Sanskrit: vārtra̍hatyāya̱ śava̍se pṛtanā̱ṣāhyā̍ya ca   indra̱ tvā va̍rtayāmasi
English: o indra for the strength that slays vṛtra and conquers in the fight  we turn thee hitherward to us

Sanskrit: a̱rvā̱cīna̱ṁ su te̱ mana̍ u̱ta cakṣu̍ḥ śatakrato   indra̍ kṛ̱ṇvantu̍ vā̱ghata̍ḥ
English: o indra lord of hundred powers may those who praise thee hitherward  direct thy spirit and thine eye

Sanskrit: nāmā̍ni te śatakrato̱ viśvā̍bhir gī̱rbhir ī̍mahe   indrā̍bhimāti̱ṣāhye̍
English: o indra lord of hundred powers with all our songs we invocate  thy names for triumph over foes

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱ṣṭu̱tasya̱ dhāma̍bhiḥ śa̱tena̍ mahayāmasi   indra̍sya carṣaṇī̱dhṛta̍ḥ
English: we strive for glory through the powers immense of him whom many praise  of indra who supports mankind

Sanskrit: indra̍ṁ vṛ̱trāya̱ hanta̍ve puruhū̱tam upa̍ bruve   bhare̍ṣu̱ vāja̍sātaye
English: for vṛtra's slaughter i address indra whom many invocate  to win us booty in the wars

Sanskrit: vāje̍ṣu sāsa̱hir bha̍va̱ tvām ī̍mahe śatakrato   indra̍ vṛ̱trāya̱ hanta̍ve
English: in battles be victorious we seek thee lord of hundred powers  indra that vṛtra may be slain

Sanskrit: dyu̱mneṣu̍ pṛta̱nājye̍ pṛtsu̱tūrṣu̱ śrava̍ḥsu ca   indra̱ sākṣvā̱bhimā̍tiṣu
English: in splendid combats of the hosts in glories where the fight is won  indra be victor over foes

Sanskrit: śu̱ṣminta̍maṁ na ū̱taye̍ dyu̱mnina̍m pāhi̱ jāgṛ̍vim   indra̱ soma̍ṁ śatakrato
English: drink thou the soma for our help bright vigilant exceeding strong  o indra lord of hundred powers

Sanskrit: i̱ndri̱yāṇi̍ śatakrato̱ yā te̱ jane̍ṣu pa̱ñcasu̍   indra̱ tāni̍ ta̱ ā vṛ̍ṇe
English: o śatakratu powers which thou mid the five races hast displayed  these indra do i claim of thee

Sanskrit: aga̍nn indra̱ śravo̍ bṛ̱had dyu̱mnaṁ da̍dhiṣva du̱ṣṭara̍m   ut te̱ śuṣma̍ṁ tirāmasi
English: indra great glory hast thou gained win splendid fame which none may mar  we make thy might perpetual

Sanskrit: a̱rvā̱vato̍ na̱ ā ga̱hy atho̍ śakra parā̱vata̍ḥ   u̱ lo̱ko yas te̍ adriva̱ indre̱ha tata̱ ā ga̍hi
English: come to us either from anear or śakra come from far away  indra wherever be thy home come to us thence o thunderarmed

Sanskrit: na tā mi̍nanti mā̱yino̱ na dhīrā̍ vra̱tā de̱vānā̍m pratha̱mā dhru̱vāṇi̍   na roda̍sī a̱druhā̍ ve̱dyābhi̱r na parva̍tā ni̱name̍ tasthi̱vāṁsa̍ḥ
English: not men of magic skill not men of wisdom impair the gods first steadfast ordinances  neer may the earth and heaven which know not malice nor the fixed hills be bowed by sage devices

Sanskrit: ṣaḍ bhā̱rām̐ eko̱ aca̍ran bibharty ṛ̱taṁ varṣi̍ṣṭha̱m upa̱ gāva̱ āgu̍ḥ   ti̱sro ma̱hīr upa̍rās tasthu̱r atyā̱ guhā̱ dve nihi̍te̱ darśy ekā̍
English: one moving not away supports six burthens the cows proceed to him the true the highest  near stand three mighty ones who travel swiftly two are concealed from sight one is apparent

Sanskrit: tri̱pā̱ja̱syo vṛ̍ṣa̱bho vi̱śvarū̍pa u̱ta tryu̱dhā pu̍ru̱dha pra̱jāvā̍n   trya̱nī̱kaḥ pa̍tyate̱ māhi̍nāvā̱n sa re̍to̱dhā vṛ̍ṣa̱bhaḥ śaśva̍tīnām
English: the bull who wears all shapes the triplebreasted threeuddered with a brood in many places  ruleth majestic with his triple aspect the bull the everlasting ones' impregner

Sanskrit: a̱bhīka̍ āsām pada̱vīr a̍bodhy ādi̱tyānā̍m ahve̱ cāru̱ nāma̍   āpa̍ś cid asmā aramanta de̱vīḥ pṛtha̱g vraja̍ntī̱ḥ pari̍ ṣīm avṛñjan
English: when nigh them as their tracer he observed them he called aloud the dear name of ādityas  the goddesses the waters stayed to meet him they who were wandering separate enclosed him

Sanskrit: trī ṣa̱dhasthā̍ sindhava̱s triḥ ka̍vī̱nām u̱ta tri̍mā̱tā vi̱dathe̍ṣu sa̱mrāṭ   ṛ̱tāva̍rī̱r yoṣa̍ṇās ti̱sro apyā̱s trir ā di̱vo vi̱dathe̱ patya̍mānāḥ
English: streams! the wise gods have thrice three habitations child of three mothers he is lord in synods  three are the holy ladies of the waters thrice here from heaven supreme in our assembly

Sanskrit: trir ā di̱vaḥ sa̍vita̱r vāryā̍ṇi di̱vedi̍va̱ ā su̍va̱ trir no̱ ahna̍ḥ   tri̱dhātu̍ rā̱ya ā su̍vā̱ vasū̍ni̱ bhaga̍ trātar dhiṣaṇe sā̱taye̍ dhāḥ
English: do thou o savitar from heaven thrice hither three times a day send down thy blessings daily  send us o bhaga triple wealth and treasure; cause the two worlds to prosper us preserver!

Sanskrit: trir ā di̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā so̍ṣavīti̱ rājā̍nā mi̱trāvaru̍ṇā supā̱ṇī   āpa̍ś cid asya̱ roda̍sī cid u̱rvī ratna̍m bhikṣanta savi̱tuḥ sa̱vāya̍
English: savitar thrice from heaven pours down abundance and the fairhanded kings varuṇa mitra;  and spacious heaven and earth yea and the waters solicit wealth that savitar may send us

Sanskrit: trir u̍tta̱mā dū̱ṇaśā̍ roca̱nāni̱ trayo̍ rāja̱nty asu̍rasya vī̱rāḥ   ṛ̱tāvā̍na iṣi̱rā dū̱ḻabhā̍sa̱s trir ā di̱vo vi̱dathe̍ santu de̱vāḥ
English: three are the bright realms best beyond attainment and three the asura's heroes rule as sovrans  holy and vigorous never to be injured thrice may the gods from heaven attend our synod

Sanskrit: a̱bhi taṣṭe̍va dīdhayā manī̱ṣām atyo̱ na vā̱jī su̱dhuro̱ jihā̍naḥ   a̱bhi pri̱yāṇi̱ marmṛ̍śa̱t parā̍ṇi ka̱vīm̐r i̍cchāmi sa̱ṁdṛśe̍ sume̱dhāḥ
English: hasting like some strong courser good at drawing a thought have i imagined like a workman  pondering what is dearest and most noble i long to see the sages full of wisdom

Sanskrit: i̱nota pṛ̍ccha̱ jani̍mā kavī̱nām ma̍no̱dhṛta̍ḥ su̱kṛta̍s takṣata̱ dyām   i̱mā u̍ te pra̱ṇyo̱3̱̍ vardha̍mānā̱ mano̍vātā̱ adha̱ nu dharma̍ṇi gman
English: ask of the sages' mighty generations firmminded and devout they framed the heaven  these are thy heartsought strengthening directions and they have come to be sky's upholders

Sanskrit: ni ṣī̱m id atra̱ guhyā̱ dadhā̍nā u̱ta kṣa̱trāya̱ roda̍sī̱ sam a̍ñjan   sam mātrā̍bhir mami̱re ye̱mur u̱rvī a̱ntar ma̱hī samṛ̍te̱ dhāya̍se dhuḥ
English: assuming in this world mysterious natures they decked the heaven and earth for high dominion  measured with measures fixed their broad expanses set the great worlds apart held firm for safety

Sanskrit: ā̱tiṣṭha̍nta̱m pari̱ viśve̍ abhūṣa̱ñ chriyo̱ vasā̍naś carati̱ svaro̍ciḥ   ma̱hat tad vṛṣṇo̱ asu̍rasya̱ nāmā vi̱śvarū̍po a̱mṛtā̍ni tasthau
English: even as he mounted up they all adorned him selfluminous he travels clothed in splendour  that is the bull's the asura's mighty figure he omniform hath reached the eternal waters

Sanskrit: asū̍ta̱ pūrvo̍ vṛṣa̱bho jyāyā̍n i̱mā a̍sya śu̱rudha̍ḥ santi pū̱rvīḥ   divo̍ napātā vi̱datha̍sya dhī̱bhiḥ kṣa̱traṁ rā̍jānā pra̱divo̍ dadhāthe
English: first the more ancient bull engendered offspring; these are his many draughts that lent him vigour  from days of old ye kings two sons of heaven by hymns of sacrifice have won dominion

Sanskrit: trīṇi̍ rājānā vi̱dathe̍ pu̱rūṇi̱ pari̱ viśvā̍ni bhūṣatha̱ḥ sadā̍ṁsi   apa̍śya̱m atra̱ mana̍sā jaga̱nvān vra̱te ga̍ndha̱rvām̐ api̍ vā̱yuke̍śān
English: three seats ye sovrans in the holy synod many yea all ye honour with your presence  there saw i going thither in the spirit gandharvas in their course with windblown tresses

Sanskrit: tad in nv a̍sya vṛṣa̱bhasya̍ dhe̱nor ā nāma̍bhir mamire̱ sakmya̱ṁ goḥ   a̱nyada̍nyad asu̱rya1̱̍ṁ vasā̍nā̱ ni mā̱yino̍ mamire rū̱pam a̍smin
English: that same companionship of her the milchcow here with the strong bull's divers forms they stablished  enduing still some new celestial figure the skilful workers shaped a form around him

Sanskrit: tad in nv a̍sya savi̱tur naki̍r me hira̱ṇyayī̍m a̱mati̱ṁ yām aśi̍śret   ā su̍ṣṭu̱tī roda̍sī viśvami̱nve apī̍va̱ yoṣā̱ jani̍māni vavre
English: let no one here debar me from enjoying the golden light which savitar diffuses  he covers both allfostering worlds with praises even as a woman cherishes her children

Sanskrit: yu̱vam pra̱tnasya̍ sādhatho ma̱ho yad daivī̍ sva̱stiḥ pari̍ ṇaḥ syātam   go̱pāji̍hvasya ta̱sthuṣo̱ virū̍pā̱ viśve̍ paśyanti mā̱yina̍ḥ kṛ̱tāni̍
English: fulfil ye twain his work the great the ancient as heavenly blessing keep your guard around us  all the wise gods behold his varied actions who stands erect whose voice is like a herdsman's

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on indra maghavan auspicious best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: pra me̍ vivi̱kvām̐ a̍vidan manī̱ṣāṁ dhe̱nuṁ cara̍ntī̱m prayu̍tā̱m ago̍pām   sa̱dyaś ci̱d yā du̍du̱he bhūri̍ dhā̱ser indra̱s tad a̱gniḥ pa̍ni̱tāro̍ asyāḥ
English: my thought with fine discernment hath discovered the cow who wanders free without a herdsman  her who hath straightway poured me food in plenty indra and agni therefore are her praisers

Sanskrit: indra̱ḥ su pū̱ṣā vṛṣa̍ṇā su̱hastā̍ di̱vo na prī̱tāḥ śa̍śa̱yaṁ du̍duhre   viśve̱ yad a̍syāṁ ra̱ṇaya̍nta de̱vāḥ pra vo 'tra̍ vasavaḥ su̱mnam a̍śyām
English: indra and pūṣan deft of hand and mighty wellpleased have drained the heaven's exhaustless udder  as in this praise the gods have all delighted may i win blessing here from you o vasus

Sanskrit: yā jā̱mayo̱ vṛṣṇa̍ i̱cchanti̍ śa̱ktiṁ na̍ma̱syantī̍r jānate̱ garbha̍m asmin   acchā̍ pu̱traṁ dhe̱navo̍ vāvaśā̱nā ma̱haś ca̍ranti̱ bibhra̍ta̱ṁ vapū̍ṁṣi
English: fain to lend vigour to the bull the siste with reverence recognize the germ within him  the cows come lowing hither to the youngling to him endued with great and wondrous beauties

Sanskrit: acchā̍ vivakmi̱ roda̍sī su̱meke̱ grāvṇo̍ yujā̱no a̍dhva̱re ma̍nī̱ṣā   i̱mā u̍ te̱ mana̍ve̱ bhūri̍vārā ū̱rdhvā bha̍vanti darśa̱tā yaja̍trāḥ
English: fixing with thought at sacrifice the pressstones i bid the wellformed heaven and earth come hither;  for these thy flames which give men boons in plenty rise up on high the beautiful the holy

Sanskrit: yā te̍ ji̱hvā madhu̍matī sume̱dhā agne̍ de̱veṣū̱cyata̍ urū̱cī   taye̱ha viśvā̱m̐ ava̍se̱ yaja̍trā̱n ā sā̍daya pā̱yayā̍ cā̱ madhū̍ni
English: agni thy meathsweet tongue that tastes fair viands which among gods is called the farextended  therewith make all the holy odes be seated here for our help and feed them with sweet juices

Sanskrit: yā te̍ agne̱ parva̍tasyeva̱ dhārāsa̍ścantī pī̱paya̍d deva ci̱trā   tām a̱smabhya̱m prama̍tiṁ jātavedo̱ vaso̱ rāsva̍ suma̱tiṁ vi̱śvaja̍nyām
English: let thy stream give us drink o god o agni wonderful and exhaustless like the rainclouds  thus care for us o vasu jātavedas show us thy lovingkindness reaching all men

Sanskrit: pra parva̍tānām uśa̱tī u̱pasthā̱d aśve̍ iva̱ viṣi̍te̱ hāsa̍māne   gāve̍va śu̱bhre mā̱tarā̍ rihā̱ṇe vipā̍ṭ chutu̱drī paya̍sā javete
English: forth from the bosom of the mountains eager as two swift mares with loosened rein contending  like two bright mother cows who lick their youngling vipāś and sutudri speed down their waters

Sanskrit: indre̍ṣite prasa̱vam bhikṣa̍māṇe̱ acchā̍ samu̱draṁ ra̱thye̍va yāthaḥ   sa̱mā̱rā̱ṇe ū̱rmibhi̱ḥ pinva̍māne a̱nyā vā̍m a̱nyām apy e̍ti śubhre
English: impelled by indra whom ye pray to urge you ye move as twere on chariots to the ocean  flowing together swelling with your billows o lucid streams each of you seeks the other

Sanskrit: acchā̱ sindhu̍m mā̱tṛta̍mām ayāsa̱ṁ vipā̍śam u̱rvīṁ su̱bhagā̍m aganma   va̱tsam i̍va mā̱tarā̍ saṁrihā̱ṇe sa̍mā̱naṁ yoni̱m anu̍ sa̱ṁcara̍ntī
English: i have attained the most maternal river we have approached vipāś the broad the blessed  licking as twere their calf the pair of mothers flow onward to their common home together

Sanskrit: e̱nā va̱yam paya̍sā̱ pinva̍mānā̱ anu̱ yoni̍ṁ de̱vakṛ̍ta̱ṁ cara̍ntīḥ   na varta̍ve prasa̱vaḥ sarga̍taktaḥ ki̱ṁyur vipro̍ na̱dyo̍ johavīti
English: we two who rise and swell with billowy waters move forward to the home which gods have made us  our flood may not be stayed when urged to motion what would the singer calling to the rivers?

Sanskrit: rama̍dhvam me̱ vaca̍se so̱myāya̱ ṛtā̍varī̱r upa̍ muhū̱rtam evai̍ḥ   pra sindhu̱m acchā̍ bṛha̱tī ma̍nī̱ṣāva̱syur a̍hve kuśi̱kasya̍ sū̱nuḥ
English: linger a little at my friendly bidding rest holy ones a moment in your journey  with hymn sublime soliciting your favour kuśika's son hath called unto the river

Sanskrit: indro̍ a̱smām̐ a̍rada̱d vajra̍bāhu̱r apā̍han vṛ̱tram pa̍ri̱dhiṁ na̱dīnā̍m   de̱vo̍ 'nayat savi̱tā su̍pā̱ṇis tasya̍ va̱yam pra̍sa̱ve yā̍ma u̱rvīḥ
English: indra who wields the thunder dug our channels he smote down vṛtra him who stayed our currents  savitar god the lovelyhanded led us and at his sending forth we flow expanded

Sanskrit: pra̱vācya̍ṁ śaśva̱dhā vī̱rya1̱̍ṁ tad indra̍sya̱ karma̱ yad ahi̍ṁ vivṛ̱ścat   vi vajre̍ṇa pari̱ṣado̍ jaghā̱nāya̱nn āpo 'ya̍nam i̱cchamā̍nāḥ
English: that hero deed of indra must be lauded for ever that he rent ahi in pieces  he smote away the obstructors with his thunder and eager for their course forth flowed the waters

Sanskrit: e̱tad vaco̍ jarita̱r māpi̍ mṛṣṭhā̱ ā yat te̱ ghoṣā̱n utta̍rā yu̱gāni̍   u̱ktheṣu̍ kāro̱ prati̍ no juṣasva̱ mā no̱ ni ka̍ḥ puruṣa̱trā nama̍s te
English: never forget this word of thine o singer which future generations shall reecho  in hymns o bard show us thy loving kindness humble us not mid men to thee be honour!

Sanskrit: o ṣu sva̍sāraḥ kā̱rave̍ śṛṇota ya̱yau vo̍ dū̱rād ana̍sā̱ rathe̍na   ni ṣū na̍madhva̱m bhava̍tā supā̱rā a̍dhoa̱kṣāḥ si̍ndhavaḥ sro̱tyābhi̍ḥ
English: list quickly sisters to the bard who cometh to you from far away with car and wagon  bow lowly down; be easy to be traversed stay rivers with your floods below our axles

Sanskrit: ā te̍ kāro śṛṇavāmā̱ vacā̍ṁsi ya̱yātha̍ dū̱rād ana̍sā̱ rathe̍na   ni te̍ naṁsai pīpyā̱neva̱ yoṣā̱ maryā̍yeva ka̱nyā̍ śaśva̱cai te̍
English: yea we will listen to thy words o singer with wain and car from far away thou comest  low like a nursing mother will i bend me and yield me as a maiden to her lover

Sanskrit: yad a̱ṅga tvā̍ bhara̱tāḥ sa̱ṁtare̍yur ga̱vyan grāma̍ iṣi̱ta indra̍jūtaḥ   arṣā̱d aha̍ prasa̱vaḥ sarga̍takta̱ ā vo̍ vṛṇe suma̱tiṁ ya̱jñiyā̍nām
English: soon as the bharatas have fared across thee the warrior band urged on and sped by indra  then let your streams flow on in rapid motion i crave your favour who deserve our worship

Sanskrit: atā̍riṣur bhara̱tā ga̱vyava̱ḥ sam abha̍kta̱ vipra̍ḥ suma̱tiṁ na̱dīnā̍m   pra pi̍nvadhvam i̱ṣaya̍ntīḥ su̱rādhā̱ ā va̱kṣaṇā̍ḥ pṛ̱ṇadhva̍ṁ yā̱ta śībha̍m
English: the warrior host the bharatas fared over the singer won the favour of the rivers  swell with your billows hasting pouring riches fill full your channels and roll swiftly onward

Sanskrit: ud va̍ ū̱rmiḥ śamyā̍ ha̱ntv āpo̱ yoktrā̍ṇi muñcata   mādu̍ṣkṛtau̱ vye̍nasā̱ghnyau śūna̱m āra̍tām
English: so let your wave bear up the pins and ye o waters spare the thongs;  and never may the pair of bulls harmless and sinless waste away

Sanskrit: tiṣṭhā̱ harī̱ ratha̱ ā yu̱jyamā̍nā yā̱hi vā̱yur na ni̱yuto̍ no̱ accha̍   pibā̱sy andho̍ a̱bhisṛ̍ṣṭo a̱sme indra̱ svāhā̍ rari̱mā te̱ madā̍ya
English: mount the bay horses to thy chariot harnessed and come to us like vāyu with his coursers  thou hastening to us shalt drink the soma hail indra we have poured it for thy rapture

Sanskrit: upā̍ji̱rā pu̍ruhū̱tāya̱ saptī̱ harī̱ ratha̍sya dhū̱rṣv ā yu̍najmi   dra̱vad yathā̱ sambhṛ̍taṁ vi̱śvata̍ś ci̱d upe̱maṁ ya̱jñam ā va̍hāta̱ indra̍m
English: for him the god who is invoked by many the two swift bay steeds to the pole i harness  that they in fleet course may bring indra hither een to this sacrifice arranged completely

Sanskrit: upo̍ nayasva̱ vṛṣa̍ṇā tapu̱ṣpotem a̍va̱ tvaṁ vṛ̍ṣabha svadhāvaḥ   grase̍tā̱m aśvā̱ vi mu̍ce̱ha śoṇā̍ di̱vedi̍ve sa̱dṛśī̍r addhi dhā̱nāḥ
English: bring the strong steeds who drink the warm libation and bull of godlike nature be thou gracious  let thy steeds eat; set free thy tawny horses and roasted grain like this consume thou daily

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇā te brahma̱yujā̍ yunajmi̱ harī̱ sakhā̍yā sadha̱māda̍ ā̱śū   sthi̱raṁ ratha̍ṁ su̱kham i̍ndrādhi̱tiṣṭha̍n prajā̱nan vi̱dvām̐ upa̍ yāhi̱ soma̍m
English: those who are yoked by prayer i harness fleet friendly bays who take their joy together  mounting thy firm and easy car o indra wise and allknowing come thou to the soma

Sanskrit: mā te̱ harī̱ vṛṣa̍ṇā vī̱tapṛ̍ṣṭhā̱ ni rī̍rama̱n yaja̍mānāso a̱nye   a̱tyāyā̍hi̱ śaśva̍to va̱yaṁ te 'ra̍ṁ su̱tebhi̍ḥ kṛṇavāma̱ somai̍ḥ
English: no other worshippers must stay beside them thy bays thy vigorous and smoothbacked coursers  pass by them all and hasten onward hither with soma pressed we will prepare to feast thee

Sanskrit: tavā̱yaṁ soma̱s tvam ehy a̱rvāṅ cha̍śvatta̱maṁ su̱manā̍ a̱sya pā̍hi   a̱smin ya̱jñe ba̱rhiṣy ā ni̱ṣadyā̍ dadhi̱ṣvemaṁ ja̱ṭhara̱ indu̍m indra
English: thine is this soma hasten to approach it drink thou thereof benevolent and cease not  sit on the sacred grass at this our worship and take these drops into thy belly indra

Sanskrit: stī̱rṇaṁ te̍ ba̱rhiḥ su̱ta i̍ndra̱ soma̍ḥ kṛ̱tā dhā̱nā atta̍ve te̱ hari̍bhyām   tado̍kase puru̱śākā̍ya̱ vṛṣṇe̍ ma̱rutva̍te̱ tubhya̍ṁ rā̱tā ha̱vīṁṣi̍
English: the grass is strewn for thee pressed is the soma; the grain is ready for thy bays to feed on  to thee who lovest them the very mighty strong girt by maruts are these gifts presented

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ nara̱ḥ parva̍tā̱s tubhya̱m āpa̱ḥ sam i̍ndra̱ gobhi̱r madhu̍mantam akran   tasyā̱gatyā̍ su̱manā̍ ṛṣva pāhi prajā̱nan vi̱dvān pa̱thyā̱3̱̍ anu̱ svāḥ
English: this the sweet draught with cows the men the mountains the waters indra have for thee made ready  come drink thereof sublime one friendlyminded foreseeing knowing well the ways thou goest

Sanskrit: yām̐ ābha̍jo ma̱ruta̍ indra̱ some̱ ye tvām ava̍rdha̱nn abha̍van ga̱ṇas te̍   tebhi̍r e̱taṁ sa̱joṣā̍ vāvaśā̱no̱3̱̍ 'gneḥ pi̍ba ji̱hvayā̱ soma̍m indra
English: the maruts they with whom thou sharedst soma indra who made thee strong and were thine army  with these accordant eagerly desirous drink thou this soma with the tongue of agni

Sanskrit: indra̱ piba̍ sva̱dhayā̍ cit su̱tasyā̱gner vā̍ pāhi ji̱hvayā̍ yajatra   a̱dhva̱ryor vā̱ praya̍taṁ śakra̱ hastā̱d dhotu̍r vā ya̱jñaṁ ha̱viṣo̍ juṣasva
English: drink indra of the juice by thine own nature or by the tongue of agni o thou holy  accept the sacrificial gift o śakra from the adhvaryu's hand or from the hotar's

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens whogives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: i̱mām ū̱ ṣu prabhṛ̍tiṁ sā̱taye̍ dhā̱ḥ śaśva̍cchaśvad ū̱tibhi̱r yāda̍mānaḥ   su̱tesu̍te vāvṛdhe̱ vardha̍nebhi̱r yaḥ karma̍bhir ma̱hadbhi̱ḥ suśru̍to̱ bhūt
English: with constant succours fain thyself to share it make this oblation which we bring effective  grown great through strengthening gifts at each libation he hath become renowned by mighty exploits

Sanskrit: indrā̍ya̱ somā̍ḥ pra̱divo̱ vidā̍nā ṛ̱bhur yebhi̱r vṛṣa̍parvā̱ vihā̍yāḥ   pra̱ya̱myamā̍nā̱n prati̱ ṣū gṛ̍bhā̱yendra̱ piba̱ vṛṣa̍dhūtasya̱ vṛṣṇa̍ḥ
English: for indra were the somas erst discovered whereby he grew strongjointed vast and skilful  indra  take quickly these presented juices drink of the strong that which the strong have shaken

Sanskrit: pibā̱ vardha̍sva̱ tava̍ ghā su̱tāsa̱ indra̱ somā̍saḥ pratha̱mā u̱teme   yathāpi̍baḥ pū̱rvyām̐ i̍ndra̱ somā̍m̐ e̱vā pā̍hi̱ panyo̍ a̱dyā navī̍yān
English: drink and wax great thine are the juices indra both somas of old time and these we bring thee  even as thou drankest indra earlier somas so drink today a new guest meet for praises

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ ama̍tro vṛ̱jane̍ vira̱pśy u1̱̍graṁ śava̍ḥ patyate dhṛ̱ṣṇv oja̍ḥ   nāha̍ vivyāca pṛthi̱vī ca̱naina̱ṁ yat somā̍so̱ harya̍śva̱m ama̍ndan
English: great and impetuous mightyvoiced in battle surpassing power is his and strength resistless  him the broad earth hath never comprehended when somas cheered the lord of tawny coursers

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ u̱gro vā̍vṛdhe vī̱ryā̍ya sa̱māca̍kre vṛṣa̱bhaḥ kāvye̍na   indro̱ bhago̍ vāja̱dā a̍sya̱ gāva̱ḥ pra jā̍yante̱ dakṣi̍ṇā asya pū̱rvīḥ
English: mighty and strong he waxed for hero exploit the bull was furnished a sage's wisdom  indra is our kind lord; his steers have vigour; his cows are many with abundant offspring

Sanskrit: pra yat sindha̍vaḥ prasa̱vaṁ yathāya̱nn āpa̍ḥ samu̱draṁ ra̱thye̍va jagmuḥ   ata̍ś ci̱d indra̱ḥ sada̍so̱ varī̍yā̱n yad ī̱ṁ soma̍ḥ pṛ̱ṇati̍ du̱gdho a̱ṁśuḥ
English: as floods according to their stream flow onward so to the sea as borne on cars the waters  vaster is indra even than his dwelling what time the stalk milked out the soma fills him

Sanskrit: sa̱mu̱dreṇa̱ sindha̍vo̱ yāda̍mānā̱ indrā̍ya̱ soma̱ṁ suṣu̍ta̱m bhara̍ntaḥ   a̱ṁśuṁ du̍hanti ha̱stino̍ bha̱ritrai̱r madhva̍ḥ punanti̱ dhāra̍yā pa̱vitrai̍ḥ
English: eager to mingle with the sea the rivers carry the wellpressed soma juice to indra  they drain the stalk out with their arms quickbanded and cleanse it with a stream of mead and filters

Sanskrit: hra̱dā i̍va ku̱kṣaya̍ḥ soma̱dhānā̱ḥ sam ī̍ vivyāca̱ sava̍nā pu̱rūṇi̍   annā̱ yad indra̍ḥ pratha̱mā vy āśa̍ vṛ̱traṁ ja̍gha̱nvām̐ a̍vṛṇīta̱ soma̍m
English: like lakes appear his flanks filled full with soma yea he contains libations in abundance  when indra had consumed the first sweet viands he after slaying vṛtra claimed the soma

Sanskrit: ā tū bha̍ra̱ māki̍r e̱tat pari̍ ṣṭhād vi̱dmā hi tvā̱ vasu̍pati̱ṁ vasū̍nām   indra̱ yat te̱ māhi̍na̱ṁ datra̱m asty a̱smabhya̱ṁ tad dha̍ryaśva̱ pra ya̍ndhi
English: then bring thou hither and let none prevent it we know thee well the lord of wealth and treasure  that splendid gift which is thine own o indra vouchsafe to us lord of the tawny coursers

Sanskrit: a̱sme pra ya̍ndhi maghavann ṛjīṣi̱nn indra̍ rā̱yo vi̱śvavā̍rasya̱ bhūre̍ḥ   a̱sme śa̱taṁ śa̱rado̍ jī̱vase̍ dhā a̱sme vī̱rāñ chaśva̍ta indra śiprin
English: o indra maghavan impetuous mover grant us abundant wealth that brings all blessings  give us a hundred autumns for our lifetime give us o fairchecked indra store of heroes

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on indra maghavan auspicious best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: indra̱ soma̍ṁ somapate̱ pibe̱mam mādhya̍ṁdina̱ṁ sava̍na̱ṁ cāru̱ yat te̍   pra̱pruthyā̱ śipre̍ maghavann ṛjīṣin vi̱mucyā̱ harī̍ i̱ha mā̍dayasva

English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers treasures

Sanskrit: i̱cchanti̍ tvā so̱myāsa̱ḥ sakhā̍yaḥ su̱nvanti̱ soma̱ṁ dadha̍ti̱ prayā̍ṁsi   titi̍kṣante a̱bhiśa̍sti̱ṁ janā̍nā̱m indra̱ tvad ā kaś ca̱na hi pra̍ke̱taḥ
English: the friends who offer soma long to find thee they pour forth soma and present their viands  they bear unmoved the cursing of the people for all our wisdom comes from thee o indra

Sanskrit: na te̍ dū̱re pa̍ra̱mā ci̱d rajā̱ṁsy ā tu pra yā̍hi harivo̱ hari̍bhyām   sthi̱rāya̱ vṛṣṇe̱ sava̍nā kṛ̱temā yu̱ktā grāvā̍ṇaḥ samidhā̱ne a̱gnau
English: not far for thee are midair's loftiest regions start hither lord of bays with thy bay horses  made for the firm and strong are these libations the pressingstones are set and fire is kindled

Sanskrit: indra̍ḥ su̱śipro̍ ma̱ghavā̱ taru̍tro ma̱hāvrā̍tas tuvikū̱rmir ṛghā̍vān   yad u̱gro dhā bā̍dhi̱to martye̍ṣu̱ kva1̱̍ tyā te̍ vṛṣabha vī̱ryā̍ṇi
English: fair cheeks hath indra maghavan the victor lord of a great host stormer strong in action  what once thou didst in might when mortals vexed theewhere now o bull are those thy hero exploits?

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hi ṣmā̍ cyā̱vaya̱nn acyu̍tā̱ny eko̍ vṛ̱trā cara̍si̱ jighna̍mānaḥ   tava̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī parva̍tā̱so 'nu̍ vra̱tāya̱ nimi̍teva tasthuḥ
English: for overthrowing what hath neer been shaken thou goest forth alone destroying vṛtras  for him who followeth thy law the mountains and heaven and earth stand as if firmly stablished

Sanskrit: u̱tābha̍ye puruhūta̱ śravo̍bhi̱r eko̍ dṛ̱ḻham a̍vado vṛtra̱hā san   i̱me ci̍d indra̱ roda̍sī apā̱re yat sa̍ṁgṛ̱bhṇā ma̍ghavan kā̱śir it te̍
English: yea muchinvoked! in safety through thy glories alone thou speakest truth as vṛtra's slayer  een these two boundless worlds to thee o indra what time thou graspest them are but a handful

Sanskrit: pra sū ta̍ indra pra̱vatā̱ hari̍bhyā̱m pra te̱ vajra̍ḥ pramṛ̱ṇann e̍tu̱ śatrū̍n   ja̱hi pra̍tī̱co a̍nū̱caḥ parā̍co̱ viśva̍ṁ sa̱tyaṁ kṛ̍ṇuhi vi̱ṣṭam a̍stu
English: forthwith thy bay steeds down the steep o indra forth crushing foemen go thy bolt of thunder!  slay those who meet thee those who flee who follow make all thy promise true; be all completed

Sanskrit: yasmai̱ dhāyu̱r ada̍dhā̱ martyā̱yābha̍ktaṁ cid bhajate ge̱hya1̱̍ṁ saḥ   bha̱drā ta̍ indra suma̱tir ghṛ̱tācī̍ sa̱hasra̍dānā puruhūta rā̱tiḥ
English: the man to whom thou givest as provider enjoys domestic plenty undivided  blest indra is thy favour dropping fatness thy worship muchinvoked! brings gifts in thousands

Sanskrit: sa̱hadā̍num puruhūta kṣi̱yanta̍m aha̱stam i̍ndra̱ sam pi̍ṇa̱k kuṇā̍rum   a̱bhi vṛ̱traṁ vardha̍māna̱m piyā̍rum a̱pāda̍m indra ta̱vasā̍ jaghantha
English: thou indra muchinvoked! didst crush to pieces kunaru handless fiend who dwelt with danu  thou with might indra smotest dead the scorner the footless vṛtra as he waxed in vigour

Sanskrit: ni sā̍ma̱nām i̍ṣi̱rām i̍ndra̱ bhūmi̍m ma̱hīm a̍pā̱rāṁ sada̍ne sasattha   asta̍bhnā̱d dyāṁ vṛ̍ṣa̱bho a̱ntari̍kṣa̱m arṣa̱ntv āpa̱s tvaye̱ha prasū̍tāḥ
English: thou hast established in her seat o indra the level earth vast vigorous unbounded  the bull hath propped the heaven and air's midregion by thee sent onward let the floods flow hither

Sanskrit: a̱lā̱tṛ̱ṇo va̱la i̍ndra vra̱jo goḥ pu̱rā hanto̱r bhaya̍māno̱ vy ā̍ra   su̱gān pa̱tho a̍kṛṇon ni̱raje̱ gāḥ prāva̱n vāṇī̍ḥ puruhū̱taṁ dhama̍ntīḥ
English: he who withheld the kine in silence i yielded in fear before thy blow o indra  he made paths easy to drive forth the cattle loudbreathing praises helped the muchinvoked one

Sanskrit: eko̱ dve vasu̍matī samī̱cī indra̱ ā pa̍prau pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām   u̱tāntari̍kṣād a̱bhi na̍ḥ samī̱ka i̱ṣo ra̱thīḥ sa̱yuja̍ḥ śūra̱ vājā̍n
English: indra alone filled full the earth and heaven the pair who meet together rich in treasures  yea bring thou near us from the air's midregion strength on thy car and wholesome food o hero

Sanskrit: diśa̱ḥ sūryo̱ na mi̍nāti̱ pradi̍ṣṭā di̱vedi̍ve̱ harya̍śvaprasūtāḥ   saṁ yad āna̱ḻ adhva̍na̱ ād id aśvai̍r vi̱moca̍naṁ kṛṇute̱ tat tv a̍sya
English: sūrya transgresses not the ordered limits set daily by the lord of tawny coursers  when to the goal he comes his journey ended his steeds he looses this is indra's doing

Sanskrit: didṛ̍kṣanta u̱ṣaso̱ yāma̍nn a̱ktor vi̱vasva̍tyā̱ mahi̍ ci̱tram anī̍kam   viśve̍ jānanti mahi̱nā yad āgā̱d indra̍sya̱ karma̱ sukṛ̍tā pu̱rūṇi̍
English: men gladly in the course of night would look on the broad bright front of the refulgent morning;  and all acknowledge when she comes in glory the manifold and goodly works of indra

Sanskrit: mahi̱ jyoti̱r nihi̍taṁ va̱kṣaṇā̍sv ā̱mā pa̱kvaṁ ca̍rati̱ bibhra̍tī̱ gauḥ   viśva̱ṁ svādma̱ sambhṛ̍tam u̱sriyā̍yā̱ṁ yat sī̱m indro̱ ada̍dhā̱d bhoja̍nāya
English: a mighty splendour rests upon her bosom bearing ripe milk the cow unripe advances  all sweetness is collected in the heifer sweetness which indra made for our enjoyment

Sanskrit: indra̱ dṛhya̍ yāmako̱śā a̍bhūvan ya̱jñāya̍ śikṣa gṛṇa̱te sakhi̍bhyaḥ   du̱rmā̱yavo̍ du̱revā̱ martyā̍so niṣa̱ṅgiṇo̍ ri̱pavo̱ hantvā̍saḥ
English: barring the way they come be firm o indra; aid friends to sacrifice and him who singeth  these must be slain by thee malignant mortals armed with ill arts our quiverbearing foemen

Sanskrit: saṁ ghoṣa̍ḥ śṛṇve 'va̱mair a̱mitrai̍r ja̱hī ny e̍ṣv a̱śani̱ṁ tapi̍ṣṭhām   vṛ̱ścem a̱dhastā̱d vi ru̍jā̱ saha̍sva ja̱hi rakṣo̍ maghavan ra̱ndhaya̍sva
English: a cry is beard from enemies most near us against them send thy fiercestflaming weapon  rend them from under crush them and subdue them slay maghavan and make the fiends our booty

Sanskrit: ud vṛ̍ha̱ rakṣa̍ḥ sa̱hamū̍lam indra vṛ̱ścā madhya̱m praty agra̍ṁ śṛṇīhi   ā kīva̍taḥ sala̱lūka̍ṁ cakartha brahma̱dviṣe̱ tapu̍ṣiṁ he̱tim a̍sya
English: root up the race of rākṣasas o indra rend it in front and crush it in the middle  how long hast thou bebaved as one who wavers? cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion

Sanskrit: sva̱staye̍ vā̱jibhi̍ś ca praṇeta̱ḥ saṁ yan ma̱hīr iṣa̍ ā̱satsi̍ pū̱rvīḥ   rā̱yo va̱ntāro̍ bṛha̱taḥ syā̍mā̱sme a̍stu̱ bhaga̍ indra pra̱jāvā̍n
English: when borne by strong steeds for our weal o leader thou seatest thee at many noble viands  may we be winners of abundant riches may indra be our wealth with store of children

Sanskrit: ā no̍ bhara̱ bhaga̍m indra dyu̱manta̱ṁ ni te̍ de̱ṣṇasya̍ dhīmahi prare̱ke   ū̱rva i̍va paprathe̱ kāmo̍ a̱sme tam ā pṛ̍ṇa vasupate̱ vasū̍nām
English: bestow on us resplendent wealth o indra let us enjoy thine overflow of bounty  wide as a sea our longing hath expanded fulfil it o thou treasurelord of treasures

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ kāma̍m mandayā̱ gobhi̱r aśvai̍ś ca̱ndrava̍tā̱ rādha̍sā pa̱pratha̍ś ca   sva̱ryavo̍ ma̱tibhi̱s tubhya̱ṁ viprā̱ indrā̍ya̱ vāha̍ḥ kuśi̱kāso̍ akran
English: with kine and horses satisfy this longing with very splendid bounty skill extend it  seeking the light with hymns to thee o indra kuśikas have brought their gift the singers

Sanskrit: ā no̍ go̱trā da̍rdṛhi gopate̱ gāḥ sam a̱smabhya̍ṁ sa̱nayo̍ yantu̱ vājā̍ḥ   di̱vakṣā̍ asi vṛṣabha sa̱tyaśu̍ṣmo̱ 'smabhya̱ṁ su ma̍ghavan bodhi go̱dāḥ
English: lord of the kine burst the kine's stable open cows shall be ours and strength that wins the booty  hero whose might is true thy home is heaven to us o maghavan grant gifts of cattle

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in this fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: astī̱dam a̍dhi̱mantha̍na̱m asti̍ pra̱jana̍naṁ kṛ̱tam   e̱tāṁ vi̱śpatnī̱m ā bha̍rā̱gnim ma̍nthāma pū̱rvathā̍
English: here is the gear for friction here tinder made ready for the spark  bring thou the matron we will rub agni in ancient fashion forth

Sanskrit: a̱raṇyo̱r nihi̍to jā̱tave̍dā̱ garbha̍ iva̱ sudhi̍to ga̱rbhiṇī̍ṣu   di̱vedi̍va̱ īḍyo̍ jāgṛ̱vadbhi̍r ha̱viṣma̍dbhir manu̱ṣye̍bhir a̱gniḥ
English: 1n the two firesticks jātavedas lieth even as the wellset germ in pregnant women  agni who day by day must be exalted by men who watch and worship with oblations

Sanskrit: u̱ttā̱nāyā̱m ava̍ bharā ciki̱tvān sa̱dyaḥ pravī̍tā̱ vṛṣa̍ṇaṁ jajāna   a̱ru̱ṣastū̍po̱ ruśa̍d asya̱ pāja̱ iḻā̍yās pu̱tro va̱yune̍ 'janiṣṭa
English: lay this with care on that which lies extended straight hath she borne the steer when made prolific  with his red pillarradiant is his splendourin our skilled task is born the son of iḷā

Sanskrit: iḻā̍yās tvā pa̱de va̱yaṁ nābhā̍ pṛthi̱vyā adhi̍   jāta̍vedo̱ ni dhī̍ma̱hy agne̍ ha̱vyāya̱ voḻha̍ve
English: in iḷā's place we set thee down upon the central point of earth  that agni jātavedas thou mayst bear our offerings to the gods

Sanskrit: mantha̍tā naraḥ ka̱vim adva̍yanta̱m prace̍tasam a̱mṛta̍ṁ su̱pratī̍kam   ya̱jñasya̍ ke̱tum pra̍tha̱mam pu̱rastā̍d a̱gniṁ na̍ro janayatā su̱śeva̍m
English: rub into life ye men the sage the guileless immortal very wise and fair to look on  o men bring forth the most propitious agni first ensign of the sacrifice to eastward

Sanskrit: yadī̱ mantha̍nti bā̱hubhi̱r vi ro̍ca̱te 'śvo̱ na vā̱jy a̍ru̱ṣo vane̱ṣv ā   ci̱tro na yāma̍nn a̱śvino̱r ani̍vṛta̱ḥ pari̍ vṛṇa̱kty aśma̍na̱s tṛṇā̱ daha̍n
English: when with their arms they rub him straight he shineth forth like a strong courser red in colour in the wood  bright checkless as it were upon the aśvins' path he passeth by the stones and burneth up the grass

Sanskrit: jā̱to a̱gnī ro̍cate̱ ceki̍tāno vā̱jī vipra̍ḥ kaviśa̱staḥ su̱dānu̍ḥ   yaṁ de̱vāsa̱ īḍya̍ṁ viśva̱vida̍ṁ havya̱vāha̱m ada̍dhur adhva̱reṣu̍
English: agni shines forth when born observant mighty the bountiful the singer praised by sages;  whom as adorable and knowing all things gods set at solemn rites as offeringbearer

Sanskrit: sīda̍ hota̱ḥ sva u̍ lo̱ke ci̍ki̱tvān sā̱dayā̍ ya̱jñaṁ su̍kṛ̱tasya̱ yonau̍   de̱vā̱vīr de̱vān ha̱viṣā̍ yajā̱sy agne̍ bṛ̱had yaja̍māne̱ vayo̍ dhāḥ
English: set thee o priest in thine own place observant lay down the sacrifice in the home of worship  thou dear to gods shalt serve them with oblation agni give long life to the sacrificer

Sanskrit: kṛ̱ṇota̍ dhū̱maṁ vṛṣa̍ṇaṁ sakhā̱yo 'sre̍dhanta itana̱ vāja̱m accha̍   a̱yam a̱gniḥ pṛ̍tanā̱ṣāṭ su̱vīro̱ yena̍ de̱vāso̱ asa̍hanta̱ dasyū̍n
English: raise ye a mighty smoke my fellowworkers! ye shall attain to wealth without obstruction  this agni is the battlewinning hero by whom the gods have overcome the dasyus

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ te̱ yoni̍r ṛ̱tviyo̱ yato̍ jā̱to aro̍cathāḥ   taṁ jā̱nann a̍gna̱ ā sī̱dāthā̍ no vardhayā̱ gira̍ḥ
English: this is thine ordered place of birth whence sprung to life thou shonest forth  knowing this agni sit thee down and prosper thou the songs we sing

Sanskrit: tanū̱napā̍d ucyate̱ garbha̍ āsu̱ro narā̱śaṁso̍ bhavati̱ yad vi̱jāya̍te   mā̱ta̱riśvā̱ yad ami̍mīta mā̱tari̱ vāta̍sya̱ sargo̍ abhava̱t sarī̍maṇi
English: as germ celestial he is called tanūnapāt and narāśaṁsa born diffused in varied shape  formed in his mother he is mātariśvan; he hath in his course become the rapid flight of wind

Sanskrit: su̱ni̱rmathā̱ nirma̍thitaḥ suni̱dhā nihi̍taḥ ka̱viḥ   agne̍ svadhva̱rā kṛ̍ṇu de̱vān de̍vaya̱te ya̍ja
English: with strong attrition rubbed to life laid down with careful hand a sage  agni make sacrifices good and for the pious bring the gods

Sanskrit: ajī̍janann a̱mṛta̱m martyā̍so 'sre̱māṇa̍ṁ ta̱raṇi̍ṁ vī̱ḻuja̍mbham   daśa̱ svasā̍ro a̱gruva̍ḥ samī̱cīḥ pumā̍ṁsaṁ jā̱tam a̱bhi saṁ ra̍bhante
English: mortals have brought to life the god immortal the conqueror with mighty jaws unfailing  the sisters ten unwedded and united together grasp the babe the newborn infant

Sanskrit: pra sa̱ptaho̍tā sana̱kād a̍rocata mā̱tur u̱pasthe̱ yad aśo̍ca̱d ūdha̍ni   na ni mi̍ṣati su̱raṇo̍ di̱vedi̍ve̱ yad asu̍rasya ja̱ṭharā̱d ajā̍yata
English: served by the seven priests he shone forth from ancient time when in his mother's bosom in her lap he glowed  giving delight each day he closeth not his eye since from the asura's body hewas brought to life

Sanskrit: a̱mi̱trā̱yudho̍ ma̱rutā̍m iva pra̱yāḥ pra̍thama̱jā brahma̍ṇo̱ viśva̱m id vi̍duḥ   dyu̱mnava̱d brahma̍ kuśi̱kāsa̱ eri̍ra̱ eka̍eko̱ dame̍ a̱gniṁ sam ī̍dhire
English: even as the maruts onslaughts who attack the foe those born the first of all knew the full power of prayer  the kuśikas have made the glorious hymn ascend and each one singly in his home have kindled fire

Sanskrit: yad a̱dya tvā̍ praya̱ti ya̱jñe a̱smin hota̍ś ciki̱tvo 'vṛ̍ṇīmahī̱ha   dhru̱vam a̍yā dhru̱vam u̱tāśa̍miṣṭhāḥ prajā̱nan vi̱dvām̐ upa̍ yāhi̱ soma̍m
English: as we o priest observant have elected thee this day what time the solemn sacrifice began  so surely hast thou worshipped surely hast thou toiled come thou unto the soma wise and knowing all

Sanskrit: agne̍ ju̱ṣasva̍ no ha̱viḥ pu̍ro̱ḻāśa̍ṁ jātavedaḥ   prā̱ta̱ḥsā̱ve dhi̍yāvaso
English: agni who knowest all accept our offering and the cake of meal  at dawn's libation rich in prayer!

Sanskrit: pu̱ro̱ḻā a̍gne paca̱tas tubhya̍ṁ vā ghā̱ pari̍ṣkṛtaḥ   taṁ ju̍ṣasva yaviṣṭhya
English: agni the sacrificial cake hath been prepared and dressed for thee  accept it o most youthful god

Sanskrit: agne̍ vī̱hi pu̍ro̱ḻāśa̱m āhu̍taṁ ti̱roa̍hnyam   saha̍saḥ sū̱nur a̍sy adhva̱re hi̱taḥ
English: agni enjoy the cake of meal and our oblation three days old  thou son of strength art stablished at our sacrifice
