English: here at the midday sacrifice enjoy thou the sacrificial cake wise jātavedas!  agni the sages in assemblies never minish the portion due to thee the mighty

Sanskrit: agne̍ tṛ̱tīye̱ sava̍ne̱ hi kāni̍ṣaḥ puro̱ḻāśa̍ṁ sahasaḥ sūna̱v āhu̍tam   athā̍ de̱veṣv a̍dhva̱raṁ vi̍pa̱nyayā̱ dhā ratna̍vantam a̱mṛte̍ṣu̱ jāgṛ̍vim
English: o agni at the third libation takewith joy the offered cake of sacrifice thou son of strength  through skill in song bear to the gods our sacrifice watchful and fraught with riches to immortal god

Sanskrit: agne̍ vṛdhā̱na āhu̍tim puro̱ḻāśa̍ṁ jātavedaḥ   ju̱ṣasva̍ ti̱roa̍hnyam
English: o waxing agni knower thou of all accept our gifts the cake  and that prepared ere yesterday

Sanskrit: pra vo̱ vājā̍ a̱bhidya̍vo ha̱viṣma̍nto ghṛ̱tācyā̍   de̱vāñ ji̍gāti sumna̱yuḥ
English: in ladle dropping oil your food goes in oblation up to heaven  goes to the gods in search of bliss

Sanskrit: īḻe̍ a̱gniṁ vi̍pa̱ścita̍ṁ gi̱rā ya̱jñasya̱ sādha̍nam   śru̱ṣṭī̱vāna̍ṁ dhi̱tāvā̍nam
English: agni i laud the sage inspired crowner of sacrifice through song  who listens and gives bounteous gifts

Sanskrit: agne̍ śa̱kema̍ te va̱yaṁ yama̍ṁ de̱vasya̍ vā̱jina̍ḥ   ati̱ dveṣā̍ṁsi tarema
English: o agni if we might obtain control of thee the potent god  then should we overcome our foes

Sanskrit: sa̱mi̱dhyamā̍no adhva̱re̱3̱̍ 'gniḥ pā̍va̱ka īḍya̍ḥ   śo̱ciṣke̍śa̱s tam ī̍mahe
English: kindled at sacrifices he is agni hallower meet for praise  with flame for hair to him we seek

Sanskrit: pṛ̱thu̱pājā̱ ama̍rtyo ghṛ̱tani̍rṇi̱k svā̍hutaḥ   a̱gnir ya̱jñasya̍ havya̱vāṭ
English: immortal agni shining far enrobed with oil well worshipped bears  the gifts of sacrifice away

Sanskrit: taṁ sa̱bādho̍ ya̱tasru̍ca i̱tthā dhi̱yā ya̱jñava̍ntaḥ   ā ca̍krur a̱gnim ū̱taye̍
English: the priests with ladles lifted up worshipping here with holy thought  have brought this agni for our aid

Sanskrit: hotā̍ de̱vo ama̍rtyaḥ pu̱rastā̍d eti mā̱yayā̍   vi̱dathā̍ni praco̱daya̍n
English: immortal sacrificer god with wondrous power he leads the way  urging the great assembly on

Sanskrit: vā̱jī vāje̍ṣu dhīyate 'dhva̱reṣu̱ pra ṇī̍yate   vipro̍ ya̱jñasya̱ sādha̍naḥ
English: strong he is set on deeds ofstrength in sacrifices led in front  as singer he completes the rite

Sanskrit: dhi̱yā ca̍kre̱ vare̍ṇyo bhū̱tānā̱ṁ garbha̱m ā da̍dhe   dakṣa̍sya pi̱tara̱ṁ tanā̍
English: excellent he was made by thought the germ of beings have i gained  yea and die sire of active strength

Sanskrit: ni tvā̍ dadhe̱ vare̍ṇya̱ṁ dakṣa̍sye̱ḻā sa̍haskṛta   agne̍ sudī̱tim u̱śija̍m
English: thee have i stablished excellent o strengthened by the sage's prayer  thee agni longing nobly bright

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ ya̱ntura̍m a̱ptura̍m ṛ̱tasya̱ yoge̍ va̱nuṣa̍ḥ   viprā̱ vājai̱ḥ sam i̍ndhate
English: agni the swift and active one singers at time of sacrifice  eagerly kindle with their food

English: thee will we kindle as a bull we who are bulls ourselves o bull  thee agni shining mightily

English: revering in our heart agni vaiśvānara the finder of the light whose promises are true  the liberal gladsome carborne god we kuśikas invoke him with oblation seeking wealth with songs

English: that agni bright vaiśvānara we invoke for help and mātariśvan worthy of the song of praise;  bṛhaspati for man's observance of the gods the singer prompt to hear the swiftlymoving guest

English: age after age vaiśvānara neighing like a horse is kindled with the women by the kuśikas  may agni he who wakes among immortal gods grant us heroic strength and wealth in noble steeds

English: let them go forth the strong as flames of fire with might gathered for victory they have yoked their spotted deer  pourers of floods the maruts masters of all wealth they who can neer be conquered make the mountains shake

English: the maruts friends of men are glorious as the fire their mighty and resplendent succour we implore  those storming sons of rudra clothed in robes of rain boongivers of good gifts roar as the lions roar

English: bearing in mind a thought with light accordant he purified the sun with three refinings;  by his own nature gained the highest treasure and looked abroad over the earth and heaven

Sanskrit: śa̱tadhā̍ra̱m utsa̱m akṣī̍yamāṇaṁ vipa̱ścita̍m pi̱tara̱ṁ vaktvā̍nām   me̱ḻim mada̍ntam pi̱tror u̱pasthe̱ taṁ ro̍dasī pipṛtaṁ satya̱vāca̍m
English: the spring that fails not with a hundred streamlets father inspired of prayers that men should utter  the sparkler joyous in his parents' bosorn him the truthspeaker sate ye earth and heaven

English: thou art the sapient son of dyaus o agni yes and the child of earth who knowest all things  bring the gods specially thou sage for worship

English: agni the wise bestows the might of heroes grants strengthening food preparing it for nectar  thou who art rich in food bring the gods hither

Sanskrit: a̱gnir dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī vi̱śvaja̍nye̱ ā bhā̍ti de̱vī a̱mṛte̱ amū̍raḥ   kṣaya̱n vājai̍ḥ puruśca̱ndro namo̍bhiḥ
English: agni infallible lights earth and heaven immortal goddesses gracious to all men  lord through his strength splendid through adorations

English: in the floods' home art thou enkindled agni o jātavedas son of strength eternal  exalting with thine help the gatheringplaces

English: set this our sacrifice among the immortals be pleased with these our presents jātavedas  o priest o agni sit thee down before us and first enjoy the drops of oil and fatness

English: for thee o purifier flow the drops of fatness rich in oil  after thy wont vouchsafe to us the choicest boon that gods may feast

English: that light of thine in heaven and earth o agni in plants o holy one and in the waters  wherewith thou hast spread wide the air's midregionbright is that splendour wavy manbeholding

English: o agni to the sea of heaven thou goest thou hast called hither gods beheld in spirit  the waters too come hither those up yonder in the sun's realm of light and those beneath it

English: let fires that dwell in mist combined with those that have their home in floods  guileless accept our sacrifice great viands free from all disease

English: agni as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle lasting rich in marvels  to us be born a son and spreading offspring agni be this thy gracious will to usward

English: both bharatas devaśravas devāvata have strongly rubbed to life effectual agni  o agni look thou forth with ample riches be every day bearer of food to feed us

English: him nobly born of old the fingers ten produced him whom his mothers counted dear  praise devāvata's agni thou devaśravas him who shall be the people's lord

English: o agni many are the names thou bearest immortal god divine and jātavedas  and many charms of charmers allinspirer! have they laid in thee lord of true attendants!

English: agni like bhaga leads the godly people he who is true to law and guards the seasons  ancient allknowing he the vṛtraslayer shall bear the singer safe through every trouble

English: i call on savitar the god on morning bṛhaspati and dadhikrās and agni  on varuṇa and mitra on the aśvins bhaga the vasus rudras and ādityas

English: agni quick sage infallible allknowing i choose to be our priest at this oblation  in our gods service he best skilled shall worship may he obtain us boons for strength and riches

English: agni to thee i lift the oilfed ladle bright with an offering bearing our oblation  from the right hand choosing the gods attendance he with rich presents hath arranged the worship

English: of keenest spirit is the man thou aidest give us good offspring thou who givest freely  in power of wealth most rich in men o agni of thee the good may we sing forth fair praises

English: men as they worship thee the god o agni have set on thee full many a brilliant aspect  so bring most youthful one the gods assembly the heavenly host which thou today shalt honour

Sanskrit: yat tvā̱ hotā̍ram a̱naja̍n mi̱yedhe̍ niṣā̱daya̍nto ya̱jathā̍ya de̱vāḥ   sa tvaṁ no̍ agne 'vi̱teha bo̱dhy adhi̱ śravā̍ṁsi dhehi nas ta̱nūṣu̍
English: when gods anoint thee priest at their oblation and seat thee for thy task as sacrificer  o agni be thou here our kind defender and to ourselves vouchsafe the gift of glory

English: as thou o agni skilful jātavedas hast sacrificed as priest of earth of heaven  so with this offering bring the gods and prosper this sacrifice today as erst for manu

Sanskrit: trīṇy āyū̍ṁṣi̱ tava̍ jātavedas ti̱sra ā̱jānī̍r u̱ṣasa̍s te agne   tābhi̍r de̱vānā̱m avo̍ yakṣi vi̱dvān athā̍ bhava̱ yaja̍mānāya̱ śaṁ yoḥ
English: three are thy times of life o jātavedas and the three mornings are thy births o agni  with these wellknowing grant the gods kind favour and help in stir and stress the man who worships

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ su̍dī̱tiṁ su̱dṛśa̍ṁ gṛ̱ṇanto̍ nama̱syāma̱s tveḍya̍ṁ jātavedaḥ   tvāṁ dū̱tam a̍ra̱tiṁ ha̍vya̱vāha̍ṁ de̱vā a̍kṛṇvann a̱mṛta̍sya̱ nābhi̍m
English: agni most bright and fair with song we honour yea the adorable o jātavedas  thee envoy messenger oblationbearer the gods have made centre of life eternal

Sanskrit: yas tvad dhotā̱ pūrvo̍ agne̱ yajī̍yān dvi̱tā ca̱ sattā̍ sva̱dhayā̍ ca śa̱mbhuḥ   tasyānu̱ dharma̱ pra ya̍jā ciki̱tvo 'thā̍ no dhā adhva̱raṁ de̱vavī̍tau
English: that priest before thee yet more skilled in worship stablished of old healthgiver by his nature  after his custom offer thou who knowest and lay our sacrifice where gods may taste it

Sanskrit: bhavā̍ no agne su̱manā̱ upe̍tau̱ sakhe̍va̱ sakhye̍ pi̱tare̍va sā̱dhuḥ   pu̱ru̱druho̱ hi kṣi̱tayo̱ janā̍nā̱m prati̍ pratī̱cīr da̍hatā̱d arā̍tīḥ
English: agni be kind to us when we approach thee good as a friend to friend as sire and mother  the races of mankind are great oppressors burn up malignity that strives against us

Sanskrit: tapo̱ ṣv a̍gne̱ anta̍rām̐ a̱mitrā̱n tapā̱ śaṁsa̱m ara̍ruṣa̱ḥ para̍sya   tapo̍ vaso cikitā̱no a̱cittā̱n vi te̍ tiṣṭhantām a̱jarā̍ a̱yāsa̍ḥ
English: agni burn up the unfriendly who are near us burn thou the foeman's curse who pays no worship  burn vasu thou who markest well the foolish let thine eternal nimble beams surround thee

Sanskrit: i̱dhmenā̍gna i̱cchamā̍no ghṛ̱tena̍ ju̱homi̍ ha̱vyaṁ tara̍se̱ balā̍ya   yāva̱d īśe̱ brahma̍ṇā̱ vanda̍māna i̱māṁ dhiya̍ṁ śata̱seyā̍ya de̱vīm
English: with fuel agni and with oil desirous mine offering i present for strength and conquest  with prayer so far as i have power adoringthis hymn divine to gain a hundred treasures

Sanskrit: uc cho̱ciṣā̍ sahasas putra stu̱to bṛ̱had vaya̍ḥ śaśamā̱neṣu̍ dhehi   re̱vad a̍gne vi̱śvāmi̍treṣu̱ śaṁ yor ma̍rmṛ̱jmā te̍ ta̱nva1̱̍m bhūri̱ kṛtva̍ḥ
English: give with thy glow thou son of strength when lauded great vital power to those who toil to serve thee  give richly agni to the viśvāmitras in rest and stir oft have we decked thy body

Sanskrit: kṛ̱dhi ratna̍ṁ susanita̱r dhanā̍nā̱ṁ sa ghed a̍gne bhavasi̱ yat sami̍ddhaḥ   sto̱tur du̍ro̱ṇe su̱bhaga̍sya re̱vat sṛ̱prā ka̱rasnā̍ dadhiṣe̱ vapū̍ṁṣi
English: give us o liberal lord great store of riches for agni such art thou when duly kindled  thou in the happy singer's home bestowest amply with arms extended things of beauty

Sanskrit: vi pāja̍sā pṛ̱thunā̱ śośu̍cāno̱ bādha̍sva dvi̱ṣo ra̱kṣaso̱ amī̍vāḥ   su̱śarma̍ṇo bṛha̱taḥ śarma̍ṇi syām a̱gner a̱haṁ su̱hava̍sya̱ praṇī̍tau
English: resplendent with thy wideextending lustre dispel the terrors of the fiends who hate us  may lofty agni be my guide and shelter the easilyinvoked the good protector

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ a̱syā u̱ṣaso̱ vyu̍ṣṭau̱ tvaṁ sūra̱ udi̍te bodhi go̱pāḥ   janme̍va̱ nitya̱ṁ tana̍yaṁ juṣasva̱ stoma̍m me agne ta̱nvā̍ sujāta
English: be thou to us while now the morn is breaking be thou a guardian when the sun hath mounted  accept as men accept a trueborn infant my laud o agni nobly born in body

Sanskrit: tvaṁ nṛ̱cakṣā̍ vṛṣa̱bhānu̍ pū̱rvīḥ kṛ̱ṣṇāsv a̍gne aru̱ṣo vi bhā̍hi   vaso̱ neṣi̍ ca̱ parṣi̱ cāty aṁha̍ḥ kṛ̱dhī no̍ rā̱ya u̱śijo̍ yaviṣṭha
English: bull who beholdest men through many mornings among the dark ones shine forth red o agni  lead us good lord and bear us over trouble help us who long most youthful god to riches

Sanskrit: aṣā̍ḻho agne vṛṣa̱bho di̍dīhi̱ puro̱ viśvā̱ḥ saubha̍gā saṁjigī̱vān   ya̱jñasya̍ ne̱tā pra̍tha̱masya̍ pā̱yor jāta̍vedo bṛha̱taḥ su̍praṇīte
English: shine forth a bull invincible o agni winning by conquest all the forts and treasures  thou jātavedas who art skilled in guiding the chief high saving sacrifice's leader

Sanskrit: acchi̍drā̱ śarma̍ jaritaḥ pu̱rūṇi̍ de̱vām̐ acchā̱ dīdyā̍naḥ sume̱dhāḥ   ratho̱ na sasni̍r a̱bhi va̍kṣi̱ vāja̱m agne̱ tvaṁ roda̍sī naḥ su̱meke̍
English: lighting gods hither agni wisest singer bring thou to us many and flawless shelters  bring vigour like a car that gathers booty bring us o agni beauteous earth and heaven

Sanskrit: pra pī̍paya vṛṣabha̱ jinva̱ vājā̱n agne̱ tvaṁ roda̍sī naḥ su̱doghe̍   de̱vebhi̍r deva su̱rucā̍ rucā̱no mā no̱ marta̍sya durma̱tiḥ pari̍ ṣṭhāt
English: swell o thou bull and give those powers an impulse een earth and heaven who yield their milk in plenty  shining o god with gods in clear effulgence let not a mortal's evil will obstruct us

Sanskrit: iḻā̍m agne puru̱daṁsa̍ṁ sa̱niṁ goḥ śa̍śvatta̱maṁ hava̍mānāya sādha   syān na̍ḥ sū̱nus tana̍yo vi̱jāvāgne̱ sā te̍ suma̱tir bhū̍tv a̱sme
English: agni as holy food to thine invoker give wealth in cattle lasting rich in marvels  to us be born a son and spreading offspring agni be this thy gracious will to usward

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ de̱vāyā̱gnaye̱ barhi̍ṣṭham arcāsmai   gama̍d de̱vebhi̱r ā sa no̱ yaji̍ṣṭho ba̱rhir ā sa̍dat
English: to agni to this god of yours i sing aloud with utmost power  may he come to us with the gods and sit best offerer on the grass

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tāvā̱ yasya̱ roda̍sī̱ dakṣa̱ṁ saca̍nta ū̱taya̍ḥ   ha̱viṣma̍nta̱s tam ī̍ḻate̱ taṁ sa̍ni̱ṣyanto 'va̍se
English: the holy whose are earth and heaven and succour waits upon his strength;  him men who bring oblations laud and they who wish to gain for grace

Sanskrit: sa ya̱ntā vipra̍ eṣā̱ṁ sa ya̱jñānā̱m athā̱ hi ṣaḥ   a̱gniṁ taṁ vo̍ duvasyata̱ dātā̱ yo vani̍tā ma̱gham
English: he is the sage who guides these men leader of sacred rites is he  him your own agni serve ye well who winneth and bestoweth wealth

Sanskrit: sa na̱ḥ śarmā̍ṇi vī̱taye̱ 'gnir ya̍cchatu̱ śaṁta̍mā   yato̍ naḥ pru̱ṣṇava̱d vasu̍ di̱vi kṣi̱tibhyo̍ a̱psv ā
English: so may the gracious agni grant most goodly shelter for our use;  whence in the heavens or in the floods he shall pour wealth upon our lands

Sanskrit: dī̱di̱vāṁsa̱m apū̍rvya̱ṁ vasvī̍bhir asya dhī̱tibhi̍ḥ   ṛkvā̍ṇo a̱gnim i̍ndhate̱ hotā̍raṁ vi̱śpati̍ṁ vi̱śām
English: the singers kindle him the priest agni the lord of tribes of men  resplendent and without a peer through his own excellent designs

Sanskrit: u̱ta no̱ brahma̍nn aviṣa u̱ktheṣu̍ deva̱hūta̍maḥ   śaṁ na̍ḥ śocā ma̱rudvṛ̱dho 'gne̍ sahasra̱sāta̍maḥ
English: help us thou brahman best of all invokers of the gods in song  beam friend of maruts bliss on us o agni a most liberal god

Sanskrit: nū no̍ rāsva sa̱hasra̍vat to̱kava̍t puṣṭi̱mad vasu̍   dyu̱mad a̍gne su̱vīrya̱ṁ varṣi̍ṣṭha̱m anu̍pakṣitam
English: yea grant us treasure thousandfold with children and with nourishment  and agni splendid hero strength exalted wasting not away

Sanskrit: ā hotā̍ ma̱ndro vi̱dathā̍ny asthāt sa̱tyo yajvā̍ ka̱vita̍ma̱ḥ sa ve̱dhāḥ   vi̱dyudra̍tha̱ḥ saha̍sas pu̱tro a̱gniḥ śo̱ciṣke̍śaḥ pṛthi̱vyām pājo̍ aśret
English: the pleasant priest is come into the synod true skilled in sacrifice most wise ordainer  agni the son of strength whose car is lightning whose hair is flame hath shown on earth his lustre

Sanskrit: ayā̍mi te̱ nama̍üktiṁ juṣasva̱ ṛtā̍va̱s tubhya̱ṁ ceta̍te sahasvaḥ   vi̱dvām̐ ā va̍kṣi vi̱duṣo̱ ni ṣa̍tsi̱ madhya̱ ā ba̱rhir ū̱taye̍ yajatra
English: to thee i offer reverent speech accept it to thee who markest it victorious faithful!  bring thou who knowest those who know and seat thee amid the sacred grass for help o holy

Sanskrit: drava̍tāṁ ta u̱ṣasā̍ vā̱jaya̍ntī̱ agne̱ vāta̍sya pa̱thyā̍bhi̱r accha̍   yat sī̍m a̱ñjanti̍ pū̱rvyaṁ ha̱virbhi̱r ā va̱ndhure̍va tasthatur duro̱ṇe
English: the two who show their vigour night and morning by the wind's paths shall haste to thee o agni  when men adorn the ancient with oblations these seek as on two chariotseats the dwelling

Sanskrit: mi̱traś ca̱ tubhya̱ṁ varu̍ṇaḥ saha̱svo 'gne̱ viśve̍ ma̱ruta̍ḥ su̱mnam a̍rcan   yac cho̱ciṣā̍ sahasas putra̱ tiṣṭhā̍ a̱bhi kṣi̱tīḥ pra̱thaya̱n sūryo̱ nṝn
English: to thee strong agni! varuṇa and mitra and all the maruts sang a song of triumph  what time unto the people's lands thou camest spreading them as the sun of men with lustre

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ te̍ a̱dya ra̍ri̱mā hi kāma̍m uttā̱naha̍stā̱ nama̍sopa̱sadya̍   yaji̍ṣṭhena̱ mana̍sā yakṣi de̱vān asre̍dhatā̱ manma̍nā̱ vipro̍ agne
English: approaching with raised hands and adoration we have this day fulfilled for thee thy longing  worship the gods with most devoted spirit a priest with no unfriendly thought o agni

Sanskrit: tvad dhi pu̍tra sahaso̱ vi pū̱rvīr de̱vasya̱ yanty ū̱tayo̱ vi vājā̍ḥ   tvaṁ de̍hi saha̱sriṇa̍ṁ ra̱yiṁ no̍ 'dro̱gheṇa̱ vaca̍sā sa̱tyam a̍gne
English: for son of strength from thee come many succours and powers abundant that a god possesses  agni to us with speech that hath no falsehood grant riches real to be told in thousands

Sanskrit: tubhya̍ṁ dakṣa kavikrato̱ yānī̱mā deva̱ martā̍so adhva̱re aka̍rma   tvaṁ viśva̍sya su̱ratha̍sya bodhi̱ sarva̱ṁ tad a̍gne amṛta svade̱ha
English: whatever god in sacrifice we mortals have wrought is all for thee strong wise of purpose!  be thou the friend of each good chariot's master all this enjoy thou here immortal agni

Sanskrit: a̱yam a̱gniḥ su̱vīrya̱syeśe̍ ma̱haḥ saubha̍gasya   rā̱ya ī̍śe svapa̱tyasya̱ goma̍ta̱ īśe̍ vṛtra̱hathā̍nām
English: this agni is the lord of great felicity and hero strength;  lord of wealth in herds of kine; lord of the battles with the foe

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ na̍ro marutaḥ saścatā̱ vṛdha̱ṁ yasmi̱n rāya̱ḥ śevṛ̍dhāsaḥ   a̱bhi ye santi̱ pṛta̍nāsu dū̱ḍhyo̍ vi̱śvāhā̱ śatru̍m āda̱bhuḥ
English: wait maruts heroes upon him the prosperer in whom is blissincreasing wealth;  who in fights ever conquer evilhearted men who overcome the enemy

Sanskrit: sa tvaṁ no̍ rā̱yaḥ śi̍śīhi̱ mīḍhvo̍ agne su̱vīrya̍sya   tuvi̍dyumna̱ varṣi̍ṣṭhasya pra̱jāva̍to 'namī̱vasya̍ śu̱ṣmiṇa̍ḥ
English: as such o agni deal us wealth and hero might o bounteous one!  most lofty very glorious rich in progeny free from disease and full of power

Sanskrit: cakri̱r yo viśvā̱ bhuva̍nā̱bhi sā̍sa̱hiś cakri̍r de̱veṣv ā duva̍ḥ   ā de̱veṣu̱ yata̍ta̱ ā su̱vīrya̱ ā śaṁsa̍ u̱ta nṛ̱ṇām
English: he who made all that lives who passes all in might who orders service to the gods  he works among the gods he works in hero strength yea also in the praise of men

Sanskrit: mā no̍ a̱gne 'ma̍taye̱ māvīra̍tāyai rīradhaḥ   māgotā̍yai sahasas putra̱ mā ni̱de 'pa̱ dveṣā̱ṁsy ā kṛ̍dhi
English: give us not up to indigence agni nor want of hero sons  nor son of strength to lack of cattle nor to blame drive thou our enemies away

Sanskrit: śa̱gdhi vāja̍sya subhaga pra̱jāva̱to 'gne̍ bṛha̱to a̍dhva̱re   saṁ rā̱yā bhūya̍sā sṛja mayo̱bhunā̱ tuvi̍dyumna̱ yaśa̍svatā
English: help us to strength blest agni! rich in progeny abundant in our sacrifice  flood us with riches yet more plenteous bringing weal with high renown most glorious one!

Sanskrit: indrā̍gnī̱ ā ga̍taṁ su̱taṁ gī̱rbhir nabho̱ vare̍ṇyam   a̱sya pā̍taṁ dhi̱yeṣi̱tā
English: moved indraagni by our hymn come to the juice the precious dew  drink ye thereof impelled by song

Sanskrit: indrā̍gnī jari̱tuḥ sacā̍ ya̱jño ji̍gāti̱ ceta̍naḥ   a̱yā pā̍tam i̱maṁ su̱tam
English: o indraagni with the man who lauds you comes the wakening rite  so drink ye both this juice assured

Sanskrit: indra̍m a̱gniṁ ka̍vi̱cchadā̍ ya̱jñasya̍ jū̱tyā vṛ̍ṇe   tā soma̍sye̱ha tṛ̍mpatām
English: through force of sacrifice i choose indraagni who love the wise  with soma let these sate them here

Sanskrit: to̱śā vṛ̍tra̱haṇā̍ huve sa̱jitvā̱nāpa̍rājitā   i̱ndrā̱gnī vā̍ja̱sāta̍mā
English: indra and agni i invoke jointvictors bounteous unsubdued  foeslayers best to win the spoil

Sanskrit: pra vā̍m arcanty u̱kthino̍ nīthā̱vido̍ jari̱tāra̍ḥ   indrā̍gnī̱ iṣa̱ ā vṛ̍ṇe
English: indra and agni singers skilled in melody hymn you bringing lauds  i choose you for the sacred food

Sanskrit: indrā̍gnī nava̱tim puro̍ dā̱sapa̍tnīr adhūnutam   sā̱kam eke̍na̱ karma̍ṇā
English: indra and agni ye cast down the ninety forts which dāsas held  together with one mighty deed

Sanskrit: indrā̍gnī̱ apa̍sa̱s pary upa̱ pra ya̍nti dhī̱taya̍ḥ   ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱thyā̱3̱̍ anu̍
English: to indraagni reverent thoughts go forward from the holy task  along the path of sacred law

Sanskrit: indrā̍gnī tavi̱ṣāṇi̍ vāṁ sa̱dhasthā̍ni̱ prayā̍ṁsi ca   yu̱vor a̱ptūrya̍ṁ hi̱tam
English: o indraagni powers are yours and dwellings and delightful food  good is your readiness to act

Sanskrit: indrā̍gnī roca̱nā di̱vaḥ pari̱ vāje̍ṣu bhūṣathaḥ   tad vā̍ṁ ceti̱ pra vī̱rya̍m
English: indra and agni in your deeds of might ye deck heaven's lucid realms  famed is that hero strength of yours

Sanskrit: sakhā̍yas tvā vavṛmahe de̱vam martā̍sa ū̱taye̍   a̱pāṁ napā̍taṁ su̱bhaga̍ṁ su̱dīdi̍tiṁ su̱pratū̍rtim ane̱hasa̍m
English: we as thy friends have chosen thee mortals a god to be our help  the waters child the blessed the resplendent one victorious and beyond compare

Sanskrit: kāya̍māno va̱nā tvaṁ yan mā̱tṝr aja̍gann a̱paḥ   na tat te̍ agne pra̱mṛṣe̍ ni̱varta̍na̱ṁ yad dū̱re sann i̱hābha̍vaḥ
English: since thou delighting in the woods hast gone unto thy mother streams  not to be scorned agni is that return of thine when from afar thou now art here

Sanskrit: ati̍ tṛ̱ṣṭaṁ va̍vakṣi̱thāthai̱va su̱manā̍ asi   praprā̱nye yanti̱ pary a̱nya ā̍sate̱ yeṣā̍ṁ sa̱khye asi̍ śri̱taḥ
English: o'er pungent smoke host thou prevailed and thus art thou benevolent  some go before and others round about thee sit they in whose friendship thou hast place

Sanskrit: ī̱yi̱vāṁsa̱m ati̱ sridha̱ḥ śaśva̍tī̱r ati̍ sa̱ścata̍ḥ   anv ī̍m avindan nici̱rāso̍ a̱druho̱ 'psu si̱ṁham i̍va śri̱tam
English: him who had passed beyond his foes beyond continual pursuits him the unerring ones observant found in floods couched like a lion in his lair

Sanskrit: sa̱sṛ̱vāṁsa̍m iva̱ tmanā̱gnim i̱tthā ti̱rohi̍tam   aina̍ṁ nayan māta̱riśvā̍ parā̱vato̍ de̱vebhyo̍ mathi̱tam pari̍
English: him wandering at his own free will agni here hidden from our view  him mātariśvan brought to us from far away produced by friction from the gods

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̱ martā̍ agṛbhṇata de̱vebhyo̍ havyavāhana   viśvā̱n yad ya̱jñām̐ a̍bhi̱pāsi̍ mānuṣa̱ tava̱ kratvā̍ yaviṣṭhya
English: o bearer of oblations thus mortals received thee from the gods  whilst thou the friend of man guardest each sacrifice with thine own power most youthful one

Sanskrit: tad bha̱draṁ tava̍ da̱ṁsanā̱ pākā̍ya cic chadayati   tvāṁ yad a̍gne pa̱śava̍ḥ sa̱māsa̍te̱ sami̍ddham apiśarva̱re
English: amid thy wonders this is good yea to the simple is it clear  when gathered round about thee agni lie the herds where thou art kindled in the morn

Sanskrit: ā ju̍hotā svadhva̱raṁ śī̱ram pā̍va̱kaśo̍ciṣam   ā̱śuṁ dū̱tam a̍ji̱ram pra̱tnam īḍya̍ṁ śru̱ṣṭī de̱vaṁ sa̍paryata
English: offer to him who knows fair rites who burns with purifying glow  swift envoy active ancient and adorable serve ye the god attentively

Sanskrit: trīṇi̍ śa̱tā trī sa̱hasrā̍ṇy a̱gniṁ tri̱ṁśac ca̍ de̱vā nava̍ cāsaparyan   aukṣa̍n ghṛ̱tair astṛ̍ṇan ba̱rhir a̍smā̱ ād id dhotā̍ra̱ṁ ny a̍sādayanta
English: three times a hundred gods and thrice a thousand and three times ten and nine have worshipped agni  for him spread sacred grass with oil bedewed him and stablished him as priest and sacrificer

Sanskrit: a̱gnir hotā̍ pu̱rohi̍to 'dhva̱rasya̱ vica̍rṣaṇiḥ   sa ve̍da ya̱jñam ā̍nu̱ṣak
English: agni is priest the great high priest of sacrifice most swift in act  he knows the rite in constant course

Sanskrit: sa ha̍vya̱vāḻ ama̍rtya u̱śig dū̱taś cano̍hitaḥ   a̱gnir dhi̱yā sam ṛ̍ṇvati
English: oblationbearer deathless well inclined an eager messenger  agni comes nigh us with the thought

Sanskrit: a̱gnir dhi̱yā sa ce̍tati ke̱tur ya̱jñasya̍ pū̱rvyaḥ   artha̱ṁ hy a̍sya ta̱raṇi̍
English: ensign of sacrifice from of old agni well knoweth with his thought  to prosper this man's aim and hope

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ sū̱nuṁ sana̍śruta̱ṁ saha̍so jā̱tave̍dasam   vahni̍ṁ de̱vā a̍kṛṇvata
English: agni illustrious from old time the son of strength who knows all life  the gods have made to their priest

Sanskrit: adā̍bhyaḥ purae̱tā vi̱śām a̱gnir mānu̍ṣīṇām   tūrṇī̱ ratha̱ḥ sadā̱ nava̍ḥ
English: infallible is agni he who goes before the tribes of men  a chariot swift and ever new

Sanskrit: sā̱hvān viśvā̍ abhi̱yuja̱ḥ kratu̍r de̱vānā̱m amṛ̍ktaḥ   a̱gnis tu̱viśra̍vastamaḥ
English: strength of the gods which none may harm subduing all his enemies  agni is mightiest in fame

Sanskrit: a̱bhi prayā̍ṁsi̱ vāha̍sā dā̱śvām̐ a̍śnoti̱ martya̍ḥ   kṣaya̍m pāva̱kaśo̍ciṣaḥ
English: by offering sacred food to him the mortal worshipper obtains  a home from him whose light makes pure

Sanskrit: pari̱ viśvā̍ni̱ sudhi̍tā̱gner a̍śyāma̱ manma̍bhiḥ   viprā̍so jā̱tave̍dasaḥ
English: from agni by our hymns may we gain all things that bring happiness  singers of him who knows all life

Sanskrit: agne̱ viśvā̍ni̱ vāryā̱ vāje̍ṣu saniṣāmahe   tve de̱vāsa̱ eri̍re
English: o agni in our deeds of might may we obtain all precious things  tle gods are centred all in thee

Sanskrit: praty a̱gnir u̱ṣasa̱ś ceki̍tā̱no 'bo̍dhi̱ vipra̍ḥ pada̱vīḥ ka̍vī̱nām   pṛ̱thu̱pājā̍ deva̱yadbhi̱ḥ sami̱ddho 'pa̱ dvārā̱ tama̍so̱ vahni̍r āvaḥ
English: agni who shines against the dawns is wakened the holy singer who precedes the sages  with farspread lustre kindled by the pious the priest hath thrown both gates of darkness open

Sanskrit: pred v a̱gnir vā̍vṛdhe̱ stome̍bhir gī̱rbhiḥ sto̍tṝ̱ṇāṁ na̍ma̱sya̍ u̱kthaiḥ   pū̱rvīr ṛ̱tasya̍ sa̱ṁdṛśa̍ś cakā̱naḥ saṁ dū̱to a̍dyaud u̱ṣaso̍ viro̱ke
English: agni hath waxen mighty by laudations to be adored with hymns of those who praise him  loving the varied shows of holy order at the first flush of dawn he shines as envoy

English: the earth's the bird's dear lofty place he guardeth he guardeth in his might the course of sūrya  guardeth the sevenheaded in the centre guardeth sublime the deities enjoyment

English: the skilful god who knows all forms of knowledge made for himself a fair form meet for worship  this agni guards with care that never ceases the soma's skin the bird's place rich in fatness

English: agni hath entered longingly the longing shrine rich with fatness giving easy access  resplendent pure sublime and purifying again again he renovates his mothers

Sanskrit: sa̱dyo jā̱ta oṣa̍dhībhir vavakṣe̱ yadī̱ vardha̍nti pra̱svo̍ ghṛ̱tena̍   āpa̍ iva pra̱vatā̱ śumbha̍mānā uru̱ṣyad a̱gniḥ pi̱tror u̱pasthe̍
English: born suddenly by plants he grew to greatness when tender shoots with holy oil increased him  like waters lovely when they hasten downward may agni in his parents' lap protect us

Sanskrit: ud u̍ ṣṭu̱taḥ sa̱midhā̍ ya̱hvo a̍dyau̱d varṣma̍n di̱vo adhi̱ nābhā̍ pṛthi̱vyāḥ   mi̱tro a̱gnir īḍyo̍ māta̱riśvā dū̱to va̍kṣad ya̱jathā̍ya de̱vān
English: extolled the strong shone forth with kindled fuel to the earth's centre to the height of heaven  may agni friend adorable mātariśvan as envoy bring the gods unto our worship

English: best of all luminaries lofty agni supported with his flame the height of heaven  when far from bhṛgus mātariśvan kindled the oblationbearer where he lay in secret

English: as holy food agni to thine invoker give wealth in cattle lasting rich in marvels  to us be born a son and spreading offspring agni be this thy gracious will to usword

English: thee agni god imperial lord of all mankind do mortal men  with understanding kindle at the sacrifice

Sanskrit: tvāṁ ya̱jñeṣv ṛ̱tvija̱m agne̱ hotā̍ram īḻate   go̱pā ṛ̱tasya̍ dīdihi̱ sve dame̍
English: they laud thee in their solemn rites agni as minister and priest  shine forth in thine own home as guardian of the law

English: he verily who honours thee with fuel knower of all life  he agni! wins heroic might he prospers well

Sanskrit: sa ke̱tur a̍dhva̱rāṇā̍m a̱gnir de̱vebhi̱r ā ga̍mat   a̱ñjā̱naḥ sa̱pta hotṛ̍bhir ha̱viṣma̍te
English: ensign of sacrifices he agni with gods is come to us  decked by the seven priests to him who bringeth gifts

English: to agni the invoking priest offer your best your lofty speech  to him ordainerlike who brings the light of songs

English: let these our hymns make agni grow whence meet for laud he springs to life  to mighty strength and great possession fair to see

English: best sacrificer bring the gods o agni to the pious man  a joyful priest thy splendour drive our foes afar

English: as such o purifier shine on us heroic glorious might  be nearest friend to those who laud thee for their weal

English: so wakeful versed in sacred hymns the holy singers kindly thee  oblationbearer deathless cherisher of strength

English: urged on by deep devotion o ye singers bring pious ones the godapproaching ladle  borne onward to the right it travels eastward and filled with oil to agni bears oblation

English: thou at thy birth didst fill both earth and heaven yea most adorable thou didst exceed them  even through the heaven's and through the earth's expanses let thy swift seventongued flames roll on o agni

English: both heaven and earth and gods who should be worshipped establish thee as priest for every dwelling  whenever human families goddevoted bringing oblations; laud thy splendid lustre

English: wise master wealthy finderout of riches he mounted those who may with case be guided  he darkbacked manifold with varied aspect hath made them burst forth from their food the brushwood

Sanskrit: sa̱mitsa̍mit su̱manā̍ bodhy a̱sme śu̱cāśu̍cā suma̱tiṁ rā̍si̱ vasva̍ḥ   ā de̍va de̱vān ya̱jathā̍ya vakṣi̱ sakhā̱ sakhī̍n su̱manā̍ yakṣy agne
English: be friendly with each kindled log of fuel with every flash bestow the boon of riches  bring thou the gods o god unto our worship serve wellinclined as friend thy friends o agni

Sanskrit: yaṁ de̱vāsa̱s trir aha̍nn ā̱yaja̍nte di̱vedi̍ve̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̱gniḥ   semaṁ ya̱jñam madhu̍mantaṁ kṛdhī na̱s tanū̍napād ghṛ̱tayo̍niṁ vi̱dhanta̍m
English: agni whom daily varuṇa and mitra the gods bring thrice a day to this our worship  tanūnapāt enrich with meath our service that dwells with holy oil that offers honour

Sanskrit: pra dīdhi̍tir vi̱śvavā̍rā jigāti̱ hotā̍ram i̱ḻaḥ pra̍tha̱maṁ yaja̍dhyai   acchā̱ namo̍bhir vṛṣa̱bhaṁ va̱ndadhyai̱ sa de̱vān ya̍kṣad iṣi̱to yajī̍yān
English: the thought that bringeth every boon proceedeth to worship first the priest of the libation  that we may greet the strong one with our homage urged may he bring the gods best sacrificer

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvo vā̍ṁ gā̱tur a̍dhva̱re a̍kāry ū̱rdhvā śo̱cīṁṣi̱ prasthi̍tā̱ rajā̍ṁsi   di̱vo vā̱ nābhā̱ ny a̍sādi̱ hotā̍ stṛṇī̱mahi̍ de̱vavya̍cā̱ vi ba̱rhiḥ
English: on high your way to sacrifice was made ready; the radiant flames went upward to the regions  full in the midst of heaven the priest is seated sirew we the sacred grass where gods may rest them

Sanskrit: sa̱pta ho̱trāṇi̱ mana̍sā vṛṇā̱nā inva̍nto̱ viśva̱m prati̍ yann ṛ̱tena̍   nṛ̱peśa̍so vi̱dathe̍ṣu̱ pra jā̱tā a̱bhī̱3̱̍maṁ ya̱jñaṁ vi ca̍ranta pū̱rvīḥ
English: claiming in mind the seven priests' burntoblations inciting all they came in settled order  to this our sacrifice approach the many who show in hero beauty at assemblies

Sanskrit: ā bhanda̍māne u̱ṣasā̱ upā̍ke u̱ta sma̍yete ta̱nvā̱3̱̍ virū̍pe   yathā̍ no mi̱tro varu̍ṇo̱ jujo̍ṣa̱d indro̍ ma̱rutvā̍m̐ u̱ta vā̱ maho̍bhiḥ
English: night and dawn lauded hither come together both smiling different are their forms in colour  that varuṇa and mitra may accept us and indra girt by maruts with his glories

Sanskrit: daivyā̱ hotā̍rā pratha̱mā ny ṛ̍ñje sa̱pta pṛ̱kṣāsa̍ḥ sva̱dhayā̍ madanti   ṛ̱taṁ śaṁsa̍nta ṛ̱tam it ta ā̍hu̱r anu̍ vra̱taṁ vra̍ta̱pā dīdhyā̍nāḥ
English: i crave the grace of heaven's two chief invokers the seven swift steeds joy in their wonted manner  these speak of truth praising the truth eternal thinking on order as the guards of order

Sanskrit: ā bhāra̍tī̱ bhāra̍tībhiḥ sa̱joṣā̱ iḻā̍ de̱vair ma̍nu̱ṣye̍bhir a̱gniḥ   sara̍svatī sārasva̱tebhi̍r a̱rvāk ti̱sro de̱vīr ba̱rhir edaṁ sa̍dantu
English: may bhāratī with all her sisters iḷā accordant with the gods with mortalls agni  sarasvatī with all her kindred rivers come to this grass three goddesses and seat them

Sanskrit: tan na̍s tu̱rīpa̱m adha̍ poṣayi̱tnu deva̍ tvaṣṭa̱r vi ra̍rā̱ṇaḥ sya̍sva   yato̍ vī̱raḥ ka̍rma̱ṇya̍ḥ su̱dakṣo̍ yu̱ktagrā̍vā̱ jāya̍te de̱vakā̍maḥ
English: well pleased with us do thou o god o tvaṣṭar give ready issue to our procreant vigour  whence springs the hero powerful skilled in action lover of gods adjuster of the pressstones

Sanskrit: vana̍spa̱te 'va̍ sṛ̱jopa̍ de̱vān a̱gnir ha̱viḥ śa̍mi̱tā sū̍dayāti   sed u̱ hotā̍ sa̱tyata̍ro yajāti̱ yathā̍ de̱vānā̱ṁ jani̍māni̱ veda̍
English: send to the gods the oblation lord of forests; and let the immolator agni dress it  he as the truer priest shall offer worship for the gods generations well he knoweth

Sanskrit: ā yā̍hy agne samidhā̱no a̱rvāṅ indre̍ṇa de̱vaiḥ sa̱ratha̍ṁ tu̱rebhi̍ḥ   ba̱rhir na̍ āstā̱m adi̍tiḥ supu̱trā svāhā̍ de̱vā a̱mṛtā̍ mādayantām
English: come thou to us o agni duly kindled together with the potent gods and indra  on this our grass sit aditi happy mother and let our hail delight the gods immortal

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱rāya̍ dhi̱ṣaṇā̍m ṛtā̱vṛdhe̍ ghṛ̱taṁ na pū̱tam a̱gnaye̍ janāmasi   dvi̱tā hotā̍ra̱m manu̍ṣaś ca vā̱ghato̍ dhi̱yā ratha̱ṁ na kuli̍śa̱ḥ sam ṛ̍ṇvati
English: to him vaiśvānara who strengthens holy law to agni we present our praise like oil made pure  with thoughtful insight human priests bring him anear our herald from of old as an axe forms a car

Sanskrit: sa ro̍cayaj ja̱nuṣā̱ roda̍sī u̱bhe sa mā̱tror a̍bhavat pu̱tra īḍya̍ḥ   ha̱vya̱vāḻ a̱gnir a̱jara̱ś cano̍hito dū̱ḻabho̍ vi̱śām ati̍thir vi̱bhāva̍suḥ
English: he made the heaven and earth resplendent by his birth child of two mothers he was meet to be implored  agni oblationbearer gracious everyoung infallible rich in radiant light the guest of men

Sanskrit: kratvā̱ dakṣa̍sya̱ taru̍ṣo̱ vidha̍rmaṇi de̱vāso̍ a̱gniṁ ja̍nayanta̱ citti̍bhiḥ   ru̱ru̱cā̱nam bhā̱nunā̱ jyoti̍ṣā ma̱hām atya̱ṁ na vāja̍ṁ sani̱ṣyann upa̍ bruve
English: within the range of their surpassinq power by might the gods created agni with inventive thought  i eager to win strength address him like a steed resplendent with his brilliance with his ample light

Sanskrit: ā ma̱ndrasya̍ sani̱ṣyanto̱ vare̍ṇyaṁ vṛṇī̱mahe̱ ahra̍ya̱ṁ vāja̍m ṛ̱gmiya̍m   rā̱tim bhṛgū̍ṇām u̱śija̍ṁ ka̱vikra̍tum a̱gniṁ rāja̍ntaṁ di̱vyena̍ śo̱ciṣā̍
English: eager to gain we crave from him the friendly god strength confident choiceworthy meet to be extolled  the bhṛgus' bounty willing strong with sages' lore even agni shining forth with light that comes from heaven

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ su̱mnāya̍ dadhire pu̱ro janā̱ vāja̍śravasam i̱ha vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣaḥ   ya̱tasru̍caḥ su̱ruca̍ṁ vi̱śvade̍vyaṁ ru̱draṁ ya̱jñānā̱ṁ sādha̍diṣṭim a̱pasā̍m
English: for happiness men having trimmed the sacred grass set agni glorious for his strength before them here;  yea with raised ladles him bright dear to all the gods perfecting aims of works rudra of solemn rites

Sanskrit: pāva̍kaśoce̱ tava̱ hi kṣaya̱m pari̱ hota̍r ya̱jñeṣu̍ vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣo̱ nara̍ḥ   agne̱ duva̍ i̱cchamā̍nāsa̱ āpya̱m upā̍sate̱ dravi̍ṇaṁ dhehi̱ tebhya̍ḥ
English: around thy dwellingplace o brightlyshining priest are men at sacrifice whose sacred grass is trimmed  wishing to do thee service agni they are there desirous of thy friendship grant them store of wealth

Sanskrit: ā roda̍sī apṛṇa̱d ā sva̍r ma̱haj jā̱taṁ yad e̍nam a̱paso̱ adhā̍rayan   so a̍dhva̱rāya̱ pari̍ ṇīyate ka̱vir atyo̱ na vāja̍sātaye̱ cano̍hitaḥ
English: he hath filled heaven and earth and the great realm of light when at his birth the skilful held him in their hold  he like a horse is led forth to the sacrifice sage graciously inclined that he may win us strength

Sanskrit: na̱ma̱syata̍ ha̱vyadā̍tiṁ svadhva̱raṁ du̍va̱syata̱ damya̍ṁ jā̱tave̍dasam   ra̱thīr ṛ̱tasya̍ bṛha̱to vica̍rṣaṇir a̱gnir de̱vānā̍m abhavat pu̱rohi̍taḥ
English: honour the oblationbearer him who knows fair rites serve ye the household friend who knows all things that be  he drives the chariot of the lofty ordinance agni most active is the great high priest of gods

Sanskrit: ti̱sro ya̱hvasya̍ sa̱midha̱ḥ pari̍jmano̱ 'gner a̍punann u̱śijo̱ amṛ̍tyavaḥ   tāsā̱m ekā̱m ada̍dhu̱r martye̱ bhuja̍m u lo̱kam u̱ dve upa̍ jā̱mim ī̍yatuḥ
English: they who are free from death fain for him purified three splendours of the mighty agni circling all  to man for his enjoyment one of these they gave the other two have passed into the sister sphere

Sanskrit: vi̱śāṁ ka̱viṁ vi̱śpati̱m mānu̍ṣī̱r iṣa̱ḥ saṁ sī̍m akṛṇva̱n svadhi̍ti̱ṁ na teja̍se   sa u̱dvato̍ ni̱vato̍ yāti̱ vevi̍ṣa̱t sa garbha̍m e̱ṣu bhuva̍neṣu dīdharat
English: man's sacrificial food hath sharpened like an axe for brightness him the sage of men the people's lord  busied with sacred rites he mounts and he descends he hath laid down his vital germ within these worlds

Sanskrit: sa ji̍nvate ja̱ṭhare̍ṣu prajajñi̱vān vṛṣā̍ ci̱treṣu̱ nāna̍da̱n na si̱ṁhaḥ   vai̱śvā̱na̱raḥ pṛ̍thu̱pājā̱ ama̍rtyo̱ vasu̱ ratnā̱ daya̍māno̱ vi dā̱śuṣe̍
English: he stirs with life in wombs dissimilar in kind born as a lion or a loudlybellowing bull  vaiśvānara immortal with widereaching might bestowing goods and wealth on him who offiers gifts

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱raḥ pra̱tnathā̱ nāka̱m āru̍had di̱vas pṛ̱ṣṭham bhanda̍mānaḥ su̱manma̍bhiḥ   sa pū̍rva̱vaj ja̱naya̍ñ ja̱ntave̱ dhana̍ṁ samā̱nam ajma̱m pary e̍ti̱ jāgṛ̍viḥ
English: vaiśvānara as of old mounted the cope of heaven heaven's ridge well greeted by those skilled in noble songs  he as of old producing riches for the folk still watchful traversesthe common way again

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tāvā̍naṁ ya̱jñiya̱ṁ vipra̍m u̱kthya1̱̍m ā yaṁ da̱dhe mā̍ta̱riśvā̍ di̱vi kṣaya̍m   taṁ ci̱trayā̍ma̱ṁ hari̍keśam īmahe sudī̱tim a̱gniṁ su̍vi̱tāya̱ navya̍se
English: for new prosperity we seek to agni him whose course is splendid goldhaired excellently bright  whom mātariśvan stablished dweller in the heaven meet for high praise and holy sage and true to law

Sanskrit: śuci̱ṁ na yāma̍nn iṣi̱raṁ sva̱rdṛśa̍ṁ ke̱tuṁ di̱vo ro̍cana̱sthām u̍ṣa̱rbudha̍m   a̱gnim mū̱rdhāna̍ṁ di̱vo apra̍tiṣkuta̱ṁ tam ī̍mahe̱ nama̍sā vā̱jina̍m bṛ̱hat
English: as pure and swift of course beholder of the light who stands in heaven's bright sphere a sign who wakes at dawn  agni the head of heaven whom none may turn asideto him the powerful with mighty prayer we seek

Sanskrit: ma̱ndraṁ hotā̍ra̱ṁ śuci̱m adva̍yāvina̱ṁ damū̍nasam u̱kthya̍ṁ vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇim   ratha̱ṁ na ci̱traṁ vapu̍ṣāya darśa̱tam manu̍rhita̱ṁ sada̱m id rā̱ya ī̍mahe
English: the cheerful priest the pure in whom no guile is found friend of the house praiseworthy dear to all mankind  fair to behold for beauty like a splendid caragni the friend of men we ever seek for wealth

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱rāya̍ pṛthu̱pāja̍se̱ vipo̱ ratnā̍ vidhanta dha̱ruṇe̍ṣu̱ gāta̍ve   a̱gnir hi de̱vām̐ a̱mṛto̍ duva̱syaty athā̱ dharmā̍ṇi sa̱natā̱ na dū̍duṣat
English: to him who shines afar vaiśvānara shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths  for agni the immortal serves the deities and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws

Sanskrit: a̱ntar dū̱to roda̍sī da̱sma ī̍yate̱ hotā̱ niṣa̍tto̱ manu̍ṣaḥ pu̱rohi̍taḥ   kṣaya̍m bṛ̱hanta̱m pari̍ bhūṣati̱ dyubhi̍r de̱vebhi̍r a̱gnir i̍ṣi̱to dhi̱yāva̍suḥ
English: he wondrous envoy goes between the earth and heaven firm seated as the herald great high priest of men  he compassethwith rays the lofty dwellingplace agni sent forward by the gods enriched with piayer

Sanskrit: ke̱tuṁ ya̱jñānā̍ṁ vi̱datha̍sya̱ sādha̍na̱ṁ viprā̍so a̱gnim ma̍hayanta̱ citti̍bhiḥ   apā̍ṁsi̱ yasmi̱nn adhi̍ saṁda̱dhur gira̱s tasmi̍n su̱mnāni̱ yaja̍māna̱ ā ca̍ke
English: sages shall glorify agni with earnest thoughts ensign of sacrifice who fills the synod full  in whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness

Sanskrit: pi̱tā ya̱jñānā̱m asu̍ro vipa̱ścitā̍ṁ vi̱māna̍m a̱gnir va̱yuna̍ṁ ca vā̱ghatā̍m   ā vi̍veśa̱ roda̍sī̱ bhūri̍varpasā purupri̱yo bha̍ndate̱ dhāma̍bhiḥ ka̱viḥ
English: the sire of sacrifice great god of holy bards agni the measure and the symbol of the priests  hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form the sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might

Sanskrit: ca̱ndram a̱gniṁ ca̱ndrara̍tha̱ṁ hari̍vrataṁ vaiśvāna̱ram a̍psu̱ṣada̍ṁ sva̱rvida̍m   vi̱gā̱haṁ tūrṇi̱ṁ tavi̍ṣībhi̱r āvṛ̍ta̱m bhūrṇi̍ṁ de̱vāsa̍ i̱ha su̱śriya̍ṁ dadhuḥ
English: bright agni with the bright car lord of green domains vaiśvānara dweller in the floods who finds the light  pervading swift and wild encompassed round with powers him very glorious have the gods established here

Sanskrit: a̱gnir de̱vebhi̱r manu̍ṣaś ca ja̱ntubhi̍s tanvā̱no ya̱jñam pu̍ru̱peśa̍saṁ dhi̱yā   ra̱thīr a̱ntar ī̍yate̱ sādha̍diṣṭibhir jī̱ro damū̍nā abhiśasti̱cāta̍naḥ
English: agni together with the gods and manu's folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form  goes carborne to and fro with those who crown each rite the fleet the household friend who turns the curse aside

Sanskrit: agne̱ jara̍sva svapa̱tya āyu̍ny ū̱rjā pi̍nvasva̱ sam iṣo̍ didīhi naḥ   vayā̍ṁsi jinva bṛha̱taś ca̍ jāgṛva u̱śig de̱vānā̱m asi̍ su̱kratu̍r vi̱pām
English: sing agni for long life to us and noble sons teem thou with plenty shine upon us store of food  increase the great man's strength thou evervigilant thou longing for the gods knowest their hymns full well

Sanskrit: vi̱śpati̍ṁ ya̱hvam ati̍thi̱ṁ nara̱ḥ sadā̍ ya̱ntāra̍ṁ dhī̱nām u̱śija̍ṁ ca vā̱ghatā̍m   a̱dhva̱rāṇā̱ṁ ceta̍naṁ jā̱tave̍dasa̱m pra śa̍ṁsanti̱ nama̍sā jū̱tibhi̍r vṛ̱dhe
English: the mighty one lord of the people and their guest the leader of their thoughts devoted friend of priests  our solemn rites' announcer jātavedas men with worship ever praise with urgings for their weal

Sanskrit: vi̱bhāvā̍ de̱vaḥ su̱raṇa̱ḥ pari̍ kṣi̱tīr a̱gnir ba̍bhūva̱ śava̍sā su̱madra̍thaḥ   tasya̍ vra̱tāni̍ bhūripo̱ṣiṇo̍ va̱yam upa̍ bhūṣema̱ dama̱ ā su̍vṛ̱ktibhi̍ḥ
English: agni the god resplendent giver of great joy hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with might  let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes

Sanskrit: vaiśvā̍nara̱ tava̱ dhāmā̱ny ā ca̍ke̱ yebhi̍ḥ sva̱rvid abha̍vo vicakṣaṇa   jā̱ta āpṛ̍ṇo̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ roda̍sī̱ agne̱ tā viśvā̍ pari̱bhūr a̍si̱ tmanā̍
English: i celebrate thy glories o vaiśvānara wherewith thou o farsighted god has found the light  thou filledst at thy birth both worlds the earth and heaven all this o agni hast thou compassed of thyself

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱rasya̍ da̱ṁsanā̍bhyo bṛ̱had ari̍ṇā̱d eka̍ḥ svapa̱syayā̍ ka̱viḥ   u̱bhā pi̱tarā̍ ma̱haya̍nn ajāyatā̱gnir dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī bhūri̍retasā
English: by his great skill the sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed mightier than vaiśvānara's wondrous acts  agni sprang into being magnifying both his parents heaven and earth rich in prolific seed

Sanskrit: soma̍sya mā ta̱vasa̱ṁ vakṣy a̍gne̱ vahni̍ṁ cakartha vi̱dathe̱ yaja̍dhyai   de̱vām̐ acchā̱ dīdya̍d yu̱ñje adri̍ṁ śamā̱ye a̍gne ta̱nva̍ṁ juṣasva
English: thou agni who wilt have the strong hast made me the soma's priest to worship in assembly  thou shinest to the gods i set the pressstones i toil; be joyful in thyself o agni

Sanskrit: prāñca̍ṁ ya̱jñaṁ ca̍kṛma̱ vardha̍tā̱ṁ gīḥ sa̱midbhi̍r a̱gniṁ nama̍sā duvasyan   di̱vaḥ śa̍śāsur vi̱dathā̍ kavī̱nāṁ gṛtsā̍ya cit ta̱vase̍ gā̱tum ī̍ṣuḥ
English: east have we turned the rite; may the hymn aid it with wood and worship shall they honour agni  from heaven the synods of the wise have learnt it een for the quick and strong they seek advancement

Sanskrit: mayo̍ dadhe̱ medhi̍raḥ pū̱tada̍kṣo di̱vaḥ su̱bandhu̍r ja̱nuṣā̍ pṛthi̱vyāḥ   avi̍ndann u darśa̱tam a̱psv a1̱̍ntar de̱vāso̍ a̱gnim a̱pasi̱ svasṝ̍ṇām
English: the prudent he whose will is pure brought welfare allied by birth to heaven and earth in kinship  the gods discovered in the midst of waters beautiful agni with the sisters' labour

Sanskrit: ava̍rdhayan su̱bhaga̍ṁ sa̱pta ya̱hvīḥ śve̱taṁ ja̍jñā̱nam a̍ru̱ṣam ma̍hi̱tvā   śiśu̱ṁ na jā̱tam a̱bhy ā̍ru̱r aśvā̍ de̱vāso̍ a̱gniṁ jani̍man vapuṣyan
English: him blessed one the seven strong floods augmented him white at birth and red when waxen mighty  as mother mares run to their newborn you ling so at his birth the gods wondered at agni

Sanskrit: śu̱krebhi̱r aṅgai̱ raja̍ ātata̱nvān kratu̍m punā̱naḥ ka̱vibhi̍ḥ pa̱vitrai̍ḥ   śo̱cir vasā̍na̱ḥ pary āyu̍r a̱pāṁ śriyo̍ mimīte bṛha̱tīr anū̍nāḥ
English: spreading with radiant limbs throughout the region purging his power with wise purifications  robing himself in light the life of waters he spreads abroad his high and perfect glories

Sanskrit: va̱vrājā̍ sī̱m ana̍datī̱r ada̍bdhā di̱vo ya̱hvīr ava̍sānā̱ ana̍gnāḥ   sanā̱ atra̍ yuva̱taya̱ḥ sayo̍nī̱r eka̱ṁ garbha̍ṁ dadhire sa̱pta vāṇī̍ḥ
English: he sought heaven's mighty ones the unconsuming the unimpaired not clothed and yet not naked  then they ancient and young who dwell together seven sounding rivers as one germ received him

Sanskrit: stī̱rṇā a̍sya sa̱ṁhato̍ vi̱śvarū̍pā ghṛ̱tasya̱ yonau̍ sra̱vathe̱ madhū̍nām   asthu̱r atra̍ dhe̱nava̱ḥ pinva̍mānā ma̱hī da̱smasya̍ mā̱tarā̍ samī̱cī
English: his piles assuming every form are scattered where flow sweet waters at the spring of fatness;  there stood the milchkine with fullladen udders and both paired mighty mothers of the wondrous

Sanskrit: ba̱bhrā̱ṇaḥ sū̍no sahaso̱ vy a̍dyau̱d dadhā̍naḥ śu̱krā ra̍bha̱sā vapū̍ṁṣi   ścota̍nti̱ dhārā̱ madhu̍no ghṛ̱tasya̱ vṛṣā̱ yatra̍ vāvṛ̱dhe kāvye̍na
English: carefully cherished son of strength thou shoncst assuming lasting and refulgent beauties  full streams of fatness and sweet juice descended there where the mighty one grew strong by wisdom

Sanskrit: pi̱tuś ci̱d ūdha̍r ja̱nuṣā̍ viveda̱ vy a̍sya̱ dhārā̍ asṛja̱d vi dhenā̍ḥ   guhā̱ cara̍nta̱ṁ sakhi̍bhiḥ śi̱vebhi̍r di̱vo ya̱hvībhi̱r na guhā̍ babhūva
English: from birth he knew even his father's bosom he set his voices and his streams in motion;  knew him who moved with blessed friends in secret with the young dames of heaven he stayed not hidden

Sanskrit: pi̱tuś ca̱ garbha̍ṁ jani̱tuś ca̍ babhre pū̱rvīr eko̍ adhaya̱t pīpyā̍nāḥ   vṛṣṇe̍ sa̱patnī̱ śuca̍ye̱ saba̍ndhū u̱bhe a̍smai manu̱ṣye̱3̱̍ ni pā̍hi

English: like brilliant lightnings mighty luminaries accompany the lightdiffusing agni  waxen as twere in secret in his dwelling while in the boundless stall they milk out amṛta

English: may we o agni thou who leadest wisely thy followers and masters of all treasures  strong in the glory of our noble offspring subdue the godless when they seek the battle

English: within the house hath sate the king immortal of mortals filling full their sacred synods  bedewed with holy oil he shineth widely agni the knower of all secret wisdom

English: come unto us with thine auspicious friendship come speeding mighty with thy mighty succours  grant us abundant wealth that saves from danger that brings a good repute a glorious portion

English: for thou hast ever been the cardriver agni of noble  strength lofty sacrifice and rightful judgment

English: through these our praises come thou to meet us bright as the sunlight  o agni well disposed with all thine aspects

English: now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee agni  loud as the voice of heaven thy blasts are roaring

Sanskrit: tam arva̍nta̱ṁ na sā̍na̱sim a̍ru̱ṣaṁ na di̱vaḥ śiśu̍m   ma̱rmṛ̱jyante̍ di̱vedi̍ve

Sanskrit: bodha̱d yan mā̱ hari̍bhyāṁ kumā̱raḥ sā̍hade̱vyaḥ   acchā̱ na hū̱ta ud a̍ram
