Sanskrit: akā̍ri̱ brahma̍ samidhāna̱ tubhya̱ṁ śaṁsā̍ty u̱kthaṁ yaja̍te̱ vy ū̍ dhāḥ   hotā̍ram a̱gnim manu̍ṣo̱ ni ṣe̍dur nama̱syanta̍ u̱śija̱ḥ śaṁsa̍m ā̱yoḥ
English: to thee o flaming god hath prayer been offered let the priest laud thee give to him who worships  men have established agni as invoker fain to adore the glory of the living

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱rāya̍ mī̱ḻhuṣe̍ sa̱joṣā̍ḥ ka̱thā dā̍śemā̱gnaye̍ bṛ̱had bhāḥ   anū̍nena bṛha̱tā va̱kṣathe̱nopa̍ stabhāyad upa̱min na rodha̍ḥ
English: how shall we give with one accord oblation to agni to vaiśvānara the bounteous?  great light with full high growth hath he uplifted and as a pillar bears the roof sustains it

Sanskrit: mā ni̍ndata̱ ya i̱mām mahya̍ṁ rā̱tiṁ de̱vo da̱dau martyā̍ya sva̱dhāvā̍n   pākā̍ya̱ gṛtso̍ a̱mṛto̱ vice̍tā vaiśvāna̱ro nṛta̍mo ya̱hvo a̱gniḥ
English: reproach not him who god and selfreliant vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal  deathless discerner wise to me the simple vaiśvānara most manly youthful agni

Sanskrit: sāma̍ dvi̱barhā̱ mahi̍ ti̱gmabhṛ̍ṣṭiḥ sa̱hasra̍retā vṛṣa̱bhas tuvi̍ṣmān   pa̱daṁ na gor apa̍gūḻhaṁ vivi̱dvān a̱gnir mahya̱m pred u̍ vocan manī̱ṣām
English: sharppointed powerful strong of boundless vigour agni who knows the lofty hymn kept secret  as the lost milchcow's track the doubly mightyhe hath declared to me this hidden knowledge

Sanskrit: pra tām̐ a̱gnir ba̍bhasat ti̱gmaja̍mbha̱s tapi̍ṣṭhena śo̱ciṣā̱ yaḥ su̱rādhā̍ḥ   pra ye mi̱nanti̱ varu̍ṇasya̱ dhāma̍ pri̱yā mi̱trasya̱ ceta̍to dhru̱vāṇi̍
English: may he with sharpened teeth the bounteous giver agni consume with flame most fiercely glowing  those who regard not varuṇa's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient mitra

Sanskrit: a̱bhrā̱taro̱ na yoṣa̍ṇo̱ vyanta̍ḥ pati̱ripo̱ na jana̍yo du̱revā̍ḥ   pā̱pāsa̱ḥ santo̍ anṛ̱tā a̍sa̱tyā i̱dam pa̱dam a̍janatā gabhī̱ram
English: like youthful women without brothers straying like dames who hate their lords of evil conduct  they who are full of sin untrue unfaithful they have engendered this abysmal station

Sanskrit: i̱dam me̍ agne̱ kiya̍te pāva̱kāmi̍nate gu̱rum bhā̱raṁ na manma̍   bṛ̱had da̍dhātha dhṛṣa̱tā ga̍bhī̱raṁ ya̱hvam pṛ̱ṣṭham praya̍sā sa̱ptadhā̍tu
English: to me weak innocent thou luminous agni hast boldly given as twere a heavy burthen  this pṛṣṭha hymn profound and strong and mighty of seven elements and with offered dainties

Sanskrit: tam in nv e̱3̱̍va sa̍ma̱nā sa̍mā̱nam a̱bhi kratvā̍ puna̱tī dhī̱tir a̍śyāḥ   sa̱sasya̱ carma̱nn adhi̱ cāru̱ pṛśne̱r agre̍ ru̱pa āru̍pita̱ṁ jabā̍ru
English: so may our song that purifies through wisdom reach in a moment him the universal  established on the height on earth's best station above the beauteous grassy skin of pṛśni

Sanskrit: pra̱vācya̱ṁ vaca̍sa̱ḥ kim me̍ a̱sya guhā̍ hi̱tam upa̍ ni̱ṇig va̍danti   yad u̱sriyā̍ṇā̱m apa̱ vār i̍va̱ vran pāti̍ pri̱yaṁ ru̱po agra̍m pa̱daṁ veḥ
English: of this my speech what shall i utter further? they indicate the milk stored up in secret  when they have thrown as twere the cows' stalls open the bird protects earths best and wellloved station

Sanskrit: i̱dam u̱ tyan mahi̍ ma̱hām anī̍ka̱ṁ yad u̱sriyā̱ saca̍ta pū̱rvyaṁ gauḥ   ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱de adhi̱ dīdyā̍na̱ṁ guhā̍ raghu̱ṣyad ra̍ghu̱yad vi̍veda
English: this is the great ones mighty apparition which from of old the radiant cow hath followed  this shining brightly in the place of order swift hasting on in secret she discovered

Sanskrit: adha̍ dyutā̱naḥ pi̱troḥ sacā̱sāma̍nuta̱ guhya̱ṁ cāru̱ pṛśne̍ḥ   mā̱tuṣ pa̱de pa̍ra̱me anti̱ ṣad gor vṛṣṇa̍ḥ śo̱ciṣa̱ḥ praya̍tasya ji̱hvā
English: he then who shone together with his parents remembered pṛśni's fair and secret treasure  which in the mother cow's most lofty station the bull's tongue of the flame bent forward tasted

Sanskrit: ṛ̱taṁ vo̍ce̱ nama̍sā pṛ̱cchyamā̍na̱s tavā̱śasā̍ jātavedo̱ yadī̱dam   tvam a̱sya kṣa̍yasi̱ yad dha̱ viśva̍ṁ di̱vi yad u̱ dravi̍ṇa̱ṁ yat pṛ̍thi̱vyām
English: with reverence i declare the law o agni; what is comes by thine order jātavedas  of this whateer it be thou art the sovran yea all the wealth that is in earth or  heaven

Sanskrit: kiṁ no̍ a̱sya dravi̍ṇa̱ṁ kad dha̱ ratna̱ṁ vi no̍ voco jātavedaś ciki̱tvān   guhādhva̍naḥ para̱maṁ yan no̍ a̱sya reku̍ pa̱daṁ na ni̍dā̱nā aga̍nma
English: what is our wealth therefrom and what our treasure? tell us o jātavedas for thou  knowest  what is our best course in this secret passage we unreproached have reached a place far distant

Sanskrit: kā ma̱ryādā̍ va̱yunā̱ kad dha̍ vā̱mam acchā̍ gamema ra̱ghavo̱ na vāja̍m   ka̱dā no̍ de̱vīr a̱mṛta̍sya̱ patnī̱ḥ sūro̱ varṇe̍na tatanann u̱ṣāsa̍ḥ
English: what is the limit what the rules the guerdon? like fleetfoot coursers speed we to the contest  when will the goddesses the immortal's spouses the dawns spread over us the sungod's splendour?

Sanskrit: a̱ni̱reṇa̱ vaca̍sā pha̱lgve̍na pra̱tītye̍na kṛ̱dhunā̍tṛ̱pāsa̍ḥ   adhā̱ te a̍gne̱ kim i̱hā va̍danty anāyu̱dhāsa̱ āsa̍tā sacantām
English: unsatisfied with speech devoid of vigour scanty and frivolous and inconclusive  wherefore do they address thee here o agni? let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow

Sanskrit: a̱sya śri̱ye sa̍midhā̱nasya̱ vṛṣṇo̱ vaso̱r anī̍ka̱ṁ dama̱ ā ru̍roca   ruśa̱d vasā̍naḥ su̱dṛśī̍karūpaḥ kṣi̱tir na rā̱yā pu̍ru̱vāro̍ adyaut
English: the majesty of him the good the mighty aflame hath shone for glory in the dwelling  he clothed in light hath shone most fair to look on wealthy in boons as a home shines with riches

Sanskrit: kṛ̱ṇu̱ṣva pāja̱ḥ prasi̍ti̱ṁ na pṛ̱thvīṁ yā̱hi rāje̱vāma̍vā̱m̐ ibhe̍na   tṛ̱ṣvīm anu̱ prasi̍tiṁ drūṇā̱no 'stā̍si̱ vidhya̍ ra̱kṣasa̱s tapi̍ṣṭhaiḥ
English: put forth like a widespreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty king with his attendants  thou following thy swift net shootest arrows transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely

Sanskrit: tava̍ bhra̱māsa̍ āśu̱yā pa̍ta̱nty anu̍ spṛśa dhṛṣa̱tā śośu̍cānaḥ   tapū̍ṁṣy agne ju̱hvā̍ pata̱ṁgān asa̍ṁdito̱ vi sṛ̍ja̱ viṣva̍g u̱lkāḥ
English: forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons follow them closely glowing in thy fury  spread with thy tongue the winged flames o agni; unfettered cast thy firebrands all around thee

Sanskrit: prati̱ spaśo̱ vi sṛ̍ja̱ tūrṇi̍tamo̱ bhavā̍ pā̱yur vi̱śo a̱syā ada̍bdhaḥ   yo no̍ dū̱re a̱ghaśa̍ṁso̱ yo anty agne̱ māki̍ṣ ṭe̱ vyathi̱r ā da̍dharṣīt
English: send thy spies forward fleetest in thy motion; be neer deceived the guardian of this people  from him who near or far is bent on evil and let no trouble sent from thee oercome us

Sanskrit: ud a̍gne tiṣṭha̱ praty ā ta̍nuṣva̱ ny a1̱̍mitrā̍m̐ oṣatāt tigmahete   yo no̱ arā̍tiṁ samidhāna ca̱kre nī̱cā taṁ dha̍kṣy ata̱saṁ na śuṣka̍m
English: rise up o agni spread thee out before us burn down our foes thou who hast sharpened arrows  him blazing agni! who hath worked us mischief consume thou utterly like driedup stubble

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvo bha̍va̱ prati̍ vi̱dhyādhy a̱smad ā̱viṣ kṛ̍ṇuṣva̱ daivyā̍ny agne   ava̍ sthi̱rā ta̍nuhi yātu̱jūnā̍ṁ jā̱mim ajā̍mi̱m pra mṛ̍ṇīhi̱ śatrū̍n
English: rise agni drive off those who fight against us make manifest thine own celestial vigour  slacken the strong bows of the demondriven destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger

Sanskrit: sa te̍ jānāti suma̱tiṁ ya̍viṣṭha̱ ya īva̍te̱ brahma̍ṇe gā̱tum aira̍t   viśvā̍ny asmai su̱dinā̍ni rā̱yo dyu̱mnāny a̱ryo vi duro̍ a̱bhi dyau̍t
English: most youthful god he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion  all fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals

Sanskrit: sed a̍gne astu su̱bhaga̍ḥ su̱dānu̱r yas tvā̱ nitye̍na ha̱viṣā̱ ya u̱kthaiḥ   piprī̍ṣati̱ sva āyu̍ṣi duro̱ṇe viśved a̍smai su̱dinā̱ sāsa̍d i̱ṣṭiḥ
English: blest agni be the man the liberal giver who with his lauds and regular oblation  is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling may all his days be bright be this his longing

Sanskrit: arcā̍mi te suma̱tiṁ ghoṣy a̱rvāk saṁ te̍ vā̱vātā̍ jaratām i̱yaṁ gīḥ   svaśvā̍s tvā su̱rathā̍ marjayemā̱sme kṣa̱trāṇi̍ dhāraye̱r anu̱ dyūn
English: i praise thy gracious favour sing in answer may this my song sing like a loved one with thee  lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion

Sanskrit: i̱ha tvā̱ bhūry ā ca̍re̱d upa̱ tman doṣā̍vastar dīdi̱vāṁsa̱m anu̱ dyūn   krīḻa̍ntas tvā su̱mana̍saḥ sapemā̱bhi dyu̱mnā ta̍sthi̱vāṁso̱ janā̍nām
English: here of free choice let each one serve thee richly resplendent day by day at eve and morning  so may we honour thee content and joyous passing beyond the glories of the people

Sanskrit: yas tvā̱ svaśva̍ḥ suhira̱ṇyo a̍gna upa̱yāti̱ vasu̍matā̱ rathe̍na   tasya̍ trā̱tā bha̍vasi̱ tasya̱ sakhā̱ yas ta̍ āti̱thyam ā̍nu̱ṣag jujo̍ṣat
English: whoso with good steeds and fine gold o agni comes nigh thee on a car laden with treasure  his friend art thou yea thou art his protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly

Sanskrit: ma̱ho ru̍jāmi ba̱ndhutā̱ vaco̍bhi̱s tan mā̍ pi̱tur gota̍mā̱d anv i̍yāya   tvaṁ no̍ a̱sya vaca̍saś cikiddhi̱ hota̍r yaviṣṭha sukrato̱ damū̍nāḥ
English: through words and kinship i destroy the mighty this power i have from gotama my father  mark thou this speech of ours o thou most youthful friend of the house exceeding wise invoker

Sanskrit: asva̍pnajas ta̱raṇa̍yaḥ su̱śevā̱ ata̍ndrāso 'vṛ̱kā aśra̍miṣṭhāḥ   te pā̱yava̍ḥ sa̱dhrya̍ñco ni̱ṣadyāgne̱ tava̍ naḥ pāntv amūra
English: knowing no slumber speedy and propitious alert and ever friendly most unwearied  may thy protecting powers unerring agni taking their places here combined preserve us

Sanskrit: ye pā̱yavo̍ māmate̱yaṁ te̍ agne̱ paśya̍nto a̱ndhaṁ du̍ri̱tād ara̍kṣan   ra̱rakṣa̱ tān su̱kṛto̍ vi̱śvave̍dā̱ dipsa̍nta̱ id ri̱pavo̱ nāha̍ debhuḥ
English: thy guardian rays o agni when they saw him preserved blind māmateya from affliction  lord of all riches he preserved the pious the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief

Sanskrit: tvayā̍ va̱yaṁ sa̍dha̱nya1̱̍s tvotā̱s tava̱ praṇī̍ty aśyāma̱ vājā̍n   u̱bhā śaṁsā̍ sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhu̱yā kṛ̍ṇuhy ahrayāṇa
English: aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward  fulfil the words of both o ever truthful straightway do this thou god whom power emboldens

Sanskrit: a̱yā te̍ agne sa̱midhā̍ vidhema̱ prati̱ stoma̍ṁ śa̱syamā̍naṁ gṛbhāya   dahā̱śaso̍ ra̱kṣasa̍ḥ pā̱hy a1̱̍smān dru̱ho ni̱do mi̍tramaho ava̱dyāt
English: o agni with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour  destroy the cursing rākṣasas preserve us o rich in friends from guile and scorn and slander

Sanskrit: yo martye̍ṣv a̱mṛta̍ ṛ̱tāvā̍ de̱vo de̱veṣv a̍ra̱tir ni̱dhāyi̍   hotā̱ yaji̍ṣṭho ma̱hnā śu̱cadhyai̍ ha̱vyair a̱gnir manu̍ṣa īra̱yadhyai̍
English: the faithful one immortal among mortals a god among the gods appointed envoy  priest best at worship must shine forth in glory  agni shall be raised high with man's oblations

Sanskrit: i̱ha tvaṁ sū̍no sahaso no a̱dya jā̱to jā̱tām̐ u̱bhayā̍m̐ a̱ntar a̍gne   dū̱ta ī̍yase yuyujā̱na ṛ̍ṣva ṛjumu̱ṣkān vṛṣa̍ṇaḥ śu̱krām̐ś ca̍
English: born for us here this day o son of vigour between both races of born beings agni  thou farest as an envoy having harnessed sublime one! thy strongmuscled radiant stallions

Sanskrit: atyā̍ vṛdha̱snū rohi̍tā ghṛ̱tasnū̍ ṛ̱tasya̍ manye̱ mana̍sā̱ javi̍ṣṭhā   a̱ntar ī̍yase aru̱ṣā yu̍jā̱no yu̱ṣmām̐ś ca̍ de̱vān viśa̱ ā ca̱ martā̍n
English: i laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing dropping oil flectest through the thoualit of order  yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you deities and mortal races

Sanskrit: a̱rya̱maṇa̱ṁ varu̍ṇam mi̱tram e̍ṣā̱m indrā̱viṣṇū̍ ma̱ruto̍ a̱śvino̱ta   svaśvo̍ agne su̱ratha̍ḥ su̱rādhā̱ ed u̍ vaha suha̱viṣe̱ janā̍ya
English: aryaman mitra varuṇa and indra with viṣṇu of the gods maruts and aśvins  these agni with good car and steeds bring hither most bountiful to folk with fair oblations

Sanskrit: gomā̍m̐ a̱gne 'vi̍mām̐ a̱śvī ya̱jño nṛ̱vatsa̍khā̱ sada̱m id a̍pramṛ̱ṣyaḥ   iḻā̍vām̐ e̱ṣo a̍sura pra̱jāvā̍n dī̱rgho ra̱yiḥ pṛ̍thubu̱dhnaḥ sa̱bhāvā̍n
English: agni be this our sacrifice eternal with brave friends rich in kine and sheep and horses  rich asura! in sacred food and children in full assembly wealth broadbased and during

Sanskrit: yas ta̍ i̱dhmaṁ ja̱bhara̍t siṣvidā̱no mū̱rdhāna̍ṁ vā ta̱tapa̍te tvā̱yā   bhuva̱s tasya̱ svata̍vām̐ḥ pā̱yur a̍gne̱ viśva̍smāt sīm aghāya̱ta u̍ruṣya
English: the man who sweating brings for thee the fuel and makes his head to ache thy faithful servant  agni to him be a selfstrong protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief

Sanskrit: yas te̱ bharā̱d anni̍yate ci̱d anna̍ṁ ni̱śiṣa̍n ma̱ndram ati̍thim u̱dīra̍t   ā de̍va̱yur i̱nadha̍te duro̱ṇe tasmi̍n ra̱yir dhru̱vo a̍stu̱ dāsvā̍n
English: who brings thee food though thou hast food in plenty welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward  who kindles thee devoutly in his dwellingto him be wealth secure and freely giving

Sanskrit: yas tvā̍ do̱ṣā ya u̱ṣasi̍ pra̱śaṁsā̍t pri̱yaṁ vā̍ tvā kṛ̱ṇava̍te ha̱viṣmā̍n   aśvo̱ na sve dama̱ ā he̱myāvā̱n tam aṁha̍saḥ pīparo dā̱śvāṁsa̍m
English: whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning and with oblation doth the thing thou lovest  in his own home even as a goidgirt courser rescue him from distress the bounteous giver

Sanskrit: yas tubhya̍m agne a̱mṛtā̍ya̱ dāśa̱d duva̱s tve kṛ̱ṇava̍te ya̱tasru̍k   na sa rā̱yā śa̍śamā̱no vi yo̍ṣa̱n naina̱m aṁha̱ḥ pari̍ varad aghā̱yoḥ
English: whoso brings gifts to thee immortal agni and doth thee service with uplifted ladle  let him not sorely toiling lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him

Sanskrit: yasya̱ tvam a̍gne adhva̱raṁ jujo̍ṣo de̱vo marta̍sya̱ sudhi̍ta̱ṁ rarā̍ṇaḥ   prī̱ted a̍sa̱d dhotrā̱ sā ya̍vi̱ṣṭhāsā̍ma̱ yasya̍ vidha̱to vṛ̱dhāsa̍ḥ
English: whose wellwrought worship thou acceptest agni thou god a mortal's gift thou liberal giver  dear be his sacrifice to thee most youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee

Sanskrit: citti̱m aci̍ttiṁ cinava̱d vi vi̱dvān pṛ̱ṣṭheva̍ vī̱tā vṛ̍ji̱nā ca̱ martā̍n   rā̱ye ca̍ naḥ svapa̱tyāya̍ deva̱ diti̍ṁ ca̱ rāsvādi̍tim uruṣya
English: may he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men like straight and crooked backs of horses  lead us o god to wealth and noble offspring keep penury afar and grant us plenty

Sanskrit: ka̱viṁ śa̍śāsuḥ ka̱vayo 'da̍bdhā nidhā̱raya̍nto̱ duryā̍sv ā̱yoḥ   ata̱s tvaṁ dṛśyā̍m̐ agna e̱tān pa̱ḍbhiḥ pa̍śye̱r adbhu̍tām̐ a̱rya evai̍ḥ
English: this sage the sages neer deceived commanded setting him down in dwellings of the living  hence mayst thou friendly god with rapid footsteps behold the gods wonderful fair to look on

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne vā̱ghate̍ su̱praṇī̍tiḥ su̱taso̍māya vidha̱te ya̍viṣṭha   ratna̍m bhara śaśamā̱nāya̍ ghṛṣve pṛ̱thu śca̱ndram ava̍se carṣaṇi̱prāḥ
English: good guidance hast thou for the priest o agni who youngest god! with outpoured soma serves thee  ruler of men thou joyous god bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler

Sanskrit: adhā̍ ha̱ yad va̱yam a̍gne tvā̱yā pa̱ḍbhir haste̍bhiś cakṛ̱mā ta̱nūbhi̍ḥ   ratha̱ṁ na kranto̱ apa̍sā bhu̱rijo̍r ṛ̱taṁ ye̍muḥ su̱dhya̍ āśuṣā̱ṇāḥ
English: now all that we thy faithful servants agni have done with feet with hands and with our bodies  the wise with toil the holy rite have guided as those who frame a car with manual cunning

Sanskrit: adhā̍ mā̱tur u̱ṣasa̍ḥ sa̱pta viprā̱ jāye̍mahi pratha̱mā ve̱dhaso̱ nṝn   di̱vas pu̱trā aṅgi̍raso bhave̱mādri̍ṁ rujema dha̱nina̍ṁ śu̱canta̍ḥ
English: may we seven sages first in rank engender from dawn the mother men to be ordainers  may we aṅgirases be sons of heaven and radiant burst the wealthcontaining mountain

Sanskrit: adhā̱ yathā̍ naḥ pi̱tara̱ḥ parā̍saḥ pra̱tnāso̍ agna ṛ̱tam ā̍śuṣā̱ṇāḥ   śucīd a̍ya̱n dīdhi̍tim uktha̱śāsa̱ḥ kṣāmā̍ bhi̱ndanto̍ aru̱ṇīr apa̍ vran
English: as in the days of old our ancient fathers speeding the work of holy worship agni  sought pure light and devotion singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red dawns apparent

Sanskrit: su̱karmā̍ṇaḥ su̱ruco̍ deva̱yanto 'yo̱ na de̱vā jani̍mā̱ dhama̍ntaḥ   śu̱canto̍ a̱gniṁ va̍vṛ̱dhanta̱ indra̍m ū̱rvaṁ gavya̍m pari̱ṣada̍nto agman
English: gods doing holy acts devout resplendent smelting like ore their human generations  enkindling agni and exalting indra they came encompassing the stall of cattle

Sanskrit: ā yū̱theva̍ kṣu̱mati̍ pa̱śvo a̍khyad de̱vānā̱ṁ yaj jani̱mānty u̍gra   martā̍nāṁ cid u̱rvaśī̍r akṛpran vṛ̱dhe ci̍d a̱rya upa̍rasyā̱yoḥ
English: strong one! he marked themand the gods before themlike herds of cattle in a foodful pasture  there they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals to aid the true the nearest one the living

Sanskrit: aka̍rma te̱ svapa̍so abhūma ṛ̱tam a̍vasrann u̱ṣaso̍ vibhā̱tīḥ   anū̍nam a̱gnim pu̍ru̱dhā su̍śca̱ndraṁ de̱vasya̱ marmṛ̍jata̱ś cāru̱ cakṣu̍ḥ
English: we have worked for thee we have laboured noblybright dawns have shed their light upon our worship  adding a beauty to the perfect agni and the god's beauteous eye that shines for ever

Sanskrit: e̱tā te̍ agna u̱cathā̍ni ve̱dho 'vo̍cāma ka̱vaye̱ tā ju̍ṣasva   uc cho̍casva kṛṇu̱hi vasya̍so no ma̱ho rā̱yaḥ pu̍ruvāra̱ pra ya̍ndhi
English: agni disposer we have sung these praises to thee the wise do thou accept them gladly  blaze up on high and ever make us richer give us great wealth o thou whose boons are many

Sanskrit: ā vo̱ rājā̍nam adhva̱rasya̍ ru̱draṁ hotā̍raṁ satya̱yaja̱ṁ roda̍syoḥ   a̱gnim pu̱rā ta̍nayi̱tnor a̱cittā̱d dhira̍ṇyarūpa̱m ava̍se kṛṇudhvam
English: win to assist you rudra lord of worship priest of both worlds effectual  sacrificer  agni invested with his golden colours before the thunder strike and lay you senseless

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ yoni̍ś cakṛ̱mā yaṁ va̱yaṁ te̍ jā̱yeva̱ patya̍ uśa̱tī su̱vāsā̍ḥ   a̱rvā̱cī̱naḥ pari̍vīto̱ ni ṣī̍de̱mā u̍ te svapāka pratī̱cīḥ
English: this shrine have we made ready for thy coming as the fond dame attires her for her husband  performer of good work sit down before us invested while these flames incline to meet thee

Sanskrit: ā̱śṛ̱ṇva̱te adṛ̍pitāya̱ manma̍ nṛ̱cakṣa̍se sumṛḻī̱kāya̍ vedhaḥ   de̱vāya̍ śa̱stim a̱mṛtā̍ya śaṁsa̱ grāve̍va̱ sotā̍ madhu̱ṣud yam ī̱ḻe
English: a hymn o priest to him who hears the gentle to him who looks on men exceeding gracious  a song of praise sing to the god immortal whom the stone presser of the sweet juice worships

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ci̍n na̱ḥ śamyā̍ agne a̱syā ṛ̱tasya̍ bodhy ṛtacit svā̱dhīḥ   ka̱dā ta̍ u̱kthā sa̍dha̱mādyā̍ni ka̱dā bha̍vanti sa̱khyā gṛ̱he te̍
English: even as true knower of the law o agni to this our solemn rite he thou attentive  when shall thy songs of festival be sung thee? when is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?

Sanskrit: ka̱thā ha̱ tad varu̍ṇāya̱ tvam a̍gne ka̱thā di̱ve ga̍rhase̱ kan na̱ āga̍ḥ   ka̱thā mi̱trāya̍ mī̱ḻhuṣe̍ pṛthi̱vyai brava̱ḥ kad a̍rya̱mṇe kad bhagā̍ya
English: why this complaint to varuṇa o agni? and why to heaven? for what is our transgression?  how wilt thou speak to earth and bounteous mitra? what wilt thou say to aryaman and bhaga?

Sanskrit: kad dhiṣṇyā̍su vṛdhasā̱no a̍gne̱ kad vātā̍ya̱ prata̍vase śubha̱ṁye   pari̍jmane̱ nāsa̍tyāya̱ kṣe brava̱ḥ kad a̍gne ru̱drāya̍ nṛ̱ghne
English: what when thou blazest on the lesser altars what to the mighty wind who comes to bless us  true circumambient? what to earth o agni what wilt thou say to mandestroying rudra?

Sanskrit: ka̱thā ma̱he pu̍ṣṭimbha̱rāya̍ pū̱ṣṇe kad ru̱drāya̱ suma̍khāya havi̱rde   kad viṣṇa̍va urugā̱yāya̱ reto̱ brava̱ḥ kad a̍gne̱ śara̍ve bṛha̱tyai
English: how to great pūṣan who promotes our welfareto honoured rudra what who gives oblations?  what sin of ours to the farstriding viṣṇu what agni wilt thou tell the lofty arrow

Sanskrit: ka̱thā śardhā̍ya ma̱rutā̍m ṛ̱tāya̍ ka̱thā sū̱re bṛ̍ha̱te pṛ̱cchyamā̍naḥ   prati̍ bra̱vo 'di̍taye tu̱rāya̱ sādhā̍ di̱vo jā̍tavedaś ciki̱tvān
English: what wilt thou tell the truthful band of maruts how answer the great sun when thou art questioned?  before the free before the swift defend us fulfil heaven's work allknowing jātavedas

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tena̍ ṛ̱taṁ niya̍tam īḻa̱ ā gor ā̱mā sacā̱ madhu̍mat pa̱kvam a̍gne   kṛ̱ṣṇā sa̱tī ruśa̍tā dhā̱sinai̱ṣā jāma̍ryeṇa̱ paya̍sā pīpāya
English: i crave the cow's true gift arranged by order though raw she hath the sweet ripe juice o agni  though she is black of hue with milk she teemeth nutritious brightly shining allsustaining

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tena̱ hi ṣmā̍ vṛṣa̱bhaś ci̍d a̱ktaḥ pumā̍m̐ a̱gniḥ paya̍sā pṛ̱ṣṭhye̍na   aspa̍ndamāno acarad vayo̱dhā vṛṣā̍ śu̱kraṁ du̍duhe̱ pṛśni̱r ūdha̍ḥ
English: agni the bull the manly hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back by law eternal  he who gives vital power goes on unswerving pṛśni the bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tenādri̱ṁ vy a̍san bhi̱danta̱ḥ sam aṅgi̍raso navanta̱ gobhi̍ḥ   śu̱naṁ nara̱ḥ pari̍ ṣadann u̱ṣāsa̍m ā̱viḥ sva̍r abhavaj jā̱te a̱gnau
English: by law the aṅgirases cleft the rock asunder and sang their hymns together with the cattle  bringing great bliss the men encompassed morning light was apparent at the birth of agni

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tena̍ de̱vīr a̱mṛtā̱ amṛ̍ktā̱ arṇo̍bhi̱r āpo̱ madhu̍madbhir agne   vā̱jī na sarge̍ṣu prastubhā̱naḥ pra sada̱m it sravi̍tave dadhanyuḥ
English: by law the immortal goddesses the waters with meathrich waves o agni and uninjured  like a strong courser lauded in his running sped to flow onward swiftly and for ever

Sanskrit: mā kasya̍ ya̱kṣaṁ sada̱m id dhu̱ro gā̱ mā ve̱śasya̍ pramina̱to māpeḥ   mā bhrātu̍r agne̱ anṛ̍jor ṛ̱ṇaṁ ve̱r mā sakhyu̱r dakṣa̍ṁ ri̱por bhu̍jema
English: go never to the feast of one who harms us the treacherous neighbour or unworthy kinsman  punish us not for a false brother's trespass let us not feel the might of friend or foeman

Sanskrit: rakṣā̍ ṇo agne̱ tava̱ rakṣa̍ṇebhī rārakṣā̱ṇaḥ su̍makha prīṇā̱naḥ   prati̍ ṣphura̱ vi ru̍ja vī̱ḍv aṁho̍ ja̱hi rakṣo̱ mahi̍ cid vāvṛdhā̱nam
English: o agni keep us safe with thy protection loving us honoured god! and ever guarding  beat thou away   severe affliction slay een the demon when he waxes mighty

Sanskrit: e̱bhir bha̍va su̱manā̍ agne a̱rkair i̱mān spṛ̍śa̱ manma̍bhiḥ śūra̱ vājā̍n   u̱ta brahmā̍ṇy aṅgiro juṣasva̱ saṁ te̍ śa̱stir de̱vavā̍tā jareta
English: through these our songs of praise be gracious agni; moved by our prayers o hero touch our viands  accept o aṅgiras these our devotions and let the praise which gods desire address thee

Sanskrit: e̱tā viśvā̍ vi̱duṣe̱ tubhya̍ṁ vedho nī̱thāny a̍gne ni̱ṇyā vacā̍ṁsi   ni̱vaca̍nā ka̱vaye̱ kāvyā̱ny aśa̍ṁsiṣam ma̱tibhi̱r vipra̍ u̱kthaiḥ
English: to thee who knowest agni thou disposer all these wise secret speeches have i uttered  sung to thee sage the charming words of wisdom to thee o singer with my thoughts and praises

Sanskrit: tvāṁ hy a̍gne̱ sada̱m it sa̍ma̱nyavo̍ de̱vāso̍ de̱vam a̍ra̱tiṁ nye̍ri̱ra iti̱ kratvā̍ nyeri̱re   ama̍rtyaṁ yajata̱ martye̱ṣv ā de̱vam āde̍vaṁ janata̱ prace̍tasa̱ṁ viśva̱m āde̍vaṁ janata̱ prace̍tasam
English: thee agni have the gods ever of one accord sent hither down a god appointed messenger yea with their wisdom sent thee down  the immortal o thou holy one mid mortal men the goddevoted god the wise have they brought forth brought forth the omnipresent goddevoted sage

Sanskrit: sa bhrāta̍ra̱ṁ varu̍ṇam agna̱ ā va̍vṛtsva de̱vām̐ acchā̍ suma̱tī ya̱jñava̍nasa̱ṁ jyeṣṭha̍ṁ ya̱jñava̍nasam   ṛ̱tāvā̍nam ādi̱tyaṁ ca̍rṣaṇī̱dhṛta̱ṁ rājā̍naṁ carṣaṇī̱dhṛta̍m
English: as such o agni bring with favour to the gods thy brother varuṇa who loveth sacrifice  true to the law the āditya who supporteth men the king supporter of mankind

Sanskrit: sakhe̱ sakhā̍yam a̱bhy ā va̍vṛtsvā̱śuṁ na ca̱kraṁ rathye̍va̱ raṁhyā̱smabhya̍ṁ dasma̱ raṁhyā̍   agne̍ mṛḻī̱kaṁ varu̍ṇe̱ sacā̍ vido ma̱rutsu̍ vi̱śvabhā̍nuṣu   to̱kāya̍ tu̱je śu̍śucāna̱ śaṁ kṛ̍dhy a̱smabhya̍ṁ dasma̱ śaṁ kṛ̍dhi
English: do thou o friend turn hither him who is our friend swift as a wheel like two carsteeds in rapid course wondrous! to us in rapid course  o agni find thou grace for us with varuṇa with maruts who illumine all  bless us thou radiant one for seed and progeny yea bless us o thou wondrous god

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ agne̱ varu̍ṇasya vi̱dvān de̱vasya̱ heḻo 'va̍ yāsisīṣṭhāḥ   yaji̍ṣṭho̱ vahni̍tama̱ḥ śośu̍cāno̱ viśvā̱ dveṣā̍ṁsi̱ pra mu̍mugdhy a̱smat
English: do thou who knowest varuṇa o agni put far away from us the god's displeasure  best sacrificer brightest one refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us

Sanskrit: sa tvaṁ no̍ agne 'va̱mo bha̍vo̱tī nedi̍ṣṭho a̱syā u̱ṣaso̱ vyu̍ṣṭau   ava̍ yakṣva no̱ varu̍ṇa̱ṁ rarā̍ṇo vī̱hi mṛ̍ḻī̱kaṁ su̱havo̍ na edhi
English: be thou o agni nearest us with succour our closest friend while now this morn is breaking  reconcile to us varuṇa be bounteous enjoy the gracious juice; be swift to hear us

Sanskrit: a̱sya śreṣṭhā̍ su̱bhaga̍sya sa̱ṁdṛg de̱vasya̍ ci̱trata̍mā̱ martye̍ṣu   śuci̍ ghṛ̱taṁ na ta̱ptam aghnyā̍yāḥ spā̱rhā de̱vasya̍ ma̱ṁhane̍va dhe̱noḥ
English: excellent is the glance of brightest splendour which the auspicious god bestows on mortals  the god's glance longedfor even as the butter pure heated of the cow the milchcow's bounty

Sanskrit: trir a̍sya̱ tā pa̍ra̱mā sa̍nti sa̱tyā spā̱rhā de̱vasya̱ jani̍māny a̱gneḥ   a̱na̱nte a̱ntaḥ pari̍vīta̱ āgā̱c chuci̍ḥ śu̱kro a̱ryo roru̍cānaḥ
English: three are those births the true the most exalted eagerly longedfor of the god of agni  he came invested in the boundless region pure radiant friendly mightily resplendent

Sanskrit: sa dū̱to viśved a̱bhi va̍ṣṭi̱ sadmā̱ hotā̱ hira̍ṇyaratho̱ raṁsu̍jihvaḥ   ro̱hida̍śvo vapu̱ṣyo̍ vi̱bhāvā̱ sadā̍ ra̱ṇvaḥ pi̍tu̱matī̍va sa̱ṁsat
English: this envoy joyeth in all seats of worship borne on his golden car sweettongued invoker  lovely to look on with red steeds effulgent like a feast rich in food joyous for ever

Sanskrit: sa ce̍taya̱n manu̍ṣo ya̱jñaba̍ndhu̱ḥ pra tam ma̱hyā ra̍śa̱nayā̍ nayanti   sa kṣe̍ty asya̱ duryā̍su̱ sādha̍n de̱vo marta̍sya sadhani̱tvam ā̍pa
English: allied by worship let him give man knowledge by an extended cord they lead him onward  he stays effectual in this mortal's dwelling and the god wins a share in his possessions

Sanskrit: sa tū no̍ a̱gnir na̍yatu prajā̱nann acchā̱ ratna̍ṁ de̱vabha̍kta̱ṁ yad a̍sya   dhi̱yā yad viśve̍ a̱mṛtā̱ akṛ̍ṇva̱n dyauṣ pi̱tā ja̍ni̱tā sa̱tyam u̍kṣan
English: let agni for he knows the way conduct us to all that he enjoys of godsent riches  what all the immortals have prepared with wisdom dyaus sire begetter raining down true blessings

Sanskrit: sa jā̍yata pratha̱maḥ pa̱styā̍su ma̱ho bu̱dhne raja̍so a̱sya yonau̍   a̱pād a̍śī̱rṣā gu̱hamā̍no̱ antā̱yoyu̍vāno vṛṣa̱bhasya̍ nī̱ḻe
English: in houses first he sprang into existence at great heaven's base and in this region's bosom;  footless and headless both his ends concealing in his bull's lair drawing himself together

Sanskrit: pra śardha̍ ārta pratha̱maṁ vi̍pa̱nyām̐ ṛ̱tasya̱ yonā̍ vṛṣa̱bhasya̍ nī̱ḻe   spā̱rho yuvā̍ vapu̱ṣyo̍ vi̱bhāvā̍ sa̱pta pri̱yāso̍ 'janayanta̱ vṛṣṇe̍
English: wondrously first he rose aloft defiant in the bull's lair the homeof holy order  longedfor young beautiful and farresplendent and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the mighty

Sanskrit: a̱smāka̱m atra̍ pi̱taro̍ manu̱ṣyā̍ a̱bhi pra se̍dur ṛ̱tam ā̍śuṣā̱ṇāḥ   aśma̍vrajāḥ su̱dughā̍ va̱vre a̱ntar ud u̱srā ā̍jann u̱ṣaso̍ huvā̱nāḥ
English: here did our human fathers take their places fain to fulfil the sacred law of worship  forth drave they with loud call dawn's teeming milchkine bid in the mountainstable in the cavern

Sanskrit: te ma̍rmṛjata dadṛ̱vāṁso̱ adri̱ṁ tad e̍ṣām a̱nye a̱bhito̱ vi vo̍can   pa̱śvaya̍ntrāso a̱bhi kā̱ram a̍rcan vi̱danta̱ jyoti̍ś cakṛ̱panta̍ dhī̱bhiḥ
English: splendid were they when they had rent the mountain others around shall tell forth this their exploit  they sang their song prepared to free the cattle they found the light; with holy hymns they worshipped

Sanskrit: te ga̍vya̱tā mana̍sā dṛ̱dhram u̱bdhaṁ gā ye̍mā̱nam pari̱ ṣanta̱m adri̍m   dṛ̱ḻhaṁ naro̱ vaca̍sā̱ daivye̍na vra̱jaṁ goma̍ntam u̱śijo̱ vi va̍vruḥ
English: eager with thought intent upon the booty the men with their celestial speech threw open  the solid mountain firm compact enclosing confining cows the stable full of cattle

Sanskrit: te ma̍nvata pratha̱maṁ nāma̍ dhe̱nos triḥ sa̱pta mā̱tuḥ pa̍ra̱māṇi̍ vindan   taj jā̍na̱tīr a̱bhy a̍nūṣata̱ vrā ā̱vir bhu̍vad aru̱ṇīr ya̱śasā̱ goḥ
English: the milchcow's earliest name they comprehended they found the mother's thriceseven noblest titles  this the bands knew and sent forth acclamationwith the bull's sheen the red one was apparent

Sanskrit: neśa̱t tamo̱ dudhi̍ta̱ṁ roca̍ta̱ dyaur ud de̱vyā u̱ṣaso̍ bhā̱nur a̍rta   ā sūryo̍ bṛha̱tas ti̍ṣṭha̱d ajrā̍m̐ ṛ̱ju marte̍ṣu vṛji̱nā ca̱ paśya̍n
English: the turbid darkness fled the heaven was sp endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial morning  sūrya ascended to the wide expanses beholding deeds of men both good and evil

Sanskrit: ād it pa̱ścā bu̍budhā̱nā vy a̍khya̱nn ād id ratna̍ṁ dhārayanta̱ dyubha̍ktam   viśve̱ viśvā̍su̱ duryā̍su de̱vā mitra̍ dhi̱ye va̍ruṇa sa̱tyam a̍stu
English: then afterwards they looked around awakened when first they held that heaven allotted treasure  now all the gods abide in all their dwellings varuṇa mitra be the prayer effective

Sanskrit: acchā̍ voceya śuśucā̱nam a̱gniṁ hotā̍raṁ vi̱śvabha̍rasa̱ṁ yaji̍ṣṭham   śucy ūdho̍ atṛṇa̱n na gavā̱m andho̱ na pū̱tam pari̍ṣiktam a̱ṁśoḥ
English: i will call hither brightlybeaming agni the herald allsupporting best at worship  he hath disclosed like the milch cows' pure udder the sorria's juice when cleansed and poured from beakers

Sanskrit: viśve̍ṣā̱m adi̍tir ya̱jñiyā̍nā̱ṁ viśve̍ṣā̱m ati̍thi̱r mānu̍ṣāṇām   a̱gnir de̱vānā̱m ava̍ āvṛṇā̱naḥ su̍mṛḻī̱ko bha̍vatu jā̱tave̍dāḥ
English: the freest god of all who should be worshipped the guest who is received in all men's houses  agni who hath secured the gods high favourmay he be gracious to us jātavedas

Sanskrit: sa̱mu̱drād ū̱rmir madhu̍mā̱m̐ ud ā̍ra̱d upā̱ṁśunā̱ sam a̍mṛta̱tvam ā̍naṭ   ghṛ̱tasya̱ nāma̱ guhya̱ṁ yad asti̍ ji̱hvā de̱vānā̍m a̱mṛta̍sya̱ nābhi̍ḥ
English: forth from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness together with the stalk it turned to amṛta  that which is holy oil's mysterious title but the gods tongue is truly amṛta's centre

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ nāma̱ pra bra̍vāmā ghṛ̱tasyā̱smin ya̱jñe dhā̍rayāmā̱ namo̍bhiḥ   upa̍ bra̱hmā śṛ̍ṇavac cha̱syamā̍na̱ṁ catu̍ḥśṛṅgo 'vamīd gau̱ra e̱tat
English: let us declare aloud the name of ghṛta and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage  so let the brahman hear the praise we utter this hath the fourhorned buffalo emitted

Sanskrit: ca̱tvāri̱ śṛṅgā̱ trayo̍ asya̱ pādā̱ dve śī̱rṣe sa̱pta hastā̍so asya   tridhā̍ ba̱ddho vṛ̍ṣa̱bho ro̍ravīti ma̱ho de̱vo martyā̱m̐ ā vi̍veśa
English: four are his horns three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two his hands are seven in number  bound with a triple bond the steer roars loudly the mighty god hath entered in to mortals

Sanskrit: tridhā̍ hi̱tam pa̱ṇibhi̍r gu̱hyamā̍na̱ṁ gavi̍ de̱vāso̍ ghṛ̱tam anv a̍vindan   indra̱ eka̱ṁ sūrya̱ eka̍ṁ jajāna ve̱nād eka̍ṁ sva̱dhayā̱ niṣ ṭa̍takṣuḥ
English: that oil in triple shape the gods discovered laid down within the cow concealed by paṇis  indra produced one shape sūrya another by their own power they formed the third from vena

Sanskrit: e̱tā a̍rṣanti̱ hṛdyā̍t samu̱drāc cha̱tavra̍jā ri̱puṇā̱ nāva̱cakṣe̍   ghṛ̱tasya̱ dhārā̍ a̱bhi cā̍kaśīmi hira̱ṇyayo̍ veta̱so madhya̍ āsām
English: from inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not  i look upon the streams of oil descending and lo! the golden reed is there among them

Sanskrit: sa̱myak sra̍vanti sa̱rito̱ na dhenā̍ a̱ntar hṛ̱dā mana̍sā pū̱yamā̍nāḥ   e̱te a̍rṣanty ū̱rmayo̍ ghṛ̱tasya̍ mṛ̱gā i̍va kṣipa̱ṇor īṣa̍māṇāḥ
English: like rivers our libations flow together cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit  the streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman

Sanskrit: sindho̍r iva prādhva̱ne śū̍gha̱nāso̱ vāta̍pramiyaḥ patayanti ya̱hvāḥ   ghṛ̱tasya̱ dhārā̍ aru̱ṣo na vā̱jī kāṣṭhā̍ bhi̱ndann ū̱rmibhi̱ḥ pinva̍mānaḥ
English: as rushing down the rapids of a river flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents  the streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences

Sanskrit: a̱bhi pra̍vanta̱ sama̍neva̱ yoṣā̍ḥ kalyā̱ṇya1̱̍ḥ smaya̍mānāso a̱gnim   ghṛ̱tasya̱ dhārā̍ḥ sa̱midho̍ nasanta̱ tā ju̍ṣā̱ṇo ha̍ryati jā̱tave̍dāḥ
English: like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling they incline to agni  the streams of holy oil attain the fuel and jātavedas joyfully receives them

Sanskrit: ka̱nyā̍ iva vaha̱tum eta̱vā u̍ a̱ñjy a̍ñjā̱nā a̱bhi cā̍kaśīmi   yatra̱ soma̍ḥ sū̱yate̱ yatra̍ ya̱jño ghṛ̱tasya̱ dhārā̍ a̱bhi tat pa̍vante
English: as maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast i now behold them  where soma flows and sacrifice is ready thither the streams of holy oil are running

Sanskrit: a̱bhy a̍rṣata suṣṭu̱tiṁ gavya̍m ā̱jim a̱smāsu̍ bha̱drā dravi̍ṇāni dhatta   i̱maṁ ya̱jñaṁ na̍yata de̱vatā̍ no ghṛ̱tasya̱ dhārā̱ madhu̍mat pavante
English: send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions  bear to the gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness

Sanskrit: dhāma̍n te̱ viśva̱m bhuva̍na̱m adhi̍ śri̱tam a̱ntaḥ sa̍mu̱dre hṛ̱dy a1̱̍ntar āyu̍ṣi   a̱pām anī̍ke sami̱the ya ābhṛ̍ta̱s tam a̍śyāma̱ madhu̍mantaṁ ta ū̱rmim
English: the universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea within the heart within all life

Sanskrit: kṣetra̍sya̱ pati̍nā va̱yaṁ hi̱tene̍va jayāmasi   gām aśva̍m poṣayi̱tnv ā sa no̍ mṛḻātī̱dṛśe̍
English: we through the master of the field even as through a friend obtain  what nourisheth our kine and steeds in such may he be good to us

Sanskrit: kṣetra̍sya pate̱ madhu̍mantam ū̱rmiṁ dhe̱nur i̍va̱ payo̍ a̱smāsu̍ dhukṣva   ma̱dhu̱ścuta̍ṁ ghṛ̱tam i̍va̱ supū̍tam ṛ̱tasya̍ na̱ḥ pata̍yo mṛḻayantu
English: as the cow yieldeth milk pour for us freely lord of the field the wave that beareth sweetness  distilling meath wellpurified like butter and let the lords of holy law be gracious

Sanskrit: madhu̍matī̱r oṣa̍dhī̱r dyāva̱ āpo̱ madhu̍man no bhavatv a̱ntari̍kṣam   kṣetra̍sya̱ pati̱r madhu̍mān no a̱stv ari̍ṣyanto̱ anv e̍naṁ carema
English: sweet be the plants for us the heavens the waters and full of sweets for us be air's midregion  may the field's lord for us be full of sweetness and may we follow after him uninjured

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ vā̱hāḥ śu̱naṁ nara̍ḥ śu̱naṁ kṛ̍ṣatu̱ lāṅga̍lam   śu̱naṁ va̍ra̱trā ba̍dhyantāṁ śu̱nam aṣṭrā̱m ud i̍ṅgaya
English: happily work our steers and men may the plough furrow happily  happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad

Sanskrit: śunā̍sīrāv i̱māṁ vāca̍ṁ juṣethā̱ṁ yad di̱vi ca̱krathu̱ḥ paya̍ḥ   tene̱mām upa̍ siñcatam
English: śuna and sīra welcome ye this laud and with the milk which ye have made in heaven  bedew ye both this earth of ours

Sanskrit: a̱rvācī̍ subhage bhava̱ sīte̱ vandā̍mahe tvā   yathā̍ naḥ su̱bhagāsa̍si̱ yathā̍ naḥ su̱phalāsa̍si
English: auspicious sītā come thou near we venerate and worship thee  that thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly

Sanskrit: indra̱ḥ sītā̱ṁ ni gṛ̍hṇātu̱ tām pū̱ṣānu̍ yacchatu   sā na̱ḥ paya̍svatī duhā̱m utta̍rāmuttarā̱ṁ samā̍m
English: may indra press the furrow down may pūṣan guide its course aright  may she as rich in milk be drained for us through each succeeding year

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ na̱ḥ phālā̱ vi kṛ̍ṣantu̱ bhūmi̍ṁ śu̱naṁ kī̱nāśā̍ a̱bhi ya̍ntu vā̱haiḥ   śu̱nam pa̱rjanyo̱ madhu̍nā̱ payo̍bhi̱ḥ śunā̍sīrā śu̱nam a̱smāsu̍ dhattam
English: happily let the shares turn up the ploughland happily go the ploughers with the oxen  with meath and milk parjanya make us happy grant us prosperity śuna and sīra

Sanskrit: ma̱hī dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī i̱ha jyeṣṭhe̍ ru̱cā bha̍vatāṁ śu̱caya̍dbhir a̱rkaiḥ   yat sī̱ṁ vari̍ṣṭhe bṛha̱tī vi̍mi̱nvan ru̱vad dho̱kṣā pa̍prathā̱nebhi̱r evai̍ḥ
English: may mighty heaven and earth most meet for honour be present here with light and gleaming splendours;  when fixing them apart vast most extensive the steer roars loudly in farreaching courses

Sanskrit: de̱vī de̱vebhi̍r yaja̱te yaja̍trai̱r ami̍natī tasthatur u̱kṣamā̍ṇe   ṛ̱tāva̍rī a̱druhā̍ de̱vapu̍tre ya̱jñasya̍ ne̱trī śu̱caya̍dbhir a̱rkaiḥ
English: the goddesses with gods holy with holy the two stand pouring out their rain exhaustless  faithful and guileless having gods for children leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours

Sanskrit: sa it svapā̱ bhuva̍neṣv āsa̱ ya i̱me dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī ja̱jāna̍   u̱rvī ga̍bhī̱re raja̍sī su̱meke̍ ava̱ṁśe dhīra̱ḥ śacyā̱ sam ai̍rat
English: sure in the worlds he was a skilful craftsman he who produced these twain the earth and heaven  wise with his power he brought both realms together spacious and deep wellfashioned unsupported

Sanskrit: nū ro̍dasī bṛ̱hadbhi̍r no̱ varū̍thai̱ḥ patnī̍vadbhir i̱ṣaya̍ntī sa̱joṣā̍ḥ   u̱rū̱cī viśve̍ yaja̱te ni pā̍taṁ dhi̱yā syā̍ma ra̱thya̍ḥ sadā̱sāḥ
English: o heaven and earth with one accord promoting with high protection as of queens our welfare  farreaching universal holy guard us may we carborne through song be victors ever

Sanskrit: pra vā̱m mahi̱ dyavī̍ a̱bhy upa̍stutim bharāmahe   śucī̱ upa̱ praśa̍staye
English: to both of you o heaven and earth we bring our lofty song of praise  pure ones! to glorify you both

Sanskrit: pu̱nā̱ne ta̱nvā̍ mi̱thaḥ svena̱ dakṣe̍ṇa rājathaḥ   ū̱hyāthe̍ sa̱nād ṛ̱tam
English: ye sanctify each other's form by your own proper might ye rule  and from of old observe the law

Sanskrit: ma̱hī mi̱trasya̍ sādhatha̱s tara̍ntī̱ pipra̍tī ṛ̱tam   pari̍ ya̱jñaṁ ni ṣe̍dathuḥ
English: furthering and fulfilling ye o mighty perfect mitra's law  ye sit around our sacrifice

Sanskrit: ko va̍s trā̱tā va̍sava̱ḥ ko va̍rū̱tā dyāvā̍bhūmī adite̱ trāsī̍thāṁ naḥ   sahī̍yaso varuṇa mitra̱ martā̱t ko vo̍ 'dhva̱re vari̍vo dhāti devāḥ
English: who of you vasus saveth? who protecteth? o heaven and earth and aditi preserve us  varuṇa mitra from the stronger mortal gods which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?

Sanskrit: pra ye dhāmā̍ni pū̱rvyāṇy arcā̱n vi yad u̱cchān vi̍yo̱tāro̱ amū̍rāḥ   vi̱dhā̱tāro̱ vi te da̍dhu̱r aja̍srā ṛ̱tadhī̍tayo rurucanta da̱smāḥ
English: they who with laud extol the ancient statutes when they shine forth infallible dividers  have ordered as perpetual ordainers and beamed as holythoughted wonderworkers

Sanskrit: pra pa̱styā̱3̱̍m adi̍ti̱ṁ sindhu̍m a̱rkaiḥ sva̱stim ī̍ḻe sa̱khyāya̍ de̱vīm   u̱bhe yathā̍ no̱ aha̍nī ni̱pāta̍ u̱ṣāsā̱naktā̍ karatā̱m ada̍bdhe
English: the housewife goddess aditi and sindhu the goddess svasti i implore for friendship  and may the unobstructed night and morning both day and night provide for our protection

Sanskrit: vy a̍rya̱mā varu̍ṇaś ceti̱ panthā̍m i̱ṣas pati̍ḥ suvi̱taṁ gā̱tum a̱gniḥ   indrā̍viṣṇū nṛ̱vad u̱ ṣu stavā̍nā̱ śarma̍ no yanta̱m ama̍va̱d varū̍tham
English: aryaman varuṇa have disclosed the pathway agni as lord of strength the road to welfare  lauded in manly mode may indraviṣṇu grant us their powerful defence and shelter

Sanskrit: ā parva̍tasya ma̱rutā̱m avā̍ṁsi de̱vasya̍ trā̱tur a̍vri̱ bhaga̍sya   pāt pati̱r janyā̱d aṁha̍so no mi̱tro mi̱triyā̍d u̱ta na̍ uruṣyet
English: i have besought the favour of the maruts of parvata of bhaga god who rescues  from trouble caused by man the lord preserve us; from woe sent by his friend let mitra save us

Sanskrit: nū ro̍dasī̱ ahi̍nā bu̱dhnye̍na stuvī̱ta de̍vī̱ apye̍bhir i̱ṣṭaiḥ   sa̱mu̱draṁ na sa̱ṁcara̍ṇe sani̱ṣyavo̍ gha̱rmasva̍raso na̱dyo̱3̱̍ apa̍ vran
English: agree through these our watery oblations goddesses heaven and earth with ahibudhnya  as if to win the sea the gharmaheaters have opened as they come anear the rivers

Sanskrit: de̱vair no̍ de̱vy adi̍ti̱r ni pā̍tu de̱vas trā̱tā trā̍yatā̱m apra̍yucchan   na̱hi mi̱trasya̱ varu̍ṇasya dhā̱sim arhā̍masi pra̱miya̱ṁ sānv a̱gneḥ
English: may goddess aditi with gods defend us save us the saviour god with care unceasing  we dare not stint the sacred food of mitra and varuṇa upon the back of agni

Sanskrit: a̱gnir ī̍śe vasa̱vya̍syā̱gnir ma̱haḥ saubha̍gasya   tāny a̱smabhya̍ṁ rāsate
English: agni is sovran lord of wealth agni of great prosperity  may he bestow these gifts on us

Sanskrit: uṣo̍ magho̱ny ā va̍ha̱ sūnṛ̍te̱ vāryā̍ pu̱ru   a̱smabhya̍ṁ vājinīvati
English: hither to us rich pleasant dawn bring many things to be desired  thou who hast ample store of wealth

Sanskrit: tat su na̍ḥ savi̱tā bhago̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā   indro̍ no̱ rādha̱sā ga̍mat
English: so then may bhaga savitar varuṇa mitra aryaman indra with bounty come to us

Sanskrit: tad de̱vasya̍ savi̱tur vārya̍m ma̱had vṛ̍ṇī̱mahe̱ asu̍rasya̱ prace̍tasaḥ   cha̱rdir yena̍ dā̱śuṣe̱ yaccha̍ti̱ tmanā̱ tan no̍ ma̱hām̐ ud a̍yān de̱vo a̱ktubhi̍ḥ
English: of savitar the god the sapient asura we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice  wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence this with his rays the great god hath vouchsafed to us

Sanskrit: di̱vo dha̱rtā bhuva̍nasya pra̱jāpa̍tiḥ pi̱śaṅga̍ṁ drā̱pim prati̍ muñcate ka̱viḥ   vi̱ca̱kṣa̱ṇaḥ pra̱thaya̍nn āpṛ̱ṇann u̱rv ajī̍janat savi̱tā su̱mnam u̱kthya̍m
English: sustainer of the heaven lord of the whole world's life the sage he putteth on his goldencoloured mail  clearsighted spreading far filling the spacious realm savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud

Sanskrit: āprā̱ rajā̍ṁsi di̱vyāni̱ pārthi̍vā̱ śloka̍ṁ de̱vaḥ kṛ̍ṇute̱ svāya̱ dharma̍ṇe   pra bā̱hū a̍srāk savi̱tā savī̍mani nive̱śaya̍n prasu̱vann a̱ktubhi̱r jaga̍t
English: he hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth the god for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn  savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life producing with his rays and lulling all that moves

Sanskrit: adā̍bhyo̱ bhuva̍nāni pra̱cāka̍śad vra̱tāni̍ de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tābhi ra̍kṣate   prāsrā̍g bā̱hū bhuva̍nasya pra̱jābhyo̍ dhṛ̱tavra̍to ma̱ho ajma̍sya rājati
English: lighting all living creatures neer to be deceived savitar god protects each holy ordinance  he hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth and with his laws observed rules his own mighty course

Sanskrit: trir a̱ntari̍kṣaṁ savi̱tā ma̍hitva̱nā trī rajā̍ṁsi pari̱bhus trīṇi̍ roca̱nā   ti̱sro diva̍ḥ pṛthi̱vīs ti̱sra i̍nvati tri̱bhir vra̱tair a̱bhi no̍ rakṣati̱ tmanā̍
English: savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness midair three regions and the triple sphere of light  sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth and willingly protects us with his triple law

Sanskrit: bṛ̱hatsu̍mnaḥ prasavī̱tā ni̱veśa̍no̱ jaga̍taḥ sthā̱tur u̱bhaya̍sya̱ yo va̱śī   sa no̍ de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā śarma̍ yacchatv a̱sme kṣayā̍ya tri̱varū̍tha̱m aṁha̍saḥ
English: most gracious god who brings to life and lulls to rest he who controls the world what moves not and what moves  may he vouchsafe us sheltersavitar the godfor tranquil life with triple bar against distress

Sanskrit: āga̍n de̱va ṛ̱tubhi̱r vardha̍tu̱ kṣaya̱ṁ dadhā̍tu naḥ savi̱tā su̍pra̱jām iṣa̍m   sa na̍ḥ kṣa̱pābhi̱r aha̍bhiś ca jinvatu pra̱jāva̍ntaṁ ra̱yim a̱sme sam i̍nvatu
English: with the year's seasons hath savitar god come nigh may he prosper our home give food and noble sons  may he invigorate us through the days and nights and may he send us opulence with progeny

Sanskrit: abhū̍d de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā vandyo̱ nu na̍ i̱dānī̱m ahna̍ upa̱vācyo̱ nṛbhi̍ḥ   vi yo ratnā̱ bhaja̍ti māna̱vebhya̱ḥ śreṣṭha̍ṁ no̱ atra̱ dravi̍ṇa̱ṁ yathā̱ dadha̍t
English: now must we praise and honour savitar the god at this time of the day the men must call to him  him who distributes wealth to manu's progeny that he may grant us here riches most excellent

Sanskrit: de̱vebhyo̱ hi pra̍tha̱maṁ ya̱jñiye̍bhyo 'mṛta̱tvaṁ su̱vasi̍ bhā̱gam u̍tta̱mam   ād id dā̱māna̍ṁ savita̱r vy ū̍rṇuṣe 'nūcī̱nā jī̍vi̱tā mānu̍ṣebhyaḥ
English: for thou at first producest for the holy gods the noblest of all portions immortality  thereafter as a gift to men o savitar thou openest existence life succeeding life

Sanskrit: aci̍ttī̱ yac ca̍kṛ̱mā daivye̱ jane̍ dī̱nair dakṣai̱ḥ prabhū̍tī pūruṣa̱tvatā̍   de̱veṣu̍ ca savita̱r mānu̍ṣeṣu ca̱ tvaṁ no̱ atra̍ suvatā̱d anā̍gasaḥ
English: if we men as we are have sinned against the gods through want of thought in weakness or through insolence  absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin o savitar alike among both gods and men

Sanskrit: na pra̱miye̍ savi̱tur daivya̍sya̱ tad yathā̱ viśva̱m bhuva̍naṁ dhārayi̱ṣyati̍   yat pṛ̍thi̱vyā vari̍ma̱nn ā sva̍ṅgu̱rir varṣma̍n di̱vaḥ su̱vati̍ sa̱tyam a̍sya̱ tat
English: none may impede that power of savitar the god whereby he will maintain the universal world  what the fairfingered god brings forth on earth's expanse or in the height of heaven that work of his stands sure

Sanskrit: indra̍jyeṣṭhān bṛ̱hadbhya̱ḥ parva̍tebhya̱ḥ kṣayā̍m̐ ebhyaḥ suvasi pa̱styā̍vataḥ   yathā̍yathā pa̱taya̍nto viyemi̱ra e̱vaiva ta̍sthuḥ savitaḥ sa̱vāya̍ te
English: to lofty hills thou sendest those whom indra leads and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these  however they may fly and draw themselves apart still savitar they stand obeying thy behest

Sanskrit: ye te̱ trir aha̍n savitaḥ sa̱vāso̍ di̱vedi̍ve̱ saubha̍gam āsu̱vanti̍   indro̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī sindhu̍r a̱dbhir ā̍di̱tyair no̱ adi̍ti̱ḥ śarma̍ yaṁsat
English: may the libations poured to thee thrice daily day after day o savitar bring us blessing  may indra heaven earth sindhu with the waters aditi with ādityas give us shelter

Sanskrit: prati̱ ṣyā sū̱narī̱ janī̍ vyu̱cchantī̱ pari̱ svasu̍ḥ   di̱vo a̍darśi duhi̱tā
English: this lady giver of delight after her sister shining forth daughter of heaven hath shown herself

Sanskrit: aśve̍va ci̱trāru̍ṣī mā̱tā gavā̍m ṛ̱tāva̍rī   sakhā̍bhūd a̱śvino̍r u̱ṣāḥ
English: unfailing mother of the kine in colour like a bright red mare  the dawn became the aśvins' friend

Sanskrit: u̱ta sakhā̍sy a̱śvino̍r u̱ta mā̱tā gavā̍m asi   u̱toṣo̱ vasva̍ īśiṣe
English: yea and thou art the aśvins' friend the mother of the kine art thou  o dawn thou rulest over wealth

Sanskrit: yā̱va̱yaddve̍ṣasaṁ tvā ciki̱tvit sū̍nṛtāvari   prati̱ stomai̍r abhutsmahi
English: thinking of thee o joyous one as her who driveth hate away  we woke to meet thee with our lauds

Sanskrit: prati̍ bha̱drā a̍dṛkṣata̱ gavā̱ṁ sargā̱ na ra̱śmaya̍ḥ   oṣā a̍prā u̱ru jraya̍ḥ
English: our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed  dawn hath filled full the wide expanse

Sanskrit: ā̱pa̱pruṣī̍ vibhāvari̱ vy ā̍va̱r jyoti̍ṣā̱ tama̍ḥ   uṣo̱ anu̍ sva̱dhām a̍va
English: when thou hast filled it fulgent one! thou layest bare the gloom with light  after thy nature aid us dawn

Sanskrit: ā dyāṁ ta̍noṣi ra̱śmibhi̱r āntari̍kṣam u̱ru pri̱yam   uṣa̍ḥ śu̱kreṇa̍ śo̱ciṣā̍
English: thou overspreadest heaven with rays the dear wide region of midair  with thy bright shining lustre dawn

Sanskrit: i̱dam u̱ tyat pu̍ru̱tama̍m pu̱rastā̱j jyoti̱s tama̍so va̱yunā̍vad asthāt   nū̱naṁ di̱vo du̍hi̱taro̍ vibhā̱tīr gā̱tuṁ kṛ̍ṇavann u̱ṣaso̱ janā̍ya
English: forth from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hatb mounted  now verily the farrefulgent mornings daughters of heaven bring welfare to the people

Sanskrit: asthu̍r u ci̱trā u̱ṣasa̍ḥ pu̱rastā̍n mi̱tā i̍va̱ svara̍vo 'dhva̱reṣu̍   vy ū̍ vra̱jasya̱ tama̍so̱ dvāro̱cchantī̍r avra̱ñ chuca̍yaḥ pāva̱kāḥ
English: the richlycoloured dawns have mounted eastward like pillars planted at our sacrifices  and flushing far splendid and purifying unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness

Sanskrit: u̱cchantī̍r a̱dya ci̍tayanta bho̱jān rā̍dho̱deyā̍yo̱ṣaso̍ ma̱ghonī̍ḥ   a̱ci̱tre a̱ntaḥ pa̱ṇaya̍ḥ sasa̱ntv abu̍dhyamānā̱s tama̍so̱ vima̍dhye
English: dispelling gloom this day the wealthy mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures  in the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened

Sanskrit: ku̱vit sa de̍vīḥ sa̱nayo̱ navo̍ vā̱ yāmo̍ babhū̱yād u̍ṣaso vo a̱dya   yenā̱ nava̍gve̱ aṅgi̍re̱ daśa̍gve sa̱ptāsye̍ revatī re̱vad ū̱ṣa
English: o goddesses is this your car i ask you ancient this day or is it new ye mornings  wherewith rich dawns ye seek with wealth navagva daśagva aṅgira the seventoned singer?

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ hi de̍vīr ṛta̱yugbhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ pariprayā̱tha bhuva̍nāni sa̱dyaḥ   pra̱bo̱dhaya̍ntīr uṣasaḥ sa̱santa̍ṁ dvi̱pāc catu̍ṣpāc ca̱rathā̍ya jī̱vam
English: with horses harnessed by eternal order goddesses swiftly round the worlds ye travel  arousing from their rest o dawns the sleeping and all that lives man bird and beast to motion

Sanskrit: kva̍ svid āsāṁ kata̱mā pu̍rā̱ṇī yayā̍ vi̱dhānā̍ vida̱dhur ṛ̍bhū̱ṇām   śubha̱ṁ yac chu̱bhrā u̱ṣasa̱ś cara̍nti̱ na vi jñā̍yante sa̱dṛśī̍r aju̱ryāḥ
English: which among these is eldest and where is she through whom they fixed the ṛbhus' regulations?  what time the splendid dawns go forth for splendour they are not known apart alike unwasting

Sanskrit: tā ghā̱ tā bha̱drā u̱ṣasa̍ḥ pu̱rāsu̍r abhi̱ṣṭidyu̍mnā ṛ̱tajā̍tasatyāḥ   yāsv ī̍jā̱naḥ śa̍śamā̱na u̱kthaiḥ stu̱vañ chaṁsa̱n dravi̍ṇaṁ sa̱dya āpa̍
English: blest were these dawns of old shining with succour true with the truth that springs from holy order;  with whom the toiling worshipper by praises hymning and lauding soon attained to riches

Sanskrit: tā ā ca̍ranti sama̱nā pu̱rastā̍t samā̱nata̍ḥ sama̱nā pa̍prathā̱nāḥ   ṛ̱tasya̍ de̱vīḥ sada̍so budhā̱nā gavā̱ṁ na sargā̍ u̱ṣaso̍ jarante
English: hither from eastward all at once they travel from one place spreading in the selfsame manner  awaking from the seat of holy order the godlike dawns come nigh like troops of cattle

English: wheneer i gratified you here together your grace was given us o ye rich in booty  protect ye twain the singer of your praises to you nāsatyas is my wish directed

English: i am the royal ruler mine is empire as mine who sway all life are all immortals  varuṇa's will the gods obey and follow i am the king of men's most lofty cover

English: i am king varuṇa to me were given these first existing high celestial powers  varuṇa's will the gods obey and follow i am the king of men's most lofty cover

English: i varuṇa am indra in their greatness these the two wide deep fairlyfashioned regions  these the two worldhalves have i even as tvaṣṭar knowing all beings joined and held together

Sanskrit: a̱ham a̱po a̍pinvam u̱kṣamā̍ṇā dhā̱raya̱ṁ diva̱ṁ sada̍na ṛ̱tasya̍   ṛ̱tena̍ pu̱tro adi̍ter ṛ̱tāvo̱ta tri̱dhātu̍ prathaya̱d vi bhūma̍
English: i made to flow the moistureshedding waters and set the heaven firm in the scat of order  by law the son of aditi law observer hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure

Sanskrit: māṁ nara̱ḥ svaśvā̍ vā̱jaya̍nto̱ māṁ vṛ̱tāḥ sa̱mara̍ṇe havante   kṛ̱ṇomy ā̱jim ma̱ghavā̱ham indra̱ iya̍rmi re̱ṇum a̱bhibhū̍tyojāḥ
English: heroes with noble horses fain for battle selected warriors call on me in combat  i indra maghavan excite the conflict; i stir the dust lord of surpassing vigour

Sanskrit: a̱haṁ tā viśvā̍ cakara̱ṁ naki̍r mā̱ daivya̱ṁ saho̍ varate̱ apra̍tītam   yan mā̱ somā̍so ma̱mada̱n yad u̱kthobhe bha̍yete̱ raja̍sī apā̱re
English: all this i did the gods own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth  when lauds and soma juice have made me joyful both the unbounded regions are affrighted

Sanskrit: vi̱duṣ ṭe̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ tasya̱ tā pra bra̍vīṣi̱ varu̍ṇāya vedhaḥ   tvaṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ śṛṇviṣe jagha̱nvān tvaṁ vṛ̱tām̐ a̍riṇā indra̱ sindhū̍n
English: all beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto varuṇa thou great disposer!  thou art renowned as having slain the vṛtras thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed

Sanskrit: a̱smāka̱m atra̍ pi̱tara̱s ta ā̍san sa̱pta ṛṣa̍yo daurga̱he ba̱dhyamā̍ne   ta āya̍janta tra̱sada̍syum asyā̱ indra̱ṁ na vṛ̍tra̱tura̍m ardhade̱vam
English: our fathers then were these the seven his what time the son of durgaha was captive  for her they gained by sacrifice trasadasyu a demigod like indra conquering foemen
