English: may our laudation of you twain lovers of meath! be sweet to you  fly hitherward ye wise of heart like falcons with your winged steeds

Sanskrit: aśvi̍nā̱ yad dha̱ karhi̍ cic chuśrū̱yāta̍m i̱maṁ hava̍m   vasvī̍r ū̱ ṣu vā̱m bhuja̍ḥ pṛ̱ñcanti̱ su vā̱m pṛca̍ḥ
English: o aśvins when at any time ye listen to this call of mine  for you is dainty food prepared they mix refreshing food for you

Sanskrit: yad a̱dya sthaḥ pa̍rā̱vati̱ yad a̍rvā̱vaty a̍śvinā   yad vā̍ pu̱rū pu̍rubhujā̱ yad a̱ntari̍kṣa̱ ā ga̍tam
English: whether o aśvins ye this day be far remote or near at hand  in many spots or in midair come hither lords of ample wealth

Sanskrit: i̱ha tyā pu̍ru̱bhūta̍mā pu̱rū daṁsā̍ṁsi̱ bibhra̍tā   va̱ra̱syā yā̱my adhri̍gū hu̱ve tu̱viṣṭa̍mā bhu̱je
English: these here who show oer widest space bringing full many a wondrous act  resistless lovingly i seek i call the mightiest to enjoy

Sanskrit: ī̱rmānyad vapu̍ṣe̱ vapu̍ś ca̱kraṁ ratha̍sya yemathuḥ   pary a̱nyā nāhu̍ṣā yu̱gā ma̱hnā rajā̍ṁsi dīyathaḥ
English: another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car  with others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes

Sanskrit: tad ū̱ ṣu vā̍m e̱nā kṛ̱taṁ viśvā̱ yad vā̱m anu̱ ṣṭave̍   nānā̍ jā̱tāv a̍re̱pasā̱ sam a̱sme bandhu̱m eya̍thuḥ
English: that deed of yours that is extolled visvas! hath all been done with this  born otherwise and spotless ye have entered kinship's bonds with us

Sanskrit: ā yad vā̍ṁ sū̱ryā ratha̱ṁ tiṣṭha̍d raghu̱ṣyada̱ṁ sadā̍   pari̍ vām aru̱ṣā vayo̍ ghṛ̱ṇā va̍ranta ā̱tapa̍ḥ
English: when sūrya mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly  birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you

Sanskrit: yu̱vor atri̍ś ciketati̱ narā̍ su̱mnena̱ ceta̍sā   gha̱rmaṁ yad vā̍m are̱pasa̱ṁ nāsa̍tyā̱snā bhu̍ra̱ṇyati̍
English: atri bethinks himself of you o heroes with a friendly mind  what time nāsatyas with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you

Sanskrit: u̱gro vā̍ṁ kaku̱ho ya̱yiḥ śṛ̱ṇve yāme̍ṣu saṁta̱niḥ   yad vā̱ṁ daṁso̍bhir aśvi̱nātri̍r narāva̱varta̍ti
English: strong is your swiftly moving steed famed his exertion in the course  when by your great deeds aśvins chiefs atri is brought to us again

Sanskrit: madhva̍ ū̱ ṣu ma̍dhūyuvā̱ rudrā̱ siṣa̍kti pi̱pyuṣī̍   yat sa̍mu̱drāti̱ parṣa̍thaḥ pa̱kvāḥ pṛkṣo̍ bharanta vām
English: lovers of sweetness rudras she who streams with sweetness waits on you  when ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of welldressed food

Sanskrit: sa̱tyam id vā u̍ aśvinā yu̱vām ā̍hur mayo̱bhuvā̍   tā yāma̍n yāma̱hūta̍mā̱ yāma̱nn ā mṛ̍ḻa̱yatta̍mā
English: aśvins with truth they call you twain bestowers of felicity;  at sacrifice most prompt to hear most gracious ye at sacrifice

Sanskrit: i̱mā brahmā̍ṇi̱ vardha̍nā̱śvibhyā̍ṁ santu̱ śaṁta̍mā   yā takṣā̍ma̱ rathā̍m̐ i̱vāvo̍cāma bṛ̱han nama̍ḥ
English: most pleasing to the aśvins be these prayers which magnify their might  which we have fashioned even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth

Sanskrit: ā no̍ gantaṁ riśādasā̱ varu̍ṇa̱ mitra̍ ba̱rhaṇā̍   upe̱maṁ cāru̍m adhva̱ram
English: o varuṇa and mitra ye who slay the foemen come with might  to this our goodly sacrifice

Sanskrit: viśva̍sya̱ hi pra̍cetasā̱ varu̍ṇa̱ mitra̱ rāja̍thaḥ   ī̱śā̱nā pi̍pyata̱ṁ dhiya̍ḥ
English: for varuṇa and mitra ye sages are rulers over all fill full our songs for this ye can

Sanskrit: upa̍ naḥ su̱tam ā ga̍ta̱ṁ varu̍ṇa̱ mitra̍ dā̱śuṣa̍ḥ   a̱sya soma̍sya pī̱taye̍
English: come to the juice that we have pressed varuṇa mitra come to drink  this soma of the worshipper

Sanskrit: ā mi̱tre varu̍ṇe va̱yaṁ gī̱rbhir ju̍humo atri̱vat   ni ba̱rhiṣi̍ sadata̱ṁ soma̍pītaye
English: to varuṇa and mitra we offer with songs as atri did sit on the sacred grass to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: vra̱tena̍ stho dhru̱vakṣe̍mā̱ dharma̍ṇā yāta̱yajja̍nā   ni ba̱rhiṣi̍ sadata̱ṁ soma̍pītaye
English: by ordinance and law ye dwell in peace secure bestirring men  sit on the sacred grass to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: mi̱traś ca̍ no̱ varu̍ṇaś ca ju̱ṣetā̍ṁ ya̱jñam i̱ṣṭaye̍   ni ba̱rhiṣi̍ sadatā̱ṁ soma̍pītaye
English: may varuṇa and mitra for our help accept the sacrifice  sit on the sacred grass to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: trī ro̍ca̱nā va̍ruṇa̱ trīm̐r u̱ta dyūn trīṇi̍ mitra dhārayatho̱ rajā̍ṁsi   vā̱vṛ̱dhā̱nāv a̱mati̍ṁ kṣa̱triya̱syānu̍ vra̱taṁ rakṣa̍māṇāv aju̱ryam
English: three spheres of light o varuṇa three heavens three firmaments ye comprehend o mitra  waxed strong ye keep the splendour of dominion guarding the ordinance that lasts for ever

Sanskrit: irā̍vatīr varuṇa dhe̱navo̍ vā̱m madhu̍mad vā̱ṁ sindha̍vo mitra duhre   traya̍s tasthur vṛṣa̱bhāsa̍s tisṛ̱ṇāṁ dhi̱ṣaṇā̍nāṁ reto̱dhā vi dyu̱manta̍ḥ
English: ye varuṇa have kine who yield refreshment; mitra your floods pour water full of sweetness  there stand the three steers splendid in their brightness who fill the three worldbowls with genial moisture

Sanskrit: prā̱tar de̱vīm adi̍tiṁ johavīmi ma̱dhyaṁdi̍na̱ udi̍tā̱ sūrya̍sya   rā̱ye mi̍trāvaruṇā sa̱rvatā̱teḻe̍ to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya̱ śaṁ yoḥ
English: i call at dawn on aditi the goddess i call at noon and when the sun is setting  i pray o mitravaruṇa for safety for wealth and progeny in rest and trouble

Sanskrit: yā dha̱rtārā̱ raja̍so roca̱nasyo̱tādi̱tyā di̱vyā pārthi̍vasya   na vā̍ṁ de̱vā a̱mṛtā̱ ā mi̍nanti vra̱tāni̍ mitrāvaruṇā dhru̱vāṇi̍
English: ye who uphold the region sphere of brightness ye who support earth's realm divine ādityas  the immortal gods o varuṇa and mitra never impair your everlasting statutes

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ mi̱trāya̍ gāyata̱ varu̍ṇāya vi̱pā gi̱rā   mahi̍kṣatrāv ṛ̱tam bṛ̱hat
English: sing forth unto your varuṇa and mitra with a song inspired  they mighty lords are lofty law

Sanskrit: sa̱mrājā̱ yā ghṛ̱tayo̍nī mi̱traś co̱bhā varu̍ṇaś ca   de̱vā de̱veṣu̍ praśa̱stā
English: full springs of fatness sovran kings mitra and varuṇa the twain  gods glorified among the gods

Sanskrit: tā na̍ḥ śakta̱m pārthi̍vasya ma̱ho rā̱yo di̱vyasya̍   mahi̍ vāṁ kṣa̱traṁ de̱veṣu̍
English: so help ye us to riches great terrestrial and celestial wealth  vast is your sway among the gods

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tam ṛ̱tena̱ sapa̍nteṣi̱raṁ dakṣa̍m āśāte   a̱druhā̍ de̱vau va̍rdhete
English: carefully tending law with law they have attained their vigorous might  the two gods wax devoid of guile

Sanskrit: vṛ̱ṣṭidyā̍vā rī̱tyā̍pe̱ṣas patī̱ dānu̍matyāḥ   bṛ̱hanta̱ṁ garta̍m āśāte
English: with rainy skies and streaming floods lords of the strength that bringeth gifts  a lofty seat have they attained

Sanskrit: yaś ci̱keta̱ sa su̱kratu̍r deva̱trā sa bra̍vītu naḥ   varu̍ṇo̱ yasya̍ darśa̱to mi̱tro vā̱ vana̍te̱ gira̍ḥ
English: full wise is he who hath discerned let him speak to us of the gods  the man whose praisesongs varuṇa the beautiful or mitra loves

Sanskrit: tā hi śreṣṭha̍varcasā̱ rājā̍nā dīrgha̱śrutta̍mā   tā satpa̍tī ṛtā̱vṛdha̍ ṛ̱tāvā̍nā̱ jane̍jane
English: for they are kings of noblest might of glorious fame most widely spread;  lords of the brave who strengthen law the holy ones with every race

Sanskrit: tā vā̍m iyā̱no 'va̍se̱ pūrvā̱ upa̍ bruve̱ sacā̍   svaśvā̍sa̱ḥ su ce̱tunā̱ vājā̍m̐ a̱bhi pra dā̱vane̍
English: approaching you with prayer for aid together i address you first  we who have good steeds call on you most sage to give us strength besides

Sanskrit: mi̱tro a̱ṁhoś ci̱d ād u̱ru kṣayā̍ya gā̱tuṁ va̍nate   mi̱trasya̱ hi pra̱tūrva̍taḥ suma̱tir asti̍ vidha̱taḥ
English: een out of misery mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case  for he who worships hath the grace of mitra fighter in the van '

Sanskrit: va̱yam mi̱trasyāva̍si̱ syāma̍ sa̱pratha̍stame   a̱ne̱hasa̱s tvota̍yaḥ sa̱trā varu̍ṇaśeṣasaḥ
English: in mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell  unmenaced guarded by the care ever as sons of varuṇa

Sanskrit: yu̱vam mi̍tre̱maṁ jana̱ṁ yata̍tha̱ḥ saṁ ca̍ nayathaḥ   mā ma̱ghona̱ḥ pari̍ khyata̱m mo a̱smāka̱m ṛṣī̍ṇāṁ gopī̱the na̍ uruṣyatam
English: ye mitra urge this people on and to one end direct their ways  neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs neglect not us the ṛṣis be our guardians when ye quaff the milk

Sanskrit: ā ci̍kitāna su̱kratū̍ de̱vau ma̍rta ri̱śāda̍sā   varu̍ṇāya ṛ̱tape̍śase dadhī̱ta praya̍se ma̱he
English: o sapient man call the two gods the very wise who slay the foe  for varuṇa whose form is law place offerings for his great delight

Sanskrit: tā hi kṣa̱tram avi̍hrutaṁ sa̱myag a̍su̱rya1̱̍m āśā̍te   adha̍ vra̱teva̱ mānu̍ṣa̱ṁ sva1̱̍r ṇa dhā̍yi darśa̱tam
English: for they have won unbroken sway in full perfection power divine  and like high laws the world of man hath been made beautiful as light

Sanskrit: tā vā̱m eṣe̱ rathā̍nām u̱rvīṁ gavyū̍tim eṣām   rā̱taha̍vyasya suṣṭu̱tiṁ da̱dhṛk stomai̍r manāmahe
English: therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours  you who accept the eulogy of ratahavya with his hymns

Sanskrit: adhā̱ hi kāvyā̍ yu̱vaṁ dakṣa̍sya pū̱rbhir a̍dbhutā   ni ke̱tunā̱ janā̍nāṁ ci̱kethe̍ pūtadakṣasā
English: and ye show wmom wondrous gods with fulness of intelligence  by men's discernment are ve marked o ye whose might is purified

Sanskrit: tad ṛ̱tam pṛ̍thivi bṛ̱hac chra̍vae̱ṣa ṛṣī̍ṇām   jra̱ya̱sā̱nāv ara̍m pṛ̱thv ati̍ kṣaranti̱ yāma̍bhiḥ
English: this is the law sublime o earth to aid the ṛṣis toil for fame  the two widespreading are prepared they come with ample overflow

Sanskrit: ā yad vā̍m īyacakṣasā̱ mitra̍ va̱yaṁ ca̍ sū̱raya̍ḥ   vyaci̍ṣṭhe bahu̱pāyye̱ yate̍mahi sva̱rājye̍
English: mitra ye gods with wandering eyes would that the worshippers and we  might strive to reach the realm ye rule most spacious and protected well

Sanskrit: ṛta̍sya gopā̱v adhi̍ tiṣṭhatho̱ ratha̱ṁ satya̍dharmāṇā para̱me vyo̍mani   yam atra̍ mitrāvaru̱ṇāva̍tho yu̱vaṁ tasmai̍ vṛ̱ṣṭir madhu̍mat pinvate di̱vaḥ
English: guardians of order ye whose laws are ever true in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend  o mitravaruṇa whomsoeer ye favour here to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven

Sanskrit: sa̱mrājā̍v a̱sya bhuva̍nasya rājatho̱ mitrā̍varuṇā vi̱dathe̍ sva̱rdṛśā̍   vṛ̱ṣṭiṁ vā̱ṁ rādho̍ amṛta̱tvam ī̍mahe̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī vi ca̍ranti ta̱nyava̍ḥ
English: this world's imperial kings o mitravaruṇa ye rule in holy synod looking on the light  we pray for rain your boon and immortality through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way

Sanskrit: sa̱mrājā̍ u̱grā vṛ̍ṣa̱bhā di̱vas patī̍ pṛthi̱vyā mi̱trāvaru̍ṇā̱ vica̍rṣaṇī   ci̱trebhi̍r a̱bhrair upa̍ tiṣṭhatho̱ rava̱ṁ dyāṁ va̍rṣayatho̱ asu̍rasya mā̱yayā̍
English: imperial kings strong heroes lords of earth and heaven mitra and varuṇa ye ever active ones  ye wait on thunder with the manytinted clouds and by the asura's magic power cause heaven to rain

Sanskrit: mā̱yā vā̍m mitrāvaruṇā di̱vi śri̱tā sūryo̱ jyoti̍ś carati ci̱tram āyu̍dham   tam a̱bhreṇa̍ vṛ̱ṣṭyā gū̍hatho di̱vi parja̍nya dra̱psā madhu̍manta īrate
English: your magic mitravaruṇa resteth in the heaven the sun the wondrous weapon cometh forth as light  ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain and waterdrops parjanya! full of sweetness flow

Sanskrit: ratha̍ṁ yuñjate ma̱ruta̍ḥ śu̱bhe su̱khaṁ śūro̱ na mi̍trāvaruṇā̱ gavi̍ṣṭiṣu   rajā̍ṁsi ci̱trā vi ca̍ranti ta̱nyavo̍ di̱vaḥ sa̍mrājā̱ paya̍sā na ukṣatam
English: the maruts yoke their easy car for victory o mitravaruṇa as a hero in the wars  the thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues imperial kings bedew us with the milk of heaven

Sanskrit: vāca̱ṁ su mi̍trāvaruṇā̱v irā̍vatīm pa̱rjanya̍ś ci̱trāṁ va̍dati̱ tviṣī̍matīm   a̱bhrā va̍sata ma̱ruta̱ḥ su mā̱yayā̱ dyāṁ va̍rṣayatam aru̱ṇām a̍re̱pasa̍m
English: refreshing is your voice o mitravaruṇa parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice  with magic power the maruts clothe them with the clouds ye two cause heaven to rain the red the spotless one

Sanskrit: dharma̍ṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā vra̱tā ra̍kṣethe̱ asu̍rasya mā̱yayā̍   ṛ̱tena̱ viśva̱m bhuva̍na̱ṁ vi rā̍jatha̱ḥ sūrya̱m ā dha̍ttho di̱vi citrya̱ṁ ratha̍m
English: wise with your law and through the asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances mitravaruṇa  ye by eternal order govern all the world ye set the sun in heaven as a refulgent car

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tena̍ ṛ̱tam api̍hitaṁ dhru̱vaṁ vā̱ṁ sūrya̍sya̱ yatra̍ vimu̱canty aśvā̍n   daśa̍ śa̱tā sa̱ha ta̍sthu̱s tad eka̍ṁ de̱vānā̱ṁ śreṣṭha̱ṁ vapu̍ṣām apaśyam
English: by your high law firm order is established there where they loose for travel sūrya's horses  ten hundred stood together there i looked on this the most marvellous deities' one chief glory

Sanskrit: tat su vā̍m mitrāvaruṇā mahi̱tvam ī̱rmā ta̱sthuṣī̱r aha̍bhir duduhre   viśvā̍ḥ pinvatha̱ḥ svasa̍rasya̱ dhenā̱ anu̍ vā̱m eka̍ḥ pa̱vir ā va̍varta
English: this mitravaruṇa is your special greatness floods that stood there they with the days attracted  ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither

Sanskrit: adhā̍rayatam pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām mitra̍rājānā varuṇā̱ maho̍bhiḥ   va̱rdhaya̍ta̱m oṣa̍dhī̱ḥ pinva̍ta̱ṁ gā ava̍ vṛ̱ṣṭiṁ sṛ̍jataṁ jīradānū
English: o mitravaruṇa ye by your greatness both kings have firmly stablished earth and heaven  ye caused the cows to stream the plants to flourish and scattering swift drops sent down the rainflood

Sanskrit: ā vā̱m aśvā̍saḥ su̱yujo̍ vahantu ya̱tara̍śmaya̱ upa̍ yantv a̱rvāk   ghṛ̱tasya̍ ni̱rṇig anu̍ vartate vā̱m upa̱ sindha̍vaḥ pra̱divi̍ kṣaranti
English: let your wellharnessed horses bear you hither hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly  a covering cloud of sacred oil attends you and your streams flow to us from days aforetime

Sanskrit: anu̍ śru̱tām a̱mati̱ṁ vardha̍d u̱rvīm ba̱rhir i̍va̱ yaju̍ṣā̱ rakṣa̍māṇā   nama̍svantā dhṛtada̱kṣādhi̱ garte̱ mitrāsā̍the varu̱ṇeḻā̍sv a̱ntaḥ
English: to make the lustre wider and more famous guarding the sacred grass with veneration  ye mitravaruṇa firm strong aweinspiring are seated on a throne amid oblations

Sanskrit: akra̍vihastā su̱kṛte̍ para̱spā yaṁ trāsā̍the varu̱ṇeḻā̍sv a̱ntaḥ   rājā̍nā kṣa̱tram ahṛ̍ṇīyamānā sa̱hasra̍sthūṇam bibhṛthaḥ sa̱ha dvau
English: with hands that shed no blood guarding the pious whom varuni3 ye save amid oblations  ye twain together kings of willing spirit uphold dominion based on thousand pillars

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyanirṇi̱g ayo̍ asya̱ sthūṇā̱ vi bhrā̍jate di̱vy a1̱̍śvāja̍nīva   bha̱dre kṣetre̱ nimi̍tā̱ tilvi̍le vā sa̱nema̱ madhvo̱ adhi̍gartyasya
English: adorned with gold its columns are of iron in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses;  or stablished on a field deepspoiled and fruitful so may we share the meath that loads your carseat

Sanskrit: hira̍ṇyarūpam u̱ṣaso̱ vyu̍ṣṭā̱v aya̍ḥsthūṇa̱m udi̍tā̱ sūrya̍sya   ā ro̍hatho varuṇa mitra̱ garta̱m ata̍ś cakṣāthe̱ adi̍ti̱ṁ diti̍ṁ ca
English: ye mount your car goldhued at break of morning and ironpillared when the sun is setting  and from that place o varuṇa and mitra behold infinity and limit~tion

Sanskrit: yad baṁhi̍ṣṭha̱ṁ nāti̱vidhe̍ sudānū̱ acchi̍dra̱ṁ śarma̍ bhuvanasya gopā   tena̍ no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭa̱ṁ siṣā̍santo jigī̱vāṁsa̍ḥ syāma
English: bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable strongest flawless  aid us with that o varuṇa and mitra and when we long to win may we be victors

Sanskrit: varu̍ṇaṁ vo ri̱śāda̍sam ṛ̱cā mi̱traṁ ha̍vāmahe   pari̍ vra̱jeva̍ bā̱hvor ja̍ga̱nvāṁsā̱ sva̍rṇaram
English: you foemanslaying varuṇa and mitra we invoke with song  who as with penfold of your arms encompass round the realm of light

Sanskrit: tā bā̱havā̍ suce̱tunā̱ pra ya̍ntam asmā̱ arca̍te   śeva̱ṁ hi jā̱rya̍ṁ vā̱ṁ viśvā̍su̱ kṣāsu̱ jogu̍ve
English: stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns  for in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness

Sanskrit: yan nū̱nam a̱śyāṁ gati̍m mi̱trasya̍ yāyām pa̱thā   asya̍ pri̱yasya̱ śarma̱ṇy ahi̍ṁsānasya saścire
English: that i may gain a refuge now may my steps be on mitra's path  men go protected in the charge of this dear friend who harms us not

Sanskrit: yu̱vābhyā̍m mitrāvaruṇopa̱maṁ dhe̍yām ṛ̱cā   yad dha̱ kṣaye̍ ma̱ghonā̍ṁ stotṝ̱ṇāṁ ca̍ spū̱rdhase̍
English: mitra and varuṇa from you may i by song win noblest meed  that shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise

Sanskrit: ā no̍ mitra sudī̱tibhi̱r varu̍ṇaś ca sa̱dhastha̱ ā   sve kṣaye̍ ma̱ghonā̱ṁ sakhī̍nāṁ ca vṛ̱dhase̍
English: with your fair splendours varuṇa and mitra to our gathering come  that in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive

Sanskrit: yu̱vaṁ no̱ yeṣu̍ varuṇa kṣa̱tram bṛ̱hac ca̍ bibhṛ̱thaḥ   u̱ru ṇo̱ vāja̍sātaye kṛ̱taṁ rā̱ye sva̱staye̍
English: with those moreover among whom ye hold your high supremacy  vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth

Sanskrit: u̱cchantyā̍m me yaja̱tā de̱vakṣa̍tre̱ ruśa̍dgavi   su̱taṁ soma̱ṁ na ha̱stibhi̱r ā pa̱ḍbhir dhā̍vataṁ narā̱ bibhra̍tāv arca̱nāna̍sam
English: when morning flushes holy ones! in the gods realm where white cows shine  supporting arcananas speed ye heroes with your active feet hither to my pressed soma juice

Sanskrit: baḻ i̱tthā de̍va niṣkṛ̱tam ādi̍tyā yaja̱tam bṛ̱hat   varu̍ṇa̱ mitrārya̍ma̱n varṣi̍ṣṭhaṁ kṣa̱tram ā̍śāthe
English: ye gods ādityas varuṇa aryaman mitra verily  have here obtained supremest sway high holy set apart for you

Sanskrit: ā yad yoni̍ṁ hira̱ṇyaya̱ṁ varu̍ṇa̱ mitra̱ sada̍thaḥ   dha̱rtārā̍ carṣaṇī̱nāṁ ya̱ntaṁ su̱mnaṁ ri̍śādasā
English: when varuṇa and mitra ye sit in your golden dwellingplace  ye twain supporters of mankind foeslayers give felicity

Sanskrit: viśve̱ hi vi̱śvave̍daso̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā   vra̱tā pa̱deva̍ saścire̱ pānti̱ martya̍ṁ ri̱ṣaḥ
English: all these possessors of all wealth varuṇa mitra aryaman  follow their ways as if with feet and guard from injury mortal man

Sanskrit: te hi sa̱tyā ṛ̍ta̱spṛśa̍ ṛ̱tāvā̍no̱ jane̍jane   su̱nī̱thāsa̍ḥ su̱dāna̍vo̱ 'ṁhoś ci̍d uru̱cakra̍yaḥ
English: for they are true they cleave to law held holy among every race  good leaders bounteous in their gifts deliverers even from distress

Sanskrit: ko nu vā̍m mi̱trāstu̍to̱ varu̍ṇo vā ta̱nūnā̍m   tat su vā̱m eṣa̍te ma̱tir atri̍bhya̱ eṣa̍te ma̱tiḥ
English: which of your persons varuṇa or mitra merits not our praise?  therefore our thought is turned to you the atris' thought is turned to you

Sanskrit: ke ṣṭhā̍ nara̱ḥ śreṣṭha̍tamā̱ ya eka̍eka āya̱ya   pa̱ra̱masyā̍ḥ parā̱vata̍ḥ
English: o heroes lordliest of all who are ye that have singly come  forth from a region most remote?

Sanskrit: kva1̱̍ vo 'śvā̱ḥ kvā̱3̱̍bhīśa̍vaḥ ka̱thaṁ śe̍ka ka̱thā ya̍ya   pṛ̱ṣṭhe sado̍ na̱sor yama̍ḥ
English: where are your horses where the reins? how came ye? how had ye the power?  rein was on nose and seat on back

Sanskrit: ja̱ghane̱ coda̍ eṣā̱ṁ vi sa̱kthāni̱ naro̍ yamuḥ   pu̱tra̱kṛ̱the na jana̍yaḥ
English: the whip is laid upon the flank the heroes stretch their thighs apart  like women when the babe is born

Sanskrit: parā̍ vīrāsa etana̱ maryā̍so̱ bhadra̍jānayaḥ   a̱gni̱tapo̱ yathāsa̍tha
English: go ye o heroes far away ye bridegrooms with a lovely spouse  that ye may warm you at the fire

Sanskrit: sana̱t sāśvya̍m pa̱śum u̱ta gavya̍ṁ śa̱tāva̍yam   śyā̱vāśva̍stutāya̱ yā dor vī̱rāyo̍pa̱barbṛ̍hat
English: may she gain cattle for her meed hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine  who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised

Sanskrit: u̱ta tvā̱ strī śaśī̍yasī pu̱ṁso bha̍vati̱ vasya̍sī   ade̍vatrād arā̱dhasa̍ḥ
English: yea many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns  away from gods andoffers not

Sanskrit: vi yā jā̱nāti̱ jasu̍ri̱ṁ vi tṛṣya̍nta̱ṁ vi kā̱mina̍m   de̱va̱trā kṛ̍ṇu̱te mana̍ḥ
English: she who discerns the weak and worn the man who thirsts and is in want  she sets her mind upon the gods

Sanskrit: u̱ta ghā̱ nemo̱ astu̍ta̱ḥ pumā̱m̐ iti̍ bruve pa̱ṇiḥ   sa vaira̍deya̱ it sa̱maḥ
English: and yet full many a one unpraised mean niggard is entitled man  only in weregild is he such

Sanskrit: u̱ta me̍ 'rapad yuva̱tir ma̍ma̱nduṣī̱ prati̍ śyā̱vāya̍ varta̱nim   vi rohi̍tā purumī̱ḻhāya̍ yematu̱r viprā̍ya dī̱rghaya̍śase
English: and she the young the joyousspirited divulged the path to śyāva yea to me  two red steeds carried me to purumīlha's side that sage of farextended fame

Sanskrit: yo me̍ dhenū̱nāṁ śa̱taṁ vaida̍daśvi̱r yathā̱ dada̍t   ta̱ra̱nta i̍va ma̱ṁhanā̍
English: him who like vaidadasvi like taranta hath bestowed on me  a hundred cows in liberal gift

Sanskrit: ya ī̱ṁ vaha̍nta ā̱śubhi̱ḥ piba̍nto madi̱ram madhu̍   atra̱ śravā̍ṁsi dadhire
English: they who are borne by rapid steeds drinking the meath that gives delight  they have attained high glories here

Sanskrit: yeṣā̍ṁ śri̱yādhi̱ roda̍sī vi̱bhrāja̍nte̱ rathe̱ṣv ā   di̱vi ru̱kma i̍vo̱pari̍
English: they by whose splendour both the worlds are overspread they shine on cars  as the gold gleams above in heaven

Sanskrit: yuvā̱ sa māru̍to ga̱ṇas tve̱ṣara̍tho̱ ane̍dyaḥ   śu̱bha̱ṁyāvāpra̍tiṣkutaḥ
English: that marut band is ever young borne on bright cars unblamable  moving to victory checked by none

Sanskrit: ko ve̍da nū̱nam e̍ṣā̱ṁ yatrā̱ mada̍nti̱ dhūta̍yaḥ   ṛ̱tajā̍tā are̱pasa̍ḥ
English: who knoweth verily of these where the allshakers take delight  born spotless after sacred law?

Sanskrit: yū̱yam marta̍ṁ vipanyavaḥ praṇe̱tāra̍ i̱tthā dhi̱yā   śrotā̍ro̱ yāma̍hūtiṣu
English: guides are ye lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn  and hearers when he cries for help

Sanskrit: te no̱ vasū̍ni̱ kāmyā̍ puruśca̱ndrā ri̍śādasaḥ   ā ya̍jñiyāso vavṛttana
English: do ye destroyers of the foe worshipful and exceeding bright  send down the treasures that we crave

Sanskrit: e̱tam me̱ stoma̍m ūrmye dā̱rbhyāya̱ parā̍ vaha   giro̍ devi ra̱thīr i̍va
English: ourmya bear thou far away to darbhya this my hymn of praise  songs goddess as if chariotborne

Sanskrit: u̱ta me̍ vocatā̱d iti̍ su̱taso̍me̱ ratha̍vītau   na kāmo̱ apa̍ veti me
English: from me to rathaviti say when he hath pressed the soma juice  the wish i had departeth not

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa kṣe̍ti̱ ratha̍vītir ma̱ghavā̱ goma̍tī̱r anu̍   parva̍te̱ṣv apa̍śritaḥ
English: this wealthy rathaviti dwells among the people rich in kine  among the mountains far withdrawn

Sanskrit: īḻe̍ a̱gniṁ svava̍sa̱ṁ namo̍bhir i̱ha pra̍sa̱tto vi ca̍yat kṛ̱taṁ na̍ḥ   rathai̍r iva̱ pra bha̍re vāja̱yadbhi̍ḥ pradakṣi̱ṇin ma̱rutā̱ṁ stoma̍m ṛdhyām
English: i laud with reverence the gracious agni here may he sit and part our meed among us  as with spoilseeking cars i bring oblation turned rightward i will swell the marut's praisesong

Sanskrit: ā ye ta̱sthuḥ pṛṣa̍tīṣu śru̱tāsu̍ su̱kheṣu̍ ru̱drā ma̱ruto̱ rathe̍ṣu   vanā̍ cid ugrā jihate̱ ni vo̍ bhi̱yā pṛ̍thi̱vī ci̍d rejate̱ parva̍taś cit
English: the maruts yea the rudras who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swiftmoving  before you fierce ones! woods bow down in terror earth even the mountain trembles at your coming

Sanskrit: parva̍taś ci̱n mahi̍ vṛ̱ddho bi̍bhāya di̱vaś ci̱t sānu̍ rejata sva̱ne va̍ḥ   yat krīḻa̍tha maruta ṛṣṭi̱manta̱ āpa̍ iva sa̱dhrya̍ñco dhavadhve
English: though vast and tall the mountain is affrighted the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring  when armed with lances ye are sporting maruts and rush along together like the waters

Sanskrit: va̱rā i̱ved rai̍va̱tāso̱ hira̍ṇyair a̱bhi sva̱dhābhi̍s ta̱nva̍ḥ pipiśre   śri̱ye śreyā̍ṁsas ta̱vaso̱ rathe̍ṣu sa̱trā mahā̍ṁsi cakrire ta̱nūṣu̍
English: they like young suitors sons of wealthy houses have with their golden natures decked their bodies  strong on their cars the lordly ones for glory have set their splendours on their forms for ever

Sanskrit: a̱jye̱ṣṭhāso̱ aka̍niṣṭhāsa e̱te sam bhrāta̍ro vāvṛdhu̱ḥ saubha̍gāya   yuvā̍ pi̱tā svapā̍ ru̱dra e̍ṣāṁ su̱dughā̱ pṛśni̍ḥ su̱dinā̍ ma̱rudbhya̍ḥ
English: none being eldest none among them youngest as brothers they have grown to happy fortune  may their sire rudra young and deft and pṛśni pouring much milk bring fair days to the maruts

Sanskrit: yad u̍tta̱me ma̍ruto madhya̱me vā̱ yad vā̍va̱me su̍bhagāso di̱vi ṣṭha   ato̍ no rudrā u̱ta vā̱ nv a1̱̍syāgne̍ vi̱ttād dha̱viṣo̱ yad yajā̍ma
English: whether o blessed maruts ye be dwelling in highest midmost or in lowest heaven  thence o ye rudras and thou also agni notice the sacrificial food we offer

Sanskrit: a̱gniś ca̱ yan ma̍ruto viśvavedaso di̱vo vaha̍dhva̱ utta̍rā̱d adhi̱ ṣṇubhi̍ḥ   te ma̍ndasā̱nā dhuna̍yo riśādaso vā̱maṁ dha̍tta̱ yaja̍mānāya sunva̱te
English: o maruts lords of all when agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights  shakers of all rejoicing slayers of the foe give riches to the somapressing worshipper

Sanskrit: agne̍ ma̱rudbhi̍ḥ śu̱bhaya̍dbhi̱r ṛkva̍bhi̱ḥ soma̍m piba mandasā̱no ga̍ṇa̱śribhi̍ḥ   pā̱va̱kebhi̍r viśvami̱nvebhi̍r ā̱yubhi̱r vaiśvā̍nara pra̱divā̍ ke̱tunā̍ sa̱jūḥ
English: o agni with the maruts as they gleam and sing gathered in troop rejoicing drink the soma juice;  with these the living ones who cleanse and further all joined with thy banner o vaiśvānara from of old

Sanskrit: tam u̍ nū̱naṁ tavi̍ṣīmantam eṣāṁ stu̱ṣe ga̱ṇam māru̍ta̱ṁ navya̍sīnām   ya ā̱śva̍śvā̱ ama̍va̱d vaha̍nta u̱teśi̍re a̱mṛta̍sya sva̱rāja̍ḥ
English: now do i glorify their mighty cohort the company of these the youthful maruts  who ride impetuous on with rapid horses and radiant in themselves are lords of amṛta

Sanskrit: tve̱ṣaṁ ga̱ṇaṁ ta̱vasa̱ṁ khādi̍hasta̱ṁ dhuni̍vratam mā̱yina̱ṁ dāti̍vāram   ma̱yo̱bhuvo̱ ye ami̍tā mahi̱tvā vanda̍sva vipra tuvi̱rādha̍so̱ nṝn
English: the mighty glittering band armbound with bracelets givers of bliss unmeasured in their greatness  with magical powers bountiful everroaringthese liberal heroes venerate thou singer

Sanskrit: ā vo̍ yantūdavā̱hāso̍ a̱dya vṛ̱ṣṭiṁ ye viśve̍ ma̱ruto̍ ju̱nanti̍   a̱yaṁ yo a̱gnir ma̍ruta̱ḥ sami̍ddha e̱taṁ ju̍ṣadhvaṁ kavayo yuvānaḥ
English: this day may all your waterbringers maruts they who impel the falling rain approach us  this fire o maruts hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you youthful sages

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ rājā̍na̱m irya̱ṁ janā̍ya vibhvata̱ṣṭaṁ ja̍nayathā yajatrāḥ   yu̱ṣmad e̍ti muṣṭi̱hā bā̱hujū̍to yu̱ṣmat sada̍śvo marutaḥ su̱vīra̍ḥ
English: ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom holy ones! a master's hand hath fashioned  ye send the fighter hand to hand armmighty and the brave hero maruts with good horses

Sanskrit: a̱rā i̱ved aca̍ramā̱ ahe̍va̱ prapra̍ jāyante̱ aka̍vā̱ maho̍bhiḥ   pṛśne̍ḥ pu̱trā u̍pa̱māso̱ rabhi̍ṣṭhā̱ḥ svayā̍ ma̱tyā ma̱ruta̱ḥ sam mi̍mikṣuḥ
English: they spring forth more and more strong in their glories like days like spokes where none are last in order  highest and mightiest are the sons of pṛśni firm to their own intention cling the maruts

Sanskrit: yat prāyā̍siṣṭa̱ pṛṣa̍tībhi̱r aśvai̍r vīḻupa̱vibhi̍r maruto̱ rathe̍bhiḥ   kṣoda̍nta̱ āpo̍ riṇa̱te vanā̱ny avo̱sriyo̍ vṛṣa̱bhaḥ kra̍ndatu̱ dyauḥ
English: when ye have hastened on with spotted coursers o maruts on your cars with strongwrought fellies  the waters are disturbed the woods are shattered let dyaus the red steer send his thunder downward

Sanskrit: prathi̍ṣṭa̱ yāma̍n pṛthi̱vī ci̍d eṣā̱m bharte̍va̱ garbha̱ṁ svam ic chavo̍ dhuḥ   vātā̱n hy aśvā̍n dhu̱ry ā̍yuyu̱jre va̱rṣaṁ sveda̍ṁ cakrire ru̱driyā̍saḥ
English: even earth hath spread herself wide at their coming and they as husbands have with power impregned her  they to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers their sweat have they made rain these sons of rudra

Sanskrit: ha̱ye naro̱ maru̍to mṛ̱ḻatā̍ na̱s tuvī̍maghāso̱ amṛ̍tā̱ ṛta̍jñāḥ   satya̍śruta̱ḥ kava̍yo̱ yuvā̍no̱ bṛha̍dgirayo bṛ̱had u̱kṣamā̍ṇāḥ
English: ho! maruts heroes skilled in law immortal be gracious unto us ye rich in treasures  ye hearers of the truth ye sage and youthful grown mighty dwelling on the lofty mountains

Sanskrit: pra va̱ḥ spaḻ a̍kran suvi̱tāya̍ dā̱vane 'rcā̍ di̱ve pra pṛ̍thi̱vyā ṛ̱tam bha̍re   u̱kṣante̱ aśvā̱n taru̍ṣanta̱ ā rajo 'nu̱ svam bhā̱nuṁ śra̍thayante arṇa̱vaiḥ
English: your spy hath called to you to give prosperity i sing to heaven and earth and offer sacrifice  they bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud

Sanskrit: amā̍d eṣām bhi̱yasā̱ bhūmi̍r ejati̱ naur na pū̱rṇā kṣa̍rati̱ vyathi̍r ya̱tī   dū̱re̱dṛśo̱ ye ci̱taya̍nta̱ ema̍bhir a̱ntar ma̱he vi̱dathe̍ yetire̱ nara̍ḥ
English: earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush like a full ship which quivering lets the water in  marked on their ways are they visible from afar the heroes press between in mighty armament

Sanskrit: gavā̍m iva śri̱yase̱ śṛṅga̍m utta̱maṁ sūryo̱ na cakṣū̱ raja̍so vi̱sarja̍ne   atyā̍ iva su̱bhva1̱̍ś cāra̍vaḥ sthana̱ maryā̍ iva śri̱yase̍ cetathā naraḥ
English: as the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might as the sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse  like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold and for your glory show like bridegrooms o ye men

Sanskrit: ko vo̍ ma̱hānti̍ maha̱tām ud a̍śnava̱t kas kāvyā̍ maruta̱ḥ ko ha̱ pauṁsyā̍   yū̱yaṁ ha̱ bhūmi̍ṁ ki̱raṇa̱ṁ na re̍jatha̱ pra yad bhara̍dhve suvi̱tāya̍ dā̱vane̍
English: who o ye maruts may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty who may reach your manly deeds?  ye verily make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity

Sanskrit: aśvā̍ i̱ved a̍ru̱ṣāsa̱ḥ saba̍ndhava̱ḥ śūrā̍ iva pra̱yudha̱ḥ prota yu̍yudhuḥ   maryā̍ iva su̱vṛdho̍ vāvṛdhu̱r nara̱ḥ sūrya̍sya̱ cakṣu̱ḥ pra mi̍nanti vṛ̱ṣṭibhi̍ḥ
English: like steeds of ruddy colour scions of one race as foremost champions they have battled in the van  the heroes have waxed strong like we1grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the sun's eye fade away

Sanskrit: te a̍jye̱ṣṭhā aka̍niṣṭhāsa u̱dbhido 'ma̍dhyamāso̱ maha̍sā̱ vi vā̍vṛdhuḥ   su̱jā̱tāso̍ ja̱nuṣā̱ pṛśni̍mātaro di̱vo maryā̱ ā no̱ acchā̍ jigātana
English: having no eldest and no youngest in their band no middlomost preeminent they have waxed in might  these sons of pṛśni sprung of noble ancestry come hitberward to us ye bridegrooms of the sky

Sanskrit: vayo̱ na ye śreṇī̍ḥ pa̱ptur oja̱sāntā̍n di̱vo bṛ̍ha̱taḥ sānu̍na̱s pari̍   aśvā̍sa eṣām u̱bhaye̱ yathā̍ vi̱duḥ pra parva̍tasya nabha̱nūm̐r a̍cucyavuḥ
English: like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky  the steeds who carry them as gods and mortals know have caused the waters of the mounuains to desgend

English: may dyaus the infinite roar for our banquet may dawns toil for us glittering with moisture  lauded by thee these maruts sons o rudra o ṛṣi have sent down the heavenly treasure

Sanskrit: praya̍jyavo ma̱ruto̱ bhrāja̍dṛṣṭayo bṛ̱had vayo̍ dadhire ru̱kmava̍kṣasaḥ   īya̍nte̱ aśvai̍ḥ su̱yame̍bhir ā̱śubhi̱ḥ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: with gleaming lances with their breasts adorned with gold the maruts rushing onward hold high power of life  they hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: sva̱yaṁ da̍dhidhve̱ tavi̍ṣī̱ṁ yathā̍ vi̱da bṛ̱han ma̍hānta urvi̱yā vi rā̍jatha   u̱tāntari̍kṣam mamire̱ vy oja̍sā̱ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: ye as ye wist have gained of your own selves your power high o ye mighty ones and wide ye shine abroad  they with their strength have even measured out the sky  their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: sā̱kaṁ jā̱tāḥ su̱bhva̍ḥ sā̱kam u̍kṣi̱tāḥ śri̱ye ci̱d ā pra̍ta̱raṁ vā̍vṛdhu̱r nara̍ḥ   vi̱ro̱kiṇa̱ḥ sūrya̍syeva ra̱śmaya̱ḥ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: strong born together they together have waxed great the heroes more and more have grown to majesty  resplendent as the sun's beams in their light are they their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: ā̱bhū̱ṣeṇya̍ṁ vo maruto mahitva̱naṁ di̍dṛ̱kṣeṇya̱ṁ sūrya̍syeva̱ cakṣa̍ṇam   u̱to a̱smām̐ a̍mṛta̱tve da̍dhātana̱ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: maruts your mightiness deserves to be adored sight to be longed for like the shining of the sun  so lead us with your aid to immortality  their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: ud ī̍rayathā marutaḥ samudra̱to yū̱yaṁ vṛ̱ṣṭiṁ va̍rṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ   na vo̍ dasrā̱ upa̍ dasyanti dhe̱nava̱ḥ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: o maruts from the ocean ye uplift the rain and fraught with vaporous moisture pour the torrents down  never ye wonderworkers are your milchkine dry their cars moved onward as they went to victory

English: when to your carpoles ye have yoked your spotted deer to be your steeds and put your golden mantles on  o maruts ye disperse all enemies abroad their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: na parva̍tā̱ na na̱dyo̍ varanta vo̱ yatrāci̍dhvam maruto̱ gaccha̱thed u̱ tat   u̱ta dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī yā̍thanā̱ pari̱ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: neither the mountains nor the rivers keep you back whither ye have resolved thither ye maruts go  ye compass round about even the heaven and earth their cars moved onward as they went to victory  whateer is ancient maruts what of recent time whateer is spoken vasus what is chanted forth  they who take cognizance of all of this are ye their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: mṛ̱ḻata̍ no maruto̱ mā va̍dhiṣṭanā̱smabhya̱ṁ śarma̍ bahu̱laṁ vi ya̍ntana   adhi̍ sto̱trasya̍ sa̱khyasya̍ gātana̱ śubha̍ṁ yā̱tām anu̱ rathā̍ avṛtsata
English: be gracious unto us ye maruts slay us not extend ye unto us shelter of many a sort  pay due regard unto our friendship and our praise their cars moved onward as they went to victory

Sanskrit: yū̱yam a̱smān na̍yata̱ vasyo̱ acchā̱ nir a̍ṁha̱tibhyo̍ maruto gṛṇā̱nāḥ   ju̱ṣadhva̍ṁ no ha̱vyadā̍tiṁ yajatrā va̱yaṁ syā̍ma̱ pata̍yo rayī̱ṇām
English: o maruts lead us on to higher fortune deliver us when lauded from afflictions  accept ye holy ones the gifts we bring you may we be masters of abundant riches

Sanskrit: ā ru̍drāsa̱ indra̍vantaḥ sa̱joṣa̍so̱ hira̍ṇyarathāḥ suvi̱tāya̍ gantana   i̱yaṁ vo̍ a̱smat prati̍ haryate ma̱tis tṛ̱ṣṇaje̱ na di̱va utsā̍ uda̱nyave̍
English: of one accord with indra o ye rudras come borne on your golden car for our prosperity  an offering from us this hymn is brought to you as unto one who th irsts for water heavenly springs

Sanskrit: vāśī̍manta ṛṣṭi̱manto̍ manī̱ṣiṇa̍ḥ su̱dhanvā̍na̱ iṣu̍manto niṣa̱ṅgiṇa̍ḥ   svaśvā̍ḥ stha su̱rathā̍ḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ svāyu̱dhā ma̍ruto yāthanā̱ śubha̍m
English: armed with your daggers full of wisdom armed with spears armed with your quivers armed with arrows with good bows  good horses and good cars have ye o pṛśni's sons ye maruts with good weapons go to victory

Sanskrit: dhū̱nu̱tha dyām parva̍tān dā̱śuṣe̱ vasu̱ ni vo̱ vanā̍ jihate̱ yāma̍no bhi̱yā   ko̱paya̍tha pṛthi̱vīm pṛ̍śnimātaraḥ śu̱bhe yad u̍grā̱ḥ pṛṣa̍tī̱r ayu̍gdhvam
English: from hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper in terror at your coming low the woods bow down  ye make the earth to tremble sons of pṛśni when for victory ye have yoked fierce ones! your spotted deer

Sanskrit: vāta̍tviṣo ma̱ruto̍ va̱rṣani̍rṇijo ya̱mā i̍va̱ susa̍dṛśaḥ su̱peśa̍saḥ   pi̱śaṅgā̍śvā aru̱ṇāśvā̍ are̱pasa̱ḥ pratva̍kṣaso mahi̱nā dyaur i̍vo̱rava̍ḥ
English: bright with the blasts of wind wrapped in their robes of rain like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form  the maruts spotless with steeds tawnyhued and red strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱dra̱psā a̍ñji̱manta̍ḥ su̱dāna̍vas tve̱ṣasa̍ṁdṛśo anava̱bhrarā̍dhasaḥ   su̱jā̱tāso̍ ja̱nuṣā̍ ru̱kmava̍kṣaso di̱vo a̱rkā a̱mṛta̱ṁ nāma̍ bhejire
English: rich in adornment rich in drops munificent bright in their aspect yielding bounties that endure  noble by birth adorned with gold upon their breasts the singers of the sky have won immortal fame

Sanskrit: ṛ̱ṣṭayo̍ vo maruto̱ aṁsa̍yo̱r adhi̱ saha̱ ojo̍ bā̱hvor vo̱ bala̍ṁ hi̱tam   nṛ̱mṇā śī̱rṣasv āyu̍dhā̱ rathe̍ṣu vo̱ viśvā̍ va̱ḥ śrīr adhi̍ ta̱nūṣu̍ pipiśe
English: borne on both shoulders o ye maruts are your spears within your arms is laid your energy and 3trength  bold thoughts are in your heads your weapons in your cars all glorious majesty is moulded on your forms

Sanskrit: goma̱d aśvā̍va̱d ratha̍vat su̱vīra̍ṁ ca̱ndrava̱d rādho̍ maruto dadā naḥ   praśa̍stiṁ naḥ kṛṇuta rudriyāso bhakṣī̱ya vo 'va̍so̱ daivya̍sya
English: vouchsafe to us o maruts splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds in cars and heroes  children of rudra give us high distinction may i enjoy your godlike help and favour

Sanskrit: ha̱ye naro̱ maru̍to mṛ̱ḻatā̍ na̱s tuvī̍maghāso̱ amṛ̍tā̱ ṛta̍jñāḥ   satya̍śruta̱ḥ kava̍yo̱ yuvā̍no̱ bṛha̍dgirayo bṛ̱had u̱kṣamā̍ṇāḥ
English: ho! maruts heroes skilled in law immortal be gracious unto us ye rich in treasures  ye hearers of the truth ye sage and youthful grown mighty dwelling on the lofty mountains

Sanskrit: pra śardhā̍ya̱ māru̍tāya̱ svabhā̍nava i̱māṁ vāca̍m anajā parvata̱cyute̍   gha̱rma̱stubhe̍ di̱va ā pṛ̍ṣṭha̱yajva̍ne dyu̱mnaśra̍vase̱ mahi̍ nṛ̱mṇam a̍rcata
English: this hymn will i make for the marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down  sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown who stay the heat who sacrifice on heights of heaven

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ marutas tavi̱ṣā u̍da̱nyavo̍ vayo̱vṛdho̍ aśva̱yuja̱ḥ pari̍jrayaḥ   saṁ vi̱dyutā̱ dadha̍ti̱ vāśa̍ti tri̱taḥ svara̱nty āpo̱ 'vanā̱ pari̍jrayaḥ
English: o maruts rich in water strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds that wander far  trita roars out at him who aims the lightningflash the waters sweeping round are thundering on their way

Sanskrit: vi̱dyunma̍haso̱ naro̱ aśma̍didyavo̱ vāta̍tviṣo ma̱ruta̍ḥ parvata̱cyuta̍ḥ   a̱bda̱yā ci̱n muhu̱r ā hrā̍dunī̱vṛta̍ḥ sta̱naya̍damā rabha̱sā udo̍jasaḥ
English: they gleam with lightning heroes casters of the stone windrapid maruts overthrowers of the bills  oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail roaring in onset violent and exceeding strong

Sanskrit: vy a1̱̍ktūn ru̍drā̱ vy ahā̍ni śikvaso̱ vy a1̱̍ntari̍kṣa̱ṁ vi rajā̍ṁsi dhūtayaḥ   vi yad ajrā̱m̐ aja̍tha̱ nāva̍ īṁ yathā̱ vi du̱rgāṇi̍ maruto̱ nāha̍ riṣyatha
English: when mighty rudras through the nights and through the days when through the sky and realms of air shakers of all  when over the broad fields ye drive along like ships een to strongholds ye come maruts but are not harmed

Sanskrit: tad vī̱rya̍ṁ vo maruto mahitva̱naṁ dī̱rghaṁ ta̍tāna̱ sūryo̱ na yoja̍nam   etā̱ na yāme̱ agṛ̍bhītaśoci̱ṣo 'na̍śvadā̱ṁ yan ny ayā̍tanā gi̱rim
English: maruts this hero strength and majesty of yours hath like the sun extended oer a lengthened way  when in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain

Sanskrit: abhrā̍ji̱ śardho̍ maruto̱ yad a̍rṇa̱sam moṣa̍thā vṛ̱kṣaṁ ka̍pa̱neva̍ vedhasaḥ   adha̍ smā no a̱rama̍tiṁ sajoṣasa̱ś cakṣu̍r iva̱ yanta̱m anu̍ neṣathā su̱gam
English: bright shone your host ye sages maruts when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it  accordant as the eye guides him who walks have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path

Sanskrit: na sa jī̍yate maruto̱ na ha̍nyate̱ na sre̍dhati̱ na vya̍thate̱ na ri̍ṣyati   nāsya̱ rāya̱ upa̍ dasyanti̱ notaya̱ ṛṣi̍ṁ vā̱ yaṁ rājā̍naṁ vā̱ suṣū̍datha
English: never is he o maruts slain or overcome never doth he decay neer is distressed or harmed;  his treasures his resources never waste away whom whether he be prince or ṛṣi ye direct

Sanskrit: ni̱yutva̍nto grāma̱jito̱ yathā̱ naro̍ 'rya̱maṇo̱ na ma̱ruta̍ḥ kaba̱ndhina̍ḥ   pinva̱nty utsa̱ṁ yad i̱nāso̱ asva̍ra̱n vy u̍ndanti pṛthi̱vīm madhvo̱ andha̍sā
English: with harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops the friendly maruts laden with their watercasks  let the spring flow and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath

Sanskrit: pra̱vatva̍tī̱yam pṛ̍thi̱vī ma̱rudbhya̍ḥ pra̱vatva̍tī̱ dyaur bha̍vati pra̱yadbhya̍ḥ   pra̱vatva̍tīḥ pa̱thyā̍ a̱ntari̍kṣyāḥ pra̱vatva̍nta̱ḥ parva̍tā jī̱radā̍navaḥ
English: free for the maruts is the earth with sloping ways free for the rushing ones is heaven with steep descents  the paths of air's midregion are precipitous precipitous the mountains with their running streams

Sanskrit: yan ma̍rutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇara̱ḥ sūrya̱ udi̍te̱ mada̍thā divo naraḥ   na vo 'śvā̍ḥ śrathaya̱ntāha̱ sisra̍taḥ sa̱dyo a̱syādhva̍naḥ pā̱ram a̍śnutha
English: when as the sun hath risen up ye take delight o bounteous radiant maruts heroes of the sky  your coursers weary not when speeding onṭheir way and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path

Sanskrit: aṁse̍ṣu va ṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ pa̱tsu khā̱dayo̱ vakṣa̍ḥsu ru̱kmā ma̍ruto̱ rathe̱ śubha̍ḥ   a̱gnibhrā̍jaso vi̱dyuto̱ gabha̍styo̱ḥ śiprā̍ḥ śī̱rṣasu̱ vita̍tā hira̱ṇyayī̍ḥ
English: lances are on your shoulders anklets on your feet gold chains are on your breasts gems maruts on your car  lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads

Sanskrit: taṁ nāka̍m a̱ryo agṛ̍bhītaśociṣa̱ṁ ruśa̱t pippa̍lam maruto̱ vi dhū̍nutha   sam a̍cyanta vṛ̱janāti̍tviṣanta̱ yat svara̍nti̱ ghoṣa̱ṁ vita̍tam ṛtā̱yava̍ḥ
English: maruts in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven splendid beyond conception for its shining fruit  they gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth the pious ones send forth a farresounding shout

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmāda̍ttasya maruto vicetaso rā̱yaḥ syā̍ma ra̱thyo̱3̱̍ vaya̍svataḥ   na yo yuccha̍ti ti̱ṣyo̱3̱̍ yathā̍ di̱vo̱3̱̍ 'sme rā̍ranta marutaḥ saha̱sriṇa̍m
English: sage maruts may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful i of life that have been given by you  o maruts let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like tisya from the sky

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ ra̱yim ma̍rutaḥ spā̱rhavī̍raṁ yū̱yam ṛṣi̍m avatha̱ sāma̍vipram   yū̱yam arva̍ntam bhara̱tāya̱ vāja̍ṁ yū̱yaṁ dha̍ttha̱ rājā̍naṁ śruṣṭi̱manta̍m
English: maruts ye further wealth with longedfor heroes further the ṛṣi skilled in chanted verses  ye give the bhārata as his strength a charger and ye bestow a king who quickly listens

Sanskrit: tad vo̍ yāmi̱ dravi̍ṇaṁ sadyaūtayo̱ yenā̱ sva1̱̍r ṇa ta̱tanā̍ma̱ nṝm̐r a̱bhi   i̱daṁ su me̍ maruto haryatā̱ vaco̱ yasya̱ tare̍ma̱ tara̍sā śa̱taṁ himā̍ḥ
English: of you most swift to succour! i solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the sun  accept o maruts graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power

Sanskrit: agne̱ śardha̍nta̱m ā ga̱ṇam pi̱ṣṭaṁ ru̱kmebhi̍r a̱ñjibhi̍ḥ   viśo̍ a̱dya ma̱rutā̱m ava̍ hvaye di̱vaś ci̍d roca̱nād adhi̍
English: agni that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold  the people of the maruts i call down today even from the luminous realm of heaven

Sanskrit: yathā̍ ci̱n manya̍se hṛ̱dā tad in me̍ jagmur ā̱śasa̍ḥ   ye te̱ nedi̍ṣṭha̱ṁ hava̍nāny ā̱gama̱n tān va̍rdha bhī̱masa̍ṁdṛśaḥ
English: even as thou thinkest in thy heart thither my wishes also tend  those who have come most near to thine invoking calls strengthen them fearful to behold

Sanskrit: mī̱ḻhuṣma̍tīva pṛthi̱vī parā̍hatā̱ mada̍nty ety a̱smad ā   ṛkṣo̱ na vo̍ maruta̱ḥ śimī̍vā̱m̐ amo̍ du̱dhro gaur i̍va bhīma̱yuḥ
English: earth like a bounteous lady liberal of her gifts struck down and shaken yet exultant comes to us  impetuous as a bear o maruts is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull

Sanskrit: ni ye ri̱ṇanty oja̍sā̱ vṛthā̱ gāvo̱ na du̱rdhura̍ḥ   aśmā̍naṁ cit sva̱rya1̱̍m parva̍taṁ gi̱rim pra cyā̍vayanti̱ yāma̍bhiḥ
English: they who with mighty strength oerthrow like oxen difficult to yoke  cause een the heavenly stone to shake ' yea shake the rocky mountain as they race along

Sanskrit: ut ti̍ṣṭha nū̱nam e̍ṣā̱ṁ stomai̱ḥ samu̍kṣitānām   ma̱rutā̍m puru̱tama̱m apū̍rvya̱ṁ gavā̱ṁ sarga̍m iva hvaye
English: rise up! even now with lauds i call the very numerous company  unequalled of these maruts like a herd of kine grown up together in their strength

Sanskrit: yu̱ṅgdhvaṁ hy aru̍ṣī̱ rathe̍ yu̱ṅgdhvaṁ rathe̍ṣu ro̱hita̍ḥ   yu̱ṅgdhvaṁ harī̍ aji̱rā dhu̱ri voḻha̍ve̱ vahi̍ṣṭhā dhu̱ri voḻha̍ve
English: bind to your car the bright red mares yoke the red coursers to your car  bind to the pole to draw the fleetfoot tawny steeds the best at drawing to the pole

Sanskrit: u̱ta sya vā̱jy a̍ru̱ṣas tu̍vi̱ṣvaṇi̍r i̱ha sma̍ dhāyi darśa̱taḥ   mā vo̱ yāme̍ṣu marutaś ci̱raṁ ka̍ra̱t pra taṁ rathe̍ṣu codata
English: yea and this loudlyneighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned fair to see  let him not cause delay o maruts in your course urge ye him onward in your cars

Sanskrit: ratha̱ṁ nu māru̍taṁ va̱yaṁ śra̍va̱syum ā hu̍vāmahe   ā yasmi̍n ta̱sthau su̱raṇā̍ni̱ bibhra̍tī̱ sacā̍ ma̱rutsu̍ roda̱sī
English: the maruts chariot ever fain to gather glory we invoke  which rodasī hath mounted bringing pleasant gifts with maruts in her company

Sanskrit: taṁ va̱ḥ śardha̍ṁ rathe̱śubha̍ṁ tve̱ṣam pa̍na̱syum ā hu̍ve   yasmi̱n sujā̍tā su̱bhagā̍ mahī̱yate̱ sacā̍ ma̱rutsu̍ mīḻhu̱ṣī
English: i call that brilliant band of yours adorable rapid on the car  whereon the bounteous dame auspicious nobly born shows glorious with the marut host

Sanskrit: ko ve̍da̱ jāna̍m eṣā̱ṁ ko vā̍ pu̱rā su̱mneṣv ā̍sa ma̱rutā̍m   yad yu̍yu̱jre ki̍lā̱sya̍ḥ
English: who knows the birth of these or who lived in the maruts favour in the days of old  what time their spotted deer were yoked?

Sanskrit: aitān rathe̍ṣu ta̱sthuṣa̱ḥ kaḥ śu̍śrāva ka̱thā ya̍yuḥ   kasmai̍ sasruḥ su̱dāse̱ anv ā̱paya̱ iḻā̍bhir vṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ sa̱ha
English: who when they stood upon their cars hath heard them tell the way they went?  who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?

Sanskrit: te ma̍ āhu̱r ya ā̍ya̱yur upa̱ dyubhi̱r vibhi̱r made̍   naro̱ maryā̍ are̱pasa̍ i̱mān paśya̱nn iti̍ ṣṭuhi
English: to me they told it and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught  youths heroes free from spot or stain behold us here and praise thou us;

Sanskrit: ye a̱ñjiṣu̱ ye vāśī̍ṣu̱ svabhā̍navaḥ sra̱kṣu ru̱kmeṣu̍ khā̱diṣu̍   śrā̱yā rathe̍ṣu̱ dhanva̍su
English: who shine selfluminous with ornaments and swords with breastplates armlets and with wreaths  arrayed on chariots and with bows

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmāka̍ṁ smā̱ rathā̱m̐ anu̍ mu̱de da̍dhe maruto jīradānavaḥ   vṛ̱ṣṭī dyāvo̍ ya̱tīr i̍va
English: o swift to pour your bounties down ye maruts with delight i look upon your cars  like splendours coming through the rain

Sanskrit: ā yaṁ nara̍ḥ su̱dāna̍vo dadā̱śuṣe̍ di̱vaḥ kośa̱m acu̍cyavuḥ   vi pa̱rjanya̍ṁ sṛjanti̱ roda̍sī̱ anu̱ dhanva̍nā yanti vṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ
English: munificent heroes they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof  they set the stormcloud free to stream through both the worlds and rainfloods flow oer desert spots

Sanskrit: ta̱tṛ̱dā̱nāḥ sindha̍va̱ḥ kṣoda̍sā̱ raja̱ḥ pra sa̍srur dhe̱navo̍ yathā   sya̱nnā aśvā̍ i̱vādhva̍no vi̱moca̍ne̱ vi yad varta̍nta e̱nya̍ḥ
English: the bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad like milchkine oer the firmament  like swift steeds hasting to their journey's restingplace to every side run glittering brooks

Sanskrit: ā yā̍ta maruto di̱va āntari̍kṣād a̱mād u̱ta   māva̍ sthāta parā̱vata̍ḥ
English: hither o maruts come from heaven from midair or from near at hand  tarry not far away from us

Sanskrit: mā vo̍ ra̱sāni̍tabhā̱ kubhā̱ krumu̱r mā va̱ḥ sindhu̱r ni rī̍ramat   mā va̱ḥ pari̍ ṣṭhāt sa̱rayu̍ḥ purī̱ṣiṇy a̱sme it su̱mnam a̍stu vaḥ
English: so let not rasā krumu or anitabha kubha or sindhu hold you back  let not the watery sarayti obstruct your way with us be all the bliss ye give

Sanskrit: taṁ va̱ḥ śardha̱ṁ rathā̍nāṁ tve̱ṣaṁ ga̱ṇam māru̍ta̱ṁ navya̍sīnām   anu̱ pra ya̍nti vṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ
English: that brilliant gathering of your cars the company of maruts of the youthful ones  the rainshowers speeding on attend

Sanskrit: śardha̍ṁśardhaṁ va eṣā̱ṁ vrāta̍ṁvrātaṁ ga̱ṇaṁga̍ṇaṁ suśa̱stibhi̍ḥ   anu̍ krāmema dhī̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: with eulogies and hymns may we follow your army troop by troop and band by band  and company by company

Sanskrit: kasmā̍ a̱dya sujā̍tāya rā̱taha̍vyāya̱ pra ya̍yuḥ   e̱nā yāme̍na ma̱ruta̍ḥ
English: to what oblationgiver sprung of noble ancestry have sped  the maruts on this course today?

Sanskrit: yena̍ to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya dhā̱nya1̱̍m bīja̱ṁ vaha̍dhve̱ akṣi̍tam   a̱smabhya̱ṁ tad dha̍ttana̱ yad va̱ īma̍he̱ rādho̍ vi̱śvāyu̱ saubha̍gam
English: vouchsafe to us the bounty that which we implore through which for child and progeny  ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away and bliss that reacheth to all life

Sanskrit: atī̍yāma ni̱das ti̱raḥ sva̱stibhi̍r hi̱tvāva̱dyam arā̍tīḥ   vṛ̱ṣṭvī śaṁ yor āpa̍ u̱sri bhe̍ṣa̱jaṁ syāma̍ marutaḥ sa̱ha
English: may we in safety pass by those who slander us leaving behind disgrace and hate  maruts may we be there when ye at dawn in rest and toil rain waters down and balm

Sanskrit: su̱de̱vaḥ sa̍mahāsati su̱vīro̍ naro maruta̱ḥ sa martya̍ḥ   yaṁ trāya̍dhve̱ syāma̱ te
English: favoured by gods shall he the man o heroes marutr! and possessed of noble sons  whom ye protect such may we be

Sanskrit: stu̱hi bho̱jān stu̍va̱to a̍sya̱ yāma̍ni̱ raṇa̱n gāvo̱ na yava̍se   ya̱taḥ pūrvā̍m̐ iva̱ sakhī̱m̐r anu̍ hvaya gi̱rā gṛ̍ṇīhi kā̱mina̍ḥ
English: praise the freegivers at this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead  so call thou unto them who come as ancient friends hymn those who love thee with a song

Sanskrit: pra śyā̍vāśva dhṛṣṇu̱yārcā̍ ma̱rudbhi̱r ṛkva̍bhiḥ   ye a̍dro̱gham a̍nuṣva̱dhaṁ śravo̱ mada̍nti ya̱jñiyā̍ḥ
English: sing boldly forth śyāvāśva with the maruts who are loud in song  who holy as their wont is joy in glory that is free from guile

Sanskrit: te hi sthi̱rasya̱ śava̍sa̱ḥ sakhā̍ya̱ḥ santi̍ dhṛṣṇu̱yā   te yāma̱nn ā dhṛ̍ṣa̱dvina̱s tmanā̍ pānti̱ śaśva̍taḥ
English: for in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength  they in their course boldspirited guard all men of their own accord

Sanskrit: te sya̱ndrāso̱ nokṣaṇo 'ti̍ ṣkandanti̱ śarva̍rīḥ   ma̱rutā̱m adhā̱ maho̍ di̱vi kṣa̱mā ca̍ manmahe
English: like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights;  and thus the maruts power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate

Sanskrit: ma̱rutsu̍ vo dadhīmahi̱ stoma̍ṁ ya̱jñaṁ ca̍ dhṛṣṇu̱yā   viśve̱ ye mānu̍ṣā yu̱gā pānti̱ martya̍ṁ ri̱ṣaḥ
English: with boldness to your maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice  who all through ages of mankind guard mortal man from injury

Sanskrit: arha̍nto̱ ye su̱dāna̍vo̱ naro̱ asā̍miśavasaḥ   pra ya̱jñaṁ ya̱jñiye̍bhyo di̱vo a̍rcā ma̱rudbhya̍ḥ
English: praiseworthy givers of good gifts heroes with full and perfect strength   to maruts holy ones of heaven will i extol the sacrifice

Sanskrit: ā ru̱kmair ā yu̱dhā nara̍ ṛ̱ṣvā ṛ̱ṣṭīr a̍sṛkṣata   anv e̍nā̱m̐ aha̍ vi̱dyuto̍ ma̱ruto̱ jajjha̍tīr iva bhā̱nur a̍rta̱ tmanā̍ di̱vaḥ
English: the lofty heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold  after these maruts followed close like laughing lightning from the sky a splendour of its own accord

Sanskrit: ye vā̍vṛ̱dhanta̱ pārthi̍vā̱ ya u̱rāv a̱ntari̍kṣa̱ ā   vṛ̱jane̍ vā na̱dīnā̍ṁ sa̱dhasthe̍ vā ma̱ho di̱vaḥ
English: they who waxed mighty of the earth they who are in the wide midair  or in the rivers compass or in the abode of ample heaven

Sanskrit: śardho̱ māru̍ta̱m uc cha̍ṁsa sa̱tyaśa̍vasa̱m ṛbhva̍sam   u̱ta sma̱ te śu̱bhe nara̱ḥ pra sya̱ndrā yu̍jata̱ tmanā̍
English: praise thou the maruts company the valorous and truly strong  the heroes hasting by themselves have yoked their deer for victory

Sanskrit: u̱ta sma̱ te paru̍ṣṇyā̱m ūrṇā̍ vasata śu̱ndhyava̍ḥ   u̱ta pa̱vyā rathā̍nā̱m adri̍m bhinda̱nty oja̍sā
English: fairgleaming on paruṣṇī they have clothed themselves in robes of wool  and with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might

Sanskrit: āpa̍thayo̱ vipa̍tha̱yo 'nta̍spathā̱ anu̍pathāḥ   e̱tebhi̱r mahya̱ṁ nāma̍bhir ya̱jñaṁ vi̍ṣṭā̱ra o̍hate
English: whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path  under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me

Sanskrit: adhā̱ naro̱ ny o̍ha̱te 'dhā̍ ni̱yuta̍ ohate   adhā̱ pārā̍vatā̱ iti̍ ci̱trā rū̱pāṇi̱ darśyā̍
English: to this the heroes well attend well do their teams attend to this  visible are their varied forms behold they are paravatas

Sanskrit: cha̱nda̱ḥstubha̍ḥ kubha̱nyava̱ utsa̱m ā kī̱riṇo̍ nṛtuḥ   te me̱ ke ci̱n na tā̱yava̱ ūmā̍ āsan dṛ̱śi tvi̱ṣe
English: hymnsinging seeking water they praising have danced about the spring  what are they unto me? no thieves but helpers splendid to behold

Sanskrit: ya ṛ̱ṣvā ṛ̱ṣṭivi̍dyutaḥ ka̱vaya̱ḥ santi̍ ve̱dhasa̍ḥ   tam ṛ̍ṣe̱ māru̍taṁ ga̱ṇaṁ na̍ma̱syā ra̱mayā̍ gi̱rā
English: sublime with lightnings for their spears sages and orderers are they  ṛṣi adore that marut host and make them happy with thy song

Sanskrit: accha̍ ṛṣe̱ māru̍taṁ ga̱ṇaṁ dā̱nā mi̱traṁ na yo̱ṣaṇā̍   di̱vo vā̍ dhṛṣṇava̱ oja̍sā stu̱tā dhī̱bhir i̍ṣaṇyata
English: ṛṣi invite the marut band with offerings as a maid her friend  from heaven too bold ones in your might haste hither glorified with songs

Sanskrit: nū ma̍nvā̱na e̍ṣāṁ de̱vām̐ acchā̱ na va̱kṣaṇā̍   dā̱nā sa̍ceta sū̱ribhi̱r yāma̍śrutebhir a̱ñjibhi̍ḥ
English: thinking of these now let him come as with the escort of the gods  and with the splendid princes famed for rapid courses to the gifts

Sanskrit: pra ye me̍ bandhve̱ṣe gāṁ voca̍nta sū̱raya̱ḥ pṛśni̍ṁ vocanta mā̱tara̍m   adhā̍ pi̱tara̍m i̱ṣmiṇa̍ṁ ru̱draṁ vo̍canta̱ śikva̍saḥ
English: princes who when i asked their kin named pṛśni as their mothercow  and the impetuous rudra they the mighty ones declared their sire

Sanskrit: sa̱pta me̍ sa̱pta śā̱kina̱ eka̍mekā śa̱tā da̍duḥ   ya̱munā̍yā̱m adhi̍ śru̱tam ud rādho̱ gavya̍m mṛje̱ ni rādho̱ aśvya̍m mṛje
English: the mighty ones the seven times seven have singly given me hundred gifts  i have obtained on yamuna famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds

Sanskrit: hayo̱ na vi̱dvām̐ a̍yuji sva̱yaṁ dhu̱ri tāṁ va̍hāmi pra̱tara̍ṇīm ava̱syuva̍m   nāsyā̍ vaśmi vi̱muca̱ṁ nāvṛta̱m puna̍r vi̱dvān pa̱thaḥ pu̍rae̱ta ṛ̱ju ne̍ṣati
English: well knowing i have bound me horselike to the pole i carry that which bears as on and gives us help  i seek for no release no turning back therefrom may he who knows the way the leader guide me straight

Sanskrit: agna̱ indra̱ varu̍ṇa̱ mitra̱ devā̱ḥ śardha̱ḥ pra ya̍nta̱ māru̍to̱ta vi̍ṣṇo   u̱bhā nāsa̍tyā ru̱dro adha̱ gnāḥ pū̱ṣā bhaga̱ḥ sara̍svatī juṣanta

Sanskrit: sa hi kṣa̱trasya̍ mana̱sasya̱ citti̍bhir evāva̱dasya̍ yaja̱tasya̱ sadhre̍ḥ   a̱va̱tsā̱rasya̍ spṛṇavāma̱ raṇva̍bhi̱ḥ śavi̍ṣṭha̱ṁ vāja̍ṁ vi̱duṣā̍ ci̱d ardhya̍m
English: for it is he with though to of ksatra manasa of yajata and sadhri and evavada  with avatsara's sweet songs will we strive to win the mightiest strength which even he who knows should gain

Sanskrit: śye̱na ā̍sā̱m adi̍tiḥ ka̱kṣyo̱3̱̍ mado̍ vi̱śvavā̍rasya yaja̱tasya̍ mā̱yina̍ḥ   sam a̱nyama̍nyam arthaya̱nty eta̍ve vi̱dur vi̱ṣāṇa̍m pari̱pāna̱m anti̱ te
English: the sacred hymns love him who wakes and watches to him who watches come the sāma verses  this soma saith unto the man who watches i rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship

Sanskrit: sa̱dā̱pṛ̱ṇo ya̍ja̱to vi dviṣo̍ vadhīd bāhuvṛ̱ktaḥ śru̍ta̱vit taryo̍ va̱ḥ sacā̍   u̱bhā sa varā̱ praty e̍ti̱ bhāti̍ ca̱ yad ī̍ṁ ga̱ṇam bhaja̍te supra̱yāva̍bhiḥ
English: sadaprna the holy tarya srutavit and bahuvrkta joined with you have slain the foes  he gains his wish in both the worlds and brightly shineswhen he adores the host with welladvancing steeds

Sanskrit: su̱ta̱mbha̱ro yaja̍mānasya̱ satpa̍ti̱r viśvā̍sā̱m ūdha̱ḥ sa dhi̱yām u̱dañca̍naḥ   bhara̍d dhe̱nū rasa̍vac chiśriye̱ payo̍ 'nubruvā̱ṇo adhy e̍ti̱ na sva̱pan
English: the worshipper's defender is sutambhara producer and uplifter of all holy thoughts  the milchcow brought sweetflavoured milk was dealt around who speaks the bidding text knows this not he who sleeps

Sanskrit: a̱gnir jā̍gāra̱ tam ṛca̍ḥ kāmayante̱ 'gnir jā̍gāra̱ tam u̱ sāmā̍ni yanti   a̱gnir jā̍gāra̱ tam a̱yaṁ soma̍ āha̱ tavā̱ham a̍smi sa̱khye nyo̍kāḥ
English: agni is watchful and the gcas love him; agni is watchful sāma verses seek him  agni is watchful to him saith this soma i rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship

Sanskrit: vi̱dā di̱vo vi̱ṣyann adri̍m u̱kthair ā̍ya̱tyā u̱ṣaso̍ a̱rcino̍ guḥ   apā̍vṛta vra̱jinī̱r ut sva̍r gā̱d vi duro̱ mānu̍ṣīr de̱va ā̍vaḥ
English: bards of approaching dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open  the sun hath risen and oped the stable portals the doors of men too hath the god thrown open

Sanskrit: vi sūryo̍ a̱mati̱ṁ na śriya̍ṁ sā̱d orvād gavā̍m mā̱tā jā̍na̱tī gā̍t   dhanva̍rṇaso na̱dya1̱̍ḥ khādo̍arṇā̱ḥ sthūṇe̍va̱ sumi̍tā dṛṁhata̱ dyauḥ
English: sūrya hath spread his light as splendour hither came the cows' mother conscious from the stable  to streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firmset pillar

Sanskrit: a̱smā u̱kthāya̱ parva̍tasya̱ garbho̍ ma̱hīnā̍ṁ ja̱nuṣe̍ pū̱rvyāya̍   vi parva̍to̱ jihī̍ta̱ sādha̍ta̱ dyaur ā̱vivā̍santo dasayanta̱ bhūma̍
English: this laud hath won the burden of the mountain to aid the ancient birth of mighty waters  the mountain parted heaven performed his office the worshippers were worn with constant serving

Sanskrit: sū̱ktebhi̍r vo̱ vaco̍bhir de̱vaju̍ṣṭai̱r indrā̱ nv a1̱̍gnī ava̍se hu̱vadhyai̍   u̱kthebhi̱r hi ṣmā̍ ka̱vaya̍ḥ suya̱jñā ā̱vivā̍santo ma̱ruto̱ yaja̍nti
English: with hymns and godloved words will i invoke you indra and agni to obtain your favour  for verily sages skilled in sacrificing worship the maruts and with lauds invite them

Sanskrit: eto̱ nv a1̱̍dya su̱dhyo̱3̱̍ bhavā̍ma̱ pra du̱cchunā̍ minavāmā̱ varī̍yaḥ   ā̱re dveṣā̍ṁsi sanu̱tar da̍dhā̱māyā̍ma̱ prāñco̱ yaja̍māna̱m accha̍
English: this day approach us may our thoughts be holy far from us let us cast away misfortune  let us keep those who hate us at a distance and haste to meet the man who sacrifices

Sanskrit: etā̱ dhiya̍ṁ kṛ̱ṇavā̍mā sakhā̱yo 'pa̱ yā mā̱tām̐ ṛ̍ṇu̱ta vra̱jaṁ goḥ   yayā̱ manu̍r viśiśi̱praṁ ji̱gāya̱ yayā̍ va̱ṇig va̱ṅkur āpā̱ purī̍ṣam
English: come let us carry out o friends the purpose wherewith the mother threw the cow's stall open  that wherewith manu conquered visisipra wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water

Sanskrit: anū̍no̱d atra̱ hasta̍yato̱ adri̱r ārca̱n yena̱ daśa̍ mā̱so nava̍gvāḥ   ṛ̱taṁ ya̱tī sa̱ramā̱ gā a̍vinda̱d viśvā̍ni sa̱tyāṅgi̍rāś cakāra
English: here urged by hands loudly hath rung the pressstone wherewith navagvas through ten months sang praises  saramā went aright and found the cattle aṅgiras gave effect to all their labours

Sanskrit: viśve̍ a̱syā vyuṣi̱ māhi̍nāyā̱ḥ saṁ yad gobhi̱r aṅgi̍raso̱ nava̍nta   utsa̍ āsām para̱me sa̱dhastha̍ ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱thā sa̱ramā̍ vida̱d gāḥ
English: when at the dawning of this mighty goddess aṅgirases all sang forth with the cattle  their spring is in the loftiest place of meetingsaramā found the kine by order's pathway

Sanskrit: ā sūryo̍ yātu sa̱ptāśva̱ḥ kṣetra̱ṁ yad a̍syorvi̱yā dī̍rghayā̱the   ra̱ghuḥ śye̱naḥ pa̍taya̱d andho̱ acchā̱ yuvā̍ ka̱vir dī̍daya̱d goṣu̱ gaccha̍n
English: borne by his coursers seven may sūrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey  down on the soma swooped the rapid falcon bright was the young sage moving mid his cattle

Sanskrit: ā sūryo̍ aruhac chu̱kram arṇo 'yu̍kta̱ yad dha̱rito̍ vī̱tapṛ̍ṣṭhāḥ   u̱dnā na nāva̍m anayanta̱ dhīrā̍ āśṛṇva̱tīr āpo̍ a̱rvāg a̍tiṣṭhan
English: sūrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fairbacked tawny horses  the wise have drawn him like a ship through water the floods obedient have descended hither

Sanskrit: dhiya̍ṁ vo a̱psu da̍dhiṣe sva̱rṣāṁ yayāta̍ra̱n daśa̍ mā̱so nava̍gvāḥ   a̱yā dhi̱yā syā̍ma de̱vago̍pā a̱yā dhi̱yā tu̍turyā̱māty aṁha̍ḥ
English: i lay upon the floods your hymn lightwinning wherewith navagvas their ten months completed  through this our hymn may we have gods to guard us through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction

Sanskrit: u̱roṣ ṭa̍ indra̱ rādha̍so vi̱bhvī rā̱tiḥ śa̍takrato   adhā̍ no viśvacarṣaṇe dyu̱mnā su̍kṣatra maṁhaya
English: wide indra śatakratu spreads the bounty of thine ample grace  so lord of fair dominion friend of all men give us splendid wealth

Sanskrit: yad ī̍m indra śra̱vāyya̱m iṣa̍ṁ śaviṣṭha dadhi̱ṣe   pa̱pra̱the dī̍rgha̱śrutta̍ma̱ṁ hira̍ṇyavarṇa du̱ṣṭara̍m
English: the food which mightiest indra thou possessest worthy of renown  is bruited as most widely famed invincible o goldenhued!

Sanskrit: śuṣmā̍so̱ ye te̍ adrivo me̱hanā̍ keta̱sāpa̍ḥ   u̱bhā de̱vāv a̱bhiṣṭa̍ye di̱vaś ca̱ gmaś ca̍ rājathaḥ
English: o darter of the stone the powers which readily obey thy will  divinities both thou and they ye rule to guard them earth and heaven

Sanskrit: u̱to no̍ a̱sya kasya̍ ci̱d dakṣa̍sya̱ tava̍ vṛtrahan   a̱smabhya̍ṁ nṛ̱mṇam ā bha̍rā̱smabhya̍ṁ nṛmaṇasyase
English: and from whatever power of thine o vṛtraslayer it may be  bring thou to us heroic strength thou hast a man's regard for us

Sanskrit: nū ta̍ ā̱bhir a̱bhiṣṭi̍bhi̱s tava̱ śarma̍ñ chatakrato   indra̱ syāma̍ sugo̱pāḥ śūra̱ syāma̍ sugo̱pāḥ
English: in thy protection with these aids of thine o lord of hundred powers  indra may we be guarded well hero may we be guarded well

Sanskrit: pra śaṁta̍mā̱ varu̍ṇa̱ṁ dīdhi̍tī̱ gīr mi̱tram bhaga̱m adi̍tiṁ nū̱nam a̍śyāḥ   pṛṣa̍dyoni̱ḥ pañca̍hotā śṛṇo̱tv atū̍rtapanthā̱ asu̍ro mayo̱bhuḥ
English: now may our sweetest song with deep devotion reach varuṇa mitra aditi and bhaga  may the five priests' lord dwelling in oblations blissgiving asura hear whose paths are open

Sanskrit: prati̍ me̱ stoma̱m adi̍tir jagṛbhyāt sū̱nuṁ na mā̱tā hṛdya̍ṁ su̱śeva̍m   brahma̍ pri̱yaṁ de̱vahi̍ta̱ṁ yad asty a̱ham mi̱tre varu̍ṇe̱ yan ma̍yo̱bhu
English: may aditi welcome even as a mother her dear heartgladdening son my song that lauds her  the prayer they love blissgiving godappointed i offer unto varuṇa and mitra

Sanskrit: ud ī̍raya ka̱vita̍maṁ kavī̱nām u̱nattai̍nam a̱bhi madhvā̍ ghṛ̱tena̍   sa no̱ vasū̍ni̱ praya̍tā hi̱tāni̍ ca̱ndrāṇi̍ de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā su̍vāti
English: in spirit him the sagest of the sages; with sacrificial oil and meath bedew him   so then let him god savitar provide us excellent ready and resplendent treasures

Sanskrit: sam i̍ndra ṇo̱ mana̍sā neṣi̱ gobhi̱ḥ saṁ sū̱ribhi̍r hariva̱ḥ saṁ sva̱sti   sam brahma̍ṇā de̱vahi̍ta̱ṁ yad asti̱ saṁ de̱vānā̍ṁ suma̱tyā ya̱jñiyā̍nām
English: with willing mind indra vouchsafe us cattle prosperity lord of bays! and pious patrons;  and with the sacred prayer by gods appointed give us the holy deities' lovingkindness

Sanskrit: de̱vo bhaga̍ḥ savi̱tā rā̱yo aṁśa̱ indro̍ vṛ̱trasya̍ sa̱ṁjito̱ dhanā̍nām   ṛ̱bhu̱kṣā vāja̍ u̱ta vā̱ pura̍ṁdhi̱r ava̍ntu no a̱mṛtā̍sas tu̱rāsa̍ḥ
English: god bhaga savitar who deals forth riches indra and they who conquer vṛtra's treasures  and vāja and ṛbhukṣan and purandhi the mighty and immortal ones protect us!

Sanskrit: ma̱rutva̍to̱ apra̍tītasya ji̱ṣṇor ajū̍ryata̱ḥ pra bra̍vāmā kṛ̱tāni̍   na te̱ pūrve̍ maghava̱n nāpa̍rāso̱ na vī̱rya1̱̍ṁ nūta̍na̱ḥ kaś ca̱nāpa̍
English: let us declare his deeds the undecaying unrivalled victor whom the maruts follow  none of old times o maghavan nor later none of these days hath reached thy hero prowess

Sanskrit: upa̍ stuhi pratha̱maṁ ra̍tna̱dheya̱m bṛha̱spati̍ṁ sani̱tāra̱ṁ dhanā̍nām   yaḥ śaṁsa̍te stuva̱te śambha̍viṣṭhaḥ purū̱vasu̍r ā̱gama̱j johu̍vānam
English: praise him the chief who gives the boon of riches bṛhaspati distributor of treasures  who blessing most the man who sings and praises comes with abundant wealth to his invoker

Sanskrit: tavo̱tibhi̱ḥ saca̍mānā̱ ari̍ṣṭā̱ bṛha̍spate ma̱ghavā̍naḥ su̱vīrā̍ḥ   ye a̍śva̱dā u̱ta vā̱ santi̍ go̱dā ye va̍stra̱dāḥ su̱bhagā̱s teṣu̱ rāya̍ḥ
English: tended bṛhaspati with thy protections the princes are unharmed and girt by heroes  wealth that brings bliss is found among the givers of horses and of cattle and of raiment

Sanskrit: vi̱sa̱rmāṇa̍ṁ kṛṇuhi vi̱ttam e̍ṣā̱ṁ ye bhu̱ñjate̱ apṛ̍ṇanto na u̱kthaiḥ   apa̍vratān prasa̱ve vā̍vṛdhā̱nān bra̍hma̱dviṣa̱ḥ sūryā̍d yāvayasva
English: make their wealth flee who through our hymns enjoying their riches yield us not an ample guerdon  far from the sun keep those who hate devotion the godless prospering in their vocation

Sanskrit: ya oha̍te ra̱kṣaso̍ de̱vavī̍tāv aca̱krebhi̱s tam ma̍ruto̱ ni yā̍ta   yo va̱ḥ śamī̍ṁ śaśamā̱nasya̱ nindā̍t tu̱cchyān kāmā̍n karate siṣvidā̱naḥ
English: with wheelless chariots drive down him o maruts who at the feasts of gods regards the demons  may he though bathed in sweat form empty wishes who blames his sacred rite who toils to serve you

Sanskrit: tam u̍ ṣṭuhi̱ yaḥ svi̱ṣuḥ su̱dhanvā̱ yo viśva̍sya̱ kṣaya̍ti bheṣa̱jasya̍   yakṣvā̍ ma̱he sau̍mana̱sāya̍ ru̱draṁ namo̍bhir de̱vam asu̍raṁ duvasya
English: praise him whose bow is strong and sure his arrow him who is lord of every balm that bealeth  worship thou rudra for his great good favour adore the asura god with salutations

Sanskrit: damū̍naso a̱paso̱ ye su̱hastā̱ vṛṣṇa̱ḥ patnī̍r na̱dyo̍ vibhvata̱ṣṭāḥ   sara̍svatī bṛhaddi̱vota rā̱kā da̍śa̱syantī̍r varivasyantu śu̱bhrāḥ
English: may the housefriends the cunninghanded artists may the steer's wives the streams carved out by vibhvan  and may the fair ones honour and befriend us sarasvatī brhaddiva and rākā

Sanskrit: pra sū ma̱he su̍śara̱ṇāya̍ me̱dhāṁ gira̍m bhare̱ navya̍sī̱ṁ jāya̍mānām   ya ā̍ha̱nā du̍hi̱tur va̱kṣaṇā̍su rū̱pā mi̍nā̱no akṛ̍ṇod i̱daṁ na̍ḥ
English: my newest song thought that now springs within me i offer to the great the sure protector  who made for us this all in fond love laying each varied form within his daughter's bosom

Sanskrit: pra su̍ṣṭu̱tiḥ sta̱naya̍ntaṁ ru̱vanta̍m i̱ḻas pati̍ṁ jaritar nū̱nam a̍śyāḥ   yo a̍bdi̱mām̐ u̍dani̱mām̐ iya̍rti̱ pra vi̱dyutā̱ roda̍sī u̱kṣamā̍ṇaḥ
English: now even now may thy fair praise o singer attain idaspati who roars and thunders  who rich in clouds and waters with his lightning speeds forth bedewing both the earth and heaven

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa stomo̱ māru̍ta̱ṁ śardho̱ acchā̍ ru̱drasya̍ sū̱nūm̐r yu̍va̱nyūm̐r ud a̍śyāḥ   kāmo̍ rā̱ye ha̍vate mā sva̱sty upa̍ stuhi̱ pṛṣa̍daśvām̐ a̱yāsa̍ḥ
English: may this my laud attain the troop of maruts those who are youths in act the sons of rudra  the wish calls me to riches and wellbeing praise the unwearied ones whose steeds are dappled

Sanskrit: praiṣa stoma̍ḥ pṛthi̱vīm a̱ntari̍kṣa̱ṁ vana̱spatī̱m̐r oṣa̍dhī rā̱ye a̍śyāḥ   de̱vode̍vaḥ su̱havo̍ bhūtu̱ mahya̱m mā no̍ mā̱tā pṛ̍thi̱vī du̍rma̱tau dhā̍t
English: may this my laud reach earth and air's midregion and forest trees and plants to win me riches  may every deity be swift to listen and mother earth with no ill thought regard me

Sanskrit: u̱rau de̍vā anibā̱dhe syā̍ma
English: gods may we dwell in free untroubled bliss

Sanskrit: sam a̱śvino̱r ava̍sā̱ nūta̍nena mayo̱bhuvā̍ su̱praṇī̍tī gamema   ā no̍ ra̱yiṁ va̍hata̱m ota vī̱rān ā viśvā̍ny amṛtā̱ saubha̍gāni
English: may we obtain the aśvins' newest favour and gain their healthbestowing happy guidance  bring riches hither unto us and heroes and all felicity and joy immortals!

Sanskrit: yad i̍ndra citra me̱hanāsti̱ tvādā̍tam adrivaḥ   rādha̱s tan no̍ vidadvasa ubhayāha̱sty ā bha̍ra
English: stonedarting indra wondrous one what wealth is richly given from thee  that bounty treasurefinder! bring filling both thy hands to us

Sanskrit: yan manya̍se̱ vare̍ṇya̱m indra̍ dyu̱kṣaṁ tad ā bha̍ra   vi̱dyāma̱ tasya̍ te va̱yam akū̍pārasya dā̱vane̍
English: bring what thou deemest worth the wish o indra that which is in heaven  so may we know thee as thou art boundless in thy munificence

Sanskrit: yat te̍ di̱tsu pra̱rādhya̱m mano̱ asti̍ śru̱tam bṛ̱hat   tena̍ dṛ̱ḻhā ci̍d adriva̱ ā vāja̍ṁ darṣi sā̱taye̍
English: thy lofty spirit farrenowned as fain to give and prompt to win  with this thou rendest een the firm stonedarter! so to gain thee strength

Sanskrit: maṁhi̍ṣṭhaṁ vo ma̱ghonā̱ṁ rājā̍naṁ carṣaṇī̱nām   indra̱m upa̱ praśa̍staye pū̱rvībhi̍r jujuṣe̱ gira̍ḥ
English: singers with many songs have made indra propitious to their fame  him who is king of human kind most liberal of your wealthy ones

Sanskrit: asmā̱ it kāvya̱ṁ vaca̍ u̱ktham indrā̍ya̱ śaṁsya̍m   tasmā̍ u̱ brahma̍vāhase̱ giro̍ vardha̱nty atra̍yo̱ gira̍ḥ śumbha̱nty atra̍yaḥ
English: to him to indra must be sung the poet's word the hymn of praise  to him accepter of the prayer the atris raise their songs on high the atris beautify their songs

Sanskrit: ko nu vā̍m mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtā̱yan di̱vo vā̍ ma̱haḥ pārthi̍vasya vā̱ de   ṛ̱tasya̍ vā̱ sada̍si̱ trāsī̍thāṁ no yajñāya̱te vā̍ paśu̱ṣo na vājā̍n
English: who mitravaruṇa is your pious servant to give you gifts from earth or mighty heaven?  preserve us in the seat of holy order and give the offerer power that winneth cattle

Sanskrit: te no̍ mi̱tro varu̍ṇo arya̱māyur indra̍ ṛbhu̱kṣā ma̱ruto̍ juṣanta   namo̍bhir vā̱ ye dadha̍te suvṛ̱ktiṁ stoma̍ṁ ru̱drāya̍ mī̱ḻhuṣe̍ sa̱joṣā̍ḥ
English: may mitra varuṇa aryaman and āyu indra ṛbhukṣan and the maruts love us  and they who of one mind with bounteous rudra accept the hymn and laud with adorations

Sanskrit: ā vā̱ṁ yeṣṭhā̍śvinā hu̱vadhyai̱ vāta̍sya̱ patma̱n rathya̍sya pu̱ṣṭau   u̱ta vā̍ di̱vo asu̍rāya̱ manma̱ prāndhā̍ṁsīva̱ yajya̍ve bharadhvam
English: you will i call to feed the carhorse aśvins with the wind's flight swiftest of those who travel  or also to the asura of heaven worshipful bring a hymn as twere libation

Sanskrit: pra sa̱kṣaṇo̍ di̱vyaḥ kaṇva̍hotā tri̱to di̱vaḥ sa̱joṣā̱ vāto̍ a̱gniḥ   pū̱ṣā bhaga̍ḥ prabhṛ̱the vi̱śvabho̍jā ā̱jiṁ na ja̍gmur ā̱śva̍śvatamāḥ
English: the heavenly victor he whose priest is kaṇva tṛta with dyaus accordant vāta agni  allfeeding pūṣan bhaga sought the oblation as they whose steeds are fleetest seek the contest

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ ra̱yiṁ yu̱ktāśva̍m bharadhvaṁ rā̱ya eṣe 'va̍se dadhīta̱ dhīḥ   su̱śeva̱ evai̍r auśi̱jasya̱ hotā̱ ye va̱ evā̍ marutas tu̱rāṇā̍m
English: bring ye your riches forward borne on horses let thought be framed for help and gain of treasure  blest he the priest of auśija through courses the courses which are yours the fleet o maruts

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ vā̱yuṁ ra̍tha̱yuja̍ṁ kṛṇudhva̱m pra de̱vaṁ vipra̍m pani̱tāra̍m a̱rkaiḥ   i̱ṣu̱dhyava̍ ṛta̱sāpa̱ḥ pura̍ṁdhī̱r vasvī̍r no̱ atra̱ patnī̱r ā dhi̱ye dhu̍ḥ
English: bring hither him who yokes the car your vāyu who praises with his songs the god and singer;  and praying and devout noble and prudent may the gods spouses in their thoughts retain us

Sanskrit: upa̍ va̱ eṣe̱ vandye̍bhiḥ śū̱ṣaiḥ pra ya̱hvī di̱vaś ci̱taya̍dbhir a̱rkaiḥ   u̱ṣāsā̱naktā̍ vi̱duṣī̍va̱ viśva̱m ā hā̍ vahato̱ martyā̍ya ya̱jñam
English: i speed to you with powers that should be honoured with songs distinguishing heaven's mighty daughters  morning and night the two as twere allknowing these bring the sacrifice unto the mortal

Sanskrit: a̱bhi vo̍ arce po̱ṣyāva̍to̱ nṝn vāsto̱ṣ pati̱ṁ tvaṣṭā̍ra̱ṁ rarā̍ṇaḥ   dhanyā̍ sa̱joṣā̍ dhi̱ṣaṇā̱ namo̍bhi̱r vana̱spatī̱m̐r oṣa̍dhī rā̱ya eṣe̍

English: we know your ways ye mighty ones receiving choice meed ye wonderful we will proclaim it  even strong birds descend not to the mortal who strives to reach them with swift blow and weapons

English: celestial and terrestrial generations and waters will i summon to the feasting  may days with bright dawns cause my songs to prosper and may the conquered streams increase their waters

English: thus thinking o ye gods the mortal wins you to give him increase of his herds of cattle the mortal wins him o ye gods your favour  here he wins wholesome food to feed this body as for mine old age nirrti consume it

English: may iḷā mother of the herds of cattle and urvasi with all the streams accept us;  may urvasi in lofty heaven accepting as she partakes the oblation of the living

English: visit us while she shares urjavya's food

English: come thou to what the stones have pressed drink soma o thou soma's lord  indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong

English: strong is the stone the draught is strong strong is this soma that is pressed  indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong

English: as strong i call on thee the strong o thunderarmed with various aids  indra best vṛtraslayer strong one with the strong

English: o sūrya when the asura's descendant svarbhanu pierced thee through and through with darkness  all creatures looked like one who is bewildered who knoweth not the place where he is standing

English: what time thou smotest down svarbhanu's magic that spread itself beneath the sky o indra  by his fourth sacred prayer atri disoovered sūrya concealed in gloom that stayed his function

English: let not the oppressor with this dread through anger swallow me up for i am thine o atri  mitra art thou the sender of true blessings thou and king varuṇa be both my helpers

English: the brahman atri as he set the pressstones serving the gods with praise and adoration  established in the heaven the eye of sūrya and caused svarbhanu's magic arts to vanish

English: the atris found the sun again him whom svarbhanu of the brood  of asuras had pierced with gloom this none besides had power to do

English: may the milchcows who hasten to their object come harmless unto us with liquid sweetness  the singer lauding calls for ample riches the seven mighty ones who bring enjoyment

English: may he support in peace and win in battle he masters both the hosts that meet together  dear shall he be to sūrya dear to agni who with pressed soma offers gifts to india

English: may indra come to us he who knows rightly to give forth treasures from his store of riches  even as a thirsty steer who roams the deserts may he drink eagerly the milkedout soma

English: lord of bay horses hero may the soma rise to thy cheeks and jaws like mountainridges  may we o king as he who driveth coursers all joy in thee with hymns invoked of many!

English: invoked of many caster of the stone my heart quakes like a rolling wheel for fear of penury  shall not puruvasu the singer give thee praise o everprospering maghavan mounted on thy car?

English: may the strong heaven make thee the strong wax stronger strong thou art borne by thy two strong bay horses  so fair of cheek with mighty chariot mighty uphold us strongwilled thunderarmed in battle

Sanskrit: yo rohi̍tau vā̱jinau̍ vā̱jinī̍vān tri̱bhiḥ śa̱taiḥ saca̍mānā̱v adi̍ṣṭa   yūne̱ sam a̍smai kṣi̱tayo̍ namantāṁ śru̱tara̍thāya maruto duvo̱yā
English: maruts let all the people in obeisance bow down before this youthful srutaratha  who rich in steeds gave me two dark red horses together with three hundred head of cattle
