Sanskrit: u̱ta na̍ḥ sutrā̱tro de̱vago̍pāḥ sū̱ribhya̍ indrāvaruṇā ra̱yiḥ ṣyā̍t   yeṣā̱ṁ śuṣma̱ḥ pṛta̍nāsu sā̱hvān pra sa̱dyo dyu̱mnā ti̱rate̱ tatu̍riḥ
English: so also indravaruṇa may our princes have riches swift to save with gods to guard them  they whose great might gives victory in battles and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness

Sanskrit: nū na̍ indrāvaruṇā gṛṇā̱nā pṛ̱ṅktaṁ ra̱yiṁ sau̍śrava̱sāya̍ devā   i̱tthā gṛ̱ṇanto̍ ma̱hina̍sya̱ śardho̱ 'po na nā̱vā du̍ri̱tā ta̍rema
English: indra and varuṇa gods whom we are lauding mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory  may we who praise the strength of what is mighty pass dangers as with boats we cross the waters

Sanskrit: pra sa̱mrāje̍ bṛha̱te manma̱ nu pri̱yam arca̍ de̱vāya̱ varu̍ṇāya sa̱pratha̍ḥ   a̱yaṁ ya u̱rvī ma̍hi̱nā mahi̍vrata̱ḥ kratvā̍ vi̱bhāty a̱jaro̱ na śo̱ciṣā̍
English: now will i sing a dear and farextending hymn to varuṇa the god sublime imperial lord  who mighty governor eternal as with flame illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power

Sanskrit: indrā̍varuṇā sutapāv i̱maṁ su̱taṁ soma̍m pibata̱m madya̍ṁ dhṛtavratā   yu̱vo ratho̍ adhva̱raṁ de̱vavī̍taye̱ prati̱ svasa̍ra̱m upa̍ yāti pī̱taye̍
English: true to law indravaruṇa drinkers of the juice drink this pressed soma which shall give you rapturous joy  your chariot cometh to the banquet of the gods to sacrifice as it were home that ye may drink

Sanskrit: indrā̍varuṇā̱ madhu̍mattamasya̱ vṛṣṇa̱ḥ soma̍sya vṛṣa̱ṇā vṛ̍ṣethām   i̱daṁ vā̱m andha̱ḥ pari̍ṣiktam a̱sme ā̱sadyā̱smin ba̱rhiṣi̍ mādayethām
English: indra and varuṇa drink your fill ye heroes of this invigorating sweetest soma  this juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it on this trimmed grass be seated and rejoice you

Sanskrit: vapu̱r nu tac ci̍ki̱tuṣe̍ cid astu samā̱naṁ nāma̍ dhe̱nu patya̍mānam   marte̍ṣv a̱nyad do̱hase̍ pī̱pāya̍ sa̱kṛc chu̱kraṁ du̍duhe̱ pṛśni̱r ūdha̍ḥ
English: e'en to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of cow is given  the one hath swelled among mankind for milking pṛśni hath drained but once her fair bright udder

Sanskrit: ye a̱gnayo̱ na śośu̍cann idhā̱nā dvir yat trir ma̱ruto̍ vāvṛ̱dhanta̍   a̱re̱ṇavo̍ hira̱ṇyayā̍sa eṣāṁ sā̱kaṁ nṛ̱mṇaiḥ pauṁsye̍bhiś ca bhūvan
English: they who like kindled flames of fire are glowing the maruts twice and thrice have waxen mighty  golden and dustless were their cars invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour

Sanskrit: ru̱drasya̱ ye mī̱ḻhuṣa̱ḥ santi̍ pu̱trā yām̐ś co̱ nu dādhṛ̍vi̱r bhara̍dhyai   vi̱de hi mā̱tā ma̱ho ma̱hī ṣā set pṛśni̍ḥ su̱bhve̱3̱̍ garbha̱m ādhā̍t
English: they who are sons of the rainpouring rudra whom the longlasting one had power to foster  the mighty ones whose germ great mother pṛśni is known to have received for man's advantage

Sanskrit: na ya īṣa̍nte ja̱nuṣo 'yā̱ nv a1̱̍ntaḥ santo̍ 'va̱dyāni̍ punā̱nāḥ   nir yad du̱hre śuca̱yo 'nu̱ joṣa̱m anu̍ śri̱yā ta̱nva̍m u̱kṣamā̍ṇāḥ
English: they shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches  when they have streamed forth brilliant at their pleasure with their own splendour they bedew their bodies

Sanskrit: ma̱kṣū na yeṣu̍ do̱hase̍ cid a̱yā ā nāma̍ dhṛ̱ṣṇu māru̍ta̱ṁ dadhā̍nāḥ   na ye stau̱nā a̱yāso̍ ma̱hnā nū ci̍t su̱dānu̱r ava̍ yāsad u̱grān
English: even those who bear the brave bold name of maruts whom not the active quickly wins for milking  even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones those who are light and agile in their greatness

Sanskrit: ta id u̱grāḥ śava̍sā dhṛ̱ṣṇuṣe̍ṇā u̱bhe yu̍janta̱ roda̍sī su̱meke̍   adha̍ smaiṣu roda̱sī svaśo̍ci̱r āma̍vatsu tasthau̱ na roka̍ḥ
English: when strong in strength and armed with potent weapons they had united wellformed earth and heaven  rodasl stood among these furious heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness

Sanskrit: a̱ne̱no vo̍ maruto̱ yāmo̍ astv ana̱śvaś ci̱d yam aja̱ty ara̍thīḥ   a̱na̱va̱so a̍nabhī̱śū ra̍ja̱stūr vi roda̍sī pa̱thyā̍ yāti̱ sādha̍n
English: no team of goats shall draw your car o maruts no horse no charioteer be he who drives it  halting not reinless through the air it travels speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven

Sanskrit: nāsya̍ va̱rtā na ta̍ru̱tā nv a̍sti̱ maru̍to̱ yam ava̍tha̱ vāja̍sātau   to̱ke vā̱ goṣu̱ tana̍ye̱ yam a̱psu sa vra̱jaṁ dartā̱ pārye̱ adha̱ dyoḥ
English: none may obstruct none overtake o maruts him whom ye succour in the strife of battle  for sons and progeny for kine and waters he bursts the cowstall on the day of trial

Sanskrit: pra ci̱tram a̱rkaṁ gṛ̍ṇa̱te tu̱rāya̱ māru̍tāya̱ svata̍vase bharadhvam   ye sahā̍ṁsi̱ saha̍sā̱ saha̍nte̱ reja̍te agne pṛthi̱vī ma̱khebhya̍ḥ
English: bring a bright hymn to praise the band of maruts the singers rapid strong in native vigour  who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty earth shakes in terror at their wars o agni

Sanskrit: tviṣī̍manto adhva̱rasye̍va di̱dyut tṛ̍ṣu̱cyava̍so ju̱hvo̱3̱̍ nāgneḥ   a̱rcatra̍yo̱ dhuna̍yo̱ na vī̱rā bhrāja̍jjanmāno ma̱ruto̱ adhṛ̍ṣṭāḥ
English: bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset  chanting their psalm singing aloud like heroes splendid from birth invincible the maruts

Sanskrit: taṁ vṛ̱dhanta̱m māru̍ta̱m bhrāja̍dṛṣṭiṁ ru̱drasya̍ sū̱nuṁ ha̱vasā vi̍vāse   di̱vaḥ śardhā̍ya̱ śuca̍yo manī̱ṣā gi̱rayo̱ nāpa̍ u̱grā a̍spṛdhran
English: that swelling band i call with invocation the brood of rudra armed with glittering lances  pure hymns are meet for that celestial army like floods and mountains have the strong ones battled

Sanskrit: e̱ṣā syā no̍ duhi̱tā di̍vo̱jāḥ kṣi̱tīr u̱cchantī̱ mānu̍ṣīr ajīgaḥ   yā bhā̱nunā̱ ruśa̍tā rā̱myāsv ajñā̍yi ti̱ras tama̍saś cid a̱ktūn
English: shedding her light on human habitations this child of heaven hath called us from our slumber;  she who at nighttime with her argent lustre hath shown herself een through the shades of darkness

Sanskrit: vi tad ya̍yur aruṇa̱yugbhi̱r aśvai̍ś ci̱tram bhā̍nty u̱ṣasa̍ś ca̱ndrara̍thāḥ   agra̍ṁ ya̱jñasya̍ bṛha̱to naya̍ntī̱r vi tā bā̍dhante̱ tama̱ ūrmyā̍yāḥ
English: all this with redrayed steeds have they divided the dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion  they bringing near the stately rite's commencement drive far away the night's surrounding shadows

Sanskrit: śravo̱ vāja̱m iṣa̱m ūrja̱ṁ vaha̍ntī̱r ni dā̱śuṣa̍ uṣaso̱ martyā̍ya   ma̱ghonī̍r vī̱rava̱t patya̍mānā̱ avo̍ dhāta vidha̱te ratna̍m a̱dya
English: dawns bringing hither to the man who worships glory and power and might and food and vigour  opulent with imperial sway like heroes favour your servant and this day enrich him

Sanskrit: i̱dā hi vo̍ vidha̱te ratna̱m astī̱dā vī̱rāya̍ dā̱śuṣa̍ uṣāsaḥ   i̱dā viprā̍ya̱ jara̍te̱ yad u̱kthā ni ṣma̱ māva̍te vahathā pu̱rā ci̍t
English: now is there treasure for the man who serves you now for the hero dawns! who brings oblation;  now for the singer when he sings the praisesong even to one like me ye brought aforetime

Sanskrit: i̱dā hi ta̍ uṣo adrisāno go̱trā gavā̱m aṅgi̍raso gṛ̱ṇanti̍   vy a1̱̍rkeṇa̍ bibhidu̱r brahma̍ṇā ca sa̱tyā nṛ̱ṇām a̍bhavad de̱vahū̍tiḥ
English: o dawn who standest on the mountain ridges aṅgirases now praise thy stalls of cattle  with prayer and holy hymn they burst them open the heroes' calling on the gods was fruitful

Sanskrit: u̱cchā di̍vo duhitaḥ pratna̱van no̍ bharadvāja̱vad vi̍dha̱te ma̍ghoni   su̱vīra̍ṁ ra̱yiṁ gṛ̍ṇa̱te ri̍rīhy urugā̱yam adhi̍ dhehi̱ śravo̍ naḥ
English: shine on us as of old thou child of heavenon him rich maid! who serves like bharadvāja  give to the singer wealth with noble heroes and upon us bestow widespreading glory

Sanskrit: ud u̍ śri̱ya u̱ṣaso̱ roca̍mānā̱ asthu̍r a̱pāṁ normayo̱ ruśa̍ntaḥ   kṛ̱ṇoti̱ viśvā̍ su̱pathā̍ su̱gāny abhū̍d u̱ vasvī̱ dakṣi̍ṇā ma̱ghonī̍
English: the radiant dawns have risen up for glory in their white splendour like the waves of waters  she maketh paths all easy fair to travel and rich hath shown herself benign and friendly

Sanskrit: bha̱drā da̍dṛkṣa urvi̱yā vi bhā̱sy ut te̍ śo̱cir bhā̱navo̱ dyām a̍paptan   ā̱vir vakṣa̍ḥ kṛṇuṣe śu̱mbhamā̱noṣo̍ devi̱ roca̍mānā̱ maho̍bhiḥ
English: we see that thou art good far shines thy lustre; thy beams thy splendours have flown up to heaven  decking thyself thou makest bare thy bosom shining in majesty thou goddess morning

Sanskrit: vaha̍nti sīm aru̱ṇāso̱ ruśa̍nto̱ gāva̍ḥ su̱bhagā̍m urvi̱yā pra̍thā̱nām   ape̍jate̱ śūro̱ aste̍va̱ śatrū̱n bādha̍te̱ tamo̍ aji̱ro na voḻhā̍
English: red are the kine and luminous that bear her the blessed one who spreadeth through the distance  the foes she chaseth like a valiant archer like a swift warrior she repelleth darkness

Sanskrit: su̱gota te̍ su̱pathā̱ parva̍teṣv avā̱te a̱pas ta̍rasi svabhāno   sā na̱ ā va̍ha pṛthuyāmann ṛṣve ra̱yiṁ di̍vo duhitar iṣa̱yadhyai̍
English: thy ways are easy on the hills thou passest invincible! se1fluminous! through waters  so lofty goddess with thine ample pathway daughter of heaven bring wealth to give us comfort

Sanskrit: sā va̍ha̱ yokṣabhi̱r avā̱toṣo̱ vara̱ṁ vaha̍si̱ joṣa̱m anu̍   tvaṁ di̍vo duhita̱r yā ha̍ de̱vī pū̱rvahū̍tau ma̱ṁhanā̍ darśa̱tā bhū̍ḥ
English: dawn bring me wealth untroubled with thine oxen thou bearest riches at thy will and pleasure;  thou who a goddess child of heaven hast shown thee lovely through bounty when we called thee early

Sanskrit: ut te̱ vaya̍ś cid vasa̱ter a̍papta̱n nara̍ś ca̱ ye pi̍tu̱bhājo̱ vyu̍ṣṭau   a̱mā sa̱te va̍hasi̱ bhūri̍ vā̱mam uṣo̍ devi dā̱śuṣe̱ martyā̍ya
English: as the birds fly forth from their restingplaces so men with store of food rise at thy dawning  yea to the liberal mortal who rernaineth at home o goddess dawn much good thou bringest

Sanskrit: kva1̱̍ tyā va̱lgū pu̍ruhū̱tādya dū̱to na stomo̍ 'vida̱n nama̍svān   ā yo a̱rvāṅ nāsa̍tyā va̱varta̱ preṣṭhā̱ hy asa̍tho asya̱ manma̍n
English: where hath the hymn with reverence like an envoy found both fair gods today invoked of many  hymn that hath brought the two nāsatyas hither? to this man's thought be ye both gods most friendly

Sanskrit: ara̍m me ganta̱ṁ hava̍nāyā̱smai gṛ̍ṇā̱nā yathā̱ pibā̍tho̱ andha̍ḥ   pari̍ ha̱ tyad va̱rtir yā̍tho ri̱ṣo na yat paro̱ nānta̍ras tutu̱ryāt
English: come readily to this mine invocation lauded with songs that ye may drink the juices  compass this house to keep it from the foeman that none may force it either near or distant

Sanskrit: akā̍ri vā̱m andha̍so̱ varī̍ma̱nn astā̍ri ba̱rhiḥ su̍prāya̱ṇata̍mam   u̱ttā̱naha̍sto yuva̱yur va̍va̱ndā vā̱ṁ nakṣa̍nto̱ adra̍ya āñjan
English: juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you for you the grass is strewn most soft to tread on  with lifted hands your servant hath adored you yearningfor you the pressstones shed the liquid

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvo vā̍m a̱gnir a̍dhva̱reṣv a̍sthā̱t pra rā̱tir e̍ti jū̱rṇinī̍ ghṛ̱tācī̍   pra hotā̍ gū̱rtama̍nā urā̱ṇo 'yu̍kta̱ yo nāsa̍tyā̱ havī̍man
English: agni uplifts him at your sacrifices forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing  up stands the gratefulminded priest elected appointed to invoke the two nāsatyas

Sanskrit: adhi̍ śri̱ye du̍hi̱tā sūrya̍sya̱ ratha̍ṁ tasthau purubhujā śa̱toti̍m   pra mā̱yābhi̍r māyinā bhūta̱m atra̱ narā̍ nṛtū̱ jani̍man ya̱jñiyā̍nām
English: lords of great wealth! for glory sūrya's daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours  famed for your magic arts were ye magicians! amid the race of gods ye dancing heroes!

Sanskrit: yu̱vaṁ śrī̱bhir da̍rśa̱tābhi̍r ā̱bhiḥ śu̱bhe pu̱ṣṭim ū̍hathuḥ sū̱ryāyā̍ḥ   pra vā̱ṁ vayo̱ vapu̱ṣe 'nu̍ papta̱n nakṣa̱d vāṇī̱ suṣṭu̍tā dhiṣṇyā vām
English: ye twain with these your glories fair to look on brought to win victory rich gifts for sūrya  after you flew your birds marvels of beauty dear to our hearts! the song well lauded reached you

Sanskrit: ā vā̱ṁ vayo 'śvā̍so̱ vahi̍ṣṭhā a̱bhi prayo̍ nāsatyā vahantu   pra vā̱ṁ ratho̱ mano̍javā asarjī̱ṣaḥ pṛ̱kṣa i̱ṣidho̱ anu̍ pū̱rvīḥ
English: may your winged coursers best to draw nāsatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes  swift as the thought your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands

Sanskrit: pu̱ru hi vā̍m purubhujā de̱ṣṇaṁ dhe̱nuṁ na̱ iṣa̍m pinvata̱m asa̍krām   stuta̍ś ca vām mādhvī suṣṭu̱tiś ca̱ rasā̍ś ca̱ ye vā̱m anu̍ rā̱tim agma̍n
English: lords of great wealth manifold is your bounty ye filled our cow with food that never faileth  lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers and poured libations which have sought your favour

Sanskrit: u̱ta ma̍ ṛ̱jre pura̍yasya ra̱ghvī su̍mī̱ḻhe śa̱tam pe̍ru̱ke ca̍ pa̱kvā   śā̱ṇḍo dā̍d dhira̱ṇina̱ḥ smaddi̍ṣṭī̱n daśa̍ va̱śāso̍ abhi̱ṣāca̍ ṛ̱ṣvān
English: mine were two mares of puraya brown swiftfooted; a hundred with sumidha food with peruk  sanda gave ten golddecked and welltrained horses tame and obedient and of lofty stature

Sanskrit: saṁ vā̍ṁ śa̱tā nā̍satyā sa̱hasrāśvā̍nām puru̱panthā̍ gi̱re dā̍t   bha̱radvā̍jāya vīra̱ nū gi̱re dā̍d dha̱tā rakṣā̍ṁsi purudaṁsasā syuḥ
English: nāsatyas! purupanthas offered hundreds thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises  gave heroes! to the singer bharadvāja yewonderworkers let the fiends be slaughtered

Sanskrit: ā vā̍ṁ su̱mne vari̍man sū̱ribhi̍ḥ ṣyām
English: may i with princes share your bliss in freedom

Sanskrit: stu̱ṣe narā̍ di̱vo a̱sya pra̱santā̱śvinā̍ huve̱ jara̍māṇo a̱rkaiḥ   yā sa̱dya u̱srā vyuṣi̱ jmo antā̱n yuyū̍ṣata̱ḥ pary u̱rū varā̍ṁsi
English: i laud the heroes twain this heaven's controllers singing with songs of praise i call the aśvins  fain in a moment when the morns are breaking to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions

Sanskrit: tā ya̱jñam ā śuci̍bhiś cakramā̱ṇā ratha̍sya bhā̱nuṁ ru̍rucū̱ rajo̍bhiḥ   pu̱rū varā̱ṁsy ami̍tā̱ mimā̍nā̱po dhanvā̱ny ati̍ yātho̱ ajrā̍n
English: moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them  traversing many wide unmeasured spaces over the wastes ye pass and fields and waters

Sanskrit: tā ha̱ tyad va̱rtir yad ara̍dhram ugre̱tthā dhiya̍ ūhathu̱ḥ śaśva̱d aśvai̍ḥ   mano̍javebhir iṣi̱raiḥ śa̱yadhyai̱ pari̱ vyathi̍r dā̱śuṣo̱ martya̍sya
English: ye to that bounteous path of yours ye mighty have ever borne away our thoughts with horses  mindswift and full of vigour that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber

Sanskrit: tā navya̍so̱ jara̍māṇasya̱ manmopa̍ bhūṣato yuyujā̱nasa̍ptī   śubha̱m pṛkṣa̱m iṣa̱m ūrja̱ṁ vaha̍ntā̱ hotā̍ yakṣat pra̱tno a̱dhrug yuvā̍nā
English: so ye when ye have yoked your chariothorses come to the hymn of the most recent singer  our true and ancient herald priest shall bring you the youthful bearing splendour food and vigour

Sanskrit: tā va̱lgū da̱srā pu̍ru̱śāka̍tamā pra̱tnā navya̍sā̱ vaca̱sā vi̍vāse   yā śaṁsa̍te stuva̱te śambha̍viṣṭhā babhū̱vatu̍r gṛṇa̱te ci̱trarā̍tī
English: with newest hymn i call those wonderworkers ancient and brilliant and exceeding mighty  bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises bestowing varied bounties on the singer

Sanskrit: tā bhu̱jyuṁ vibhi̍r a̱dbhyaḥ sa̍mu̱drāt tugra̍sya sū̱num ū̍hathū̱ rajo̍bhiḥ   a̱re̱ṇubhi̱r yoja̍nebhir bhu̱jantā̍ pata̱tribhi̱r arṇa̍so̱ nir u̱pasthā̍t
English: so ye with birds out of the sea and waters bore bhujyu son of tugra through the regions  speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces out of the bosom of the flood they bore him

Sanskrit: vi ja̱yuṣā̍ rathyā yāta̱m adri̍ṁ śru̱taṁ hava̍ṁ vṛṣaṇā vadhrima̱tyāḥ   da̱śa̱syantā̍ śa̱yave̍ pipyathu̱r gām iti̍ cyavānā suma̱tim bhu̍raṇyū
English: victors carborne ye rent the rock asunder bulls heard the calling of the eunuch's consort  bounteous ye filled the cow with milk for śayu thus swift and zealous ones ye showed your favour

Sanskrit: yad ro̍dasī pra̱divo̱ asti̱ bhūmā̱ heḻo̍ de̱vānā̍m u̱ta ma̍rtya̱trā   tad ā̍dityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣo̱yuje̱ tapu̍r a̱ghaṁ da̍dhāta
English: whateer from olden time heaven earth! existeth great object of the wrath of gods and mortals  make that ādityas vasus sons of rudra an evil brand to one allied with demons

Sanskrit: ya ī̱ṁ rājā̍nāv ṛtu̱thā vi̱dadha̱d raja̍so mi̱tro varu̍ṇa̱ś cike̍tat   ga̱mbhī̱rāya̱ rakṣa̍se he̱tim a̍sya̱ droghā̍ya ci̱d vaca̍sa̱ āna̍vāya
English: may he who knows as varuṇa and mitra air's realm appointing both the kings in season  against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon against the lying words that strangers utter

Sanskrit: anta̍raiś ca̱krais tana̍yāya va̱rtir dyu̱matā yā̍taṁ nṛ̱vatā̱ rathe̍na   sanu̍tyena̱ tyaja̍sā̱ martya̍sya vanuṣya̱tām api̍ śī̱rṣā va̍vṛktam
English: come to our home with friendly wheels for offipring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes  strike off ye twain the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us

Sanskrit: ā pa̍ra̱mābhi̍r u̱ta ma̍dhya̱mābhi̍r ni̱yudbhi̍r yātam ava̱mābhi̍r a̱rvāk   dṛ̱ḻhasya̍ ci̱d goma̍to̱ vi vra̱jasya̱ duro̍ vartaṁ gṛṇa̱te ci̍trarātī
English: come hitherward to us with teams of horses the highest and the midmost and the lowest  bountiful lords throw open to the singer doors een of the firmclosed stall of cattle

Sanskrit: ā ri̍kha kiki̱rā kṛ̍ṇu paṇī̱nāṁ hṛda̍yā kave   athe̍m a̱smabhya̍ṁ randhaya
English: tear up and read in pieces sage the hearts of avaricious churls  and make them subject to our will

Sanskrit: yām pū̍ṣan brahma̱coda̍nī̱m ārā̱m bibha̍rṣy āghṛṇe   tayā̍ samasya̱ hṛda̍ya̱m ā ri̍kha kiki̱rā kṛ̍ṇu
English: thou glowing pūṣan carriest an awl that urges men to prayer;  therewith do thou tear up and rend to shreds the heart of every one

Sanskrit: yā te̱ aṣṭrā̱ goo̍pa̱śāghṛ̍ṇe paśu̱sādha̍nī   tasyā̍s te su̱mnam ī̍mahe
English: thou bearest glowing lord! a goad with horny point that guides the cows  thence do we seek thy gift of bliss

Sanskrit: u̱ta no̍ go̱ṣaṇi̱ṁ dhiya̍m aśva̱sāṁ vā̍ja̱sām u̱ta   nṛ̱vat kṛ̍ṇuhi vī̱taye̍
English: and make this hymn of ours produce kine horses and a store of wealth  for our delight and use as men

Sanskrit: sam pū̍ṣan vi̱duṣā̍ naya̱ yo añja̍sānu̱śāsa̍ti   ya e̱vedam iti̱ brava̍t
English: o pusan bring us to the man who knows who shall direct us straight  and say unto us it is here

Sanskrit: sam u̍ pū̱ṣṇā ga̍memahi̱ yo gṛ̱hām̐ a̍bhi̱śāsa̍ti   i̱ma e̱veti̍ ca̱ brava̍t
English: may we go forth with pūṣan who shall point the houses out to us  and say to us these same are they

Sanskrit: pū̱ṣṇaś ca̱kraṁ na ri̍ṣyati̱ na kośo 'va̍ padyate   no a̍sya vyathate pa̱viḥ
English: unharmed is pūṣan's chariot wheel; the box neer falleth to the ground  nor doth the loosened feliy shake

Sanskrit: yo a̍smai ha̱viṣāvi̍dha̱n na tam pū̱ṣāpi̍ mṛṣyate   pra̱tha̱mo vi̍ndate̱ vasu̍
English: pūṣan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift  that man is first to gather wealth

Sanskrit: pū̱ṣā gā anv e̍tu naḥ pū̱ṣā ra̍kṣa̱tv arva̍taḥ   pū̱ṣā vāja̍ṁ sanotu naḥ
English: may pūṣan follow near our kine; may pūṣan keep our horses safe  may pūṣan gather gear for us

Sanskrit: pūṣa̱nn anu̱ pra gā i̍hi̱ yaja̍mānasya sunva̱taḥ   a̱smāka̍ṁ stuva̱tām u̱ta
English: follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee;  and ours who sing thee songs of praise

Sanskrit: māki̍r neśa̱n mākī̍ṁ riṣa̱n mākī̱ṁ saṁ śā̍ri̱ keva̍ṭe   athāri̍ṣṭābhi̱r ā ga̍hi
English: let none be lost none injured none sink in a pit and break a limb  return with these all safe and sound

Sanskrit: śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m pū̱ṣaṇa̍ṁ va̱yam irya̱m ana̍ṣṭavedasam   īśā̍naṁ rā̱ya ī̍mahe
English: pūṣan who listens to our prayers the strong whose wealth is never lost  the lord of riches we implore

Sanskrit: pūṣa̱n tava̍ vra̱te va̱yaṁ na ri̍ṣyema̱ kadā̍ ca̱na   sto̱tāra̍s ta i̱ha sma̍si
English: secure in thy protecting care o pūṣan never may we fail  we here are they who sing thy praise

Sanskrit: pari̍ pū̱ṣā pa̱rastā̱d dhasta̍ṁ dadhātu̱ dakṣi̍ṇam   puna̍r no na̱ṣṭam āja̍tu
English: from out the distance far and wide may pūṣan stretch his right hand forth  and drive our lost again to us

Sanskrit: hu̱ve vo̍ de̱vīm adi̍ti̱ṁ namo̍bhir mṛḻī̱kāya̱ varu̍ṇam mi̱tram a̱gnim   a̱bhi̱kṣa̱dām a̍rya̱maṇa̍ṁ su̱śeva̍ṁ trā̱tṝn de̱vān sa̍vi̱tāra̱m bhaga̍ṁ ca
English: i call with prayers on aditi your goddess on agni mitra varuṇa for favour  on aryaman who gives unasked the gracious on gods who save on savitar and bhaga

Sanskrit: su̱jyoti̍ṣaḥ sūrya̱ dakṣa̍pitṝn anāgā̱stve su̍maho vīhi de̱vān   dvi̱janmā̍no̱ ya ṛ̍ta̱sāpa̍ḥ sa̱tyāḥ sva̍rvanto yaja̱tā a̍gniji̱hvāḥ
English: visit to prove us free from sin o sūrya lord of great might the bright gods sprung from dakṣa  twiceborn and true observing sacred duties holy and full of light whose tongue is agni

Sanskrit: u̱ta dyā̍vāpṛthivī kṣa̱tram u̱ru bṛ̱had ro̍dasī śara̱ṇaṁ su̍ṣumne   ma̱has ka̍ratho̱ vari̍vo̱ yathā̍ no̱ 'sme kṣayā̍ya dhiṣaṇe ane̱haḥ
English: and o ye heaven and earth a wide dominion o ye most blissful worlds our lofty shelter  give ample room and freedom for our dwelling a home ye hemispheres which none may rival

Sanskrit: ā no̍ ru̱drasya̍ sū̱navo̍ namantām a̱dyā hū̱tāso̱ vasa̱vo 'dhṛ̍ṣṭāḥ   yad ī̱m arbhe̍ maha̱ti vā̍ hi̱tāso̍ bā̱dhe ma̱ruto̱ ahvā̍ma de̱vān
English: this day invited may the sons of rudra resistless excellent stoop down to meet us;  for when beset with slight or sore affliction we ever call upon the gods the maruts;

Sanskrit: mi̱myakṣa̱ yeṣu̍ roda̱sī nu de̱vī siṣa̍kti pū̱ṣā a̍bhyardha̱yajvā̍   śru̱tvā hava̍m maruto̱ yad dha̍ yā̱tha bhūmā̍ rejante̱ adhva̍ni̱ pravi̍kte
English: to whom the goddess rodasī clings closely whom pūṣan follows bringing ample bounty  what time ye hear our call and come o maruts upon your separate path all creatures tremble

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tyaṁ vī̱raṁ girva̍ṇasam a̱rcendra̱m brahma̍ṇā jarita̱r nave̍na   śrava̱d id dhava̱m upa̍ ca̱ stavā̍no̱ rāsa̱d vājā̱m̐ upa̍ ma̱ho gṛ̍ṇā̱naḥ
English: with a new hymn extol o thou who singest the lover of the song the hero indra  may he exalted hear our invocation and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded

Sanskrit: o̱māna̍m āpo mānuṣī̱r amṛ̍kta̱ṁ dhāta̍ to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya̱ śaṁ yoḥ   yū̱yaṁ hi ṣṭhā bhi̱ṣajo̍ mā̱tṛta̍mā̱ viśva̍sya sthā̱tur jaga̍to̱ jani̍trīḥ
English: give full protection friends of man ye waters in peace and trouble to our sons and grandsons  for ye are our most motherly physicians parents of all that standeth all that moveth

Sanskrit: ā no̍ de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā trāya̍māṇo̱ hira̍ṇyapāṇir yaja̱to ja̍gamyāt   yo datra̍vām̐ u̱ṣaso̱ na pratī̍kaṁ vyūrṇu̱te dā̱śuṣe̱ vāryā̍ṇi
English: may savitar come hither and approach us the god who rescues holy goldenhanded  the god who bounteous as the face of morning discloses precious gifts for him who worships

Sanskrit: u̱ta tvaṁ sū̍no sahaso no a̱dyā de̱vām̐ a̱sminn a̍dhva̱re va̍vṛtyāḥ   syām a̱haṁ te̱ sada̱m id rā̱tau tava̍ syām a̱gne 'va̍sā su̱vīra̍ḥ
English: and thou o son of strength do thou turn hither the gods today to this our holy service  may i for evermore enjoy thy bounty and agni by thy grace be rich in heroes

Sanskrit: u̱ta tyā me̱ hava̱m ā ja̍gmyāta̱ṁ nāsa̍tyā dhī̱bhir yu̱vam a̱ṅga vi̍prā   atri̱ṁ na ma̱has tama̍so 'mumukta̱ṁ tūrva̍taṁ narā duri̱tād a̱bhīke̍
English: come also to my call o ye nāsatyas yea verily through my prayers ye holy sages  as from great darkness ye delivered atri protect us chiefs from danger in the conflict

Sanskrit: te no̍ rā̱yo dyu̱mato̱ vāja̍vato dā̱tāro̍ bhūta nṛ̱vata̍ḥ puru̱kṣoḥ   da̱śa̱syanto̍ di̱vyāḥ pārthi̍vāso̱ gojā̍tā̱ apyā̍ mṛ̱ḻatā̍ ca devāḥ
English: o gods bestow upon us riches splendid with strength and heroes bringing food in plenty  be gracious helpful gods of earth of heaven born of the cow and dwellers in the waters

Sanskrit: te no̍ ru̱draḥ sara̍svatī sa̱joṣā̍ mī̱ḻhuṣma̍nto̱ viṣṇu̍r mṛḻantu vā̱yuḥ   ṛ̱bhu̱kṣā vājo̱ daivyo̍ vidhā̱tā pa̱rjanyā̱vātā̍ pipyatā̱m iṣa̍ṁ naḥ
English: may rudra and sarasvatī accordant viṣṇu and vāyu pour down gifts and bless us;  ṛbhukṣan vāja and divine vidhatar parjanya vāta make our food abundant

Sanskrit: u̱ta sya de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā bhago̍ no̱ 'pāṁ napā̍d avatu̱ dānu̱ papri̍ḥ   tvaṣṭā̍ de̱vebhi̱r jani̍bhiḥ sa̱joṣā̱ dyaur de̱vebhi̍ḥ pṛthi̱vī sa̍mu̱draiḥ
English: may this god savitar the lord the offspring of waters pouring down his dew be gracious  and with the gods and dames accordant tvaṣṭar; dyaus with the gods and prthivi with oceans

Sanskrit: u̱ta no 'hi̍r bu̱dhnya̍ḥ śṛṇotv a̱ja eka̍pāt pṛthi̱vī sa̍mu̱draḥ   viśve̍ de̱vā ṛ̍tā̱vṛdho̍ huvā̱nāḥ stu̱tā mantrā̍ḥ kaviśa̱stā a̍vantu
English: may ajaekapād and ahibudhnya and earth and ocean hear our invocation;  all gods who strengthen law invoked and lauded and holy texts uttered by sages help us

Sanskrit: e̱vā napā̍to̱ mama̱ tasya̍ dhī̱bhir bha̱radvā̍jā a̱bhy a̍rcanty a̱rkaiḥ   gnā hu̱tāso̱ vasa̱vo 'dhṛ̍ṣṭā̱ viśve̍ stu̱tāso̍ bhūtā yajatrāḥ
English: so with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of bharadvāja sing aloud to please you  the dames invoked and the resistless vasus and all ye holy ones have been exalted

Sanskrit: na tad di̱vā na pṛ̍thi̱vyānu̍ manye̱ na ya̱jñena̱ nota śamī̍bhir ā̱bhiḥ   u̱bjantu̱ taṁ su̱bhva1̱̍ḥ parva̍tāso̱ ni hī̍yatām atiyā̱jasya̍ ya̱ṣṭā
English: this i allow not in the earth or heaven at sacrifice or in these holy duties  may the huge mountains crush him down degraded be atiyaja's sacrificing patron

Sanskrit: ati̍ vā̱ yo ma̍ruto̱ manya̍te no̱ brahma̍ vā̱ yaḥ kri̱yamā̍ṇa̱ṁ nini̍tsāt   tapū̍ṁṣi̱ tasmai̍ vṛji̱nāni̍ santu brahma̱dviṣa̍m a̱bhi taṁ śo̍catu̱ dyauḥ
English: or he who holds us in contempt o maruts or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making  may agonies of burning be his portion may the sky scorch the man who hates devotion

Sanskrit: kim a̱ṅga tvā̱ brahma̍ṇaḥ soma go̱pāṁ kim a̱ṅga tvā̍hur abhiśasti̱pāṁ na̍ḥ   kim a̱ṅga na̍ḥ paśyasi ni̱dyamā̍nān brahma̱dviṣe̱ tapu̍ṣiṁ he̱tim a̍sya
English: why then o soma do they call thee keeper of prayer? why then our guardian from reproaches?  why then beholdest thou how men revile us? cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion

Sanskrit: ava̍ntu̱ mām u̱ṣaso̱ jāya̍mānā̱ ava̍ntu mā̱ sindha̍va̱ḥ pinva̍mānāḥ   ava̍ntu mā̱ parva̍tāso dhru̱vāso 'va̍ntu mā pi̱taro̍ de̱vahū̍tau
English: may mornings as they spring to life protect me and may the rivers as they swell preserve me  my guardians be the firmlyseated mountains the fathers when i call on gods defend me!

Sanskrit: vi̱śva̱dānī̍ṁ su̱mana̍saḥ syāma̱ paśye̍ma̱ nu sūrya̍m u̱ccara̍ntam   tathā̍ kara̱d vasu̍pati̱r vasū̍nāṁ de̱vām̐ ohā̱no 'va̱sāga̍miṣṭhaḥ
English: through all our days may we be healthy minded and look upon the sun when he arises  grant this the treasurelord of treasures coming observant oftenest of gods with succour!

Sanskrit: indro̱ nedi̍ṣṭha̱m ava̱sāga̍miṣṭha̱ḥ sara̍svatī̱ sindhu̍bhi̱ḥ pinva̍mānā   pa̱rjanyo̍ na̱ oṣa̍dhībhir mayo̱bhur a̱gniḥ su̱śaṁsa̍ḥ su̱hava̍ḥ pi̱teva̍
English: most near most oft comes indra with protection and she sarasvatī who swells with rivers   parjanya bringing health with herbs and agni well lauded swift to listen like a father

Sanskrit: viśve̍ devāsa̱ ā ga̍ta śṛṇu̱tā ma̍ i̱maṁ hava̍m   edam ba̱rhir ni ṣī̍data
English: hear this mine invocation; come hither o universal gods  be seated on this holy grass

Sanskrit: yo vo̍ devā ghṛ̱tasnu̍nā ha̱vyena̍ prati̱bhūṣa̍ti   taṁ viśva̱ upa̍ gacchatha
English: to him who comes to meet you gods with offerings bathed in holy oil  approach ye one and all to him

Sanskrit: upa̍ naḥ sū̱navo̱ gira̍ḥ śṛ̱ṇvantv a̱mṛta̍sya̱ ye   su̱mṛ̱ḻī̱kā bha̍vantu naḥ
English: all sons of immortality shall listen to the songs we sing  and be exceeding good to us

Sanskrit: viśve̍ de̱vā ṛ̍tā̱vṛdha̍ ṛ̱tubhi̍r havana̱śruta̍ḥ   ju̱ṣantā̱ṁ yujya̱m paya̍ḥ
English: may all the gods who strengthen law with ṛtus listening to our call  be pleased with theit appropriate draught

Sanskrit: sto̱tram indro̍ ma̱rudga̍ṇa̱s tvaṣṭṛ̍mān mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā   i̱mā ha̱vyā ju̍ṣanta naḥ
English: may indra with the marut host with tvaṣṭar mitra aryaman  accept the laud and these our gifts

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ no̍ agne adhva̱raṁ hota̍r vayuna̱śo ya̍ja   ci̱ki̱tvān daivya̱ṁ jana̍m
English: o agni priest as rules ordain offer this sacrifice of ours  remembering the heavenly folk

Sanskrit: viśve̍ devāḥ śṛṇu̱temaṁ hava̍m me̱ ye a̱ntari̍kṣe̱ ya upa̱ dyavi̱ ṣṭha   ye a̍gniji̱hvā u̱ta vā̱ yaja̍trā ā̱sadyā̱smin ba̱rhiṣi̍ mādayadhvam
English: listen allgods to this mine invocation ye who inhabit heaven and air's midregions  all ye o holy ones whose tongue is agni seated upon this sacred grass be joyful

Sanskrit: viśve̍ de̱vā mama̍ śṛṇvantu ya̱jñiyā̍ u̱bhe roda̍sī a̱pāṁ napā̍c ca̱ manma̍   mā vo̱ vacā̍ṁsi pari̱cakṣyā̍ṇi vocaṁ su̱mneṣv id vo̱ anta̍mā madema
English: may the allgods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two worldhalves hear it and the waters child  let me not utter words that ye may disregard closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss

Sanskrit: ye ke ca̱ jmā ma̱hino̱ ahi̍māyā di̱vo ja̍jñi̱re a̱pāṁ sa̱dhasthe̍   te a̱smabhya̍m i̱ṣaye̱ viśva̱m āyu̱ḥ kṣapa̍ u̱srā va̍rivasyantu de̱vāḥ
English: and those who mighty with the wiles of serpents were born on earth in heaven where waters gather  may they vouchsafe us life of full duration may the gods kindly give us nights and mornings

Sanskrit: agnī̍parjanyā̱v ava̍ta̱ṁ dhiya̍m me̱ 'smin have̍ suhavā suṣṭu̱tiṁ na̍ḥ   iḻā̍m a̱nyo ja̱naya̱d garbha̍m a̱nyaḥ pra̱jāva̍tī̱r iṣa̱ ā dha̍ttam a̱sme
English: at this my call o agni and parjanya help swift to hear my thought and our laudation  one generates holy food the other offspring so grant us food enough with store of children

Sanskrit: stī̱rṇe ba̱rhiṣi̍ samidhā̱ne a̱gnau sū̱ktena̍ ma̱hā nama̱sā vi̍vāse   a̱smin no̍ a̱dya vi̱dathe̍ yajatrā̱ viśve̍ devā ha̱viṣi̍ mādayadhvam
English: when holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled with hymn and lowly homage i invite you  allgods to day in this our great assembly rejoice ye holy in the gifts we offer

Sanskrit: ud u̱ tyac cakṣu̱r mahi̍ mi̱trayo̱r ām̐ eti̍ pri̱yaṁ varu̍ṇayo̱r ada̍bdham   ṛ̱tasya̱ śuci̍ darśa̱tam anī̍kaṁ ru̱kmo na di̱va udi̍tā̱ vy a̍dyaut
English: that mighty eye of varuṇa and mitra infallible and dear is moving upward  the pure and lovely face of holy order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising

Sanskrit: veda̱ yas trīṇi̍ vi̱dathā̍ny eṣāṁ de̱vānā̱ṁ janma̍ sanu̱tar ā ca̱ vipra̍ḥ   ṛ̱ju marte̍ṣu vṛji̱nā ca̱ paśya̍nn a̱bhi ca̍ṣṭe̱ sūro̍ a̱rya evā̍n
English: the sage who knows these gods three ranks and orders and all their generations near and distant  beholding good and evil acts of mortals sūra marks well the doing of the pious

Sanskrit: stu̱ṣa u̍ vo ma̱ha ṛ̱tasya̍ go̱pān adi̍tim mi̱traṁ varu̍ṇaṁ sujā̱tān   a̱rya̱maṇa̱m bhaga̱m ada̍bdhadhītī̱n acchā̍ voce sadha̱nya̍ḥ pāva̱kān
English: i praise you guards of mighty law eternal aditi mitra varuṇa the noble  aryaman bhaga all whose thoughts are faithful hither i call the bright who share in common

Sanskrit: ri̱śāda̍sa̱ḥ satpa̍tī̱m̐r ada̍bdhān ma̱ho rājña̍ḥ suvasa̱nasya̍ dā̱tṝn   yūna̍ḥ sukṣa̱trān kṣaya̍to di̱vo nṝn ā̍di̱tyān yā̱my adi̍tiṁ duvo̱yu
English: lords of the brave infallible foedestroyers great kings bestowers of fair homes to dwell in  young heroes ruling heaven with strong dominion ādityas aditi i seek with worship

Sanskrit: dyau̱3̱̍ṣ pita̱ḥ pṛthi̍vi̱ māta̱r adhru̱g agne̍ bhrātar vasavo mṛ̱ḻatā̍ naḥ   viśva̍ ādityā adite sa̱joṣā̍ a̱smabhya̱ṁ śarma̍ bahu̱laṁ vi ya̍nta
English: o heaven our father earth our guileless mother o brother agni and ye vasus bless us  grant us o aditi and ye ādityas all of one mind your manifold protection

Sanskrit: mā no̱ vṛkā̍ya vṛ̱kye̍ samasmā aghāya̱te rī̍radhatā yajatrāḥ   yū̱yaṁ hi ṣṭhā ra̱thyo̍ nas ta̱nūnā̍ṁ yū̱yaṁ dakṣa̍sya̱ vaca̍so babhū̱va
English: give us not up to any evil creature as spoil to wolf or shewolf o ye holy  for ye are they who guide aright our bodies ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour

Sanskrit: mā va̱ eno̍ a̱nyakṛ̍tam bhujema̱ mā tat ka̍rma vasavo̱ yac caya̍dhve   viśva̍sya̱ hi kṣaya̍tha viśvadevāḥ sva̱yaṁ ri̱pus ta̱nva̍ṁ rīriṣīṣṭa
English: let us not suffer for the sin of others nor do the deed which ye o vasus punish  ye universal gods! are allcontrollers may he do harm unto himself who hates me

Sanskrit: nama̱ id u̱graṁ nama̱ ā vi̍vāse̱ namo̍ dādhāra pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām   namo̍ de̱vebhyo̱ nama̍ īśa eṣāṁ kṛ̱taṁ ci̱d eno̱ nama̱sā vi̍vāse
English: mighty is homage i adopt and use it homage hath held in place the earth and heaven  homage to gods! homage commands and rules them i banish even committed sin by homage

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tasya̍ vo ra̱thya̍ḥ pū̱tada̍kṣān ṛ̱tasya̍ pastya̱sado̱ ada̍bdhān   tām̐ ā namo̍bhir uru̱cakṣa̍so̱ nṝn viśvā̍n va̱ ā na̍me ma̱ho ya̍jatrāḥ
English: you furtherers of law pure in your spirit infallible dwellers in the home of order  to you all heroes mighty and farseeing i bow me down o holy ones with homage

Sanskrit: te hi śreṣṭha̍varcasa̱s ta u̍ nas ti̱ro viśvā̍ni duri̱tā naya̍nti   su̱kṣa̱trāso̱ varu̍ṇo mi̱tro a̱gnir ṛ̱tadhī̍tayo vakma̱rāja̍satyāḥ
English: for these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely  varuṇa mitra agni mighty rulers trueminded faithful to the hymn's controllers

Sanskrit: te na̱ indra̍ḥ pṛthi̱vī kṣāma̍ vardhan pū̱ṣā bhago̱ adi̍ti̱ḥ pañca̱ janā̍ḥ   su̱śarmā̍ṇa̱ḥ svava̍saḥ sunī̱thā bhava̍ntu naḥ sutrā̱trāsa̍ḥ sugo̱pāḥ
English: may they earth aditi indra bhaga pūṣan increase our laud increase the fivefold people  giving good help good refuge goodly guidance be they our good deliverers good protectors

Sanskrit: nū sa̱dmāna̍ṁ di̱vyaṁ naṁśi̍ devā̱ bhāra̍dvājaḥ suma̱tiṁ yā̍ti̱ hotā̍   ā̱sā̱nebhi̱r yaja̍māno mi̱yedhai̍r de̱vānā̱ṁ janma̍ vasū̱yur va̍vanda
