English: supreme he stirs this man to give the guerdonindra most efficacious of the princes  wherewith o thunderer thou removest sorrow and bold one! partest wealth among the nobles

Sanskrit: indro̱ vāja̍sya̱ sthavi̍rasya dā̱tendro̍ gī̱rbhir va̍rdhatāṁ vṛ̱ddhama̍hāḥ   indro̍ vṛ̱traṁ hani̍ṣṭho astu̱ satvā tā sū̱riḥ pṛ̍ṇati̱ tūtu̍jānaḥ
English: indra is hewho gives enduring vigour may our songs magnify the god most mighty  best vṛtraslayer be the hero indra these things he gives as prince with strong endeavour

Sanskrit: ma̱ndrasya̍ ka̱ver di̱vyasya̱ vahne̱r vipra̍manmano vaca̱nasya̱ madhva̍ḥ   apā̍ na̱s tasya̍ saca̱nasya̍ de̱veṣo̍ yuvasva gṛṇa̱te goa̍grāḥ
English: of this our charming our celestial soma eloquent wise priest with inspired devotion  of this thy close attendant hast thou drunken god send the singer food with milk to grace it

Sanskrit: a̱yam u̍śā̱naḥ pary adri̍m u̱srā ṛ̱tadhī̍tibhir ṛta̱yug yu̍jā̱naḥ   ru̱jad aru̍gṇa̱ṁ vi va̱lasya̱ sānu̍m pa̱ṇīm̐r vaco̍bhir a̱bhi yo̍dha̱d indra̍ḥ
English: craving the kine rushing against the mountain led on by law with holyminded comrades  he broke the neverbroken ridge of vala with words of might indra subdued the paṇis

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ dyo̍tayad a̱dyuto̱ vy a1̱̍ktūn do̱ṣā vasto̍ḥ śa̱rada̱ indu̍r indra   i̱maṁ ke̱tum a̍dadhu̱r nū ci̱d ahnā̱ṁ śuci̍janmana u̱ṣasa̍ś cakāra
English: this indu lighted darksome nights o indra throughout the years at morning and at evening  him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign he made the mornings to be born in splendour

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ ro̍cayad a̱ruco̍ rucā̱no̱3̱̍ 'yaṁ vā̍saya̱d vy ṛ1̱̍tena̍ pū̱rvīḥ   a̱yam ī̍yata ṛta̱yugbhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ sva̱rvidā̱ nābhi̍nā carṣaṇi̱prāḥ
English: he shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not by law he lighted up the host of mornings  he moves with steeds yoked by eternal order contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight

Sanskrit: nū gṛ̍ṇā̱no gṛ̍ṇa̱te pra̍tna rāja̱nn iṣa̍ḥ pinva vasu̱deyā̍ya pū̱rvīḥ   a̱pa oṣa̍dhīr avi̱ṣā vanā̍ni̱ gā arva̍to̱ nṝn ṛ̱case̍ rirīhi
English: now praised o ancient king! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures  give waters herbs that have no poison forests and kine and steeds and men to him who lauds thee

Sanskrit: sa̱trā madā̍sa̱s tava̍ vi̱śvaja̍nyāḥ sa̱trā rāyo 'dha̱ ye pārthi̍vāsaḥ   sa̱trā vājā̍nām abhavo vibha̱ktā yad de̱veṣu̍ dhā̱raya̍thā asu̱rya̍m
English: thy raptures ever were for all men's profit so evermore have been thine earthly riches  thou still hast been the dealerforth of vigour since among gods thou hast had power and godhead

Sanskrit: anu̱ pra ye̍je̱ jana̱ ojo̍ asya sa̱trā da̍dhire̱ anu̍ vī̱ryā̍ya   syū̱ma̱gṛbhe̱ dudha̱ye 'rva̍te ca̱ kratu̍ṁ vṛñja̱nty api̍ vṛtra̱hatye̍
English: men have obtained his strength by sacrificing and ever urged him on to hero valour  for the reinseizing the impetuous charger they furnished power even for vṛtra's slaughter

Sanskrit: taṁ sa̱dhrīcī̍r ū̱tayo̱ vṛṣṇyā̍ni̱ pauṁsyā̍ni ni̱yuta̍ḥ saścu̱r indra̍m   sa̱mu̱draṁ na sindha̍va u̱kthaśu̍ṣmā uru̱vyaca̍sa̱ṁ gira̱ ā vi̍śanti
English: associate with him as teams of horses help manly might and vigour follow indra  as rivers reach the sea so strong with praises our holy songs reach him the comprehensive

Sanskrit: sa rā̱yas khām upa̍ sṛjā gṛṇā̱naḥ pu̍ruśca̱ndrasya̱ tvam i̍ndra̱ vasva̍ḥ   pati̍r babhū̱thāsa̍mo̱ janā̍nā̱m eko̱ viśva̍sya̱ bhuva̍nasya̱ rājā̍
English: lauded by us let flow the spring o indra of excellent and brightlyshining riches  for thou art lord of men without an equal of all the world thou art the only sovran

Sanskrit: sa tu śru̍dhi̱ śrutyā̱ yo du̍vo̱yur dyaur na bhūmā̱bhi rāyo̍ a̱ryaḥ   aso̱ yathā̍ na̱ḥ śava̍sā cakā̱no yu̱geyu̍ge̱ vaya̍sā̱ ceki̍tānaḥ
English: hear what thou mayst hear thou who fain for worship as heaven girds earth guardest thy servant's treasure;  tlat thou mayst be our own joying in power famed through thy might in every generation

Sanskrit: ka̱dā bhu̍va̱n ratha̍kṣayāṇi̱ brahma̍ ka̱dā sto̱tre sa̍hasrapo̱ṣya̍ṁ dāḥ   ka̱dā stoma̍ṁ vāsayo 'sya rā̱yā ka̱dā dhiya̍ḥ karasi̱ vāja̍ratnāḥ
English: when shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? when dost thou give the singer food for thousands?  when wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

Sanskrit: karhi̍ svi̱t tad i̍ndra̱ yan nṛbhi̱r nṝn vī̱rair vī̱rān nī̱ḻayā̍se̱ jayā̱jīn   tri̱dhātu̱ gā adhi̍ jayāsi̱ goṣv indra̍ dyu̱mnaṁ sva̍rvad dhehy a̱sme
English: when wilt thou gatber men with men o indra heroes with heroes and prevail in combat?  thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle so indra give thou us celestial glory

Sanskrit: karhi̍ svi̱t tad i̍ndra̱ yaj ja̍ri̱tre vi̱śvapsu̱ brahma̍ kṛ̱ṇava̍ḥ śaviṣṭha   ka̱dā dhiyo̱ na ni̱yuto̍ yuvāse ka̱dā goma̍ghā̱ hava̍nāni gacchāḥ
English: yea when wilt thou o indra thou most mighty make the prayer allsustaining for the singer?  when wilt thou yoke as we yoke songs thy horses and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

Sanskrit: sa goma̍ghā jari̱tre aśva̍ścandrā̱ vāja̍śravaso̱ adhi̍ dhehi̱ pṛkṣa̍ḥ   pī̱pi̱hīṣa̍ḥ su̱dughā̍m indra dhe̱num bha̱radvā̍jeṣu su̱ruco̍ rurucyāḥ
English: grant to the singer food with store of cattle splendid with horses and the fame of riches  send food to swell the milchcow good at milking bright be its shine among the bharadvājas

Sanskrit: tam ā nū̱naṁ vṛ̱jana̍m a̱nyathā̍ ci̱c chūro̱ yac cha̍kra̱ vi duro̍ gṛṇī̱ṣe   mā nir a̍raṁ śukra̱dugha̍sya dhe̱nor ā̍ṅgira̱sān brahma̍ṇā vipra jinva
English: lead otherwise this present foeman śakra! hence art thou praised as hero foe destroyer  him who gives pure gifts may i praise unceasing sage quicken the aṅgirases by devotion

Sanskrit: saṁ ca̱ tve ja̱gmur gira̍ indra pū̱rvīr vi ca̱ tvad ya̍nti vi̱bhvo̍ manī̱ṣāḥ   pu̱rā nū̱naṁ ca̍ stu̱taya̱ ṛṣī̍ṇām paspṛ̱dhra indre̱ adhy u̍kthā̱rkā
English: full many songs have met in thee o indra and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth  now and of old the eulogies of sages their holy hymns and lauds have yearned for indra

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱hū̱to yaḥ pu̍rugū̱rta ṛbhvā̱m̐ eka̍ḥ purupraśa̱sto asti̍ ya̱jñaiḥ   ratho̱ na ma̱he śava̍se yujā̱no̱3̱̍ 'smābhi̱r indro̍ anu̱mādyo̍ bhūt
English: he praised of many bold invoked of many alone is glorified at sacrifices  like a car harnessed for some great achievement indra must be the cause of our rejoicing

Sanskrit: na yaṁ hiṁsa̍nti dhī̱tayo̱ na vāṇī̱r indra̱ṁ nakṣa̱ntīd a̱bhi va̱rdhaya̍ntīḥ   yadi̍ sto̱tāra̍ḥ śa̱taṁ yat sa̱hasra̍ṁ gṛ̱ṇanti̱ girva̍ṇasa̱ṁ śaṁ tad a̍smai
English: they make their way to indra and exalt him bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble;  for when a hundred or a thousand singers laud him who loves the song their praise delights him

Sanskrit: asmā̍ e̱tad di̱vy a1̱̍rceva̍ mā̱sā mi̍mi̱kṣa indre̱ ny a̍yāmi̱ soma̍ḥ   jana̱ṁ na dhanva̍nn a̱bhi saṁ yad āpa̍ḥ sa̱trā vā̍vṛdhu̱r hava̍nāni ya̱jñaiḥ
English: as brightness mingles with the moon in heaven the offered soma yearns to mix with indra  like water brought to men in desert places our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him

Sanskrit: asmā̍ e̱tan mahy ā̍ṅgū̱ṣam a̍smā̱ indrā̍ya sto̱tram ma̱tibhi̍r avāci   asa̱d yathā̍ maha̱ti vṛ̍tra̱tūrya̱ indro̍ vi̱śvāyu̍r avi̱tā vṛ̱dhaś ca̍
English: to him this mighty eulogy to indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets  that in the great encounter with the foemen loved of all life indra may guard and help us

Sanskrit: ya oji̍ṣṭha indra̱ taṁ su no̍ dā̱ mado̍ vṛṣan svabhi̱ṣṭir dāsvā̍n   sauva̍śvya̱ṁ yo va̱nava̱t svaśvo̍ vṛ̱trā sa̱matsu̍ sā̱saha̍d a̱mitrā̍n
English: give us the rapture that is mightiest indra prompt to bestow and swift to aid o hero  that wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter and quells the vṛtras and the foes in battle

Sanskrit: tvāṁ hī̱3̱̍ndrāva̍se̱ vivā̍co̱ hava̍nte carṣa̱ṇaya̱ḥ śūra̍sātau   tvaṁ vipre̍bhi̱r vi pa̱ṇīm̐r a̍śāya̱s tvota̱ it sani̍tā̱ vāja̱m arvā̍
English: for with loud voice the tribes invoke thee indra to aid them in the battlefield of heroes  thou with the singers hast pierced through the paṇis the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tām̐ i̍ndro̱bhayā̍m̐ a̱mitrā̱n dāsā̍ vṛ̱trāṇy āryā̍ ca śūra   vadhī̱r vane̍va̱ sudhi̍tebhi̱r atkai̱r ā pṛ̱tsu da̍rṣi nṛ̱ṇāṁ nṛ̍tama
English: both races indra of opposing foemen o hero both the ārya and the dāsa  hast thou struck down like woods with wellshot lightnings thou rentest them in fight most manly chieftain!

Sanskrit: sa tvaṁ na̍ i̱ndrāka̍vābhir ū̱tī sakhā̍ vi̱śvāyu̍r avi̱tā vṛ̱dhe bhū̍ḥ   sva̍rṣātā̱ yad dhvayā̍masi tvā̱ yudhya̍nto ne̱madhi̍tā pṛ̱tsu śū̍ra
English: indra befriend us with no scanty succour prosper and aid us loved of all that liveth  when fighting for the sunlight we invoke thee o hero in the fray in war's division

Sanskrit: nū̱naṁ na̍ indrāpa̱rāya̍ ca syā̱ bhavā̍ mṛḻī̱ka u̱ta no̍ a̱bhiṣṭau̍   i̱tthā gṛ̱ṇanto̍ ma̱hina̍sya̱ śarma̍n di̱vi ṣyā̍ma̱ pārye̍ go̱ṣata̍māḥ
English: be ours o indra now and for the future be graciously inclined and near to help us  thus may we singing sheltered by the mighty win many cattle on the day of trial

Sanskrit: apū̍rvyā puru̱tamā̍ny asmai ma̱he vī̱rāya̍ ta̱vase̍ tu̱rāya̍   vi̱ra̱pśine̍ va̱jriṇe̱ śaṁta̍māni̱ vacā̍ṁsy ā̱sā sthavi̍rāya takṣam
English: i with my lips have fashioned for this hero words never matched most plentiful and auspicious  for him the ancient great strong energetic the very mighty wielder of the thunder

Sanskrit: sa mā̱tarā̱ sūrye̍ṇā kavī̱nām avā̍sayad ru̱jad adri̍ṁ gṛṇā̱naḥ   svā̱dhībhi̱r ṛkva̍bhir vāvaśā̱na ud u̱sriyā̍ṇām asṛjan ni̱dāna̍m
English: amid the sages with the sun he brightened the parents glorified he burst the mountain;  and roaring with the holythoughted singers he loosed the bond that held the beams of morning

Sanskrit: sa vahni̍bhi̱r ṛkva̍bhi̱r goṣu̱ śaśva̍n mi̱tajñu̍bhiḥ puru̱kṛtvā̍ jigāya   pura̍ḥ puro̱hā sakhi̍bhiḥ sakhī̱yan dṛ̱ḻhā ru̍roja ka̱vibhi̍ḥ ka̱viḥ san
English: famed for great deeds with priests who kneel and laud him he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle  and broken down the forts the fortdestroyer a friend with friends a sage among the sages

Sanskrit: sa nī̱vyā̍bhir jari̱tāra̱m acchā̍ ma̱ho vāje̍bhir ma̱hadbhi̍ś ca̱ śuṣmai̍ḥ   pu̱ru̱vīrā̍bhir vṛṣabha kṣitī̱nām ā gi̍rvaṇaḥ suvi̱tāya̱ pra yā̍hi
English: come with thy girthed mares with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises  come hither borne by mares with many heroes lover of song! steer! for the people's welfare

Sanskrit: sa sarge̍ṇa̱ śava̍sā ta̱kto atyai̍r a̱pa indro̍ dakṣiṇa̱tas tu̍rā̱ṣāṭ   i̱tthā sṛ̍jā̱nā ana̍pāvṛ̱d artha̍ṁ di̱vedi̍ve viviṣur apramṛ̱ṣyam
English: indra with rush and might sped by his coursers hath swiftly won the waters from the southward  thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal incessant and exhaustless

Sanskrit: abhū̱r eko̍ rayipate rayī̱ṇām ā hasta̍yor adhithā indra kṛ̱ṣṭīḥ   vi to̱ke a̱psu tana̍ye ca̱ sūre 'vo̍canta carṣa̱ṇayo̱ vivā̍caḥ
English: sole lord of wealth art thou o lord of riches thou in thine hands hast held the people indra!  men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters progeny and sunlight

Sanskrit: tvad bhi̱yendra̱ pārthi̍vāni̱ viśvācyu̍tā cic cyāvayante̱ rajā̍ṁsi   dyāvā̱kṣāmā̱ parva̍tāso̱ vanā̍ni̱ viśva̍ṁ dṛ̱ḻham bha̍yate̱ ajma̱nn ā te̍
English: through fear of thee o indra all the regions of earth though naught may move them shake and tremble  all that is firm is frightened at thy coming the earth the heaven the mountain and the forest

Sanskrit: tvaṁ kutse̍nā̱bhi śuṣṇa̍m indrā̱śuṣa̍ṁ yudhya̱ kuya̍va̱ṁ gavi̍ṣṭau   daśa̍ prapi̱tve adha̱ sūrya̍sya muṣā̱yaś ca̱kram avi̍ve̱ rapā̍ṁsi
English: with kutsa indra! thou didst conquer śuṣṇa voracious bane of crops in fight for cattle  in the close fray thou rentest him thou stolest the sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes

Sanskrit: tvaṁ śa̱tāny ava̱ śamba̍rasya̱ puro̍ jaghanthāpra̱tīni̱ dasyo̍ḥ   aśi̍kṣo̱ yatra̱ śacyā̍ śacīvo̱ divo̍dāsāya sunva̱te su̍takre bha̱radvā̍jāya gṛṇa̱te vasū̍ni
English: thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles impregnable of śambara the dasyu  when strong with might thou holpest divodāsa who poured libations out o somabuyer and madest bharadvāja rich who praised thee

Sanskrit: sa sa̍tyasatvan maha̱te raṇā̍ya̱ ratha̱m ā ti̍ṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhī̱mam   yā̱hi pra̍pathi̱nn ava̱sopa̍ ma̱drik pra ca̍ śruta śrāvaya carṣa̱ṇibhya̍ḥ
English: as such true hero for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car o brave and manly  come with thine help to me thou distant roamer and glorious god spread among men my glory

Sanskrit: bhūya̱ id vā̍vṛdhe vī̱ryā̍ya̱m̐ eko̍ aju̱ryo da̍yate̱ vasū̍ni   pra ri̍rice di̱va indra̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyā a̱rdham id a̍sya̱ prati̱ roda̍sī u̱bhe
English: indra hath waxed yet more for hero prowess alone eternal he bestoweth treasures  indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness one half of him equalleth earth and heaven

Sanskrit: adhā̍ manye bṛ̱had a̍su̱rya̍m asya̱ yāni̍ dā̱dhāra̱ naki̱r ā mi̍nāti   di̱vedi̍ve̱ sūryo̍ darśa̱to bhū̱d vi sadmā̍ny urvi̱yā su̱kratu̍r dhāt
English: yea mighty i esteem his godlike nature none hindereth what he hath once determined  near and afar he spread and set the regions and every day the sun became apparent

Sanskrit: a̱dyā ci̱n nū ci̱t tad apo̍ na̱dīnā̱ṁ yad ā̍bhyo̱ ara̍do gā̱tum i̍ndra   ni parva̍tā adma̱sado̱ na se̍du̱s tvayā̍ dṛ̱ḻhāni̍ sukrato̱ rajā̍ṁsi
English: een now endures thine exploit of the rivers when indra for their floods thou clavest passage  like men who sit at meat the mountains settled by thee most wise! the regions were made steadfast

Sanskrit: sa̱tyam it tan na tvāvā̍m̐ a̱nyo a̱stīndra̍ de̱vo na martyo̱ jyāyā̍n   aha̱nn ahi̍m pari̱śayā̍na̱m arṇo 'vā̍sṛjo a̱po acchā̍ samu̱dram
English: this is the truth none else is like thee indra no god superior to thee no mortal  thou slewest ahi who besieged the waters and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward

Sanskrit: tvam a̱po vi duro̱ viṣū̍cī̱r indra̍ dṛ̱ḻham a̍ruja̱ḥ parva̍tasya   rājā̍bhavo̱ jaga̍taś carṣaṇī̱nāṁ sā̱kaṁ sūrya̍ṁ ja̱naya̱n dyām u̱ṣāsa̍m
English: indra thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides and the firmness of the mountain  thou art the king of men of all that liveth engendering at once sun heaven and morning

Sanskrit: indra̍ṁ vo̱ nara̍ḥ sa̱khyāya̍ sepur ma̱ho yanta̍ḥ suma̱taye̍ cakā̱nāḥ   ma̱ho hi dā̱tā vajra̍hasto̱ asti̍ ma̱hām u̍ ra̱ṇvam ava̍se yajadhvam
English: your men have followed indra for his friendship and for his lovingkindness glorified him  for he bestows great wealth the thunderwielder worship him great and kind to win his favour

Sanskrit: ā yasmi̱n haste̱ naryā̍ mimi̱kṣur ā rathe̍ hira̱ṇyaye̍ rathe̱ṣṭhāḥ   ā ra̱śmayo̱ gabha̍styoḥ sthū̱rayo̱r ādhva̱nn aśvā̍so̱ vṛṣa̍ṇo yujā̱nāḥ
English: him to whose hand men closely cling and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed  with his firm arms he holds the reins; his horses the stallions are yoked ready for the journey

Sanskrit: śri̱ye te̱ pādā̱ duva̱ ā mi̍mikṣur dhṛ̱ṣṇur va̱jrī śava̍sā̱ dakṣi̍ṇāvān   vasā̍no̱ atka̍ṁ sura̱bhiṁ dṛ̱śe kaṁ sva1̱̍r ṇa nṛ̍tav iṣi̱ro ba̍bhūtha
English: thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory bold thunderarmed rich through thy strength in guerdon  robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer

Sanskrit: sa soma̱ āmi̍ślatamaḥ su̱to bhū̱d yasmi̍n pa̱ktiḥ pa̱cyate̱ santi̍ dhā̱nāḥ   indra̱ṁ nara̍ḥ stu̱vanto̍ brahmakā̱rā u̱kthā śaṁsa̍nto de̱vavā̍tatamāḥ
English: that soma when effused hath best consistence for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled;  by which the men who pray extolling indra chief favourites of gods recite their praises

Sanskrit: na te̱ anta̱ḥ śava̍so dhāyy a̱sya vi tu bā̍badhe̱ roda̍sī mahi̱tvā   ā tā sū̱riḥ pṛ̍ṇati̱ tūtu̍jāno yū̱thevā̱psu sa̱mīja̍māna ū̱tī
English: no limit of thy might hath been appointed which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven  these the prince filleth full with strong endeavour driving as twere with help his flocks to waters

Sanskrit: e̱ved indra̍ḥ su̱hava̍ ṛ̱ṣvo a̍stū̱tī anū̍tī hiriśi̱praḥ satvā̍   e̱vā hi jā̱to asa̍mātyojāḥ pu̱rū ca̍ vṛ̱trā ha̍nati̱ ni dasyū̍n
English: so be the lofty indra prompt to listen helper unaided goldenvisored hero  yea so may he shown forth in might unequalled smite down the many vṛtras and the dasyus

Sanskrit: ā gāvo̍ agmann u̱ta bha̱dram a̍kra̱n sīda̍ntu go̱ṣṭhe ra̱ṇaya̍ntv a̱sme   pra̱jāva̍tīḥ puru̱rūpā̍ i̱ha syu̱r indrā̍ya pū̱rvīr u̱ṣaso̱ duhā̍nāḥ
English: the kine have come and brought good fortune let them rest in the cowpen and be happy near us  here let them stay prolific manycoloured and yield through many morns their milk for indra

Sanskrit: indro̱ yajva̍ne pṛṇa̱te ca̍ śikṣa̱ty uped da̍dāti̱ na svam mu̍ṣāyati   bhūyo̍bhūyo ra̱yim id a̍sya va̱rdhaya̱nn abhi̍nne khi̱lye ni da̍dhāti deva̱yum
English: indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts he takes not what is his and gives him more thereto  increasing ever more and ever more his wealth he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds

Sanskrit: na tā na̍śanti̱ na da̍bhāti̱ taska̍ro̱ nāsā̍m āmi̱tro vyathi̱r ā da̍dharṣati   de̱vām̐ś ca̱ yābhi̱r yaja̍te̱ dadā̍ti ca̱ jyog it tābhi̍ḥ sacate̱ gopa̍tiḥ sa̱ha
English: these are neer lost no robber ever injures them no evilminded foe attempts to harass them  the master of the kine lives many a year with these the cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the gods

Sanskrit: na tā arvā̍ re̱ṇuka̍kāṭo aśnute̱ na sa̍ṁskṛta̱tram upa̍ yanti̱ tā a̱bhi   u̱ru̱gā̱yam abha̍ya̱ṁ tasya̱ tā anu̱ gāvo̱ marta̍sya̱ vi ca̍ranti̱ yajva̍naḥ
English: the charger with his dusty brow oertakes them not and never to the shambles do they take their way  these cows the cattle of the pious worshipper roam over widespread pasture where no danger is

Sanskrit: gāvo̱ bhago̱ gāva̱ indro̍ me acchā̱n gāva̱ḥ soma̍sya pratha̱masya̍ bha̱kṣaḥ   i̱mā yā gāva̱ḥ sa ja̍nāsa̱ indra̍ i̱cchāmīd dhṛ̱dā mana̍sā ci̱d indra̍m
English: to me the cows seem bhaga they seem indra they seem a portion of the firstpoured soma  these present cows they o ye indra i long for indra with my heart and spirit

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ gā̍vo medayathā kṛ̱śaṁ ci̍d aśrī̱raṁ ci̍t kṛṇuthā su̱pratī̍kam   bha̱draṁ gṛ̱haṁ kṛ̍ṇutha bhadravāco bṛ̱had vo̱ vaya̍ ucyate sa̱bhāsu̍
English: o cows ye fatten een the worn and wasted and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on  prosper my house ye with auspicious voices your power is glorified in our assemblies

Sanskrit: pra̱jāva̍tīḥ sū̱yava̍saṁ ri̱śantī̍ḥ śu̱ddhā a̱paḥ su̍prapā̱ṇe piba̍ntīḥ   mā va̍ḥ ste̱na ī̍śata̱ māghaśa̍ṁsa̱ḥ pari̍ vo he̱tī ru̱drasya̍ vṛjyāḥ
English: crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places  never be thief or sinful man your matter and may the dart of rudra still avoid you

Sanskrit: upe̱dam u̍pa̱parca̍nam ā̱su goṣūpa̍ pṛcyatām   upa̍ ṛṣa̱bhasya̱ reta̱sy upe̍ndra̱ tava̍ vī̱rye̍
English: now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these cows  mixt with the steer's prolific flow and indra with thy hero might

Sanskrit: kim a̍sya̱ made̱ kim v a̍sya pī̱tāv indra̱ḥ kim a̍sya sa̱khye ca̍kāra   raṇā̍ vā̱ ye ni̱ṣadi̱ kiṁ te a̍sya pu̱rā vi̍vidre̱ kim u̱ nūta̍nāsaḥ
English: what deed hath indra done in the wild transport in quaffing or in friendship with the soma?  what joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

Sanskrit: sad a̍sya̱ made̱ sad v a̍sya pī̱tāv indra̱ḥ sad a̍sya sa̱khye ca̍kāra   raṇā̍ vā̱ ye ni̱ṣadi̱ sat te a̍sya pu̱rā vi̍vidre̱ sad u̱ nūta̍nāsaḥ
English: in its wild joy indra hath proved him faithful faithful in quaffing faithful in its friendship  his truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted

Sanskrit: na̱hi nu te̍ mahi̱mana̍ḥ samasya̱ na ma̍ghavan maghava̱ttvasya̍ vi̱dma   na rādha̍sorādhaso̱ nūta̍na̱syendra̱ naki̍r dadṛśa indri̱yaṁ te̍
English: all thy vast power o maghavan we know not know not the riches of thy full abundance  no one hath seen that might of thine productive of bounty every day renewed o indra

Sanskrit: e̱tat tyat ta̍ indri̱yam a̍ceti̱ yenāva̍dhīr va̱raśi̍khasya̱ śeṣa̍ḥ   vajra̍sya̱ yat te̱ niha̍tasya̱ śuṣmā̍t sva̱nāc ci̍d indra para̱mo da̱dāra̍
English: this one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed wherewith thou slewest varasikha's children  when by the force of thy descending thunder at the mere solund their boldest was demolished

Sanskrit: vadhī̱d indro̍ va̱raśi̍khasya̱ śeṣo̍ 'bhyāva̱rtine̍ cāyamā̱nāya̱ śikṣa̍n   vṛ̱cīva̍to̱ yad dha̍riyū̱pīyā̍yā̱ṁ han pūrve̱ ardhe̍ bhi̱yasāpa̍ro̱ dart
English: in aid of abhyavartin cayamana indra destroyed the seed of varasikha  at hariyupiya he smote the vanguard of the vrcivans and the rear fled frighted

Sanskrit: tri̱ṁśaccha̍taṁ va̱rmiṇa̍ indra sā̱kaṁ ya̱vyāva̍tyām puruhūta śrava̱syā   vṛ̱cīva̍nta̱ḥ śara̍ve̱ patya̍mānā̱ḥ pātrā̍ bhindā̱nā nya̱rthāny ā̍yan
English: three thousand mailed in quest of fame together on the yavyavati o muchsought indra  vrcivan's sons falling before the arrow like bursting vessels went to their destruction

Sanskrit: yasya̱ gāvā̍v aru̱ṣā sū̍yava̱syū a̱ntar ū̱ ṣu cara̍to̱ reri̍hāṇā   sa sṛñja̍yāya tu̱rvaśa̱m parā̍dād vṛ̱cīva̍to daivavā̱tāya̱ śikṣa̍n
English: he whose two red steers seeking goodly pasture plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven  gave turvaśa to sṛñjaya and to aid him gave the vrcivans up to daivavata

Sanskrit: dva̱yām̐ a̍gne ra̱thino̍ viṁśa̱tiṁ gā va̱dhūma̍to ma̱ghavā̱ mahya̍ṁ sa̱mrāṭ   a̱bhyā̱va̱rtī cā̍yamā̱no da̍dāti dū̱ṇāśe̱yaṁ dakṣi̍ṇā pārtha̱vānā̍m
English: two wagonteams with damsels twenty oxen o agni abhydvartin cayamdna  the liberal sovran giveth me this guerdon of prthu's seed is hard to win from others

Sanskrit: śru̱dhī na̍ indra̱ hvayā̍masi tvā ma̱ho vāja̍sya sā̱tau vā̍vṛṣā̱ṇāḥ   saṁ yad viśo 'ya̍nta̱ śūra̍sātā u̱graṁ no 'va̱ḥ pārye̱ aha̍n dāḥ
English: o indra hear us raining down the soma we call on thee to win us mighty valour  give us strong succour on the day of trial when the tribes gather on the field of battle

Sanskrit: tvāṁ vā̱jī ha̍vate vājine̱yo ma̱ho vāja̍sya̱ gadhya̍sya sā̱tau   tvāṁ vṛ̱treṣv i̍ndra̱ satpa̍ti̱ṁ taru̍tra̱ṁ tvāṁ ca̍ṣṭe muṣṭi̱hā goṣu̱ yudhya̍n
English: the warrior son of warrior sire invokes thee to gain great strength that may be won as booty  to thee the brave man's lord the fiends' subduer he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ka̱viṁ co̍dayo̱ 'rkasā̍tau̱ tvaṁ kutsā̍ya̱ śuṣṇa̍ṁ dā̱śuṣe̍ vark   tvaṁ śiro̍ ama̱rmaṇa̱ḥ parā̍hann atithi̱gvāya̱ śaṁsya̍ṁ kari̱ṣyan
English: thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight didst ruin śuṣṇa for the pious kutsa  the invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of atithigva

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ratha̱m pra bha̍ro yo̱dham ṛ̱ṣvam āvo̱ yudhya̍ntaṁ vṛṣa̱bhaṁ daśa̍dyum   tvaṁ tugra̍ṁ veta̱save̱ sacā̍ha̱n tvaṁ tuji̍ṁ gṛ̱ṇanta̍m indra tūtoḥ
English: the lofty battlecar thou broughtest forward; thou holpest dasadyu the strong when fighting  along with vetasu thou slewest tugra and madest tuji strong who praised thee indra

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tad u̱ktham i̍ndra ba̱rhaṇā̍ ka̱ḥ pra yac cha̱tā sa̱hasrā̍ śūra̱ darṣi̍   ava̍ gi̱rer dāsa̱ṁ śamba̍raṁ ha̱n prāvo̱ divo̍dāsaṁ ci̱trābhi̍r ū̱tī
English: thou madest good the laud what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes o hero  slewest the dāsa śambara of the mountain and with strange aids didst succour divodāsa

Sanskrit: tvaṁ śra̱ddhābhi̍r mandasā̱naḥ somai̍r da̱bhīta̍ye̱ cumu̍rim indra siṣvap   tvaṁ ra̱jim piṭhī̍nase daśa̱syan ṣa̱ṣṭiṁ sa̱hasrā̱ śacyā̱ sacā̍han
English: made glad with somadraughts and faith thou sentest cumuri to his sleep to please dabhīti  thou kindly giving raji to pithinas slewest with might at once the sixty thousand

Sanskrit: a̱haṁ ca̱na tat sū̱ribhi̍r ānaśyā̱ṁ tava̱ jyāya̍ indra su̱mnam oja̍ḥ   tvayā̱ yat stava̍nte sadhavīra vī̱rās tri̱varū̍thena̱ nahu̍ṣā śaviṣṭha
English: may i too with the liberal chiefs o indra acquire thy blin supreme and domination  when mightiest! herogirt! nahuṣa heroes boast them in thee the triplystrong defender

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ te̍ a̱syām i̍ndra dyu̱mnahū̍tau̱ sakhā̍yaḥ syāma mahina̱ preṣṭhā̍ḥ   prāta̍rdaniḥ kṣatra̱śrīr a̍stu̱ śreṣṭho̍ gha̱ne vṛ̱trāṇā̍ṁ sa̱naye̱ dhanā̍nām
English: so may we he thy friends thy best beloved o indra at this holy invocation  best be pratardani illustrious ruler in slaying foemen and in gaining riches

Sanskrit: yā ta̍ ū̱tir a̍va̱mā yā pa̍ra̱mā yā ma̍dhya̱mendra̍ śuṣmi̱nn asti̍   tābhi̍r ū̱ ṣu vṛ̍tra̱hatye̍ 'vīr na e̱bhiś ca̱ vājai̍r ma̱hān na̍ ugra
English: with thine assistance o thou mighty indra be it the least the midmost or the highest  great with those aids and by these powers support us strong god! in battle that subdues our foemen

Sanskrit: ābhi̱ḥ spṛdho̍ mitha̱tīr ari̍ṣaṇyann a̱mitra̍sya vyathayā ma̱nyum i̍ndra   ābhi̱r viśvā̍ abhi̱yujo̱ viṣū̍cī̱r āryā̍ya̱ viśo 'va̍ tārī̱r dāsī̍ḥ
English: with these discomfit hosts that fight against us and check the opponent's wrath thyself uninjured  with these chase all our foes to every quarter subdue the tribes of dāsas to the ārya

Sanskrit: indra̍ jā̱maya̍ u̱ta ye 'jā̍mayo 'rvācī̱nāso̍ va̱nuṣo̍ yuyu̱jre   tvam e̍ṣāṁ vithu̱rā śavā̍ṁsi ja̱hi vṛṣṇyā̍ni kṛṇu̱hī parā̍caḥ
English: those who array themselves as foes to smite us o indra be they kin or be they strangers  strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward

Sanskrit: śūro̍ vā̱ śūra̍ṁ vanate̱ śarī̍rais tanū̱rucā̱ taru̍ṣi̱ yat kṛ̱ṇvaite̍   to̱ke vā̱ goṣu̱ tana̍ye̱ yad a̱psu vi kranda̍sī u̱rvarā̍su̱ bravai̍te
English: with strength of limb the hero slays the hero when bright in arms they range them for the combat  when two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring waters kine or cornlands

Sanskrit: na̱hi tvā̱ śūro̱ na tu̱ro na dhṛ̱ṣṇur na tvā̍ yo̱dho manya̍māno yu̱yodha̍   indra̱ naki̍ṣ ṭvā̱ praty a̍sty eṣā̱ṁ viśvā̍ jā̱tāny a̱bhy a̍si̱ tāni̍
English: yet no strong man hath conquered thee no hero no brave no warrior trusting in his valour  not one of these is match for thee o indra thou far surpassest all these living creatures

Sanskrit: sa pa̍tyata u̱bhayo̍r nṛ̱mṇam a̱yor yadī̍ ve̱dhasa̍ḥ sami̱the hava̍nte   vṛ̱tre vā̍ ma̱ho nṛ̱vati̱ kṣaye̍ vā̱ vyaca̍svantā̱ yadi̍ vitanta̱saite̍
English: he is the lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict  when with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes

Sanskrit: adha̍ smā te carṣa̱ṇayo̱ yad ejā̱n indra̍ trā̱tota bha̍vā varū̱tā   a̱smākā̍so̱ ye nṛta̍māso a̱rya indra̍ sū̱rayo̍ dadhi̱re pu̱ro na̍ḥ
English: and when the people stir themselves for battle be thou their saviour indra and protector  and theirs thy manliest of our friends the pious the chiefs who have installed us priests o indra

Sanskrit: anu̍ te dāyi ma̱ha i̍ndri̱yāya̍ sa̱trā te̱ viśva̱m anu̍ vṛtra̱hatye̍   anu̍ kṣa̱tram anu̱ saho̍ yaja̱trendra̍ de̱vebhi̱r anu̍ te nṛ̱ṣahye̍
English: to thee for high dominion hath been for evermore for slaughtering the vṛtras  all lordly power and might o holy indra given by gods for victory in battle

Sanskrit: e̱vā na̱ḥ spṛdha̱ḥ sam a̍jā sa̱matsv indra̍ rāra̱ndhi mi̍tha̱tīr ade̍vīḥ   vi̱dyāma̱ vasto̱r ava̍sā gṛ̱ṇanto̍ bha̱radvā̍jā u̱ta ta̍ indra nū̱nam
English: so urge our hosts together in the combats yield up the godless bands that fight against us  singing at morn may we find thee with favour yea indra and een now we bharadvājas

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̱ mada̱ indre̱ śloka̍ u̱kthā sacā̱ some̍ṣu suta̱pā ṛ̍jī̱ṣī   a̱rca̱tryo̍ ma̱ghavā̱ nṛbhya̍ u̱kthair dyu̱kṣo rājā̍ gi̱rām akṣi̍totiḥ
English: strong rapturous joy praise glory are with indra impetuous god he quaffs the juice of soma  that maghavan whom men must laud with singing heavendweller king of songs whose help is lasting

Sanskrit: tatu̍rir vī̱ro naryo̱ vice̍tā̱ḥ śrotā̱ hava̍ṁ gṛṇa̱ta u̱rvyū̍tiḥ   vasu̱ḥ śaṁso̍ na̱rāṁ kā̱rudhā̍yā vā̱jī stu̱to vi̱dathe̍ dāti̱ vāja̍m
English: he friend of man most wise victorious hero hears with farreaching aid the singer call him  excellent praise of men the bard's supporter strong he gives strength extolled in holy synod

Sanskrit: akṣo̱ na ca̱kryo̍ḥ śūra bṛ̱han pra te̍ ma̱hnā ri̍rice̱ roda̍syoḥ   vṛ̱kṣasya̱ nu te̍ puruhūta va̱yā vy ū̱3̱̍tayo̍ ruruhur indra pū̱rvīḥ
English: the lofty axle of thy wheels o hero is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness  like branches of a tree invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee o indra

Sanskrit: śacī̍vatas te puruśāka̱ śākā̱ gavā̍m iva sru̱taya̍ḥ sa̱ṁcara̍ṇīḥ   va̱tsānā̱ṁ na ta̱ntaya̍s ta indra̱ dāma̍nvanto adā̱māna̍ḥ sudāman
English: strong lord thine energies endowed with vigour are like the paths of kine converging homeward  like bonds of cord indra that bind the younglings no bonds are they o thou of boundless bounty

Sanskrit: a̱nyad a̱dya karva̍ram a̱nyad u̱ śvo 'sa̍c ca̱ san muhu̍r āca̱krir indra̍ḥ   mi̱tro no̱ atra̱ varu̍ṇaś ca pū̱ṣāryo vaśa̍sya parye̱tāsti̍
English: one act today another act tomorrow oft indra makes what is not yet existeni  here have we mitra varuṇa and pūṣan to overcome the foeman's domination

Sanskrit: vi tvad āpo̱ na parva̍tasya pṛ̱ṣṭhād u̱kthebhi̍r indrānayanta ya̱jñaiḥ   taṁ tvā̱bhiḥ su̍ṣṭu̱tibhi̍r vā̱jaya̍nta ā̱jiṁ na ja̍gmur girvāho̱ aśvā̍ḥ
English: by song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee as from a mountain's ridge o indra  urging thy might with these fair lauds they seek thee o theme of song as horses rush tobattle

Sanskrit: na yaṁ jara̍nti śa̱rado̱ na māsā̱ na dyāva̱ indra̍m avaka̱rśaya̍nti   vṛ̱ddhasya̍ cid vardhatām asya ta̱nūḥ stome̍bhir u̱kthaiś ca̍ śa̱syamā̍nā
English: that indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age nor fleeting days enfeeble  still may his body wax een now so mighty glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him

Sanskrit: na vī̱ḻave̱ nama̍te̱ na sthi̱rāya̱ na śardha̍te̱ dasyu̍jūtāya sta̱vān   ajrā̱ indra̍sya gi̱raya̍ś cid ṛ̱ṣvā ga̍mbhī̱re ci̍d bhavati gā̱dham a̍smai
English: extolled he bends not to the strong the steadfast nor to the bold incited by the dasyu  high mountains are as level plains to indra even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on

Sanskrit: ga̱mbhī̱reṇa̍ na u̱ruṇā̍matri̱n preṣo ya̍ndhi sutapāva̱n vājā̍n   sthā ū̱ ṣu ū̱rdhva ū̱tī ari̍ṣaṇyann a̱ktor vyu̍ṣṭau̱ pari̍takmyāyām
English: impetuous speeder through all depth and distance give strengthening food thou drinker of the juices  stand up erect to help us unreluctant what time the gloom of night brightens to morning

Sanskrit: saca̍sva nā̱yam ava̍se a̱bhīka̍ i̱to vā̱ tam i̍ndra pāhi ri̱ṣaḥ   a̱mā cai̍na̱m ara̍ṇye pāhi ri̱ṣo made̍ma śa̱tahi̍māḥ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: hasting to help come hither and protect him keep him from harm when he is here o indra  at home abroad from injury preserve him may brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters

Sanskrit: su̱ta it tvaṁ nimi̍śla indra̱ some̱ stome̱ brahma̍ṇi śa̱syamā̍na u̱kthe   yad vā̍ yu̱ktābhyā̍m maghava̱n hari̍bhyā̱m bibhra̱d vajra̍m bā̱hvor i̍ndra̱ yāsi̍
English: thou art attached to pressedout soma indra at laud at prayer and when the hymn is chanted;  or when with yoked bays maghavan thou comest o indra bearing in thine arms the thunder

Sanskrit: yad vā̍ di̱vi pārye̱ suṣvi̍m indra vṛtra̱hatye 'va̍si̱ śūra̍sātau   yad vā̱ dakṣa̍sya bi̱bhyuṣo̱ abi̍bhya̱d ara̍ndhaya̱ḥ śardha̍ta indra̱ dasyū̍n
English: or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at vṛtra's slaughter;  or when thou while the strong one feared undaunted gavest to death indra the daring dasyus

Sanskrit: pātā̍ su̱tam indro̍ astu̱ soma̍m praṇe̱nīr u̱gro ja̍ri̱tāra̍m ū̱tī   kartā̍ vī̱rāya̱ suṣva̍ya u lo̱kaṁ dātā̱ vasu̍ stuva̱te kī̱raye̍ cit
English: let indra drink the pressedout soma helper and mighty guide of him who sings his praises  he gives the hero room who pours oblations and treasure even to the lowly singer

Sanskrit: ganteyā̍nti̱ sava̍nā̱ hari̍bhyām ba̱bhrir vajra̍m pa̱piḥ soma̍ṁ da̱dir gāḥ   kartā̍ vī̱raṁ narya̱ṁ sarva̍vīra̱ṁ śrotā̱ hava̍ṁ gṛṇa̱taḥ stoma̍vāhāḥ
English: een humble rites with his bay steeds he visits he wields the bolt drinks soma gives us cattle  he makes the valiant rich in store of heroes accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling

Sanskrit: asmai̍ va̱yaṁ yad vā̱vāna̱ tad vi̍viṣma̱ indrā̍ya̱ yo na̍ḥ pra̱divo̱ apa̱s kaḥ   su̱te some̍ stu̱masi̱ śaṁsa̍d u̱kthendrā̍ya̱ brahma̱ vardha̍na̱ṁ yathāsa̍t
English: what he hath longed for we have brought to indra who from the days of old hath done us service  while soma flows we will sing hymn and laud him so that our prayer may streng then indra's vigour

Sanskrit: brahmā̍ṇi̱ hi ca̍kṛ̱ṣe vardha̍nāni̱ tāva̍t ta indra ma̱tibhi̍r viviṣmaḥ   su̱te some̍ sutapā̱ḥ śaṁta̍māni̱ rāṇḍyā̍ kriyāsma̱ vakṣa̍ṇāni ya̱jñaiḥ
English: thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting therefore we wait on thee with hymns o indra  may we by the pressed soma somadrinker! bring thee with sacrifice blissful sweet refreshment

Sanskrit: sa no̍ bodhi puro̱ḻāśa̱ṁ rarā̍ṇa̱ḥ pibā̱ tu soma̱ṁ goṛ̍jīkam indra   edam ba̱rhir yaja̍mānasya sīdo̱ruṁ kṛ̍dhi tvāya̱ta u̍ lo̱kam
English: mark well our sacrificial cake delighted indra drink soma and the milk commingled  here on the sacrificer's grass be seated give ample room to thy devoted servant

Sanskrit: sa ma̍ndasvā̱ hy anu̱ joṣa̍m ugra̱ pra tvā̍ ya̱jñāsa̍ i̱me a̍śnuvantu   preme havā̍saḥ puruhū̱tam a̱sme ā tve̱yaṁ dhīr ava̍sa indra yamyāḥ
English: o mighty one be joyful as thou willest let these our sacrifices reach and find thee;  and may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee whom many men invoke to help us

Sanskrit: taṁ va̍ḥ sakhāya̱ḥ saṁ yathā̍ su̱teṣu̱ some̍bhir īm pṛṇatā bho̱jam indra̍m   ku̱vit tasmā̱ asa̍ti no̱ bharā̍ya̱ na suṣvi̱m indro 'va̍se mṛdhāti
English: friends when thejuices flow replenish duly your own your bounteous indra with the soma  will it not aid him to support us? indra spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour

Sanskrit: e̱ved indra̍ḥ su̱te a̍stāvi̱ some̍ bha̱radvā̍jeṣu̱ kṣaya̱d in ma̱ghona̍ḥ   asa̱d yathā̍ jari̱tra u̱ta sū̱rir indro̍ rā̱yo vi̱śvavā̍rasya dā̱tā
English: while soma flowed thus indra hath been lauded ruler of nobles mid the bharadvājas  that indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure

Sanskrit: ya eka̱ id dhavya̍ś carṣaṇī̱nām indra̱ṁ taṁ gī̱rbhir a̱bhy a̍rca ā̱bhiḥ   yaḥ patya̍te vṛṣa̱bho vṛṣṇyā̍vān sa̱tyaḥ satvā̍ purumā̱yaḥ saha̍svān
English: with these my hymns i glorify that indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals  the lord the mighty one of manly vigour victorious hero true and full of wisdom

Sanskrit: tam u̍ na̱ḥ pūrve̍ pi̱taro̱ nava̍gvāḥ sa̱pta viprā̍so a̱bhi vā̱jaya̍ntaḥ   na̱kṣa̱ddā̱bhaṁ tatu̍rim parvate̱ṣṭhām adro̍ghavācam ma̱tibhi̱ḥ śavi̍ṣṭham
English: our sires of old navagvas sages seven while urging him to show his might extolled him  dwelling on heights swift smiting down opponents guileless in word and in his thoughts most mighty

Sanskrit: tam ī̍maha̱ indra̍m asya rā̱yaḥ pu̍ru̱vīra̍sya nṛ̱vata̍ḥ puru̱kṣoḥ   yo askṛ̍dhoyur a̱jara̱ḥ sva̍rvā̱n tam ā bha̍ra harivo māda̱yadhyai̍
English: we seek that indra to obtain his riches that bring much food and men and store of heroes  bring us lord of bay steeds to make us joyful celestial wealth abundant undecaying

Sanskrit: tan no̱ vi vo̍co̱ yadi̍ te pu̱rā ci̍j jari̱tāra̍ āna̱śuḥ su̱mnam i̍ndra   kas te̍ bhā̱gaḥ kiṁ vayo̍ dudhra khidva̱ḥ puru̍hūta purūvaso 'sura̱ghnaḥ
English: tell thou us this if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune  what is thy share and portion strong subduer asuraslayer rich invoked of many?

Sanskrit: tam pṛ̱cchantī̱ vajra̍hastaṁ rathe̱ṣṭhām indra̱ṁ vepī̱ vakva̍rī̱ yasya̱ nū gīḥ   tu̱vi̱grā̱bhaṁ tu̍vikū̱rmiṁ ra̍bho̱dāṁ gā̱tum i̍ṣe̱ nakṣa̍te̱ tumra̱m accha̍
English: he who for carborne indra armed with thunder hath a hymn craving deeplypiercing fluent  who sends a song effectual firmlygrasping and strengthbestowing he comes near the mighty

Sanskrit: a̱yā ha̱ tyam mā̱yayā̍ vāvṛdhā̱nam ma̍no̱juvā̍ svatava̱ḥ parva̍tena   acyu̍tā cid vīḻi̱tā svo̍jo ru̱jo vi dṛ̱ḻhā dhṛ̍ṣa̱tā vi̍rapśin
English: strong of thyself thou by this art hast shattered with thoughtswift parvata him who waxed against thee  and mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken

Sanskrit: taṁ vo̍ dhi̱yā navya̍syā̱ śavi̍ṣṭham pra̱tnam pra̍tna̱vat pa̍ritaṁsa̱yadhyai̍   sa no̍ vakṣad animā̱naḥ su̱vahmendro̱ viśvā̱ny ati̍ du̱rgahā̍ṇi
English: him will we fit for you with new devotion the strongest ancient one in ancient manner  so may that indra boundless faithful leader conduct us oer all places hard to traverse

Sanskrit: ā janā̍ya̱ druhva̍ṇe̱ pārthi̍vāni di̱vyāni̍ dīpayo̱ 'ntari̍kṣā   tapā̍ vṛṣan vi̱śvata̍ḥ śo̱ciṣā̱ tān bra̍hma̱dviṣe̍ śocaya̱ kṣām a̱paś ca̍
English: thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven  with heat o bull on every side consume them heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion

Sanskrit: bhuvo̱ jana̍sya di̱vyasya̱ rājā̱ pārthi̍vasya̱ jaga̍tas tveṣasaṁdṛk   dhi̱ṣva vajra̱ṁ dakṣi̍ṇa indra̱ haste̱ viśvā̍ ajurya dayase̱ vi mā̱yāḥ
English: of all the heavenly folk of earthly creatures thou art the king o god of splendid aspect  in thy right hand o indra grasp die thunder eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments

Sanskrit: ā sa̱ṁyata̍m indra ṇaḥ sva̱stiṁ śa̍tru̱tūryā̍ya bṛha̱tīm amṛ̍dhrām   yayā̱ dāsā̱ny āryā̍ṇi vṛ̱trā karo̍ vajrin su̱tukā̱ nāhu̍ṣāṇi
English: give us confirmed prosperity o indra vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing  strengthen therewith the ārya's hate and dāsa's and let the arms of nahusas be mighty

Sanskrit: sa no̍ ni̱yudbhi̍ḥ puruhūta vedho vi̱śvavā̍rābhi̱r ā ga̍hi prayajyo   na yā ade̍vo̱ vara̍te̱ na de̱va ābhi̍r yāhi̱ tūya̱m ā ma̍drya̱drik
English: come with thy team which brings all blessings hither disposer muchinvoked exceeding holy  thou whom no fiend no god can stay or hinder come swittly with these steeds in my direction

Sanskrit: i̱mā u̍ tvā puru̱tama̍sya kā̱ror havya̍ṁ vīra̱ havyā̍ havante   dhiyo̍ rathe̱ṣṭhām a̱jara̱ṁ navī̍yo ra̱yir vibhū̍tir īyate vaca̱syā
English: these the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked o hero;  hymns call anew the chariotborne eternal by eloquence men gain abundant riches

Sanskrit: tam u̍ stuṣa̱ indra̱ṁ yo vidā̍no̱ girvā̍hasaṁ gī̱rbhir ya̱jñavṛ̍ddham   yasya̱ diva̱m ati̍ ma̱hnā pṛ̍thi̱vyāḥ pu̍rumā̱yasya̍ riri̱ce ma̍hi̱tvam
English: i praise that indra known to all men honoured with songs extolled with hymns at sacrifices  whose majesty rich in wondrous arts surpasseth the magnitude of earth and heaven in greatness

Sanskrit: sa it tamo̍ 'vayu̱naṁ ta̍ta̱nvat sūrye̍ṇa va̱yuna̍vac cakāra   ka̱dā te̱ martā̍ a̱mṛta̍sya̱ dhāmeya̍kṣanto̱ na mi̍nanti svadhāvaḥ
English: he hath made pathways with the sun to aid him throughout the darkness that extended pathless  mortals who yearn to worship neer dishonour o mighty god thy law who art immortal

Sanskrit: yas tā ca̱kāra̱ sa kuha̍ svi̱d indra̱ḥ kam ā jana̍ṁ carati̱ kāsu̍ vi̱kṣu   kas te̍ ya̱jño mana̍se̱ śaṁ varā̍ya̱ ko a̱rka i̍ndra kata̱maḥ sa hotā̍
English: and he who did these things where is that indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit?  what sacrifice contents thy mind  and wishes? what priest among them all? what hymn o indra?

Sanskrit: i̱dā hi te̱ vevi̍ṣataḥ purā̱jāḥ pra̱tnāsa̍ ā̱suḥ pu̍rukṛ̱t sakhā̍yaḥ   ye ma̍dhya̱māsa̍ u̱ta nūta̍nāsa u̱tāva̱masya̍ puruhūta bodhi
English: yea here were they who born of old have served thee thy friends of ancient time thou active worker  bethink thee now of these invoked of many! the midmost and the recent and the youngest

Sanskrit: tam pṛ̱cchanto 'va̍rāsa̱ḥ parā̍ṇi pra̱tnā ta̍ indra̱ śrutyānu̍ yemuḥ   arcā̍masi vīra brahmavāho̱ yād e̱va vi̱dma tāt tvā̍ ma̱hānta̍m
English: inquiring after him thy later servants indra have gained thy former old traditions  hero to whom the prayer is brought we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tvā̱ pājo̍ ra̱kṣaso̱ vi ta̍sthe̱ mahi̍ jajñā̱nam a̱bhi tat su ti̍ṣṭha   tava̍ pra̱tnena̱ yujye̍na̱ sakhyā̱ vajre̍ṇa dhṛṣṇo̱ apa̱ tā nu̍dasva
English: the demon's strength is gathered fast against thee great as that strength hath grown go forth to meet it  with thine own ancient friend and companion the thunderbolt brave champion! drive it backward

Sanskrit: sa tu śru̍dhīndra̱ nūta̍nasya brahmaṇya̱to vī̍ra kārudhāyaḥ   tvaṁ hy ā̱3̱̍piḥ pra̱divi̍ pitṝ̱ṇāṁ śaśva̍d ba̱bhūtha̍ su̱hava̱ eṣṭau̍
English: hear too the prayer of this thy present beadsman o indra hero cherishing the singer  for thou wast aye our fathers' friend aforetime still swift to listen to their supplication

Sanskrit: protaye̱ varu̍ṇam mi̱tram indra̍m ma̱ruta̍ḥ kṛ̱ṣvāva̍se no a̱dya   pra pū̱ṣaṇa̱ṁ viṣṇu̍m a̱gnim pura̍ṁdhiṁ savi̱tāra̱m oṣa̍dhī̱ḥ parva̍tām̐ś ca
English: bring to our help this day for our protection varuṇa mitra  indra and the maruts  pūṣan and viṣṇu agni and purandhi savitar also and the plants and mountains

Sanskrit: i̱ma u̍ tvā puruśāka prayajyo jari̱tāro̍ a̱bhy a̍rcanty a̱rkaiḥ   śru̱dhī hava̱m ā hu̍va̱to hu̍vā̱no na tvāvā̍m̐ a̱nyo a̍mṛta̱ tvad a̍sti
English: the singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very mighty and most holy  hear when invoked the invoker's invocation beside thee there is nonelike thee immortal!

Sanskrit: nū ma̱ ā vāca̱m upa̍ yāhi vi̱dvān viśve̍bhiḥ sūno sahaso̱ yaja̍traiḥ   ye a̍gniji̱hvā ṛ̍ta̱sāpa̍ ā̱sur ye manu̍ṁ ca̱krur upa̍ra̱ṁ dasā̍ya
English: now to my words come quickly thou who knowest o son of strength with all who claim our worship  who visit sacred rites whose tongue is agni gods who made manu stronger than the dasyu

Sanskrit: sa no̍ bodhi purae̱tā su̱geṣū̱ta du̱rgeṣu̍ pathi̱kṛd vidā̍naḥ   ye aśra̍māsa u̱ravo̱ vahi̍ṣṭhā̱s tebhi̍r na indrā̱bhi va̍kṣi̱ vāja̍m
English: on good and evil ways be thou our leader thou who art known to all as pathpreparer  bring power to us o indra with thy horses steeds that are best to draw broadbacked unwearied

Sanskrit: dyaur na ya i̍ndrā̱bhi bhūmā̱ryas ta̱sthau ra̱yiḥ śava̍sā pṛ̱tsu janā̍n   taṁ na̍ḥ sa̱hasra̍bharam urvarā̱sāṁ da̱ddhi sū̍no sahaso vṛtra̱tura̍m
English: give us wealth indra that with might as heaven oertops the earth oercomes our foes in battle  wealth that brings thousands and that wins the cornlands wealth son of strength! that vanquishes the foeman

Sanskrit: di̱vo na tubhya̱m anv i̍ndra sa̱trāsu̱rya̍ṁ de̱vebhi̍r dhāyi̱ viśva̍m   ahi̱ṁ yad vṛ̱tram a̱po va̍vri̱vāṁsa̱ṁ hann ṛ̍jīṣi̱n viṣṇu̍nā sacā̱naḥ
English: even as the power of dyaus to thee o indra all asura sway was by the gods entrusted  when thou impetuous! leagued with viṣṇu slewest vṛtra the dragon who enclosed the waters

Sanskrit: tūrva̱nn ojī̍yān ta̱vasa̱s tavī̍yān kṛ̱tabra̱hmendro̍ vṛ̱ddhama̍hāḥ   rājā̍bhava̱n madhu̍naḥ so̱myasya̱ viśvā̍sā̱ṁ yat pu̱rāṁ da̱rtnum āva̍t
English: indra strong victor mightier than the mighty addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour  lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces became the king of the sweet juice of soma

Sanskrit: śa̱tair a̍padran pa̱ṇaya̍ i̱ndrātra̱ daśo̍ṇaye ka̱vaye̱ 'rkasā̍tau   va̱dhaiḥ śuṣṇa̍syā̱śuṣa̍sya mā̱yāḥ pi̱tvo nāri̍recī̱t kiṁ ca̱na pra
English: there indra while the light was won the paṇis f1ed 'neath a hundred blows for wise dasoni  and greedy śuṣṇa's magical devices nor left he any of their food remaining

Sanskrit: ma̱ho dru̱ho apa̍ vi̱śvāyu̍ dhāyi̱ vajra̍sya̱ yat pata̍ne̱ pādi̱ śuṣṇa̍ḥ   u̱ru ṣa sa̱ratha̱ṁ sāra̍thaye ka̱r indra̱ḥ kutsā̍ya̱ sūrya̍sya sā̱tau
English: what time the thunder fell and śuṣṇa perished all life's support from the great druh was taken  indra made room for his cardrivcr kutsa who sate beside him when he gained the sunlight

Sanskrit: pra śye̱no na ma̍di̱ram a̱ṁśum a̍smai̱ śiro̍ dā̱sasya̱ namu̍cer mathā̱yan   prāva̱n namī̍ṁ sā̱pyaṁ sa̱santa̍m pṛ̱ṇag rā̱yā sam i̱ṣā saṁ sva̱sti
English: as the hawk rent for him the stalk that gladdens he wrenched the head from namuci the dāsa  he guarded nam sayya's son in slumber and sated him with food success and riches

Sanskrit: vi pipro̱r ahi̍māyasya dṛ̱ḻhāḥ puro̍ vajri̱ñ chava̍sā̱ na da̍rdaḥ   sudā̍ma̱n tad rekṇo̍ apramṛ̱ṣyam ṛ̱jiśva̍ne dā̱traṁ dā̱śuṣe̍ dāḥ
English: thou thunderarmed with thy great might hast shattered pipru's strong forts who knew the wiles of serpents  thou gavest to thy worshipper ṛjiśvan imperishable wealth o bounteous giver

Sanskrit: sa ve̍ta̱suṁ daśa̍māya̱ṁ daśo̍ṇi̱ṁ tūtu̍ji̱m indra̍ḥ svabhi̱ṣṭisu̍mnaḥ   ā tugra̱ṁ śaśva̱d ibha̱ṁ dyota̍nāya mā̱tur na sī̱m upa̍ sṛjā i̱yadhyai̍
English: the crafty vetasu the swift dasni and tugra speedily with all his servants  hath indra gladdening with strong assistance forced near as twere to glorify the mother

Sanskrit: sa ī̱ṁ spṛdho̍ vanate̱ apra̍tīto̱ bibhra̱d vajra̍ṁ vṛtra̱haṇa̱ṁ gabha̍stau   tiṣṭha̱d dharī̱ adhy aste̍va̱ garte̍ vaco̱yujā̍ vahata̱ indra̍m ṛ̱ṣvam
English: resistless with the hosts he battles bearing in both his arms the vṛtraslaying thunder  he mounts his bays as the carseat an archer yoked at a word they bear the lofty indra

Sanskrit: sa̱nema̱ te 'va̍sā̱ navya̍ indra̱ pra pū̱rava̍ḥ stavanta e̱nā ya̱jñaiḥ   sa̱pta yat pura̱ḥ śarma̱ śāra̍dī̱r dard dhan dāsī̍ḥ puru̱kutsā̍ya̱ śikṣa̍n
English: may we o indra gain by thy new favour so parus laud thee with their sacrifices  that thou hast wrecked seven autumn forts their shelter slain dāsa tribes and aided purukutsa

Sanskrit: tvaṁ vṛ̱dha i̍ndra pū̱rvyo bhū̍r variva̱syann u̱śane̍ kā̱vyāya̍   parā̱ nava̍vāstvam anu̱deya̍m ma̱he pi̱tre da̍dātha̱ svaṁ napā̍tam
English: favouring uśanā the son of kavi thou wast his ancient strengthener o indra  thou gavest navavāstva as a present to the great father gavest back his grandson

Sanskrit: tvaṁ dhuni̍r indra̱ dhuni̍matīr ṛ̱ṇor a̱paḥ sī̱rā na srava̍ntīḥ   pra yat sa̍mu̱dram ati̍ śūra̱ parṣi̍ pā̱rayā̍ tu̱rvaśa̱ṁ yadu̍ṁ sva̱sti
English: thou roaring indra drovest on the waters that made a roaring sound like rushing rivers  what time o hero oer the sea thou broughtest in safety broughtest turvaśa and yadu

Sanskrit: tava̍ ha̱ tyad i̍ndra̱ viśva̍m ā̱jau sa̱sto dhunī̱cumu̍rī̱ yā ha̱ siṣva̍p   dī̱daya̱d it tubhya̱ṁ some̍bhiḥ su̱nvan da̱bhīti̍r i̱dhmabhṛ̍tiḥ pa̱kthy a1̱̍rkaiḥ
English: this indra was thy work in war thou sentest dhuni and cumuri to sleep and slumber  dabhīti lit the flame for thee and worshipped with fuel hymns poured soma dressed oblations

Sanskrit: ma̱hām̐ indro̍ nṛ̱vad ā ca̍rṣaṇi̱prā u̱ta dvi̱barhā̍ ami̱naḥ saho̍bhiḥ   a̱sma̱drya̍g vāvṛdhe vī̱ryā̍yo̱ruḥ pṛ̱thuḥ sukṛ̍taḥ ka̱rtṛbhi̍r bhūt
English: great herolike controlling men is indra unwasting in his powers doubled in vastness  he turned to us hath grown to hero vigour broad wide he hath been decked by those who serve him

Sanskrit: indra̍m e̱va dhi̱ṣaṇā̍ sā̱taye̍ dhād bṛ̱hanta̍m ṛ̱ṣvam a̱jara̱ṁ yuvā̍nam   aṣā̍ḻhena̱ śava̍sā śūśu̱vāṁsa̍ṁ sa̱dyaś ci̱d yo vā̍vṛ̱dhe asā̍mi
English: the bowl made indra swift to gather booty the high the lofty youthful undecaying  him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer and even at once grown to complete perfection

Sanskrit: pṛ̱thū ka̱rasnā̍ bahu̱lā gabha̍stī asma̱drya1̱̍k sam mi̍mīhi̱ śravā̍ṁsi   yū̱theva̍ pa̱śvaḥ pa̍śu̱pā damū̍nā a̱smām̐ i̍ndrā̱bhy ā va̍vṛtsvā̱jau
English: stretch out those hands of thine extend to usward thy wide capacious arms and grant us glory  like as the household herdsman guards the cattle so move thou round about us in the combat

Sanskrit: taṁ va̱ indra̍ṁ ca̱tina̍m asya śā̱kair i̱ha nū̱naṁ vā̍ja̱yanto̍ huvema   yathā̍ ci̱t pūrve̍ jari̱tāra̍ ā̱sur ane̍dyā anava̱dyā ari̍ṣṭāḥ
English: now fain for strength let us invite your indra hither who lieth hidden with his heroes  free from all blame without reproach uninjured een as were those who sang of old his praises

Sanskrit: dhṛ̱tavra̍to dhana̱dāḥ soma̍vṛddha̱ḥ sa hi vā̱masya̱ vasu̍naḥ puru̱kṣuḥ   saṁ ja̍gmire pa̱thyā̱3̱̍ rāyo̍ asmin samu̱dre na sindha̍vo̱ yāda̍mānāḥ
English: with steadfast laws wealthgiver strong through soma he hath much fair and precious food to feed us  in him unite all paths that lead to riches like rivers that commingle with the ocean

Sanskrit: śavi̍ṣṭhaṁ na̱ ā bha̍ra śūra̱ śava̱ oji̍ṣṭha̱m ojo̍ abhibhūta u̱gram   viśvā̍ dyu̱mnā vṛṣṇyā̱ mānu̍ṣāṇām a̱smabhya̍ṁ dā harivo māda̱yadhyai̍
English: bring unto us the mightiest might o hero strong and most potent force thou great subduer!  all splendid vigorous powers of men vouchsafe us lord of bay steeds that they may make us joyful

Sanskrit: yas te̱ mada̍ḥ pṛtanā̱ṣāḻ amṛ̍dhra̱ indra̱ taṁ na̱ ā bha̍ra śūśu̱vāṁsa̍m   yena̍ to̱kasya̱ tana̍yasya sā̱tau ma̍ṁsī̱mahi̍ jigī̱vāṁsa̱s tvotā̍ḥ
English: bring us grown mighty in its strength o indra thy friendly rapturous joy that wins the battle  wherewith by thee assisted and triumphant we may laud thee in gaining seed and offspring

Sanskrit: ā no̍ bhara̱ vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ śuṣma̍m indra dhana̱spṛta̍ṁ śūśu̱vāṁsa̍ṁ su̱dakṣa̍m   yena̱ vaṁsā̍ma̱ pṛta̍nāsu̱ śatrū̱n tavo̱tibhi̍r u̱ta jā̱mīm̐r ajā̍mīn
English: indra bestow on us the power heroic skilled and exceeding strong that wins the booty  wherewith by thine assistance we may conquer our foes in battle be they kin or stranger

Sanskrit: ā te̱ śuṣmo̍ vṛṣa̱bha e̍tu pa̱ścād otta̱rād a̍dha̱rād ā pu̱rastā̍t   ā vi̱śvato̍ a̱bhi sam e̍tv a̱rvāṅ indra̍ dyu̱mnaṁ sva̍rvad dhehy a̱sme
English: let thine heroic strength come from behind us before us from above us or below us  from every side may it approach us indra give us the glory of the realm of splendour

Sanskrit: nṛ̱vat ta̍ indra̱ nṛta̍mābhir ū̱tī va̍ṁsī̱mahi̍ vā̱maṁ śroma̍tebhiḥ   īkṣe̱ hi vasva̍ u̱bhaya̍sya rāja̱n dhā ratna̱m mahi̍ sthū̱ram bṛ̱hanta̍m
English: with most heroic aid from thee like heroes indra may we win wealth by deeds glory  thou king art lord of earthly heavenly treasure vouchsafe us riches vast sublime and lasting

Sanskrit: ma̱rutva̍ntaṁ vṛṣa̱bhaṁ vā̍vṛdhā̱nam aka̍vāriṁ di̱vyaṁ śā̱sam indra̍m   vi̱śvā̱sāha̱m ava̍se̱ nūta̍nāyo̱graṁ sa̍ho̱dām i̱ha taṁ hu̍vema
English: the bull whose strength hath waxed whom maruts follow freegiving indra the celestial ruler  mighty allconquering the victorygiver him let us call to grant us new protection

English: thou art our guileless most delightful herald the god among mankind of holy synods  a priest with purifying tongue o agni sacrifice with thy mouth to thine own body

Sanskrit: dhanyā̍ ci̱d dhi tve dhi̱ṣaṇā̱ vaṣṭi̱ pra de̱vāñ janma̍ gṛṇa̱te yaja̍dhyai   vepi̍ṣṭho̱ aṅgi̍rasā̱ṁ yad dha̱ vipro̱ madhu̍ ccha̱ndo bhana̍ti re̱bha i̱ṣṭau
English: for even the blessed longing that is in thee would bring the gods down to the singer's worship  when the aṅgirases' sagest sage the poet sings the sweet measure at the solemn service

Sanskrit: adi̍dyuta̱t sv apā̍ko vi̱bhāvāgne̱ yaja̍sva̱ roda̍sī urū̱cī   ā̱yuṁ na yaṁ nama̍sā rā̱taha̍vyā a̱ñjanti̍ supra̱yasa̱m pañca̱ janā̍ḥ
English: bright hath he beamed the wise the farrefulgent worship the two widespreading worlds o agni  whom as the living one rich in oblations the five tribes bringing gifts adorn with homage

English: when i with reverence clip the grass for agni when the trimmed ladle fullof oil is lifted  firm on the seat of earth is based the altar eyelike the sacrifice is directed sunward

English: enrich us o thou priest of many aspects with the gods agni with thy fires enkindled  o son of strength clad in the robe of riches may we escape from woe as from  a prison

Sanskrit: pu̱ro vo̍ ma̱ndraṁ di̱vyaṁ su̍vṛ̱ktim pra̍ya̱ti ya̱jñe a̱gnim a̍dhva̱re da̍dhidhvam   pu̱ra u̱kthebhi̱ḥ sa hi no̍ vi̱bhāvā̍ svadhva̱rā ka̍rati jā̱tave̍dāḥ
English: install at sacrifice while the rite advances your pleasant heavenly agni meet for praises  with hymnsfor he illumines usinstall him he jātavedas makes our rites successful

Sanskrit: tam u̍ dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hota̱r agne̍ a̱gnibhi̱r manu̍ṣa idhā̱naḥ   stoma̱ṁ yam a̍smai ma̱mate̍va śū̱ṣaṁ ghṛ̱taṁ na śuci̍ ma̱taya̍ḥ pavante
English: hear this laud radiant priest of many aspects o agni with the fires of man enkindled  laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter strength to this man as twere for selfadvantage

Sanskrit: pī̱pāya̱ sa śrava̍sā̱ martye̍ṣu̱ yo a̱gnaye̍ da̱dāśa̱ vipra̍ u̱kthaiḥ   ci̱trābhi̱s tam ū̱tibhi̍ś ci̱traśo̍cir vra̱jasya̍ sā̱tā goma̍to dadhāti
English: mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to agni  and the god wondrous bright with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle

Sanskrit: ā yaḥ pa̱prau jāya̍māna u̱rvī dū̍re̱dṛśā̍ bhā̱sā kṛ̱ṣṇādhvā̍   adha̍ ba̱hu ci̱t tama̱ ūrmyā̍yās ti̱raḥ śo̱ciṣā̍ dadṛśe pāva̱kaḥ
English: he at his birth whose path is black behind him filled heaven and earth with farapparent splendour  and he himself hath been through night's thick darkness made manifest by light the purifier

Sanskrit: nū na̍ś ci̱tram pu̍ru̱vājā̍bhir ū̱tī agne̍ ra̱yim ma̱ghava̍dbhyaś ca dhehi   ye rādha̍sā̱ śrava̍sā̱ cāty a̱nyān su̱vīrye̍bhiś cā̱bhi santi̱ janā̍n
English: with thy most mighty aid confer o agni wonderful wealth on us and on our princes  who stand preeminent surpassing others in liberal gifts in fame and hero virtues

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ ya̱jñaṁ cano̍ dhā agna u̱śan yaṁ ta̍ āsā̱no ju̍hu̱te ha̱viṣmā̍n   bha̱radvā̍jeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛ̱ktim avī̱r vāja̍sya̱ gadhya̍sya sā̱tau
English: agni accept this sacrifice with gladness which seated here the worshipper presenteth  fair hymns hadst thou among the bharadvājas and holpest them to gain abundant vigour

Sanskrit: vi dveṣā̍ṁsīnu̱hi va̱rdhayeḻā̱m made̍ma śa̱tahi̍māḥ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: scatter our foes increase our store may we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons

Sanskrit: aha̍ś ca kṛ̱ṣṇam aha̱r arju̍naṁ ca̱ vi va̍rtete̱ raja̍sī ve̱dyābhi̍ḥ   vai̱śvā̱na̱ro jāya̍māno̱ na rājāvā̍tira̱j jyoti̍ṣā̱gnis tamā̍ṁsi
English: one half of day is dark and bright the other both atmospheres move on by sage devices  agni vaiśvānara when born as sovran hath with his lustre overcome the darkness

Sanskrit: nāhaṁ tantu̱ṁ na vi jā̍nā̱my otu̱ṁ na yaṁ vaya̍nti sama̱re 'ta̍mānāḥ   kasya̍ svit pu̱tra i̱ha vaktvā̍ni pa̱ro va̍dā̱ty ava̍reṇa pi̱trā
English: i know not either warp or woof i know not the web they weave when moving to the contest  whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the father near him?

Sanskrit: sa it tantu̱ṁ sa vi jā̍nā̱ty otu̱ṁ sa vaktvā̍ny ṛtu̱thā va̍dāti   ya ī̱ṁ cike̍tad a̱mṛta̍sya go̱pā a̱vaś cara̍n pa̱ro a̱nyena̱ paśya̍n
English: for both the warp and woof he understandeth and in due time shall speak what should be spoken  who knoweth as the immortal world's protector descending seeing with no aid from other

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ hotā̍ pratha̱maḥ paśya̍te̱mam i̱daṁ jyoti̍r a̱mṛta̱m martye̍ṣu   a̱yaṁ sa ja̍jñe dhru̱va ā niṣa̱tto 'ma̍rtyas ta̱nvā̱3̱̍ vardha̍mānaḥ
English: he is the priest the first of all behold him mid mortal men he is the light immortal  here was he born firmseated in his station immortal ever waxing in his body

Sanskrit: dhru̱vaṁ jyoti̱r nihi̍taṁ dṛ̱śaye̱ kam mano̱ javi̍ṣṭham pa̱taya̍tsv a̱ntaḥ   viśve̍ de̱vāḥ sama̍nasa̱ḥ sake̍tā̱ eka̱ṁ kratu̍m a̱bhi vi ya̍nti sā̱dhu
English: a firm light hath been set for men to look on among all things that fly the mind is swiftest  all gods of one accord with one intention move unobstructed to a single purpose

Sanskrit: vi me̱ karṇā̍ patayato̱ vi cakṣu̱r vī̱3̱̍daṁ jyoti̱r hṛda̍ya̱ āhi̍ta̱ṁ yat   vi me̱ mana̍ś carati dū̱raā̍dhī̱ḥ kiṁ svi̍d va̱kṣyāmi̱ kim u̱ nū ma̍niṣye
English: mine ears unclose to hear mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens  far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance what shall i speak what shall i now imagine?

Sanskrit: viśve̍ de̱vā a̍namasyan bhiyā̱nās tvām a̍gne̱ tama̍si tasthi̱vāṁsa̍m   vai̱śvā̱na̱ro̍ 'vatū̱taye̱ no 'ma̍rtyo 'vatū̱taye̍ naḥ
English: all the gods bowed them down in fear before thee agni when thou wast dwelling in the darkness  vaiśvānara be gracious to assist us may the immortal favour us and help us

Sanskrit: pṛ̱kṣasya̱ vṛṣṇo̍ aru̱ṣasya̱ nū saha̱ḥ pra nu vo̍caṁ vi̱dathā̍ jā̱tave̍dasaḥ   vai̱śvā̱na̱rāya̍ ma̱tir navya̍sī̱ śuci̱ḥ soma̍ iva pavate̱ cāru̍r a̱gnaye̍
English: at jātavedas' holy gathering i will tell aloud the conquering might of the swift redhued steer  a pure and fresher hymn flows to vaiśvānara even as for agni lovely soma is made pure

English: that agni when in loftiest heaven he sprang to life guardian of holy laws kept and observed them well  exceeding wise he measured out the firmament vaiśvānara attained to heaven by mightiness

Sanskrit: vy a̍stabhnā̱d roda̍sī mi̱tro adbhu̍to 'nta̱rvāva̍d akṛṇo̱j jyoti̍ṣā̱ tama̍ḥ   vi carma̍ṇīva dhi̱ṣaṇe̍ avartayad vaiśvāna̱ro viśva̍m adhatta̱ vṛṣṇya̍m
English: wonderful mitra propped the heaven and earth apart and covered and concealed  the darkness with his light  he made the two bowls part asunder like two skins vaiśvānara put forth all his creative power

English: in every age bestow upon the singers wealth worthy of holy synods glorious ever new  king undecaying as it were with sharpened bolt smite down the sinner like a tree with lightningflash

English: do thou bestow o agni on our wealthy chiefs rule with good heroes undecaying bending not  so may we win for us strength o vaiśvānara hundredfold thousandfold o agni by thy help

English: o thou who dwellest in three places helper keep with effective guards our princely patrons  keep our band agni who have brought thee presents lengthen their lives vaiśvānara when lauded

English: from thee o agni springs the mighty singer from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman  o king vaiśvānara bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r

English: agni vaiśvānara no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances  when thou arising from thy parents' bosom foundest the light for days' appointed courses

English: the summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the immortal's light vaiśvānara's brilliancy  all creatures in existence rest upon his head the seven swiftflowing streams have grown like branches forth

English: vaiśvānara who measured out the realms of air sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven  the undeceivable who spread out all the worlds keeper is he and guard of immortality

English: he who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the son of strength with newest worship  calling the heavenly priest to share the banquet who rends the wood bright with his blackened pathway

English: whitehued and thundering he dwells in splendour most youthful with the loudvoiced and eternal  agni most variform the purifier who follows crunching many ample forests

English: incited by the wind thy flames o agni move onward pure one! pure in all directions  thy most destructive heavenly navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly

Sanskrit: ye te̍ śu̱krāsa̱ḥ śuca̍yaḥ śuciṣma̱ḥ kṣāṁ vapa̍nti̱ viṣi̍tāso̱ aśvā̍ḥ   adha̍ bhra̱mas ta̍ urvi̱yā vi bhā̍ti yā̱taya̍māno̱ adhi̱ sānu̱ pṛśne̍ḥ
English: thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened o radiant one they shear the ground beneath them  and far and wide shines out thy flame and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges

Sanskrit: adha̍ ji̱hvā pā̍patīti̱ pra vṛṣṇo̍ goṣu̱yudho̱ nāśani̍ḥ sṛjā̱nā   śūra̍syeva̱ prasi̍tiḥ kṣā̱tir a̱gner du̱rvartu̍r bhī̱mo da̍yate̱ vanā̍ni
English: forth darts the bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle  agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset dread and resistless he destroys the forests

Sanskrit: ā bhā̱nunā̱ pārthi̍vāni̱ jrayā̍ṁsi ma̱has to̱dasya̍ dhṛṣa̱tā ta̍tantha   sa bā̍dha̱svāpa̍ bha̱yā saho̍bhi̱ḥ spṛdho̍ vanu̱ṣyan va̱nuṣo̱ ni jū̍rva
English: thou with the sunlight of the great impeller hast boldly overspread the earth's expanses  so drive away with conquering might all perils fighting out foemen burn up those who harm us

Sanskrit: sa ci̍tra ci̱traṁ ci̱taya̍ntam a̱sme citra̍kṣatra ci̱trata̍maṁ vayo̱dhām   ca̱ndraṁ ra̱yim pu̍ru̱vīra̍m bṛ̱hanta̱ṁ candra̍ ca̱ndrābhi̍r gṛṇa̱te yu̍vasva
English: wondrous! of wondrous power! give to the singer wealth wondrous marked most wonderful lifegiving  wealth bright o bright one vast with many heroes give with thy bright flames to the man who lauds thee

Sanskrit: hu̱ve va̍ḥ sū̱nuṁ saha̍so̱ yuvā̍na̱m adro̍ghavācam ma̱tibhi̱r yavi̍ṣṭham   ya inva̍ti̱ dravi̍ṇāni̱ prace̍tā vi̱śvavā̍rāṇi puru̱vāro̍ a̱dhruk
English: i invocate your son of strength the youthful with hymns the youngest god whose speech is guileless;  sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure bringer of many boons devoid of malice

Sanskrit: tve vasū̍ni purvaṇīka hotar do̱ṣā vasto̱r eri̍re ya̱jñiyā̍saḥ   kṣāme̍va̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ yasmi̱n saṁ saubha̍gāni dadhi̱re pā̍va̱ke
English: at eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts o priest of many aspects  on whom the purifier all things living as on firm ground their happiness have stablished

Sanskrit: tvaṁ vi̱kṣu pra̱diva̍ḥ sīda ā̱su kratvā̍ ra̱thīr a̍bhavo̱ vāryā̍ṇām   ata̍ inoṣi vidha̱te ci̍kitvo̱ vy ā̍nu̱ṣag jā̍tavedo̱ vasū̍ni
English: thou from of old hast dwelt among these people by mental power the charioteer of blessings  hence sendest thou o sapient jātavedas to him who serves thee treasures in succession

Sanskrit: yo na̱ḥ sanu̍tyo abhi̱dāsa̍d agne̱ yo anta̍ro mitramaho vanu̱ṣyāt   tam a̱jare̍bhi̱r vṛṣa̍bhi̱s tava̱ svais tapā̍ tapiṣṭha̱ tapa̍sā̱ tapa̍svān
English: agni whoever secretly attacks us the neighbour thou with mitra's might! who harms us  burn him with thine own steers for ever youthful burning with burning heat thou fiercest burner

Sanskrit: yas te̍ ya̱jñena̍ sa̱midhā̱ ya u̱kthair a̱rkebhi̍ḥ sūno sahaso̱ dadā̍śat   sa martye̍ṣv amṛta̱ prace̍tā rā̱yā dyu̱mnena̱ śrava̍sā̱ vi bhā̍ti
English: he who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel with hymn o son of strength and chanted praises  shines out immortal! in the midst of mortals a sage with wealth with splendour and with glory

Sanskrit: sa tat kṛ̍dhīṣi̱tas tūya̍m agne̱ spṛdho̍ bādhasva̱ saha̍sā̱ saha̍svān   yac cha̱syase̱ dyubhi̍r a̱kto vaco̍bhi̱s taj ju̍ṣasva jari̱tur ghoṣi̱ manma̍
English: do this o agni when we urge thee quickly triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen  when thou art praised with words and decked with brightness accept this chanted hymn the singer's worship

Sanskrit: a̱śyāma̱ taṁ kāma̍m agne̱ tavo̱tī a̱śyāma̍ ra̱yiṁ ra̍yivaḥ su̱vīra̍m   a̱śyāma̱ vāja̍m a̱bhi vā̱jaya̍nto̱ 'śyāma̍ dyu̱mnam a̍jarā̱jara̍ṁ te
English: help us that we may gain this wish o agni gain riches wealthy one! with store of heroes  desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened and win eternal! thine eternal glory

Sanskrit: yathā̍ hota̱r manu̍ṣo de̱vatā̍tā ya̱jñebhi̍ḥ sūno sahaso̱ yajā̍si   e̱vā no̍ a̱dya sa̍ma̱nā sa̍mā̱nān u̱śann a̍gna uśa̱to ya̍kṣi de̱vān
English: as at man's service of the gods invoker thou son of strength dost sacrifice and worship  so bring for us today all gods together bring willingly the willing gods o agni

Sanskrit: sa no̍ vi̱bhāvā̍ ca̱kṣaṇi̱r na vasto̍r a̱gnir va̱ndāru̱ vedya̱ś cano̍ dhāt   vi̱śvāyu̱r yo a̱mṛto̱ martye̍ṣūṣa̱rbhud bhūd ati̍thir jā̱tave̍dāḥ
English: may agni radiant herald of the morning meet to be known accept our praise with favour  dear to all life mid mortal men immortal our guest awake at dawn is jātavedas

Sanskrit: dyāvo̱ na yasya̍ pa̱naya̱nty abhva̱m bhāsā̍ṁsi vaste̱ sūryo̱ na śu̱kraḥ   vi ya i̱noty a̱jara̍ḥ pāva̱ko 'śna̍sya cic chiśnathat pū̱rvyāṇi̍
English: whose might the very heavens regard with wonder bright as the sun he clothes himself with lustre  he who sends forth eternal purifier hath shattered een the ancient works of aśna

Sanskrit: va̱dmā hi sū̍no̱ asy a̍dma̱sadvā̍ ca̱kre a̱gnir ja̱nuṣājmānna̍m   sa tvaṁ na̍ ūrjasana̱ ūrja̍ṁ dhā̱ rāje̍va jer avṛ̱ke kṣe̍ṣy a̱ntaḥ
English: thou art a singer son! our feastcompanion agni at birth prepared his food and pathway  therefore vouchsafe us strength o strengthbestower win like a king foes trouble not thy dwelling

Sanskrit: niti̍kti̱ yo vā̍ra̱ṇam anna̱m atti̍ vā̱yur na rāṣṭry aty e̍ty a̱ktūn   tu̱ryāma̱ yas ta̍ ā̱diśā̱m arā̍tī̱r atyo̱ na hruta̱ḥ pata̍taḥ pari̱hrut
English: even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftnessand overtakes the nights as vāyu kingdoms  may we oercome those who resist thine orders like a steed casting down the flying foemen

Sanskrit: ā sūryo̱ na bhā̍nu̱madbhi̍r a̱rkair agne̍ ta̱tantha̱ roda̍sī̱ vi bhā̱sā   ci̱tro na̍ya̱t pari̱ tamā̍ṁsy a̱ktaḥ śo̱ciṣā̱ patma̍nn auśi̱jo na dīya̍n
English: like sūrya with his fulgent rays o agni thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour  decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness like auśija with clear flame swifily flying

Sanskrit: tvāṁ hi ma̱ndrata̍mam arkaśo̱kair va̍vṛ̱mahe̱ mahi̍ na̱ḥ śroṣy a̍gne   indra̱ṁ na tvā̱ śava̍sā de̱vatā̍ vā̱yum pṛ̍ṇanti̱ rādha̍sā̱ nṛta̍māḥ
English: we have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams' glow hear our great laud o agni  the best men praise thee as the peer of indra in strength mid gods like viyu in thy bounty

Sanskrit: nū no̍ agne 'vṛ̱kebhi̍ḥ sva̱sti veṣi̍ rā̱yaḥ pa̱thibhi̱ḥ parṣy aṁha̍ḥ   tā sū̱ribhyo̍ gṛṇa̱te rā̍si su̱mnam made̍ma śa̱tahi̍māḥ su̱vīrā̍ḥ
English: now agni on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal save us from sorrow  grant chiefs and bard this boon may we live happy with hero children through a hundred winters

Sanskrit: agne̱ sa kṣe̍ṣad ṛta̱pā ṛ̍te̱jā u̱ru jyoti̍r naśate deva̱yuṣ ṭe̍   yaṁ tvam mi̱treṇa̱ varu̍ṇaḥ sa̱joṣā̱ deva̱ pāsi̱ tyaja̍sā̱ marta̱m aṁha̍ḥ
English: true guardian of the law thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace o agni  whom thou as varuṇa in accord with mitra guardest o god by banishing his trouble

Sanskrit: ī̱je ya̱jñebhi̍ḥ śaśa̱me śamī̍bhir ṛ̱dhadvā̍rāyā̱gnaye̍ dadāśa   e̱vā ca̱na taṁ ya̱śasā̱m aju̍ṣṭi̱r nāṁho̱ marta̍ṁ naśate̱ na pradṛ̍ptiḥ
English: he hath paid sacrifices toiled in worship and offered gifts to wealthincreasing agni  him the displeasure of the famous moves not outrage and scorn affect not such a mortal

Sanskrit: sūro̱ na yasya̍ dṛśa̱tir a̍re̱pā bhī̱mā yad eti̍ śuca̱tas ta̱ ā dhīḥ   heṣa̍svataḥ śu̱rudho̱ nāyam a̱ktoḥ kutrā̍ cid ra̱ṇvo va̍sa̱tir va̍ne̱jāḥ
English: bright god whose look is free from stain like sūrya's thou swift what time thou earnestly desirest  hast gear to give us come with joy at evening where child of wood thou mayest also tarry

Sanskrit: ti̱gmaṁ ci̱d ema̱ mahi̱ varpo̍ asya̱ bhasa̱d aśvo̱ na ya̍masā̱na ā̱sā   vi̱jeha̍mānaḥ para̱śur na ji̱hvāṁ dra̱vir na drā̍vayati̱ dāru̱ dhakṣa̍t
English: fierce is his gait and vast his wondrous body he champeth like a horse with bit and bridle  and darting forth his tongue as twere a hatchet burning the woods smelteth them like a smelter

Sanskrit: sa id aste̍va̱ prati̍ dhād asi̱ṣyañ chiśī̍ta̱ tejo 'ya̍so̱ na dhārā̍m   ci̱tradhra̍jatir ara̱tir yo a̱ktor ver na dru̱ṣadvā̍ raghu̱patma̍jaṁhāḥ
English: archerlike fain toshoot he sets his arrow and whets his splendour like the edge of iron  the messenger of night with brilliant pathway like a treeroosting bird of rapid pinion

Sanskrit: sa ī̍ṁ re̱bho na prati̍ vasta u̱srāḥ śo̱ciṣā̍ rārapīti mi̱trama̍hāḥ   nakta̱ṁ ya ī̍m aru̱ṣo yo divā̱ nṝn ama̍rtyo aru̱ṣo yo divā̱ nṝn
English: in beams of morn he clothes him like the singer and bright as mitra with his splendour crackles  red in the night by day the men's possession red he belongs to men by day immortal

Sanskrit: di̱vo na yasya̍ vidha̱to navī̍no̱d vṛṣā̍ ru̱kṣa oṣa̍dhīṣu nūnot   ghṛṇā̱ na yo dhraja̍sā̱ patma̍nā̱ yann ā roda̍sī̱ vasu̍nā̱ daṁ su̱patnī̍
English: like heaven's when scattering beams his voice was uttered among the plants the radiant hero shouted  who with his glow in rapid course came hither to fill both worlds wellwedded dames with treasure

Sanskrit: dhāyo̍bhir vā̱ yo yujye̍bhir a̱rkair vi̱dyun na da̍vidyo̱t svebhi̱ḥ śuṣmai̍ḥ   śardho̍ vā̱ yo ma̱rutā̍ṁ ta̱takṣa̍ ṛ̱bhur na tve̱ṣo ra̍bhasā̱no a̍dyaut
English: who with supporting streams and rays that suit him hath flashed like lightning with his native vigour  like the deft maker of the band of maruts the bright impetuous one hath shone refulgent

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hi kṣaita̍va̱d yaśo 'gne̍ mi̱tro na patya̍se   tvaṁ vi̍carṣaṇe̱ śravo̱ vaso̍ pu̱ṣṭiṁ na pu̍ṣyasi
English: thou agni even as mitra hast a princely glory of thine own  thou active vasu makest fame increase like full prosperity

Sanskrit: tvāṁ hi ṣmā̍ carṣa̱ṇayo̍ ya̱jñebhi̍r gī̱rbhir īḻa̍te   tvāṁ vā̱jī yā̍ty avṛ̱ko ra̍ja̱stūr vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇiḥ
English: for verily men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs  to thee the friendly courser seen of all comes speeding through the air

Sanskrit: sa̱joṣa̍s tvā di̱vo naro̍ ya̱jñasya̍ ke̱tum i̍ndhate   yad dha̱ sya mānu̍ṣo̱ jana̍ḥ sumnā̱yur ju̱hve a̍dhva̱re
English: of one accord men kindle thee heaven's signal of the sacrifice  when craving bliss this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite

Sanskrit: ṛdha̱d yas te̍ su̱dāna̍ve dhi̱yā marta̍ḥ śa̱śama̍te   ū̱tī ṣa bṛ̍ha̱to di̱vo dvi̱ṣo aṁho̱ na ta̍rati
English: let the man thrive who travails sore in prayer far thee the bountiful  he with the help of lofty dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity

Sanskrit: sa̱midhā̱ yas ta̱ āhu̍ti̱ṁ niśi̍ti̱m martyo̱ naśa̍t   va̱yāva̍nta̱ṁ sa pu̍ṣyati̱ kṣaya̍m agne śa̱tāyu̍ṣam
English: the mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee  supports a house with many a branch agni to live a hundred years

Sanskrit: tve̱ṣas te̍ dhū̱ma ṛ̍ṇvati di̱vi ṣañ chu̱kra āta̍taḥ   sūro̱ na hi dyu̱tā tvaṁ kṛ̱pā pā̍vaka̱ roca̍se
English: thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft and farextended shines in heaven  for purifier! like the sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow

Sanskrit: adhā̱ hi vi̱kṣv īḍyo 'si̍ pri̱yo no̱ ati̍thiḥ   ra̱ṇvaḥ pu̱rī̍va̱ jūrya̍ḥ sū̱nur na tra̍ya̱yāyya̍ḥ
English: for in men's houses thou must be glorified as a wellloved guest  gay like an elder in a fort claiming protection like a son

Sanskrit: kratvā̱ hi droṇe̍ a̱jyase 'gne̍ vā̱jī na kṛtvya̍ḥ   pari̍jmeva sva̱dhā gayo 'tyo̱ na hvā̱ryaḥ śiśu̍ḥ
English: thou agni like an able steed art urged by wisdom in the wood  thou art like wind; food home art thou like a young horse that runs astray

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tyā ci̱d acyu̱tāgne̍ pa̱śur na yava̍se   dhāmā̍ ha̱ yat te̍ ajara̱ vanā̍ vṛ̱ścanti̱ śikva̍saḥ
English: een things imperishable thou o agni like a gazing ox  eatest when hosts eternal one! of thee the mighty rend the woods

Sanskrit: veṣi̱ hy a̍dhvarīya̱tām agne̱ hotā̱ dame̍ vi̱śām   sa̱mṛdho̍ viśpate kṛṇu ju̱ṣasva̍ ha̱vyam a̍ṅgiraḥ
English: agni thou enterest as priest the home of men who sacrifice  lord of the people prosper them accept the ofrering aṅgiras!

Sanskrit: acchā̍ no mitramaho deva de̱vān agne̱ voca̍ḥ suma̱tiṁ roda̍syoḥ   vī̱hi sva̱stiṁ su̍kṣi̱tiṁ di̱vo nṝn dvi̱ṣo aṁhā̍ṁsi duri̱tā ta̍rema̱ tā ta̍rema̱ tavāva̍sā tarema
English: o agni god with mitra's might call hither the favour of the gods from earth and heaven  bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely may we oercome the foe's malign oppressions may we oercome them through thy help oercome them

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hy a̍gne pratha̱mo ma̱notā̱syā dhi̱yo abha̍vo dasma̱ hotā̍   tvaṁ sī̍ṁ vṛṣann akṛṇor du̱ṣṭarī̍tu̱ saho̱ viśva̍smai̱ saha̍se̱ saha̍dhyai
English: thou first inventor of this prayer o agni worker of marvels hast become our herald  thou bull hast made us strength which none may conquer strength that shall overcome all other prowess

Sanskrit: adhā̱ hotā̱ ny a̍sīdo̱ yajī̍yān i̱ḻas pa̱da i̱ṣaya̱nn īḍya̱ḥ san   taṁ tvā̱ nara̍ḥ pratha̱maṁ de̍va̱yanto̍ ma̱ho rā̱ye ci̱taya̍nto̱ anu̍ gman
English: as priest thou sattest at the seat of worship furthering us best offerer meet for honour  so first to thee have pious men resorted turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches

Sanskrit: vṛ̱teva̱ yanta̍m ba̱hubhi̍r vasa̱vyai̱3̱̍s tve ra̱yiṁ jā̍gṛ̱vāṁso̱ anu̍ gman   ruśa̍ntam a̱gniṁ da̍rśa̱tam bṛ̱hanta̍ṁ va̱pāva̍ntaṁ vi̱śvahā̍ dīdi̱vāṁsa̍m
English: in thee still watching they have followed riches who goest with much wealth as with an army  the radiant agni lofty fair to look on worshipped with marrow evermore resplendent

Sanskrit: pa̱daṁ de̱vasya̱ nama̍sā̱ vyanta̍ḥ śrava̱syava̱ḥ śrava̍ āpa̱nn amṛ̍ktam   nāmā̍ni cid dadhire ya̱jñiyā̍ni bha̱drāyā̍ṁ te raṇayanta̱ saṁdṛ̍ṣṭau
English: they who approached the god's abode with homage eager for glory won them perfect glory  yea they gained even sacrificial titles and found delight in thine auspicious aspect

Sanskrit: tvāṁ va̍rdhanti kṣi̱taya̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyāṁ tvāṁ rāya̍ u̱bhayā̍so̱ janā̍nām   tvaṁ trā̱tā ta̍raṇe̱ cetyo̍ bhūḥ pi̱tā mā̱tā sada̱m in mānu̍ṣāṇām
English: on earth the people magnify thee greatly thee their celestial and terrestrial riches  thou helper must be known as our preserver father and mother of mankind for ever

Sanskrit: sa̱pa̱ryeṇya̱ḥ sa pri̱yo vi̱kṣv a1̱̍gnir hotā̍ ma̱ndro ni ṣa̍sādā̱ yajī̍yān   taṁ tvā̍ va̱yaṁ dama̱ ā dī̍di̱vāṁsa̱m upa̍ jñu̱bādho̱ nama̍sā sadema
English: dear priest among mankind adorable agni hath seated him joygiver skilled in worship  let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling kneeling upon our knees with adoration

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̍ va̱yaṁ su̱dhyo̱3̱̍ navya̍m agne sumnā̱yava̍ īmahe deva̱yanta̍ḥ   tvaṁ viśo̍ anayo̱ dīdyā̍no di̱vo a̍gne bṛha̱tā ro̍ca̱nena̍
English: longing for bliss pureminded goddevoted agni we seek thee such meet to be lauded  thou agni leddest forth our men to battle refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour

Sanskrit: vi̱śāṁ ka̱viṁ vi̱śpati̱ṁ śaśva̍tīnāṁ ni̱tośa̍naṁ vṛṣa̱bhaṁ ca̍rṣaṇī̱nām   pretī̍ṣaṇim i̱ṣaya̍ntam pāva̱kaṁ rāja̍ntam a̱gniṁ ya̍ja̱taṁ ra̍yī̱ṇām
English: sage of mankind all peoples' lord and master the bull of men the sender down of blessings  still pressing on promoting purifying agni the holy one the lord of riches

Sanskrit: so a̍gna īje śaśa̱me ca̱ marto̱ yas ta̱ āna̍ṭ sa̱midhā̍ ha̱vyadā̍tim   ya āhu̍ti̱m pari̱ vedā̱ namo̍bhi̱r viśvet sa vā̱mā da̍dhate̱ tvota̍ḥ
English: agni the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel  and well knows sacrifice with adoration gains every joy with thee to guard and help him

Sanskrit: a̱smā u̍ te̱ mahi̍ ma̱he vi̍dhema̱ namo̍bhir agne sa̱midho̱ta ha̱vyaiḥ   vedī̍ sūno sahaso gī̱rbhir u̱kthair ā te̍ bha̱drāyā̍ṁ suma̱tau ya̍tema
English: mightily let us worship thee the mighty with reverence agni! fuel and oblations  with songs o son of strength with hymns with altar so may we strive for thine auspicious favour

Sanskrit: ā yas ta̱tantha̱ roda̍sī̱ vi bhā̱sā śravo̍bhiś ca śrava̱sya1̱̍s taru̍traḥ   bṛ̱hadbhi̱r vājai̱ḥ sthavi̍rebhir a̱sme re̱vadbhi̍r agne vita̱raṁ vi bhā̍hi
English: thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories glorious and triumphant  continue thou to shine on us o agni with strength abundant rich and long enduring

Sanskrit: nṛ̱vad va̍so̱ sada̱m id dhe̍hy a̱sme bhūri̍ to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya pa̱śvaḥ   pū̱rvīr iṣo̍ bṛha̱tīr ā̱rea̍ghā a̱sme bha̱drā sau̍śrava̱sāni̍ santu
English: vouchsafe us ever as man needs o vasu abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring  food noble plenteous far from sin and evil he with us and fair fame to make us happy

Sanskrit: pu̱rūṇy a̍gne puru̱dhā tvā̱yā vasū̍ni rājan va̱sutā̍ te aśyām   pu̱rūṇi̱ hi tve pu̍ruvāra̱ santy agne̱ vasu̍ vidha̱te rāja̍ni̱ tve
English: may i obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace king agni;  for in thee bounteous one in thee the sovran agni are many boons for him who serves thee

Sanskrit: e̱nā vo̍ a̱gniṁ nama̍so̱rjo napā̍ta̱m ā hu̍ve   pri̱yaṁ ceti̍ṣṭham ara̱tiṁ sva̍dhva̱raṁ viśva̍sya dū̱tam a̱mṛta̍m
English: with this my reverent hymn i call agni for you the son of strength  dear wisest envoy served with noble sacrifice immortal messenger of all

Sanskrit: sa yo̍jate aru̱ṣā vi̱śvabho̍jasā̱ sa du̍drava̱t svā̍hutaḥ   su̱brahmā̍ ya̱jñaḥ su̱śamī̱ vasū̍nāṁ de̱vaṁ rādho̱ janā̍nām
English: his two red horses allsupporting let him yoke let him wellworshipped urge them fast  then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end and heavenly gift of wealth to men

Sanskrit: ud a̍sya śo̱cir a̍sthād ā̱juhvā̍nasya mī̱ḻhuṣa̍ḥ   ud dhū̱māso̍ aru̱ṣāso̍ divi̱spṛśa̱ḥ sam a̱gnim i̍ndhate̱ nara̍ḥ
English: the flame of him the bountiful the muchinvoked hath mounted up  and his redcoloured smokeclouds reach and touch the sky the men are kindling agni well

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̍ dū̱taṁ kṛ̍ṇmahe ya̱śasta̍maṁ de̱vām̐ ā vī̱taye̍ vaha   viśvā̍ sūno sahaso marta̱bhoja̍nā̱ rāsva̱ tad yat tvema̍he
English: thee thee most glorious one we make our messenger bring the gods hither to the feast  give us o son of strength all food that fcedeth man give that for which we pray to thee

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne gṛ̱hapa̍ti̱s tvaṁ hotā̍ no adhva̱re   tvam potā̍ viśvavāra̱ prace̍tā̱ yakṣi̱ veṣi̍ ca̱ vārya̍m
English: thou agni art the homestead's lord our herald at the sacrifice  lord of all boons thou art the cleanser and a sage pay worship and enjoy the good

Sanskrit: kṛ̱dhi ratna̱ṁ yaja̍mānāya sukrato̱ tvaṁ hi ra̍tna̱dhā asi̍   ā na̍ ṛ̱te śi̍śīhi̱ viśva̍m ṛ̱tvija̍ṁ su̱śaṁso̱ yaś ca̱ dakṣa̍te
English: give riches to the sacrificer o most wise for thou art he who granteth wealth  inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite; all who are skilled in singing praise

Sanskrit: tve a̍gne svāhuta pri̱yāsa̍ḥ santu sū̱raya̍ḥ   ya̱ntāro̱ ye ma̱ghavā̍no̱ janā̍nām ū̱rvān daya̍nta̱ gonā̍m
English: o agni who art worshipped well dear let our princes he to thee  our wealthy patrons who are governors of men who part as gifts their stalls of kine

Sanskrit: yeṣā̱m iḻā̍ ghṛ̱taha̍stā duro̱ṇa ām̐ api̍ prā̱tā ni̱ṣīda̍ti   tām̐s trā̍yasva sahasya dru̱ho ni̱do yacchā̍ na̱ḥ śarma̍ dīrgha̱śrut
English: they in whose home her hand bearing the sacred oil iḷā sits down wellsatisfied  guard them victorious god from slander and from harm give us a refuge famed afar

Sanskrit: sa ma̱ndrayā̍ ca ji̱hvayā̱ vahni̍r ā̱sā vi̱duṣṭa̍raḥ   agne̍ ra̱yim ma̱ghava̍dbhyo na̱ ā va̍ha ha̱vyadā̍tiṁ ca sūdaya
English: do thou a priest with pleasant tongue most wise and very near to us  agni bring riches hither to our liberal chiefs and speed the oflering of our gifts

Sanskrit: ye rādhā̍ṁsi̱ dada̱ty aśvyā̍ ma̱ghā kāme̍na̱ śrava̍so ma̱haḥ   tām̐ aṁha̍saḥ pipṛhi pa̱rtṛbhi̱ṣ ṭvaṁ śa̱tam pū̱rbhir ya̍viṣṭhya
English: they who bestow as bounty plenteous wealth of steeds moved by desire of great renown  do thou with saving help preserve them from distress most youthful! with a hundred forts

Sanskrit: de̱vo vo̍ draviṇo̱dāḥ pū̱rṇāṁ vi̍vaṣṭy ā̱sica̍m   ud vā̍ si̱ñcadhva̱m upa̍ vā pṛṇadhva̱m ād id vo̍ de̱va o̍hate
English: the god who gives your wealth demands a full libation poured to him  pour ye it forth then fill the vessel full again then doth the god pay heed to you

Sanskrit: taṁ hotā̍ram adhva̱rasya̱ prace̍tasa̱ṁ vahni̍ṁ de̱vā a̍kṛṇvata   dadhā̍ti̱ ratna̍ṁ vidha̱te su̱vīrya̍m a̱gnir janā̍ya dā̱śuṣe̍
English: him have the gods appointed priest of sacrifice oblationbearer passing wise  agni gives wealth and valour to the worshipper to folk who offer up their gifts

Sanskrit: i̱ndhe rājā̱ sam a̱ryo namo̍bhi̱r yasya̱ pratī̍ka̱m āhu̍taṁ ghṛ̱tena̍   naro̍ ha̱vyebhi̍r īḻate sa̱bādha̱ āgnir agra̍ u̱ṣasā̍m aśoci
English: the king whose face is decked with oil is kindled with homage offered by his faithful servant  the men the priests adore him with oblations agni hath shone forth when the dawn is breaking

Sanskrit: a̱yam u̱ ṣya suma̍hām̐ avedi̱ hotā̍ ma̱ndro manu̍ṣo ya̱hvo a̱gniḥ   vi bhā a̍kaḥ sasṛjā̱naḥ pṛ̍thi̱vyāṁ kṛ̱ṣṇapa̍vi̱r oṣa̍dhībhir vavakṣe
English: yea he hath been acknowledged as most mighty the joyous priest of men the youthful agni  he spreading oer the earth made light around him and grew among the plants with blackened fellies

Sanskrit: kayā̍ no agne̱ vi va̍saḥ suvṛ̱ktiṁ kām u̍ sva̱dhām ṛ̍ṇavaḥ śa̱syamā̍naḥ   ka̱dā bha̍vema̱ pata̍yaḥ sudatra rā̱yo va̱ntāro̍ du̱ṣṭara̍sya sā̱dhoḥ
English: how dost thou decorate our hymn o agni? what power dost thou exert when thou art lauded?  when bounteous god may we be lords of riches winners of precious wealth which none may conquer?
