Sanskrit: ayu̍kta sa̱pta ha̱rita̍ḥ sa̱dhasthā̱d yā ī̱ṁ vaha̍nti̱ sūrya̍ṁ ghṛ̱tācī̍ḥ   dhāmā̍ni mitrāvaruṇā yu̱vāku̱ḥ saṁ yo yū̱theva̱ jani̍māni̱ caṣṭe̍
English: he from their home hath yoked the seven gold coursers who dropping oil and fatness carry sūrya  yours varuṇa and mitra he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman

Sanskrit: ud vā̍m pṛ̱kṣāso̱ madhu̍manto asthu̱r ā sūryo̍ aruhac chu̱kram arṇa̍ḥ   yasmā̍ ādi̱tyā adhva̍no̱ rada̍nti mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā varu̍ṇaḥ sa̱joṣā̍ḥ
English: your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted to the bright ocean sūrya hath ascended  for whom the ādityas make his pathway ready aryaman mitra varuṇa accordant

Sanskrit: i̱me ce̱tāro̱ anṛ̍tasya̱ bhūre̍r mi̱tro a̍rya̱mā varu̍ṇo̱ hi santi̍   i̱ma ṛ̱tasya̍ vāvṛdhur duro̱ṇe śa̱gmāsa̍ḥ pu̱trā adi̍te̱r ada̍bdhāḥ
English: for these even aryaman varuṇa and mitra are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood  these aditi's sons infallible and mighty have waxen in the home of law eternal

Sanskrit: i̱me mi̱tro varu̍ṇo dū̱ḻabhā̍so 'ce̱tasa̍ṁ cic citayanti̱ dakṣai̍ḥ   api̱ kratu̍ṁ su̱ceta̍sa̱ṁ vata̍ntas ti̱raś ci̱d aṁha̍ḥ su̱pathā̍ nayanti
English: these mitra varuṇa whom none deceiveth with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom  and wakening moreover thoughtful insight lead it by easy paths oer grief and trouble

Sanskrit: i̱me di̱vo ani̍miṣā pṛthi̱vyāś ci̍ki̱tvāṁso̍ ace̱tasa̍ṁ nayanti   pra̱vrā̱je ci̍n na̱dyo̍ gā̱dham a̍sti pā̱raṁ no̍ a̱sya vi̍ṣpi̱tasya̍ parṣan
English: they ever vigilant with eyes that close not caring for heaven and earth lead on the thoughtless  even in the river's bed there is a shallow across this broad expanse may they conduct us

Sanskrit: yad go̱pāva̱d adi̍ti̱ḥ śarma̍ bha̱dram mi̱tro yaccha̍nti̱ varu̍ṇaḥ su̱dāse̍   tasmi̱nn ā to̱kaṁ tana̍ya̱ṁ dadhā̍nā̱ mā ka̍rma deva̱heḻa̍naṁ turāsaḥ
English: when aditi and varuṇa and mitra like guardians give sudās their friendly shelter  granting him sons and lineal succession let us not bold ones! move the gods to anger

Sanskrit: ava̱ vedi̱ṁ hotrā̍bhir yajeta̱ ripa̱ḥ kāś ci̍d varuṇa̱dhruta̱ḥ saḥ   pari̱ dveṣo̍bhir arya̱mā vṛ̍ṇaktū̱ruṁ su̱dāse̍ vṛṣaṇā u lo̱kam
English: may he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of varuṇa's reviler  aryaman save us us all those who hate us give room and freedom to sudās ye mighty

Sanskrit: sa̱svaś ci̱d dhi samṛ̍tis tve̱ṣy e̍ṣām apī̱cye̍na̱ saha̍sā̱ saha̍nte   yu̱ṣmad bhi̱yā vṛ̍ṣaṇo̱ reja̍mānā̱ dakṣa̍sya cin mahi̱nā mṛ̱ḻatā̍ naḥ
English: hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting by their mysterious might they hold dominion  heroes! we cry trembling in fear before you even in the greatness of your power have mercy

Sanskrit: yo brahma̍ṇe suma̱tim ā̱yajā̍te̱ vāja̍sya sā̱tau pa̍ra̱masya̍ rā̱yaḥ   sīkṣa̍nta ma̱nyum ma̱ghavā̍no a̱rya u̱ru kṣayā̍ya cakrire su̱dhātu̍
English: he who wins favour for his prayer by worship that he may gain him strength and highest riches  that good man's mind the mighty ones will follow they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling

Sanskrit: i̱yaṁ de̍va pu̱rohi̍tir yu̱vabhyā̍ṁ ya̱jñeṣu̍ mitrāvaruṇāv akāri   viśvā̍ni du̱rgā pi̍pṛtaṁ ti̱ro no̍ yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: this priestly task gods! varuṇa and mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices  convey us safely over every peril preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: yaṁ trāya̍dhva i̱dami̍da̱ṁ devā̍so̱ yaṁ ca̱ naya̍tha   tasmā̍ agne̱ varu̍ṇa̱ mitrārya̍ma̱n maru̍ta̱ḥ śarma̍ yacchata
English: whomso ye rescue here and there whomso ye guide o deities  to him give shelter agni mitra varuṇa ye maruts and thou aryaman

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmāka̍ṁ devā̱ ava̱sāha̍ni pri̱ya ī̍jā̱nas ta̍rati̱ dviṣa̍ḥ   pra sa kṣaya̍ṁ tirate̱ vi ma̱hīr iṣo̱ yo vo̱ varā̍ya̱ dāśa̍ti
English: through your kind favour gods on some auspicious day the worshipper subdues his foes  that man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list

Sanskrit: na̱hi va̍ś cara̱maṁ ca̱na vasi̍ṣṭhaḥ pari̱maṁsa̍te   a̱smāka̍m a̱dya ma̍rutaḥ su̱te sacā̱ viśve̍ pibata kā̱mina̍ḥ
English: vasiṣṭha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all  o maruts of our soma juice effused today drink all of you with eager haste

Sanskrit: na̱hi va̍ ū̱tiḥ pṛta̍nāsu̱ mardha̍ti̱ yasmā̱ arā̍dhvaṁ naraḥ   a̱bhi va̱ āva̍rt suma̱tir navī̍yasī̱ tūya̍ṁ yāta pipīṣavaḥ
English: your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye heroes grant your gifts  may your most recent favour turn to us again come quickly ye who fain would drink

Sanskrit: o ṣu ghṛ̍ṣvirādhaso yā̱tanāndhā̍ṁsi pī̱taye̍   i̱mā vo̍ ha̱vyā ma̍ruto ra̱re hi ka̱m mo ṣv a1̱̍nyatra̍ gantana
English: come hitherward to drink the juice o ye whose bounties give you joy  these offerings are for you these maruts i present go not to any place but this

Sanskrit: ā ca̍ no ba̱rhiḥ sada̍tāvi̱tā ca̍ naḥ spā̱rhāṇi̱ dāta̍ve̱ vasu̍   asre̍dhanto marutaḥ so̱mye madhau̱ svāhe̱ha mā̍dayādhvai
English: sit on our sacred grass be graciously inclined to give the wealth for which we long  to take delight ye maruts friends of all with svāhā in sweet soma juice

Sanskrit: sa̱svaś ci̱d dhi ta̱nva1̱̍ḥ śumbha̍mānā̱ ā ha̱ṁsāso̱ nīla̍pṛṣṭhā apaptan   viśva̱ṁ śardho̍ a̱bhito̍ mā̱ ni ṣe̍da̱ naro̱ na ra̱ṇvāḥ sava̍ne̱ mada̍ntaḥ
English: decking the beauty of their forms in secret the swans with purple backs have flown down hither  around me all the company hath settled like joyous heroes glad in our libation

Sanskrit: yo no̍ maruto a̱bhi du̍rhṛṇā̱yus ti̱raś ci̱ttāni̍ vasavo̱ jighā̍ṁsati   dru̱haḥ pāśā̱n prati̱ sa mu̍cīṣṭa̱ tapi̍ṣṭhena̱ hanma̍nā hantanā̱ tam
English: maruts the man whose wrath is hard to master he who would slay us ere we think o vasus  may he be tangled in the toils of mischief; smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon

Sanskrit: sāṁta̍panā i̱daṁ ha̱vir maru̍ta̱s taj ju̍juṣṭana   yu̱ṣmāko̱tī ri̍śādasaḥ
English: o maruts ye consuming gods enjoy this offering brought for you  to help us ye who slay the foe

Sanskrit: gṛha̍medhāsa̱ ā ga̍ta̱ maru̍to̱ māpa̍ bhūtana   yu̱ṣmāko̱tī su̍dānavaḥ
English: sharers of household sacrifice come maruts stay not far away  that ye may help us bounteous ones

Sanskrit: i̱heha̍ vaḥ svatavasa̱ḥ kava̍ya̱ḥ sūrya̍tvacaḥ   ya̱jñam ma̍ruta̱ ā vṛ̍ṇe
English: here selfstrong maruts yea even here ye sages with your sunbright skins  i dedicate your sacrifice

Sanskrit: trya̍mbakaṁ yajāmahe su̱gandhi̍m puṣṭi̱vardha̍nam   u̱rvā̱ru̱kam i̍va̱ bandha̍nān mṛ̱tyor mu̍kṣīya̱ māmṛtā̍t
English: tryambaka we worship sweet augmenter of prosperity  as from its stem the cucumber so may i be released from death not reft of immortality

Sanskrit: pra sā̍ka̱mukṣe̍ arcatā ga̱ṇāya̱ yo daivya̍sya̱ dhāmna̱s tuvi̍ṣmān   u̱ta kṣo̍danti̱ roda̍sī mahi̱tvā nakṣa̍nte̱ nāka̱ṁ nirṛ̍ter ava̱ṁśāt
English: sing to the troop that pours down rain in common the mighty company of celestial nature  they make the worldhalves tremble with their greatness from depths of earth and sky they reach to heaven

Sanskrit: ja̱nūś ci̍d vo marutas tve̱ṣye̍ṇa̱ bhīmā̍sa̱s tuvi̍manya̱vo 'yā̍saḥ   pra ye maho̍bhi̱r oja̍so̱ta santi̱ viśvo̍ vo̱ yāma̍n bhayate sva̱rdṛk
English: yea your birth maruts was with wild commotion ye who move swiftly fierce in wrath terrific  ye allsurpassing in your might and vigour each looker on the light fears at your coming

Sanskrit: bṛ̱had vayo̍ ma̱ghava̍dbhyo dadhāta̱ jujo̍ṣa̱nn in ma̱ruta̍ḥ suṣṭu̱tiṁ na̍ḥ   ga̱to nādhvā̱ vi ti̍rāti ja̱ntum pra ṇa̍ḥ spā̱rhābhi̍r ū̱tibhi̍s tireta
English: give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the maruts  as the way travelled helpeth people onward so further us with your delightful succours

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmoto̱ vipro̍ marutaḥ śata̱svī yu̱ṣmoto̱ arvā̱ sahu̍riḥ saha̱srī   yu̱ṣmota̍ḥ sa̱mrāḻ u̱ta ha̍nti vṛ̱tram pra tad vo̍ astu dhūtayo de̱ṣṇam
English: your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand  the sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman may this your gift ye shakers be distinguished

Sanskrit: tām̐ ā ru̱drasya̍ mī̱ḻhuṣo̍ vivāse ku̱vin naṁsa̍nte ma̱ruta̱ḥ puna̍r naḥ   yat sa̱svartā̍ jihīḻi̱re yad ā̱vir ava̱ tad ena̍ īmahe tu̱rāṇā̍m
English: i call as such the sons of bounteous rudra will not the maruts turn again to usward?  what secret sin or open stirs their anger that we implore the swift ones to forgive us

Sanskrit: pra sā vā̍ci suṣṭu̱tir ma̱ghonā̍m i̱daṁ sū̱ktam ma̱ruto̍ juṣanta   ā̱rāc ci̱d dveṣo̍ vṛṣaṇo yuyota yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: this eulogy of the bounteous hath been spoken accept ye maruts this our hymn of praises  ye bulls keep those who hate us at a distance preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: madhvo̍ vo̱ nāma̱ māru̍taṁ yajatrā̱ḥ pra ya̱jñeṣu̱ śava̍sā madanti   ye re̱jaya̍nti̱ roda̍sī cid u̱rvī pinva̱nty utsa̱ṁ yad ayā̍sur u̱grāḥ
English: yea through the power of your sweet juice ye holy! the marut host is glad at sacrifices  they cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble they make the spring flow when they come the mighty

Sanskrit: ni̱ce̱tāro̱ hi ma̱ruto̍ gṛ̱ṇanta̍m praṇe̱tāro̱ yaja̍mānasya̱ manma̍   a̱smāka̍m a̱dya vi̱dathe̍ṣu ba̱rhir ā vī̱taye̍ sadata pipriyā̱ṇāḥ
English: the maruts watch the man who sings their praises promoters of the thought of him who worships  seat you on sacred grass in our assembly this day with friendly minds to share the banquet

Sanskrit: naitāva̍d a̱nye ma̱ruto̱ yathe̱me bhrāja̍nte ru̱kmair āyu̍dhais ta̱nūbhi̍ḥ   ā roda̍sī viśva̱piśa̍ḥ piśā̱nāḥ sa̍mā̱nam a̱ñjy a̍ñjate śu̱bhe kam
English: no others gleam so brightly as these maruts with their own forms their golden gauds their weapons  with all adornments decking earth and heaven they heighten for bright show their common splendour

Sanskrit: ṛdha̱k sā vo̍ maruto di̱dyud a̍stu̱ yad va̱ āga̍ḥ puru̱ṣatā̱ karā̍ma   mā va̱s tasyā̱m api̍ bhūmā yajatrā a̱sme vo̍ astu suma̱tiś cani̍ṣṭhā
English: far from us be your blazing dart o maruts when we through human frailty sin against you  let us not he exposed to that ye holy! may your most loving favour still attend us

Sanskrit: kṛ̱te ci̱d atra̍ ma̱ruto̍ raṇantānava̱dyāsa̱ḥ śuca̍yaḥ pāva̱kāḥ   pra ṇo̍ 'vata suma̱tibhi̍r yajatrā̱ḥ pra vāje̍bhis tirata pu̱ṣyase̍ naḥ
English: may even what we have done delight the maruts the blameless ones the bright the purifying  further us o ye holy with your kindness advance us mightily that we may prosper

Sanskrit: u̱ta stu̱tāso̍ ma̱ruto̍ vyantu̱ viśve̍bhi̱r nāma̍bhi̱r naro̍ ha̱vīṁṣi̍   dadā̍ta no a̱mṛta̍sya pra̱jāyai̍ jigṛ̱ta rā̱yaḥ sū̱nṛtā̍ ma̱ghāni̍
English: and may the maruts praised by all their titles heroes enjoy the taste of our oblations  give us of amṛta for the sake of offspring awake the excellent fair stores of riches

Sanskrit: ā stu̱tāso̍ maruto̱ viśva̍ ū̱tī acchā̍ sū̱rīn sa̱rvatā̍tā jigāta   ye na̱s tmanā̍ śa̱tino̍ va̱rdhaya̍nti yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: hither ye maruts praised with all your succours with all felicity come to our princes  who of themselves a hundredfold increase us preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: ka ī̱ṁ vya̍ktā̱ nara̱ḥ sanī̍ḻā ru̱drasya̱ maryā̱ adha̱ svaśvā̍ḥ
English: wno are these radiant men in serried rank rudra's young heroes borne by noble steeds?

Sanskrit: naki̱r hy e̍ṣāṁ ja̱nūṁṣi̱ veda̱ te a̱ṅga vi̍dre mi̱tho ja̱nitra̍m
English: verily no one knoweth whence they sprang they and they only know each other's birth

Sanskrit: a̱bhi sva̱pūbhi̍r mi̱tho va̍panta̱ vāta̍svanasaḥ śye̱nā a̍spṛdhran
English: they strew each other with their blasts these hawks they strove together roaring like the wind

Sanskrit: e̱tāni̱ dhīro̍ ni̱ṇyā ci̍keta̱ pṛśni̱r yad ūdho̍ ma̱hī ja̱bhāra̍
English: a sage was he who knew these mysteries what in her udder mighty pṛśni bore

Sanskrit: sā viṭ su̱vīrā̍ ma̱rudbhi̍r astu sa̱nāt saha̍ntī̱ puṣya̍ntī nṛ̱mṇam
English: ever victorious through the maruts be this band of heroes nursing manly strength

Sanskrit: yāma̱ṁ yeṣṭhā̍ḥ śu̱bhā śobhi̍ṣṭhāḥ śri̱yā sammi̍ślā̱ ojo̍bhir u̱grāḥ
English: most bright in splendour flectest on their way closeknit to glory strong with varied power

Sanskrit: u̱graṁ va̱ oja̍ḥ sthi̱rā śavā̱ṁsy adhā̍ ma̱rudbhi̍r ga̱ṇas tuvi̍ṣmān
English: yea mighty is your power and firm your strength so potent with the maruts be the band

Sanskrit: śu̱bhro va̱ḥ śuṣma̱ḥ krudhmī̱ manā̍ṁsi̱ dhuni̱r muni̍r iva̱ śardha̍sya dhṛ̱ṣṇoḥ
English: bright is your spirit wrathful are your minds your bold troop's minstrel is like one inspired

Sanskrit: sane̍my a̱smad yu̱yota̍ di̱dyum mā vo̍ durma̱tir i̱ha praṇa̍ṅ naḥ
English: ever avert your blazing shaft from us and let not your displeasure reach us here

Sanskrit: pri̱yā vo̱ nāma̍ huve tu̱rāṇā̱m ā yat tṛ̱pan ma̍ruto vāvaśā̱nāḥ
English: your dear names conquering maruts we invoke calling aloud till we are satisfied

Sanskrit: svā̱yu̱dhāsa̍ i̱ṣmiṇa̍ḥ suni̱ṣkā u̱ta sva̱yaṁ ta̱nva1̱̍ḥ śumbha̍mānāḥ
English: wellarmed impetuous in their haste they deck themselves their forms with oblations to you the pure ornaments made of gold

Sanskrit: śucī̍ vo ha̱vyā ma̍ruta̱ḥ śucī̍nā̱ṁ śuci̍ṁ hinomy adhva̱raṁ śuci̍bhyaḥ   ṛ̱tena̍ sa̱tyam ṛ̍ta̱sāpa̍ āya̱ñ chuci̍janmāna̱ḥ śuca̍yaḥ pāva̱kāḥ
English: pure maruts pure yourselves are your oblations to you the pure pure sacrifice i offer  by law they came to truth the law's observers bright by their birth and pure and sanctifying

Sanskrit: aṁse̱ṣv ā ma̍rutaḥ khā̱dayo̍ vo̱ vakṣa̍ḥsu ru̱kmā u̍paśiśriyā̱ṇāḥ   vi vi̱dyuto̱ na vṛ̱ṣṭibhī̍ rucā̱nā anu̍ sva̱dhām āyu̍dhai̱r yaccha̍mānāḥ
English: your rings o maruts rest upon your shoulders and chains of gold are twined upon your bosoms  gleaming with drops of rain like lightningflashes after your wont ye whirl about your weapons

Sanskrit: pra bu̱dhnyā̍ va īrate̱ mahā̍ṁsi̱ pra nāmā̍ni prayajyavas tiradhvam   sa̱ha̱sriya̱ṁ damya̍m bhā̱gam e̱taṁ gṛ̍hame̱dhīya̍m maruto juṣadhvam
English: wide in the depth of air spread forth your glories far most adorable ye bear your titles  maruts accept this thousandfold allotment of household sacrifice and household treasure

Sanskrit: yadi̍ stu̱tasya̍ maruto adhī̱thetthā vipra̍sya vā̱jino̱ havī̍man   ma̱kṣū rā̱yaḥ su̱vīrya̍sya dāta̱ nū ci̱d yam a̱nya ā̱dabha̱d arā̍vā
English: if maruts ye regard the praise recited here at this mighty singer invocation  vouchsafe us quickly wealth with noble heroes wealth which no man uho hateth us may injure

Sanskrit: atyā̍so̱ na ye ma̱ruta̱ḥ svañco̍ yakṣa̱dṛśo̱ na śu̱bhaya̍nta̱ maryā̍ḥ   te ha̍rmye̱ṣṭhāḥ śiśa̍vo̱ na śu̱bhrā va̱tsāso̱ na pra̍krī̱ḻina̍ḥ payo̱dhāḥ
English: the maruts fleet as coursers while they deck them like youths spectators of a festal meeting  linger like beauteous colts about the dwelling like frisking calves these who pour down the water

Sanskrit: da̱śa̱syanto̍ no ma̱ruto̍ mṛḻantu variva̱syanto̱ roda̍sī su̱meke̍   ā̱re go̱hā nṛ̱hā va̱dho vo̍ astu su̱mnebhi̍r a̱sme va̍savo namadhvam
English: so may the maruts help us and be gracious bringing free room to lovely earth and heaven  far be your bolt that slayeth men and cattle ye vasus turn yourselves to us with blessings

Sanskrit: ā vo̱ hotā̍ johavīti sa̱ttaḥ sa̱trācī̍ṁ rā̱tim ma̍ruto gṛṇā̱naḥ   ya īva̍to vṛṣaṇo̱ asti̍ go̱pāḥ so adva̍yāvī havate va u̱kthaiḥ
English: the priest when seated loudly calls you maruts praising in song your universal bounty  he bulls! who hath so much in his possession free from duplicity with hymns invokes you

Sanskrit: i̱me tu̱ram ma̱ruto̍ rāmayantī̱me saha̱ḥ saha̍sa̱ ā na̍manti   i̱me śaṁsa̍ṁ vanuṣya̱to ni pā̍nti gu̱ru dveṣo̱ ara̍ruṣe dadhanti
English: these maruts bring the swift man to a standstill and strength with mightier strength they break and humble  these guard the singer from the man who hates him and lay their sore displeasure on the wicked

Sanskrit: i̱me ra̱dhraṁ ci̍n ma̱ruto̍ junanti̱ bhṛmi̍ṁ ci̱d yathā̱ vasa̍vo ju̱ṣanta̍   apa̍ bādhadhvaṁ vṛṣaṇa̱s tamā̍ṁsi dha̱tta viśva̱ṁ tana̍yaṁ to̱kam a̱sme
English: these maruts rouse even the poor and needy the vasus love him as an active champion  drive to a distance o ye bulls the darkness give us full store of children and descendants

Sanskrit: mā vo̍ dā̱trān ma̍ruto̱ nir a̍rāma̱ mā pa̱ścād da̍ghma rathyo vibhā̱ge   ā na̍ḥ spā̱rhe bha̍jatanā vasa̱vye̱3̱̍ yad ī̍ṁ sujā̱taṁ vṛ̍ṣaṇo vo̱ asti̍
English: never o maruts may we lose your bounty nor carborne lords! be hitidmost when ye deal it  give us a share in that delightful treasure the genuine wealth that bulls! is your possession

Sanskrit: saṁ yad dhana̍nta ma̱nyubhi̱r janā̍sa̱ḥ śūrā̍ ya̱hvīṣv oṣa̍dhīṣu vi̱kṣu   adha̍ smā no maruto rudriyāsas trā̱tāro̍ bhūta̱ pṛta̍nāsv a̱ryaḥ
English: what time the men in fury rush together for running streams for pastures and for houses  then o ye maruts ye who spring from rudra be our protectors in the strife with foemen

English: thou art renowned as giving wealth to every one in all the battles that are fought  craving protection all these people of the earth o muchinvoked implore thy name

English: each day would i enrich the man who sang my praise in whatsoever place he were  no kinship is there better maghavan than thine a father even is no more

English: none other like to thee of earth or of the heavens hath been or ever will be born  desiring horses indra maghavan! and kine as men of might we call on thee

English: bring indra the victorious ones; bring elder thou the younger host  for maghavan thou art rich in treasures from of old and must be called in every fight

English: drive thou away our enemies o maghavan make riches easy to be won  be thou our good protector in the strife for spoil cherisher of our friends be thou

English: o indra give us wisdom as a sire gives wisdom to his sons  guide us o muchinvoked in this our way may we still live and look upon the light

English: grant that no mighty foes unknown malevolent unhallowed tread us to the ground  with thine assistance hero may we ass through all the waters that are rul`ng down

Sanskrit: e̱bhir na̍ i̱ndrāha̍bhir daśasya durmi̱trāso̱ hi kṣi̱taya̱ḥ pava̍nte   prati̱ yac caṣṭe̱ anṛ̍tam ane̱nā ava̍ dvi̱tā varu̍ṇo mā̱yī na̍ḥ sāt
English: honour us in these present days o indra for hostile men are making expiation  our sin that sinless varuṇa discovered the wondrouswise hath long ago forgiven

Sanskrit: vo̱cemed indra̍m ma̱ghavā̍nam enam ma̱ho rā̱yo rādha̍so̱ yad dada̍n naḥ   yo arca̍to̱ brahma̍kṛti̱m avi̍ṣṭho yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: we will address this liberal lord this indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches  best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: indra̱ṁ naro̍ ne̱madhi̍tā havante̱ yat pāryā̍ yu̱naja̍te̱ dhiya̱s tāḥ   śūro̱ nṛṣā̍tā̱ śava̍saś cakā̱na ā goma̍ti vra̱je bha̍jā̱ tvaṁ na̍ḥ
English: men call on indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive  hero rejoicing in thy might in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle

Sanskrit: ya i̍ndra̱ śuṣmo̍ maghavan te̱ asti̱ śikṣā̱ sakhi̍bhyaḥ puruhūta̱ nṛbhya̍ḥ   tvaṁ hi dṛ̱ḻhā ma̍ghava̱n vice̍tā̱ apā̍ vṛdhi̱ pari̍vṛta̱ṁ na rādha̍ḥ
English: grant indra maghavan invoked of many to these my friends the strength which thou possessest  thou maghavan hast rent strong places open unclose for us wise god thy hidden bounty

Sanskrit: indro̱ rājā̱ jaga̍taś carṣaṇī̱nām adhi̱ kṣami̱ viṣu̍rūpa̱ṁ yad asti̍   tato̍ dadāti dā̱śuṣe̱ vasū̍ni̱ coda̱d rādha̱ upa̍stutaś cid a̱rvāk
English: king of the living world of men is indra of all in varied form that earth containeth  thence to the worshipper he giveth riches may he enrich us also when we laud him

Sanskrit: nū ci̍n na̱ indro̍ ma̱ghavā̱ sahū̍tī dā̱no vāja̱ṁ ni ya̍mate na ū̱tī   anū̍nā̱ yasya̱ dakṣi̍ṇā pī̱pāya̍ vā̱maṁ nṛbhyo̍ a̱bhivī̍tā̱ sakhi̍bhyaḥ
English: maghavan indra when we all invoke him bountiful ever sendeth strength to aid us  whose perfect guerdon never failing bringeth wealth to the men to friends the thing they covet

Sanskrit: nū i̍ndra rā̱ye vari̍vas kṛdhī na̱ ā te̱ mano̍ vavṛtyāma ma̱ghāya̍   goma̱d aśvā̍va̱d ratha̍va̱d vyanto̍ yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: quick indra give us room and way to riches and let us bring thy mind to grant us treasures  that we may win us cars and steeds and cattle preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: na soma̱ indra̱m asu̍to mamāda̱ nābra̍hmāṇo ma̱ghavā̍naṁ su̱tāsa̍ḥ   tasmā̍ u̱kthaṁ ja̍naye̱ yaj jujo̍ṣan nṛ̱van navī̍yaḥ śṛ̱ṇava̱d yathā̍ naḥ
English: soma unpressed neer gladdened liberal indra no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him  i generate a laud that shall delight him new and heroic so that he may hear us

Sanskrit: u̱kthau̍kthe̱ soma̱ indra̍m mamāda nī̱thenī̍the ma̱ghavā̍naṁ su̱tāsa̍ḥ   yad ī̍ṁ sa̱bādha̍ḥ pi̱tara̱ṁ na pu̱trāḥ sa̍mā̱nada̍kṣā̱ ava̍se̱ hava̍nte
English: at every laud the soma gladdens indra pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted  what time the priests with one united effort call him to aid as sons invoke their father

Sanskrit: ca̱kāra̱ tā kṛ̱ṇava̍n nū̱nam a̱nyā yāni̍ bru̱vanti̍ ve̱dhasa̍ḥ su̱teṣu̍   janī̍r iva̱ pati̱r eka̍ḥ samā̱no ni mā̍mṛje̱ pura̱ indra̱ḥ su sarvā̍ḥ
English: these deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits such as the priests declare at their libations  indra hath taken and possessed all castles like as one common husband doth his spouses

Sanskrit: e̱vā tam ā̍hur u̱ta śṛ̍ṇva̱ indra̱ eko̍ vibha̱ktā ta̱raṇi̍r ma̱ghānā̍m   mi̱tha̱stura̍ ū̱tayo̱ yasya̍ pū̱rvīr a̱sme bha̱drāṇi̍ saścata pri̱yāṇi̍
English: even thus have they declared him famed is indra as conqueror sole distributer of treasures;  whose many succours come in close succession may dear delightful benefits attend us

Sanskrit: e̱vā vasi̍ṣṭha̱ indra̍m ū̱taye̱ nṝn kṛ̍ṣṭī̱nāṁ vṛ̍ṣa̱bhaṁ su̱te gṛ̍ṇāti   sa̱ha̱sriṇa̱ upa̍ no māhi̱ vājā̍n yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: thus to bring help to men vasiṣṭha laudeth indra the peoples' hero at libation  bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: ni du̱rga i̍ndra śnathihy a̱mitrā̍m̐ a̱bhi ye no̱ martā̍so a̱manti̍   ā̱re taṁ śaṁsa̍ṁ kṛṇuhi nini̱tsor ā no̍ bhara sa̱mbhara̍ṇa̱ṁ vasū̍nām
English: o indra where the ground is hard to traverse smite down our foes the mortals who assail us  keep far from us the curse of the reviler bring us accumulated store of treasures

Sanskrit: śa̱taṁ te̍ śiprinn ū̱taya̍ḥ su̱dāse̍ sa̱hasra̱ṁ śaṁsā̍ u̱ta rā̱tir a̍stu   ja̱hi vadha̍r va̱nuṣo̱ martya̍syā̱sme dyu̱mnam adhi̱ ratna̍ṁ ca dhehi
English: god of the fair helm give sudās a hundred succours a thousand blessings and thy bounty  strike down the weapon of our mortal foeman bestow upon us splendid fame and riches

Sanskrit: tvāva̍to̱ hī̍ndra̱ kratve̱ asmi̱ tvāva̍to 'vi̱tuḥ śū̍ra rā̱tau   viśved ahā̍ni taviṣīva ugra̱m̐ oka̍ḥ kṛṇuṣva harivo̱ na ma̍rdhīḥ
English: i wait the power of one like thee o indra gifts of a helper such as thou art hero  strong mighty god dwell with me now and ever lord of bay horses do not thou desert us

Sanskrit: kutsā̍ e̱te harya̍śvāya śū̱ṣam indre̱ saho̍ de̱vajū̍tam iyā̱nāḥ   sa̱trā kṛ̍dhi su̱hanā̍ śūra vṛ̱trā va̱yaṁ taru̍trāḥ sanuyāma̱ vāja̍m
English: here are the kutsas supplicating indra for might the lord of bays for godsent conquest  make our foes ever easy to be vanquished may we victorious win the spoil o hero

Sanskrit: e̱vā na̍ indra̱ vārya̍sya pūrdhi̱ pra te̍ ma̱hīṁ su̍ma̱tiṁ ve̍vidāma   iṣa̍m pinva ma̱ghava̍dbhyaḥ su̱vīrā̍ṁ yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: with precious things o indra thus content us may we attain to thine exalted favour  send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: yoni̍ṣ ṭa indra̱ sada̍ne akāri̱ tam ā nṛbhi̍ḥ puruhūta̱ pra yā̍hi   aso̱ yathā̍ no 'vi̱tā vṛ̱dhe ca̱ dado̱ vasū̍ni ma̱mada̍ś ca̱ somai̍ḥ
English: a home is made for thee to dwell in indra o muchinvoked go thitherwith the heroes  that thou to prosper us mayst be our helper vouchsafe us wealth rejoice with draughts of soma

Sanskrit: gṛ̱bhī̱taṁ te̱ mana̍ indra dvi̱barhā̍ḥ su̱taḥ soma̱ḥ pari̍ṣiktā̱ madhū̍ni   visṛ̍ṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛ̱ktir i̱yam indra̱ṁ johu̍vatī manī̱ṣā
English: indra thy wish twicestrong is comprehended pressed is the soma poured are pleasant juices  this hymn of praise from loosened tongue made perfect draws indra to itself with loud invoking

Sanskrit: ā no̍ di̱va ā pṛ̍thi̱vyā ṛ̍jīṣinn i̱dam ba̱rhiḥ so̍ma̱peyā̍ya yāhi   vaha̍ntu tvā̱ hara̍yo ma̱drya̍ñcam āṅgū̱ṣam acchā̍ ta̱vasa̱m madā̍ya
English: come thou impetuous; god from earth or heaven; come to our holy grass to drink the soma  hither to me let thy bay horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful

Sanskrit: ā no̱ viśvā̍bhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ sa̱joṣā̱ brahma̍ juṣā̱ṇo ha̍ryaśva yāhi   varī̍vṛja̱t sthavi̍rebhiḥ suśiprā̱sme dadha̱d vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ śuṣma̍m indra
English: come unto us with all thine aids accordant lord of bay steeds accepting our devotions  fairhelmeted oercoming with the mighty and lending us the strength of bulls o indra

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa stomo̍ ma̱ha u̱grāya̱ vāhe̍ dhu̱rī̱3̱̍vātyo̱ na vā̱jaya̍nn adhāyi   indra̍ tvā̱yam a̱rka ī̍ṭṭe̱ vasū̍nāṁ di̱vī̍va̱ dyām adhi̍ na̱ḥ śroma̍taṁ dhāḥ
English: as to the chariot pole a vigorous courser this laud is brought to the great strong upholder  this hymn solicits wealth of thee in heaven as twere above the sky set thou our glory

Sanskrit: e̱vā na̍ indra̱ vārya̍sya pūrdhi̱ pra te̍ ma̱hīṁ su̍ma̱tiṁ ve̍vidāma   iṣa̍m pinva ma̱ghava̍dbhyaḥ su̱vīrā̍ṁ yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: with precious things o indra thus content us may we attain to thine exalted favour  send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings

Sanskrit: ud u̱ brahmā̍ṇy airata śrava̱syendra̍ṁ sama̱rye ma̍hayā vasiṣṭha   ā yo viśvā̍ni̱ śava̍sā ta̱tāno̍paśro̱tā ma̱ īva̍to̱ vacā̍ṁsi
English: prayers have been offered up through love of glory vasiṣṭha honour indra in the battle  he who with might extends through all existence hears words which i his faithful servant utter

Sanskrit: ayā̍mi̱ ghoṣa̍ indra de̱vajā̍mir ira̱jyanta̱ yac chu̱rudho̱ vivā̍ci   na̱hi svam āyu̍ś ciki̱te jane̍ṣu̱ tānīd aṁhā̱ṁsy ati̍ parṣy a̱smān
English: a cry was raised which reached the gods o indra a cry to them to send us strength in combat  none among men knows his own life's duration bear us in safety over these our troubles

Sanskrit: yu̱je ratha̍ṁ ga̱veṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ hari̍bhyā̱m upa̱ brahmā̍ṇi jujuṣā̱ṇam a̍sthuḥ   vi bā̍dhiṣṭa̱ sya roda̍sī mahi̱tvendro̍ vṛ̱trāṇy a̍pra̱tī ja̍gha̱nvān
English: the bays the bootyseeking car i harness my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly  indra when he had slain resistless foemen forced with his might the two worldhalves asunder

Sanskrit: āpa̍ś cit pipyuḥ sta̱ryo̱3̱̍ na gāvo̱ nakṣa̍nn ṛ̱taṁ ja̍ri̱tāra̍s ta indra   yā̱hi vā̱yur na ni̱yuto̍ no̱ acchā̱ tvaṁ hi dhī̱bhir daya̍se̱ vi vājā̍n
English: like barren cows moreover swelled the waters the singen sought thy holy rite o indra  come unto us as with his team comes vāyu thou through our solemn hymns bestowest booty

Sanskrit: te tvā̱ madā̍ indra mādayantu śu̱ṣmiṇa̍ṁ tuvi̱rādha̍saṁ jari̱tre   eko̍ deva̱trā daya̍se̱ hi martā̍n a̱smiñ chū̍ra̱ sava̍ne mādayasva
English: so may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee indra the mighty very bounteous to the singer  alone among the gods thou pitiest mortals o hero make thee glad at this libation

Sanskrit: e̱ved indra̱ṁ vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ vajra̍bāhu̱ṁ vasi̍ṣṭhāso a̱bhy a̍rcanty a̱rkaiḥ   sa na̍ḥ stu̱to vī̱rava̍d dhātu̱ goma̍d yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: thus the vasisthas glorify with praises indra the powerful whose arm wields thunder  praised may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings

Sanskrit: pibā̱ soma̍m indra̱ manda̍tu tvā̱ yaṁ te̍ su̱ṣāva̍ harya̱śvādri̍ḥ   so̱tur bā̱hubhyā̱ṁ suya̍to̱ nārvā̍
English: drink soma lord of bays and let it cheer thee indra the stone like a well guided courser  directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it

Sanskrit: yas te̱ mado̱ yujya̱ś cāru̱r asti̱ yena̍ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ haryaśva̱ haṁsi̍   sa tvām i̍ndra prabhūvaso mamattu
English: so let the draught of joy thy dear companion by which o lord of bays thou slayest foemen  delight thee indra lord of princely treasures

Sanskrit: bodhā̱ su me̍ maghava̱n vāca̱m emāṁ yāṁ te̱ vasi̍ṣṭho̱ arca̍ti̱ praśa̍stim   i̱mā brahma̍ sadha̱māde̍ juṣasva
English: mark closely maghavan the words i utter this eulogy recited by vasiṣṭha  accept the prayers i offer at thy banquet

Sanskrit: śru̱dhī hava̍ṁ vipipā̱nasyādre̱r bodhā̱ vipra̱syārca̍to manī̱ṣām   kṛ̱ṣvā duvā̱ṁsy anta̍mā̱ sace̱mā
English: hear thou the call of the juicedrinking pressstone hear thou the brahman's hymn who sings and lauds thee  take to thine inmost self these adorations

Sanskrit: na te̱ giro̱ api̍ mṛṣye tu̱rasya̱ na su̍ṣṭu̱tim a̍su̱rya̍sya vi̱dvān   sadā̍ te̱ nāma̍ svayaśo vivakmi
English: i know and neer forget the hymns and praises of thee the conqueror and thy strength immortal  thy name i ever utter selfrefulgent

Sanskrit: bhūri̱ hi te̱ sava̍nā̱ mānu̍ṣeṣu̱ bhūri̍ manī̱ṣī ha̍vate̱ tvām it   māre a̱sman ma̍ghava̱ñ jyok ka̍ḥ
English: among mankind many are thy libations and many a time the pious sageinvokes thee  o maghavan be not long distant from us

Sanskrit: tubhyed i̱mā sava̍nā śūra̱ viśvā̱ tubhya̱m brahmā̍ṇi̱ vardha̍nā kṛṇomi   tvaṁ nṛbhi̱r havyo̍ vi̱śvadhā̍si
English: all these libations are for thee o hero to thee i offer these my prayers that strengthen  ever in every place must men invoke thee

Sanskrit: nū ci̱n nu te̱ manya̍mānasya da̱smod a̍śnuvanti mahi̱māna̍m ugra   na vī̱rya̍m indra te̱ na rādha̍ḥ
English: never do men attain o wonderworker thy greatness mighty one who must be lauded  nor indra thine heroic power and bounty

Sanskrit: ye ca̱ pūrva̱ ṛṣa̍yo̱ ye ca̱ nūtnā̱ indra̱ brahmā̍ṇi ja̱naya̍nta̱ viprā̍ḥ   a̱sme te̍ santu sa̱khyā śi̱vāni̍ yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: among all ṛṣis indra old and recent who have engendered hymns as sacred singers  even with us be thine auspicious friendships ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings

Sanskrit: asā̍vi de̱vaṁ goṛ̍jīka̱m andho̱ ny a̍smi̱nn indro̍ ja̱nuṣe̍m uvoca   bodhā̍masi tvā haryaśva ya̱jñair bodhā̍ na̱ḥ stoma̱m andha̍so̱ made̍ṣu
English: pressed is the juice divine with milk commingled thereto hath indra ever been accustomed  we wake thee lord of bays with sacrifices mark this our laud in the wild joy of soma

Sanskrit: pra ya̍nti ya̱jñaṁ vi̱paya̍nti ba̱rhiḥ so̍ma̱mādo̍ vi̱dathe̍ du̱dhravā̍caḥ   ny u̍ bhriyante ya̱śaso̍ gṛ̱bhād ā dū̱raü̍pabdo̱ vṛṣa̍ṇo nṛ̱ṣāca̍ḥ
English: on to the rite they move the grass they scatter these somadrinkers eloquent in synod  hither for men to grasp are brought the pressstones farthundering famous strong that wait on heroes

Sanskrit: tvam i̍ndra̱ sravi̍ta̱vā a̱pas ka̱ḥ pari̍ṣṭhitā̱ ahi̍nā śūra pū̱rvīḥ   tvad vā̍vakre ra̱thyo̱3̱̍ na dhenā̱ reja̍nte̱ viśvā̍ kṛ̱trimā̍ṇi bhī̱ṣā
English: indra thou settest free the many waters that were encompassed hero by the dragon  down rolled as if on chariots borne the rivers through fear of thee all things created tremble

Sanskrit: bhī̱mo vi̍ve̱ṣāyu̍dhebhir eṣā̱m apā̍ṁsi̱ viśvā̱ naryā̍ṇi vi̱dvān   indra̱ḥ puro̱ jarhṛ̍ṣāṇo̱ vi dū̍dho̱d vi vajra̍hasto mahi̱nā ja̍ghāna
English: skilled in all manly deeds the god terrific hath with his weapons mastered these opponents  indra in rapturous joy shook down their castles he slew them in his might the thunderwielder

Sanskrit: na yā̱tava̍ indra jūjuvur no̱ na vanda̍nā śaviṣṭha ve̱dyābhi̍ḥ   sa śa̍rdhad a̱ryo viṣu̍ṇasya ja̱ntor mā śi̱śnade̍vā̱ api̍ gur ṛ̱taṁ na̍ḥ
English: no evil spirits have impelled us indra nor fiends o mightiest god with their devices  let our true god subdue the hostile rabble let not the lewd approach our holy worship

Sanskrit: a̱bhi kratve̍ndra bhū̱r adha̱ jman na te̍ vivyaṅ mahi̱māna̱ṁ rajā̍ṁsi   svenā̱ hi vṛ̱traṁ śava̍sā ja̱ghantha̱ na śatru̱r anta̍ṁ vividad yu̱dhā te̍
English: thou in thy strength surpassest earth and heaven the regions comprehend not all thy greatness  with thine own power and might thou slewest vṛtra no foe hath found the end of thee in battle

Sanskrit: de̱vāś ci̍t te asu̱ryā̍ya̱ pūrve 'nu̍ kṣa̱trāya̍ mamire̱ sahā̍ṁsi   indro̍ ma̱ghāni̍ dayate vi̱ṣahyendra̱ṁ vāja̍sya johuvanta sā̱tau
English: even the earlier deities submitted their powers to thy supreme divine dominion  indra wins wealth and deals it out to other's men in the strife for booty call on indra

Sanskrit: kī̱riś ci̱d dhi tvām ava̍se ju̱hāveśā̍nam indra̱ saubha̍gasya̱ bhūre̍ḥ   avo̍ babhūtha śatamūte a̱sme a̍bhikṣa̱ttus tvāva̍to varū̱tā
English: the humble hath invoked thee for protection thee lord of great felicity o indra  thou with a hundred aids hast been our helper one who brings gifts like thee hath his defender

Sanskrit: sakhā̍yas ta indra vi̱śvaha̍ syāma namovṛ̱dhāso̍ mahi̱nā ta̍rutra   va̱nvantu̍ smā̱ te 'va̍sā samī̱ke̱3̱̍ 'bhī̍tim a̱ryo va̱nuṣā̱ṁ śavā̍ṁsi
English: may we o indra be thy friends for ever eagerly conqueror yielding greater homage  may through thy grace the strength of us who battle quell in the shock the onset of the foeman

Sanskrit: sa na̍ indra̱ tvaya̍tāyā i̱ṣe dhā̱s tmanā̍ ca̱ ye ma̱ghavā̍no ju̱nanti̍   vasvī̱ ṣu te̍ jari̱tre a̍stu śa̱ktir yū̱yam pā̍ta sva̱stibhi̱ḥ sadā̍ naḥ
English: place us by food which thou hast given o indra us and the wealthy patrons who command us  let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee ye gods preserve us evermore with blessings

Sanskrit: u̱gro ja̍jñe vī̱ryā̍ya sva̱dhāvā̱ñ cakri̱r apo̱ naryo̱ yat ka̍ri̱ṣyan   jagmi̱r yuvā̍ nṛ̱ṣada̍na̱m avo̍bhis trā̱tā na̱ indra̱ ena̍so ma̱haś ci̍t
English: strong godlynatured born for hero exploit man's friend hedoth whatever deed he willeth  saving us een from great transgression indra the youthful visiteth man's home with favour

Sanskrit: hantā̍ vṛ̱tram indra̱ḥ śūśu̍vāna̱ḥ prāvī̱n nu vī̱ro ja̍ri̱tāra̍m ū̱tī   kartā̍ su̱dāse̱ aha̱ vā u̍ lo̱kaṁ dātā̱ vasu̱ muhu̱r ā dā̱śuṣe̍ bhūt
English: waxing greatness indra slayeth vṛtra the hero with his aid hath helped the singer  he gave sudās wide room and space and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations

Sanskrit: yu̱dhmo a̍na̱rvā kha̍ja̱kṛt sa̱madvā̱ śūra̍ḥ satrā̱ṣāḍ ja̱nuṣe̱m aṣā̍ḻhaḥ   vy ā̍sa̱ indra̱ḥ pṛta̍nā̱ḥ svojā̱ adhā̱ viśva̍ṁ śatrū̱yanta̍ṁ jaghāna
English: soldier unchecked warrousing battling hero unconquered from of old victorious ever  indra the very strong hath scattered armies; yea he hath slain each foe who fought against him

Sanskrit: u̱bhe ci̍d indra̱ roda̍sī mahi̱tvā pa̍prātha̱ tavi̍ṣībhis tuviṣmaḥ   ni vajra̱m indro̱ hari̍vā̱n mimi̍kṣa̱n sam andha̍sā̱ made̍ṣu̱ vā u̍voca
English: thou with thy greatness hast filled full o indra even both the worlds with might o thou most mighty  lord of bays indra brandishing his thunder is gratified with soma at the banquet

Sanskrit: śa̱gdhy ū̱3̱̍ ṣu śa̍cīpata̱ indra̱ viśvā̍bhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ   bhaga̱ṁ na hi tvā̍ ya̱śasa̍ṁ vasu̱vida̱m anu̍ śūra̱ carā̍masi
English: wandering here the radiant calf finds none to fetter him and seeks  the mother to declare his praise

Sanskrit: pau̱ro aśva̍sya puru̱kṛd gavā̍m a̱sy utso̍ deva hira̱ṇyaya̍ḥ   naki̱r hi dāna̍m pari̱mardhi̍ṣa̱t tve yadya̱d yāmi̱ tad ā bha̍ra
English: and now that great and mighty team the team of horses that are his  and traces of his car are seen

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hy ehi̱ cera̍ve vi̱dā bhaga̱ṁ vasu̍ttaye   ud vā̍vṛṣasva maghava̱n gavi̍ṣṭaya̱ ud i̱ndrāśva̍miṣṭaye
English: the seven milk a single cow; the two set other five to work  on the stream's loudresounding bank

Sanskrit: tvam pu̱rū sa̱hasrā̍ṇi śa̱tāni̍ ca yū̱thā dā̱nāya̍ maṁhase   ā pu̍raṁda̱raṁ ca̍kṛma̱ vipra̍vacasa̱ indra̱ṁ gāya̱nto 'va̍se
English: entreated by vivasvān's ten indra cast down the waterjar  with threefold hammer from the sky

Sanskrit: a̱vi̱pro vā̱ yad avi̍dha̱d vipro̍ vendra te̱ vaca̍ḥ   sa pra ma̍mandat tvā̱yā śa̍takrato̱ prācā̍manyo̱ aha̍ṁsana
English: three times the newlykindled flame proceeds around the sacrifice  the priests anoint it with the meath

Sanskrit: u̱grabā̍hur mrakṣa̱kṛtvā̍ puraṁda̱ro yadi̍ me śṛ̱ṇava̱d dhava̍m   va̱sū̱yavo̱ vasu̍patiṁ śa̱takra̍tu̱ṁ stomai̱r indra̍ṁ havāmahe
English: with reverence they drain the fount that circles with its wheel above  exhaustless with the mouth below

Sanskrit: na pā̱pāso̍ manāmahe̱ nārā̍yāso̱ na jaḻha̍vaḥ   yad in nv indra̱ṁ vṛṣa̍ṇa̱ṁ sacā̍ su̱te sakhā̍yaṁ kṛ̱ṇavā̍mahai
English: the pressingstones are set at work the meath is poured into the tank  at the outshedding of the fount

Sanskrit: u̱graṁ yu̍yujma̱ pṛta̍nāsu sāsa̱him ṛ̱ṇakā̍ti̱m adā̍bhyam   vedā̍ bhṛ̱maṁ ci̱t sani̍tā ra̱thīta̍mo vā̱jina̱ṁ yam id ū̱ naśa̍t
English: ye cows protect the fount the two mighty ones bless the sacrifice  the handles twain are wrought of gold

Sanskrit: yata̍ indra̱ bhayā̍mahe̱ tato̍ no̱ abha̍yaṁ kṛdhi   magha̍vañ cha̱gdhi tava̱ tan na̍ ū̱tibhi̱r vi dviṣo̱ vi mṛdho̍ jahi
English: pour on the juice the ornament which reaches both the heaven and earth  supply the liquid to the bull

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hi rā̍dhaspate̱ rādha̍so ma̱haḥ kṣaya̱syāsi̍ vidha̱taḥ   taṁ tvā̍ va̱yam ma̍ghavann indra girvaṇaḥ su̱tāva̍nto havāmahe
English: these know their own abidingplace like calves beside the mother cows  they meet together with their kin

Sanskrit: indra̱ḥ spaḻ u̱ta vṛ̍tra̱hā pa̍ra̱spā no̱ vare̍ṇyaḥ   sa no̍ rakṣiṣac cara̱maṁ sa ma̍dhya̱maṁ sa pa̱ścāt pā̍tu naḥ pu̱raḥ
English: devouring in their greedy jaws they make sustaining food in heaven  to indra agni light and prayer

Sanskrit: tvaṁ na̍ḥ pa̱ścād a̍dha̱rād u̍tta̱rāt pu̱ra indra̱ ni pā̍hi vi̱śvata̍ḥ   ā̱re a̱smat kṛ̍ṇuhi̱ daivya̍m bha̱yam ā̱re he̱tīr ade̍vīḥ
English: the pious one milked out rich food sustenance dealt in portions seven  together with the sun's seven rays

Sanskrit: a̱dyādyā̱ śvaḥśva̱ indra̱ trāsva̍ pa̱re ca̍ naḥ   viśvā̍ ca no jari̱tṝn sa̍tpate̱ ahā̱ divā̱ nakta̍ṁ ca rakṣiṣaḥ
English: i took some soma when the sun rose up o mitra varuṇa  that is the sick man's medicine

Sanskrit: pra̱bha̱ṅgī śūro̍ ma̱ghavā̍ tu̱vīma̍gha̱ḥ sammi̍ślo vi̱ryā̍ya̱ kam   u̱bhā te̍ bā̱hū vṛṣa̍ṇā śatakrato̱ ni yā vajra̍m mimi̱kṣatu̍ḥ
English: from where oblations must be laid which is the wellbeloved's home  he with his tongue hath compassed heaven

Sanskrit: agna̱ ā yā̍hy a̱gnibhi̱r hotā̍raṁ tvā vṛṇīmahe   ā tvām a̍naktu̱ praya̍tā ha̱viṣma̍tī̱ yaji̍ṣṭham ba̱rhir ā̱sade̍
English: o agni with thy mighty wealth guard us from all malignity  yea from all hate of mortal man

Sanskrit: acchā̱ hi tvā̍ sahasaḥ sūno aṅgira̱ḥ sruca̱ś cara̍nty adhva̱re   ū̱rjo napā̍taṁ ghṛ̱take̍śam īmahe̱ 'gniṁ ya̱jñeṣu̍ pū̱rvyam
English: for over thee o friend from birth the wrath of man hath no control  nay guardian of the earth art thou

Sanskrit: agne̍ ka̱vir ve̱dhā a̍si̱ hotā̍ pāvaka̱ yakṣya̍ḥ   ma̱ndro yaji̍ṣṭho adhva̱reṣv īḍyo̱ vipre̍bhiḥ śukra̱ manma̍bhiḥ
English: as such with all the gods o son of strength auspicious in thy flame  give us wealth bringing all things good

Sanskrit: adro̍gha̱m ā va̍hośa̱to ya̍viṣṭhya de̱vām̐ a̍jasra vī̱taye̍   a̱bhi prayā̍ṁsi̱ sudhi̱tā va̍so gahi̱ manda̍sva dhī̱tibhi̍r hi̱taḥ
English: malignities stay not from wealth the mortal man whom agni thou  protectest while he offers gifts

Sanskrit: tvam it sa̱prathā̍ a̱sy agne̍ trātar ṛ̱tas ka̱viḥ   tvāṁ viprā̍saḥ samidhāna dīdiva̱ ā vi̍vāsanti ve̱dhasa̍ḥ
English: sage agni be whom thou dost urge in worship of the gods to wealth  with thine assistance winneth kine

Sanskrit: śocā̍ śociṣṭha dīdi̱hi vi̱śe mayo̱ rāsva̍ sto̱tre ma̱hām̐ a̍si   de̱vānā̱ṁ śarma̱n mama̍ santu sū̱raya̍ḥ śatrū̱ṣāha̍ḥ sva̱gnaya̍ḥ
English: riches with many heroes thou hast for the man who offers gifts  lead thou us on to higher bliss

Sanskrit: yathā̍ cid vṛ̱ddham a̍ta̱sam agne̍ sa̱ṁjūrva̍si̱ kṣami̍   e̱vā da̍ha mitramaho̱ yo a̍sma̱dhrug du̱rmanmā̱ kaś ca̱ vena̍ti
English: save us o jātavedas nor abandon us to him who sins  unto the evilhearted man

Sanskrit: mā no̱ martā̍ya ri̱pave̍ rakṣa̱svine̱ māghaśa̍ṁsāya rīradhaḥ   asre̍dhadbhis ta̱raṇi̍bhir yaviṣṭhya śi̱vebhi̍ḥ pāhi pā̱yubhi̍ḥ
English: o agni let no godless man avert thy bounty as a god  over all treasures thou art lord

Sanskrit: pā̱hi no̍ agna̱ eka̍yā pā̱hy u1̱̍ta dvi̱tīya̍yā   pā̱hi gī̱rbhis ti̱sṛbhi̍r ūrjām pate pā̱hi ca̍ta̱sṛbhi̍r vaso
English: so son of strength thou aidest us to what is great and excellent  those vasu! friend! who sing thy praise

Sanskrit: pā̱hi viśva̍smād ra̱kṣaso̱ arā̍vṇa̱ḥ pra sma̱ vāje̍ṣu no 'va   tvām id dhi nedi̍ṣṭhaṁ de̱vatā̍taya ā̱piṁ nakṣā̍mahe vṛ̱dhe
English: let our songs come anear to him beauteous and bright with piercing flame  our offerings with our homage to the  lord of wealth to him whom many praise for help

Sanskrit: ā no̍ agne vayo̱vṛdha̍ṁ ra̱yim pā̍vaka̱ śaṁsya̍m   rāsvā̍ ca na upamāte puru̱spṛha̱ṁ sunī̍tī̱ svaya̍śastaram
English: to agni jātavedas to the son of strength that he may give us precious gifts  immortal from of old priest among mortal men the most delightful in the house

Sanskrit: yena̱ vaṁsā̍ma̱ pṛta̍nāsu̱ śardha̍ta̱s tara̍nto a̱rya ā̱diśa̍ḥ   sa tvaṁ no̍ vardha̱ praya̍sā śacīvaso̱ jinvā̱ dhiyo̍ vasu̱vida̍ḥ
English: agni made yours by sacrifice agni while holy rites advance;  agni the first in songs first with the warrior steed; agni to win the land for us

Sanskrit: śiśā̍no vṛṣa̱bho ya̍thā̱gniḥ śṛṅge̱ davi̍dhvat   ti̱gmā a̍sya̱ hana̍vo̱ na pra̍ti̱dhṛṣe̍ su̱jambha̱ḥ saha̍so ya̱huḥ
English: may agni who is lord of wealth vouchsafe us food for friendship sake  agni we ever seek for seed and progeny the vasu who protects our lives

Sanskrit: na̱hi te̍ agne vṛṣabha prati̱dhṛṣe̱ jambhā̍so̱ yad vi̱tiṣṭha̍se   sa tvaṁ no̍ hota̱ḥ suhu̍taṁ ha̱viṣ kṛ̍dhi̱ vaṁsvā̍ no̱ vāryā̍ pu̱ru
English: solicit with your chants for help agni the god with piercing flame  for riches famous agni purumīlha and ye men! agni to light our dwelling well

Sanskrit: śeṣe̱ vane̍ṣu mā̱troḥ saṁ tvā̱ martā̍sa indhate   ata̍ndro ha̱vyā va̍hasi havi̱ṣkṛta̱ ād id de̱veṣu̍ rājasi
English: agni we laud that he may keep our foes afar agni to give us health and strength  let him as guardian be invoked in all the tribes the lighterup of glowing brands

Sanskrit: i̱māni̍ vām bhāga̱dheyā̍ni sisrata̱ indrā̍varuṇā̱ pra ma̱he su̱teṣu̍ vām   ya̱jñeya̍jñe ha̱ sava̍nā bhura̱ṇyatho̱ yat su̍nva̱te yaja̍mānāya̱ śikṣa̍thaḥ
English: he who as sovran lord of men moves with his chariots unrestrained  the vṛtraslayer vanquisher of fighting hosts preeminent is praised with song

Sanskrit: ni̱ṣṣidhva̍rī̱r oṣa̍dhī̱r āpa̍ āstā̱m indrā̍varuṇā mahi̱māna̱m āśa̍ta   yā sisra̍tū̱ raja̍saḥ pā̱re adhva̍no̱ yayo̱ḥ śatru̱r naki̱r āde̍va̱ oha̍te
English: honour that indra puruhanman! for his aid in whose sustaining hand of old  the splendid bolt of thunder was deposited as the great sun was set in heaven

Sanskrit: sa̱tyaṁ tad i̍ndrāvaruṇā kṛ̱śasya̍ vā̱m madhva̍ ū̱rmiṁ du̍hate sa̱pta vāṇī̍ḥ   tābhi̍r dā̱śvāṁsa̍m avataṁ śubhas patī̱ yo vā̱m ada̍bdho a̱bhi pāti̱ citti̍bhiḥ
English: no one by deed attains to him who works and strengthens evermore  no not by sacrifice to indra praised o all resistless daring bold in might

Sanskrit: ghṛ̱ta̱pruṣa̱ḥ saumyā̍ jī̱radā̍navaḥ sa̱pta svasā̍ra̱ḥ sada̍na ṛ̱tasya̍   yā ha̍ vām indrāvaruṇā ghṛta̱ścuta̱s tābhi̍r dhatta̱ṁ yaja̍mānāya śikṣatam
English: the potent conqueror invincible in war him at whose birth the mighty ones  the kine who spread   sent their loud voices out heavens earths seat their loud voices out

Sanskrit: avo̍cāma maha̱te saubha̍gāya sa̱tyaṁ tve̱ṣābhyā̍m mahi̱māna̍m indri̱yam   a̱smān sv i̍ndrāvaruṇā ghṛta̱ścuta̱s tribhi̍ḥ sā̱ptebhi̍r avataṁ śubhas patī
English: o indra if a hundred heavens and if a hundred earths were thine  no not a thousand suns could match thee at thy birth not both the worlds o thunderer

Sanskrit: indrā̍varuṇā̱ yad ṛ̱ṣibhyo̍ manī̱ṣāṁ vā̱co ma̱tiṁ śru̱tam a̍datta̱m agre̍   yāni̱ sthānā̍ny asṛjanta̱ dhīrā̍ ya̱jñaṁ ta̍nvā̱nās tapa̍sā̱bhy a̍paśyam
English: thou hero hast performed thy hero deeds with might yea all with strength o strongest one  maghavan help us to a stable full of kine o thunderer with wondrous aids

Sanskrit: indrā̍varuṇā saumana̱sam adṛ̍ptaṁ rā̱yas poṣa̱ṁ yaja̍māneṣu dhattam   pra̱jām pu̱ṣṭim bhū̍tim a̱smāsu̍ dhattaṁ dīrghāyu̱tvāya̱ pra ti̍rataṁ na̱ āyu̍ḥ
English: let not a godless mortal gain this food o thou whose life is long!  but one who yokes the brighthued steeds the etasas even indra yoker of the bays

Sanskrit: yam ṛ̱tvijo̍ bahu̱dhā ka̱lpaya̍nta̱ḥ sace̍taso ya̱jñam i̱maṁ vaha̍nti   yo a̍nūcā̱no brā̍hma̱ṇo yu̱kta ā̍sī̱t kā svi̱t tatra̱ yaja̍mānasya sa̱ṁvit
English: i send you forth the song of praise for indu herogladdener  with hymn and plenty he invites you to complete the sacrifice

Sanskrit: eka̍ e̱vāgnir ba̍hu̱dhā sami̍ddha̱ eka̱ḥ sūryo̱ viśva̱m anu̱ prabhū̍taḥ   ekai̱voṣāḥ sarva̍m i̱daṁ vi bhā̱ty eka̱ṁ vā i̱daṁ vi ba̍bhūva̱ sarva̍m
English: thou wishest for thy kine a bull for those who long for his approach  for those who turn away from him lord of thy cows whom none may kill

Sanskrit: jyoti̍ṣmantaṁ ketu̱manta̍ṁ trica̱kraṁ su̱khaṁ ratha̍ṁ su̱ṣada̱m bhūri̍vāram   ci̱trāma̍ghā̱ yasya̱ yoge̍ 'dhijajñe̱ taṁ vā̍ṁ hu̱ve ati̍ rikta̱m piba̍dhyai
English: the dappled kine who stream with milk prepare his draught of soma juice  clans in the birthplace of the gods in the three luminous realms of heaven

Sanskrit: yu̱vaṁ de̍vā̱ kratu̍nā pū̱rvyeṇa̍ yu̱ktā rathe̍na tavi̱ṣaṁ ya̍jatrā   āga̍cchataṁ nāsatyā̱ śacī̍bhir i̱daṁ tṛ̱tīya̱ṁ sava̍nam pibāthaḥ
English: even as a car to give us aid we draw thee hither for our bliss  strong in thy deeds checking assault lord mightiest indra of the brave!

Sanskrit: yu̱vāṁ de̱vās traya̍ ekāda̱śāsa̍ḥ sa̱tyāḥ sa̱tyasya̍ dadṛśe pu̱rastā̍t   a̱smāka̍ṁ ya̱jñaṁ sava̍naṁ juṣā̱ṇā pā̱taṁ soma̍m aśvinā̱ dīdya̍gnī
English: great in thy power and wisdom strong with thought that comprehendeth all  thou hast filled full with majesty

Sanskrit: pa̱nāyya̱ṁ tad a̍śvinā kṛ̱taṁ vā̍ṁ vṛṣa̱bho di̱vo raja̍saḥ pṛthi̱vyāḥ   sa̱hasra̱ṁ śaṁsā̍ u̱ta ye gavi̍ṣṭau̱ sarvā̱m̐ it tām̐ upa̍ yātā̱ piba̍dhyai
English: thou very mighty one whose hands by virtue of thy greatness grasp  the golden bolt that breaks its way

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ vā̍m bhā̱go nihi̍to yajatre̱mā giro̍ nāsa̱tyopa̍ yātam   piba̍ta̱ṁ soma̱m madhu̍mantam a̱sme pra dā̱śvāṁsa̍m avata̱ṁ śacī̍bhiḥ
English: your lord of might that neer hath bent that ruleth over all mankind  i call that he as he is wont may aid the chariots and the men

Sanskrit: prati̍ te dasyave vṛka̱ rādho̍ ada̱rśy ahra̍yam   dyaur na pra̍thi̱nā śava̍ḥ
English: now pray we to these ksatriyas to the ādityas for their aid  these who are gracious to assist

Sanskrit: daśa̱ mahya̍m pautakra̱taḥ sa̱hasrā̱ dasya̍ve̱ vṛka̍ḥ   nityā̍d rā̱yo a̍maṁhata
English: may mitra bear us oer distress and varuṇa and aryaman  yea the ādityas as they know

Sanskrit: śa̱tam me̍ garda̱bhānā̍ṁ śa̱tam ūrṇā̍vatīnām   śa̱taṁ dā̱sām̐ ati̱ sraja̍ḥ
English: for wonderful and meet for praise is these ādityas saving help  to him who offers and prepares

Sanskrit: tatro̱ api̱ prāṇī̍yata pū̱takra̍tāyai̱ vya̍ktā   aśvā̍nā̱m in na yū̱thyā̍m
English: the mighty aid of you the great varuṇa mitra aryaman  we claim to be our sure defence

Sanskrit: ace̍ty a̱gniś ci̍ki̱tur ha̍vya̱vāṭ sa su̱madra̍thaḥ   a̱gniḥ śu̱kreṇa̍ śo̱ciṣā̍ bṛ̱hat sūro̍ arocata di̱vi sūryo̍ arocata
English: guard us ādityas still alive before the deadly weapon strike  are yc not they who hear our call?

Sanskrit: bhūrīd indra̍sya vī̱rya1̱̍ṁ vy akhya̍m a̱bhy āya̍ti   rādha̍s te dasyave vṛka
English: loud singing at the sacred rite where soma flows we priests invoke  with haste that he may help as the bard's cherisher indra who findeth wealth for you

Sanskrit: śa̱taṁ śve̱tāsa̍ u̱kṣaṇo̍ di̱vi tāro̱ na ro̍cante   ma̱hnā diva̱ṁ na ta̍stabhuḥ
English: whom with fair helm in rapture of the juice the firm resistless slayers hinder not  giver of glorious wealth to him who sing a his praise honouring him who toils and pours

Sanskrit: śa̱taṁ ve̱ṇūñ cha̱taṁ śuna̍ḥ śa̱taṁ carmā̍ṇi mlā̱tāni̍   śa̱tam me̍ balbajastu̱kā aru̍ṣīṇā̱ṁ catu̍ḥśatam
English: śakra who like a currycomb for horses or a golden goad  indra the vṛtraslayer urges eagerly the opening of the stall of kine

Sanskrit: su̱de̱vāḥ stha̍ kāṇvāyanā̱ vayo̍vayo vica̱ranta̍ḥ   aśvā̍so̱ na ca̍ṅkramata
English: who for the worshipper scatters forth ample wealth even though buried piled in heaps  may indra lord of bay steeds fairhelmed thunderer act at his pleasure as he lists

Sanskrit: ād it sā̱ptasya̍ carkira̱nn ānū̍nasya̱ mahi̱ śrava̍ḥ   śyāvī̍r atidhva̱san pa̱thaś cakṣu̍ṣā ca̱na sa̱ṁnaśe̍
English: hero whom many praise what thou hast longed for oven of old from men  all that we offer unto thee o indra now sacrifice laud effectual speech

Sanskrit: e̱tat ta̍ indra vī̱rya̍ṁ gī̱rbhir gṛ̱ṇanti̍ kā̱rava̍ḥ   te stobha̍nta̱ ūrja̍m āvan ghṛta̱ścuta̍m pau̱rāso̍ nakṣan dhī̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: though indra thou art called by men from east and west from north and south  come hither quickly with fleet steeds

Sanskrit: nakṣa̍nta̱ indra̱m ava̍se sukṛ̱tyayā̱ yeṣā̍ṁ su̱teṣu̱ manda̍se   yathā̍ saṁva̱rte ama̍do̱ yathā̍ kṛ̱śa e̱vāsme i̍ndra matsva
English: if in the effluence of heaven rich in its light thou takest joy  or in the sea in soma juice

Sanskrit: ā no̱ viśve̍ sa̱joṣa̍so̱ devā̍so̱ ganta̱nopa̍ naḥ   vasa̍vo ru̱drā ava̍se na̱ ā ga̍mañ chṛ̱ṇvantu̍ ma̱ruto̱ hava̍m
English: with songs i call thee great and wide even as a cow to profit us  indra to drink the somadraught

Sanskrit: pū̱ṣā viṣṇu̱r hava̍nam me̱ sara̍sva̱ty ava̍ntu sa̱pta sindha̍vaḥ   āpo̱ vāta̱ḥ parva̍tāso̱ vana̱spati̍ḥ śṛ̱ṇotu̍ pṛthi̱vī hava̍m
English: hither o indra let thy bays bear up and bring upon thy car  thy glory god! and majesty

Sanskrit: yad i̍ndra̱ rādho̱ asti̍ te̱ māgho̍nam maghavattama   tena̍ no bodhi sadha̱mādyo̍ vṛ̱dhe bhago̍ dā̱nāya̍ vṛtrahan
English: thou indra wouldst be sung and praised as great strong lordly in thy deeds  come hither drink our soma juice

Sanskrit: āji̍pate nṛpate̱ tvam id dhi no̱ vāja̱ ā va̍kṣi sukrato   vī̱tī hotrā̍bhir u̱ta de̱vavī̍tibhiḥ sasa̱vāṁso̱ vi śṛ̍ṇvire
English: we who have shed the soma and prepared the feast are calling thee  to sit on this our sacred grass

Sanskrit: santi̱ hy a1̱̍rya ā̱śiṣa̱ indra̱ āyu̱r janā̍nām   a̱smān na̍kṣasva maghava̱nn upāva̍se dhu̱kṣasva̍ pi̱pyuṣī̱m iṣa̍m
English: as indra thou art evermore the common lord of all alike  as such we invocate thee now

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ ta̍ indra̱ stome̍bhir vidhema̱ tvam a̱smāka̍ṁ śatakrato   mahi̍ sthū̱raṁ śa̍śa̱yaṁ rādho̱ ahra̍ya̱m praska̍ṇvāya̱ ni to̍śaya
English: the men with stones have milked for thee this nectar of the soma juice  indra be pleased with it and drink

Sanskrit: u̱pa̱maṁ tvā̍ ma̱ghonā̱ṁ jyeṣṭha̍ṁ ca vṛṣa̱bhāṇā̍m   pū̱rbhitta̍mam maghavann indra go̱vida̱m īśā̍naṁ rā̱ya ī̍mahe
English: may our hymns give thee great delight display thy bounty thunderer  drive off the enemies of prayer

Sanskrit: ya ā̱yuṁ kutsa̍m atithi̱gvam arda̍yo vāvṛdhā̱no di̱vedi̍ve   taṁ tvā̍ va̱yaṁ harya̍śvaṁ śa̱takra̍tuṁ vāja̱yanto̍ havāmahe
English: crush with thy foot the niggard churls who bring no gifts mighty art thou  there is not one to equal thee

Sanskrit: ā no̱ viśve̍ṣā̱ṁ rasa̱m madhva̍ḥ siñca̱ntv adra̍yaḥ   ye pa̍rā̱vati̍ sunvi̱re jane̱ṣv ā ye a̍rvā̱vatīnda̍vaḥ
English: thou art the lord of soma pressed soma impressed is also thine  thou art the sovran of the folk

Sanskrit: viśvā̱ dveṣā̍ṁsi ja̱hi cāva̱ cā kṛ̍dhi̱ viśve̍ sanva̱ntv ā vasu̍   śīṣṭe̍ṣu cit te madi̱rāso̍ a̱ṁśavo̱ yatrā̱ soma̍sya tṛ̱mpasi̍
English: come go thou forth dwelling in heaven and listening to the prayers of men  thou fillest both the heavens and earth

Sanskrit: indra̱ nedī̍ya̱ ed i̍hi mi̱tame̍dhābhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ   ā śa̍ṁtama̱ śaṁta̍mābhir a̱bhiṣṭi̍bhi̱r ā svā̍pe svā̱pibhi̍ḥ
English: even that hill with rocky heights with hundreds thousands held within  thou for thy worshippers brakest through

Sanskrit: ā̱ji̱tura̱ṁ satpa̍tiṁ vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇiṁ kṛ̱dhi pra̱jāsv ābha̍gam   pra sū ti̍rā̱ śacī̍bhi̱r ye ta̍ u̱kthina̱ḥ kratu̍m puna̱ta ā̍nu̱ṣak
English: we call on thee both night and day to taste the flowing soma juice  do thou fulfil our heart's desire

Sanskrit: yas te̱ sādhi̱ṣṭho 'va̍se̱ te syā̍ma̱ bhare̍ṣu te   va̱yaṁ hotrā̍bhir u̱ta de̱vahū̍tibhiḥ sasa̱vāṁso̍ manāmahe
English: where is that everyouthful steer strong necked and never yet bent down?  what brahman ministers to him?

Sanskrit: a̱haṁ hi te̍ harivo̱ brahma̍ vāja̱yur ā̱jiṁ yāmi̱ sado̱tibhi̍ḥ   tvām id e̱va tam ame̱ sam a̍śva̱yur ga̱vyur agre̍ mathī̱nām
English: to whose libation doth the steer betake him with delight therein?  who takes delight in indra now?

Sanskrit: yathā̱ manau̱ viva̍svati̱ soma̍ṁ śa̱krāpi̍baḥ su̱tam   yathā̍ tri̱te chanda̍ indra̱ jujo̍ṣasy ā̱yau mā̍dayase̱ sacā̍
English: with powers of mighty ones hath he ancient beloved been equipped  through whom the father manu made prayers efficacious with the gods

Sanskrit: pṛṣa̍dhre̱ medhye̍ māta̱riśva̱nīndra̍ suvā̱ne ama̍ndathāḥ   yathā̱ soma̱ṁ daśa̍śipre̱ daśo̍ṇye̱ syūma̍raśmā̱v ṛjū̍nasi
English: him maker of the sky let stones wet with the soma neer forsake  nor hymns and prayer that must be said

Sanskrit: ya u̱kthā keva̍lā da̱dhe yaḥ soma̍ṁ dhṛṣi̱tāpi̍bat   yasmai̱ viṣṇu̱s trīṇi̍ pa̱dā vi̍cakra̱ma upa̍ mi̱trasya̱ dharma̍bhiḥ
English: indra who knew full well disclosed the kine to the aṅgirases  this his great deed must be extolled

Sanskrit: yasya̱ tvam i̍ndra̱ stome̍ṣu cā̱kano̱ vāje̍ vājiñ chatakrato   taṁ tvā̍ va̱yaṁ su̱dughā̍m iva go̱duho̍ juhū̱masi̍ śrava̱syava̍ḥ
English: indra promoter of the song the sage's strengthener as of old  shall come to bless and succour us at presentation of this laud

Sanskrit: yo no̍ dā̱tā sa na̍ḥ pi̱tā ma̱hām̐ u̱gra ī̍śāna̱kṛt   ayā̍mann u̱gro ma̱ghavā̍ purū̱vasu̱r gor aśva̍sya̱ pra dā̍tu naḥ
English: now after their desire's intent the pious singers with the cry  of hail! have sung loud hymns to thee indra to gain a stall of kine

Sanskrit: yasmai̱ tvaṁ va̍so dā̱nāya̱ maṁha̍se̱ sa rā̱yas poṣa̍m invati   va̱sū̱yavo̱ vasu̍patiṁ śa̱takra̍tu̱ṁ stomai̱r indra̍ṁ havāmahe
English: with indra rest all deeds of might deeds done and yet to be performed  whom singers know devoid of guile

Sanskrit: ka̱dā ca̱na pra yu̍cchasy u̱bhe ni pā̍si̱ janma̍nī   turī̍yāditya̱ hava̍naṁ ta indri̱yam ā ta̍sthāv a̱mṛta̍ṁ di̱vi
English: when the five tribes with all their men to indra have sent out their voice  and when the priest hath strewn much grass this is the friend's own dwellingplace

Sanskrit: yasmai̱ tvam ma̍ghavann indra girvaṇa̱ḥ śikṣo̱ śikṣa̍si dā̱śuṣe̍   a̱smāka̱ṁ gira̍ u̱ta su̍ṣṭu̱tiṁ va̍so kaṇva̱vac chṛ̍ṇudhī̱ hava̍m
English: this praise is verily thine own thou hast performed these manly deeds  and sped the wheel upon its way

Sanskrit: astā̍vi̱ manma̍ pū̱rvyam brahmendrā̍ya vocata   pū̱rvīr ṛ̱tasya̍ bṛha̱tīr a̍nūṣata sto̱tur me̱dhā a̍sṛkṣata
English: at the oerflowing of this steer boldly he strode for life and took  soma as cattle take their corn

Sanskrit: sam indro̱ rāyo̍ bṛha̱tīr a̍dhūnuta̱ saṁ kṣo̱ṇī sam u̱ sūrya̍m   saṁ śu̱krāsa̱ḥ śuca̍ya̱ḥ saṁ gavā̍śira̱ḥ somā̱ indra̍m amandiṣuḥ
English: receiving this and craving help we who with you are dakṣa's sons  would fain exalt the maruts lord

Sanskrit: yathā̱ manau̱ sāṁva̍raṇau̱ soma̍m i̱ndrāpi̍baḥ su̱tam   nīpā̍tithau maghava̱n medhyā̍tithau̱ puṣṭi̍gau̱ śruṣṭi̍gau̱ sacā̍
English: offer ye up as praise to him that wherein indra takes delight  the somabringers magnify indra's great energy with hymns good are the gifts that indra gives

Sanskrit: pā̱rṣa̱dvā̱ṇaḥ praska̍ṇva̱ṁ sam a̍sādaya̱c chayā̍na̱ṁ jivri̱m uddhi̍tam   sa̱hasrā̍ṇy asiṣāsa̱d gavā̱m ṛṣi̱s tvoto̱ dasya̍ve̱ vṛka̍ḥ
English: sole among chiefs companionless impetuous and peerless he  hath waxen great oer many folk yea over all things born in might

Sanskrit: ya u̱kthebhi̱r na vi̱ndhate̍ ci̱kid ya ṛ̍ṣi̱coda̍naḥ   indra̱ṁ tam acchā̍ vada̱ navya̍syā ma̱ty ari̍ṣyanta̱ṁ na bhoja̍se
English: lord of swift bounty he will win een with a steed of worthless sort  this indra must be told of thee who wilt perform heroic deeds

Sanskrit: yasmā̍ a̱rkaṁ sa̱ptaśī̍rṣāṇam ānṛ̱cus tri̱dhātu̍m utta̱me pa̱de   sa tv i1̱̍mā viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni cikrada̱d ād ij ja̍niṣṭa̱ pauṁsya̍m
English: come to us hither let us pay devotions that enhance thy might  for which most potent! thou wouldst fain bless the man here who strives for fame

Sanskrit: yo no̍ dā̱tā vasū̍nā̱m indra̱ṁ taṁ hū̍mahe va̱yam   vi̱dmā hy a̍sya suma̱tiṁ navī̍yasīṁ ga̱mema̱ goma̍ti vra̱je
English: for thou o indra makest yet more bold the spirit of the bold  who with strong soma serveth thee still ready with his reverent prayers

Sanskrit: yasmai̱ tvaṁ va̍so dā̱nāya̱ śikṣa̍si̱ sa rā̱yas poṣa̍m aśnute   taṁ tvā̍ va̱yam ma̍ghavann indra girvaṇaḥ su̱tāva̍nto havāmahe
English: worthy of song he looketh down as a man looketh into wells  pleased with the somabringer's skill he maketh him his mate and friend

Sanskrit: ka̱dā ca̱na sta̱rīr a̍si̱ nendra̍ saścasi dā̱śuṣe̍   upo̱pen nu ma̍ghava̱n bhūya̱ in nu te̱ dāna̍ṁ de̱vasya̍ pṛcyate
English: in strength and wisdom all the gods indra have yielded unto thee  be thou the guard of all o thou whom many praise

Sanskrit: pra yo na̍na̱kṣe a̱bhy oja̍sā̱ krivi̍ṁ va̱dhaiḥ śuṣṇa̍ṁ nigho̱ṣaya̍n   ya̱ded asta̍mbhīt pra̱thaya̍nn a̱mūṁ diva̱m ād ij ja̍niṣṭa̱ pārthi̍vaḥ
English: praised indra is this might of thine best for the service of the gods  that thou with power dost slay vṛtra o lord of strength

Sanskrit: yasyā̱yaṁ viśva̱ āryo̱ dāsa̍ḥ śevadhi̱pā a̱riḥ   ti̱raś ci̍d a̱rye ruśa̍me̱ parī̍ravi̱ tubhyet so a̍jyate ra̱yiḥ
English: he makes the races of mankind like synods of the beauteous one  indra knows this his manifest deed and is renowned

Sanskrit: tu̱ra̱ṇyavo̱ madhu̍mantaṁ ghṛta̱ścuta̱ṁ viprā̍so a̱rkam ā̍nṛcuḥ   a̱sme ra̱yiḥ pa̍prathe̱ vṛṣṇya̱ṁ śavo̱ 'sme su̍vā̱nāsa̱ inda̍vaḥ
English: thy might o indra at its birth thee also and thy mental power  in thy care maghavan rich in kine! they have increased exceedingly

Sanskrit: pra su śru̱taṁ su̱rādha̍sa̱m arcā̍ śa̱kram a̱bhiṣṭa̍ye   yaḥ su̍nva̱te stu̍va̱te kāmya̱ṁ vasu̍ sa̱hasre̍ṇeva̱ maṁha̍te
English: both boonsmay indra hitherward turned listen to this prayer of ours  and mightiest maghavan with thought inclined to us come near to drink the soma juice

Sanskrit: śa̱tānī̍kā he̱tayo̍ asya du̱ṣṭarā̱ indra̍sya sa̱miṣo̍ ma̱hīḥ   gi̱rir na bhu̱jmā ma̱ghava̍tsu pinvate̱ yad ī̍ṁ su̱tā ama̍ndiṣuḥ
English: for him strong independent ruler heaven and earth have fashioned forth for power and might  thou seatest thee as first among thy peers in place for thy soul longs for soma juice

Sanskrit: yad ī̍ṁ su̱tāsa̱ inda̍vo̱ 'bhi pri̱yam ama̍ndiṣuḥ   āpo̱ na dhā̍yi̱ sava̍nam ma̱ ā va̍so̱ dughā̍ i̱vopa̍ dā̱śuṣe̍
English: fill thyself full o lord of wealth o indra with the juice we shed  we know thee lord of bay steeds victor in the fight vanquishing een the invincible

Sanskrit: a̱ne̱hasa̍ṁ vo̱ hava̍mānam ū̱taye̱ madhva̍ḥ kṣaranti dhī̱taya̍ḥ   ā tvā̍ vaso̱ hava̍mānāsa̱ inda̍va̱ upa̍ sto̱treṣu̍ dadhire
English: changeless in truth o maghavan indra let it be as thou in wisdom willest it  may we o fair of check win booty with thine aid o thunderer swiftly seeking it

Sanskrit: ā na̱ḥ some̍ svadhva̱ra i̍yā̱no atyo̱ na to̍śate   yaṁ te̍ svadāva̱n svada̍nti gū̱rtaya̍ḥ pau̱re cha̍ndayase̱ hava̍m
English: indra with all thy saving helps give us assistance lord of power  for after thee we follow even as glorious bliss thee hero finderout of wealth

Sanskrit: pra vī̱ram u̱graṁ vivi̍ciṁ dhana̱spṛta̱ṁ vibhū̍ti̱ṁ rādha̍so ma̱haḥ   u̱drīva̍ vajrinn ava̱to va̍sutva̱nā sadā̍ pīpetha dā̱śuṣe̍
English: increaser of our steeds and multiplying kine a golden well o god art thou  for no one may impair the gifts laid up in thee bring me whatever thing i ask

Sanskrit: yad dha̍ nū̱nam pa̍rā̱vati̱ yad vā̍ pṛthi̱vyāṁ di̱vi   yu̱jā̱na i̍ndra̱ hari̍bhir mahemata ṛ̱ṣva ṛ̱ṣvebhi̱r ā ga̍hi
English: for thoucome to the worshipper!wilt find great wealth to make us rich  fill thyself full o maghavan for gain of kine full indra for the gain of steeds

Sanskrit: ra̱thi̱rāso̱ hara̍yo̱ ye te̍ a̱sridha̱ ojo̱ vāta̍sya̱ pipra̍ti   yebhi̱r ni dasyu̱m manu̍ṣo ni̱ghoṣa̍yo̱ yebhi̱ḥ sva̍ḥ pa̱rīya̍se
English: thou as thy gift bestowest many hundred herds yea many thousands dost thou give  with singers' hymns have we brought the fortrender near singing to indra for his grace

Sanskrit: e̱tāva̍tas te vaso vi̱dyāma̍ śūra̱ navya̍saḥ   yathā̱ prāva̱ eta̍śa̱ṁ kṛtvye̱ dhane̱ yathā̱ vaśa̱ṁ daśa̍vraje
English: whether the simple or the sage indra have offered praise to thee  he śatakratu! by his love hath gladdened thee ambitious! ever pressing on!

Sanskrit: yathā̱ kaṇve̍ maghava̱n medhe̍ adhva̱re dī̱rghanī̍the̱ damū̍nasi   yathā̱ gośa̍rye̱ asi̍ṣāso adrivo̱ mayi̍ go̱traṁ ha̍ri̱śriya̍m
English: if he the strong of arm the breakerdown of forts the great destroyer hear my call  we seeking riches cry to indra lord of wealth to śatakratu with our lauds

Sanskrit: a̱bhi pra va̍ḥ su̱rādha̍sa̱m indra̍m arca̱ yathā̍ vi̱de   yo ja̍ri̱tṛbhyo̍ ma̱ghavā̍ purū̱vasu̍ḥ sa̱hasre̍ṇeva̱ śikṣa̍ti
English: agni come hither with thy fires; we choose thee as invoking priest  let the extended ladle full of oil balm thee best priest to sit on sacred grass

Sanskrit: śa̱tānī̍keva̱ pra ji̍gāti dhṛṣṇu̱yā hanti̍ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ dā̱śuṣe̍   gi̱rer i̍va̱ pra rasā̍ asya pinvire̱ datrā̍ṇi puru̱bhoja̍saḥ
English: for unto thee o aṅgiras o son of strength move ladles in the sacrifice  to agni child of force whose locks drop oil we seek foremost in sacrificial rites

Sanskrit: ā tvā̍ su̱tāsa̱ inda̍vo̱ madā̱ ya i̍ndra girvaṇaḥ   āpo̱ na va̍jri̱nn anv o̱kya1̱̍ṁ sara̍ḥ pṛ̱ṇanti̍ śūra̱ rādha̍se
English: agni thou art disposer sage herald bright god! and worshipful  best offerer cheerful to be praised in holy rites pure lord! by singers with their hymns

Sanskrit: a̱ne̱hasa̍m pra̱tara̍ṇaṁ vi̱vakṣa̍ṇa̱m madhva̱ḥ svādi̍ṣṭham īm piba   ā yathā̍ mandasā̱naḥ ki̱rāsi̍ na̱ḥ pra kṣu̱dreva̱ tmanā̍ dhṛ̱ṣat
English: most youthful and eternal bring the longing gods to me the guileless for the feast  come vasu to the banquet that is wellprepared rejoice thee gracious with our songs

Sanskrit: ā na̱ḥ stoma̱m upa̍ dra̱vad dhi̍yā̱no aśvo̱ na sotṛ̍bhiḥ   yaṁ te̍ svadhāvan sva̱daya̍nti dhe̱nava̱ indra̱ kaṇve̍ṣu rā̱taya̍ḥ
English: famed art thou agni far and wide preserver righteous and a sage  the holy singers o refulgent kindled god! arrangers call on thee to come

Sanskrit: u̱graṁ na vī̱raṁ nama̱sopa̍ sedima̱ vibhū̍ti̱m akṣi̍tāvasum   u̱drīva̍ vajrinn ava̱to na si̍ñca̱te kṣara̍ntīndra dhī̱taya̍ḥ
English: shine most resplendent! blaze send bliss unto the folk and to thy worshipper  great art thou  so may my princes with good fires subduing foes rest in the keeping of the gods

Sanskrit: yad dha̍ nū̱naṁ yad vā̍ ya̱jñe yad vā̍ pṛthi̱vyām adhi̍   ato̍ no ya̱jñam ā̱śubhi̍r mahemata u̱gra u̱grebhi̱r ā ga̍hi
English: o agni as thou burnest down to earth even highgrown underwood  so bright as mitra is burn him who injures us him who plots ill against thy friend

Sanskrit: a̱ji̱rāso̱ hara̍yo̱ ye ta̍ ā̱śavo̱ vātā̍ iva prasa̱kṣiṇa̍ḥ   yebhi̱r apa̍tya̱m manu̍ṣaḥ pa̱rīya̍se̱ yebhi̱r viśva̱ṁ sva̍r dṛ̱śe
English: give us not as a prey to mortal enemy nor to the wicked friend of fiends  with conquering guards auspicious unassailable protect us o most youthful god

Sanskrit: e̱tāva̍tas ta īmaha̱ indra̍ su̱mnasya̱ goma̍taḥ   yathā̱ prāvo̍ maghava̱n medhyā̍tithi̱ṁ yathā̱ nīpā̍tithi̱ṁ dhane̍
English: protect us agni through the first protect us through the second hymn  protect us through three hymns o lord of power and might through four hymns vasu guard thou us

Sanskrit: yathā̱ kaṇve̍ maghavan tra̱sada̍syavi̱ yathā̍ pa̱kthe daśa̍vraje   yathā̱ gośa̍rye̱ asa̍nor ṛ̱jiśva̱nīndra̱ goma̱d dhira̍ṇyavat
English: preserve us from each fiend who brings the gods no gift preserve thou us in deeds of strength  for we possess in thee the nearest friend of all for service of the gods and weal

Sanskrit: svā̱dor a̍bhakṣi̱ vaya̍saḥ sume̱dhāḥ svā̱dhyo̍ varivo̱vitta̍rasya   viśve̱ yaṁ de̱vā u̱ta martyā̍so̱ madhu̍ bru̱vanto̍ a̱bhi sa̱ṁcara̍nti
English: wisely have i enjoyed the savoury viand religiousthoughted best to find out treasure  the food to which all deities and mortals calling it meath gather themselves together

Sanskrit: a̱ntaś ca̱ prāgā̱ adi̍tir bhavāsy avayā̱tā hara̍so̱ daivya̍sya   inda̱v indra̍sya sa̱khyaṁ ju̍ṣā̱ṇaḥ śrauṣṭī̍va̱ dhura̱m anu̍ rā̱ya ṛ̍dhyāḥ
English: tlou shalt be aditi as thou hast entered within appeaser of celestial anger  indu enjoying indra's friendship bring usas a swift steed the carforward to riches

Sanskrit: apā̍ma̱ soma̍m a̱mṛtā̍ abhū̱māga̍nma̱ jyoti̱r avi̍dāma de̱vān   kiṁ nū̱nam a̱smān kṛ̍ṇava̱d arā̍ti̱ḥ kim u̍ dhū̱rtir a̍mṛta̱ martya̍sya
English: we have drunk soma and become immortal; we have attained the light the gods discovered  now what may foeman's malice do to harm us? what o immortal mortal man's deception?

Sanskrit: śaṁ no̍ bhava hṛ̱da ā pī̱ta i̍ndo pi̱teva̍ soma sū̱nave̍ su̱śeva̍ḥ   sakhe̍va̱ sakhya̍ uruśaṁsa̱ dhīra̱ḥ pra ṇa̱ āyu̍r jī̱vase̍ soma tārīḥ
English: absorbed into the heart be sweet o indu as a kind father to his son o soma  as a wise friend to friend do thou wideruler o soma lengthen out our days for living

Sanskrit: i̱me mā̍ pī̱tā ya̱śasa̍ uru̱ṣyavo̱ ratha̱ṁ na gāva̱ḥ sam a̍nāha̱ parva̍su   te mā̍ rakṣantu vi̱srasa̍ś ca̱ritrā̍d u̱ta mā̱ srāmā̍d yavaya̱ntv inda̍vaḥ
English: these glorious drops that give me freedom have i drunk closely they knit my joints as straps secure a car  let them protect my foot from slipping on the way yea let the drops i drink preserve me from disease

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ na mā̍ mathi̱taṁ saṁ di̍dīpa̱ḥ pra ca̍kṣaya kṛṇu̱hi vasya̍so naḥ   athā̱ hi te̱ mada̱ ā so̍ma̱ manye̍ re̱vām̐ i̍va̱ pra ca̍rā pu̱ṣṭim accha̍
English: make me shine bright like fire produced by friction give us a clearer sight and make us better  for in carouse i think of thee o soma shall i as a rich man attain to comfort?

Sanskrit: i̱ṣi̱reṇa̍ te̱ mana̍sā su̱tasya̍ bhakṣī̱mahi̱ pitrya̍syeva rā̱yaḥ   soma̍ rāja̱n pra ṇa̱ āyū̍ṁṣi tārī̱r ahā̍nīva̱ sūryo̍ vāsa̱rāṇi̍
English: may we enjoy with an enlivened spirit the juice thou givest like ancestral riches  o soma king prolong thou our existence as sūrya makes the shining days grow longer

Sanskrit: soma̍ rājan mṛ̱ḻayā̍ naḥ sva̱sti tava̍ smasi vra̱tyā̱3̱̍s tasya̍ viddhi   ala̍rti̱ dakṣa̍ u̱ta ma̱nyur i̍ndo̱ mā no̍ a̱ryo a̍nukā̱mam parā̍ dāḥ
English: king soma favour us and make us prosper we are thy devotees; of this be mindful  spirit and power are fresh in us o indu give us not up unto our foeman's pleasure

English: o worshipped with oblations pure agni we call on thee as erst  did bhṛgu manus aṅgiras

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hy a̍gne a̱gninā̱ vipro̱ vipre̍ṇa̱ san sa̱tā   sakhā̱ sakhyā̍ sami̱dhyase̍
English: for thou o agni by the fire sage by the sage good by the good  friend by the friend art lighted up

Sanskrit: sa tvaṁ viprā̍ya dā̱śuṣe̍ ra̱yiṁ de̍hi saha̱sriṇa̍m   agne̍ vī̱rava̍tī̱m iṣa̍m
English: so wealth in thousands food with store of heroes give thou to the sage  o agni to the worshipper

Sanskrit: agne̱ bhrāta̱ḥ saha̍skṛta̱ rohi̍daśva̱ śuci̍vrata   i̱maṁ stoma̍ṁ juṣasva me
English: o agni brother made by strength lord of red steeds and brilliant sway  take pleasure in this laud of mine

Sanskrit: u̱ta tvā̍gne̱ mama̱ stuto̍ vā̱śrāya̍ prati̱harya̍te   go̱ṣṭhaṁ gāva̍ ivāśata
English: my praises agni go to thee as the cows seek the stall to meet  the lowing calf that longs for milk

Sanskrit: tubhya̱ṁ tā a̍ṅgirastama̱ viśvā̍ḥ sukṣi̱taya̱ḥ pṛtha̍k   agne̱ kāmā̍ya yemire
English: agni best aṅgiras to thee all people who have pleasant homes  apart have turned as to their wish

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ dhī̱bhir ma̍nī̱ṣiṇo̱ medhi̍rāso vipa̱ścita̍ḥ   a̱dma̱sadyā̍ya hinvire
English: the sages skilled in holy song and thinkers with their thoughts have urged  agni to share the sacred feast

Sanskrit: taṁ tvām ajme̍ṣu vā̱jina̍ṁ tanvā̱nā a̍gne adhva̱ram   vahni̱ṁ hotā̍ram īḻate
English: so agni unto thee the priest invoker strong in forays pray  those who spin out the sacrifice

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱trā hi sa̱dṛṅṅ asi̱ viśo̱ viśvā̱ anu̍ pra̱bhuḥ   sa̱matsu̍ tvā havāmahe
English: in many a place the same in look art thou a prince oer all the tribes  in battles we invoke thine aid

Sanskrit: tam ī̍ḻiṣva̱ ya āhu̍to̱ 'gnir vi̱bhrāja̍te ghṛ̱taiḥ   i̱maṁ na̍ḥ śṛṇava̱d dhava̍m
English: pray thou to agni pray to him who blazes served with sacred oil  let him give ear to this our call

Sanskrit: taṁ tvā̍ va̱yaṁ ha̍vāmahe śṛ̱ṇvanta̍ṁ jā̱tave̍dasam   agne̱ ghnanta̱m apa̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: we call on thee as such as one who hears as jātavedas one  agni! who beats away our foes

Sanskrit: vi̱śāṁ rājā̍na̱m adbhu̍ta̱m adhya̍kṣa̱ṁ dharma̍ṇām i̱mam   a̱gnim ī̍ḻe̱ sa u̍ śravat
English: i pray to agni king of men the wonderful the president  of holy laws may he give ear

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ vi̱śvāyu̍vepasa̱m marya̱ṁ na vā̱jina̍ṁ hi̱tam   sapti̱ṁ na vā̍jayāmasi
English: him like a bridegroom him who stirs all people like a noble horse  like a fleet steed we instigate

Sanskrit: ghnan mṛ̱dhrāṇy apa̱ dviṣo̱ daha̱n rakṣā̍ṁsi vi̱śvahā̍   agne̍ ti̱gmena̍ dīdihi
English: slaying things deadly burning up foes rākṣasas on every side  shine agni with thy sharpened flame

Sanskrit: yaṁ tvā̱ janā̍sa indha̱te ma̍nu̱ṣvad a̍ṅgirastama   agne̱ sa bo̍dhi me̱ vaca̍ḥ
English: thou whom the people kindle even as manus did best aṅgiras!  o agni mark thou this my speech

Sanskrit: yad a̍gne divi̱jā asy a̍psu̱jā vā̍ sahaskṛta   taṁ tvā̍ gī̱rbhir ha̍vāmahe
English: o agni made by strength! be thou born in the heavens or born in floods  as such we call on thee with songs

Sanskrit: tubhya̱ṁ ghet te janā̍ i̱me viśvā̍ḥ sukṣi̱taya̱ḥ pṛtha̍k   dhā̱siṁ hi̍nva̱nty atta̍ve
English: yea all the people all the folk who have good dwellings each apart  send food for thee to eat thereof

Sanskrit: te ghed a̍gne svā̱dhyo 'hā̱ viśvā̍ nṛ̱cakṣa̍saḥ   tara̍ntaḥ syāma du̱rgahā̍
English: o agni so may we devout gazed at by men throughout our days  pass lightly over all distress

Sanskrit: a̱gnim ma̱ndram pu̍rupri̱yaṁ śī̱ram pā̍va̱kaśo̍ciṣam   hṛ̱dbhir ma̱ndrebhi̍r īmahe
English: we venerate with cheerful hearts the cheerful agni dear to all  burning with purifying flame

Sanskrit: sa tvam a̍gne vi̱bhāva̍suḥ sṛ̱jan sūryo̱ na ra̱śmibhi̍ḥ   śardha̱n tamā̍ṁsi jighnase
English: so thou o agni rich in light beaming like sūrya with thy rays  boldly demolishest the gloom

Sanskrit: tat te̍ sahasva īmahe dā̱traṁ yan nopa̱dasya̍ti   tvad a̍gne̱ vārya̱ṁ vasu̍
English: we pray to thee for this thy gift victor the gift that faileth not  o agni choicest wealth from thee

Sanskrit: asta̍bhnā̱d dyām asu̍ro vi̱śvave̍dā̱ ami̍mīta vari̱māṇa̍m pṛthi̱vyāḥ   āsī̍da̱d viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni sa̱mrāḍ viśvet tāni̱ varu̍ṇasya vra̱tāni̍
English: lord of all wealth the asura propped the heavens and measured out the broad earth's wide expanses  he king supreme approached all living creatures all these are varuṇa's holy operations

Sanskrit: e̱vā va̍ndasva̱ varu̍ṇam bṛ̱hanta̍ṁ nama̱syā dhīra̍m a̱mṛta̍sya go̱pām   sa na̱ḥ śarma̍ tri̱varū̍tha̱ṁ vi ya̍ṁsat pā̱taṁ no̍ dyāvāpṛthivī u̱pasthe̍
English: so humbly worship varuṇa the mighty revere the wise guard of world immortal  may he vouchsafe us triplybarred protection o earth and heaven within your lap preserve us

Sanskrit: i̱māṁ dhiya̱ṁ śikṣa̍māṇasya deva̱ kratu̱ṁ dakṣa̍ṁ varuṇa̱ saṁ śi̍śādhi   yayāti̱ viśvā̍ duri̱tā tare̍ma su̱tarmā̍ṇa̱m adhi̱ nāva̍ṁ ruhema
English: sharpen this song of him who strives his utmost sharpen god varuṇa his strength and insight;  may we ascend the ship that bears us safely whereby we may pass over all misfortune

Sanskrit: ā vā̱ṁ grāvā̍ṇo aśvinā dhī̱bhir viprā̍ acucyavuḥ   nāsa̍tyā̱ soma̍pītaye̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: aśvins with songs the singer stones have made you hasten hitherward  nāsatyas to the somadraught let all the others die away

Sanskrit: yathā̍ vā̱m atri̍r aśvinā gī̱rbhir vipro̱ ajo̍havīt   nāsa̍tyā̱ soma̍pītaye̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: as the sage atri with his hymns o aśvins called you eagerly  nāsatyas to the somadraught let all the others die away

Sanskrit: e̱vā vā̍m ahva ū̱taye̱ yathāhu̍vanta̱ medhi̍rāḥ   nāsa̍tyā̱ soma̍pītaye̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: so have i called you to our aid even as the wise have called of old  nāsatyas to the somadraught let all the others die away

Sanskrit: a̱smā ū̱ ṣu prabhū̍taye̱ varu̍ṇāya ma̱rudbhyo 'rcā̍ vi̱duṣṭa̍rebhyaḥ   yo dhī̱tā mānu̍ṣāṇām pa̱śvo gā i̍va̱ rakṣa̍ti̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: to make this varuṇa come forth sing thou a song unto the band of maruts wiser than thyself  this varuṇa who guardeth well the thoughts of men like herds of kine  let all the others die away

Sanskrit: tam ū̱ ṣu sa̍ma̱nā gi̱rā pi̍tṝ̱ṇāṁ ca̱ manma̍bhiḥ   nā̱bhā̱kasya̱ praśa̍stibhi̱r yaḥ sindhū̍nā̱m upo̍da̱ye sa̱ptasva̍sā̱ sa ma̍dhya̱mo nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: him altogether praise i with the song and hymns our fathers sang and with nabhāka's eulogies  him dwelling at the rivers source surrounded by his sisters seven

Sanskrit: sa kṣapa̱ḥ pari̍ ṣasvaje̱ ny u1̱̍sro mā̱yayā̍ dadhe̱ sa viśva̱m pari̍ darśa̱taḥ   tasya̱ venī̱r anu̍ vra̱tam u̱ṣas ti̱sro a̍vardhaya̱n nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: the nights he hath encompassed and stablished the morns with magic art visible over all is he  his dear ones following his law have prospered the three dawns for him

Sanskrit: yaḥ ka̱kubho̍ nidhāra̱yaḥ pṛ̍thi̱vyām adhi̍ darśa̱taḥ   sa mātā̍ pū̱rvyam pa̱daṁ tad varu̍ṇasya̱ saptya̱ṁ sa hi go̱pā i̱veryo̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: he visible oer all the earth stablished the quarters of the sky  he measured out the eastern place that is the fold of varuṇa like a strong herdsman is the god

Sanskrit: yo dha̱rtā bhuva̍nānā̱ṁ ya u̱srāṇā̍m apī̱cyā̱3̱̍ veda̱ nāmā̍ni̱ guhyā̍   sa ka̱viḥ kāvyā̍ pu̱ru rū̱paṁ dyaur i̍va puṣyati̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: he who supports the worlds of life he who well knows the hidden names mysterious of the morning beams  he cherishes much wisdom sage as heaven brings forth each varied form

Sanskrit: yasmi̱n viśvā̍ni̱ kāvyā̍ ca̱kre nābhi̍r iva śri̱tā   tri̱taṁ jū̱tī sa̍paryata vra̱je gāvo̱ na sa̱ṁyuje̍ yu̱je aśvā̍m̐ ayukṣata̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: in whom all wisdom centres as the nave is set within the wheel  haste ye to honour trita as kine haste to gather in the fold even as they muster steeds to yoke

Sanskrit: ya ā̱sv atka̍ ā̱śaye̱ viśvā̍ jā̱tāny e̍ṣām   pari̱ dhāmā̍ni̱ marmṛ̍śa̱d varu̍ṇasya pu̱ro gaye̱ viśve̍ de̱vā anu̍ vra̱taṁ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: he wraps these regions as a robe; he contemplates the tribes of gods and all the works of mortal men  before the home of varuṇa all the gods follow his decree

Sanskrit: sa sa̍mu̱dro a̍pī̱cya̍s tu̱ro dyām i̍va rohati̱ ni yad ā̍su̱ yaju̍r da̱dhe   sa mā̱yā a̱rcinā̍ pa̱dāstṛ̍ṇā̱n nāka̱m āru̍ha̱n nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: he is an ocean farremoved yet through the heaven to him ascends the worship which these realms possess  with his bright foot he overthrew their magic and went up to heaven

Sanskrit: yasya̍ śve̱tā vi̍cakṣa̱ṇā ti̱sro bhūmī̍r adhikṣi̱taḥ   trir utta̍rāṇi pa̱pratu̱r varu̍ṇasya dhru̱vaṁ sada̱ḥ sa sa̍ptā̱nām i̍rajyati̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: ruler whose bright farseeing rays pervading all three earths have filled the three superior realms of heaven  firm is the seat of varuṇa over the seven he rules as king

Sanskrit: yaḥ śve̱tām̐ adhi̍nirṇijaś ca̱kre kṛ̱ṣṇām̐ anu̍ vra̱tā   sa dhāma̍ pū̱rvyam ma̍me̱ yaḥ ska̱mbhena̱ vi roda̍sī a̱jo na dyām adhā̍raya̱n nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: who after his decree oerspread the dark ones with a robe of light;  who measured out the ancient seat who pillared both the worlds apart as the unborn supported heaven let all the others die away
