English: indra and agni surely ye as conquerors will give us wealth  whereby in fight we may oercome that which is strong and firmly fixed as agni burns the woods with wind let all the others die away

Sanskrit: na̱hi vā̍ṁ va̱vrayā̍ma̱he 'thendra̱m id ya̍jāmahe̱ śavi̍ṣṭhaṁ nṛ̱ṇāṁ nara̍m   sa na̍ḥ ka̱dā ci̱d arva̍tā̱ gama̱d ā vāja̍sātaye̱ gama̱d ā me̱dhasā̍taye̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: we set no snares to tangle you; indra we worship and adore hero of heroes mightiest  once may he come unto us with his steed come unto us to win us strength and to complete the sacrifice

Sanskrit: tā hi madhya̱m bharā̍ṇām indrā̱gnī a̍dhikṣi̱taḥ   tā u̍ kavitva̱nā ka̱vī pṛ̱cchyamā̍nā sakhīya̱te saṁ dhī̱tam a̍śnutaṁ narā̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: for famous indraagni ye are dwellers in the midst of frays  sages in wisdom ye are knit to him who seeketh you as friends heroes bestow on him his wish

Sanskrit: a̱bhy a̍rca nabhāka̱vad i̍ndrā̱gnī ya̱jasā̍ gi̱rā   yayo̱r viśva̍m i̱daṁ jaga̍d i̱yaṁ dyauḥ pṛ̍thi̱vī ma̱hy u1̱̍pasthe̍ bibhṛ̱to vasu̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: nabhākalike with sacred song indra's and agni's praise i sing  theirs to whom all this world belongs this heaven and this mighty earth which bear rich treasure in their lap

Sanskrit: pra brahmā̍ṇi nabhāka̱vad i̍ndrā̱gnibhyā̍m irajyata   yā sa̱ptabu̍dhnam arṇa̱vaṁ ji̱hmabā̍ram aporṇu̱ta indra̱ īśā̍na̱ oja̍sā̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: to indra and to agni send your prayers as was nabhāka's wont  who oped with sideway opening the sea with its foundations sevenindra all powerful in his might

Sanskrit: api̍ vṛśca purāṇa̱vad vra̱tate̍r iva guṣpi̱tam ojo̍ dā̱sasya̍ dambhaya   va̱yaṁ tad a̍sya̱ sambhṛ̍ta̱ṁ vasv indre̍ṇa̱ vi bha̍jemahi̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: tear thou asunder as of old like tangles of a creeping plant  demolish thou the dāsa's might may we with indra's help divide the treasure he hath gathered up

Sanskrit: yad i̍ndrā̱gnī janā̍ i̱me vi̱hvaya̍nte̱ tanā̍ gi̱rā   a̱smāke̍bhi̱r nṛbhi̍r va̱yaṁ sā̍sa̱hyāma̍ pṛtanya̱to va̍nu̱yāma̍ vanuṣya̱to nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: what time with this same song these men call indraagni sundry ways  may we with our own heroes quell those who provoke us to the fight and conquer those who strive with us

Sanskrit: yā nu śve̱tāv a̱vo di̱va u̱ccarā̍ta̱ upa̱ dyubhi̍ḥ   i̱ndrā̱gnyor anu̍ vra̱tam uhā̍nā yanti̱ sindha̍vo̱ yān sī̍m ba̱ndhād amu̍ñcatā̱ṁ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: the two refulgent with their beams rise and come downward from the sky  by indra's and by agni's hest flowing away the rivers run which they released from their restraint

Sanskrit: pū̱rvīṣ ṭa̍ i̱ndropa̍mātayaḥ pū̱rvīr u̱ta praśa̍staya̱ḥ sūno̍ hi̱nvasya̍ harivaḥ   vasvo̍ vī̱rasyā̱pṛco̱ yā nu sādha̍nta no̱ dhiyo̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: o indra many are thine aids many thy ways of guiding us  lord of the bay steeds hinva's son to a good hero come our prayers which soon shall have accomplishment

Sanskrit: taṁ śi̍śītā suvṛ̱ktibhi̍s tve̱ṣaṁ satvā̍nam ṛ̱gmiya̍m   u̱to nu ci̱d ya oja̍sā̱ śuṣṇa̍syā̱ṇḍāni̱ bheda̍ti̱ jeṣa̱t sva̍rvatīr a̱po nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: inspire him with your holy hymns the hero bright and glorious  him who with might demolisheth even the brood of śuṣṇa and winneth for us the heavenly streams

Sanskrit: taṁ śi̍śītā svadhva̱raṁ sa̱tyaṁ satvā̍nam ṛ̱tviya̍m   u̱to nu ci̱d ya oha̍ta ā̱ṇḍā śuṣṇa̍sya̱ bheda̱ty ajai̱ḥ sva̍rvatīr a̱po nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: inspire him worshipped with fair rites the glorious hero truly brave  he brake in pieces śuṣṇa's brood who still expected not the stroke and won for us the heavenly streams let all the others die away

Sanskrit: e̱vendrā̱gnibhyā̍m pitṛ̱van navī̍yo mandhātṛ̱vad a̍ṅgira̱svad a̍vāci   tri̱dhātu̍nā̱ śarma̍ṇā pātam a̱smān va̱yaṁ syā̍ma̱ pata̍yo rayī̱ṇām
English: thus have we sung anew to indraagni as sang our sires aṅgirases and mandhātar  guard us with triple shelter and preserve us may we be masters of a store of riches

Sanskrit: a̱gnim a̍stoṣy ṛ̱gmiya̍m a̱gnim ī̱ḻā ya̱jadhyai̍   a̱gnir de̱vām̐ a̍naktu na u̱bhe hi vi̱dathe̍ ka̱vir a̱ntaś cara̍ti dū̱tya1̱̍ṁ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: the glorious agni have i praised and worshipped with the sacred food  may agni deck the gods for us between both gatheringplaces he goes on his embassy the sage may all the others die away

Sanskrit: ny a̍gne̱ navya̍sā̱ vaca̍s ta̱nūṣu̱ śaṁsa̍m eṣām   ny arā̍tī̱ rarā̍vṇā̱ṁ viśvā̍ a̱ryo arā̍tīr i̱to yu̍cchantv ā̱muro̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: agni burn down the word within their bodies through our newest speech  all hatreds of the godless all the wicked man's malignities away let the destroyers go may all the others die away

Sanskrit: agne̱ manmā̍ni̱ tubhya̱ṁ kaṁ ghṛ̱taṁ na ju̍hva ā̱sani̍   sa de̱veṣu̱ pra ci̍kiddhi̱ tvaṁ hy asi̍ pū̱rvyaḥ śi̱vo dū̱to vi̱vasva̍to̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: agni i offer hymns to thee like holy oil within thy mouth  acknowledge them among the gods for thou art the most excellent the worshipper's blissful messenger let all the others die away

Sanskrit: tatta̍d a̱gnir vayo̍ dadhe̱ yathā̍yathā kṛpa̱ṇyati̍   ū̱rjāhu̍ti̱r vasū̍nā̱ṁ śaṁ ca̱ yoś ca̱ mayo̍ dadhe̱ viśva̍syai de̱vahū̍tyai̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: agni bestows all vital power even as each man supplicates  he brings the vasus strengthening gifts and grants delight in rest and stir for every calling on the gods let all the others die away

Sanskrit: sa ci̍keta̱ sahī̍yasā̱gniś ci̱treṇa̱ karma̍ṇā   sa hotā̱ śaśva̍tīnā̱ṁ dakṣi̍ṇābhir a̱bhīvṛ̍ta i̱noti̍ ca pratī̱vya1̱̍ṁ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: agni hath made himself renowned by wonderful victorious act  he is the priest of all the tribes chosen with sacrificial meeds he urges deities to receive let all the others die away

Sanskrit: a̱gnir jā̱tā de̱vānā̍m a̱gnir ve̍da̱ martā̍nām apī̱cya̍m   a̱gniḥ sa dra̍viṇo̱dā a̱gnir dvārā̱ vy ū̍rṇute̱ svā̍huto̱ navī̍yasā̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: agni knows all that springs from gods he knows the mystery of men  giver of wealth is agni he uncloses both the doors to us when worshipped with our newest gift let all the others die away

Sanskrit: a̱gnir de̱veṣu̱ saṁva̍su̱ḥ sa vi̱kṣu ya̱jñiyā̱sv ā   sa mu̱dā kāvyā̍ pu̱ru viśva̱m bhūme̍va puṣyati de̱vo de̱veṣu̍ ya̱jñiyo̱ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me
English: agni inhabiteth with gods and men who offer sacrifice  he cherisheth with great delight much wisdom as all things that be god among gods adorable may all the others die away

Sanskrit: yo a̱gniḥ sa̱ptamā̍nuṣaḥ śri̱to viśve̍ṣu̱ sindhu̍ṣu   tam āga̍nma tripa̱styam ma̍ndhā̱tur da̍syu̱hanta̍mam a̱gniṁ ya̱jñeṣu̍ pū̱rvyaṁ nabha̍ntām anya̱ke sa̍me

Sanskrit: sa tvaṁ no̍ deva̱ mana̍sā̱ vāyo̍ mandā̱no a̍gri̱yaḥ   kṛ̱dhi vājā̍m̐ a̱po dhiya̍ḥ
English: so glad and joyful in thine heart do thou god vāyu first of all  vouchsafe us water strength and thought

Sanskrit: tā vā̱ṁ viśva̍sya go̱pā de̱vā de̱veṣu̍ ya̱jñiyā̍   ṛ̱tāvā̍nā yajase pū̱tada̍kṣasā
English: i worship you who guard this all gods holiest among the gods  you faithful to the law whose power is sanctified

Sanskrit: mi̱trā tanā̱ na ra̱thyā̱3̱̍ varu̍ṇo̱ yaś ca̍ su̱kratu̍ḥ   sa̱nāt su̍jā̱tā tana̍yā dhṛ̱tavra̍tā
English: so too like charioteers are they mitra and sapient varuṇa  sons highborn from of old whose holy laws stand fast

Sanskrit: tā mā̱tā vi̱śvave̍dasāsu̱ryā̍ya̱ prama̍hasā   ma̱hī ja̍jā̱nādi̍tir ṛ̱tāva̍rī
English: these twain possessors of all wealth most glorious for supremest sway  aditi mighty mother true to law brought forth

Sanskrit: ma̱hāntā̍ mi̱trāvaru̍ṇā sa̱mrājā̍ de̱vāv asu̍rā   ṛ̱tāvā̍nāv ṛ̱tam ā gho̍ṣato bṛ̱hat
English: great varuṇa and mitra gods asuras and imperial lords  true to eternal law proclaim the high decree

Sanskrit: napā̍tā̱ śava̍so ma̱haḥ sū̱nū dakṣa̍sya su̱kratū̍   sṛ̱pradā̍nū i̱ṣo vāstv adhi̍ kṣitaḥ
English: the offspring of a lofty power dakṣa's two sons exceeding strong  who lords of flowing rain dwell in the place of food

Sanskrit: saṁ yā dānū̍ni ye̱mathu̍r di̱vyāḥ pārthi̍vī̱r iṣa̍ḥ   nabha̍svatī̱r ā vā̍ṁ carantu vṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ḥ
English: ye who have gathered up your gifts celestial and terrestrial food  let your rain come to us fraught with the mist of heaven

Sanskrit: adhi̱ yā bṛ̍ha̱to di̱vo̱3̱̍ 'bhi yū̱theva̱ paśya̍taḥ   ṛ̱tāvā̍nā sa̱mrājā̱ nama̍se hi̱tā
English: the twain who from the lofty sky seem to look down on herds below  holy imperial lords are set to be revered

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tāvā̍nā̱ ni ṣe̍datu̱ḥ sāmrā̍jyāya su̱kratū̍   dhṛ̱tavra̍tā kṣa̱triyā̍ kṣa̱tram ā̍śatuḥ
English: they true to law exceeding strong have sat them down for savran rule  princes whose laws stand fast they have obtained their sway

Sanskrit: a̱kṣṇaś ci̍d gātu̱vitta̍rānulba̱ṇena̱ cakṣa̍sā   ni ci̍n mi̱ṣantā̍ nici̱rā ni ci̍kyatuḥ
English: pathfinders even better than the eye with unobstructed sight  even when they close their lids observant they perceive

Sanskrit: u̱ta no̍ de̱vy adi̍tir uru̱ṣyatā̱ṁ nāsa̍tyā   u̱ru̱ṣyantu̍ ma̱ruto̍ vṛ̱ddhaśa̍vasaḥ
English: so may the goddess aditi may the nāsatyas guard us well  the martits guard us wellendowed with mighty strength

Sanskrit: te no̍ nā̱vam u̍ruṣyata̱ divā̱ nakta̍ṁ sudānavaḥ   ari̍ṣyanto̱ ni pā̱yubhi̍ḥ sacemahi
English: do ye o bounteous gods protect our dwelling lace by day and night  with you for our defenders may we go unharmed

Sanskrit: aghna̍te̱ viṣṇa̍ve va̱yam ari̍ṣyantaḥ su̱dāna̍ve   śru̱dhi sva̍yāvan sindho pū̱rvaci̍ttaye
English: may we unharmed serve bountiful viṣṇu the god who slayeth none  selfmoving sindhu hear and be the first to mark

Sanskrit: tad vārya̍ṁ vṛṇīmahe̱ vari̍ṣṭhaṁ gopa̱yatya̍m   mi̱tro yat pānti̱ varu̍ṇo̱ yad a̍rya̱mā
English: this sure protection we elect desirable and reaching far  which mitra varuṇa and aryaman afford

Sanskrit: u̱ta na̱ḥ sindhu̍r a̱pāṁ tan ma̱ruta̱s tad a̱śvinā̍   indro̱ viṣṇu̍r mī̱ḍhvāṁsa̍ḥ sa̱joṣa̍saḥ
English: and may the sindhu of the floods the maruts and the asvin pair  boon indra and boon viṣṇu have one mind with us

Sanskrit: te hi ṣmā̍ va̱nuṣo̱ naro̱ 'bhimā̍ti̱ṁ kaya̍sya cit   ti̱gmaṁ na kṣoda̍ḥ prati̱ghnanti̱ bhūrṇa̍yaḥ
English: because these warring heroes stay the enmity of every foe  as the fierce waterflood repels the furious ones

Sanskrit: a̱yam eka̍ i̱tthā pu̱rūru ca̍ṣṭe̱ vi vi̱śpati̍ḥ   tasya̍ vra̱tāny anu̍ vaś carāmasi
English: here this one god the lord of men looks forth exceeding far and wide  and we for your advantage keep his holy laws

Sanskrit: anu̱ pūrvā̍ṇy o̱kyā̍ sāmrā̱jyasya̍ saścima   mi̱trasya̍ vra̱tā varu̍ṇasya dīrgha̱śrut
English: we keep the old accustomed laws the statutes of supremacy  the iongknown laws of mitra and of varuṇa

Sanskrit: pari̱ yo ra̱śminā̍ di̱vo 'ntā̍n ma̱me pṛ̍thi̱vyāḥ   u̱bhe ā pa̍prau̱ roda̍sī mahi̱tvā
English: he who hath measured with his ray the boundaries of heaven and earth  and with his majesty hath filled the two worlds full

Sanskrit: ud u̱ ṣya śa̍ra̱ṇe di̱vo jyoti̍r ayaṁsta̱ sūrya̍ḥ   a̱gnir na śu̱kraḥ sa̍midhā̱na āhu̍taḥ
English: sūrya hath spread his light aloft up to the region of the sky  like agni all aflame when gifts are offered him

Sanskrit: vaco̍ dī̱rghapra̍sadma̱nīśe̱ vāja̍sya̱ goma̍taḥ   īśe̱ hi pi̱tvo̍ 'vi̱ṣasya̍ dā̱vane̍
English: with him who sits afar the word is lord of food that comes from kine  controller of the gift of unempoisoned food

Sanskrit: tat sūrya̱ṁ roda̍sī u̱bhe do̱ṣā vasto̱r upa̍ bruve   bho̱jeṣv a̱smām̐ a̱bhy uc ca̍rā̱ sadā̍
English: so unto sūrya heaven and earth at morning and at eve i speak  bringing enjoyments ever rise thou up for us

Sanskrit: ṛ̱jram u̍kṣa̱ṇyāya̍ne raja̱taṁ hara̍yāṇe   ratha̍ṁ yu̱ktam a̍sanāma su̱ṣāma̍ṇi
English: from uksanyayana a bay from harayana a white steed  and from susaman we obtained a hamessed car

Sanskrit: tā me̱ aśvyā̍nā̱ṁ harī̍ṇāṁ ni̱tośa̍nā   u̱to nu kṛtvyā̍nāṁ nṛ̱vāha̍sā
English: these two shall bring me further gain of troops of tawnycoloured steeds  the carriers shall they be of active men of war

Sanskrit: smada̍bhīśū̱ kaśā̍vantā̱ viprā̱ navi̍ṣṭhayā ma̱tī   ma̱ho vā̱jinā̱v arva̍ntā̱ sacā̍sanam
English: and the two sages have i gained who hold the reins and bear the whip  and the two great strong coursers with my newest song

Sanskrit: sakhā̍ya̱ ā śi̍ṣāmahi̱ brahmendrā̍ya va̱jriṇe̍   stu̱ṣa ū̱ ṣu vo̱ nṛta̍māya dhṛ̱ṣṇave̍
English: companions let us learn a prayer to indra whom the thunder arms  to glorify your bold and most heroic friend

Sanskrit: śava̍sā̱ hy asi̍ śru̱to vṛ̍tra̱hatye̍na vṛtra̱hā   ma̱ghair ma̱ghono̱ ati̍ śūra dāśasi
English: for thou by slaying vṛtra art the vṛtraslayer famed for might  thou hero in rich gifts surpassest wealthy chiefs

Sanskrit: sa na̱ḥ stavā̍na̱ ā bha̍ra ra̱yiṁ ci̱traśra̍vastamam   ni̱re̱ke ci̱d yo ha̍rivo̱ vasu̍r da̱diḥ
English: as such when glorified bring us riches of very wondrous fame  set in the highest rank wealthgiver lord of bays!

Sanskrit: ā ni̍re̱kam u̱ta pri̱yam indra̱ darṣi̱ janā̍nām   dhṛ̱ṣa̱tā dhṛ̍ṣṇo̱ stava̍māna̱ ā bha̍ra
English: yea indra thou disclosest that preeminent dear wealth of men  boldly o bold one glorified bring it to us

Sanskrit: na te̍ sa̱vyaṁ na dakṣi̍ṇa̱ṁ hasta̍ṁ varanta ā̱mura̍ḥ   na pa̍ri̱bādho̍ harivo̱ gavi̍ṣṭiṣu
English: the workers of destruction stay neither thy right hand nor thy left  nor hosts that press about thee lord of bays in fight

Sanskrit: ā tvā̱ gobhi̍r iva vra̱jaṁ gī̱rbhir ṛ̍ṇomy adrivaḥ   ā smā̱ kāma̍ṁ jari̱tur ā mana̍ḥ pṛṇa
English: o thunderarmed i come with songs to thee as to a stall with kine  fulfil the wish and thought of him who sings thy praise

Sanskrit: viśvā̍ni vi̱śvama̍naso dhi̱yā no̍ vṛtrahantama   ugra̍ praṇeta̱r adhi̱ ṣū va̍so gahi
English: chief vṛtraslayer through the hymn of visvamanas think of all  all that concerneth us excellent mighty guide

Sanskrit: va̱yaṁ te̍ a̱sya vṛ̍trahan vi̱dyāma̍ śūra̱ navya̍saḥ   vaso̍ḥ spā̱rhasya̍ puruhūta̱ rādha̍saḥ
English: may we o vṛtraslayer o hero find this thy newest boon longedfor and excellent thou who art much invoked!

Sanskrit: indra̱ yathā̱ hy asti̱ te 'pa̍rītaṁ nṛto̱ śava̍ḥ   amṛ̍ktā rā̱tiḥ pu̍ruhūta dā̱śuṣe̍
English: o indra dancer muchinvoked! as thy great power is unsurpassed  so be thy bounty to the worshipper unchecked

Sanskrit: ā vṛ̍ṣasva mahāmaha ma̱he nṛ̍tama̱ rādha̍se   dṛ̱ḻhaś ci̍d dṛhya maghavan ma̱ghatta̍ye
English: most mighty most heroic one for mighty bounty fill thee full  though strong strengthen thyself to win wealth maghavan!

Sanskrit: nū a̱nyatrā̍ cid adriva̱s tvan no̍ jagmur ā̱śasa̍ḥ   magha̍vañ cha̱gdhi tava̱ tan na̍ ū̱tibhi̍ḥ
English: o thunderer never have our prayers gone forth to any god but thee  so help us maghavan with thine assistance now

Sanskrit: na̱hy a1̱̍ṅga nṛ̍to̱ tvad a̱nyaṁ vi̱ndāmi̱ rādha̍se   rā̱ye dyu̱mnāya̱ śava̍se ca girvaṇaḥ
English: for dancer verily i find none else for bounty saving thee  for splendid wealth and power thou lover of the song

Sanskrit: endu̱m indrā̍ya siñcata̱ pibā̍ti so̱myam madhu̍   pra rādha̍sā codayāte mahitva̱nā
English: for indra pour ye out the drops meath blent with soma let him drink  with bounty and with majesty will he further us

Sanskrit: upo̱ harī̍ṇā̱m pati̱ṁ dakṣa̍m pṛ̱ñcanta̍m abravam   nū̱naṁ śru̍dhi stuva̱to a̱śvyasya̍
English: i spake to the bay coursers' lord to him who gives ability  now hear the son of asva as he praises thee

Sanskrit: na̱hy a1̱̍ṅga pu̱rā ca̱na ja̱jñe vī̱rata̍ra̱s tvat   nakī̍ rā̱yā naivathā̱ na bha̱ndanā̍
English: never was any hero born before thee mightier than thou  none certairdy like thee in goodness and in wealth

Sanskrit: ed u̱ madhvo̍ ma̱dinta̍raṁ si̱ñca vā̍dhvaryo̱ andha̍saḥ   e̱vā hi vī̱raḥ stava̍te sa̱dāvṛ̍dhaḥ
English: o ministering priest pour out of the sweet juice what gladdens most  so is the hero praised who ever prospers us

Sanskrit: indra̍ sthātar harīṇā̱ṁ naki̍ṣ ṭe pū̱rvyastu̍tim   ud ā̍naṁśa̱ śava̍sā̱ na bha̱ndanā̍
English: indra whom tawny coursers bear praise such as thine preeminent  none by his power or by his goodness hath attained

Sanskrit: taṁ vo̱ vājā̍nā̱m pati̱m ahū̍mahi śrava̱syava̍ḥ   aprā̍yubhir ya̱jñebhi̍r vāvṛ̱dhenya̍m
English: we seeking glory have invoked this master of all power and might  who must be glorified by constant sacri fice

Sanskrit: eto̱ nv indra̱ṁ stavā̍ma̱ sakhā̍ya̱ḥ stomya̱ṁ nara̍m   kṛ̱ṣṭīr yo viśvā̍ a̱bhy asty eka̱ it
English: come sing we praise to indra friends the hero who deserves the laud  him who with none to aid oercomes all tribes of men

Sanskrit: ago̍rudhāya ga̱viṣe̍ dyu̱kṣāya̱ dasmya̱ṁ vaca̍ḥ   ghṛ̱tāt svādī̍yo̱ madhu̍naś ca vocata
English: to him who wins the kine who keeps no cattle back celestial god  speak wondrous speech more sweet than butter and than meath

Sanskrit: yasyāmi̍tāni vī̱ryā̱3̱̍ na rādha̱ḥ parye̍tave   jyoti̱r na viśva̍m a̱bhy asti̱ dakṣi̍ṇā
English: whose hero powers are measureless whose bounty neer may be surpassed  whose liberality like light is over all

Sanskrit: stu̱hīndra̍ṁ vyaśva̱vad anū̍rmiṁ vā̱jina̱ṁ yama̍m   a̱ryo gaya̱m maṁha̍māna̱ṁ vi dā̱śuṣe̍
English: as vyaśva did praise indra praise the strong unfluctuating guide  who gives the foe's possessions to the worshipper

Sanskrit: e̱vā nū̱nam upa̍ stuhi̱ vaiya̍śva daśa̱maṁ nava̍m   suvi̍dvāṁsaṁ ca̱rkṛtya̍ṁ ca̱raṇī̍nām
English: now son of vyaśva praise thou him who to the tenth time still is new  the very wise whom living men must glorify

Sanskrit: vetthā̱ hi nirṛ̍tīnā̱ṁ vajra̍hasta pari̱vṛja̍m   aha̍rahaḥ śu̱ndhyuḥ pa̍ri̱padā̍m iva
English: thou knowest indra thunderarmed how to avoid destructive powers  as one secure from pitfalls each returning day

Sanskrit: tad i̱ndrāva̱ ā bha̍ra̱ yenā̍ daṁsiṣṭha̱ kṛtva̍ne   dvi̱tā kutsā̍ya śiśnatho̱ ni co̍daya
English: o indra bring that aid wherewith of old most wondrous! thou didst slay  his foes for active kutsa send it down to us

Sanskrit: tam u̍ tvā nū̱nam ī̍mahe̱ navya̍ṁ daṁsiṣṭha̱ sanya̍se   sa tvaṁ no̱ viśvā̍ a̱bhimā̍tīḥ sa̱kṣaṇi̍ḥ
English: so now we seek thee fresh in might most wonderful in act! for gain  for thou art he who conquers all our foes for us

Sanskrit: ya ṛkṣā̱d aṁha̍so mu̱cad yo vāryā̍t sa̱pta sindhu̍ṣu   vadha̍r dā̱sasya̍ tuvinṛmṇa nīnamaḥ
English: who will set free from ruinous woe or ārya on the seven streams  o valiant hero bend the dāsa's weapon down

Sanskrit: yathā̍ varo su̱ṣāmṇe̍ sa̱nibhya̱ āva̍ho ra̱yim   vya̍śvebhyaḥ subhage vājinīvati
English: as to varosusaman thou broughtest great riches for their gain  to vyaśva's sons blest lady rich in ample wealth!

Sanskrit: ā nā̱ryasya̱ dakṣi̍ṇā̱ vya̍śvām̐ etu so̱mina̍ḥ   sthū̱raṁ ca̱ rādha̍ḥ śa̱tava̍t sa̱hasra̍vat
English: let narya's sacrificial meed reach vyaśva's somabearing sons  in hundreds and in thousands be the great reward

Sanskrit: yat tvā̍ pṛ̱cchād ī̍jā̱naḥ ku̍ha̱yā ku̍hayākṛte   e̱ṣo apa̍śrito va̱lo go̍ma̱tīm ava̍ tiṣṭhati
English: if one should ask thee where is he who sacrificed? whither lookest thou?  like vala he hath passed away and dwelleth now on gomati

Sanskrit: īḻi̍ṣvā̱ hi pra̍tī̱vya1̱̍ṁ yaja̍sva jā̱tave̍dasam   ca̱ri̱ṣṇudhū̍ma̱m agṛ̍bhītaśociṣam
English: worship thou jātavedas pray to him who willingly accepts  whose smoke wanders at will and none may grasp his flame

Sanskrit: dā̱māna̍ṁ viśvacarṣaṇe̱ 'gniṁ vi̍śvamano gi̱rā   u̱ta stu̍ṣe̱ viṣpa̍rdhaso̱ rathā̍nām
English: thou all men's friend visvamanas exaltest agni with thy song  the giver and his flames with which no cars contend

Sanskrit: yeṣā̍m ābā̱dha ṛ̱gmiya̍ i̱ṣaḥ pṛ̱kṣaś ca̍ ni̱grabhe̍   u̱pa̱vidā̱ vahni̍r vindate̱ vasu̍
English: whose resolute assault to win vigour and food deserves our praise  through whose discovering power the priest obtaineth wealth

Sanskrit: ud a̍sya śo̱cir a̍sthād dīdi̱yuṣo̱ vy a1̱̍jara̍m   tapu̍rjambhasya su̱dyuto̍ gaṇa̱śriya̍ḥ
English: up springs the imperishable flame the flame of the refulgent one  most bright with glowing jaws and glory in his train

Sanskrit: ud u̍ tiṣṭha svadhvara̱ stavā̍no de̱vyā kṛ̱pā   a̱bhi̱khyā bhā̱sā bṛ̍ha̱tā śu̍śu̱kvani̍ḥ
English: skilled in fair sacrifice extolled arise in godlike loveliness  shining with lofty splendour with effulgent light

Sanskrit: agne̍ yā̱hi su̍śa̱stibhi̍r ha̱vyā juhvā̍na ānu̱ṣak   yathā̍ dū̱to ba̱bhūtha̍ havya̱vāha̍naḥ
English: called straight to our oblations come o agni through our eulogies  as thou hast been our envoy bearing up our gifts

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ va̍ḥ pū̱rvyaṁ hu̍ve̱ hotā̍raṁ carṣaṇī̱nām   tam a̱yā vā̱cā gṛ̍ṇe̱ tam u̍ vaḥ stuṣe
English: i call your agni from of old invoking priest of living men  him with this song i laud and magnify for you

Sanskrit: ya̱jñebhi̱r adbhu̍takratu̱ṁ yaṁ kṛ̱pā sū̱daya̍nta̱ it   mi̱traṁ na jane̱ sudhi̍tam ṛ̱tāva̍ni
English: whom wondrous wise they animate with solemn rites and his fair form  kind as a friend to men who keep the holy law

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tāvā̍nam ṛtāyavo ya̱jñasya̱ sādha̍naṁ gi̱rā   upo̍ enaṁ jujuṣu̱r nama̍sas pa̱de
English: him true to law who perfecteth the sacrifice lawloving ones!  ye with your song have gratified in the place of prayer

Sanskrit: acchā̍ no̱ aṅgi̍rastamaṁ ya̱jñāso̍ yantu sa̱ṁyata̍ḥ   hotā̱ yo asti̍ vi̱kṣv ā ya̱śasta̍maḥ
English: may all our sacrifices go to him the truest aṅgiras  who is among mankind the most illustrious priest

Sanskrit: agne̱ tava̱ tye a̍ja̱rendhā̍nāso bṛ̱had bhāḥ   aśvā̍ iva̱ vṛṣa̍ṇas taviṣī̱yava̍ḥ
English: imperishable agni thine are all these high enkindled lights  like horses and like stallions showing forth their strength

Sanskrit: sa tvaṁ na̍ ūrjām pate ra̱yiṁ rā̍sva su̱vīrya̍m   prāva̍ nas to̱ke tana̍ye sa̱matsv ā
English: so give us lord of power and might riches combined with hero strength  and guard us with our sons and grand sons in our frays

Sanskrit: yad vā u̍ vi̱śpati̍ḥ śi̱taḥ suprī̍to̱ manu̍ṣo vi̱śi   viśved a̱gniḥ prati̱ rakṣā̍ṁsi sedhati
English: soon as the eager lord of men is friendly unto manti's race  agni averteth from us all the demon host

Sanskrit: śru̱ṣṭy a̍gne̱ nava̍sya me̱ stoma̍sya vīra viśpate   ni mā̱yina̱s tapu̍ṣā ra̱kṣaso̍ daha
English: o hero agni lord of men on hearing this new laud of mine  burn down the rākṣasas enchanters with thy flame

Sanskrit: na tasya̍ mā̱yayā̍ ca̱na ri̱pur ī̍śīta̱ martya̍ḥ   yo a̱gnaye̍ da̱dāśa̍ ha̱vyadā̍tibhiḥ
English: no mortal foe can eer prevail by arts of magic over him  who serveth agni well with sacrificial gifts

Sanskrit: vya̍śvas tvā vasu̱vida̍m ukṣa̱ṇyur a̍prīṇā̱d ṛṣi̍ḥ   ma̱ho rā̱ye tam u̍ tvā̱ sam i̍dhīmahi
English: vyaśva the sage who sought the bull hath won thee finder of good things  as such may we enkindle thee for ample wealth

Sanskrit: u̱śanā̍ kā̱vyas tvā̱ ni hotā̍ram asādayat   ā̱ya̱jiṁ tvā̱ mana̍ve jā̱tave̍dasam
English: uśanā kāvya stablished thee o agni as invoking priest  thee jātavedas sacrificing priest for man

Sanskrit: viśve̱ hi tvā̍ sa̱joṣa̍so de̱vāso̍ dū̱tam akra̍ta   śru̱ṣṭī de̍va pratha̱mo ya̱jñiyo̍ bhuvaḥ
English: all deities of one accord appointed thee their messenger  thou god through hearing hadst first claim to sacrifice

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ ghā̍ vī̱ro a̱mṛta̍ṁ dū̱taṁ kṛ̍ṇvīta̱ martya̍ḥ   pā̱va̱kaṁ kṛ̱ṣṇava̍rtani̱ṁ vihā̍yasam
English: him may the mortal hero make his own immortal messenger  farspreading purifier him whose path is black

Sanskrit: taṁ hu̍vema ya̱tasru̍caḥ su̱bhāsa̍ṁ śu̱kraśo̍ciṣam   vi̱śām a̱gnim a̱jara̍m pra̱tnam īḍya̍m
English: with lifted ladles let us call him splendid with his brilliant flame  men's ancient agni wasting not adorable

English: ye carry on your bodies ye who see it all so bless us graciously therewith  cast maruts to the ground our sick man's malady replace the dislocated limb

English: sing praise to hiin the lord of light the gods have made the god to be their messenger  and sent oblation to gods

English: his or the lauding sage's word his son of strength! who is most prompt with sacred gifts  set thou beneath the gods vasu above mankind the speech of the intelligent

English: gods ye are with the simple ones ye know each mortal in your hearts;  ye vasus well discriminate the false and true

Sanskrit: ye ci̱d dhi mṛ̱tyuba̍ndhava̱ ādi̍tyā̱ mana̍va̱ḥ smasi̍   pra sū na̱ āyu̍r jī̱vase̍ tiretana

English: and thy two highiylauded bays strong stallions draw thy car who art  untouched by age most gladdening car for which we pray

Sanskrit: tam ī̍mahe puruṣṭu̱taṁ ya̱hvam pra̱tnābhi̍r ū̱tibhi̍ḥ   ni ba̱rhiṣi̍ pri̱ye sa̍da̱d adha̍ dvi̱tā
English: with ancient offerings we implore the young and strong whom many praise  he from of old hath sat upon dear sacred grass

Sanskrit: vardha̍svā̱ su pu̍ruṣṭuta̱ ṛṣi̍ṣṭutābhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ   dhu̱kṣasva̍ pi̱pyuṣī̱m iṣa̱m avā̍ ca naḥ
English: wax miglity thou whom many laud for aids which ṛṣis have extolled  pour down for us abundant food and guard us well

Sanskrit: indra̱ tvam a̍vi̱ted a̍sī̱tthā stu̍va̱to a̍drivaḥ   ṛ̱tād i̍yarmi te̱ dhiya̍m mano̱yuja̍m
English: o indra caster of the stone thou helpest him who praises thee  from sacrifice i send to thee a mindyoked hymn

Sanskrit: i̱ha tyā sa̍dha̱mādyā̍ yujā̱naḥ soma̍pītaye   harī̍ indra pra̱tadva̍sū a̱bhi sva̍ra
English: here yoking for the somadraught these horses sharers of thy feast  thy bay steeds indra fraught with weal tb consent to come

Sanskrit: a̱bhi sva̍rantu̱ ye tava̍ ru̱drāsa̍ḥ sakṣata̱ śriya̍m   u̱to ma̱rutva̍tī̱r viśo̍ a̱bhi praya̍ḥ
English: attendants on thy glory let the rudras roar assent to thee  and all the marut companies come tothe feast

Sanskrit: i̱mā a̍sya̱ pratū̍rtayaḥ pa̱daṁ ju̍ṣanta̱ yad di̱vi   nābhā̍ ya̱jñasya̱ saṁ da̍dhu̱r yathā̍ vi̱de
English: these his victorious followers bold in the heavens the place they love  leagued in the heart of sacrifice as well we know

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ dī̱rghāya̱ cakṣa̍se̱ prāci̍ praya̱ty a̍dhva̱re   mimī̍te ya̱jñam ā̍nu̱ṣag vi̱cakṣya̍
English: that we may long behold the light what time the ordered rite proceeds  he duly measures as he views the sacrifice

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̱yam i̍ndra te̱ ratha̍ u̱to te̱ vṛṣa̍ṇā̱ harī̍   vṛṣā̱ tvaṁ śa̍takrato̱ vṛṣā̱ hava̍ḥ
English: o indra strong is this thy car and strong are these bay steeds of thine  o śatakratu thou art strong strong is our call

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̱ grāvā̱ vṛṣā̱ mado̱ vṛṣā̱ somo̍ a̱yaṁ su̱taḥ   vṛṣā̍ ya̱jño yam inva̍si̱ vṛṣā̱ hava̍ḥ
English: strong is the pressstone strong thy joy strong is the flowing soma juice  strong is the rite thou furtherest strong is our call

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̍ tvā̱ vṛṣa̍ṇaṁ huve̱ vajri̍ñ ci̱trābhi̍r ū̱tibhi̍ḥ   vā̱vantha̱ hi prati̍ṣṭuti̱ṁ vṛṣā̱ hava̍ḥ
English: as strong i call on thee the strong o thunderer with thy thousand aids  for thou hast won the hymn of praise strong is our call

Sanskrit: ya i̍ndra soma̱pāta̍mo̱ mada̍ḥ śaviṣṭha̱ ceta̍ti   yenā̱ haṁsi̱ ny a1̱̍triṇa̱ṁ tam ī̍mahe
English: joy mightiest indra known and marked sprung most from somadraughts wherewith  thou smitest down the greedy fiend for that we long

Sanskrit: yenā̱ daśa̍gva̱m adhri̍guṁ ve̱paya̍nta̱ṁ sva̍rṇaram   yenā̍ samu̱dram āvi̍thā̱ tam ī̍mahe
English: wherewith thou bolpest adhrigu the great daśagva and the god  who stirs the sunlight and the sea for that we long

Sanskrit: yena̱ sindhu̍m ma̱hīr a̱po rathā̍m̐ iva praco̱daya̍ḥ   panthā̍m ṛ̱tasya̱ yāta̍ve̱ tam ī̍mahe
English: wherewith thou dravest forth like cars sindhu and all the mighty floods  to go the way ordained by law for that we long

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ stoma̍m a̱bhiṣṭa̍ye ghṛ̱taṁ na pū̱tam a̍drivaḥ   yenā̱ nu sa̱dya oja̍sā va̱vakṣi̍tha
English: accept this laud for aid made pure like oil thou caster of the stone  whereby even in a moment thou hast waxen great

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ ju̍ṣasva girvaṇaḥ samu̱dra i̍va pinvate   indra̱ viśvā̍bhir ū̱tibhi̍r va̱vakṣi̍tha
English: be pleased songlover with this song it flows abundant like the sea  indra with all thy succours thou hast waxen great

Sanskrit: yo no̍ de̱vaḥ pa̍rā̱vata̍ḥ sakhitva̱nāya̍ māma̱he   di̱vo na vṛ̱ṣṭim pra̱thaya̍n va̱vakṣi̍tha
English: the god who from afar hath sent gifts to maintain our friendship's bond  thou spreading them like rain from heaven hast waxen great

Sanskrit: va̱va̱kṣur a̍sya ke̱tava̍ u̱ta vajro̱ gabha̍styoḥ   yat sūryo̱ na roda̍sī̱ ava̍rdhayat
English: the beams that mark him have grown strong the thunder rests between his arms  when like the sun he hath increased both heaven and earth

Sanskrit: yadi̍ pravṛddha satpate sa̱hasra̍m mahi̱ṣām̐ agha̍ḥ   ād it ta̍ indri̱yam mahi̱ pra vā̍vṛdhe
English: when mighty lord of heroes thou didst cat a thousand buffaloes  then grew and waxed exceeding great thine indrapower

Sanskrit: indra̱ḥ sūrya̍sya ra̱śmibhi̱r ny a̍rśasā̱nam o̍ṣati   a̱gnir vane̍va sāsa̱hiḥ pra vā̍vṛdhe
English: indra consumeth with the rays of sūrya the malicious man  like agni conquering the woods he hath grown strong

Sanskrit: i̱yaṁ ta̍ ṛ̱tviyā̍vatī dhī̱tir e̍ti̱ navī̍yasī   sa̱pa̱ryantī̍ purupri̱yā mimī̍ta̱ it
English: this newest thought of ours that suits the time approaches unto thee  serving beloved in many a place it metes and marks

Sanskrit: garbho̍ ya̱jñasya̍ deva̱yuḥ kratu̍m punīta ānu̱ṣak   stomai̱r indra̍sya vāvṛdhe̱ mimī̍ta̱ it
English: the pious germ of sacrifice directly purifies the soul  by indra's lauds it waxes great it metes and marks

Sanskrit: sa̱nir mi̱trasya̍ papratha̱ indra̱ḥ soma̍sya pī̱taye̍   prācī̱ vāśī̍va sunva̱te mimī̍ta̱ it
English: indra who wins the friend hath spread himself to drink the somadraught  like worshipper's dilating praise; it metes and marks

Sanskrit: yaṁ viprā̍ u̱kthavā̍haso 'bhiprama̱ndur ā̱yava̍ḥ   ghṛ̱taṁ na pi̍pya ā̱sany ṛ̱tasya̱ yat
English: he whom the sages living men have gladdened offering up their hymns  hath swelled like oil of sacrifice in agni's mouth

Sanskrit: u̱ta sva̱rāje̱ adi̍ti̱ḥ stoma̱m indrā̍ya jījanat   pu̱ru̱pra̱śa̱stam ū̱taya̍ ṛ̱tasya̱ yat
English: aditi also hath brought forth a hymn for indra sovran lord  the work of sacrifice for help is glorified

Sanskrit: a̱bhi vahna̍ya ū̱taye 'nū̍ṣata̱ praśa̍staye   na de̍va̱ vivra̍tā̱ harī̍ ṛ̱tasya̱ yat
English: the ministering priests have sung their songs for aid and eulogy  god thy bays turn not from the rite which law ordains

Sanskrit: yat soma̍m indra̱ viṣṇa̍vi̱ yad vā̍ gha tri̱ta ā̱ptye   yad vā̍ ma̱rutsu̱ manda̍se̱ sam indu̍bhiḥ
English: if indra thou drink soma by viṣṇu's or tṛta āptya's side  or with the maruts take delight in flowing drops;

Sanskrit: yad vā̍ śakra parā̱vati̍ samu̱dre adhi̱ manda̍se   a̱smāka̱m it su̱te ra̍ṇā̱ sam indu̍bhiḥ
English: or śakra if thou gladden thee afar or in the sea of air  rejoice thee in this juice of ours in flowing drops

Sanskrit: yad vāsi̍ sunva̱to vṛ̱dho yaja̍mānasya satpate   u̱kthe vā̱ yasya̱ raṇya̍si̱ sam indu̍bhiḥ
English: or lord of heroes if thou aid the worshipper who shed; the juice  or him whose laud delights thee and his flowing drops

Sanskrit: de̱vaṁde̍va̱ṁ vo 'va̍sa̱ indra̍mindraṁ gṛṇī̱ṣaṇi̍   adhā̍ ya̱jñāya̍ tu̱rvaṇe̱ vy ā̍naśuḥ
English: to magnify the god the god indra yea indra for your help  and promptly end the sacrificethis have they gained

Sanskrit: ya̱jñebhi̍r ya̱jñavā̍hasa̱ṁ some̍bhiḥ soma̱pāta̍mam   hotrā̍bhi̱r indra̍ṁ vāvṛdhu̱r vy ā̍naśuḥ
English: with worship him whom men adore with soma him who drinks it most  indra with lauds have they increasedthis have they gained

Sanskrit: ma̱hīr a̍sya̱ praṇī̍tayaḥ pū̱rvīr u̱ta praśa̍stayaḥ   viśvā̱ vasū̍ni dā̱śuṣe̱ vy ā̍naśuḥ
English: his leadings are with power and might and his instructions manifold  he gives the worshipper all wealth this have they gained

Sanskrit: indra̍ṁ vṛ̱trāya̱ hanta̍ve de̱vāso̍ dadhire pu̱raḥ   indra̱ṁ vāṇī̍r anūṣatā̱ sam oja̍se
English: for slaying vṛtra have the gods set indra in the foremost place  indra the choral bands have sung for vigorous strength

Sanskrit: ma̱hānta̍m mahi̱nā va̱yaṁ stome̍bhir havana̱śruta̍m   a̱rkair a̱bhi pra ṇo̍numa̱ḥ sam oja̍se
English: we to the mighty with our might with lauds to him who hears our call  with holy hymns have sung aloud for vigorous strength

Sanskrit: na yaṁ vi̍vi̱kto roda̍sī̱ nāntari̍kṣāṇi va̱jriṇa̍m   amā̱d id a̍sya titviṣe̱ sam oja̍saḥ
English: not earth nor heaven nor firmaments contain the thunderwielding god  they shake before his violent rush and vigorous strength

Sanskrit: yad i̍ndra pṛta̱nājye̍ de̱vās tvā̍ dadhi̱re pu̱raḥ   ād it te̍ harya̱tā harī̍ vavakṣatuḥ
English: what time the gods o indra get thee foremost in the furious fight  then thy two beautiful bay steeds carried thee on

Sanskrit: ya̱dā vṛ̱traṁ na̍dī̱vṛta̱ṁ śava̍sā vajri̱nn ava̍dhīḥ   ād it te̍ harya̱tā harī̍ vavakṣatuḥ
English: when vṛtra stayer of the floods thou si"est thundeicr with might  then thy two beautiful bay steeds carried thee on

Sanskrit: ya̱dā te̱ viṣṇu̱r oja̍sā̱ trīṇi̍ pa̱dā vi̍cakra̱me   ād it te̍ harya̱tā harī̍ vavakṣatuḥ
English: when viṣṇu through thine energy strode wide those three great steps of his  then thy two beautiful bay steeds carried thee on

Sanskrit: ya̱dā te̍ harya̱tā harī̍ vāvṛ̱dhāte̍ di̱vedi̍ve   ād it te̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni yemire
English: when thy two beautiful bay steeds grew great and greater day by day  even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee

Sanskrit: ya̱dā te̱ māru̍tī̱r viśa̱s tubhya̍m indra niyemi̱re   ād it te̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni yemire
English: when indra all the marut folk humbly submitted them to thee  even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee

Sanskrit: ya̱dā sūrya̍m a̱muṁ di̱vi śu̱kraṁ jyoti̱r adhā̍rayaḥ   ād it te̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni yemire
English: when yonder sun that brilliant light thou settest in the heaven above  even then all creatures that had life bowed down to thee

Sanskrit: i̱māṁ ta̍ indra suṣṭu̱tiṁ vipra̍ iyarti dhī̱tibhi̍ḥ   jā̱mim pa̱deva̱ pipra̍tī̱m prādhva̱re
English: to thee o indra with this thought the sage lifts up this eulogy  akin and leading as on foot to sacrifice

Sanskrit: yad a̍sya̱ dhāma̍ni pri̱ye sa̍mīcī̱nāso̱ asva̍ran   nābhā̍ ya̱jñasya̍ do̱hanā̱ prādhva̱re
English: when in thine own dear dwelling all gathered have lifted up the voice  milkstreams at worship's central spot for sacrifice

Sanskrit: su̱vīrya̱ṁ svaśvya̍ṁ su̱gavya̍m indra daddhi naḥ   hote̍va pū̱rvaci̍ttaye̱ prādhva̱re
English: as priest o indra give us wealth in brave men and good steeds ana kine  that we may first remember thee for sacrifice

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gne vrata̱pā a̍si de̱va ā martye̱ṣv ā   tvaṁ ya̱jñeṣv īḍya̍ḥ
English: thou agni god mid mortal men art guard of sacred rites thou art  to be adored at sacrifice

Sanskrit: tvam a̍si pra̱śasyo̍ vi̱dathe̍ṣu sahantya   agne̍ ra̱thīr a̍dhva̱rāṇā̍m
English: o mighty agni thou must be glorified at our festivals  bearing our offerings to the gods

Sanskrit: sa tvam a̱smad apa̱ dviṣo̍ yuyo̱dhi jā̍tavedaḥ   ade̍vīr agne̱ arā̍tīḥ
English: o jātavedas agni fight and drive our foes afar from us  themand their godless enmities

Sanskrit: anti̍ ci̱t santa̱m aha̍ ya̱jñam marta̍sya ri̱poḥ   nopa̍ veṣi jātavedaḥ
English: thou jātavedas seekest not the worship of a hostile man  however nigh itbe to thee

Sanskrit: martā̱ ama̍rtyasya te̱ bhūri̱ nāma̍ manāmahe   viprā̍so jā̱tave̍dasaḥ
English: we sages mortals as we are adore the mighty name oof thee  immortal jātavedas' name

Sanskrit: vipra̱ṁ viprā̱so 'va̍se de̱vam martā̍sa ū̱taye̍   a̱gniṁ gī̱rbhir ha̍vāmahe
English: sages we call the sage to help mortals we call the god to aid  we call on agni with our songs

Sanskrit: ā te̍ va̱tso mano̍ yamat para̱māc ci̍t sa̱dhasthā̍t   agne̱ tvāṁkā̍mayā gi̱rā
English: may vatsa draw thy mind away even from thy loftiest dwellingplace  agni with song that yearns for thee

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱trā hi sa̱dṛṅṅ asi̱ viśo̱ viśvā̱ anu̍ pra̱bhuḥ   sa̱matsu̍ tvā havāmahe
English: thou art the same in many a place mid all the people thou art lord  in fray and fightt we call on thee

Sanskrit: sa̱matsv a̱gnim ava̍se vāja̱yanto̍ havāmahe   vāje̍ṣu ci̱trarā̍dhasam
English: when we are seeking strength we call agni to help us in the strife  the giver of rich gifts in war

Sanskrit: pra̱tno hi ka̱m īḍyo̍ adhva̱reṣu̍ sa̱nāc ca̱ hotā̱ navya̍ś ca̱ satsi̍   svāṁ cā̍gne ta̱nva̍m pi̱praya̍svā̱smabhya̍ṁ ca̱ saubha̍ga̱m ā ya̍jasva
English: ancient adorablie at sacrifices priest from of old meet for our praise thou sittest  fill full and satisfy thy body agni and win us happiness by offering worship

Sanskrit: yat stho dī̱rghapra̍sadmani̱ yad vā̱do ro̍ca̱ne di̱vaḥ   yad vā̍ samu̱dre adhy ākṛ̍te gṛ̱he 'ta̱ ā yā̍tam aśvinā
English: whether ye travel far away or dwell in yonder light of heaven  or in a mansion that is built above the sea come thence ye aśvins hitherward

Sanskrit: yad vā̍ ya̱jñam mana̍ve sammimi̱kṣathu̍r e̱vet kā̱ṇvasya̍ bodhatam   bṛha̱spati̱ṁ viśvā̍n de̱vām̐ a̱haṁ hu̍va̱ indrā̱viṣṇū̍ a̱śvinā̍v āśu̱heṣa̍sā
English: or if for manuye prepared the sacrifice remember also kaṇva's son  i call bṛhaspati indra viṣṇu all the gods the aśvins borne by rapid steeds

Sanskrit: tyā nv a1̱̍śvinā̍ huve su̱daṁsa̍sā gṛ̱bhe kṛ̱tā   yayo̱r asti̱ pra ṇa̍ḥ sa̱khyaṁ de̱veṣv adhy āpya̍m
English: those aśvins i invoke who work marvels brought hither to receive  with whom our friendship is most famed and kinship passing that of gods

Sanskrit: yayo̱r adhi̱ pra ya̱jñā a̍sū̱re santi̍ sū̱raya̍ḥ   tā ya̱jñasyā̍dhva̱rasya̱ prace̍tasā sva̱dhābhi̱r yā piba̍taḥ so̱myam madhu̍
English: on whom the solemn rites depend whose worshippers rise without the sun  these who foreknow the holy work of sacrifice and by their godhead drink the sweets of soma juice

Sanskrit: yad a̱dyāśvi̍nā̱v apā̱g yat prāk stho vā̍jinīvasū   yad dru̱hyavy ana̍vi tu̱rvaśe̱ yadau̍ hu̱ve vā̱m atha̱ mā ga̍tam
English: whether ye lords of ample wealth now linger in the cast or west  with druhyu or with anu yadu turvaga i call you hither; come to me

Sanskrit: yad a̱ntari̍kṣe̱ pata̍thaḥ purubhujā̱ yad ve̱me roda̍sī̱ anu̍   yad vā̍ sva̱dhābhi̍r adhi̱tiṣṭha̍tho̱ ratha̱m ata̱ ā yā̍tam aśvinā
English: lords of great riches whether through the firmament ye fly or speed through heaven and earth  or with your godlike natures stand upon your cars come thence o aśvins hitherward

Sanskrit: ā nū̱nam a̍śvinā yu̱vaṁ va̱tsasya̍ ganta̱m ava̍se   prāsmai̍ yacchatam avṛ̱kam pṛ̱thu ccha̱rdir yu̍yu̱taṁ yā arā̍tayaḥ
English: to help and favour vatsa now o aśvins come ye hitherward  bestow on him a dwelling spacious and secure and keep malignities away

Sanskrit: yad a̱ntari̍kṣe̱ yad di̱vi yat pañca̱ mānu̍ṣā̱m̐ anu̍   nṛ̱mṇaṁ tad dha̍ttam aśvinā
English: all manliness that is in heaven with the five tribes or in midair  bestow ye aśvins upon us

Sanskrit: ye vā̱ṁ daṁsā̍ṁsy aśvinā̱ viprā̍saḥ parimāmṛ̱śuḥ   e̱vet kā̱ṇvasya̍ bodhatam
English: remember kaṇva first of all among the singers aśvins who  have thought upon your wondrous deeds

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ vā̍ṁ gha̱rmo a̍śvinā̱ stome̍na̱ pari̍ ṣicyate   a̱yaṁ somo̱ madhu̍mān vājinīvasū̱ yena̍ vṛ̱traṁ cike̍tathaḥ
English: aśvins for you with song of praise this hot oblation is effused  this your sweet soma juice ye lords of ample wealth through which ye think upon the foe

Sanskrit: yad a̱psu yad vana̱spatau̱ yad oṣa̍dhīṣu purudaṁsasā kṛ̱tam   tena̍ māviṣṭam aśvinā
English: whatever ye have done in floods in the tree wonderworkers and in growing plants  therewith o aśvins succour me

Sanskrit: yan nā̍satyā bhura̱ṇyatho̱ yad vā̍ deva bhiṣa̱jyatha̍ḥ   a̱yaṁ vā̍ṁ va̱tso ma̱tibhi̱r na vi̍ndhate ha̱viṣma̍nta̱ṁ hi gaccha̍thaḥ
English: what force nāsatyas ye exert whatever gods ye tend and heal  this your own vatsa gains not by his hymns alone ye visit him who offers gifts

Sanskrit: ā nū̱nam a̱śvino̱r ṛṣi̱ḥ stoma̍ṁ ciketa vā̱mayā̍   ā soma̱m madhu̍mattamaṁ gha̱rmaṁ si̍ñcā̱d atha̍rvaṇi
English: now hath the ṛṣi splendidly thought out the aśvins' hymn of praise  let the atharvan pour the warm oblation forth and soma very rich in sweets

Sanskrit: ā nū̱naṁ ra̱ghuva̍rtani̱ṁ ratha̍ṁ tiṣṭhātho aśvinā   ā vā̱ṁ stomā̍ i̱me mama̱ nabho̱ na cu̍cyavīrata
English: ye aśvins now ascend your car that lightly rolls upon its way  may these my praises make you speed hitherward like a cloud of heaven

Sanskrit: yad a̱dya vā̍ṁ nāsatyo̱kthair ā̍cucyuvī̱mahi̍   yad vā̱ vāṇī̍bhir aśvine̱vet kā̱ṇvasya̍ bodhatam
English: when o nāsatyas we this day make you speed hither with our hymns  or aśvins with our songs of praise remember kanya specially

Sanskrit: yad vā̍ṁ ka̱kṣīvā̍m̐ u̱ta yad vya̍śva̱ ṛṣi̱r yad vā̍ṁ dī̱rghata̍mā ju̱hāva̍   pṛthī̱ yad vā̍ṁ vai̱nyaḥ sāda̍neṣv e̱ved ato̍ aśvinā cetayethām
English: as erst kakṣīvān and the ṛṣi vyaśva as erst dīrghatamas invoked your presence  or in the sacrificial chambers vainya pṛthi so be ye mindful of us here o aśvins

Sanskrit: yā̱taṁ cha̍rdi̱ṣpā u̱ta na̍ḥ para̱spā bhū̱taṁ ja̍ga̱tpā u̱ta na̍s tanū̱pā   va̱rtis to̱kāya̱ tana̍yāya yātam
English: come as homeguardians saving us from foemen guarding our living creatures and our bodies  come to the house to give us seed and offspring

Sanskrit: yad indre̍ṇa sa̱ratha̍ṁ yā̱tho a̍śvinā̱ yad vā̍ vā̱yunā̱ bhava̍tha̱ḥ samo̍kasā   yad ā̍di̱tyebhi̍r ṛ̱bhubhi̍ḥ sa̱joṣa̍sā̱ yad vā̱ viṣṇo̍r vi̱krama̍ṇeṣu̱ tiṣṭha̍thaḥ
English: whether with indra ye be faring aśvins or resting in one dwellingplace with vāyu  in concord with the ṛbhus or ādityas or standing still in viṣṇu's stridingplaces

Sanskrit: yad a̱dyāśvinā̍v a̱haṁ hu̱veya̱ vāja̍sātaye   yat pṛ̱tsu tu̱rvaṇe̱ saha̱s tac chreṣṭha̍m a̱śvino̱r ava̍ḥ
English: when i o aśvins call on you today that i may gather strength  or as allconquering might in war be that the aśvins' noblest grace

Sanskrit: ā nū̱naṁ yā̍tam aśvine̱mā ha̱vyāni̍ vāṁ hi̱tā   i̱me somā̍so̱ adhi̍ tu̱rvaśe̱ yadā̍v i̱me kaṇve̍ṣu vā̱m atha̍
English: now come ye aśvins hitherward here are oblations set for you;  these somadraughts to aid yadu and  turvaśa these offered you mid kaniva's sons

Sanskrit: yan nā̍satyā parā̱ke a̍rvā̱ke asti̍ bheṣa̱jam   tena̍ nū̱naṁ vi̍ma̱dāya̍ pracetasā cha̱rdir va̱tsāya̍ yacchatam
English: whatever healing balm is yours nisatyas near or far away  therewith great sages grant a home to vatsa and to vimada

Sanskrit: abhu̍tsy u̱ pra de̱vyā sā̱kaṁ vā̱cāham a̱śvino̍ḥ   vy ā̍var de̱vy ā ma̱tiṁ vi rā̱tim martye̍bhyaḥ
English: together with the goddess with the aśvins' speech have i awoke  thou goddess hast disclosed the hymn and holy gift from mortal men

Sanskrit: pra bo̍dhayoṣo a̱śvinā̱ pra de̍vi sūnṛte mahi   pra ya̍jñahotar ānu̱ṣak pra madā̍ya̱ śravo̍ bṛ̱hat
English: awake the aśvins goddess dawn! up mighty lady of sweet strains!  rise straightway priest of sacrifice! high glory to the gladdening draught!

Sanskrit: yad u̍ṣo̱ yāsi̍ bhā̱nunā̱ saṁ sūrye̍ṇa rocase   ā hā̱yam a̱śvino̱ ratho̍ va̱rtir yā̍ti nṛ̱pāyya̍m
English: thou dawn approaching with thy light shinest together with the sun  and to this manprotecting home the chariot ofthe aśvins comes

Sanskrit: yad āpī̍tāso a̱ṁśavo̱ gāvo̱ na du̱hra ūdha̍bhiḥ   yad vā̱ vāṇī̱r anū̍ṣata̱ pra de̍va̱yanto̍ a̱śvinā̍
English: when yellow stalks give forth the juice as cows from udders pour their milk  and voices sound the song of praise the aśvins' worshippers show first

Sanskrit: pra dyu̱mnāya̱ pra śava̍se̱ pra nṛ̱ṣāhyā̍ya̱ śarma̍ṇe   pra dakṣā̍ya pracetasā
English: forward for glory and for strength protection that shall conquer men  and power and skill most sapient ones!

Sanskrit: yan nū̱naṁ dhī̱bhir a̍śvinā pi̱tur yonā̍ ni̱ṣīda̍thaḥ   yad vā̍ su̱mnebhi̍r ukthyā
English: when aśvins worthy of our lauds ye seat you in the father's house  with wisdom or the bliss ye bring

Sanskrit: ā no̱ viśvā̍bhir ū̱tibhi̱r aśvi̍nā̱ gaccha̍taṁ yu̱vam   dasrā̱ hira̍ṇyavartanī̱ piba̍taṁ so̱myam madhu̍
English: with all the succours that are yours o aśvins hither come to us  wonderful borne on paths of gold drink ye the meath with soma juice

Sanskrit: ā nū̱naṁ yā̍tam aśvinā̱ rathe̍na̱ sūrya̍tvacā   bhujī̱ hira̍ṇyapeśasā̱ kavī̱ gambhī̍racetasā
English: come now ye aśvins on your car decked with a sunbright canopy  bountiful with your golden forms sages with depth of intellect

Sanskrit: ā yā̍ta̱ṁ nahu̍ṣa̱s pary āntari̍kṣāt suvṛ̱ktibhi̍ḥ   pibā̍tho aśvinā̱ madhu̱ kaṇvā̍nā̱ṁ sava̍ne su̱tam
English: come hither from the nahusas come drawn by pure hymns from midair  o aśvins drink the savoury juice shed in the kaṇvas' sacrifice

Sanskrit: ā no̍ yātaṁ di̱vas pary āntari̍kṣād adhapriyā   pu̱traḥ kaṇva̍sya vām i̱ha su̱ṣāva̍ so̱myam madhu̍
English: come to us hither from the heavens come from midair wellloved by us  here kaṇva's son hath pressed for you the pleasant meath of soma juice

Sanskrit: ā no̍ yāta̱m upa̍śru̱ty aśvi̍nā̱ soma̍pītaye   svāhā̱ stoma̍sya vardhanā̱ pra ka̍vī dhī̱tibhi̍r narā
English: come aśvins to give car to us to drink the soma aśvins come  hail strengtheners of the praisesong speed onward ye heroes with your thoughts

Sanskrit: yac ci̱d dhi vā̍m pu̱ra ṛṣa̍yo juhū̱re 'va̍se narā   ā yā̍tam aśvi̱nā ga̍ta̱m upe̱māṁ su̍ṣṭu̱tim mama̍
English: as heroes in the olden time the ṛṣis called you to their aid  so now o aśvins come to us come near to this mine eulogy

Sanskrit: di̱vaś ci̍d roca̱nād adhy ā no̍ gantaṁ svarvidā   dhī̱bhir va̍tsapracetasā̱ stome̍bhir havanaśrutā
English: even from the luminous sphere of heaven come to us ye who find the light  carers for vatsa through our prayers and lauds o yewho hearour call

Sanskrit: kim a̱nye pary ā̍sate̱ 'smat stome̍bhir a̱śvinā̍   pu̱traḥ kaṇva̍sya vā̱m ṛṣi̍r gī̱rbhir va̱tso a̍vīvṛdhat
English: do others more than we adore the aśvins with their hymns of praise?  the ṛṣi vatsa kaṇva's son hath magnified you with his songs

Sanskrit: ā vā̱ṁ vipra̍ i̱hāva̱se 'hva̱t stome̍bhir aśvinā   ari̍prā̱ vṛtra̍hantamā̱ tā no̍ bhūtam mayo̱bhuvā̍
English: the holy singer with his hymns hath called you aśvins hitherward;  best vṛtraslayers free from stain as such bring us felicity

Sanskrit: ā yad vā̱ṁ yoṣa̍ṇā̱ ratha̱m ati̍ṣṭhad vājinīvasū   viśvā̍ny aśvinā yu̱vam pra dhī̱tāny a̍gacchatam
English: what time ye lords of ample wealth the lady mounted on your car  then o ye aśvins ye attained all wishes that your hearts desired

Sanskrit: ata̍ḥ sa̱hasra̍nirṇijā̱ rathe̱nā yā̍tam aśvinā   va̱tso vā̱m madhu̍ma̱d vaco 'śa̍ṁsīt kā̱vyaḥ ka̱viḥ
English: come thence o aśvins on your car that hath a thousand ornaments  vatsa the sage the sage's son hath sung a song of sweets to you

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱ma̱ndrā pu̍rū̱vasū̍ mano̱tarā̍ rayī̱ṇām   stoma̍m me a̱śvinā̍v i̱mam a̱bhi vahnī̍ anūṣātām
English: cheerers of many rich in goods discoverers of opulence  the aśvins riders through the sky have welcomed this my song of praise

Sanskrit: ā no̱ viśvā̍ny aśvinā dha̱ttaṁ rādhā̱ṁsy ahra̍yā   kṛ̱taṁ na̍ ṛ̱tviyā̍vato̱ mā no̍ rīradhataṁ ni̱de
English: o aśvins grant us all rich gifts wherewith no man mav interfere  make us observe the stated times give us not over to reproach

Sanskrit: yan nā̍satyā parā̱vati̱ yad vā̱ stho adhy amba̍re   ata̍ḥ sa̱hasra̍nirṇijā̱ rathe̱nā yā̍tam aśvinā
English: whether nāsatyas ye be nigh or whether ye be far away  come thence o aśvins on your car that hath a thousand ornaments

Sanskrit: yo vā̍ṁ nāsatyā̱v ṛṣi̍r gī̱rbhir va̱tso avī̍vṛdhat   tasmai̍ sa̱hasra̍nirṇija̱m iṣa̍ṁ dhattaṁ ghṛta̱ścuta̍m
English: vatsa the ṛṣi with his songs nāsatyas hath exalted you  grant him rich food distilling oil graced with a thousand ornaments

Sanskrit: prāsmā̱ ūrja̍ṁ ghṛta̱ścuta̱m aśvi̍nā̱ yaccha̍taṁ yu̱vam   yo vā̍ṁ su̱mnāya̍ tu̱ṣṭava̍d vasū̱yād dā̍nunas patī
English: bestow on him o aśvins food that strengthens and that drops with oil  on him who praises you for bliss and lords of bounty prays for wealth

Sanskrit: ā no̍ gantaṁ riśādase̱maṁ stoma̍m purubhujā   kṛ̱taṁ na̍ḥ su̱śriyo̍ nare̱mā dā̍tam a̱bhiṣṭa̍ye
English: come to us ye who slay the foe lords of rich treasure to this hymn  o heroes give us high renown and these good things of earth for help

Sanskrit: ā vā̱ṁ viśvā̍bhir ū̱tibhi̍ḥ pri̱yame̍dhā ahūṣata   rāja̍ntāv adhva̱rāṇā̱m aśvi̍nā̱ yāma̍hūtiṣu
English: the priyamedhas have invoked you with all succours that are yours  you aśvins lords of solemn rites with calls entreating you to come

Sanskrit: ā no̍ gantam mayo̱bhuvāśvi̍nā śa̱mbhuvā̍ yu̱vam   yo vā̍ṁ vipanyū dhī̱tibhi̍r gī̱rbhir va̱tso avī̍vṛdhat
English: come to us aśvins ye who bring felicity auspicious ones  to vatsa who with prayer and hymn lovers of song hath honoured you

Sanskrit: yābhi̱ḥ kaṇva̱m medhā̍tithi̱ṁ yābhi̱r vaśa̱ṁ daśa̍vrajam   yābhi̱r gośa̍rya̱m āva̍ta̱ṁ tābhi̍r no 'vataṁ narā
English: aid us o heroes for those hymns for which ye helped gosarya erst  gave vaśa dasavraja aid and kaṇva and medhatithi

Sanskrit: yābhi̍r narā tra̱sada̍syu̱m āva̍ta̱ṁ kṛtvye̱ dhane̍   tābhi̱ḥ ṣv a1̱̍smām̐ a̍śvinā̱ prāva̍ta̱ṁ vāja̍sātaye
English: and favoured trasadasyu ye heroes in spoildeciding fray  for these o aśvins graciously assist us in acquiring strength

Sanskrit: pra vā̱ṁ stomā̍ḥ suvṛ̱ktayo̱ giro̍ vardhantv aśvinā   puru̍trā̱ vṛtra̍hantamā̱ tā no̍ bhūtam puru̱spṛhā̍
English: o aśvins may pure hymns of ours and songs and praises honour you  best slayers everywhere of foes as such we fondly yearn for you

Sanskrit: trīṇi̍ pa̱dāny a̱śvino̍r ā̱viḥ sānti̱ guhā̍ pa̱raḥ   ka̱vī ṛ̱tasya̱ patma̍bhir a̱rvāg jī̱vebhya̱s pari̍
English: three places of the aśvins erst concealed are made apparent now  both sages with the flight of law come hither unto those who live

Sanskrit: pra yad va̍s tri̱ṣṭubha̱m iṣa̱m maru̍to̱ vipro̱ akṣa̍rat   vi parva̍teṣu rājatha
English: o maruts when the sage hath poured the tṛṣṭup forth as food for you  ye shine amid the mountainclouds

Sanskrit: yad a̱ṅga ta̍viṣīyavo̱ yāma̍ṁ śubhrā̱ aci̍dhvam   ni parva̍tā ahāsata
English: when bright ones fain to show your might ye have determined on your course  the mountainclouds have bent them down

Sanskrit: ud ī̍rayanta vā̱yubhi̍r vā̱śrāsa̱ḥ pṛśni̍mātaraḥ   dhu̱kṣanta̍ pi̱pyuṣī̱m iṣa̍m
English: loud roaring with the winds the sons of pṛśni have upraised themselves  they have poured out the streaming food

Sanskrit: vapa̍nti ma̱ruto̱ miha̱m pra ve̍payanti̱ parva̍tān   yad yāma̱ṁ yānti̍ vā̱yubhi̍ḥ
English: the maruts spread the mist abroad and make mountains rock and reel  when with the winds they go their way

Sanskrit: ni yad yāmā̍ya vo gi̱rir ni sindha̍vo̱ vidha̍rmaṇe   ma̱he śuṣmā̍ya yemi̱re
English: what time the rivers and the hills before your coming bowed them down  so to sustain your mighty force

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmām̐ u̱ nakta̍m ū̱taye̍ yu̱ṣmān divā̍ havāmahe   yu̱ṣmān pra̍ya̱ty a̍dhva̱re
English: we call on you for aid by night on you for succour in the day  on you while sacrifice proceeds

Sanskrit: ud u̱ tye a̍ru̱ṇapsa̍vaś ci̱trā yāme̍bhir īrate   vā̱śrā adhi̱ ṣṇunā̍ di̱vaḥ
English: these verily wondrous red of hue speed on their courses with a roar  over the ridges of the sky

Sanskrit: sṛ̱janti̍ ra̱śmim oja̍sā̱ panthā̱ṁ sūryā̍ya̱ yāta̍ve   te bhā̱nubhi̱r vi ta̍sthire
English: with might they drop the loosened rein so that the sun may run his course  and spread themselves with beams of light

Sanskrit: i̱mām me̍ maruto̱ gira̍m i̱maṁ stoma̍m ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ   i̱mam me̍ vanatā̱ hava̍m
English: accept ye maruts this my song accept ye this mine hymn of praise  accept ṛbhukṣans this my call

Sanskrit: trīṇi̱ sarā̍ṁsi̱ pṛśna̍yo dudu̱hre va̱jriṇe̱ madhu̍   utsa̱ṁ kava̍ndham u̱driṇa̍m
English: the dappled cows have poured three lakes meath for the thunderwielding god  from the great cask the watery cloud

Sanskrit: maru̍to̱ yad dha̍ vo di̱vaḥ su̍mnā̱yanto̱ havā̍mahe   ā tū na̱ upa̍ gantana
English: o maruts quickly come to us when longing for felicity  we call you hither from the sky

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ hi ṣṭhā su̍dānavo̱ rudrā̍ ṛbhukṣaṇo̱ dame̍   u̱ta prace̍taso̱ made̍
English: for rudras and ṛbhukṣans ye most bountiful are in the house  wise when the gladdening draught is drunk

Sanskrit: ā no̍ ra̱yim ma̍da̱cyuta̍m puru̱kṣuṁ vi̱śvadhā̍yasam   iya̍rtā maruto di̱vaḥ
English: o maruts send us down from heaven riches distilling rapturous joy  with plenteous food sustaining all

Sanskrit: adhī̍va̱ yad gi̍rī̱ṇāṁ yāma̍ṁ śubhrā̱ aci̍dhvam   su̱vā̱nair ma̍ndadhva̱ indu̍bhiḥ
English: when bright ones hither from the hills ye have resolved to take your way  ye revel in the drops effused

Sanskrit: e̱tāva̍taś cid eṣāṁ su̱mnam bhi̍kṣeta̱ martya̍ḥ   adā̍bhyasya̱ manma̍bhiḥ
English: man should solicit with his lauds happiness which belongs to them  so great a band invincible

Sanskrit: ye dra̱psā i̍va̱ roda̍sī̱ dhama̱nty anu̍ vṛ̱ṣṭibhi̍ḥ   utsa̍ṁ du̱hanto̱ akṣi̍tam
English: they who like fiery sparks with showers of rain blow through the heaven and earth  milking the spring that never fails

Sanskrit: ud u̍ svā̱nebhi̍r īrata̱ ud rathai̱r ud u̍ vā̱yubhi̍ḥ   ut stomai̱ḥ pṛśni̍mātaraḥ
English: with chariots and tumultuous roar with tempests and with hymns of praise  the sons of pṛśni hurry forth

Sanskrit: yenā̱va tu̱rvaśa̱ṁ yadu̱ṁ yena̱ kaṇva̍ṁ dhana̱spṛta̍m   rā̱ye su tasya̍ dhīmahi
English: for wealth we think of that whereby ye aided yadu turvaśa  and kanva who obtained the spoil

Sanskrit: i̱mā u̍ vaḥ sudānavo ghṛ̱taṁ na pi̱pyuṣī̱r iṣa̍ḥ   vardhā̍n kā̱ṇvasya̱ manma̍bhiḥ
English: may these our viands bounteous ones i that flow in streams like holy oil  with kaṇva's hymns increase your might

Sanskrit: kva̍ nū̱naṁ su̍dānavo̱ mada̍thā vṛktabarhiṣaḥ   bra̱hmā ko va̍ḥ saparyati
English: where bounteous lords for whom the grass is trimmed are ye rejoicing now?  what brahman is adoring you?

Sanskrit: na̱hi ṣma̱ yad dha̍ vaḥ pu̱rā stome̍bhir vṛktabarhiṣaḥ   śardhā̍m̐ ṛ̱tasya̱ jinva̍tha
English: is it not there where ye of old supplied with sacred grass for lauds  inspired the strong in sacrifice?

Sanskrit: sam u̱ tye ma̍ha̱tīr a̱paḥ saṁ kṣo̱ṇī sam u̱ sūrya̍m   saṁ vajra̍m parva̱śo da̍dhuḥ
English: they brought together both the worlds the mighty waters and the sun  and joint by joint the thunderbolt

Sanskrit: vi vṛ̱tram pa̍rva̱śo ya̍yu̱r vi parva̍tām̐ arā̱jina̍ḥ   ca̱krā̱ṇā vṛṣṇi̱ pauṁsya̍m
English: they sundered vṛtra limb from limb and split the gloomy mountainclouds  performing a heroic deed

Sanskrit: anu̍ tri̱tasya̱ yudhya̍ta̱ḥ śuṣma̍m āvann u̱ta kratu̍m   anv indra̍ṁ vṛtra̱tūrye̍
English: they reinforced the power and strength of trita as he fought and helped  indra in battle with the foe

Sanskrit: vi̱dyuddha̍stā a̱bhidya̍va̱ḥ śiprā̍ḥ śī̱rṣan hi̍ra̱ṇyayī̍ḥ   śu̱bhrā vy a̍ñjata śri̱ye
English: they deck themselves for glory bright celestial lightning in their hands  and helms of gold upon their heads

Sanskrit: u̱śanā̱ yat pa̍rā̱vata̍ u̱kṣṇo randhra̱m ayā̍tana   dyaur na ca̍kradad bhi̱yā
English: when eagerly ye from far away came to the cavern of the bull  he bellowed in his fear like heaven

Sanskrit: ā no̍ ma̱khasya̍ dā̱vane 'śvai̱r hira̍ṇyapāṇibhiḥ   devā̍sa̱ upa̍ gantana
English: borne by your goldenfooted steeds o gods come hither to receive  the sacrifice we offer you

Sanskrit: yad e̍ṣā̱m pṛṣa̍tī̱ rathe̱ praṣṭi̱r vaha̍ti̱ rohi̍taḥ   yānti̍ śu̱bhrā ri̱ṇann a̱paḥ
English: when the red leader draws along their spotted deer yoked to the car  the bright ones come and shed the rain

Sanskrit: su̱ṣome̍ śarya̱ṇāva̍ty ārjī̱ke pa̱styā̍vati   ya̱yur nica̍krayā̱ nara̍ḥ
English: susoma saryakiavan and arjika full of homes have they  these heroes sought with downward car

Sanskrit: ka̱dā ga̍cchātha maruta i̱tthā vipra̱ṁ hava̍mānam   mā̱rḍī̱kebhi̱r nādha̍mānam
English: when maruts ye come to him the singer who invokes you thus  with favours to your suppliant?

Sanskrit: kad dha̍ nū̱naṁ ka̍dhapriyo̱ yad indra̱m aja̍hātana   ko va̍ḥ sakhi̱tva o̍hate
English: what now? where have ye still a friend since ye left indra all alone?  who counteth on your friendship now?

Sanskrit: sa̱ho ṣu ṇo̱ vajra̍hastai̱ḥ kaṇvā̍so a̱gnim ma̱rudbhi̍ḥ   stu̱ṣe hira̍ṇyavāśībhiḥ
English: the kaṇvas sing forth agni's praise together with our maruts who  wield thunder and wear swords of gold

Sanskrit: o ṣu vṛṣṇa̱ḥ praya̍jyū̱n ā navya̍se suvi̱tāya̍   va̱vṛ̱tyāṁ ci̱travā̍jān
English: hither for new felicity may i attract the impetuous ones  the heroes with their wondrous strength

Sanskrit: gi̱raya̍ś ci̱n ni ji̍hate̱ parśā̍nāso̱ manya̍mānāḥ   parva̍tāś ci̱n ni ye̍mire
English: before them sink the very hills deerning themseives abysses yea  even the mountains bend them down

Sanskrit: ākṣṇa̱yāvā̍no vahanty a̱ntari̍kṣeṇa̱ pata̍taḥ   dhātā̍raḥ stuva̱te vaya̍ḥ
English: steeds flying on their tortuous path through midair carry them and give  the man who lauds them strength and life

Sanskrit: a̱gnir hi jāni̍ pū̱rvyaś chando̱ na sūro̍ a̱rciṣā̍   te bhā̱nubhi̱r vi ta̍sthire
English: agni was born the first of all like sūrya lovely with his light  with lustre these have spread abroad

Sanskrit: yad i̍ndra̱ prāg apā̱g uda̱ṅ nya̍g vā hū̱yase̱ nṛbhi̍ḥ   simā̍ pu̱rū nṛṣū̍to a̱sy āna̱ve 'si̍ praśardha tu̱rvaśe̍
English: though indra thou art called by men eastward and westward north and south  thou chiefly art with ānava and turvaśa brave champion i urged by men to come

Sanskrit: yad vā̱ rume̱ ruśa̍me̱ śyāva̍ke̱ kṛpa̱ indra̍ mā̱daya̍se̱ sacā̍   kaṇvā̍sas tvā̱ brahma̍bhi̱ḥ stoma̍vāhasa̱ indrā ya̍ccha̱nty ā ga̍hi
English: or indra when with ruma ruśama śyāvaka and kṛpa thou rejoicest thee  still do the kaṇvas bringing praises with their prayers o indra draw thee hither come

Sanskrit: yathā̍ gau̱ro a̱pā kṛ̱taṁ tṛṣya̱nn ety averi̍ṇam   ā̱pi̱tve na̍ḥ prapi̱tve tūya̱m ā ga̍hi̱ kaṇve̍ṣu̱ su sacā̱ piba̍
English: even as the wildbull when he thirsts goes to the desert's watery pool  come hither quickly both at morning and at eve and with the kaṇvas drink thy fill

Sanskrit: manda̍ntu tvā maghavann i̱ndrenda̍vo rādho̱deyā̍ya sunva̱te   ā̱muṣyā̱ soma̍m apibaś ca̱mū su̱taṁ jyeṣṭha̱ṁ tad da̍dhiṣe̱ saha̍ḥ
English: may the drops gladden thee rich indra and obtain bounty for him who pours the juice  soma pressed in the mortar didst thou take and drink and hence hast won surpassing might

Sanskrit: pra ca̍kre̱ saha̍sā̱ saho̍ ba̱bhañja̍ ma̱nyum oja̍sā   viśve̍ ta indra pṛtanā̱yavo̍ yaho̱ ni vṛ̱kṣā i̍va yemire
English: with mightier strength he conquered strength with energy he crushed their wrath  o indra strong in youth all those who sought the fray bent and bowed down to thee like trees

Sanskrit: sa̱hasre̍ṇeva sacate yavī̱yudhā̱ yas ta̱ āna̱ḻ upa̍stutim   pu̱tram prā̍va̱rgaṁ kṛ̍ṇute su̱vīrye̍ dā̱śnoti̱ nama̍üktibhiḥ
English: he who wins promise of thine aid goes girt as with a thousand mighty men of war  he makes his son preeminent in hero might he serves with reverential prayer

Sanskrit: mā bhe̍ma̱ mā śra̍miṣmo̱grasya̍ sa̱khye tava̍   ma̱hat te̱ vṛṣṇo̍ abhi̱cakṣya̍ṁ kṛ̱tam paśye̍ma tu̱rvaśa̱ṁ yadu̍m
English: with thee the mighty for our friend we will not fear or feel fatigue  may we see turvaśa and yadu thy great deed o hero must be glorified

Sanskrit: sa̱vyām anu̍ sphi̱gya̍ṁ vāvase̱ vṛṣā̱ na dā̱no a̍sya roṣati   madhvā̱ sampṛ̍ktāḥ sāra̱gheṇa̍ dhe̱nava̱s tūya̱m ehi̱ dravā̱ piba̍
English: on his left hip the hero hath reclined himself the proffered feast offends him not  the milk is blended with the honey of the bee quickly come hither baste and drink

Sanskrit: a̱śvī ra̱thī su̍rū̱pa id gomā̱m̐ id i̍ndra te̱ sakhā̍   śvā̱tra̱bhājā̱ vaya̍sā sacate̱ sadā̍ ca̱ndro yā̍ti sa̱bhām upa̍
English: indra thy friend is fair of form and rich in horses cars and kine  he evermore hath food accompanied by wealth and radiant joins the company

Sanskrit: ṛśyo̱ na tṛṣya̍nn ava̱pāna̱m ā ga̍hi̱ pibā̱ soma̱ṁ vaśā̱m̐ anu̍   ni̱megha̍māno maghavan di̱vedi̍va̱ oji̍ṣṭhaṁ dadhiṣe̱ saha̍ḥ
English: come like a thirsty antelope to the drinkingplace drink soma to thy heart's desire  raining it down o maghavan day after day thou gainest thy surpassing might

Sanskrit: adhva̍ryo drā̱vayā̱ tvaṁ soma̱m indra̍ḥ pipāsati   upa̍ nū̱naṁ yu̍yuje̱ vṛṣa̍ṇā̱ harī̱ ā ca̍ jagāma vṛtra̱hā
English: priest let the soma juice flow forth for indra longs to drink thereof  he even now hath yoked his vigorous bay steeds the vṛtraslayer hath come near

Sanskrit: sva̱yaṁ ci̱t sa ma̍nyate̱ dāśu̍ri̱r jano̱ yatrā̱ soma̍sya tṛ̱mpasi̍   i̱daṁ te̱ anna̱ṁ yujya̱ṁ samu̍kṣita̱ṁ tasyehi̱ pra dra̍vā̱ piba̍
English: the man with whom thou fillcst thee with soma deems himself a pious worshipper  this thine appropriate food is here poured out for thee come hasten forward drink of it

Sanskrit: ra̱the̱ṣṭhāyā̍dhvaryava̱ḥ soma̱m indrā̍ya sotana   adhi̍ bra̱dhnasyādra̍yo̱ vi ca̍kṣate su̱nvanto̍ dā̱śva̍dhvaram
English: press out the soma juice ye priests for indra borne upon his car  the pressingstones speak loud of indra while they shed the juice which offered honours him

Sanskrit: upa̍ bra̱dhnaṁ vā̱vātā̱ vṛṣa̍ṇā̱ harī̱ indra̍m a̱pasu̍ vakṣataḥ   a̱rvāñca̍ṁ tvā̱ sapta̍yo 'dhvara̱śriyo̱ vaha̍ntu̱ sava̱ned upa̍
English: to the brown juice may his dear vigorous bay steeds bring indra to our holy task  hither let thy carsteeds who seek the sacrifice bring thee to our drinkofferings

Sanskrit: pra pū̱ṣaṇa̍ṁ vṛṇīmahe̱ yujyā̍ya purū̱vasu̍m   sa śa̍kra śikṣa puruhūta no dhi̱yā tuje̍ rā̱ye vi̍mocana
English: pūṣan the lord of ample wealth for firm alliance we elect  may he with wisdom śakra! looser! muchinvoked! aid us to riches and to seed

Sanskrit: saṁ na̍ḥ śiśīhi bhu̱rijo̍r iva kṣu̱raṁ rāsva̍ rā̱yo vi̍mocana   tve tan na̍ḥ su̱veda̍m u̱sriya̱ṁ vasu̱ yaṁ tvaṁ hi̱noṣi̱ martya̍m
English: sharpen us like a razor in the barber's hands send riches thou who settest free  easy to find with thee are treasures of the dawn for mortal man whom thou dost speed

Sanskrit: vemi̍ tvā pūṣann ṛ̱ñjase̱ vemi̱ stota̍va āghṛṇe   na tasya̍ ve̱my ara̍ṇa̱ṁ hi tad va̍so stu̱ṣe pa̱jrāya̱ sāmne̍
English: pūṣan i long to win thy love i long to praise thee radiant god  excellent lord tis strange tome no wish have i to sing the psalm that pajra sings

Sanskrit: parā̱ gāvo̱ yava̍sa̱ṁ kac ci̍d āghṛṇe̱ nitya̱ṁ rekṇo̍ amartya   a̱smāka̍m pūṣann avi̱tā śi̱vo bha̍va̱ maṁhi̍ṣṭho̱ vāja̍sātaye
English: my kine o radiant god seek pasture where they will my during wealth immortal one  be our protector pūṣan! be most liberal lord propitious to our gathering strength

Sanskrit: sthū̱raṁ rādha̍ḥ śa̱tāśva̍ṁ kuru̱ṅgasya̱ divi̍ṣṭiṣu   rājña̍s tve̱ṣasya̍ su̱bhaga̍sya rā̱tiṣu̍ tu̱rvaśe̍ṣv amanmahi
English: rich was the gift kurunga gave a hundred steeds at morning rites  among the gifts of turvaśas we thought of him the opulent the splendid king

Sanskrit: dhī̱bhiḥ sā̱tāni̍ kā̱ṇvasya̍ vā̱jina̍ḥ pri̱yame̍dhair a̱bhidyu̍bhiḥ   ṣa̱ṣṭiṁ sa̱hasrānu̱ nirma̍jām aje̱ nir yū̱thāni̱ gavā̱m ṛṣi̍ḥ
English: what by his morning songs kaṇva the powerful hath with the priyamedhas gained

Sanskrit: vṛ̱kṣāś ci̍n me abhipi̱tve a̍rāraṇuḥ   gām bha̍janta me̱hanāśva̍m bhajanta me̱hanā̍
English: the very trees were joyful at my coming kine they obtained in plenty steeds in plenty

Sanskrit: dū̱rād i̱heva̱ yat sa̱ty a̍ru̱ṇapsu̱r aśi̍śvitat   vi bhā̱nuṁ vi̱śvadhā̍tanat
English: when even as she were present here red dawn hath shone from far away  she spreadeth light on every side

Sanskrit: nṛ̱vad da̍srā mano̱yujā̱ rathe̍na pṛthu̱pāja̍sā   sace̍the aśvino̱ṣasa̍m
English: like heroes on your willyoked car farshining wonderworkers! ye  attend o aśvins on the dawn

Sanskrit: yu̱vābhyā̍ṁ vājinīvasū̱ prati̱ stomā̍ adṛkṣata   vāca̍ṁ dū̱to yatho̍hiṣe
English: by you o lords of ample wealth our songs of praise have been observed  as envoy have i brought the prayer

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱pri̱yā ṇa̍ ū̱taye̍ puruma̱ndrā pu̍rū̱vasū̍   stu̱ṣe kaṇvā̍so a̱śvinā̍
English: kaṇvas must praise the aśvins dear to many making many glad  most rich that they may succour us

Sanskrit: maṁhi̍ṣṭhā vāja̱sāta̍me̱ṣaya̍ntā śu̱bhas patī̍   gantā̍rā dā̱śuṣo̍ gṛ̱ham
English: most liberal best at winning strength inciters lords of splendour who  visit the worshipper's abode

Sanskrit: tā su̍de̱vāya̍ dā̱śuṣe̍ sume̱dhām avi̍tāriṇīm   ghṛ̱tair gavyū̍tim ukṣatam
English: so for devout sudeva dew with fatness his unfailing mead  and make it rich for sacrifice

Sanskrit: ā na̱ḥ stoma̱m upa̍ dra̱vat tūya̍ṁ śye̱nebhi̍r ā̱śubhi̍ḥ   yā̱tam aśve̍bhir aśvinā
English: hitherward running speedily with horses as with rapid hawks  come aśvins to our song of praise

Sanskrit: yebhi̍s ti̱sraḥ pa̍rā̱vato̍ di̱vo viśvā̍ni roca̱nā   trīm̐r a̱ktūn pa̍ri̱dīya̍thaḥ
English: wherewith the three wide distances and all the lights that are in heaven  ye traverse and three times of night

Sanskrit: u̱ta no̱ goma̍tī̱r iṣa̍ u̱ta sā̱tīr a̍harvidā   vi pa̱thaḥ sā̱taye̍ sitam
English: o finders of the day that we may win us food of kine and wealth  open the paths for us to tread

Sanskrit: ā no̱ goma̍ntam aśvinā su̱vīra̍ṁ su̱ratha̍ṁ ra̱yim   vo̱ḻham aśvā̍vatī̱r iṣa̍ḥ
English: o aśvins bring us wealth in kine in noble heroes and in cars  bring us the strength that horses give

Sanskrit: vā̱vṛ̱dhā̱nā śu̍bhas patī dasrā̱ hira̍ṇyavartanī   piba̍taṁ so̱myam madhu̍

Sanskrit: a̱smabhya̍ṁ vājinīvasū ma̱ghava̍dbhyaś ca sa̱pratha̍ḥ   cha̱rdir ya̍nta̱m adā̍bhyam
English: to us ye lords of ample wealth and to our wealth chiefs extend  wide shelter neer to be assailed

Sanskrit: ni ṣu brahma̱ janā̍nā̱ṁ yāvi̍ṣṭa̱ṁ tūya̱m ā ga̍tam   mo ṣv a1̱̍nyām̐ upā̍ratam
English: come quickly downward to the prayer of people whom ye favour most  approach not unto other folk

Sanskrit: a̱sya pi̍batam aśvinā yu̱vam mada̍sya̱ cāru̍ṇaḥ   madhvo̍ rā̱tasya̍ dhiṣṇyā
English: ye aśvins whom our minds perceive drink of this lovely gladdening draught  the mcath which we present to you

Sanskrit: a̱sme ā va̍hataṁ ra̱yiṁ śa̱tava̍ntaṁ saha̱sriṇa̍m   pu̱ru̱kṣuṁ vi̱śvadhā̍yasam
English: bring riches hither unto us in hundreds and in thousands source  of plenteous food sustaining all

Sanskrit: pu̱ru̱trā ci̱d dhi vā̍ṁ narā vi̱hvaya̍nte manī̱ṣiṇa̍ḥ   vā̱ghadbhi̍r aśvi̱nā ga̍tam
English: verily sages call on you ye heroes in full many a place  moved by the priests o aśvins conic

Sanskrit: janā̍so vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣo ha̱viṣma̍nto ara̱ṁkṛta̍ḥ   yu̱vāṁ ha̍vante aśvinā
English: men who have trimmed the sacred grass bringing oblations and prepared  o aśvins are invoking you

Sanskrit: a̱smāka̍m a̱dya vā̍m a̱yaṁ stomo̱ vāhi̍ṣṭho̱ anta̍maḥ   yu̱vābhyā̍m bhūtv aśvinā
English: may this our hymn of praise today most powerful to bring you be  o aśvins nearest to your hearts

Sanskrit: yo ha̍ vā̱m madhu̍no̱ dṛti̱r āhi̍to ratha̱carṣa̍ṇe   tata̍ḥ pibatam aśvinā

Sanskrit: tena̍ no vājinīvasū̱ paśve̍ to̱kāya̱ śaṁ gave̍   vaha̍ta̱m pīva̍rī̱r iṣa̍ḥ
English: for this ye lords of ample wealth bring blessing for our herd our kine  our progeny and plenteous food

Sanskrit: u̱ta no̍ di̱vyā iṣa̍ u̱ta sindhū̍m̐r aharvidā   apa̱ dvāre̍va varṣathaḥ

Sanskrit: ka̱dā vā̍ṁ tau̱gryo vi̍dhat samu̱dre ja̍hi̱to na̍rā   yad vā̱ṁ ratho̱ vibhi̱ṣ patā̍t
English: when did the son of tugra serve you men? abandoned in the sea  that with winged steeds your car might fly

Sanskrit: yu̱vaṁ kaṇvā̍ya nāsatyā̱ ṛpi̍riptāya ha̱rmye   śaśva̍d ū̱tīr da̍śasyathaḥ
English: ye o nāsatyas ministered to kaṇva with repeated aid  when cast into the heated pit

Sanskrit: tābhi̱r ā yā̍tam ū̱tibhi̱r navya̍sībhiḥ suśa̱stibhi̍ḥ   yad vā̍ṁ vṛṣaṇvasū hu̱ve
English: come near with those most recent aids of yours which merit eulogy  when i invoke you wealthy gods

Sanskrit: yathā̍ ci̱t kaṇva̱m āva̍tam pri̱yame̍dham upastu̱tam   atri̍ṁ śi̱ñjāra̍m aśvinā
English: as ye protected kaṇva erst priyamedha and upastuta  atri sinjara aśvins twain

Sanskrit: yatho̱ta kṛtvye̱ dhane̱ 'ṁśuṁ goṣv a̱gastya̍m   yathā̱ vāje̍ṣu̱ sobha̍rim

Sanskrit: e̱tāva̍d vāṁ vṛṣaṇvasū̱ ato̍ vā̱ bhūyo̍ aśvinā   gṛ̱ṇanta̍ḥ su̱mnam ī̍mahe
English: for so much bliss or even more o aśvins wealthy gods than this  we pray white singing hymns to you

Sanskrit: ratha̱ṁ hira̍ṇyavandhura̱ṁ hira̍ṇyābhīśum aśvinā   ā hi sthātho̍ divi̱spṛśa̍m
English: ascend your car with golden seat o aśvins and with reins of gold  that reaches even to the sky

Sanskrit: hi̱ra̱ṇyayī̍ vā̱ṁ rabhi̍r ī̱ṣā akṣo̍ hira̱ṇyaya̍ḥ   u̱bhā ca̱krā hi̍ra̱ṇyayā̍
English: golden is its supporting shaft the axle also is of gold  and both the wheels are made of gold

Sanskrit: tena̍ no vājinīvasū parā̱vata̍ś ci̱d ā ga̍tam   upe̱māṁ su̍ṣṭu̱tim mama̍

Sanskrit: ā va̍hethe parā̱kāt pū̱rvīr a̱śnantā̍v aśvinā   iṣo̱ dāsī̍r amartyā

Sanskrit: ā no̍ dyu̱mnair ā śravo̍bhi̱r ā rā̱yā yā̍tam aśvinā   puru̍ścandrā̱ nāsa̍tyā
English: with splendour riches and renown o aśvins hither come to us  nāsatyas shining brilliantly

Sanskrit: eha vā̍m pruṣi̱tapsa̍vo̱ vayo̍ vahantu pa̱rṇina̍ḥ   acchā̍ svadhva̱raṁ jana̍m
English: may dappled horses steeds who fly with pinions bring you hitherward  to people skilled in sacrifice

Sanskrit: ratha̍ṁ vā̱m anu̍gāyasa̱ṁ ya i̱ṣā varta̍te sa̱ha   na ca̱kram a̱bhi bā̍dhate
English: the whcel delayeth not that car of yours accompanied by song  that cometh with a store of food

Sanskrit: hi̱ra̱ṇyaye̍na̱ rathe̍na dra̱vatpā̍ṇibhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ   dhīja̍vanā̱ nāsa̍tyā
English: borne on that chariot wrought of gold with coursers very fleet of foot  come o nāsatyas swift as thought

Sanskrit: yu̱vam mṛ̱gaṁ jā̍gṛ̱vāṁsa̱ṁ svada̍tho vā vṛṣaṇvasū   tā na̍ḥ pṛṅktam i̱ṣā ra̱yim
English: o wealthy gods ye taste and find the brisk and watchful wild beast good  associate wealth with food for us

Sanskrit: tā me̍ aśvinā sanī̱nāṁ vi̱dyāta̱ṁ navā̍nām   yathā̍ cic cai̱dyaḥ ka̱śuḥ śa̱tam uṣṭrā̍nā̱ṁ dada̍t sa̱hasrā̱ daśa̱ gonā̍m
English: as such o aśvins find for me my share of newpresented gifts  as kasu cedi's son gave me a hundred head of buffaloes and ten thousand kine

Sanskrit: yo me̱ hira̍ṇyasaṁdṛśo̱ daśa̱ rājño̱ ama̍ṁhata   a̱dha̱spa̱dā ic cai̱dyasya̍ kṛ̱ṣṭaya̍ś carma̱mnā a̱bhito̱ janā̍ḥ
English: he who hath given me for mine own ten kings like gold to look upon  at caidya's feet are all the people round about all those who think upon the shield

Sanskrit: māki̍r e̱nā pa̱thā gā̱d yene̱me yanti̍ ce̱daya̍ḥ   a̱nyo net sū̱rir oha̍te bhūri̱dāva̍ttaro̱ jana̍ḥ
English: no man not any goes upon the path on which the cedis walk  no other prince no folk is held more liberal of gifts than they

Sanskrit: pibā̍ su̱tasya̍ ra̱sino̱ matsvā̍ na indra̱ goma̍taḥ   ā̱pir no̍ bodhi sadha̱mādyo̍ vṛ̱dhe̱3̱̍ 'smām̐ a̍vantu te̱ dhiya̍ḥ
English: drink indra of the savoury juice and cheer thee with our milky draught  be for our weal our friend and sharer of the feast and let thy wisdom guard us well

Sanskrit: bhū̱yāma̍ te suma̱tau vā̱jino̍ va̱yam mā na̍ḥ star a̱bhimā̍taye   a̱smāñ ci̱trābhi̍r avatād a̱bhiṣṭi̍bhi̱r ā na̍ḥ su̱mneṣu̍ yāmaya
English: in thy kind grace and favour may we still be strong expose us not to foe's attack  with manifold assistance guard and succour us and bring us to felicity

Sanskrit: i̱mā u̍ tvā purūvaso̱ giro̍ vardhantu̱ yā mama̍   pā̱va̱kava̍rṇā̱ḥ śuca̍yo vipa̱ścito̱ 'bhi stomai̍r anūṣata
English: may these my songs of praise exalt thee lord who hast abundant wealth  men skilled in holy hymns pure with the hues of fire have sung them with their lauds to thee

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ sa̱hasra̱m ṛṣi̍bhi̱ḥ saha̍skṛtaḥ samu̱dra i̍va paprathe   sa̱tyaḥ so a̍sya mahi̱mā gṛ̍ṇe̱ śavo̍ ya̱jñeṣu̍ vipra̱rājye̍
English: he with his might enhanced by ṛṣis thousandfold hath like an ocean spread himself  his majesty is praised as true at solemn rites his power where holy singers rule

Sanskrit: indra̱m id de̱vatā̍taya̱ indra̍m praya̱ty a̍dhva̱re   indra̍ṁ samī̱ke va̱nino̍ havāmaha̱ indra̱ṁ dhana̍sya sā̱taye̍
English: indra for worship of the gods indra while sacrifice proceeds  indra as worshippers in battleshock we call indra that we may win the spoil

Sanskrit: indro̍ ma̱hnā roda̍sī papratha̱c chava̱ indra̱ḥ sūrya̍m arocayat   indre̍ ha̱ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni yemira̱ indre̍ suvā̱nāsa̱ inda̍vaḥ
English: with might hath indra spread out heaven and earth with power hath indra lighted up the sun  in indra are all creatures closely held; in him meet the distilling somadrops

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tvā̍ pū̱rvapī̍taya̱ indra̱ stome̍bhir ā̱yava̍ḥ   sa̱mī̱cī̱nāsa̍ ṛ̱bhava̱ḥ sam a̍svaran ru̱drā gṛ̍ṇanta̱ pūrvya̍m
English: men with their lauds are urging thee indra to drink the soma first  the ṛbhus in accord have lifted up their voice and rudras sung thee as the first

Sanskrit: a̱syed indro̍ vāvṛdhe̱ vṛṣṇya̱ṁ śavo̱ made̍ su̱tasya̱ viṣṇa̍vi   a̱dyā tam a̍sya mahi̱māna̍m ā̱yavo 'nu̍ ṣṭuvanti pū̱rvathā̍
English: indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice in the wild rapture of this juice  and living men today even as of old sing forth their praises to his majesty

Sanskrit: tat tvā̍ yāmi su̱vīrya̱ṁ tad brahma̍ pū̱rvaci̍ttaye   yenā̱ yati̍bhyo̱ bhṛga̍ve̱ dhane̍ hi̱te yena̱ praska̍ṇva̱m āvi̍tha
English: i crave of thee that hero strength that thou mayst first regard this prayer  wherewith thou holpest bhṛgu and the yatis and praskaṇva when the prize was staked

Sanskrit: yenā̍ samu̱dram asṛ̍jo ma̱hīr a̱pas tad i̍ndra̱ vṛṣṇi̍ te̱ śava̍ḥ   sa̱dyaḥ so a̍sya mahi̱mā na sa̱ṁnaśe̱ yaṁ kṣo̱ṇīr a̍nucakra̱de
English: wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea that indra is thy manly strength  for ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud

Sanskrit: śa̱gdhī na̍ indra̱ yat tvā̍ ra̱yiṁ yāmi̍ su̱vīrya̍m   śa̱gdhi vājā̍ya pratha̱maṁ siṣā̍sate śa̱gdhi stomā̍ya pūrvya
English: help us o indra when we pray to thee for wealth and hero might  first help thou on to strength the man who strives to win and aid our laud o ancient one

Sanskrit: śa̱gdhī no̍ a̱sya yad dha̍ pau̱ram āvi̍tha̱ dhiya̍ indra̱ siṣā̍sataḥ   śa̱gdhi yathā̱ ruśa̍ma̱ṁ śyāva̍ka̱ṁ kṛpa̱m indra̱ prāva̱ḥ sva̍rṇaram
English: help for us indra as thou holpest paura once this man's devotions bent on gain  help as thou gavest ruśama and śyāvaka and svarṇara and kṛpa aid

Sanskrit: nir i̍ndra bṛha̱tībhyo̍ vṛ̱traṁ dhanu̍bhyo asphuraḥ   nir arbu̍dasya̱ mṛga̍yasya mā̱yino̱ niḥ parva̍tasya̱ gā ā̍jaḥ
English: thou from the lofty plains above o indra hurledst vṛtra down  thou dravest forth the kine of guileful mṛgaya and arbuda from the mountain's hold

English: the fairest courser of them all who runneth on as twere to heaven  which indra and the maruts gave and pākasthāman kaurayāṇ

English: for him for indra for the god be pressed three draughts of soma juice  in the juicedrinker's own abode

English: three reservoirs exude their drops filled are three beakers to the brim  all for one offering to the god

Sanskrit: prapra̱ kṣayā̍ya̱ panya̍se̱ janā̍ya̱ juṣṭo̍ a̱druhe̍   vī̱ty a̍rṣa̱ cani̍ṣṭhayā

Sanskrit: sa sū̱nur mā̱tarā̱ śuci̍r jā̱to jā̱te a̍rocayat   ma̱hān ma̱hī ṛ̍tā̱vṛdhā̍
English: he the bright son when born illumed his parents who had sprung to life  great son great strengtheners of law

Sanskrit: sa sa̱pta dhī̱tibhi̍r hi̱to na̱dyo̍ ajinvad a̱druha̍ḥ   yā eka̱m akṣi̍ vāvṛ̱dhuḥ
English: urged by the seven devotions he hath stirred the guileless rivers which  have magnified the single eye

Sanskrit: tā a̱bhi santa̱m astṛ̍tam ma̱he yuvā̍na̱m ā da̍dhuḥ   indu̍m indra̱ tava̍ vra̱te
English: these helped to might theyouthful one high over all invincible  even indu indra! in thy law

Sanskrit: a̱bhi vahni̱r ama̍rtyaḥ sa̱pta pa̍śyati̱ vāva̍hiḥ   krivi̍r de̱vīr a̍tarpayat
English: the immortal courser good to draw looks down upon the seven the fount  hath satisfied the goddesses

Sanskrit: avā̱ kalpe̍ṣu naḥ puma̱s tamā̍ṁsi soma̱ yodhyā̍   tāni̍ punāna jaṅghanaḥ
English: aid us in holy rites o man o pavamana drive away  dark shades that must be met in fight

Sanskrit: nū navya̍se̱ navī̍yase sū̱ktāya̍ sādhayā pa̱thaḥ   pra̱tna̱vad ro̍cayā̱ ruca̍ḥ

Sanskrit: pava̍māna̱ mahi̱ śravo̱ gām aśva̍ṁ rāsi vī̱rava̍t   sanā̍ me̱dhāṁ sanā̱ sva̍ḥ
English: give pavamana high renown give kine and steeds and hero sons  win for us wisdom win the light

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa dhi̱yā yā̱ty aṇvyā̱ śūro̱ rathe̍bhir ā̱śubhi̍ḥ   gaccha̱nn indra̍sya niṣkṛ̱tam

Sanskrit: e̱ṣa hi̱to vi nī̍yate̱ 'ntaḥ śu̱bhrāva̍tā pa̱thā   yadī̍ tu̱ñjanti̱ bhūrṇa̍yaḥ

English: him even him the fingers ten and the seven songs make beautiful  wellweaponed best of gladdeners

Sanskrit: upā̍smai gāyatā nara̱ḥ pava̍mānā̱yenda̍ve   a̱bhi de̱vām̐ iya̍kṣate

Sanskrit: a̱bhi te̱ madhu̍nā̱ payo 'tha̍rvāṇo aśiśrayuḥ   de̱vaṁ de̱vāya̍ deva̱yu

Sanskrit: gi̱rā yadī̱ saba̍ndhava̱ḥ pañca̱ vrātā̍ apa̱syava̍ḥ   pa̱ri̱ṣkṛ̱ṇvanti̍ dharṇa̱sim

Sanskrit: sa̱tyamu̍grasya bṛha̱taḥ saṁ sra̍vanti saṁsra̱vāḥ   saṁ ya̍nti ra̱sino̱ rasā̍ḥ punā̱no brahma̍ṇā hara̱ indrā̍yendo̱ pari̍ srava
