Sanskrit: barhi̍ṣadaḥ pitara ū̱ty a1̱̍rvāg i̱mā vo̍ ha̱vyā ca̍kṛmā ju̱ṣadhva̍m   ta ā ga̱tāva̍sā̱ śaṁta̍me̱nāthā̍ na̱ḥ śaṁ yor a̍ra̱po da̍dhāta
English: fathers who sit on sacred grass come help us these offerings have we made for you; accept them  so come to us with most auspicious favour and give us health and strength without a trouble

Sanskrit: upa̍hūtāḥ pi̱tara̍ḥ so̱myāso̍ barhi̱ṣye̍ṣu ni̱dhiṣu̍ pri̱yeṣu̍   ta ā ga̍mantu̱ ta i̱ha śru̍va̱ntv adhi̍ bruvantu̱ te̍ 'vantv a̱smān
English: may they the fathers worthy of the soma invited to their favourite oblations  laid on the sacred grass come nigh and listen may they be gracious unto us and bless us

Sanskrit: ācyā̱ jānu̍ dakṣiṇa̱to ni̱ṣadye̱maṁ ya̱jñam a̱bhi gṛ̍ṇīta̱ viśve̍   mā hi̍ṁsiṣṭa pitara̱ḥ kena̍ cin no̱ yad va̱ āga̍ḥ puru̱ṣatā̱ karā̍ma
English: bowing your bended knees and seated southward accept this sacrifice of ours with favour  punish us not for any sin o fathers which we through human frailty have committed

Sanskrit: āsī̍nāso aru̱ṇīnā̍m u̱pasthe̍ ra̱yiṁ dha̍tta dā̱śuṣe̱ martyā̍ya   pu̱trebhya̍ḥ pitara̱s tasya̱ vasva̱ḥ pra ya̍cchata̱ ta i̱horja̍ṁ dadhāta
English: lapped in the bosom of the purple mornings give riches to the man who brings oblations  grant to your sons a portion of that treasure and present give them energy ye fathers

Sanskrit: ye na̱ḥ pūrve̍ pi̱tara̍ḥ so̱myāso̍ 'nūhi̱re so̍mapī̱thaṁ vasi̍ṣṭhāḥ   tebhi̍r ya̱maḥ sa̍ṁrarā̱ṇo ha̱vīṁṣy u̱śann u̱śadbhi̍ḥ pratikā̱mam a̍ttu
English: our ancient fathers who deserve the soma who came most noble to our soma banquet  with these let yama yearning with the yearning rejoicing eat our offerings at his pleasure

Sanskrit: ye tā̍tṛ̱ṣur de̍va̱trā jeha̍mānā hotrā̱vida̱ḥ stoma̍taṣṭāso a̱rkaiḥ   āgne̍ yāhi suvi̱datre̍bhir a̱rvāṅ sa̱tyaiḥ ka̱vyaiḥ pi̱tṛbhi̍r gharma̱sadbhi̍ḥ
English: come to us agni with the gracioug fathers who dwell in glowing light the very kavyas  who thirsted mid the gods who hasten hither oblation winners theme of singers' praises

Sanskrit: ye sa̱tyāso̍ havi̱rado̍ havi̱ṣpā indre̍ṇa de̱vaiḥ sa̱ratha̱ṁ dadhā̍nāḥ   āgne̍ yāhi sa̱hasra̍ṁ devava̱ndaiḥ parai̱ḥ pūrvai̍ḥ pi̱tṛbhi̍r gharma̱sadbhi̍ḥ
English: come agni come with countless ancient fathers dwellers in light primeval godadorers  eaters and drinkers of oblations truthful who travel with the deities and indra

Sanskrit: agni̍ṣvāttāḥ pitara̱ eha ga̍cchata̱ sada̍ḥsadaḥ sadata supraṇītayaḥ   a̱ttā ha̱vīṁṣi̱ praya̍tāni ba̱rhiṣy athā̍ ra̱yiṁ sarva̍vīraṁ dadhātana
English: fathers whom agni's flames have tasted come ye nigh ye kindly leaders take ye each your proper place  eat sacrificial food presented on the grass grant riches with a multitude of hero sons

Sanskrit: tvam a̍gna īḻi̱to jā̍tave̱do 'vā̍ḍ ḍha̱vyāni̍ sura̱bhīṇi̍ kṛ̱tvī   prādā̍ḥ pi̱tṛbhya̍ḥ sva̱dhayā̱ te a̍kṣann a̱ddhi tvaṁ de̍va̱ praya̍tā ha̱vīṁṣi̍
English: thou agni jātavedas when entreated didst bear the offerings which thou madest fragrant  and give them to the fathers who did cat them with svadha eat thou god the gifts we bring thee

Sanskrit: ye ce̱ha pi̱taro̱ ye ca̱ neha yām̐ś ca̍ vi̱dma yām̐ u̍ ca̱ na pra̍vi̱dma   tvaṁ ve̍ttha̱ yati̱ te jā̍tavedaḥ sva̱dhābhi̍r ya̱jñaṁ sukṛ̍taṁ juṣasva
English: thou jātavedas knowest well the number of fathers who are here and who are absent  of fathers whom we know and whom we know not accept the sacrifice wellprepared with portions

Sanskrit: ye a̍gnida̱gdhā ye ana̍gnidagdhā̱ madhye̍ di̱vaḥ sva̱dhayā̍ mā̱daya̍nte   tebhi̍ḥ sva̱rāḻ asu̍nītim e̱tāṁ ya̍thāva̱śaṁ ta̱nva̍ṁ kalpayasva
English: they who consumed by fire or not cremated joy in their offering in the midst of heaven  grant them o sovran lord the world of spirits and their own body as thy pleasure wills it

Sanskrit: vṛṣā̱ vṛṣṇe̍ duduhe̱ doha̍sā di̱vaḥ payā̍ṁsi ya̱hvo adi̍te̱r adā̍bhyaḥ   viśva̱ṁ sa ve̍da̱ varu̍ṇo̱ yathā̍ dhi̱yā sa ya̱jñiyo̍ yajatu ya̱jñiyā̍m̐ ṛ̱tūn
English: the bull hath yielded for the bull the milk of heaven the son of aditi can never be deceived  according to his wisdom varuṇa knoweth all may he the holy hallow times for sacrifice

Sanskrit: rapa̍d gandha̱rvīr apyā̍ ca̱ yoṣa̍ṇā na̱dasya̍ nā̱de pari̍ pātu me̱ mana̍ḥ   i̱ṣṭasya̱ madhye̱ adi̍ti̱r ni dhā̍tu no̱ bhrātā̍ no jye̱ṣṭhaḥ pra̍tha̱mo vi vo̍cati
English: gandharvi spake may she the lady of the flood amid the river's roaring leave my heart untouched  may aditi accomplish all that we desire and may our eldest brother tell us this as chief

Sanskrit: so ci̱n nu bha̱drā kṣu̱matī̱ yaśa̍svaty u̱ṣā u̍vāsa̱ mana̍ve̱ sva̍rvatī   yad ī̍m u̱śanta̍m uśa̱tām anu̱ kratu̍m a̱gniṁ hotā̍raṁ vi̱dathā̍ya̱ jīja̍nan
English: yea even this blessed morning rich in store of food splendid with heavenly lustre hath shone out for man  since they as was the wish of yearning gods brought forth that yearning agni for the assembly as the priest

Sanskrit: adha̱ tyaṁ dra̱psaṁ vi̱bhva̍ṁ vicakṣa̱ṇaṁ vir ābha̍rad iṣi̱taḥ śye̱no a̍dhva̱re   yadī̱ viśo̍ vṛ̱ṇate̍ da̱smam āryā̍ a̱gniṁ hotā̍ra̱m adha̱ dhīr a̍jāyata
English: and the fleet falcon brought for sacrifice from afar this flowing drop most excellent and keen of sight  then when the āryan tribes chose as invoking priest agni the wonderworker and the hymn rose up

Sanskrit: sadā̍si ra̱ṇvo yava̍seva̱ puṣya̍te̱ hotrā̍bhir agne̱ manu̍ṣaḥ svadhva̱raḥ   vipra̍sya vā̱ yac cha̍śamā̱na u̱kthya1̱̍ṁ vāja̍ṁ sasa̱vām̐ u̍pa̱yāsi̱ bhūri̍bhiḥ
English: still art thou kind to him who feeds thee as with grass and skilled in sacrifice offers thee holy gifts  when thou having received the sage's strengthening food with lauds after long toil cornest with many more

Sanskrit: ud ī̍raya pi̱tarā̍ jā̱ra ā bhaga̱m iya̍kṣati harya̱to hṛ̱tta i̍ṣyati   viva̍kti̱ vahni̍ḥ svapa̱syate̍ ma̱khas ta̍vi̱ṣyate̱ asu̍ro̱ vepa̍te ma̱tī
English: urge thou thy parents as a lover ' to delight the lovely one desires and craves it from his heart  the priest calls out the sacrificer shows his skill the asura tries his strength and with the hymn is stirred

Sanskrit: yas te̍ agne suma̱tim marto̱ akṣa̱t saha̍saḥ sūno̱ ati̱ sa pra śṛ̍ṇve   iṣa̱ṁ dadhā̍no̱ vaha̍māno̱ aśvai̱r ā sa dyu̱mām̐ ama̍vān bhūṣati̱ dyūn
English: farfamed is he the mortal man o agni thou son of strength who hath obtained thy favour  he gathering power borne onward by his horses makes his days lovely in his might and splendour

Sanskrit: yad a̍gna e̱ṣā sami̍ti̱r bhavā̍ti de̱vī de̱veṣu̍ yaja̱tā ya̍jatra   ratnā̍ ca̱ yad vi̱bhajā̍si svadhāvo bhā̱gaṁ no̱ atra̱ vasu̍mantaṁ vītāt
English: when holy agni the divine assembly the sacred synod mid the gods is gathered  and when thou godlike one dealest forth treasures vouchsafe us too our portion of the riches

Sanskrit: śru̱dhī no̍ agne̱ sada̍ne sa̱dhasthe̍ yu̱kṣvā ratha̍m a̱mṛta̍sya dravi̱tnum   ā no̍ vaha̱ roda̍sī de̱vapu̍tre̱ māki̍r de̱vānā̱m apa̍ bhūr i̱ha syā̍ḥ
English: hear us o agni in your common dwelling harness thy rapid car of amṛta  bring heaven and earth the deities' parents hither stay with us here nor from the gods be distant

Sanskrit: maina̍m agne̱ vi da̍ho̱ mābhi śo̍co̱ māsya̱ tvaca̍ṁ cikṣipo̱ mā śarī̍ram   ya̱dā śṛ̱taṁ kṛ̱ṇavo̍ jātave̱do 'the̍m ena̱m pra hi̍ṇutāt pi̱tṛbhya̍ḥ
English: burn him not up nor quite consume him agni let not his body or his skin be scattered  o jātavedas when thou hast matured him then send him on his way unto the fathers

Sanskrit: śṛ̱taṁ ya̱dā kara̍si jātave̱do 'the̍m ena̱m pari̍ dattāt pi̱tṛbhya̍ḥ   ya̱dā gacchā̱ty asu̍nītim e̱tām athā̍ de̱vānā̍ṁ vaśa̱nīr bha̍vāti
English: when thou hast made him ready jātavedas then do thou give him over to the fathers  when he attains unto the life that waits him he shall become the deities' controller

Sanskrit: sūrya̱ṁ cakṣu̍r gacchatu̱ vāta̍m ā̱tmā dyāṁ ca̍ gaccha pṛthi̱vīṁ ca̱ dharma̍ṇā   a̱po vā̍ gaccha̱ yadi̱ tatra̍ te hi̱tam oṣa̍dhīṣu̱ prati̍ tiṣṭhā̱ śarī̍raiḥ
English: the sun receive thine eye tne wind thy spirit; go as thy merit is to earth or heaven  go if it be thy lot unto the waters; go make thine home in plants with all thy members

Sanskrit: a̱jo bhā̱gas tapa̍sā̱ taṁ ta̍pasva̱ taṁ te̍ śo̱cis ta̍patu̱ taṁ te̍ a̱rciḥ   yās te̍ śi̱vās ta̱nvo̍ jātaveda̱s tābhi̍r vahainaṁ su̱kṛtā̍m u lo̱kam
English: thy portion is the goat with heat consume him let thy fierce flame thy glowing splendour burn him  with thine auspicious forms o jātavedas bear this man to the region of the pious

Sanskrit: ava̍ sṛja̱ puna̍r agne pi̱tṛbhyo̱ yas ta̱ āhu̍ta̱ś cara̍ti sva̱dhābhi̍ḥ   āyu̱r vasā̍na̱ upa̍ vetu̱ śeṣa̱ḥ saṁ ga̍cchatāṁ ta̱nvā̍ jātavedaḥ
English: again o agni to the fathers send him who offered in thee goes with our oblations  wearing new life let him increase his offspring let him rejoin a body jātavedas

Sanskrit: yat te̍ kṛ̱ṣṇaḥ śa̍ku̱na ā̍tu̱toda̍ pipī̱laḥ sa̱rpa u̱ta vā̱ śvāpa̍daḥ   a̱gniṣ ṭad vi̱śvād a̍ga̱daṁ kṛ̍ṇotu̱ soma̍ś ca̱ yo brā̍hma̱ṇām̐ ā̍vi̱veśa̍
English: what wound soeer the dark bird hath inflicted the emmet or the serpent or the jackal  may agni who devoureth all things heal it and soma who hath passed into the brahmans

Sanskrit: a̱gner varma̱ pari̱ gobhi̍r vyayasva̱ sam prorṇu̍ṣva̱ pīva̍sā̱ meda̍sā ca   net tvā̍ dhṛ̱ṣṇur hara̍sā̱ jarhṛ̍ṣāṇo da̱dhṛg vi̍dha̱kṣyan pa̍rya̱ṅkhayā̍te
English: shield thee with flesh against the flames of agni encompass thee about with fat and marrow  so will the bold one eager to attack thee with fierce glow fail to girdle and consume thee

Sanskrit: i̱mam a̍gne cama̱sam mā vi ji̍hvaraḥ pri̱yo de̱vānā̍m u̱ta so̱myānā̍m   e̱ṣa yaś ca̍ma̱so de̍va̱pāna̱s tasmi̍n de̱vā a̱mṛtā̍ mādayante
English: forbear o agni to upset this ladle the gods and they who merit soma love it  this ladle this which serves the gods to drink from in this the immortal deities rejoice them

Sanskrit: kra̱vyāda̍m a̱gnim pra hi̍ṇomi dū̱raṁ ya̱marā̍jño gacchatu ripravā̱haḥ   i̱haivāyam ita̍ro jā̱tave̍dā de̱vebhyo̍ ha̱vyaṁ va̍hatu prajā̱nan
English: 1 send afar flesh eating agni bearing off stains may he depart to yama's subjects  but let this other jātavedas carry oblation to the gods for he is skilful

Sanskrit: yo a̱gniḥ kra̱vyāt pra̍vi̱veśa̍ vo gṛ̱ham i̱mam paśya̱nn ita̍raṁ jā̱tave̍dasam   taṁ ha̍rāmi pitṛya̱jñāya̍ de̱vaṁ sa gha̱rmam i̍nvāt para̱me sa̱dhasthe̍
English: i choose as god for fatherworship agni flesheater who hath past within your dwelling  while looking on this other jātavedas let him light flames in the supreme assembly

Sanskrit: yo a̱gniḥ kra̍vya̱vāha̍naḥ pi̱tṝn yakṣa̍d ṛtā̱vṛdha̍ḥ   pred u̍ ha̱vyāni̍ vocati de̱vebhya̍ś ca pi̱tṛbhya̱ ā
English: with offerings meet let agni bring the fathers who support the law  let him announce oblations paid to fathers and to deities

Sanskrit: u̱śanta̍s tvā̱ ni dhī̍mahy u̱śanta̱ḥ sam i̍dhīmahi   u̱śann u̍śa̱ta ā va̍ha pi̱tṝn ha̱viṣe̱ atta̍ve
English: right gladly would we set thee down right gladly make thee burn and glow  gladly bring yearning fathers nigh to cat the food of sacrifice

Sanskrit: yaṁ tvam a̍gne sa̱mada̍ha̱s tam u̱ nir vā̍payā̱ puna̍ḥ   ki̱yāmbv atra̍ rohatu pākadū̱rvā vya̍lkaśā
English: cool agni and again refresh the spot which thou hast scorched and burnt  here let the waterlily grow and tender grass and leafy herb

Sanskrit: śīti̍ke̱ śīti̍kāvati̱ hlādi̍ke̱ hlādi̍kāvati   ma̱ṇḍū̱kyā̱3̱̍ su saṁ ga̍ma i̱maṁ sv a1̱̍gniṁ ha̍rṣaya
English: o full of coolness thou cool plant full of fresh moisture freshening herb  come hither with the female frog fill with delight this agni here

Sanskrit: pa̱re̱yi̱vāṁsa̍m pra̱vato̍ ma̱hīr anu̍ ba̱hubhya̱ḥ panthā̍m anupaspaśā̱nam   vai̱va̱sva̱taṁ sa̱ṁgama̍na̱ṁ janā̍nāṁ ya̱maṁ rājā̍naṁ ha̱viṣā̍ duvasya
English: honour the king with thine oblations yama vivasvān's son who gathers men together  who travelled to the lofty heights above us who searcbes out and shows the path to many

Sanskrit: ya̱mo no̍ gā̱tum pra̍tha̱mo vi̍veda̱ naiṣā gavyū̍ti̱r apa̍bharta̱vā u̍   yatrā̍ na̱ḥ pūrve̍ pi̱tara̍ḥ pare̱yur e̱nā ja̍jñā̱nāḥ pa̱thyā̱3̱̍ anu̱ svāḥ
English: yama first found for us a place to dwell in this pasture never can be taken from  us  men born on earth tread their own paths that lead them whither our ancient fathers have departed

Sanskrit: māta̍lī ka̱vyair ya̱mo aṅgi̍robhi̱r bṛha̱spati̱r ṛkva̍bhir vāvṛdhā̱naḥ   yām̐ś ca̍ de̱vā vā̍vṛ̱dhur ye ca̍ de̱vān svāhā̱nye sva̱dhayā̱nye ma̍danti
English: mitali prospers there with kavyas yama with aṅgiras' sons bṛhaspati with rkvans  exalters of the gods by gods exalted some joy in praise and some in our oblation

Sanskrit: i̱maṁ ya̍ma prasta̱ram ā hi sīdāṅgi̍robhiḥ pi̱tṛbhi̍ḥ saṁvidā̱naḥ   ā tvā̱ mantrā̍ḥ kaviśa̱stā va̍hantv e̱nā rā̍jan ha̱viṣā̍ mādayasva
English: come seat thee on this bed of grass o yama in company with aṅgirases and fathers  let texts recited by the sages bring thee o king let this oblation make thee joyful

Sanskrit: aṅgi̍robhi̱r ā ga̍hi ya̱jñiye̍bhi̱r yama̍ vairū̱pair i̱ha mā̍dayasva   viva̍svantaṁ huve̱ yaḥ pi̱tā te̱ 'smin ya̱jñe ba̱rhiṣy ā ni̱ṣadya̍
English: come yama with the aṅgirases the holy rejoice thee here with children of virūpa  to sit on sacred grass at this our worship i call vivasvān too thy father hither

Sanskrit: aṅgi̍raso naḥ pi̱taro̱ nava̍gvā̱ atha̍rvāṇo̱ bhṛga̍vaḥ so̱myāsa̍ḥ   teṣā̍ṁ va̱yaṁ su̍ma̱tau ya̱jñiyā̍nā̱m api̍ bha̱dre sau̍mana̱se syā̍ma
English: our fathers are aṅgirases navagvas atharvans bhṛgus who deserve the soma  may these the holy look on us with favour may we enjoy their gracious lovingkindness

Sanskrit: prehi̱ prehi̍ pa̱thibhi̍ḥ pū̱rvyebhi̱r yatrā̍ na̱ḥ pūrve̍ pi̱tara̍ḥ pare̱yuḥ   u̱bhā rājā̍nā sva̱dhayā̱ mada̍ntā ya̱mam pa̍śyāsi̱ varu̍ṇaṁ ca de̱vam
English: go forth go forth upon the ancient pathways whereon our sires of old have gone before us  'mere shalt thou look on both the kings enjoying their sacred food god varuṇa and yama

Sanskrit: saṁ ga̍cchasva pi̱tṛbhi̱ḥ saṁ ya̱mene̍ṣṭāpū̱rtena̍ para̱me vyo̍man   hi̱tvāyā̍va̱dyam puna̱r asta̱m ehi̱ saṁ ga̍cchasva ta̱nvā̍ su̱varcā̍ḥ
English: meet yama meet the fathers meet the merit of free or ordered acts in highest heaven  leave sin and evil seek anew thy dwelling and bright with glory wear another body

Sanskrit: ape̍ta̱ vī̍ta̱ vi ca̍ sarpa̱tāto̱ 'smā e̱tam pi̱taro̍ lo̱kam a̍kran   aho̍bhir a̱dbhir a̱ktubhi̱r vya̍ktaṁ ya̱mo da̍dāty ava̱sāna̍m asmai
English: go hence depart ye fly in all directions this place for him the fathers have provided  yama bestows on him a place to rest in adorned with days and beams of light and waters

Sanskrit: ati̍ drava sārame̱yau śvānau̍ catura̱kṣau śa̱balau̍ sā̱dhunā̍ pa̱thā   athā̍ pi̱tṝn su̍vi̱datrā̱m̐ upe̍hi ya̱mena̱ ye sa̍dha̱māda̱m mada̍nti
English: run and outspeed the two dogs saramā's offspring brindled foureyed upon thy happy pathway  draw nigh then to the graciousminded fathers where they rejoice in company with yama

Sanskrit: yau te̱ śvānau̍ yama rakṣi̱tārau̍ catura̱kṣau pa̍thi̱rakṣī̍ nṛ̱cakṣa̍sau   tābhyā̍m ena̱m pari̍ dehi rājan sva̱sti cā̍smā anamī̱vaṁ ca̍ dhehi
English: and those two dogs of thine yama the watchers foureyed who look on men and guard the pathway  entrust this man o king to their protection and with prosperity and health endow him

Sanskrit: u̱rū̱ṇa̱sāv a̍su̱tṛpā̍ udumba̱lau ya̱masya̍ dū̱tau ca̍rato̱ janā̱m̐ anu̍   tāv a̱smabhya̍ṁ dṛ̱śaye̱ sūryā̍ya̱ puna̍r dātā̱m asu̍m a̱dyeha bha̱dram
English: darkhued insatiate with distended nostrils yama's two envoys roam among the people;  may they restore to us a fair existence here and today that we may see the sunlight

Sanskrit: ya̱māya̱ soma̍ṁ sunuta ya̱māya̍ juhutā ha̱viḥ   ya̱maṁ ha̍ ya̱jño ga̍cchaty a̱gnidū̍to̱ ara̍ṁkṛtaḥ
English: to yama pour the soma bring to yama consecrated gifts  to yama sacrifice prepared and heralded by agni goes

Sanskrit: ya̱māya̍ ghṛ̱tava̍d dha̱vir ju̱hota̱ pra ca̍ tiṣṭhata   sa no̍ de̱veṣv ā ya̍mad dī̱rgham āyu̱ḥ pra jī̱vase̍
English: offer to yama holy gifts enriched with butter and draw near  so may he grant that we may live long days of life among the gods

Sanskrit: ya̱māya̱ madhu̍mattama̱ṁ rājñe̍ ha̱vyaṁ ju̍hotana   i̱daṁ nama̱ ṛṣi̍bhyaḥ pūrva̱jebhya̱ḥ pūrve̍bhyaḥ pathi̱kṛdbhya̍ḥ
English: offer to yama to the king oblation very rich in meath  bow down before the ṛṣis of the ancient times who made this path in days of old

Sanskrit: trika̍drukebhiḥ patati̱ ṣaḻ u̱rvīr eka̱m id bṛ̱hat   tri̱ṣṭub gā̍ya̱trī chandā̍ṁsi̱ sarvā̱ tā ya̱ma āhi̍tā
English: into the six expanses flies the great one in trkadrukas  the gāyatrī the tṛṣṭup all metres in yama are contained

Sanskrit: tvaṣṭā̍ duhi̱tre va̍ha̱tuṁ kṛ̍ṇo̱tītī̱daṁ viśva̱m bhuva̍na̱ṁ sam e̍ti   ya̱masya̍ mā̱tā pa̍ryu̱hyamā̍nā ma̱ho jā̱yā viva̍svato nanāśa
English: tvastar prepares the bridal of his daughter all the world hears the tidings and assembles  but yama's mother spouse of great vivasvān vanished as she was carried to her dwelling

English: i yami am possessed by love of yama that i may rest on the same couch beside him  i as a wife would yield me to my husband like carwheels let us speed to meet each other

English: they stand not still they never close their eyelids those sentinels of gods who wander round us  not mego quickly wanton with another and hasten like a chariot wheel to meet him

English: may sūrya's eye with days and nights endow him and ever may his light spread out before him  in heaven and earth the kindred pair commingle on yam! be the unbrotherly act of yama

English: embrace another yami; let another even as the woodbine rings the tree enfold thee  win thou his heart and let him win thy fancy and he shall form with thee a blest alliance

Sanskrit: u̱ṣau̍ṣo̱ hi va̍so̱ agra̱m eṣi̱ tvaṁ ya̱mayo̍r abhavo vi̱bhāvā̍   ṛ̱tāya̍ sa̱pta da̍dhiṣe pa̱dāni̍ ja̱naya̍n mi̱traṁ ta̱nve̱3̱̍ svāyai̍
English: for vasu thou precedest every morning and still hast been the twins' illuminator  for sacrifice seven places thou retainest while for thine own self thou engenderest mitra

Sanskrit: bhuva̱ś cakṣu̍r ma̱ha ṛ̱tasya̍ go̱pā bhuvo̱ varu̍ṇo̱ yad ṛ̱tāya̱ veṣi̍   bhuvo̍ a̱pāṁ napā̍j jātavedo̱ bhuvo̍ dū̱to yasya̍ ha̱vyaṁ jujo̍ṣaḥ
English: thou art the eye and guard of mighty order and varuṇa when to sacrifice thou comest  thou art the waters child o jātavedas envoy of him whose offering thou acceptest

Sanskrit: bhuvo̍ ya̱jñasya̱ raja̍saś ca ne̱tā yatrā̍ ni̱yudbhi̱ḥ saca̍se śi̱vābhi̍ḥ   di̱vi mū̱rdhāna̍ṁ dadhiṣe sva̱rṣāṁ ji̱hvām a̍gne cakṛṣe havya̱vāha̍m
English: thou art the leader of the rite and region to which with thine auspicious teams thou teadest  thy lightbestowing head to heaven thou liftest making thy tongue the oblationbearer agni

Sanskrit: a̱sya tri̱taḥ kratu̍nā va̱vre a̱ntar i̱cchan dhī̱tim pi̱tur evai̱ḥ para̍sya   sa̱ca̱syamā̍naḥ pi̱tror u̱pasthe̍ jā̱mi bru̍vā̱ṇa āyu̍dhāni veti
English: through his wise insight trita in the cavern seeking as ever the chief sire's intention  carefully tended in his parents' bosom calling the weapons kin goes forth to combat

Sanskrit: sa pitryā̱ṇy āyu̍dhāni vi̱dvān indre̍ṣita ā̱ptyo a̱bhy a̍yudhyat   tri̱śī̱rṣāṇa̍ṁ sa̱ptara̍śmiṁ jagha̱nvān tvā̱ṣṭrasya̍ ci̱n niḥ sa̍sṛje tri̱to gāḥ
English: wellskilled to use the weapons of his father āptya urged on by indra fought the battle  then trita slew the foe sevenrayed threeheaded and freed the cattle of the son of tvaṣṭar

Sanskrit: bhūrīd indra̍ u̱dina̍kṣanta̱m ojo 'vā̍bhina̱t satpa̍ti̱r manya̍mānam   tvā̱ṣṭrasya̍ cid vi̱śvarū̍pasya̱ gonā̍m ācakrā̱ṇas trīṇi̍ śī̱rṣā parā̍ vark
English: lord of the brave indra cleft him in pieces who sought to gain much strength and deemed him mighty  he smote his three heads from his body seizing the cattle of the oniniform son of tvaṣṭar

Sanskrit: āpo̱ hi ṣṭhā ma̍yo̱bhuva̱s tā na̍ ū̱rje da̍dhātana   ma̱he raṇā̍ya̱ cakṣa̍se
English: ye waters are beneficent so help ye us to energy  that we may look on great delight

Sanskrit: yo va̍ḥ śi̱vata̍mo̱ rasa̱s tasya̍ bhājayate̱ha na̍ḥ   u̱śa̱tīr i̍va mā̱tara̍ḥ
English: give us a portion of the sap the most auspicious that ye have  like mothers in their longing love

Sanskrit: tasmā̱ ara̍ṁ gamāma vo̱ yasya̱ kṣayā̍ya̱ jinva̍tha   āpo̍ ja̱naya̍thā ca naḥ
English: to you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on;  and waters give us procreant strength

Sanskrit: śaṁ no̍ de̱vīr a̱bhiṣṭa̍ya̱ āpo̍ bhavantu pī̱taye̍   śaṁ yor a̱bhi sra̍vantu naḥ
English: the waters be to us for drink goddesses for our aid and bliss  let them stream to us health and strength

Sanskrit: īśā̍nā̱ vāryā̍ṇā̱ṁ kṣaya̍ntīś carṣaṇī̱nām   a̱po yā̍cāmi bheṣa̱jam
English: 1 beg the floods to give us balm these queens who rule oer precious things  and have supreme control of men

Sanskrit: a̱psu me̱ somo̍ abravīd a̱ntar viśvā̍ni bheṣa̱jā   a̱gniṁ ca̍ vi̱śvaśa̍mbhuvam
English: within the waterssoma thus hath told medwell all balms that heal  and agni he who blesseth all

Sanskrit: āpa̍ḥ pṛṇī̱ta bhe̍ṣa̱jaṁ varū̍thaṁ ta̱nve̱3̱̍ mama̍   jyok ca̱ sūrya̍ṁ dṛ̱śe
English: o waters teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm  so that i long may see the sun

Sanskrit: i̱dam ā̍pa̱ḥ pra va̍hata̱ yat kiṁ ca̍ duri̱tam mayi̍   yad vā̱ham a̍bhidu̱droha̱ yad vā̍ śe̱pa u̱tānṛ̍tam
English: whatever sin is found in me whatever evil i have wrought  if i have lied or falsely sworn waters remove it far from me

Sanskrit: āpo̍ a̱dyānv a̍cāriṣa̱ṁ rase̍na̱ sam a̍gasmahi   paya̍svān agna̱ ā ga̍hi̱ tam mā̱ saṁ sṛ̍ja̱ varca̍sā
English: the waters i this day have sought and to their moisture have we come  o agni rich in milk come thou and with thy splendour cover me

Sanskrit: sva̱sti no̍ di̱vo a̍gne pṛthi̱vyā vi̱śvāyu̍r dhehi ya̱jathā̍ya deva   sace̍mahi̱ tava̍ dasma prake̱tair u̍ru̱ṣyā ṇa̍ u̱rubhi̍r deva̱ śaṁsai̍ḥ
English: o agni shared by all men living bring us good luck for sacrifice from earth and heaven  with us be thine intelligence wonderworker! protect us god with thy farreaching blessings

Sanskrit: i̱mā a̍gne ma̱taya̱s tubhya̍ṁ jā̱tā gobhi̱r aśvai̍r a̱bhi gṛ̍ṇanti̱ rādha̍ḥ   ya̱dā te̱ marto̱ anu̱ bhoga̱m āna̱ḍ vaso̱ dadhā̍no ma̱tibhi̍ḥ sujāta
English: these hymns brought forth for thee o agni laud thee for bounteous gifts with cattle and with horses  good lord when man from thee hath gained enjoyment by hymns o noblyborn hath he obtained it

Sanskrit: a̱gnim ma̍nye pi̱tara̍m a̱gnim ā̱pim a̱gnim bhrāta̍ra̱ṁ sada̱m it sakhā̍yam   a̱gner anī̍kam bṛha̱taḥ sa̍paryaṁ di̱vi śu̱kraṁ ya̍ja̱taṁ sūrya̍sya
English: agni i deem my kinsman and my father count him my brother and my friend for ever  i honour as the face of lofty agni in heaven the bright and holy light of sūrya

Sanskrit: si̱dhrā a̍gne̱ dhiyo̍ a̱sme sanu̍trī̱r yaṁ trāya̍se̱ dama̱ ā nitya̍hotā   ṛ̱tāvā̱ sa ro̱hida̍śvaḥ puru̱kṣur dyubhi̍r asmā̱ aha̍bhir vā̱mam a̍stu
English: effectual agni are our prayers for profit he whom at home thou priest for ever guardest  is rich in food drawn by red steeds and holy by day and night to him shall all be pleasant

Sanskrit: dyubhi̍r hi̱tam mi̱tram i̍va pra̱yoga̍m pra̱tnam ṛ̱tvija̍m adhva̱rasya̍ jā̱ram   bā̱hubhyā̍m a̱gnim ā̱yavo̍ 'jananta vi̱kṣu hotā̍ra̱ṁ ny a̍sādayanta
English: men with their arms have generated agni helpful as some kind friend adorned with splendours  and stablished as invoker mid the people the ancient priest the sacrifice's lover

Sanskrit: sva̱yaṁ ya̍jasva di̱vi de̍va de̱vān kiṁ te̱ pāka̍ḥ kṛṇava̱d apra̍cetāḥ   yathāya̍ja ṛ̱tubhi̍r deva de̱vān e̱vā ya̍jasva ta̱nva̍ṁ sujāta
English: worship thyself o god the gods in heaven what void of knowledge shall the fool avail thee?  as thou o god hast worshipped gods by seasons so noblyborn! to thine own self pay worship

Sanskrit: bhavā̍ no agne 'vi̱tota go̱pā bhavā̍ vaya̱skṛd u̱ta no̍ vayo̱dhāḥ   rāsvā̍ ca naḥ sumaho ha̱vyadā̍ti̱ṁ trāsvo̱ta na̍s ta̱nvo̱3̱̍ apra̍yucchan
English: agni be thou our guardian and protector bestow upon us life and vital vigour  accept o mighty one the gifts we offer and with unceasing care protect our bodies

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ sa yasya̱ śarma̱nn avo̍bhir a̱gner edha̍te jari̱tābhiṣṭau̍   jyeṣṭhe̍bhi̱r yo bhā̱nubhi̍r ṛṣū̱ṇām pa̱ryeti̱ pari̍vīto vi̱bhāvā̍
English: this is that agni he by whose protection favour and help the singer is successful;  who with the noblest flames of glowing fuel comes forth encompassed with farspreading lustre

Sanskrit: yo bhā̱nubhi̍r vi̱bhāvā̍ vi̱bhāty a̱gnir de̱vebhi̍r ṛ̱tāvāja̍sraḥ   ā yo vi̱vāya̍ sa̱khyā sakhi̱bhyo 'pa̍rihvṛto̱ atyo̱ na sapti̍ḥ
English: agni the holy one the everlasting who shines far beaming with celestial splendours;  he who hath come unto his friends with friendship like a fleet steed who never trips or stumbles

Sanskrit: īśe̱ yo viśva̍syā de̱vavī̍te̱r īśe̍ vi̱śvāyu̍r u̱ṣaso̱ vyu̍ṣṭau   ā yasmi̍n ma̱nā ha̱vīṁṣy a̱gnāv ari̍ṣṭarathaḥ ska̱bhnāti̍ śū̱ṣaiḥ
English: he who is lord of all divine oblation shared by all living men at break of morning  agni to whom our offerings are devoted in whom rests he whose car through might is scatheless

Sanskrit: śū̱ṣebhi̍r vṛ̱dho ju̍ṣā̱ṇo a̱rkair de̱vām̐ acchā̍ raghu̱patvā̍ jigāti   ma̱ndro hotā̱ sa ju̱hvā̱3̱̍ yaji̍ṣṭha̱ḥ sammi̍ślo a̱gnir ā ji̍gharti de̱vān
English: increasing by his strength while lauds content him with easy flight unto the gods he travels  agni the cheerful priest best sacrificer balms with his tongue the gods with whom he mingles

Sanskrit: tam u̱srām indra̱ṁ na reja̍mānam a̱gniṁ gī̱rbhir namo̍bhi̱r ā kṛ̍ṇudhvam   ā yaṁ viprā̍so ma̱tibhi̍r gṛ̱ṇanti̍ jā̱tave̍dasaṁ ju̱hva̍ṁ sa̱hānā̍m
English: with songs and adorations bring ye hither agni who stirs himself at dawn like indra  whom sages laud with hymns as jātavedas of those who wield the sacrificial ladle

Sanskrit: saṁ yasmi̱n viśvā̱ vasū̍ni ja̱gmur vāje̱ nāśvā̱ḥ saptī̍vanta̱ evai̍ḥ   a̱sme ū̱tīr indra̍vātatamā arvācī̱nā a̍gna̱ ā kṛ̍ṇuṣva
English: in whom all goodly treasures meet together even as steeds and riders for the booty  inclining hither bring us help o agni even assistance most desired by indra

Sanskrit: adhā̱ hy a̍gne ma̱hnā ni̱ṣadyā̍ sa̱dyo ja̍jñā̱no havyo̍ ba̱bhūtha̍   taṁ te̍ de̱vāso̱ anu̱ keta̍m āya̱nn adhā̍vardhanta pratha̱māsa̱ ūmā̍ḥ
English: yea at thy birth when thou hadst sat in glory thou agni wast the aim of invocations  the gods came near obedient to thy sunimons and thus attained their rank as chief protectors

Sanskrit: eka̍ḥ samu̱dro dha̱ruṇo̍ rayī̱ṇām a̱smad dhṛ̱do bhūri̍janmā̱ vi ca̍ṣṭe   siṣa̱kty ūdha̍r ni̱ṇyor u̱pastha̱ utsa̍sya̱ madhye̱ nihi̍tam pa̱daṁ veḥ
English: he only is the sea holder of treasures born many a time he views the hearts within us  he hides him in the secret couple's bosom the bird dwells in the middle of the fountain

Sanskrit: sa̱mā̱naṁ nī̱ḻaṁ vṛṣa̍ṇo̱ vasā̍nā̱ḥ saṁ ja̍gmire mahi̱ṣā arva̍tībhiḥ   ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱daṁ ka̱vayo̱ ni pā̍nti̱ guhā̱ nāmā̍ni dadhire̱ parā̍ṇi
English: inhabiting one dwellingplace in common strong stallions and the mares have come together  the sages guard the seat of holy order and keep the highest names concealed within them

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tā̱yinī̍ mā̱yinī̱ saṁ da̍dhāte mi̱tvā śiśu̍ṁ jajñatur va̱rdhaya̍ntī   viśva̍sya̱ nābhi̱ṁ cara̍to dhru̱vasya̍ ka̱veś ci̱t tantu̱m mana̍sā vi̱yanta̍ḥ
English: the holy pair of wondrous power have coupled they formed the infant they who bred produced him  the central point of all that moves and moves not the while they wove the sage's thread with insight

Sanskrit: ṛ̱tasya̱ hi va̍rta̱naya̱ḥ sujā̍ta̱m iṣo̱ vājā̍ya pra̱diva̱ḥ saca̍nte   a̱dhī̱vā̱saṁ roda̍sī vāvasā̱ne ghṛ̱tair annai̍r vāvṛdhāte̱ madhū̍nām
English: for tracks of order and refreshing viands attend from ancient times the goodly infant  wearing him as a mantle earth and heaven grow strong by food of pleasant drink and fatness

Sanskrit: sa̱pta svasṝ̱r aru̍ṣīr vāvaśā̱no vi̱dvān madhva̱ uj ja̍bhārā dṛ̱śe kam   a̱ntar ye̍me a̱ntari̍kṣe purā̱jā i̱cchan va̱vrim a̍vidat pūṣa̱ṇasya̍
English: he calling loudly to the seven red sisters hath skilled in sweet drink brought them to be looked on  he born of old in middle air hath halted and sought and found the covering robe of pūṣan

Sanskrit: sa̱pta ma̱ryādā̍ḥ ka̱vaya̍s tatakṣu̱s tāsā̱m ekā̱m id a̱bhy a̍ṁhu̱ro gā̍t   ā̱yor ha̍ ska̱mbha u̍pa̱masya̍ nī̱ḻe pa̱thāṁ vi̍sa̱rge dha̱ruṇe̍ṣu tasthau
English: seven are the pathways which the wise have fashioned; to one of these may come the troubled mortal  he standeth in the dwelling of the highest a pillar on sure ground where paths are parted

Sanskrit: asa̍c ca̱ sac ca̍ para̱me vyo̍ma̱n dakṣa̍sya̱ janma̱nn adi̍ter u̱pasthe̍   a̱gnir ha̍ naḥ prathama̱jā ṛ̱tasya̱ pūrva̱ āyu̍ni vṛṣa̱bhaś ca̍ dhe̱nuḥ
English: not being being in the highest heaven in aditi's bosom and in dakṣa's birthplace  is agni our firstborn of holy order the milchcow and the bull in life's beginning

Sanskrit: saṁsa̱m id yu̍vase vṛṣa̱nn agne̱ viśvā̍ny a̱rya ā   i̱ḻas pa̱de sam i̍dhyase̱ sa no̱ vasū̱ny ā bha̍ra
English: thou mighty agni gatherest up all that is precious for thy friend  bring us all treasures as thou art enkindled in libation's place

Sanskrit: saṁ ga̍cchadhva̱ṁ saṁ va̍dadhva̱ṁ saṁ vo̱ manā̍ṁsi jānatām   de̱vā bhā̱gaṁ yathā̱ pūrve̍ saṁjānā̱nā u̱pāsa̍te
English: assemble speak together let your minds be all of one accord  as ancient gods unanimous sit down to their appointed share

Sanskrit: sa̱mā̱no mantra̱ḥ sami̍tiḥ samā̱nī sa̍mā̱nam mana̍ḥ sa̱ha ci̱ttam e̍ṣām   sa̱mā̱nam mantra̍m a̱bhi ma̍ntraye vaḥ samā̱nena̍ vo ha̱viṣā̍ juhomi
English: the place is common common the assembly common the mind so be their thought united  a common purpose do i lay before you and worship with your general oblation

Sanskrit: sa̱mā̱nī va̱ ākū̍tiḥ samā̱nā hṛda̍yāni vaḥ   sa̱mā̱nam a̍stu vo̱ mano̱ yathā̍ va̱ḥ susa̱hāsa̍ti
English: one and the same be your resolve and be your minds of one accord  united be the thoughts of all that all may happily agree

Sanskrit: ṛ̱taṁ ca̍ sa̱tyaṁ cā̱bhī̍ddhā̱t tapa̱so 'dhy a̍jāyata   tato̱ rātry a̍jāyata̱ tata̍ḥ samu̱dro a̍rṇa̱vaḥ
English: from fervour kindled to its height eternal law and truth were born  thence was the night produced and thence the billowy flood of sea arose

Sanskrit: sa̱mu̱drād a̍rṇa̱vād adhi̍ saṁvatsa̱ro a̍jāyata   a̱ho̱rā̱trāṇi̍ vi̱dadha̱d viśva̍sya miṣa̱to va̱śī
English: from that same billowy flood of sea the year was afterwards produced  ordainer of the days nights lord over all who close the eye

Sanskrit: sū̱ryā̱ca̱ndra̱masau̍ dhā̱tā ya̍thāpū̱rvam a̍kalpayat   diva̍ṁ ca pṛthi̱vīṁ cā̱ntari̍kṣa̱m atho̱ sva̍ḥ
English: dhātar the great creator then formed in due order sun and moon  he formed in order heaven and earth the regions of the air and light

Sanskrit: āyaṁ gauḥ pṛśni̍r akramī̱d asa̍dan mā̱tara̍m pu̱raḥ   pi̱tara̍ṁ ca pra̱yan sva̍ḥ
English: this spotted bull hath come and sat before the mother in the east  advancing to his father heaven

Sanskrit: a̱ntaś ca̍rati roca̱nāsya prā̱ṇād a̍pāna̱tī   vy a̍khyan mahi̱ṣo diva̍m
English: expiring when he draws his breath she moves along the lucid spheres  the bull shines out through all the sky

Sanskrit: tri̱ṁśad dhāma̱ vi rā̍jati̱ vāk pa̍ta̱ṁgāya̍ dhīyate   prati̱ vasto̱r aha̱ dyubhi̍ḥ
English: song is bestowed upon the bird it rules supreme through thirty realms  throughout the days at break of morn

Sanskrit: pra nū̱naṁ jā̱tave̍dasa̱m aśva̍ṁ hinota vā̱jina̍m   i̱daṁ no̍ ba̱rhir ā̱sade̍
English: now send ye jātavedas forth send hitherward the vigorous steed  to seat him on our sacred grass

Sanskrit: a̱sya pra jā̱tave̍daso̱ vipra̍vīrasya mī̱ḻhuṣa̍ḥ   ma̱hīm i̍yarmi suṣṭu̱tim
English: i raise the lofty eulogy of jātavedas raining boons  with sages for his hero band

Sanskrit: yā ruco̍ jā̱tave̍daso deva̱trā ha̍vya̱vāha̍nīḥ   tābhi̍r no ya̱jñam i̍nvatu
English: with flames of jātavedas which carry oblation to the gods  may he promote our sacrifice

Sanskrit: prāgnaye̱ vāca̍m īraya vṛṣa̱bhāya̍ kṣitī̱nām   sa na̍ḥ parṣa̱d ati̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: to agni send i forth my song to him the bull of all the folk  so may he bear us past our foes

Sanskrit: yaḥ para̍syāḥ parā̱vata̍s ti̱ro dhanvā̍ti̱roca̍te   sa na̍ḥ parṣa̱d ati̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: who from the distance far away shines brilliantly across the wastes  so may he bear us past our foes

Sanskrit: yo rakṣā̍ṁsi ni̱jūrva̍ti̱ vṛṣā̍ śu̱kreṇa̍ śo̱ciṣā̍   sa na̍ḥ parṣa̱d ati̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: the bull with brightlygleaming flame who utterly consumes the fiends  so may he bear us past our foes

Sanskrit: yo viśvā̱bhi vi̱paśya̍ti̱ bhuva̍nā̱ saṁ ca̱ paśya̍ti   sa na̍ḥ parṣa̱d ati̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: who looks on all existing things and comprehends them with his view  so may he bear us past our foes

Sanskrit: yo a̱sya pā̱re raja̍saḥ śu̱kro a̱gnir ajā̍yata   sa na̍ḥ parṣa̱d ati̱ dviṣa̍ḥ
English: resplendent agni who was born in farthest region of the air  so may he bear us past our foes

Sanskrit: vāta̱ ā vā̍tu bheṣa̱jaṁ śa̱mbhu ma̍yo̱bhu no̍ hṛ̱de   pra ṇa̱ āyū̍ṁṣi tāriṣat
English: filling our hearts with health and joy may vāta breathe his balm on us  may he prolong our days of life

Sanskrit: u̱ta vā̍ta pi̱tāsi̍ na u̱ta bhrāto̱ta na̱ḥ sakhā̍   sa no̍ jī̱vāta̍ve kṛdhi
English: thou art our father vāta yea thou art a brother and a friend  so give us strength that we may live

Sanskrit: yad a̱do vā̍ta te gṛ̱he̱3̱̍ 'mṛta̍sya ni̱dhir hi̱taḥ   tato̍ no dehi jī̱vase̍
English: the store of amṛta laid away yonder o vāta in thine home  give us thereof that we may live

Sanskrit: mahi̍ trī̱ṇām avo̍ 'stu dyu̱kṣam mi̱trasyā̍rya̱mṇaḥ   du̱rā̱dharṣa̱ṁ varu̍ṇasya
English: great unassailable must he the heavenly favour of three gods  varuṇa mitra aryaman

Sanskrit: na̱hi teṣā̍m a̱mā ca̱na nādhva̍su vāra̱ṇeṣu̍   īśe̍ ri̱pur a̱ghaśa̍ṁsaḥ
English: o'er these neither at home nor yet abroad or pathways that are strange  the evilminded foe hath power

Sanskrit: yasmai̍ pu̱trāso̱ adi̍te̱ḥ pra jī̱vase̱ martyā̍ya   jyoti̱r yaccha̱nty aja̍sram
English: nor over him the man on whom the sons of aditi bestow eternal light that he may live

Sanskrit: viṣṇu̱r yoni̍ṁ kalpayatu̱ tvaṣṭā̍ rū̱pāṇi̍ piṁśatu   ā si̍ñcatu pra̱jāpa̍tir dhā̱tā garbha̍ṁ dadhātu te
English: may viṣṇu form and mould the womb may tvaṣṭar duly shape the forms  prajāpati infuse the stream and dhātar lay the germ for thee

Sanskrit: garbha̍ṁ dhehi sinīvāli̱ garbha̍ṁ dhehi sarasvati   garbha̍ṁ te a̱śvinau̍ de̱vāv ā dha̍ttā̱m puṣka̍rasrajā
English: o sinīvālī set the germ set thou the germ sarasvatī  may the twain gods bestow the germ the aśvins crowned with lotuses

Sanskrit: hi̱ra̱ṇyayī̍ a̱raṇī̱ yaṁ ni̱rmantha̍to a̱śvinā̍   taṁ te̱ garbha̍ṁ havāmahe daśa̱me mā̱si sūta̍ve
English: that which the aśvins twain rub forth with the attritionsticks of gold  that germ of thine we invocate that in the tenth month thou mayst bear

Sanskrit: apa̍śyaṁ tvā̱ mana̍sā̱ ceki̍tāna̱ṁ tapa̍so jā̱taṁ tapa̍so̱ vibhū̍tam   i̱ha pra̱jām i̱ha ra̱yiṁ rarā̍ṇa̱ḥ pra jā̍yasva pra̱jayā̍ putrakāma
English: i saw thee meditating in thy spirit what sprang from fervour and hath thence developed  bestowing offspring here bestowing riches spread in thine offspring thou who cravest children

Sanskrit: apa̍śyaṁ tvā̱ mana̍sā̱ dīdhyā̍nā̱ṁ svāyā̍ṁ ta̱nū ṛtvye̱ nādha̍mānām   upa̱ mām u̱ccā yu̍va̱tir ba̍bhūyā̱ḥ pra jā̍yasva pra̱jayā̍ putrakāme
English: i saw thee pondering in thine heart and praying that in due time thy body might be fruitful  come as a youthful woman rise to meet me spread in thine offspring thou who cravest children

Sanskrit: a̱haṁ garbha̍m adadhā̱m oṣa̍dhīṣv a̱haṁ viśve̍ṣu̱ bhuva̍neṣv a̱ntaḥ   a̱ham pra̱jā a̍janayam pṛthi̱vyām a̱haṁ jani̍bhyo apa̱rīṣu̍ pu̱trān
English: in plants and herbs in all existent beings i have deposited the germ of increase  all progeny on earth have i engendered and sons in women who will be hereafter

Sanskrit: bṛha̱spati̍r nayatu du̱rgahā̍ ti̱raḥ puna̍r neṣad a̱ghaśa̍ṁsāya̱ manma̍   kṣi̱pad aśa̍sti̱m apa̍ durma̱tiṁ ha̱nn athā̍ kara̱d yaja̍mānāya̱ śaṁ yoḥ
English: bṛhaspati lead us safely over troubles and turn his evil thought against the sinner;  repel the curse and drive away illfeeling and give the sacrificer peace and comfort!

Sanskrit: narā̱śaṁso̍ no 'vatu prayā̱je śaṁ no̍ astv anuyā̱jo have̍ṣu   kṣi̱pad aśa̍sti̱m apa̍ durma̱tiṁ ha̱nn athā̍ kara̱d yaja̍mānāya̱ śaṁ yoḥ
English: may narāśaṁsa aid us at prayāja blest be our anuyāja at invokings  may he repel the curse and chase illfeeling and give the sacrificer peace and comfort

Sanskrit: tapu̍rmūrdhā tapatu ra̱kṣaso̱ ye bra̍hma̱dviṣa̱ḥ śara̍ve̱ hanta̱vā u̍   kṣi̱pad aśa̍sti̱m apa̍ durma̱tiṁ ha̱nn athā̍ kara̱d yaja̍mānāya̱ śaṁ yoḥ
English: may he whose head is flaming burn the demons haters of prayer so that the arrow slay them  may he repel the curse and chase illfeeling and give the sacrificer peace and comfort

Sanskrit: pratha̍ś ca̱ yasya̍ sa̱pratha̍ś ca̱ nāmānu̍ṣṭubhasya ha̱viṣo̍ ha̱vir yat   dhā̱tur dyutā̍nāt savi̱tuś ca̱ viṣṇo̍ rathaṁta̱ram ā ja̍bhārā̱ vasi̍ṣṭhaḥ
English: vasiṣṭha mastered the rathantara took it from radiant dhātar savitar and viṣṇu  oblation portion of fourfold oblation known by the names of saprathas and prathas

Sanskrit: avi̍nda̱n te ati̍hita̱ṁ yad āsī̍d ya̱jñasya̱ dhāma̍ para̱maṁ guhā̱ yat   dhā̱tur dyutā̍nāt savi̱tuś ca̱ viṣṇo̍r bha̱radvā̍jo bṛ̱had ā ca̍kre a̱gneḥ
English: these sages found what lay remote and hidden the sacrifice's loftiest secret essence  from radiant dhātar savitar and viṣṇu from agni bharadvāja brought the brhat

Sanskrit: te̍ 'vinda̱n mana̍sā̱ dīdhyā̍nā̱ yaju̍ḥ ṣka̱nnam pra̍tha̱maṁ de̍va̱yāna̍m   dhā̱tur dyutā̍nāt savi̱tuś ca̱ viṣṇo̱r ā sūryā̍d abharan gha̱rmam e̱te
English: they found with mental eyes the earliest yajus a pathway to the gods that had descended  from radiant dhātar savitar and viṣṇu from sūrya did these sages bring the gharma

Sanskrit: pra sa̍sāhiṣe puruhūta̱ śatrū̱ñ jyeṣṭha̍s te̱ śuṣma̍ i̱ha rā̱tir a̍stu   indrā bha̍ra̱ dakṣi̍ṇenā̱ vasū̍ni̱ pati̱ḥ sindhū̍nām asi re̱vatī̍nām
English: o muchinvoked thou hast subdued thy foemen thy might is loftiest; here display thy bounty  in thy right hand o indra bring us treasures thou art the lord of rivers filled with riches

Sanskrit: mṛ̱go na bhī̱maḥ ku̍ca̱ro gi̍ri̱ṣṭhāḥ pa̍rā̱vata̱ ā ja̍ganthā̱ para̍syāḥ   sṛ̱kaṁ sa̱ṁśāya̍ pa̱vim i̍ndra ti̱gmaṁ vi śatrū̍n tāḻhi̱ vi mṛdho̍ nudasva
English: like a dread wild beast roaming on the mountain thou hast approached us from the farthest distance  whetting thy bold and thy sharp blade o indra crush thou the foe and scatter those who hate us

Sanskrit: indra̍ kṣa̱tram a̱bhi vā̱mam ojo 'jā̍yathā vṛṣabha carṣaṇī̱nām   apā̍nudo̱ jana̍m amitra̱yanta̍m u̱ruṁ de̱vebhyo̍ akṛṇor u lo̱kam
English: thou mighty indra sprangest into being as strength for lovely lordship oer the people  thou drovest off the folk who were unfriendly and to the gods thou gavest room and freedom

Sanskrit: ut ti̍ṣṭha̱tāva̍ paśya̱tendra̍sya bhā̱gam ṛ̱tviya̍m   yadi̍ śrā̱to ju̱hota̍na̱ yady aśrā̍to mama̱ttana̍
English: now lift ye up yourselves and look on indra's seasonable share  if it be ready offer it; unready ye have been remise

Sanskrit: śrā̱taṁ ha̱vir o ṣv i̍ndra̱ pra yā̍hi ja̱gāma̱ sūro̱ adhva̍no̱ vima̍dhyam   pari̍ tvāsate ni̱dhibhi̱ḥ sakhā̍yaḥ kula̱pā na vrā̱japa̍ti̱ṁ cara̍ntam
English: oblation is prepared come to us indra; the sun hath travelled over half his journey  friends with their stores are sitting round thee waiting like lords of clans for the tribe's wandering chieftain

Sanskrit: śrā̱tam ma̍nya̱ ūdha̍ni śrā̱tam a̱gnau suśrā̍tam manye̱ tad ṛ̱taṁ navī̍yaḥ   mādhya̍ṁdinasya̱ sava̍nasya da̱dhnaḥ pibe̍ndra vajrin purukṛj juṣā̱ṇaḥ
English: dressed in the udder and on fire i fancy; welldressed i fancy is this recent present  drink indra of the curd of noon's libation with favour thunderer thou whose deeds are mighty

Sanskrit: tyam ū̱ ṣu vā̱jina̍ṁ de̱vajū̍taṁ sa̱hāvā̍naṁ taru̱tāra̱ṁ rathā̍nām   ari̍ṣṭanemim pṛta̱nāja̍m ā̱śuṁ sva̱staye̱ tārkṣya̍m i̱hā hu̍vema
English: this very mighty one whom gods commission the conqueror of cars ever triumphant  swift fleet to battle with uninjured fellies even tārkṣya for our weal will we call hither

Sanskrit: indra̍syeva rā̱tim ā̱johu̍vānāḥ sva̱staye̱ nāva̍m i̱vā ru̍hema   urvī̱ na pṛthvī̱ bahu̍le̱ gabhī̍re̱ mā vā̱m etau̱ mā pare̍tau riṣāma
English: as though we offered up our gifts to indra may we ascend him as a ship for safety  like the two wide worlds broad deep farextended may we be safe both when he comes and leaves you

Sanskrit: sa̱dyaś ci̱d yaḥ śava̍sā̱ pañca̍ kṛ̱ṣṭīḥ sūrya̍ iva̱ jyoti̍ṣā̱pas ta̱tāna̍   sa̱ha̱sra̱sāḥ śa̍ta̱sā a̍sya̱ raṁhi̱r na smā̍ varante yuva̱tiṁ na śaryā̍m
English: he who with might the five lands hath pervaded like sūrya with his lustre and the waters  his strength wins hundreds thousands none avert it as the young maid repelleth not her lover

Sanskrit: pa̱ta̱ṁgam a̱ktam asu̍rasya mā̱yayā̍ hṛ̱dā pa̍śyanti̱ mana̍sā vipa̱ścita̍ḥ   sa̱mu̱dre a̱ntaḥ ka̱vayo̱ vi ca̍kṣate̱ marī̍cīnām pa̱dam i̍cchanti ve̱dhasa̍ḥ
English: the sapient with their spirit and their mind behold the bird adorned with all an asura's magic might  sages observe him in the ocean's inmost depth the wise disposers seek the station of his rays

Sanskrit: pa̱ta̱ṁgo vāca̱m mana̍sā bibharti̱ tāṁ ga̍ndha̱rvo̍ 'vada̱d garbhe̍ a̱ntaḥ   tāṁ dyota̍mānāṁ sva̱rya̍m manī̱ṣām ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱de ka̱vayo̱ ni pā̍nti
English: the flying bird bears speech within his spirit erst the gandharva in the womb pronounced it  and at the seat of sacrifice the sages cherish this radiant heavenlybright invention

Sanskrit: apa̍śyaṁ go̱pām ani̍padyamāna̱m ā ca̱ parā̍ ca pa̱thibhi̱ś cara̍ntam   sa sa̱dhrīcī̱ḥ sa viṣū̍cī̱r vasā̍na̱ ā va̍rīvarti̱ bhuva̍neṣv a̱ntaḥ
English: i saw the herdsman him who never resteth approaching and departing on his pathways  he clothed in gathered and diffusive splendour within the worlds continually travels

Sanskrit: pra sū̱nava̍ ṛbhū̱ṇām bṛ̱han na̍vanta vṛ̱janā̍   kṣāmā̱ ye vi̱śvadhā̍ya̱so 'śna̍n dhe̱nuṁ na mā̱tara̍m
English: with hymns of praise their sons have told aloud the ṛbhus' mighty deeds  who allsupporting have enjoyed the earth as twere a mother cow

Sanskrit: pra de̱vaṁ de̱vyā dhi̱yā bhara̍tā jā̱tave̍dasam   ha̱vyā no̍ vakṣad ānu̱ṣak
English: bring forth the god with song divine being jātavedas hitherward  to bear our gifts at once to heaven

Sanskrit: a̱yam u̱ ṣya pra de̍va̱yur hotā̍ ya̱jñāya̍ nīyate   ratho̱ na yor a̱bhīvṛ̍to̱ ghṛṇī̍vāñ cetati̱ tmanā̍
English: he here a goddevoted priest led forward comes to sacrifice  like a car covered for the road he glowing knows himself the way

Sanskrit: a̱yam a̱gnir u̍ruṣyaty a̱mṛtā̍d iva̱ janma̍naḥ   saha̍saś ci̱t sahī̍yān de̱vo jī̱vāta̍ve kṛ̱taḥ
English: this agni rescues from distress as twere from the immortal race  a god yet mightier than strength a god who hath been made for life

Sanskrit: pra vo̍ grāvāṇaḥ savi̱tā de̱vaḥ su̍vatu̱ dharma̍ṇā   dhū̱rṣu yu̍jyadhvaṁ sunu̱ta
English: may savitar the god o stones stir you according to the law  be harnessed to the shafts and press

Sanskrit: grāvā̍ṇo̱ apa̍ du̱cchunā̱m apa̍ sedhata durma̱tim   u̱srāḥ ka̍rtana bheṣa̱jam
English: stones drive calamity away drive ye away malevolence  make ye the cows our medicine

Sanskrit: grāvā̍ṇa̱ upa̍re̱ṣv ā ma̍hī̱yante̍ sa̱joṣa̍saḥ   vṛṣṇe̱ dadha̍to̱ vṛṣṇya̍m
English: of one accord the upper stones giving the bull his bulllike strength  look down with pride on those below

Sanskrit: grāvā̍ṇaḥ savi̱tā nu vo̍ de̱vaḥ su̍vatu̱ dharma̍ṇā   yaja̍mānāya sunva̱te
English: may savitar the god o stones stir you as law commands for him  who sacrifices pouring juice

Sanskrit: a̱bhī̱va̱rtena̍ ha̱viṣā̱ yenendro̍ abhivāvṛ̱te   tenā̱smān bra̍hmaṇas pate̱ 'bhi rā̱ṣṭrāya̍ vartaya
English: with offering for success in fight whence indra was victorious  with this o brahmaṇaspati let us attain to royal sway

Sanskrit: a̱bhi̱vṛtya̍ sa̱patnā̍n a̱bhi yā no̱ arā̍tayaḥ   a̱bhi pṛ̍ta̱nyanta̍ṁ tiṣṭhā̱bhi yo na̍ ira̱syati̍
English: subduing those who rival us subduing all malignities  withstand the man who menaces withstand the man who angers us

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tvā̍ de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tābhi somo̍ avīvṛtat   a̱bhi tvā̱ viśvā̍ bhū̱tāny a̍bhīva̱rto yathāsa̍si
English: soma and savitar the god have made thee a victorious king  all elements have aided thee to make thee general conqueror

Sanskrit: yenendro̍ ha̱viṣā̍ kṛ̱tvy abha̍vad dyu̱mny u̍tta̱maḥ   i̱daṁ tad a̍kri devā asapa̱tnaḥ kilā̍bhuvam
English: oblation that which indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high  this have i offered gods! and hence now verily am rivalless

Sanskrit: a̱sa̱pa̱tnaḥ sa̍patna̱hābhirā̍ṣṭro viṣāsa̱hiḥ   yathā̱ham e̍ṣām bhū̱tānā̍ṁ vi̱rājā̍ni̱ jana̍sya ca
English: slayer of rivals rivalless victorious with royal sway  over these beings may i rule may i be sovran of the folk

Sanskrit: ā yā̍hi̱ vana̍sā sa̱ha gāva̍ḥ sacanta varta̱niṁ yad ūdha̍bhiḥ
English: with all thy beauty come the kine approaching with full udders follow on thy path

Sanskrit: ā yā̍hi̱ vasvyā̍ dhi̱yā maṁhi̍ṣṭho jāra̱yanma̍khaḥ su̱dānu̍bhiḥ
English: come with kind thoughts most liberal rousing the warrior's hymn of praise with bounteous ones

Sanskrit: pi̱tu̱bhṛto̱ na tantu̱m it su̱dāna̍va̱ḥ prati̍ dadhmo̱ yajā̍masi
English: as nourishers we tie the thread and liberal with our bounty offer sacrifice

Sanskrit: u̱ṣā apa̱ svasu̱s tama̱ḥ saṁ va̍rtayati varta̱niṁ su̍jā̱tatā̍
English: dawn drives away her sister's gloom and through her excellence makes her retrace her path

Sanskrit: ā tvā̍hārṣam a̱ntar e̍dhi dhru̱vas ti̱ṣṭhāvi̍cācaliḥ   viśa̍s tvā̱ sarvā̍ vāñchantu̱ mā tvad rā̱ṣṭram adhi̍ bhraśat
English: be with us; i have chosen thee stand stedfast and immovable  let all the people wish for thee let not thy kingship fall away

Sanskrit: i̱haivaidhi̱ māpa̍ cyoṣṭhā̱ḥ parva̍ta i̱vāvi̍cācaliḥ   indra̍ ive̱ha dhru̱vas ti̍ṣṭhe̱ha rā̱ṣṭram u̍ dhāraya
English: be even here; fall not away be like a mountain unremoved  stand stedfast here like indra's self and hold the kingship in the grasp

Sanskrit: i̱mam indro̍ adīdharad dhru̱vaṁ dhru̱veṇa̍ ha̱viṣā̍   tasmai̱ somo̱ adhi̍ brava̱t tasmā̍ u̱ brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̍ḥ
English: this man hath indra stablished made secure by strong oblation's power  may soma speak a benison and brahmaṇaspati on him

Sanskrit: dhru̱vā dyaur dhru̱vā pṛ̍thi̱vī dhru̱vāsa̱ḥ parva̍tā i̱me   dhru̱vaṁ viśva̍m i̱daṁ jaga̍d dhru̱vo rājā̍ vi̱śām a̱yam
English: firm is the sky and firm the earth and stedfast also are these hills  stedfast is all this living world and stedfast is this king of men

Sanskrit: dhru̱vaṁ te̱ rājā̱ varu̍ṇo dhru̱vaṁ de̱vo bṛha̱spati̍ḥ   dhru̱vaṁ ta̱ indra̍ś cā̱gniś ca̍ rā̱ṣṭraṁ dhā̍rayatāṁ dhru̱vam
English: stedfast may varuṇa the king stedfast the god bṛhaspati  stedfast may indra stedfast too may agni keep thy stedfast reign

Sanskrit: dhru̱vaṁ dhru̱veṇa̍ ha̱viṣā̱bhi soma̍m mṛśāmasi   atho̍ ta̱ indra̱ḥ keva̍lī̱r viśo̍ bali̱hṛta̍s karat
English: on constant soma let us think with constant sacrificial gift  and then may indra make the clans bring tribute unto thee alone

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tyam i̱ṭato̱ ratha̱m indra̱ prāva̍ḥ su̱tāva̍taḥ   aśṛ̍ṇoḥ so̱mino̱ hava̍m
English: for iṭa's sake who pressed the juice thou indra didst protect his car  and hear the somagiver's call

Sanskrit: tvam ma̱khasya̱ dodha̍ta̱ḥ śiro 'va̍ tva̱co bha̍raḥ   aga̍cchaḥ so̱mino̍ gṛ̱ham
English: thou from his skin hast borne the head of the swiftmoving combatant  and sought the somapourer's home

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tyam i̍ndra̱ martya̍m āstrabu̱dhnāya̍ ve̱nyam   muhu̍ḥ śrathnā mana̱syave̍
English: venya that mortal man hast thou for āstrabudhna the devout  o indra many a time set free

Sanskrit: tvaṁ tyam i̍ndra̱ sūrya̍m pa̱ścā santa̍m pu̱ras kṛ̍dhi   de̱vānā̍ṁ cit ti̱ro vaśa̍m
English: bring indra to the east again that sun who now is in the west  even against the will of gods

Sanskrit: vi̱bhrāḍ bṛ̱hat pi̍batu so̱myam madhv āyu̱r dadha̍d ya̱jñapa̍tā̱v avi̍hrutam   vāta̍jūto̱ yo a̍bhi̱rakṣa̍ti̱ tmanā̍ pra̱jāḥ pu̍poṣa puru̱dhā vi rā̍jati
English: may the bright god drink glorious somamingled meath giving the sacrifice's lord uninjured life;  he who windurged in person guards our offspring well hath nourished them with food and shines oer many a land

Sanskrit: vi̱bhrāḍ bṛ̱hat subhṛ̍taṁ vāja̱sāta̍ma̱ṁ dharma̍n di̱vo dha̱ruṇe̍ sa̱tyam arpi̍tam   a̱mi̱tra̱hā vṛ̍tra̱hā da̍syu̱haṁta̍ma̱ṁ jyoti̍r jajñe asura̱hā sa̍patna̱hā
English: radiant as high truth cherished best at winning strength truth based upon the statute that supports the heavens  he rose a light that kills vṛtras and enemies best slayer of the dasyus asuras and foes

Sanskrit: i̱daṁ śreṣṭha̱ṁ jyoti̍ṣā̱ṁ jyoti̍r utta̱maṁ vi̍śva̱jid dha̍na̱jid u̍cyate bṛ̱hat   vi̱śva̱bhrāḍ bhrā̱jo mahi̱ sūryo̍ dṛ̱śa u̱ru pa̍prathe̱ saha̱ ojo̱ acyu̍tam
English: this light the best of lights supreme allconquering winner of riches is exalted with high laud  alllighting radiant mighty as the sun to see he spreadeth wide unfailing victory and strength

Sanskrit: vi̱bhrāja̱ñ jyoti̍ṣā̱ sva1̱̍r aga̍ccho roca̱naṁ di̱vaḥ   yene̱mā viśvā̱ bhuva̍nā̱ny ābhṛ̍tā vi̱śvaka̍rmaṇā vi̱śvade̍vyāvatā
English: beaming forth splendour with thy light thou hast attained heaven's lustrous realm  by thee were brought together all existing things possessor of all godhead alleffecting god

Sanskrit: ma̱yo̱bhūr vāto̍ a̱bhi vā̍tū̱srā ūrja̍svatī̱r oṣa̍dhī̱r ā ri̍śantām   pīva̍svatīr jī̱vadha̍nyāḥ pibantv ava̱sāya̍ pa̱dvate̍ rudra mṛḻa
English: may the wind blow upon our cows with healing may they eat herbage full of vigorous juices  may they drink waters rich in life and fatness to food that moves on feet be gracious rudra

Sanskrit: yāḥ sarū̍pā̱ virū̍pā̱ eka̍rūpā̱ yāsā̍m a̱gnir iṣṭyā̱ nāmā̍ni̱ veda̍   yā aṅgi̍rasa̱s tapa̍se̱ha ca̱krus tābhya̍ḥ parjanya̱ mahi̱ śarma̍ yaccha
English: likecoloured varioushued or singlecoloured whose names through sacrifice are known to agni  whom the aṅgirases produced by fervourvouchsafe to these parjanya great protection

Sanskrit: yā de̱veṣu̍ ta̱nva1̱̍m aira̍yanta̱ yāsā̱ṁ somo̱ viśvā̍ rū̱pāṇi̱ veda̍   tā a̱smabhya̱m paya̍sā̱ pinva̍mānāḥ pra̱jāva̍tīr indra go̱ṣṭhe ri̍rīhi
English: those who have offered to the gods their bodies whose varied forms are all well known to soma  those grant us in our cattlepen o indra with their full streams of milk and plenteous offspring

Sanskrit: pra̱jāpa̍ti̱r mahya̍m e̱tā rarā̍ṇo̱ viśvai̍r de̱vaiḥ pi̱tṛbhi̍ḥ saṁvidā̱naḥ   śi̱vāḥ sa̱tīr upa̍ no go̱ṣṭham āka̱s tāsā̍ṁ va̱yam pra̱jayā̱ saṁ sa̍dema
English: prajāpati bestowing these upon me oneminded with all gods and with the fathers  hath to our cowpen brought auspicious cattle so may we own the offspring they will bear us

Sanskrit: vāta̍sya̱ nu ma̍hi̱māna̱ṁ ratha̍sya ru̱jann e̍ti sta̱naya̍nn asya̱ ghoṣa̍ḥ   di̱vi̱spṛg yā̍ty aru̱ṇāni̍ kṛ̱ṇvann u̱to e̍ti pṛthi̱vyā re̱ṇum asya̍n
English: o the wind's chariot o its power and glory! crashing it goes and hath a voice of thunder  it makes the regions red and touches heaven and as it moves the dust of earth is scattered

Sanskrit: sam prera̍te̱ anu̱ vāta̍sya vi̱ṣṭhā aina̍ṁ gacchanti̱ sama̍na̱ṁ na yoṣā̍ḥ   tābhi̍ḥ sa̱yuk sa̱ratha̍ṁ de̱va ī̍yate̱ 'sya viśva̍sya̱ bhuva̍nasya̱ rājā̍
English: along the traces of the wind they hurry they come to him as dames to an assembly  borne on his car with these for his attendants the god speeds forth the universe's monarch

Sanskrit: a̱ntari̍kṣe pa̱thibhi̱r īya̍māno̱ na ni vi̍śate kata̱mac ca̱nāha̍ḥ   a̱pāṁ sakhā̍ prathama̱jā ṛ̱tāvā̱ kva̍ svij jā̱taḥ kuta̱ ā ba̍bhūva
English: travelling on the paths of air's midregion no single day doth he take rest or slumber  holy and earliestborn friend of the waters where did he spring and from what region came he?

Sanskrit: ā̱tmā de̱vānā̱m bhuva̍nasya̱ garbho̍ yathāva̱śaṁ ca̍rati de̱va e̱ṣaḥ   ghoṣā̱ id a̍sya śṛṇvire̱ na rū̱paṁ tasmai̱ vātā̍ya ha̱viṣā̍ vidhema
English: germ of the world the deities vital spirit this god moves ever as his will inclines him  his voice is heard his shape is ever viewless let us adore this wind with our oblation

Sanskrit: tubhye̱dam i̍ndra̱ pari̍ ṣicyate̱ madhu̱ tvaṁ su̱tasya̍ ka̱laśa̍sya rājasi   tvaṁ ra̱yim pu̍ru̱vīrā̍m u nas kṛdhi̱ tvaṁ tapa̍ḥ pari̱tapyā̍jaya̱ḥ sva̍ḥ
English: this pleasant meath o indra is effused for thee thou art the ruling lord of beaker and of juice  bestow upon us wealth with many hero sons thou having glowed with fervour wonnest heavenly light

Sanskrit: sva̱rjita̱m mahi̍ mandā̱nam andha̍so̱ havā̍mahe̱ pari̍ śa̱kraṁ su̱tām̐ upa̍   i̱maṁ no̍ ya̱jñam i̱ha bo̱dhy ā ga̍hi̱ spṛdho̱ jaya̍ntam ma̱ghavā̍nam īmahe
English: let us call śakra to libations here effused winner of light who joyeth in the potent juice  mark well this sacrifice of ours and come to us we pray to maghavan the vanquisher of hosts

Sanskrit: soma̍sya̱ rājño̱ varu̍ṇasya̱ dharma̍ṇi̱ bṛha̱spate̱r anu̍matyā u̱ śarma̍ṇi   tavā̱ham a̱dya ma̍ghava̱nn upa̍stutau̱ dhāta̱r vidhā̍taḥ ka̱laśā̍m̐ abhakṣayam
English: by royal soma's and by varuṇa's decree under bṛhaspati's and anumati's guard  this day by thine authority o maghavan maker disposer thou! have i enjoyed the jars

Sanskrit: prasū̍to bha̱kṣam a̍karaṁ ca̱rāv api̱ stoma̍ṁ ce̱mam pra̍tha̱maḥ sū̱rir un mṛ̍je   su̱te sā̱tena̱ yady āga̍maṁ vā̱m prati̍ viśvāmitrajamadagnī̱ dame̍
English: 1 too urged on have had my portion in the bowl and as first prince i drew forth this my hymn of praise  when with the prize i came unto the flowing juice o viśvāmitra jamadagni to your home

Sanskrit: ṛ̱ṣa̱bham mā̍ samā̱nānā̍ṁ sa̱patnā̍nāṁ viṣāsa̱him   ha̱ntāra̱ṁ śatrū̍ṇāṁ kṛdhi vi̱rāja̱ṁ gopa̍ti̱ṁ gavā̍m
English: make me a bull among my peers make me my rivals conqueror  make me the slayer of my foes a sovran ruler lord of kine

Sanskrit: a̱ham a̍smi sapatna̱hendra̍ i̱vāri̍ṣṭo̱ akṣa̍taḥ   a̱dhaḥ sa̱patnā̍ me pa̱dor i̱me sarve̍ a̱bhiṣṭhi̍tāḥ
English: i am my rivals slayer like indra unwounded and unhurt  and all these enemies of mine are vanquished and beneath my feet

Sanskrit: atrai̱va vo 'pi̍ nahyāmy u̱bhe ārtnī̍ iva̱ jyayā̍   vāca̍s pate̱ ni ṣe̍dhe̱mān yathā̱ mad adha̍ra̱ṁ vadā̍n
English: here verily i bind you fast as the two bowends with the string  press down these men o lord of speech that they may humbly speak to me

Sanskrit: a̱bhi̱bhūr a̱ham āga̍maṁ vi̱śvaka̍rmeṇa̱ dhāmnā̍   ā va̍ś ci̱ttam ā vo̍ vra̱tam ā vo̱ 'haṁ sami̍tiṁ dade
English: hither i came as conqueror with mighty alleffecting power  and i have mastered all your thought your synod and your holy work

Sanskrit: yo̱ga̱kṣe̱maṁ va̍ ā̱dāyā̱ham bhū̍yāsam utta̱ma ā vo̍ mū̱rdhāna̍m akramīm   a̱dha̱spa̱dān ma̱ ud va̍data ma̱ṇḍūkā̍ ivoda̱kān ma̱ṇḍūkā̍ uda̱kād i̍va
English: may i be highest having gained your strength in war your skill in peace  my feet have trodden on your heads  speak to me from beneath my feet as frogs from out the water croak as frogs from out the water croak

Sanskrit: devā̍ḥ ka̱pota̍ iṣi̱to yad i̱cchan dū̱to nirṛ̍tyā i̱dam ā̍ja̱gāma̍   tasmā̍ arcāma kṛ̱ṇavā̍ma̱ niṣkṛ̍ti̱ṁ śaṁ no̍ astu dvi̱pade̱ śaṁ catu̍ṣpade
English: gods whatsoeer the dove came hither seeking sent to us as the envoy of destruction  for that let us sing hymns and make atonement well be it with our quadrupeds and bipeds

Sanskrit: śi̱vaḥ ka̱pota̍ iṣi̱to no̍ astv anā̱gā de̍vāḥ śaku̱no gṛ̱heṣu̍   a̱gnir hi vipro̍ ju̱ṣatā̍ṁ ha̱vir na̱ḥ pari̍ he̱tiḥ pa̱kṣiṇī̍ no vṛṇaktu
English: auspicious be the dove that hath been sent us a harmless bird ye gods within our dwelling  may agni sage be pleased with our oblation and may the missile borne on wings avoid us

Sanskrit: he̱tiḥ pa̱kṣiṇī̱ na da̍bhāty a̱smān ā̱ṣṭryām pa̱daṁ kṛ̍ṇute agni̱dhāne̍   śaṁ no̱ gobhya̍ś ca̱ puru̍ṣebhyaś cāstu̱ mā no̍ hiṁsīd i̱ha de̍vāḥ ka̱pota̍ḥ
English: let not the arrow that hath wings distract us beside the fireplace on the hearth it settles  may it bring welfare to our men and cattle here let the dove ye gods forbear to harm us

Sanskrit: yad ulū̍ko̱ vada̍ti mo̱gham e̱tad yat ka̱pota̍ḥ pa̱dam a̱gnau kṛ̱ṇoti̍   yasya̍ dū̱taḥ prahi̍ta e̱ṣa e̱tat tasmai̍ ya̱māya̱ namo̍ astu mṛ̱tyave̍
English: the screeching of the owl is ineffective and when beside the fire the dove hath settled  to him who sent it hither as an envoy to him be reverence paid to death to yama

Sanskrit: ṛ̱cā ka̱pota̍ṁ nudata pra̱ṇoda̱m iṣa̱m mada̍nta̱ḥ pari̱ gāṁ na̍yadhvam   sa̱ṁyo̱paya̍nto duri̱tāni̱ viśvā̍ hi̱tvā na̱ ūrja̱m pra pa̍tā̱t pati̍ṣṭhaḥ
English: drive forth the dove chase it with holy verses rejoicing bring ye hither food and cattle  barring the way against all grief and trouble let the swift bird fly forth and leave us vigour

Sanskrit: ape̍hi manasas pa̱te 'pa̍ krāma pa̱raś ca̍ra   pa̱ro nirṛ̍tyā̱ ā ca̍kṣva bahu̱dhā jīva̍to̱ mana̍ḥ
English: avaunt thou master of the mind depart and vanish far away  look on destruction far from hence the live man's mind is manifold

Sanskrit: bha̱draṁ vai vara̍ṁ vṛṇate bha̱draṁ yu̍ñjanti̱ dakṣi̍ṇam   bha̱draṁ vai̍vasva̱te cakṣu̍r bahu̱trā jīva̍to̱ mana̍ḥ
English: a happy boon do men elect a mighty blessing they obtain  bliss with vaivasvata they see the live man's mind seeks many a place

Sanskrit: yad ā̱śasā̍ ni̱ḥśasā̍bhi̱śaso̍pāri̱ma jāgra̍to̱ yat sva̱panta̍ḥ   a̱gnir viśvā̱ny apa̍ duṣkṛ̱tāny aju̍ṣṭāny ā̱re a̱smad da̍dhātu
English: if by address by blame by imprecation we have committed sin awake or sleeping  all hateful acts of ours all evil doings may agni bear away to distant places

Sanskrit: yad i̍ndra brahmaṇas pate 'bhidro̱haṁ carā̍masi   prace̍tā na āṅgira̱so dvi̍ṣa̱tām pā̱tv aṁha̍saḥ
English: when indra brahmaṇaspati our deeds are wrongful and unjust  may provident aṅgirasa prevent our foes from troubling us

Sanskrit: ajai̍ṣmā̱dyāsa̍nāma̱ cābhū̱mānā̍gaso va̱yam   jā̱gra̱tsva̱pnaḥ sa̍ṁka̱lpaḥ pā̱po yaṁ dvi̱ṣmas taṁ sa ṛ̍cchatu̱ yo no̱ dveṣṭi̱ tam ṛ̍cchatu
English: we have prevailed this day and won we are made free from sin and guilt  ill thoughts that visit us awake or sleeping seize the man we hate yea seize the man who hateth us

Sanskrit: a̱kṣībhyā̍ṁ te̱ nāsi̍kābhyā̱ṁ karṇā̍bhyā̱ṁ chubu̍kā̱d adhi̍   yakṣma̍ṁ śīrṣa̱ṇya̍m ma̱stiṣkā̍j ji̱hvāyā̱ vi vṛ̍hāmi te
English: from both thy nostrils from thine eyes from both thine ears and from thy chin  forth from thy head and brain and tongue i drive thy malady away

Sanskrit: grī̱vābhya̍s ta u̱ṣṇihā̍bhya̱ḥ kīka̍sābhyo anū̱kyā̍t   yakṣma̍ṁ doṣa̱ṇya1̱̍m aṁsā̍bhyām bā̱hubhyā̱ṁ vi vṛ̍hāmi te
English: from the necktendons and the neck from the breastbones and from the spine  from shoulders upper lower arms i drive thy malady away

Sanskrit: ā̱ntrebhya̍s te̱ gudā̍bhyo vani̱ṣṭhor hṛda̍yā̱d adhi̍   yakṣma̱m mata̍snābhyāṁ ya̱knaḥ plā̱śibhyo̱ vi vṛ̍hāmi te
English: from viscera and all within forth from the rectum from the heart  from kidneys liver and from spleen i drive thy malady away

Sanskrit: ū̱rubhyā̍ṁ te aṣṭhī̱vadbhyā̱m pārṣṇi̍bhyā̱m prapa̍dābhyām   yakṣma̱ṁ śroṇi̍bhyā̱m bhāsa̍dā̱d bhaṁsa̍so̱ vi vṛ̍hāmi te
English: from thighs from kneecaps and from heels and from the forepart of the feet  from hips from stomach and from groin i drive thy malady away

Sanskrit: meha̍nād vana̱ṁkara̍ṇā̱l loma̍bhyas te na̱khebhya̍ḥ   yakṣma̱ṁ sarva̍smād ā̱tmana̱s tam i̱daṁ vi vṛ̍hāmi te
English: from what is voided from within and from thy hair and from they nails  from all thyself from top to toe i drive thy malady away

Sanskrit: aṅgā̍daṅgā̱l lomno̍lomno jā̱tam parva̍ṇiparvaṇi   yakṣma̱ṁ sarva̍smād ā̱tmana̱s tam i̱daṁ vi vṛ̍hāmi te
English: from every member every hair disease that comes in every joint  from all thyself from top to toe i drive thy malady away

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇā̱gniḥ sa̍ṁvidā̱no ra̍kṣo̱hā bā̍dhatām i̱taḥ   amī̍vā̱ yas te̱ garbha̍ṁ du̱rṇāmā̱ yoni̍m ā̱śaye̍
English: may agni yielding to our prayer the rakṣasslayer drive away  the malady of evil name that hath beset thy labouring womb

Sanskrit: yas te̱ garbha̱m amī̍vā du̱rṇāmā̱ yoni̍m ā̱śaye̍   a̱gniṣ ṭam brahma̍ṇā sa̱ha niṣ kra̱vyāda̍m anīnaśat
English: agni concurring in the prayer drive off the eater of the flesh  the malady of evil name that hath attacked thy babe and womb

Sanskrit: yas te̱ hanti̍ pa̱taya̍ntaṁ niṣa̱tsnuṁ yaḥ sa̍rīsṛ̱pam   jā̱taṁ yas te̱ jighā̍ṁsati̱ tam i̱to nā̍śayāmasi
English: that which destroys the sinking germ the settled moving embryo  that which will kill the babe at birtheven this will we drive far away

Sanskrit: yas ta̍ ū̱rū vi̱hara̍ty anta̱rā dampa̍tī̱ śaye̍   yoni̱ṁ yo a̱ntar ā̱reḻhi̱ tam i̱to nā̍śayāmasi
English: that which divides thy legs that it may lie between the married pair  that penetrates and licks thy sideeven this will we exterminate

Sanskrit: yas tvā̱ bhrātā̱ pati̍r bhū̱tvā jā̱ro bhū̱tvā ni̱padya̍te   pra̱jāṁ yas te̱ jighā̍ṁsati̱ tam i̱to nā̍śayāmasi
English: what rests by thee in borrowed form of brother lover or of lord  and would destroy thy progenyeven this will we exterminate

Sanskrit: yas tvā̱ svapne̍na̱ tama̍sā mohayi̱tvā ni̱padya̍te   pra̱jāṁ yas te̱ jighā̍ṁsati̱ tam i̱to nā̍śayāmasi
English: that which through sleep or darkness hath deceived thee and lies down by thee  and will destroy thy progenyeven this will we exterminate

Sanskrit: mu̱ñcāmi̍ tvā ha̱viṣā̱ jīva̍nāya̱ kam a̍jñātaya̱kṣmād u̱ta rā̍jaya̱kṣmāt   grāhi̍r ja̱grāha̱ yadi̍ vai̱tad e̍na̱ṁ tasyā̍ indrāgnī̱ pra mu̍muktam enam
English: for life i set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from consumption;  or if the grasping demon have possessed him free him from her o indra thou and agni

Sanskrit: yadi̍ kṣi̱tāyu̱r yadi̍ vā̱ pare̍to̱ yadi̍ mṛ̱tyor a̍nti̱kaṁ nī̍ta e̱va   tam ā ha̍rāmi̱ nirṛ̍ter u̱pasthā̱d aspā̍rṣam enaṁ śa̱taśā̍radāya
English: be his days ended be he now departed be he brought very near to death already  out of destruction's lap again i bring him save him for life to last a hundred autumns

Sanskrit: sa̱ha̱srā̱kṣeṇa̍ śa̱taśā̍radena śa̱tāyu̍ṣā ha̱viṣāhā̍rṣam enam   śa̱taṁ yathe̱maṁ śa̱rado̱ nayā̱tīndro̱ viśva̍sya duri̱tasya̍ pā̱ram
English: with hundredeyed oblation hundredautumned bringing a hundred lives have i restored him  that indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune

Sanskrit: śa̱taṁ jī̍va śa̱rado̱ vardha̍mānaḥ śa̱taṁ he̍ma̱ntāñ cha̱tam u̍ vasa̱ntān   śa̱tam i̍ndrā̱gnī sa̍vi̱tā bṛha̱spati̍ḥ śa̱tāyu̍ṣā ha̱viṣe̱mam puna̍r duḥ
English: live waxing in thy strength a hundred autumns live through a hundred springs a hundred winters  through hundredlived oblation indra agni bṛhaspati savitar yield him for a hundred!

Sanskrit: āhā̍rṣa̱ṁ tvāvi̍daṁ tvā̱ puna̱r āgā̍ḥ punarnava   sarvā̍ṅga̱ sarva̍ṁ te̱ cakṣu̱ḥ sarva̱m āyu̍ś ca te 'vidam
English: so have i found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed  whole in thy members! i have found thy sight and all thy life for thee

Sanskrit: tī̱vrasyā̱bhiva̍yaso a̱sya pā̍hi sarvara̱thā vi harī̍ i̱ha mu̍ñca   indra̱ mā tvā̱ yaja̍mānāso a̱nye ni rī̍rama̱n tubhya̍m i̱me su̱tāsa̍ḥ
English: taste this strong draught enriched with offered viands with all thy chariot here unyoke thy coursers  let not those other sacrificers stay thee indra these juices shed for thee are ready

Sanskrit: tubhya̍ṁ su̱tās tubhya̍m u̱ sotvā̍sa̱s tvāṁ gira̱ḥ śvātryā̱ ā hva̍yanti   indre̱dam a̱dya sava̍naṁ juṣā̱ṇo viśva̍sya vi̱dvām̐ i̱ha pā̍hi̱ soma̍m
English: thine is the juice effused thine are the juices yet to be pressed our resonant songs invite thee  o indra pleased today with this libation come thou who knowest all and drink the soma

Sanskrit: ya u̍śa̱tā mana̍sā̱ soma̍m asmai sarvahṛ̱dā de̱vakā̍maḥ su̱noti̍   na gā indra̱s tasya̱ parā̍ dadāti praśa̱stam ic cāru̍m asmai kṛṇoti
English: whoso devoted to the god effuses soma for him with yearning heart and spirit  never doth indra give away his cattle for him he makes the lovely soma famous

Sanskrit: anu̍spaṣṭo bhavaty e̱ṣo a̍sya̱ yo a̍smai re̱vān na su̱noti̱ soma̍m   nir a̍ra̱tnau ma̱ghavā̱ taṁ da̍dhāti brahma̱dviṣo̍ ha̱nty anā̍nudiṣṭaḥ
English: he looks with ioving favour on the mortal who like a rich man pours for him the soma  maghavan in his bended arm supports him he slays unasked the men who hate devotion

Sanskrit: a̱śvā̱yanto̍ ga̱vyanto̍ vā̱jaya̍nto̱ havā̍mahe̱ tvopa̍ganta̱vā u̍   ā̱bhūṣa̍ntas te suma̱tau navā̍yāṁ va̱yam i̍ndra tvā śu̱naṁ hu̍vema
English: we call on thee to come to us desirous of goods and spoil of cattle and of horses  for thy new love and favour are we present let us invoke thee indra as our welfare

Sanskrit: ud a̱sau sūryo̍ agā̱d ud a̱yam mā̍ma̱ko bhaga̍ḥ   a̱haṁ tad vi̍dva̱lā pati̍m a̱bhy a̍sākṣi viṣāsa̱hiḥ
English: yon sun hath mounted up and this my happy fate hate mounted high  i knowing this as conqueror have won my husband for mine own

Sanskrit: a̱haṁ ke̱tur a̱ham mū̱rdhāham u̱grā vi̱vāca̍nī   mamed anu̱ kratu̱m pati̍ḥ sehā̱nāyā̍ u̱pāca̍ret
English: i am the banner and the head a mighty arbitress am i  i am victorious and my lord shall be submissive to my will

Sanskrit: mama̍ pu̱trāḥ śa̍tru̱haṇo 'tho̍ me duhi̱tā vi̱rāṭ   u̱tāham a̍smi saṁja̱yā patyau̍ me̱ śloka̍ utta̱maḥ
English: my sons are slayers of the foe my daughter is a ruling queen  i am victorious oer my lord my song of triumph is supreme

Sanskrit: yenendro̍ ha̱viṣā̍ kṛ̱tvy abha̍vad dyu̱mny u̍tta̱maḥ   i̱daṁ tad a̍kri devā asapa̱tnā kilā̍bhuvam
English: oblation that which indra gave and thus grew glorious and most high  this have i offered o ye gods and rid me of each rival wife

Sanskrit: a̱sa̱pa̱tnā sa̍patna̱ghnī jaya̍nty abhi̱bhūva̍rī   āvṛ̍kṣam a̱nyāsā̱ṁ varco̱ rādho̱ asthe̍yasām iva
English: destroyer of the rival wife sole spouse victorious conqueror  the others' glory have i seized as twere the wealth of weaker dames

Sanskrit: sam a̍jaiṣam i̱mā a̱haṁ sa̱patnī̍r abhi̱bhūva̍rī   yathā̱ham a̱sya vī̱rasya̍ vi̱rājā̍ni̱ jana̍sya ca
English: i have subdued as conqueror these rivals these my fellowwives  that i may hold imperial sway over this hero and the folk

Sanskrit: sūryo̍ no di̱vas pā̍tu̱ vāto̍ a̱ntari̍kṣāt   a̱gnir na̱ḥ pārthi̍vebhyaḥ
English: may sūrya guard us out of heaven and vāta from the firmament  and agni from terrestrial spots

Sanskrit: joṣā̍ savita̱r yasya̍ te̱ hara̍ḥ śa̱taṁ sa̱vām̐ arha̍ti   pā̱hi no̍ di̱dyuta̱ḥ pata̍ntyāḥ
English: thou savitar whose flame deserves hundred libations be thou pleased  from failing lightning keep us safe

Sanskrit: cakṣu̍r no de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā cakṣu̍r na u̱ta parva̍taḥ   cakṣu̍r dhā̱tā da̍dhātu naḥ
English: may savitar the god and may parvata also give us sight;  may the creator give us sight

Sanskrit: cakṣu̍r no dhehi̱ cakṣu̍ṣe̱ cakṣu̍r vi̱khyai ta̱nūbhya̍ḥ   saṁ ce̱daṁ vi ca̍ paśyema
English: give sight unto our eye give thou our bodies sight that they may see  may we survey discern this world

Sanskrit: su̱sa̱ṁdṛśa̍ṁ tvā va̱yam prati̍ paśyema sūrya   vi pa̍śyema nṛ̱cakṣa̍saḥ
English: thus sūrya may we look on thee on thee most lovely to behold  see clearly with the eyes of men

Sanskrit: i̱mā nu ka̱m bhuva̍nā sīṣadhā̱mendra̍ś ca̱ viśve̍ ca de̱vāḥ
English: we will with indra and all gods to aid us bring these existing worlds into subjection

Sanskrit: ya̱jñaṁ ca̍ nas ta̱nva̍ṁ ca pra̱jāṁ cā̍di̱tyair indra̍ḥ sa̱ha cī̍kḷpāti
English: our sacrifice our bodies and our offspr let indra form together with ādityas

English: with the ādityas with the band of maruts may indra be protector of our bodies
