English: brisk at the place of iḷā hymned by men who wake our own familiar friend is kindled in the house;  hotar of all oblation worthy of our choice lord beaming trusty friend to one who loveth him

Sanskrit: sa da̍rśata̱śrīr ati̍thir gṛ̱hegṛ̍he̱ vane̍vane śiśriye takva̱vīr i̍va   jana̍ṁjana̱ṁ janyo̱ nāti̍ manyate̱ viśa̱ ā kṣe̍ti vi̱śyo̱3̱̍ viśa̍ṁviśam
English: he excellent in glory guest in every house finds like a swiftwinged bird a home in every tree  benevolent to men he scorns no living man friend to the tribes of men he dwells with every tribe

Sanskrit: su̱dakṣo̱ dakṣai̱ḥ kratu̍nāsi su̱kratu̱r agne̍ ka̱viḥ kāvye̍nāsi viśva̱vit   vasu̱r vasū̍nāṁ kṣayasi̱ tvam eka̱ id dyāvā̍ ca̱ yāni̍ pṛthi̱vī ca̱ puṣya̍taḥ
English: most sage with insight passing skilful with thy powers art thou o agni wise with wisdom knowing all  as vasu thou alone art lord of all good things of all the treasures that the heavens and earth produce

Sanskrit: pra̱jā̱nann a̍gne̱ tava̱ yoni̍m ṛ̱tviya̱m iḻā̍yās pa̱de ghṛ̱tava̍nta̱m āsa̍daḥ   ā te̍ cikitra u̱ṣasā̍m i̱veta̍yo 're̱pasa̱ḥ sūrya̍syeva ra̱śmaya̍ḥ
English: foreknowing well o agni thou in iḷā's place hast occupied thy regular station balmed with oil  marked are thy comings like the comings of the dawns the rays of him who shineth spotless as the sun

Sanskrit: tava̱ śriyo̍ va̱rṣya̍syeva vi̱dyuta̍ś ci̱trāś ci̍kitra u̱ṣasā̱ṁ na ke̱tava̍ḥ   yad oṣa̍dhīr a̱bhisṛ̍ṣṭo̱ vanā̍ni ca̱ pari̍ sva̱yaṁ ci̍nu̱ṣe anna̍m ā̱sye̍
English: thy glories are as lightnings from the rainy cloud marked manyhued like heralds of the dawns approach  when loosed to wander over plants and forest trees thou crammest by thyself thy food into thy mouth

Sanskrit: tam oṣa̍dhīr dadhire̱ garbha̍m ṛ̱tviya̱ṁ tam āpo̍ a̱gniṁ ja̍nayanta mā̱tara̍ḥ   tam it sa̍mā̱naṁ va̱nina̍ś ca vī̱rudho̱ 'ntarva̍tīś ca̱ suva̍te ca vi̱śvahā̍
English: him duly coming as their germ have plants received this agni have maternal waters brought to life  so in like manner do the forest trees and plants bear him within them and produce him evermore

Sanskrit: vāto̍padhūta iṣi̱to vaśā̱m̐ anu̍ tṛ̱ṣu yad annā̱ vevi̍ṣad vi̱tiṣṭha̍se   ā te̍ yatante ra̱thyo̱3̱̍ yathā̱ pṛtha̱k chardhā̍ṁsy agne a̱jarā̍ṇi̱ dhakṣa̍taḥ
English: when sped and urged by wind thou spreadest thee abroad swift piercing through thy food according to thy will  thy neverceasing blazes longing to consume like men on chariots agni strive on every side

Sanskrit: me̱dhā̱kā̱raṁ vi̱datha̍sya pra̱sādha̍nam a̱gniṁ hotā̍ram pari̱bhūta̍mam ma̱tim   tam id arbhe̍ ha̱viṣy ā sa̍mā̱nam it tam in ma̱he vṛ̍ṇate̱ nānyaṁ tvat
English: agni the hotarpriest who fills the assembly full waker of knowledge chief controller of the thought  him yea none other than thyself doth man elect at sacrificial offerings great and small alike

Sanskrit: tvām id atra̍ vṛṇate tvā̱yavo̱ hotā̍ram agne vi̱dathe̍ṣu ve̱dhasa̍ḥ   yad de̍va̱yanto̱ dadha̍ti̱ prayā̍ṁsi te ha̱viṣma̍nto̱ mana̍vo vṛ̱ktaba̍rhiṣaḥ
English: here agni the arrangers those attached to thee elect thee as their priest in sacred gatherings  when men with strewn clipt grass and sacrificial gifts offer thee entertainment piously inclined

Sanskrit: tavā̍gne ho̱traṁ tava̍ po̱tram ṛ̱tviya̱ṁ tava̍ ne̱ṣṭraṁ tvam a̱gnid ṛ̍tāya̱taḥ   tava̍ praśā̱straṁ tvam a̍dhvarīyasi bra̱hmā cāsi̍ gṛ̱hapa̍tiś ca no̱ dame̍
English: thine is the herald's task and cleanser's duly timed; leader art thou and kindler for the pious man  thou art director thou the ministering priest thou art the brahman lord and master in our home

Sanskrit: yas tubhya̍m agne a̱mṛtā̍ya̱ martya̍ḥ sa̱midhā̱ dāśa̍d u̱ta vā̍ ha̱viṣkṛ̍ti   tasya̱ hotā̍ bhavasi̱ yāsi̍ dū̱tya1̱̍m upa̍ brūṣe̱ yaja̍sy adhvarī̱yasi̍
English: when mortal man presents to thee immortal god agni his fuel or his sacrificial gift  then thou art his adhvaryu hotar messenger callest the gods and orderest the sacrifice

Sanskrit: i̱mā a̍smai ma̱tayo̱ vāco̍ a̱smad ām̐ ṛco̱ gira̍ḥ suṣṭu̱taya̱ḥ sam a̍gmata   va̱sū̱yavo̱ vasa̍ve jā̱tave̍dase vṛ̱ddhāsu̍ ci̱d vardha̍no̱ yāsu̍ cā̱kana̍t
English: from us these hymns in concert have gone forth to him these holy words these ṛcas songs and eulogies  eager for wealth to jātavedas fain for wealth when they have waxen strong they please their strengthener

Sanskrit: i̱mām pra̱tnāya̍ suṣṭu̱tiṁ navī̍yasīṁ vo̱ceya̍m asmā uśa̱te śṛ̱ṇotu̍ naḥ   bhū̱yā anta̍rā hṛ̱dy a̍sya ni̱spṛśe̍ jā̱yeva̱ patya̍ uśa̱tī su̱vāsā̍ḥ
English: this newest eulogy will i speak forth to him the ancient one who loves it may he hear our voice  may it come near his heart and make it stir with love as a fond welldressed matron clings about her lord

Sanskrit: yasmi̱nn aśvā̍sa ṛṣa̱bhāsa̍ u̱kṣaṇo̍ va̱śā me̱ṣā a̍vasṛ̱ṣṭāsa̱ āhu̍tāḥ   kī̱lā̱la̱pe soma̍pṛṣṭhāya ve̱dhase̍ hṛ̱dā ma̱tiṁ ja̍naye̱ cāru̍m a̱gnaye̍
English: he in whom horses bulls oxen and barren cows and rams when duly set apart are offered up  to agni somasprinkled drinker of sweet juice disposer with my heart i bring a fair hymn forth

Sanskrit: ahā̍vy agne ha̱vir ā̱sye̍ te sru̱cī̍va ghṛ̱taṁ ca̱mvī̍va̱ soma̍ḥ   vā̱ja̱sani̍ṁ ra̱yim a̱sme su̱vīra̍m praśa̱staṁ dhe̍hi ya̱śasa̍m bṛ̱hanta̍m
English: into thy mouth is poured the offering agni as soma into cup oil into ladle  vouchsafe us wealth strengthwinning blest with heroes wealth lofty praised by men and full of splendour

Sanskrit: sa̱hasra̍śīrṣā̱ puru̍ṣaḥ sahasrā̱kṣaḥ sa̱hasra̍pāt   sa bhūmi̍ṁ vi̱śvato̍ vṛ̱tvāty a̍tiṣṭhad daśāṅgu̱lam
English: a thousand heads hath puruṣa a thousand eyes a thousand feet  on every side pervading earth he fills a space ten fingers wide

Sanskrit: puru̍ṣa e̱vedaṁ sarva̱ṁ yad bhū̱taṁ yac ca̱ bhavya̍m   u̱tāmṛ̍ta̱tvasyeśā̍no̱ yad anne̍nāti̱roha̍ti
English: this puruṣa is all that yet hath been and all that is to be;  the lord of immortality which waxes greater still by food

Sanskrit: e̱tāvā̍n asya mahi̱māto̱ jyāyā̍m̐ś ca̱ pūru̍ṣaḥ   pādo̍ 'sya̱ viśvā̍ bhū̱tāni̍ tri̱pād a̍syā̱mṛta̍ṁ di̱vi
English: so mighty is his greatness; yea greater than this is puruṣa  all creatures are onefourth of him threefourths eternal life in heaven

Sanskrit: tri̱pād ū̱rdhva ud ai̱t puru̍ṣa̱ḥ pādo̍ 'sye̱hābha̍va̱t puna̍ḥ   tato̱ viṣva̱ṅ vy a̍krāmat sāśanānaśa̱ne a̱bhi
English: with threefourths puruṣa went up onefourth of him again was here  thence he strode out to every side over what cats not and what cats

Sanskrit: tasmā̍d vi̱rāḻ a̍jāyata vi̱rājo̱ adhi̱ pūru̍ṣaḥ   sa jā̱to aty a̍ricyata pa̱ścād bhūmi̱m atho̍ pu̱raḥ
English: from him virāj was born; again puruṣa from virāj was born  as soon as he was born he spread eastward and westward oer the earth

English: when gods prepared the sacrifice with puruṣa as their offering  its oil was spring the holy gift was autumn; summer was the wood

Sanskrit: taṁ ya̱jñam ba̱rhiṣi̱ praukṣa̱n puru̍ṣaṁ jā̱tam a̍gra̱taḥ   tena̍ de̱vā a̍yajanta sā̱dhyā ṛṣa̍yaś ca̱ ye
English: they balmed as victim on the grass puruṣa born in earliest time  with him the deities and all sādhyas and ṛṣis sacrificed

English: from that great general sacrifice the dripping fat was gathered up  he formed the creatures ofthe air and animals both wild and tame

Sanskrit: tasmā̍d ya̱jñāt sa̍rva̱huta̱ ṛca̱ḥ sāmā̍ni jajñire   chandā̍ṁsi jajñire̱ tasmā̱d yaju̱s tasmā̍d ajāyata

English: from it were horses born from it all cattle with two rows of teeth  from it were generated kine from it the goats and sheep were born

English: when they divided puruṣa how many portions did they make?  what do they call his mouth his arms? what do they call his thighs and feet?

English: the brahman was his mouth of both his arms was the rājanya made  his thighs became the vaiśya from his feet the śūdra was produced

English: the moon was gendered from his mind and from his eye the sun had birth;  indra and agni from his mouth were born and vāyu from his breath

English: forth from his navel came midair the sky was fashioned from his head  earth from his feet and from his car the regions thus they formed the worlds

Sanskrit: sa̱ptāsyā̍san pari̱dhaya̱s triḥ sa̱pta sa̱midha̍ḥ kṛ̱tāḥ   de̱vā yad ya̱jñaṁ ta̍nvā̱nā aba̍dhna̱n puru̍ṣam pa̱śum
English: seven fencingsticks had he thrice seven layers of fuel were prepared  when the gods offering sacrifice bound as their victim puruṣa

English: gods sacrificing sacrificed the victim these were the earliest holy ordinances  the mighty ones attained the height of heaven there where the sādhyas gods of old are dwelling

Sanskrit: indra̍ṁ stavā̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ yasya̍ ma̱hnā vi̍babā̱dhe ro̍ca̱nā vi jmo antā̍n   ā yaḥ pa̱prau ca̍rṣaṇī̱dhṛd varo̍bhi̱ḥ pra sindhu̍bhyo riricā̱no ma̍hi̱tvā
English: i will extol the most heroic indra who with his might forced earth and sky asunder;  who hath filled all with width as man's upholder surpassing floods and rivers in his greatness

English: sūrya is he throughout the wide expanses shall indra turn him swift as carwheels hither  like a stream resting not but ever active he hath destroyed with light the blackhued darkness

English: to him i sing a holy prayer incessant new matchless common to the earth and heaven  who marks as they were backs all living creatures neer doth he fail a friend the noble indra

Sanskrit: indrā̍ya̱ giro̱ ani̍śitasargā a̱paḥ prera̍ya̱ṁ saga̍rasya bu̱dhnāt   yo akṣe̍ṇeva ca̱kriyā̱ śacī̍bhi̱r viṣva̍k ta̱stambha̍ pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām
English: i will send forth my songs in flow unceasing like water from the ocean's depth to indra  who to his car on both its sides securely hath fixed the earth and heaven as with an axle

Sanskrit: āpā̍ntamanyus tṛ̱pala̍prabharmā̱ dhuni̱ḥ śimī̍vā̱ñ charu̍mām̐ ṛjī̱ṣī   somo̱ viśvā̍ny ata̱sā vanā̍ni̱ nārvāg indra̍m prati̱mānā̍ni debhuḥ
English: rousing with draughts the shaker rushing onward impetuous very strong armed as with arrows  is soma; forest trees and all the bushes deceive not indra with their offered likeness

Sanskrit: na yasya̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī na dhanva̱ nāntari̍kṣa̱ṁ nādra̍ya̱ḥ somo̍ akṣāḥ   yad a̍sya ma̱nyur a̍dhinī̱yamā̍naḥ śṛ̱ṇāti̍ vī̱ḻu ru̱jati̍ sthi̱rāṇi̍
English: soma hath flowed to him whom naught can equal the earth the heavens the firmament the mountains  when heightened in his ire his indignation shatters the firm and breaks the strong in pieces

Sanskrit: ja̱ghāna̍ vṛ̱traṁ svadhi̍ti̱r vane̍va ru̱roja̱ puro̱ ara̍da̱n na sindhū̍n   bi̱bheda̍ gi̱riṁ nava̱m in na ku̱mbham ā gā indro̍ akṛṇuta sva̱yugbhi̍ḥ
English: as an axe fells the tree so be slew vṛtra brake down the strongholds and dug out the rivers  he cleft the mountain like a newmade pitcher indra brought forth the kine with his companions

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ha̱ tyad ṛ̍ṇa̱yā i̍ndra̱ dhīro̱ 'sir na parva̍ vṛji̱nā śṛ̍ṇāsi   pra ye mi̱trasya̱ varu̍ṇasya̱ dhāma̱ yuja̱ṁ na janā̍ mi̱nanti̍ mi̱tram
English: wise art thou punisher of guilt o indra the sword lops limbs thou smitest down the sinner  the men who injure as it were a comrade the lofty law of varuṇa and mitra

Sanskrit: pra ye mi̱tram prārya̱maṇa̍ṁ du̱revā̱ḥ pra sa̱ṁgira̱ḥ pra varu̍ṇam mi̱nanti̍   ny a1̱̍mitre̍ṣu va̱dham i̍ndra̱ tumra̱ṁ vṛṣa̱n vṛṣā̍ṇam aru̱ṣaṁ śi̍śīhi
English: men who lead evil lives who break agreements and injure varuṇa aryaman and mitra  against these foes o mighty indra sharpen as furious death thy bull of fiery colour

Sanskrit: indro̍ di̱va indra̍ īśe pṛthi̱vyā indro̍ a̱pām indra̱ it parva̍tānām   indro̍ vṛ̱dhām indra̱ in medhi̍rāṇā̱m indra̱ḥ kṣeme̱ yoge̱ havya̱ indra̍ḥ
English: indra is sovran lord of earth and heaven indra is lord of waters and of mountains  indra is lord of prosperers and sages indra must be invoked in rest and effort

Sanskrit: prāktubhya̱ indra̱ḥ pra vṛ̱dho aha̍bhya̱ḥ prāntari̍kṣā̱t pra sa̍mu̱drasya̍ dhā̱seḥ   pra vāta̍sya̱ pratha̍sa̱ḥ pra jmo antā̱t pra sindhu̍bhyo ririce̱ pra kṣi̱tibhya̍ḥ
English: vaster than days and nights giver of increase vaster than firmament and flood of ocean  vaster than bounds of earth and wind's extension vaster than rivers and our lands is indra

Sanskrit: pra śośu̍catyā u̱ṣaso̱ na ke̱tur a̍si̱nvā te̍ vartatām indra he̱tiḥ   aśme̍va vidhya di̱va ā sṛ̍jā̱nas tapi̍ṣṭhena̱ heṣa̍sā̱ drogha̍mitrān
English: forward as herald of refulgent morning let thine insatiate arrow fly o indra  and pierce as twere a stone launched forth from heaven with hottest blaze the men who love deception

Sanskrit: anv aha̱ māsā̱ anv id vanā̱ny anv oṣa̍dhī̱r anu̱ parva̍tāsaḥ   anv indra̱ṁ roda̍sī vāvaśā̱ne anv āpo̍ ajihata̱ jāya̍mānam
English: him verily the moons the mountains followed the tall trees followed and the plants and herbage  yearning with love both worlds approached the waters waited on indra when he first had being

Sanskrit: karhi̍ svi̱t sā ta̍ indra ce̱tyāsa̍d a̱ghasya̱ yad bhi̱nado̱ rakṣa̱ eṣa̍t   mi̱tra̱kruvo̱ yac chasa̍ne̱ na gāva̍ḥ pṛthi̱vyā ā̱pṛg a̍mu̱yā śaya̍nte
English: where was the vengeful dart when thou o indra clavest the demon ever beat on outrage?  when fiends lay there upon the ground extended like cattle in the place of immolation?

Sanskrit: śa̱trū̱yanto̍ a̱bhi ye na̍s tata̱sre mahi̱ vrādha̍nta oga̱ṇāsa̍ indra   a̱ndhenā̱mitrā̱s tama̍sā sacantāṁ sujyo̱tiṣo̍ a̱ktava̱s tām̐ a̱bhi ṣyu̍ḥ
English: those who are set in enmity against us the ogaṇas o indra waxen mighty  let blinding darkness follow those our foemen while these shall have bright shining nights to light them

Sanskrit: pu̱rūṇi̱ hi tvā̱ sava̍nā̱ janā̍nā̱m brahmā̍ṇi̱ manda̍n gṛṇa̱tām ṛṣī̍ṇām   i̱mām ā̱ghoṣa̱nn ava̍sā̱ sahū̍tiṁ ti̱ro viśvā̱m̐ arca̍to yāhy a̱rvāṅ
English: may plentiful libations of the people and singing ṛṣis holy prayers rejoice thee  hearing with love this common invocation come unto us pass by all those who praise thee

Sanskrit: e̱vā te̍ va̱yam i̍ndra bhuñjatī̱nāṁ vi̱dyāma̍ sumatī̱nāṁ navā̍nām   vi̱dyāma̱ vasto̱r ava̍sā gṛ̱ṇanto̍ vi̱śvāmi̍trā u̱ta ta̍ indra nū̱nam
English: o indra thus may we be made partakers of thy new favours that shall bring us profit  singing with love may we the viśvāmitras win daylight even now through thee o indra

Sanskrit: śu̱naṁ hu̍vema ma̱ghavā̍na̱m indra̍m a̱smin bhare̱ nṛta̍ma̱ṁ vāja̍sātau   śṛ̱ṇvanta̍m u̱gram ū̱taye̍ sa̱matsu̱ ghnanta̍ṁ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ sa̱ṁjita̱ṁ dhanā̍nām
English: call we on maghavan auspicious indra best hero in the fight where spoil is gathered  the strong who listens who gives aid in battles who slays the vṛtras wins and gathers riches

Sanskrit: ra̱kṣo̱haṇa̍ṁ vā̱jina̱m ā ji̍gharmi mi̱tram prathi̍ṣṭha̱m upa̍ yāmi̱ śarma̍   śiśā̍no a̱gniḥ kratu̍bhi̱ḥ sami̍ddha̱ḥ sa no̱ divā̱ sa ri̱ṣaḥ pā̍tu̱ nakta̍m
English: i balm with oil the mighty rakṣasslayer; to the most famous friend i come for shelter  enkindled sharpened by our rites may agni protect us in the day and night from evil

Sanskrit: ayo̍daṁṣṭro a̱rciṣā̍ yātu̱dhānā̱n upa̍ spṛśa jātaveda̱ḥ sami̍ddhaḥ   ā ji̱hvayā̱ mūra̍devān rabhasva kra̱vyādo̍ vṛ̱ktvy api̍ dhatsvā̱san
English: o jātavedas with the teeth of iron enkindled with thy flame attack the demons  seize with thy longue the foolish gods' adorers rend put within thy mouth the rawflesh caters

Sanskrit: u̱bhobha̍yāvi̱nn upa̍ dhehi̱ daṁṣṭrā̍ hi̱ṁsraḥ śiśā̱no 'va̍ra̱m para̍ṁ ca   u̱tāntari̍kṣe̱ pari̍ yāhi rāja̱ñ jambhai̱ḥ saṁ dhe̍hy a̱bhi yā̍tu̱dhānā̍n
English: apply thy teeth the upper and the lower thou who hast both enkindled and destroying  roam also in the air o king around us and with thy jaws assail the wicked spirits

Sanskrit: ya̱jñair iṣū̍ḥ sa̱ṁnama̍māno agne vā̱cā śa̱lyām̐ a̱śani̍bhir dihā̱naḥ   tābhi̍r vidhya̱ hṛda̍ye yātu̱dhānā̍n pratī̱co bā̱hūn prati̍ bhaṅdhy eṣām
English: bending thy shafts through sacrifices agni whetting their points with song as if with whetstones  pierce to the heart therewith the yātudhānas and break their arms uplifed to attack thee

Sanskrit: agne̱ tvaca̍ṁ yātu̱dhāna̍sya bhindhi hi̱ṁsrāśani̱r hara̍sā hantv enam   pra parvā̍ṇi jātavedaḥ śṛṇīhi kra̱vyāt kra̍vi̱ṣṇur vi ci̍notu vṛ̱kṇam
English: pierce through the yātudhāna's skin o agni; let the destroying dart with fire consume him  rend his joints jātavedas let the cater of flesh fleshseeking track his mangled body

Sanskrit: yatre̱dānī̱m paśya̍si jātaveda̱s tiṣṭha̍ntam agna u̱ta vā̱ cara̍ntam   yad vā̱ntari̍kṣe pa̱thibhi̱ḥ pata̍nta̱ṁ tam astā̍ vidhya̱ śarvā̱ śiśā̍naḥ
English: where now thou seest agni jātavedas one of these demons standing still or roaming  or flying on those paths in air's midregion sharpen the shaft and as an archer pierce him

Sanskrit: u̱tāla̍bdhaṁ spṛṇuhi jātaveda ālebhā̱nād ṛ̱ṣṭibhi̍r yātu̱dhānā̍t   agne̱ pūrvo̱ ni ja̍hi̱ śośu̍cāna ā̱māda̱ḥ kṣviṅkā̱s tam a̍da̱ntv enī̍ḥ
English: tear from the evil spirit jātavedas what he hath seized and with his spears hath captured  blazing before him strike him down o agni; let spotted carrioneating kites devour him

Sanskrit: i̱ha pra brū̍hi yata̱maḥ so a̍gne̱ yo yā̍tu̱dhāno̱ ya i̱daṁ kṛ̱ṇoti̍   tam ā ra̍bhasva sa̱midhā̍ yaviṣṭha nṛ̱cakṣa̍sa̱ś cakṣu̍ṣe randhayainam
English: here tell this forth o agni whosoever is he himself or acteth as a demon  him grasp o thou most youthful with thy fuel to the matiseer's eye give him as booty

Sanskrit: tī̱kṣṇenā̍gne̱ cakṣu̍ṣā rakṣa ya̱jñam prāñca̱ṁ vasu̍bhya̱ḥ pra ṇa̍ya pracetaḥ   hi̱ṁsraṁ rakṣā̍ṁsy a̱bhi śośu̍cāna̱m mā tvā̍ dabhan yātu̱dhānā̍ nṛcakṣaḥ
English: with keen glance guard the sacrifice o agni thou sage conduct it onward to the vasus  let not the fiends o manbeholder harm thee burning against the rākṣasas to slay them

Sanskrit: nṛ̱cakṣā̱ rakṣa̱ḥ pari̍ paśya vi̱kṣu tasya̱ trīṇi̱ prati̍ śṛṇī̱hy agrā̍   tasyā̍gne pṛ̱ṣṭīr hara̍sā śṛṇīhi tre̱dhā mūla̍ṁ yātu̱dhāna̍sya vṛśca
English: look on the fiend mid men as manbeholder rend thou his three extremities in pieces  demolish with thy flame his ribs o agni the yātudhāna's root destroy thou triply

Sanskrit: trir yā̍tu̱dhāna̱ḥ prasi̍tiṁ ta etv ṛ̱taṁ yo a̍gne̱ anṛ̍tena̱ hanti̍   tam a̱rciṣā̍ sphū̱rjaya̍ñ jātavedaḥ sama̱kṣam e̍naṁ gṛṇa̱te ni vṛ̍ṅdhi
English: thrice agni let thy noose surround the demon who with his falsehood injures holy order  loud roaring with thy flame o jātavedas crush him and cast him down before the singer

Sanskrit: tad a̍gne̱ cakṣu̱ḥ prati̍ dhehi re̱bhe śa̍phā̱ruja̱ṁ yena̱ paśya̍si yātu̱dhāna̍m   a̱tha̱rva̱vaj jyoti̍ṣā̱ daivye̍na sa̱tyaṁ dhūrva̍ntam a̱cita̱ṁ ny o̍ṣa
English: lead thou the worshipper that eye o agni wherewith thou lookest on the hoofarmed demon  with light celestial in atharvan's manner burn up the foot who ruins truth with falsehood

Sanskrit: yad a̍gne a̱dya mi̍thu̱nā śapā̍to̱ yad vā̱cas tṛ̱ṣṭaṁ ja̱naya̍nta re̱bhāḥ   ma̱nyor mana̍saḥ śara̱vyā̱3̱̍ jāya̍te̱ yā tayā̍ vidhya̱ hṛda̍ye yātu̱dhānā̍n
English: agni what curse the pair this day have uttered what heated word the worshippers have spoken  each arrowy taunt sped from the angry spiritpierce to the heart therewith the yātudhānas

Sanskrit: parā̍ śṛṇīhi̱ tapa̍sā yātu̱dhānā̱n parā̍gne̱ rakṣo̱ hara̍sā śṛṇīhi   parā̱rciṣā̱ mūra̍devāñ chṛṇīhi̱ parā̍su̱tṛpo̍ a̱bhi śośu̍cānaḥ
English: with fervent heat exterminate the demons; destroy the fiends with burning flame o agni  destroy with fire the foolish gods' adorers; blaze and destrepy the insatiable monsters

Sanskrit: parā̱dya de̱vā vṛ̍ji̱naṁ śṛ̍ṇantu pra̱tyag e̍naṁ śa̱pathā̍ yantu tṛ̱ṣṭāḥ   vā̱cāste̍na̱ṁ śara̍va ṛcchantu̱ marma̱n viśva̍syaitu̱ prasi̍tiṁ yātu̱dhāna̍ḥ
English: may gods destroy this day the evildoer may each hot curse of his return and blast him  let arrows pierce the liar in his vitals and visva's net enclose the yātudhāna

Sanskrit: yaḥ pauru̍ṣeyeṇa kra̱viṣā̍ sama̱ṅkte yo aśvye̍na pa̱śunā̍ yātu̱dhāna̍ḥ   yo a̱ghnyāyā̱ bhara̍ti kṣī̱ram a̍gne̱ teṣā̍ṁ śī̱rṣāṇi̱ hara̱sāpi̍ vṛśca
English: the fiend who smears himself with flesh of cattle with flesh of horses and of human bodies  who steals the milchcow's milk away o agnitear off the heads of such with fiery fury

Sanskrit: sa̱ṁva̱tsa̱rīṇa̱m paya̍ u̱sriyā̍yā̱s tasya̱ māśī̍d yātu̱dhāno̍ nṛcakṣaḥ   pī̱yūṣa̍m agne yata̱mas titṛ̍psā̱t tam pra̱tyañca̍m a̱rciṣā̍ vidhya̱ marma̍n
English: the cow gives milk each year o manregarder let not the yātudhāna ever taste it  if one would glut him with the biesting agni pierce with thy flame his vitals as he meets thee

Sanskrit: vi̱ṣaṁ gavā̍ṁ yātu̱dhānā̍ḥ piba̱ntv ā vṛ̍ścyantā̱m adi̍taye du̱revā̍ḥ   parai̍nān de̱vaḥ sa̍vi̱tā da̍dātu̱ parā̍ bhā̱gam oṣa̍dhīnāṁ jayantām
English: let the fiends drink the poison of the cattle; may aditi cast off the evildoers  may the god savitar give them up to ruin and be their share of plants and herbs denied them

Sanskrit: sa̱nād a̍gne mṛṇasi yātu̱dhānā̱n na tvā̱ rakṣā̍ṁsi̱ pṛta̍nāsu jigyuḥ   anu̍ daha sa̱hamū̍rān kra̱vyādo̱ mā te̍ he̱tyā mu̍kṣata̱ daivyā̍yāḥ
English: agni from days of old thou slayest demons never shall rākṣasas in fight oercome thee  burn up the foolish ones the fleshdevourers let none of them escape thine heavenly arrow

Sanskrit: tvaṁ no̍ agne adha̱rād uda̍ktā̱t tvam pa̱ścād u̱ta ra̍kṣā pu̱rastā̍t   prati̱ te te̍ a̱jarā̍sa̱s tapi̍ṣṭhā a̱ghaśa̍ṁsa̱ṁ śośu̍cato dahantu
English: guard us o agni from above and under protect us flom behind us and before us;  and may thy flames most fierce and never wasting glowing with fervent heat consume the sinner

Sanskrit: pa̱ścāt pu̱rastā̍d adha̱rād uda̍ktāt ka̱viḥ kāvye̍na̱ pari̍ pāhi rājan   sakhe̱ sakhā̍yam a̱jaro̍ jari̱mṇe 'gne̱ martā̱m̐ ama̍rtya̱s tvaṁ na̍ḥ
English: from rear from front from under from above us o king protect us as a sage with wisdom  guard to old age thy friend o friend eternal o agni as immortal guard us mortals

Sanskrit: pari̍ tvāgne̱ pura̍ṁ va̱yaṁ vipra̍ṁ sahasya dhīmahi   dhṛ̱ṣadva̍rṇaṁ di̱vedi̍ve ha̱ntāra̍m bhaṅgu̱rāva̍tām
English: we set thee round us as a fort victorious agni thee a sage  of hero lineage day by day destroyer of our treacherous foes

Sanskrit: vi̱ṣeṇa̍ bhaṅgu̱rāva̍ta̱ḥ prati̍ ṣma ra̱kṣaso̍ daha   agne̍ ti̱gmena̍ śo̱ciṣā̱ tapu̍ragrābhir ṛ̱ṣṭibhi̍ḥ
English: burn with thy poison turned against the treacherous brood of rākṣasas  o agni with thy sharpened glow with lances armed with points of flame

Sanskrit: praty a̍gne mithu̱nā da̍ha yātu̱dhānā̍ kimī̱dinā̍   saṁ tvā̍ śiśāmi jāgṛ̱hy ada̍bdhaṁ vipra̱ manma̍bhiḥ
English: burn thou the paired kimīdins brun agni the yātudhāna pairs  i sharpen thee infallible with hymns o sage be vigilant

Sanskrit: praty a̍gne̱ hara̍sā̱ hara̍ḥ śṛṇī̱hi vi̱śvata̱ḥ prati̍   yā̱tu̱dhāna̍sya ra̱kṣaso̱ bala̱ṁ vi ru̍ja vī̱rya̍m
English: shoot forth o agni with thy flame demolish them on every side  break thou the yātudhāna's strength the vigour of the rākṣasa

Sanskrit: ha̱viṣ pānta̍m a̱jara̍ṁ sva̱rvidi̍ divi̱spṛśy āhu̍ta̱ṁ juṣṭa̍m a̱gnau   tasya̱ bharma̍ṇe̱ bhuva̍nāya de̱vā dharma̍ṇe̱ kaṁ sva̱dhayā̍ paprathanta
English: dear ageless sacrificial drink is offered in lightdiscovering heavenpervading agni  the gods spread forth through his celestial nature that he might bear the world up and sustain it

Sanskrit: gī̱rṇam bhuva̍na̱ṁ tama̱sāpa̍gūḻham ā̱viḥ sva̍r abhavaj jā̱te a̱gnau   tasya̍ de̱vāḥ pṛ̍thi̱vī dyaur u̱tāpo 'ra̍ṇaya̱nn oṣa̍dhīḥ sa̱khye a̍sya
English: the world was swallowed and concealed in darkness agni was born and light became apparent  the deities the broad earth and the heavens and plants and waters gloried in his friendship

Sanskrit: de̱vebhi̱r nv i̍ṣi̱to ya̱jñiye̍bhir a̱gniṁ sto̍ṣāṇy a̱jara̍m bṛ̱hanta̍m   yo bhā̱nunā̍ pṛthi̱vīṁ dyām u̱temām ā̍ta̱tāna̱ roda̍sī a̱ntari̍kṣam
English: inspired by gods who claim our adoration i now will laud eternal lofty agni  him who hath spread abroad the earth with lustre this heaven and both the worlds and air's midregion

Sanskrit: yo hotāsī̍t pratha̱mo de̱vaju̍ṣṭo̱ yaṁ sa̱māñja̱nn ājye̍nā vṛṇā̱nāḥ   sa pa̍ta̱trī̍tva̱raṁ sthā jaga̱d yac chvā̱tram a̱gnir a̍kṛṇoj jā̱tave̍dāḥ
English: earliest priest whom all the gods accepted and chose him and anointed him with butter  he swiftly made all things that fly stand travel all that hath motion agni jātavedas

Sanskrit: yaj jā̍tavedo̱ bhuva̍nasya mū̱rdhann ati̍ṣṭho agne sa̱ha ro̍ca̱nena̍   taṁ tvā̍hema ma̱tibhi̍r gī̱rbhir u̱kthaiḥ sa ya̱jñiyo̍ abhavo rodasi̱prāḥ
English: because thou agni jātavedas stoodest at the world's head with thy refulgent splendour  we sent thee forth with hymns and songs and praises thou filledst heaven and earth god meet for worship

Sanskrit: mū̱rdhā bhu̱vo bha̍vati̱ nakta̍m a̱gnis tata̱ḥ sūryo̍ jāyate prā̱tar u̱dyan   mā̱yām ū̱ tu ya̱jñiyā̍nām e̱tām apo̱ yat tūrṇi̱ś cara̍ti prajā̱nan
English: head of the world is agni in the nighttime; then as the sun at morn springs up and rises  then to his task goes the prompt priest foreknowing the wondrous power of gods who must be honoured

Sanskrit: dṛ̱śenyo̱ yo ma̍hi̱nā sami̱ddho 'ro̍cata di̱viyo̍nir vi̱bhāvā̍   tasmi̍nn a̱gnau sū̍ktavā̱kena̍ de̱vā ha̱vir viśva̱ āju̍havus tanū̱pāḥ
English: lovely is he who kindled in his greatness hath shone forth seated in the heavens refulgent  with resonant hymns all gods who guard our bodies have offered up oblation in this agni

Sanskrit: sū̱kta̱vā̱kam pra̍tha̱mam ād id a̱gnim ād id dha̱vir a̍janayanta de̱vāḥ   sa e̍ṣāṁ ya̱jño a̍bhavat tanū̱pās taṁ dyaur ve̍da̱ tam pṛ̍thi̱vī tam āpa̍ḥ
English: first the gods brought the hymnal into being; then they engendered agni then oblation  he was their sacrifice that guards our bodies him the heavens know the earth the waters know him

Sanskrit: yaṁ de̱vāso 'ja̍nayantā̱gniṁ yasmi̱nn āju̍havu̱r bhuva̍nāni̱ viśvā̍   so a̱rciṣā̍ pṛthi̱vīṁ dyām u̱temām ṛ̍jū̱yamā̍no atapan mahi̱tvā
English: he agni whom the gods have generated in whom they offered up all worlds and creatures  he with his bright glow heated earth and heaven urging himself right onward in his grandeur

Sanskrit: stome̍na̱ hi di̱vi de̱vāso̍ a̱gnim ajī̍jana̱ñ chakti̍bhī rodasi̱prām   tam ū̍ akṛṇvan tre̱dhā bhu̱ve kaṁ sa oṣa̍dhīḥ pacati vi̱śvarū̍pāḥ
English: then by the laud the gods engendered agni in heaven who fills both worlds through strength and vigour  they made him to appear in threefold essence he ripens plants of every form and nature

Sanskrit: ya̱ded e̍na̱m ada̍dhur ya̱jñiyā̍so di̱vi de̱vāḥ sūrya̍m ādite̱yam   ya̱dā ca̍ri̱ṣṇū mi̍thu̱nāv abhū̍tā̱m ād it prāpa̍śya̱n bhuva̍nāni̱ viśvā̍
English: what time the gods whose due is worship set him as sūrya son of aditi in heaven  when the pair ever wandering sprang to being all creatures that existed looked upon them

Sanskrit: viśva̍smā a̱gnim bhuva̍nāya de̱vā vai̍śvāna̱raṁ ke̱tum ahnā̍m akṛṇvan   ā yas ta̱tāno̱ṣaso̍ vibhā̱tīr apo̍ ūrṇoti̱ tamo̍ a̱rciṣā̱ yan
English: for all the world of life the gods made agni vaiśvānara to be the days' bright banner  him who hath spread abroad the radiant mornings and coming with his light unveils the darkness

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱raṁ ka̱vayo̍ ya̱jñiyā̍so̱ 'gniṁ de̱vā a̍janayann aju̱ryam   nakṣa̍tram pra̱tnam ami̍nac cari̱ṣṇu ya̱kṣasyādhya̍kṣaṁ tavi̱ṣam bṛ̱hanta̍m
English: the wise and holy deities engendered agni vaiśvānara whom age neer touches  the ancient star that wanders on for ever lofty and strong lord of the living being

Sanskrit: vai̱śvā̱na̱raṁ vi̱śvahā̍ dīdi̱vāṁsa̱m mantrai̍r a̱gniṁ ka̱vim acchā̍ vadāmaḥ   yo ma̍hi̱mnā pa̍riba̱bhūvo̱rvī u̱tāvastā̍d u̱ta de̱vaḥ pa̱rastā̍t
English: we call upon the sage with holy verses agni vaiśvānara the everbeaming  who hath surpassed both heaven and earth in greatness he is a god below a god above us

Sanskrit: dve sru̱tī a̍śṛṇavam pitṝ̱ṇām a̱haṁ de̱vānā̍m u̱ta martyā̍nām   tābhyā̍m i̱daṁ viśva̱m eja̱t sam e̍ti̱ yad a̍nta̱rā pi̱tara̍m mā̱tara̍ṁ ca
English: i have heard mention of two several pathways ways of the fathers and of gods and mortals  on these two paths each moving creature travels each thing between the father and the mother

Sanskrit: dve sa̍mī̱cī bi̍bhṛta̱ś cara̍ntaṁ śīrṣa̱to jā̱tam mana̍sā̱ vimṛ̍ṣṭam   sa pra̱tyaṅ viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni tasthā̱v apra̍yucchan ta̱raṇi̱r bhrāja̍mānaḥ
English: these two united paths bear him who journeys born from the head and pondered with the spirit  he stands directed to all things existing hasting unresting in his fiery splendour

Sanskrit: yatrā̱ vade̍te̱ ava̍ra̱ḥ para̍ś ca yajña̱nyo̍ḥ kata̱ro nau̱ vi ve̍da   ā śe̍ku̱r it sa̍dha̱māda̱ṁ sakhā̍yo̱ nakṣa̍nta ya̱jñaṁ ka i̱daṁ vi vo̍cat
English: which of us twain knows where they speak together upper and lower of the two riteleaders?  our friends have helped to gather our assembly they came to sacrifice; who will announce it?

Sanskrit: katy a̱gnaya̱ḥ kati̱ sūryā̍sa̱ḥ katy u̱ṣāsa̱ḥ katy u̍ svi̱d āpa̍ḥ   nopa̱spija̍ṁ vaḥ pitaro vadāmi pṛ̱cchāmi̍ vaḥ kavayo vi̱dmane̱ kam
English: how many are the fires and suns in number? what is the number of the dawns and waters?  not jestingly i speak to you o fathers sages i ask you this for information

Sanskrit: yā̱va̱nmā̱tram u̱ṣaso̱ na pratī̍kaṁ supa̱rṇyo̱3̱̍ vasa̍te mātariśvaḥ   tāva̍d dadhā̱ty upa̍ ya̱jñam ā̱yan brā̍hma̱ṇo hotu̱r ava̍ro ni̱ṣīda̍n
English: as great as is the fairwinged morning's presence to him who dwells beside us mātariśvan!  is what the brahman does when he approaches to sacrifice and sits below the hotar

Sanskrit: vi hi soto̱r asṛ̍kṣata̱ nendra̍ṁ de̱vam a̍maṁsata   yatrāma̍dad vṛ̱ṣāka̍pir a̱ryaḥ pu̱ṣṭeṣu̱ matsa̍khā̱ viśva̍smā̱d indra̱ utta̍raḥ
English: men have abstained from pouring juice they count not indra as a god  where at the votary's store my friend vrsakapi hath drunk his fill supreme is indra over all

Sanskrit: parā̱ hī̍ndra̱ dhāva̍si vṛ̱ṣāka̍pe̱r ati̱ vyathi̍ḥ   no aha̱ pra vi̍ndasy a̱nyatra̱ soma̍pītaye̱ viśva̍smā̱d indra̱ utta̍raḥ
English: thou indra heedless passest by the ill vrsakapi hath wrought;  yet nowhere else thou findest place wherein to drink the soma juice supreme is indra over all

Sanskrit: kim a̱yaṁ tvāṁ vṛ̱ṣāka̍piś ca̱kāra̱ hari̍to mṛ̱gaḥ   yasmā̍ ira̱syasīd u̱ nv a1̱̍ryo vā̍ puṣṭi̱mad vasu̱ viśva̍smā̱d indra̱ utta̍raḥ
English: what hath he done to injure thee this tawny beast vrsakapi  with whom thou art so angry now? what is the votary's foodful store? supreme is indra over all

Sanskrit: yam i̱maṁ tvaṁ vṛ̱ṣāka̍pim pri̱yam i̍ndrābhi̱rakṣa̍si   śvā nv a̍sya jambhiṣa̱d api̱ karṇe̍ varāha̱yur viśva̍smā̱d indra̱ utta̍raḥ
English: soon may the hound who hunts the boar seize him and bite him in the car  o indra that vrsakapi whom thou protectest as a friend supreme is indra over all

Sanskrit: pri̱yā ta̱ṣṭāni̍ me ka̱pir vya̍ktā̱ vy a̍dūduṣat   śiro̱ nv a̍sya rāviṣa̱ṁ na su̱gaṁ du̱ṣkṛte̍ bhuva̱ṁ viśva̍smā̱d indra̱ utta̍raḥ

English: soma obtained her first of all; next the gandharva was her lord  agai was thy third husband now one bornof woman is thy fourth

Sanskrit: somo̍ dadad gandha̱rvāya̍ gandha̱rvo da̍dad a̱gnaye̍   ra̱yiṁ ca̍ pu̱trām̐ś cā̍dād a̱gnir mahya̱m atho̍ i̱mām
English: soma to the gandharva and to agni the gandharva gave  and agni hath bestowed on me riches and sons and this my spouse

Sanskrit: i̱haiva sta̱m mā vi yau̍ṣṭa̱ṁ viśva̱m āyu̱r vy a̍śnutam   krīḻa̍ntau pu̱trair naptṛ̍bhi̱r moda̍mānau̱ sve gṛ̱he
English: be ye not parted; dwell ye here reach the full time of human life  with sons and grandsons sport and play rejoicing in your own abode

Sanskrit: ā na̍ḥ pra̱jāṁ ja̍nayatu pra̱jāpa̍tir ājara̱sāya̱ sam a̍naktv arya̱mā   adu̍rmaṅgalīḥ patilo̱kam ā vi̍śa̱ śaṁ no̍ bhava dvi̱pade̱ śaṁ catu̍ṣpade
English: so may prajāpati bring children forth to us; may aryaman adorn us till old age come nigh  not inauspicious enter thou thy husband's house bring blessing to our bipeds and our quadrupeds

Sanskrit: agho̍racakṣu̱r apa̍tighny edhi śi̱vā pa̱śubhya̍ḥ su̱manā̍ḥ su̱varcā̍ḥ   vī̱ra̱sūr de̱vakā̍mā syo̱nā śaṁ no̍ bhava dvi̱pade̱ śaṁ catu̍ṣpade
English: not evileyed no slayer of thy husband bring weal to cattle radiant gentlehearted;  loving the gods delightful bearing heroes bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds

Sanskrit: i̱māṁ tvam i̍ndra mīḍhvaḥ supu̱trāṁ su̱bhagā̍ṁ kṛṇu   daśā̍syām pu̱trān ā dhe̍hi̱ pati̍m ekāda̱śaṁ kṛ̍dhi
English: o bounteous indra make this bride blest in her sons and fortunate  vouchsafe to her ten sons and make her husband the eleventh man

Sanskrit: sa̱mrājñī̱ śvaśu̍re bhava sa̱mrājñī̍ śva̱śrvām bha̍va   nanā̍ndari sa̱mrājñī̍ bhava sa̱mrājñī̱ adhi̍ de̱vṛṣu̍
English: over thy husband's father and thy husband's mother bear full sway  over the sister of thy lord over his brothers rule supreme

Sanskrit: sam a̍ñjantu̱ viśve̍ de̱vāḥ sam āpo̱ hṛda̍yāni nau   sam mā̍ta̱riśvā̱ saṁ dhā̱tā sam u̱ deṣṭrī̍ dadhātu nau
English: so may the universal gods so may the waters join our hearts  may mātariśvan dhātar and destri together bind us close

Sanskrit: tvayā̍ manyo sa̱ratha̍m āru̱janto̱ harṣa̍māṇāso dhṛṣi̱tā ma̍rutvaḥ   ti̱gmeṣa̍va̱ āyu̍dhā sa̱ṁśiśā̍nā a̱bhi pra ya̍ntu̱ naro̍ a̱gnirū̍pāḥ
English: borne on with thee o manyu girt by maruts let our brave men impetuous bursting forward  march on like flames of fire in form exulting with pointed arrows sharpening their weapons

Sanskrit: a̱gnir i̍va manyo tviṣi̱taḥ sa̍hasva senā̱nīr na̍ḥ sahure hū̱ta e̍dhi   ha̱tvāya̱ śatrū̱n vi bha̍jasva̱ veda̱ ojo̱ mimā̍no̱ vi mṛdho̍ nudasva
English: flashing like fire be thou o conquering manyu invoked o victor as our army's leader  slay thou our foes distribute their possessions show forth thy vigour scatter those who hate us

Sanskrit: saha̍sva manyo a̱bhimā̍tim a̱sme ru̱jan mṛ̱ṇan pra̍mṛ̱ṇan prehi̱ śatrū̍n   u̱graṁ te̱ pājo̍ na̱nv ā ru̍rudhre va̱śī vaśa̍ṁ nayasa ekaja̱ tvam
English: o manyu overcome thou our assailant on! breaking slaying crushing down the foemen  they have not hindered thine impetuous vigour mighty sole born! thou makest them thy subjects

Sanskrit: eko̍ bahū̱nām a̍si manyav īḻi̱to viśa̍ṁviśaṁ yu̱dhaye̱ saṁ śi̍śādhi   akṛ̍ttaru̱k tvayā̍ yu̱jā va̱yaṁ dyu̱manta̱ṁ ghoṣa̍ṁ vija̱yāya̍ kṛṇmahe
English: alone or many thou art worshipped manyu sharpen the spirit of each clan for battle  with thee to aid o thou of perfect splendour we will uplift the glorious shout for conquest

Sanskrit: vi̱je̱ṣa̱kṛd indra̍ ivānavabra̱vo̱3̱̍ 'smāka̍m manyo adhi̱pā bha̍ve̱ha   pri̱yaṁ te̱ nāma̍ sahure gṛṇīmasi vi̱dmā tam utsa̱ṁ yata̍ āba̱bhūtha̍
English: unyielding bringing victory like indra o manyu be thou here our sovran ruler  to thy dear name o victor we sing praises we know the spring from which thou art come hither

Sanskrit: ābhū̍tyā saha̱jā va̍jra sāyaka̱ saho̍ bibharṣy abhibhūta̱ utta̍ram   kratvā̍ no manyo sa̱ha me̱dy e̍dhi mahādha̱nasya̍ puruhūta sa̱ṁsṛji̍
English: twinborn with power destructive bolt of thunder the highest conquering might is thine subduer!  be friendly to its in thy spirit manyu o muchinvoked in shock of mighty battle

Sanskrit: saṁsṛ̍ṣṭa̱ṁ dhana̍m u̱bhaya̍ṁ sa̱mākṛ̍tam a̱smabhya̍ṁ dattā̱ṁ varu̍ṇaś ca ma̱nyuḥ   bhiya̱ṁ dadhā̍nā̱ hṛda̍yeṣu̱ śatra̍va̱ḥ parā̍jitāso̱ apa̱ ni la̍yantām
English: for spoil let varuṇa and manyu give us the wealth of both sides gathered and collected;  and let our enemies with stricken spirits oerwhelmed with terror slink away defeated

Sanskrit: yas te̍ ma̱nyo 'vi̍dhad vajra sāyaka̱ saha̱ oja̍ḥ puṣyati̱ viśva̍m ānu̱ṣak   sā̱hyāma̱ dāsa̱m ārya̱ṁ tvayā̍ yu̱jā saha̍skṛtena̱ saha̍sā̱ saha̍svatā
English: he who hath reverenced thee manyu destructive bolt breeds for himself forthwith all conquering energy  ārya and dāsa will we conquer with thine aid with thee the conqueror with conquest conquestsped

Sanskrit: ma̱nyur indro̍ ma̱nyur e̱vāsa̍ de̱vo ma̱nyur hotā̱ varu̍ṇo jā̱tave̍dāḥ   ma̱nyuṁ viśa̍ īḻate̱ mānu̍ṣī̱r yāḥ pā̱hi no̍ manyo̱ tapa̍sā sa̱joṣā̍ḥ
English: manyu was indra yea the god was manyu manyu was hotar varuṇa jātavedas  the tribes of human lineage worship manyu accordant with thy fervour manyu guard us

Sanskrit: a̱bhī̍hi manyo ta̱vasa̱s tavī̍yā̱n tapa̍sā yu̱jā vi ja̍hi̱ śatrū̍n   a̱mi̱tra̱hā vṛ̍tra̱hā da̍syu̱hā ca̱ viśvā̱ vasū̱ny ā bha̍rā̱ tvaṁ na̍ḥ
English: come hither manyu mightier tham the mighty; chase with thy fervour for ally our foemen  slayer of foes of vṛtra and of dasyu bring thou to us all kinds of wealth and treasure

Sanskrit: tvaṁ hi ma̍nyo a̱bhibhū̍tyojāḥ svaya̱mbhūr bhāmo̍ abhimātiṣā̱haḥ   vi̱śvaca̍rṣaṇi̱ḥ sahu̍ri̱ḥ sahā̍vān a̱smāsv oja̱ḥ pṛta̍nāsu dhehi
English: for thou art manyu of surpassing vigour fierce queller of the foe and selfexistent  shared by all men victorious subduer vouchsafe to us superior strengith in battles

Sanskrit: a̱bhā̱gaḥ sann apa̱ pare̍to asmi̱ tava̱ kratvā̍ tavi̱ṣasya̍ pracetaḥ   taṁ tvā̍ manyo akra̱tur ji̍hīḻā̱haṁ svā ta̱nūr ba̍la̱deyā̍ya̱ mehi̍
English: i have departed still without a portion wise god! according to thy will the mighty  i feeble man was wroth thee o manyu i am myself; come thou to give me vigour

Sanskrit: a̱yaṁ te̍ a̱smy upa̱ mehy a̱rvāṅ pra̍tīcī̱naḥ sa̍hure viśvadhāyaḥ   manyo̍ vajrinn a̱bhi mām ā va̍vṛtsva̱ hanā̍va̱ dasyū̍m̐r u̱ta bo̍dhy ā̱peḥ
English: come hither i am all thine own; advancing turn thou to me victorious allsupporter!  come to me manyu wielder of the thunder bethink thee of thy friend and slay the dasyus

Sanskrit: a̱bhi prehi̍ dakṣiṇa̱to bha̍vā̱ me 'dhā̍ vṛ̱trāṇi̍ jaṅghanāva̱ bhūri̍   ju̱homi̍ te dha̱ruṇa̱m madhvo̱ agra̍m u̱bhā u̍pā̱ṁśu pra̍tha̱mā pi̍bāva
English: approach and on my right hand hold thy station so shall we slay a multitude of foemen  the best of meath i offer to support thee may we be first to drink thereof in quiet

Sanskrit: cakṣu̍ṣaḥ pi̱tā mana̍sā̱ hi dhīro̍ ghṛ̱tam e̍ne ajana̱n nanna̍māne   ya̱ded antā̱ ada̍dṛhanta̱ pūrva̱ ād id dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī a̍prathetām
English: the father of the eye the wise in spirit created both these worlds submerged in fatness  then when the eastern ends were firmly fastened the heavens and the earth were far extended

Sanskrit: vi̱śvaka̍rmā̱ vima̍nā̱ ād vihā̍yā dhā̱tā vi̍dhā̱tā pa̍ra̱mota sa̱ṁdṛk   teṣā̍m i̱ṣṭāni̱ sam i̱ṣā ma̍danti̱ yatrā̍ saptaṛ̱ṣīn pa̱ra eka̍m ā̱huḥ
English: mighty in mind and power is visvakarman maker disposer and most lofty presence  their offerings joy in rich juice where they value one only one beyond the seven ṛṣis

Sanskrit: yo na̍ḥ pi̱tā ja̍ni̱tā yo vi̍dhā̱tā dhāmā̍ni̱ veda̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ viśvā̍   yo de̱vānā̍ṁ nāma̱dhā eka̍ e̱va taṁ sa̍mpra̱śnam bhuva̍nā yanty a̱nyā
English: father who made us he who as disposer knoweth all races and all things existing  even he alone the deities' narnegiverhim other beings seek for information

Sanskrit: ta āya̍janta̱ dravi̍ṇa̱ṁ sam a̍smā̱ ṛṣa̍ya̱ḥ pūrve̍ jari̱tāro̱ na bhū̱nā   a̱sūrte̱ sūrte̱ raja̍si niṣa̱tte ye bhū̱tāni̍ sa̱makṛ̍ṇvann i̱māni̍
English: to him in sacrifice they offered treasuresṛṣis of old in numerous troops as singers  who in the distant near and lower region made ready all these things that have existence

Sanskrit: pa̱ro di̱vā pa̱ra e̱nā pṛ̍thi̱vyā pa̱ro de̱vebhi̱r asu̍rai̱r yad asti̍   kaṁ svi̱d garbha̍m pratha̱maṁ da̍dhra̱ āpo̱ yatra̍ de̱vāḥ sa̱mapa̍śyanta̱ viśve̍
English: that which is earlier than this earth and heaven before the asuras and gods had being  what was the germ primeval which the waters received where all the gods were seen together?

Sanskrit: tam id garbha̍m pratha̱maṁ da̍dhra̱ āpo̱ yatra̍ de̱vāḥ sa̱maga̍cchanta̱ viśve̍   a̱jasya̱ nābhā̱v adhy eka̱m arpi̍ta̱ṁ yasmi̱n viśvā̍ni̱ bhuva̍nāni ta̱sthuḥ
English: the waters they received that germ primeval wherein the gods were gathefed all together  it rested set upon the unborn's navel that one wherein abide all things existing

Sanskrit: na taṁ vi̍dātha̱ ya i̱mā ja̱jānā̱nyad yu̱ṣmāka̱m anta̍ram babhūva   nī̱hā̱reṇa̱ prāvṛ̍tā̱ jalpyā̍ cāsu̱tṛpa̍ uktha̱śāsa̍ś caranti
English: ye will not find him who produced these creatures another thing hath risen up among you  enwrapt in misty cloud with lips that stammer hymnchanters wander and are discontented

Sanskrit: ya i̱mā viśvā̱ bhuva̍nāni̱ juhva̱d ṛṣi̱r hotā̱ ny asī̍dat pi̱tā na̍ḥ   sa ā̱śiṣā̱ dravi̍ṇam i̱cchamā̍naḥ prathama̱cchad ava̍rā̱m̐ ā vi̍veśa
English: he who sate down as hotarpriest the ṛṣi our father offering up all things existing  he seeking through his wish a great possession came among men on earth as archetypal

Sanskrit: kiṁ svi̍d āsīd adhi̱ṣṭhāna̍m ā̱rambha̍ṇaṁ kata̱mat svi̍t ka̱thāsī̍t   yato̱ bhūmi̍ṁ ja̱naya̍n vi̱śvaka̍rmā̱ vi dyām aurṇo̍n mahi̱nā vi̱śvaca̍kṣāḥ
English: what was the place whereon he took his station? what was it that supported him? how was it?  whence visvakarman seeing all producing the earth with mighty power disclosed the heavens

Sanskrit: vi̱śvata̍ścakṣur u̱ta vi̱śvato̍mukho vi̱śvato̍bāhur u̱ta vi̱śvata̍spāt   sam bā̱hubhyā̱ṁ dhama̍ti̱ sam pata̍trai̱r dyāvā̱bhūmī̍ ja̱naya̍n de̱va eka̍ḥ
English: he who hath eyes on all sides round about him a mouth on all sides arms and feet on all sides  he the sole god producing earth and heaven weldeth them with his arms as wings together

Sanskrit: kiṁ svi̱d vana̱ṁ ka u̱ sa vṛ̱kṣa ā̍sa̱ yato̱ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī ni̍ṣṭata̱kṣuḥ   manī̍ṣiṇo̱ mana̍sā pṛ̱cchated u̱ tad yad a̱dhyati̍ṣṭha̱d bhuva̍nāni dhā̱raya̍n
English: what was the tree what wood in sooth produced it from which they fashioned out the earth and heaven?  ye thoughtful men inquire within your spirit whereon he stood when he established all things

Sanskrit: yā te̱ dhāmā̍ni para̱māṇi̱ yāva̱mā yā ma̍dhya̱mā vi̍śvakarmann u̱temā   śikṣā̱ sakhi̍bhyo ha̱viṣi̍ svadhāvaḥ sva̱yaṁ ya̍jasva ta̱nva̍ṁ vṛdhā̱naḥ
English: nine highest lowest sacrificial natures and these thy midmost here o visvakarman  teach thou thy friends at sacrifice o blessed and come thyself exalted to our worship

Sanskrit: viśva̍karman ha̱viṣā̍ vāvṛdhā̱naḥ sva̱yaṁ ya̍jasva pṛthi̱vīm u̱ta dyām   muhya̍ntv a̱nye a̱bhito̱ janā̍sa i̱hāsmāka̍m ma̱ghavā̍ sū̱rir a̍stu
English: bring thou thyself exalted with oblation o visvakarman earth and heaven to worship  let other men around us live in folly here let us have a rich and liberal patron

Sanskrit: vā̱cas pati̍ṁ vi̱śvaka̍rmāṇam ū̱taye̍ mano̱juva̱ṁ vāje̍ a̱dyā hu̍vema   sa no̱ viśvā̍ni̱ hava̍nāni joṣad vi̱śvaśa̍mbhū̱r ava̍se sā̱dhuka̍rmā
English: let us invoke today to aid our labour the lord of speech the thoughtswift visvakarman  may he hear kindly all our invocations who gives all bliss for aid whose works are righteous

Sanskrit: a̱gniḥ sapti̍ṁ vājambha̱raṁ da̍dāty a̱gnir vī̱raṁ śrutya̍ṁ karmani̱ḥṣṭhām   a̱gnī roda̍sī̱ vi ca̍rat sama̱ñjann a̱gnir nārī̍ṁ vī̱raku̍kṣi̱m pura̍ṁdhim
English: agni bestows the fleet prizewinning courser agni the hero famed and firm in duty  agni pervades and decks the earth and heaven and fills the fruitful dame who teems with heroes

Sanskrit: a̱gner apna̍saḥ sa̱mid a̍stu bha̱drāgnir ma̱hī roda̍sī̱ ā vi̍veśa   a̱gnir eka̍ṁ codayat sa̱matsv a̱gnir vṛ̱trāṇi̍ dayate pu̱rūṇi̍
English: blest be the wood that feeds the active agni within the two great worlds hath agni entered  agni impels a single man to battle and with him rends in pieces many a foeman

Sanskrit: a̱gnir ha̱ tyaṁ jara̍ta̱ḥ karṇa̍m āvā̱gnir a̱dbhyo nir a̍daha̱j jarū̍tham   a̱gnir atri̍ṁ gha̱rma u̍ruṣyad a̱ntar a̱gnir nṛ̱medha̍m pra̱jayā̍sṛja̱t sam
English: agni rejoiced the car of him who praised lim and from the waters burnt away jarutha  agni saved atri in the fiery cavem and made nrmedha rich with troops of children

Sanskrit: a̱gnir dā̱d dravi̍ṇaṁ vī̱rape̍śā a̱gnir ṛṣi̱ṁ yaḥ sa̱hasrā̍ sa̱noti̍   a̱gnir di̱vi ha̱vyam ā ta̍tānā̱gner dhāmā̍ni̱ vibhṛ̍tā puru̱trā
English: agni hath granted wealth that decks the hero and sent the sage who wins a thousand cattle  agni hath made oblations rise to heaven to every place are agni's laws extended

Sanskrit: a̱gnim u̱kthair ṛṣa̍yo̱ vi hva̍yante̱ 'gniṁ naro̱ yāma̍ni bādhi̱tāsa̍ḥ   a̱gniṁ vayo̍ a̱ntari̍kṣe̱ pata̍nto̱ 'gniḥ sa̱hasrā̱ pari̍ yāti̱ gonā̍m
English: with songs of praise the ṛṣis call on agni; on agni heroes worsted in the foray  birds flying in the region call on agni around a thousand cattle agni wanders

Sanskrit: a̱gniṁ viśa̍ īḻate̱ mānu̍ṣī̱r yā a̱gnim manu̍ṣo̱ nahu̍ṣo̱ vi jā̱tāḥ   a̱gnir gāndha̍rvīm pa̱thyā̍m ṛ̱tasyā̱gner gavyū̍tir ghṛ̱ta ā niṣa̍ttā
English: races of human birth pay agni worship men who have sprung from nahus' line adore him  stablished in holy oil is agni's pasture on the gandharva path of law and order

Sanskrit: a̱gnaye̱ brahma̍ ṛ̱bhava̍s tatakṣur a̱gnim ma̱hām a̍vocāmā suvṛ̱ktim   agne̱ prāva̍ jari̱tāra̍ṁ yavi̱ṣṭhāgne̱ mahi̱ dravi̍ṇa̱m ā ya̍jasva
English: the ṛbhus fabricated prayer for agni and we with mighty hymns have called on agni  agni most youthful god protect the singer win us by worship agni great possessions

Sanskrit: apa̍śyam asya maha̱to ma̍hi̱tvam ama̍rtyasya̱ martyā̍su vi̱kṣu   nānā̱ hanū̱ vibhṛ̍te̱ sam bha̍rete̱ asi̍nvatī̱ bapsa̍tī̱ bhūry a̍ttaḥ
English: i have beheld the might of this great being immortal in the midst of tribes of mortals  his jaws now open and now shut together much they devour insatiately chewing

Sanskrit: guhā̱ śiro̱ nihi̍ta̱m ṛdha̍g a̱kṣī asi̍nvann atti ji̱hvayā̱ vanā̍ni   atrā̍ṇy asmai pa̱ḍbhiḥ sam bha̍ranty uttā̱naha̍stā̱ nama̱sādhi̍ vi̱kṣu
English: his eyes are turned away his head is hidden unsated with his tongue he eats the fuel  with hands upraised with reverence in the houses for him they quickly bring his food together

Sanskrit: pra mā̱tuḥ pra̍ta̱raṁ guhya̍m i̱cchan ku̍mā̱ro na vī̱rudha̍ḥ sarpad u̱rvīḥ   sa̱saṁ na pa̱kvam a̍vidac chu̱canta̍ṁ riri̱hvāṁsa̍ṁ ri̱pa u̱pasthe̍ a̱ntaḥ
English: seeking as twere his mother's secret bosom he like a child creeps on through widespread bushes  one he finds glowing like hot food made ready and kissing deep within the earth's recmes

Sanskrit: tad vā̍m ṛ̱taṁ ro̍dasī̱ pra bra̍vīmi̱ jāya̍māno mā̱tarā̱ garbho̍ atti   nāhaṁ de̱vasya̱ martya̍ś ciketā̱gnir a̱ṅga vice̍tā̱ḥ sa prace̍tāḥ
English: this holy law i tell you earth and heaven the infant at his birth dovours his parents  no knowledge of the god have i a mortal yea agni knoweth best for he hath wisdom

Sanskrit: yo a̍smā̱ anna̍ṁ tṛ̱ṣv ā̱3̱̍dadhā̱ty ājyai̍r ghṛ̱tair ju̱hoti̱ puṣya̍ti   tasmai̍ sa̱hasra̍m a̱kṣabhi̱r vi ca̱kṣe 'gne̍ vi̱śvata̍ḥ pra̱tyaṅṅ a̍si̱ tvam
English: this man who quickly gives him food who offers his gifts of oil and butter and supports him   him with his thousand eyes he closely looks on thou showest him thy face from all sides agni

Sanskrit: kiṁ de̱veṣu̱ tyaja̱ ena̍ś caka̱rthāgne̍ pṛ̱cchāmi̱ nu tvām avi̍dvān   akrī̍ḻa̱n krīḻa̱n hari̱r atta̍ve̱ 'dan vi pa̍rva̱śaś ca̍karta̱ gām i̍vā̱siḥ
English: agni hast thou committed sin or treason among the gods? in ignorance i ask thee  playing not playing he goldhued and toothless hath cut his food up as the knife a victim

Sanskrit: viṣū̍co̱ aśvā̍n yuyuje vane̱jā ṛjī̍tibhī raśa̱nābhi̍r gṛbhī̱tān   ca̱kṣa̱de mi̱tro vasu̍bhi̱ḥ sujā̍ta̱ḥ sam ā̍nṛdhe̱ parva̍bhir vāvṛdhā̱naḥ
English: he born in wood hath yoked his horses rushing in all directions held with reins that glitter  the wellborn friend hath carved his food with vasus in all his limbs he hath increased and prospered

Sanskrit: viprā̍so̱ na manma̍bhiḥ svā̱dhyo̍ devā̱vyo̱3̱̍ na ya̱jñaiḥ svapna̍saḥ   rājā̍no̱ na ci̱trāḥ su̍sa̱ṁdṛśa̍ḥ kṣitī̱nāṁ na maryā̍ are̱pasa̍ḥ
English: ye by your hymns are like highthoughted singers skilful inviting gods with sacrifices;  fair to behold like kings with bright adornment like spotless gallants leaders of the people

Sanskrit: a̱gnir na ye bhrāja̍sā ru̱kmava̍kṣaso̱ vātā̍so̱ na sva̱yuja̍ḥ sa̱dyaū̍tayaḥ   pra̱jñā̱tāro̱ na jyeṣṭhā̍ḥ sunī̱taya̍ḥ su̱śarmā̍ṇo̱ na somā̍ ṛ̱taṁ ya̱te
English: like fire with flashing flame breastbound with chains of gold like tempestblasts selfmoving swift to lend your aid;  as best of all foreknowers excellent to guide like somas good to guard the man who follows law

Sanskrit: vātā̍so̱ na ye dhuna̍yo jiga̱tnavo̍ 'gnī̱nāṁ na ji̱hvā vi̍ro̱kiṇa̍ḥ   varma̍ṇvanto̱ na yo̱dhāḥ śimī̍vantaḥ pitṝ̱ṇāṁ na śaṁsā̍ḥ surā̱taya̍ḥ
English: shakers of all like gales of wind they travel like tongues of burning fires in their effulgence  mighty are they as warriors clad in armour and like the fathers' prayers most bounteous givers

Sanskrit: rathā̍nā̱ṁ na ye1̱̍ 'rāḥ sanā̍bhayo jigī̱vāṁso̱ na śūrā̍ a̱bhidya̍vaḥ   va̱re̱yavo̱ na maryā̍ ghṛta̱pruṣo̍ 'bhisva̱rtāro̍ a̱rkaṁ na su̱ṣṭubha̍ḥ
English: like spokes of carwheels in one nave united ever victorious like heavenly heroes  shedding their precious balm like youthful suitors they raise their voice and chant their psalm as singers

Sanskrit: aśvā̍so̱ na ye jyeṣṭhā̍sa ā̱śavo̍ didhi̱ṣavo̱ na ra̱thya̍ḥ su̱dāna̍vaḥ   āpo̱ na ni̱mnair u̱dabhi̍r jiga̱tnavo̍ vi̱śvarū̍pā̱ aṅgi̍raso̱ na sāma̍bhiḥ
English: they who are fleet to travel like the noblest steeds long to obtain the prize like bounteous charioteers  like waters speeding on with their precipitous floods like omniform aṅgirases with sāmahymns

Sanskrit: grāvā̍ṇo̱ na sū̱raya̱ḥ sindhu̍mātara ādardi̱rāso̱ adra̍yo̱ na vi̱śvahā̍   śi̱śūlā̱ na krī̱ḻaya̍ḥ sumā̱taro̍ mahāgrā̱mo na yāma̍nn u̱ta tvi̱ṣā
English: born from the stream like pressstones are the princes for ever like the stones that crush in pieces;  sons of a beauteous dame like playful children like a great host upon the march with splendour

Sanskrit: u̱ṣasā̱ṁ na ke̱tavo̍ 'dhvara̱śriya̍ḥ śubha̱ṁyavo̱ nāñjibhi̱r vy a̍śvitan   sindha̍vo̱ na ya̱yiyo̱ bhrāja̍dṛṣṭayaḥ parā̱vato̱ na yoja̍nāni mamire
English: like rays of dawn the visitors of sacrifice they shine with ornaments as eager to be bright  like rivers hasting on glittering with their spears from far away they measure out the distances

Sanskrit: su̱bhā̱gān no̍ devāḥ kṛṇutā su̱ratnā̍n a̱smān sto̱tṝn ma̍ruto vāvṛdhā̱nāḥ   adhi̍ sto̱trasya̍ sa̱khyasya̍ gāta sa̱nād dhi vo̍ ratna̱dheyā̍ni̱ santi̍
English: gods send us happiness and make us wealthy letting us singers prosper o ye maruts  bethink you of our praise and of our friendship ye from of old have riches to vouchsafe us

Sanskrit: a̱bhra̱pruṣo̱ na vā̱cā pru̍ṣā̱ vasu̍ ha̱viṣma̍nto̱ na ya̱jñā vi̍jā̱nuṣa̍ḥ   su̱māru̍ta̱ṁ na bra̱hmāṇa̍m a̱rhase̍ ga̱ṇam a̍stoṣy eṣā̱ṁ na śo̱bhase̍
English: as with their voice from cloud they sprinkle treasure so are the wise man's liberal sacrifices  i praise their company that merits worship as the good martits' priest to pay them honour

Sanskrit: śri̱ye maryā̍so a̱ñjīm̐r a̍kṛṇvata su̱māru̍ta̱ṁ na pū̱rvīr ati̱ kṣapa̍ḥ   di̱vas pu̱trāsa̱ etā̱ na ye̍tira ādi̱tyāsa̱s te a̱krā na vā̍vṛdhuḥ
English: the youths have wrought their ornaments for glory through many nightsthis noble band of maruts  like stags the sons of dyatis have striven onward the sons of aditi grown strong like pillars

Sanskrit: pra ye di̱vaḥ pṛ̍thi̱vyā na ba̱rhaṇā̱ tmanā̍ riri̱cre a̱bhrān na sūrya̍ḥ   pāja̍svanto̱ na vī̱rāḥ pa̍na̱syavo̍ ri̱śāda̍so̱ na maryā̍ a̱bhidya̍vaḥ
English: they who extend beyond the earth and heaven by their own mass as from the cloud spreads sūrya;  like mighty heroes covetous of glory like heavenly gallants who destroy the wicked

Sanskrit: yu̱ṣmāka̍m bu̱dhne a̱pāṁ na yāma̍ni vithu̱ryati̱ na ma̱hī śra̍tha̱ryati̍   vi̱śvapsu̍r ya̱jño a̱rvāg a̱yaṁ su va̱ḥ praya̍svanto̱ na sa̱trāca̱ ā ga̍ta
English: when ye come nigh as in the depth of waters the earth is loosened as it were and shaken  this your allfeedin sacrifice approaches come all united fraught as twere with viands

Sanskrit: yū̱yaṁ dhū̱rṣu pra̱yujo̱ na ra̱śmibhi̱r jyoti̍ṣmanto̱ na bhā̱sā vyu̍ṣṭiṣu   śye̱nāso̱ na svaya̍śaso ri̱śāda̍saḥ pra̱vāso̱ na prasi̍tāsaḥ pari̱pruṣa̍ḥ
English: ye are like horses fastened to the chariot poles luminous with your beams with splendour as at dawn;  like selfbright falcons punishers of wicked men like hovering birds urged forward scattering rain around

Sanskrit: pra yad vaha̍dhve marutaḥ parā̱kād yū̱yam ma̱haḥ sa̱ṁvara̍ṇasya̱ vasva̍ḥ   vi̱dā̱nāso̍ vasavo̱ rādhya̍syā̱rāc ci̱d dveṣa̍ḥ sanu̱tar yu̍yota
English: when ye come forth o maruts from the distance from the great treasury of rich possessions  knowing o vasus boons that should be granted even from afar drive back the men who hate us

Sanskrit: ya u̱dṛci̍ ya̱jñe a̍dhvare̱ṣṭhā ma̱rudbhyo̱ na mānu̍ṣo̱ dadā̍śat   re̱vat sa vayo̍ dadhate su̱vīra̱ṁ sa de̱vānā̱m api̍ gopī̱the a̍stu
English: he who engaged in the rite's final duty brings as a man oblation to the maruts  wins him life's wealthy fulness blest with heroes he shall be present too where gods drink soma

Sanskrit: te hi ya̱jñeṣu̍ ya̱jñiyā̍sa̱ ūmā̍ ādi̱tyena̱ nāmnā̱ śambha̍viṣṭhāḥ   te no̍ 'vantu ratha̱tūr ma̍nī̱ṣām ma̱haś ca̱ yāma̍nn adhva̱re ca̍kā̱nāḥ
English: for these are helps adored at sacrifices bringing good fortune by their name ādityas  speeding on cars let them protect our praises delighting in our sacrifice and worship

Sanskrit: ā va̍ ṛñjasa ū̱rjāṁ vyu̍ṣṭi̱ṣv indra̍m ma̱ruto̱ roda̍sī anaktana   u̱bhe yathā̍ no̱ aha̍nī sacā̱bhuvā̱ sada̍ḥsado variva̱syāta̍ u̱dbhidā̍
English: i grasp at you when power and strength begin to dawn bedew ye indra and the maruts heaven and earth  that day and night in every hall of sacrifice may wait on us and bless us when they first spring forth

Sanskrit: tad u̱ śreṣṭha̱ṁ sava̍naṁ sunota̱nātyo̱ na hasta̍yato̱ adri̍ḥ so̱tari̍   vi̱dad dhy a1̱̍ryo a̱bhibhū̍ti̱ pauṁsya̍m ma̱ho rā̱ye ci̍t tarute̱ yad arva̍taḥ
English: press the libation out most excellent of all the pressingstone is grasped like a handguided steed  so let it win the valour that subdues the foe and the fleet courser's might that speeds to ample wealth

Sanskrit: tad id dhy a̍sya̱ sava̍naṁ vi̱ver a̱po yathā̍ pu̱rā mana̍ve gā̱tum aśre̍t   goa̍rṇasi tvā̱ṣṭre aśva̍nirṇiji̱ prem a̍dhva̱reṣv a̍dhva̱rām̐ a̍śiśrayuḥ
English: juice that this stone pours out removes defect of ours as in old time it brought prosperity to man  at sacrifices they established holy rites on tvaṣṭar's milkblent juice bright with the hue of steeds

Sanskrit: apa̍ hata ra̱kṣaso̍ bhaṅgu̱rāva̍taḥ skabhā̱yata̱ nirṛ̍ti̱ṁ sedha̱tāma̍tim   ā no̍ ra̱yiṁ sarva̍vīraṁ sunotana devā̱vya̍m bharata̱ śloka̍m adrayaḥ
English: drive ye the treacherous demons far away from us keep nirrti afar and banish penury  pour riches forth for us with troops of hero sons and bear ye up o stones the song that visits gods

Sanskrit: di̱vaś ci̱d ā vo 'ma̍vattarebhyo vi̱bhvanā̍ cid ā̱śva̍pastarebhyaḥ   vā̱yoś ci̱d ā soma̍rabhastarebhyo̱ 'gneś ci̍d arca pitu̱kṛtta̍rebhyaḥ
English: to you who are more mighty than the heavens themselves who finishing your task with more than vibhvan's speed  more rapidly than vāyu seize the soma juice better than agni give us food to you i sing

Sanskrit: bhu̱rantu̍ no ya̱śasa̱ḥ sotv andha̍so̱ grāvā̍ṇo vā̱cā di̱vitā̍ di̱vitma̍tā   naro̱ yatra̍ duha̱te kāmya̱m madhv ā̍gho̱ṣaya̍nto a̱bhito̍ mitha̱stura̍ḥ
English: stirred be the glorious stones let it press out the juice the stone with heavenly song that reaches up to heaven  there where the men draw forth the meath for which they long sending their voice around in rivalry of speed

Sanskrit: su̱nvanti̱ soma̍ṁ rathi̱rāso̱ adra̍yo̱ nir a̍sya̱ rasa̍ṁ ga̱viṣo̍ duhanti̱ te   du̱hanty ūdha̍r upa̱seca̍nāya̱ kaṁ naro̍ ha̱vyā na ma̍rjayanta ā̱sabhi̍ḥ
English: the stones press out the soma swift as carborne men and eager for the spoil drain forth the sap thereof  to fill the beaker they exhaust the udder's store as the men purify oblations with their lips

Sanskrit: e̱te na̍ra̱ḥ svapa̍so abhūtana̱ ya indrā̍ya sunu̱tha soma̍m adrayaḥ   vā̱maṁvā̍maṁ vo di̱vyāya̱ dhāmne̱ vasu̍vasu va̱ḥ pārthi̍vāya sunva̱te
English: ye present men have been most skilful in your work even ye o stones who pressed soma for indra's drink  may all ye have of fair go to the heavenly race and all your treasure to the earthly worshipper

Sanskrit: pra su va̍ āpo mahi̱māna̍m utta̱maṁ kā̱rur vo̍cāti̱ sada̍ne vi̱vasva̍taḥ   pra sa̱ptasa̍pta tre̱dhā hi ca̍kra̱muḥ pra sṛtva̍rīṇā̱m ati̱ sindhu̱r oja̍sā
English: the singer o ye waters in vivasvān's place shall tell your grandeur forth that is beyond compare  the rivers have come forward triply seven and seven sindhu in might surpasses all the streams that flow

Sanskrit: pra te̍ 'rada̱d varu̍ṇo̱ yāta̍ve pa̱thaḥ sindho̱ yad vājā̍m̐ a̱bhy adra̍va̱s tvam   bhūmyā̱ adhi̍ pra̱vatā̍ yāsi̱ sānu̍nā̱ yad e̍ṣā̱m agra̱ṁ jaga̍tām ira̱jyasi̍
English: varuṇa cut the channels for thy forward course o sindhu when thou rannest on to win the race  thou speedest oer precipitous ridges of the earth when thou art lord and leader of these moving floods

Sanskrit: di̱vi sva̱no ya̍tate̱ bhūmyo̱pary a̍na̱ntaṁ śuṣma̱m ud i̍yarti bhā̱nunā̍   a̱bhrād i̍va̱ pra sta̍nayanti vṛ̱ṣṭaya̱ḥ sindhu̱r yad eti̍ vṛṣa̱bho na roru̍vat
English: his roar is lifted up to heaven above the earth he puts forth endless vigour with a flash of light  like floods of rain that fall in thunder from the cloud so sindhu rushes on bellowing like a bull

Sanskrit: a̱bhi tvā̍ sindho̱ śiśu̱m in na mā̱taro̍ vā̱śrā a̍rṣanti̱ paya̍seva dhe̱nava̍ḥ   rāje̍va̱ yudhvā̍ nayasi̱ tvam it sicau̱ yad ā̍sā̱m agra̍m pra̱vatā̱m ina̍kṣasi
English: like mothers to their calves like milch kine with their milk so sindhu unto thee the roaring rivers run  thou leadest as a warrior king thine army's wings what time thou comest in the van of these swift streams

Sanskrit: i̱mam me̍ gaṅge yamune sarasvati̱ śutu̍dri̱ stoma̍ṁ sacatā̱ paru̱ṣṇy ā   a̱si̱knyā ma̍rudvṛdhe vi̱tasta̱yārjī̍kīye śṛṇu̱hy ā su̱ṣoma̍yā
English: favour ye this my laud o gan!gā yamunā o sutudri paruṣṇī and sarasvatī  with asikni vitasta o marudvrdha o ārjīkīya with susoma hear my call

Sanskrit: tṛ̱ṣṭāma̍yā pratha̱maṁ yāta̍ve sa̱jūḥ su̱sartvā̍ ra̱sayā̍ śve̱tyā tyā   tvaṁ si̍ndho̱ kubha̍yā goma̱tīṁ krumu̍m meha̱tnvā sa̱ratha̱ṁ yābhi̱r īya̍se
English: first with trstama thou art eager to flow forth with rasā and susartu and with svetya here  with kubha; and with these sindhu and mehatnu thou seekest in thy course krumu and gomati

Sanskrit: ṛjī̱ty enī̱ ruśa̍tī mahi̱tvā pari̱ jrayā̍ṁsi bharate̱ rajā̍ṁsi   ada̍bdhā̱ sindhu̍r a̱pasā̍m a̱pasta̱māśvā̱ na ci̱trā vapu̍ṣīva darśa̱tā
English: flashing and whitelygleaming in her mightiness she moves along her ample volumes through the realms  most active of the active sindhu unrestrained like to a dappled mare beautiful fair to see

Sanskrit: svaśvā̱ sindhu̍ḥ su̱rathā̍ su̱vāsā̍ hira̱ṇyayī̱ sukṛ̍tā vā̱jinī̍vatī   ūrṇā̍vatī yuva̱tiḥ sī̱lamā̍vaty u̱tādhi̍ vaste su̱bhagā̍ madhu̱vṛdha̍m
English: rich in good steeds is sindhu rich in cars and robes rich in gold noblyfashioned rich in ample wealth  blest silamavati and young urnavati invest themselves with raiment rich in store of sweets

Sanskrit: su̱khaṁ ratha̍ṁ yuyuje̱ sindhu̍r a̱śvina̱ṁ tena̱ vāja̍ṁ saniṣad a̱sminn ā̱jau   ma̱hān hy a̍sya mahi̱mā pa̍na̱syate 'da̍bdhasya̱ svaya̍śaso vira̱pśina̍ḥ
English: sindhu hath yoked her car lightrolling drawn by steeds and with that car shall she win booty in this fight  so have i praised its power mighty and unrestrained of independent glory roaring as it runs

Sanskrit: vasū̍nāṁ vā carkṛṣa̱ iya̍kṣan dhi̱yā vā̍ ya̱jñair vā̱ roda̍syoḥ   arva̍nto vā̱ ye ra̍yi̱manta̍ḥ sā̱tau va̱nuṁ vā̱ ye su̱śruṇa̍ṁ su̱śruto̱ dhuḥ
English: i am prepared to laud with song or worship the noble ones who are in earth and heaven  or coursers who have triumphed in the contest or those who famed have won the prize with glory

Sanskrit: hava̍ eṣā̱m asu̍ro nakṣata̱ dyāṁ śra̍vasya̱tā mana̍sā niṁsata̱ kṣām   cakṣā̍ṇā̱ yatra̍ suvi̱tāya̍ de̱vā dyaur na vāre̍bhiḥ kṛ̱ṇava̍nta̱ svaiḥ
English: their call the call of gods went up to heaven they kissed the ground with gloryseeking spirit  there where the gods look on for happy fortune and like the kindly heavens bestow their bounties

Sanskrit: i̱yam e̍ṣām a̱mṛtā̍nā̱ṁ gīḥ sa̱rvatā̍tā̱ ye kṛ̱paṇa̍nta̱ ratna̍m   dhiya̍ṁ ca ya̱jñaṁ ca̱ sādha̍nta̱s te no̍ dhāntu vasa̱vya1̱̍m asā̍mi
English: this is the song of those immortal beings who long for treasures in their full perfection  may these completing prayers and sacrifices bestow upon us wealth where naught is wanting

Sanskrit: ā tat ta̍ indrā̱yava̍ḥ panantā̱bhi ya ū̱rvaṁ goma̍nta̱ṁ titṛ̍tsān   sa̱kṛ̱tsva1̱̍ṁ ye pu̍rupu̱trām ma̱hīṁ sa̱hasra̍dhārām bṛha̱tīṁ dudu̍kṣan
English: those living men extolled thy deed o indra those who would fain burst through the stall of cattle  fain to milk her who bare but once great lofty whose sons are many and her streams past number

Sanskrit: śacī̍va̱ indra̱m ava̍se kṛṇudhva̱m anā̍nataṁ da̱maya̍ntam pṛta̱nyūn   ṛ̱bhu̱kṣaṇa̍m ma̱ghavā̍naṁ suvṛ̱ktim bhartā̱ yo vajra̱ṁ narya̍m puru̱kṣuḥ
English: sacivan win to your assistance indra who never bends who overcomes his foemen  ṛbhukṣan maghavan the hymn's upholder who rich in food bears man's kind friend the thunder

Sanskrit: yad vā̱vāna̍ puru̱tama̍m purā̱ṣāḻ ā vṛ̍tra̱hendro̱ nāmā̍ny aprāḥ   ace̍ti prā̱saha̱s pati̱s tuvi̍ṣmā̱n yad ī̍m u̱śmasi̱ karta̍ve̱ kara̱t tat
English: since he who won of old anew hath triumphed indra hath earned his name of vṛtraslaycr  he hath appeared the mighty lord of conquest what we would have him do let him accomplish

Sanskrit: jani̍ṣṭhā u̱graḥ saha̍se tu̱rāya̍ ma̱ndra oji̍ṣṭho bahu̱lābhi̍mānaḥ   ava̍rdha̱nn indra̍m ma̱ruta̍ś ci̱d atra̍ mā̱tā yad vī̱raṁ da̱dhana̱d dhani̍ṣṭhā
English: thou wast born mighty for victorious valour exulting strongest full of pride and courage  there even there the maruts strengthened indra when his most rapid mother stirred the hero

Sanskrit: dru̱ho niṣa̍ttā pṛśa̱nī ci̱d evai̍ḥ pu̱rū śaṁse̍na vāvṛdhu̱ṣ ṭa indra̍m   a̱bhīvṛ̍teva̱ tā ma̍hāpa̱dena̍ dhvā̱ntāt pra̍pi̱tvād ud a̍ranta̱ garbhā̍ḥ
English: there with fiend's ways een pṛśni was seated with much laudation they exalted indra  as if encompassed by the mightyfooted from darkness near at hand forth came the children

Sanskrit: ṛ̱ṣvā te̱ pādā̱ pra yaj jigā̱sy ava̍rdha̱n vājā̍ u̱ta ye ci̱d atra̍   tvam i̍ndra sālāvṛ̱kān sa̱hasra̍m ā̱san da̍dhiṣe a̱śvinā va̍vṛtyāḥ
English: high are thy feet when on thy way thou goest the strength thou foundest here hath lent thee vigour  thousand hyenas in thy mouth thou holdest o indra mayst thou turn the aśvins hither

Sanskrit: sa̱ma̱nā tūrṇi̱r upa̍ yāsi ya̱jñam ā nāsa̍tyā sa̱khyāya̍ vakṣi   va̱sāvyā̍m indra dhārayaḥ sa̱hasrā̱śvinā̍ śūra dadatur ma̱ghāni̍
English: speeding at once to sacrifice thou comest for friendship thou art bringing both nāsatyas  thou hadst a thousand treasures in possession the aśvins o thou hero gave thee riches

Sanskrit: manda̍māna ṛ̱tād adhi̍ pra̱jāyai̱ sakhi̍bhi̱r indra̍ iṣi̱rebhi̱r artha̍m   ābhi̱r hi mā̱yā upa̱ dasyu̱m āgā̱n miha̱ḥ pra ta̱mrā a̍vapa̱t tamā̍ṁsi
English: glad for the race that rests on holy order with friends who hasten to their goal hath indra  with these his magic powers assailed the dasyu he cast away the gloomy mists the darkness

Sanskrit: sanā̍mānā cid dhvasayo̱ ny a̍smā̱ avā̍ha̱nn indra̍ u̱ṣaso̱ yathāna̍ḥ   ṛ̱ṣvair a̍gaccha̱ḥ sakhi̍bhi̱r nikā̍maiḥ sā̱kam pra̍ti̱ṣṭhā hṛdyā̍ jaghantha
English: two of like name for him didst thou demolish as indra striking down the car of uṣas  with thy beloved lofty friends thou camest and with the assurance of thine heart thou slewest

Sanskrit: tvaṁ ja̍ghantha̱ namu̍cim makha̱syuṁ dāsa̍ṁ kṛṇvā̱na ṛṣa̍ye̱ vimā̍yam   tvaṁ ca̍kartha̱ mana̍ve syo̱nān pa̱tho de̍va̱trāñja̍seva̱ yānā̍n
English: warloving namuci thou smotest robbing the dāsa of his magic for the ṛṣi  for man thou madest ready pleasant pathways paths leading as it were directly godward

Sanskrit: tvam e̱tāni̍ papriṣe̱ vi nāmeśā̍na indra dadhiṣe̱ gabha̍stau   anu̍ tvā de̱vāḥ śava̍sā madanty u̱pari̍budhnān va̱nina̍ś cakartha
English: these names of thine thou hast fulfilled completely as lord thou boldest in thine arm o indra  in thee through thy great might the gods are joyful the roots of trees hast thou directed upward

Sanskrit: ca̱kraṁ yad a̍syā̱psv ā niṣa̍ttam u̱to tad a̍smai̱ madhv ic ca̍cchadyāt   pṛ̱thi̱vyām ati̍ṣita̱ṁ yad ūdha̱ḥ payo̱ goṣv ada̍dhā̱ oṣa̍dhīṣu
English: may the sweet soma juices make him happy to cast his quoit that lies in depth of waters  thou from the udder which oer earth is fastened hast poured the milk into the kine and herbage

Sanskrit: aśvā̍d iyā̱yeti̱ yad vada̱nty oja̍so jā̱tam u̱ta ma̍nya enam   ma̱nyor i̍yāya ha̱rmyeṣu̍ tasthau̱ yata̍ḥ praja̱jña indro̍ asya veda
English: when others call him offspring of the courser my meaning is that mighty power produced him  he came from manyu and remained in houses whence he hath sprung is known to indra only

Sanskrit: vaya̍ḥ supa̱rṇā upa̍ sedu̱r indra̍m pri̱yame̍dhā̱ ṛṣa̍yo̱ nādha̍mānāḥ   apa̍ dhvā̱ntam ū̍rṇu̱hi pū̱rdhi cakṣu̍r mumu̱gdhy a1̱̍smān ni̱dhaye̍va ba̱ddhān
English: like birds of beauteous wing the priyamedhas ṛṣis imploring have come nigh to indra  dispel the darkness and fill full our vision deliver us as men whom snares entangle

Sanskrit: bṛha̍spate pratha̱maṁ vā̱co agra̱ṁ yat praira̍ta nāma̱dheya̱ṁ dadhā̍nāḥ   yad e̍ṣā̱ṁ śreṣṭha̱ṁ yad a̍ri̱pram āsī̍t pre̱ṇā tad e̍ṣā̱ṁ nihi̍ta̱ṁ guhā̱viḥ
English: whenmen bṛhaspati giving names to objects sent out vāk's first and earliest utterances  all that was excellent and spotless treasured within them was disclosed through their affection

Sanskrit: saktu̍m iva̱ tita̍ünā pu̱nanto̱ yatra̱ dhīrā̱ mana̍sā̱ vāca̱m akra̍ta   atrā̱ sakhā̍yaḥ sa̱khyāni̍ jānate bha̱draiṣā̍ṁ la̱kṣmīr nihi̱tādhi̍ vā̱ci
English: where like men cleansing cornflour in a cribble the wise in spirit have created language  friends see and recognize the marks of friendship their speech retains the blessed sign imprinted

Sanskrit: ya̱jñena̍ vā̱caḥ pa̍da̱vīya̍m āya̱n tām anv a̍vinda̱nn ṛṣi̍ṣu̱ pravi̍ṣṭām   tām ā̱bhṛtyā̱ vy a̍dadhuḥ puru̱trā tāṁ sa̱pta re̱bhā a̱bhi saṁ na̍vante
English: with sacrifice the trace of vāk they foilowed and found her harbouring within the ṛṣis  they brought her dealt her forth in many places seven singers make her tones resound in concert

Sanskrit: u̱ta tva̱ḥ paśya̱n na da̍darśa̱ vāca̍m u̱ta tva̍ḥ śṛ̱ṇvan na śṛ̍ṇoty enām   u̱to tva̍smai ta̱nva1̱̍ṁ vi sa̍sre jā̱yeva̱ patya̍ uśa̱tī su̱vāsā̍ḥ
English: one man hath neer seen vāk and yet he seeth one man hath hearing but hath never heard her  but to another hath she shown her beauty as a fond welldressed woman to her husband

Sanskrit: u̱ta tva̍ṁ sa̱khye sthi̱rapī̍tam āhu̱r naina̍ṁ hinva̱nty api̱ vāji̍neṣu   adhe̍nvā carati mā̱yayai̱ṣa vāca̍ṁ śuśru̱vām̐ a̍pha̱lām a̍pu̱ṣpām
English: one man they call a laggard dull in friendship they never urge him on to deeds of valour  he wanders on in profitless illusion the voice he heard yields neither fruitnor blossom

Sanskrit: yas ti̱tyāja̍ saci̱vida̱ṁ sakhā̍ya̱ṁ na tasya̍ vā̱cy api̍ bhā̱go a̍sti   yad ī̍ṁ śṛ̱ṇoty ala̍kaṁ śṛṇoti na̱hi pra̱veda̍ sukṛ̱tasya̱ panthā̍m
English: no part in vāk hath he who hath abandoned his own dear friend who knows the truth of friendship  even if he hears her still in vain he listens naught knows he of the path of righteous action

Sanskrit: a̱kṣa̱ṇvanta̱ḥ karṇa̍vanta̱ḥ sakhā̍yo manoja̱veṣv asa̍mā babhūvuḥ   ā̱da̱ghnāsa̍ upaka̱kṣāsa̍ u tve hra̱dā i̍va̱ snātvā̍ u tve dadṛśre
English: unequal in the quickness of their spirit are friends endowed alike with eyes and hearing  some look like tanks that reach the mouth or shoulder others like pools of water fit to bathe in

Sanskrit: hṛ̱dā ta̱ṣṭeṣu̱ mana̍so ja̱veṣu̱ yad brā̍hma̱ṇāḥ sa̱ṁyaja̍nte̱ sakhā̍yaḥ   atrāha̍ tva̱ṁ vi ja̍hur ve̱dyābhi̱r oha̍brahmāṇo̱ vi ca̍ranty u tve
English: when friendly brahmans sacrifice together with mental impulse which the heart hath fashioned  they leave one far behind through their attainments and some who count as brahmans wander elsewhere

Sanskrit: i̱me ye nārvāṅ na pa̱raś cara̍nti̱ na brā̍hma̱ṇāso̱ na su̱teka̍rāsaḥ   ta e̱te vāca̍m abhi̱padya̍ pā̱payā̍ si̱rīs tantra̍ṁ tanvate̱ apra̍jajñayaḥ
English: those men who step not back and move not forward nor brahmans nor preparers of libations  having attained to vāk in sinful fashion spin out their thread in ignorance like spinsters

Sanskrit: sarve̍ nandanti ya̱śasāga̍tena sabhāsā̱hena̱ sakhyā̱ sakhā̍yaḥ   ki̱lbi̱ṣa̱spṛt pi̍tu̱ṣaṇi̱r hy e̍ṣā̱m ara̍ṁ hi̱to bhava̍ti̱ vāji̍nāya
English: all friends are joyful in the friend who cometh in triumph having conquered in assembly  he is their blameaverter foodprovider prepared is he and fit for deed of vigour

Sanskrit: ṛ̱cāṁ tva̱ḥ poṣa̍m āste pupu̱ṣvān gā̍ya̱traṁ tvo̍ gāyati̱ śakva̍rīṣu   bra̱hmā tvo̱ vada̍ti jātavi̱dyāṁ ya̱jñasya̱ mātrā̱ṁ vi mi̍mīta u tvaḥ
English: one plies his constant task reciting verses one sings the holy psalm in sakvari measures  one more the brahman tells the lore of being and one lays down the rules of sacrificing

Sanskrit: de̱vānā̱ṁ nu va̱yaṁ jānā̱ pra vo̍cāma vipa̱nyayā̍   u̱ktheṣu̍ śa̱syamā̍neṣu̱ yaḥ paśyā̱d utta̍re yu̱ge
English: let us with tuneful skill proclaim these generations of the gods  that one may see them when these hymns are chanted in a future age

Sanskrit: brahma̍ṇa̱s pati̍r e̱tā saṁ ka̱rmāra̍ ivādhamat   de̱vānā̍m pū̱rvye yu̱ge 'sa̍ta̱ḥ sad a̍jāyata
English: these brahmaṇaspati produced with blast and smelting like a smith  existence in an earlier age of gods from nonexistence sprang

Sanskrit: de̱vānā̍ṁ yu̱ge pra̍tha̱me 'sa̍ta̱ḥ sad a̍jāyata   tad āśā̱ anv a̍jāyanta̱ tad u̍ttā̱napa̍da̱s pari̍
English: existence in the earliest age of gods from nonexistence sprang  thereafter were the regions born this sprang from the productive power

Sanskrit: bhūr ja̍jña uttā̱napa̍do bhu̱va āśā̍ ajāyanta   adi̍te̱r dakṣo̍ ajāyata̱ dakṣā̱d v adi̍ti̱ḥ pari̍
English: earth sprang from the productive power the regions from the earth were born  dakṣa was born of aditi and aditi was dakṣa's child

Sanskrit: adi̍ti̱r hy aja̍niṣṭa̱ dakṣa̱ yā du̍hi̱tā tava̍   tāṁ de̱vā anv a̍jāyanta bha̱drā a̱mṛta̍bandhavaḥ
English: for aditi o dakṣa she who is thy daughter was brought forth  after her were the blessed gods born sharers of immortal life

Sanskrit: yad de̍vā a̱daḥ sa̍li̱le susa̍ṁrabdhā̱ ati̍ṣṭhata   atrā̍ vo̱ nṛtya̍tām iva tī̱vro re̱ṇur apā̍yata
English: when ye o gods in yonder deep closeclasping one another stood  thence as of dancers from your feet a thickening cloud of dust arose

Sanskrit: yad de̍vā̱ yata̍yo yathā̱ bhuva̍nā̱ny api̍nvata   atrā̍ samu̱dra ā gū̱ḻham ā sūrya̍m ajabhartana
English: when o ye gods like yatis ye caused all existing things to grow  then ye brought sūrya forward who was lying hidden in the sea

Sanskrit: a̱ṣṭau pu̱trāso̱ adi̍te̱r ye jā̱tās ta̱nva1̱̍s pari̍   de̱vām̐ upa̱ prait sa̱ptabhi̱ḥ parā̍ mārtā̱ṇḍam ā̍syat
English: eight are the sons of adid who from her body sprang to life  with seven she went to meet the gods she cast martanda far away

Sanskrit: sa̱ptabhi̍ḥ pu̱trair adi̍ti̱r upa̱ prait pū̱rvyaṁ yu̱gam   pra̱jāyai̍ mṛ̱tyave̍ tva̱t puna̍r mārtā̱ṇḍam ābha̍rat
English: so with her seven sons aditi went forth to meet the earlier age  she brought martanda thitherward to spring to life and die again

Sanskrit: i̱mām me̍ agne sa̱midha̍ṁ juṣasve̱ḻas pa̱de prati̍ haryā ghṛ̱tācī̍m   varṣma̍n pṛthi̱vyāḥ su̍dina̱tve ahnā̍m ū̱rdhvo bha̍va sukrato devaya̱jyā
English: enjoy o agni this my fuel welcome the oilfilled ladle where we pour libation  rise up for worship of the gods wise agni on the earth's height while days are bright with beauty

Sanskrit: ā de̱vānā̍m agra̱yāve̱ha yā̍tu̱ narā̱śaṁso̍ vi̱śvarū̍pebhi̱r aśvai̍ḥ   ṛ̱tasya̍ pa̱thā nama̍sā mi̱yedho̍ de̱vebhyo̍ de̱vata̍maḥ suṣūdat
English: may he who goes before the gods come hither with steeds whose shapes are varied narasarhsa  may he most godlike speed our offered viands with homage godward on the path of order

Sanskrit: śa̱śva̱tta̱mam ī̍ḻate dū̱tyā̍ya ha̱viṣma̍nto manu̱ṣyā̍so a̱gnim   vahi̍ṣṭhai̱r aśvai̍ḥ su̱vṛtā̱ rathe̱nā de̱vān va̍kṣi̱ ni ṣa̍de̱ha hotā̍
English: men with oblations laud most constant agni and pray him to perform an envoy's duty  with lightlyrolling car and best draughthorses bring the gods hither and sit down as hotar

Sanskrit: vi pra̍thatāṁ de̱vaju̍ṣṭaṁ tira̱ścā dī̱rghaṁ drā̱ghmā su̍ra̱bhi bhū̍tv a̱sme   ahe̍ḻatā̱ mana̍sā deva barhi̱r indra̍jyeṣṭhām̐ uśa̱to ya̍kṣi de̱vān
English: may the delight of gods spread out transversely may it be with us long in length and fragrant  o holy grass divine with friendly spirit bring thou the willing gods whose chief is indra

Sanskrit: di̱vo vā̱ sānu̍ spṛ̱śatā̱ varī̍yaḥ pṛthi̱vyā vā̱ mātra̍yā̱ vi śra̍yadhvam   u̱śa̱tīr dvā̍ro mahi̱nā ma̱hadbhi̍r de̱vaṁ ratha̍ṁ ratha̱yur dhā̍rayadhvam
English: touch ye the farextending height of heaven or spring apart to suit the wide earth's measure  yearning ye doors with those sublime in greatness seize eagerly the heavenly car that cometh

Sanskrit: de̱vī di̱vo du̍hi̱tarā̍ suśi̱lpe u̱ṣāsā̱naktā̍ sadatā̱ṁ ni yonau̍   ā vā̍ṁ de̱vāsa̍ uśatī u̱śanta̍ u̱rau sī̍dantu subhage u̱pasthe̍
English: here in this shrine may dawn and night the daughters of heaven the skilful goddesses be seated  in your wide lap auspicious willing ladies may the gods seat them with a willing spirit

Sanskrit: ū̱rdhvo grāvā̍ bṛ̱had a̱gniḥ sami̍ddhaḥ pri̱yā dhāmā̱ny adi̍ter u̱pasthe̍   pu̱rohi̍tāv ṛtvijā ya̱jñe a̱smin vi̱duṣṭa̍rā̱ dravi̍ṇa̱m ā ya̍jethām
English: up stands the stone high burns the fire enkindled aditi's lap contains the friendly natures  ye two chief priests who serve at this our worship may ye more skilled win for us rich possessions

Sanskrit: tisro̍ devīr ba̱rhir i̱daṁ varī̍ya̱ ā sī̍data cakṛ̱mā va̍ḥ syo̱nam   ma̱nu̱ṣvad ya̱jñaṁ sudhi̍tā ha̱vīṁṣīḻā̍ de̱vī ghṛ̱tapa̍dī juṣanta
English: on our wide grass three goddesses be seated for you have we prepared and made it pleasant  may iḷā she whose foot drops oil the goddess taste manlike sacrifice and wellset presents

Sanskrit: deva̍ tvaṣṭa̱r yad dha̍ cāru̱tvam āna̱ḍ yad aṅgi̍rasā̱m abha̍vaḥ sacā̱bhūḥ   sa de̱vānā̱m pātha̱ upa̱ pra vi̱dvām̐ u̱śan ya̍kṣi draviṇodaḥ su̱ratna̍ḥ
English: since thou god tvaṣṭar hast made beauty perfect since hou hast been the aṅgirases' companion  willing most wealthy giver of possessions grant us the gods assembly thou who knowest

Sanskrit: vana̍spate raśa̱nayā̍ ni̱yūyā̍ de̱vānā̱m pātha̱ upa̍ vakṣi vi̱dvān   svadā̍ti de̱vaḥ kṛ̱ṇava̍d dha̱vīṁṣy ava̍tā̱ṁ dyāvā̍pṛthi̱vī hava̍m me
English: wellknowing binding with thy cord bring hither lord of the wood the deities' assembly  the god prepare and season our oblations may heaven and earth be gracious to my calling

Sanskrit: āgne̍ vaha̱ varu̍ṇam i̱ṣṭaye̍ na̱ indra̍ṁ di̱vo ma̱ruto̍ a̱ntari̍kṣāt   sīda̍ntu ba̱rhir viśva̱ ā yaja̍trā̱ḥ svāhā̍ de̱vā a̱mṛtā̍ mādayantām
English: agni bring hither varuṇa to help us indra from heaven from air's midrealm the maruts  on sacred grass all holy ones be seated and let the immortal gods rejoice in svāhā

Sanskrit: bha̱drā a̱gner va̍dhrya̱śvasya̍ sa̱ṁdṛśo̍ vā̱mī praṇī̍tiḥ su̱raṇā̱ upe̍tayaḥ   yad ī̍ṁ sumi̱trā viśo̱ agra̍ i̱ndhate̍ ghṛ̱tenāhu̍to jarate̱ davi̍dyutat
English: auspicious is the aspect of vadhryasva's fire good is its guidance pleasant are its visitings  when first the people of sumitra kindle it with butter poured thercon it crackles and shines bright

Sanskrit: ghṛ̱tam a̱gner va̍dhrya̱śvasya̱ vardha̍naṁ ghṛ̱tam anna̍ṁ ghṛ̱tam v a̍sya̱ meda̍nam   ghṛ̱tenāhu̍ta urvi̱yā vi pa̍prathe̱ sūrya̍ iva rocate sa̱rpirā̍sutiḥ
English: butter is that which makes vadhryaiva's fire growstrong the butter is its food the butter makes it fat  it spreads abroad when butter hath been offered it and balmed with streams of butter shines forth like the sun

Sanskrit: yat te̱ manu̱r yad anī̍kaṁ sumi̱traḥ sa̍mī̱dhe a̍gne̱ tad i̱daṁ navī̍yaḥ   sa re̱vac cho̍ca̱ sa giro̍ juṣasva̱ sa vāja̍ṁ darṣi̱ sa i̱ha śravo̍ dhāḥ
English: still newest is this face of thine o agni which manu and sumitra have enkindled  so richly shine accept our songs with favour so give us strengthening food so send us glory

Sanskrit: yaṁ tvā̱ pūrva̍m īḻi̱to va̍dhrya̱śvaḥ sa̍mī̱dhe a̍gne̱ sa i̱daṁ ju̍ṣasva   sa na̍ḥ sti̱pā u̱ta bha̍vā tanū̱pā dā̱traṁ ra̍kṣasva̱ yad i̱daṁ te̍ a̱sme
English: accept this offering agni whom aforetime vadhryasva hath entreated and enkindled  guard well our homes and ople guard our bodies protect thy girt to us which thou hast granted

Sanskrit: bhavā̍ dyu̱mnī vā̍dhryaśvo̱ta go̱pā mā tvā̍ tārīd a̱bhimā̍ti̱r janā̍nām   śūra̍ iva dhṛ̱ṣṇuś cyava̍naḥ sumi̱traḥ pra nu vo̍ca̱ṁ vādhrya̍śvasya̱ nāma̍
English: be splendid guard us kinsman of vadhryasva let not the enmity of men oercome thee  like the bold hero cyavāna i sumitra tell forth the title of vadhryaiva's kinsman

Sanskrit: sam a̱jryā̍ parva̱tyā̱3̱̍ vasū̍ni̱ dāsā̍ vṛ̱trāṇy āryā̍ jigetha   śūra̍ iva dhṛ̱ṣṇuś cyava̍no̱ janā̍nā̱ṁ tvam a̍gne pṛtanā̱yūm̐r a̱bhi ṣyā̍ḥ
English: all treasures hast thou won of plains and mountains and quelled the dāsas' and āryas' hatred  like the bold hero cyavāna o agni mayst thou subdue the men who long for battle

Sanskrit: dī̱rghata̍ntur bṛ̱hadu̍kṣā̱yam a̱gniḥ sa̱hasra̍starīḥ śa̱tanī̍tha̱ ṛbhvā̍   dyu̱mān dyu̱matsu̱ nṛbhi̍r mṛ̱jyamā̍naḥ sumi̱treṣu̍ dīdayo deva̱yatsu̍
English: deft agni hath a lengthened thread tall oxen a thousand heifers numberless devices  decked by the men splendid among the splendid shine brightly forth amid devout sumitras

Sanskrit: tve dhe̱nuḥ su̱dughā̍ jātavedo 'sa̱ścate̍va sama̱nā sa̍ba̱rdhuk   tvaṁ nṛbhi̱r dakṣi̍ṇāvadbhir agne sumi̱trebhi̍r idhyase deva̱yadbhi̍ḥ
English: thine is the teeming cow o jātavedas who pours at once her ceaseless flow sabardhuk  thou art lit up by men enriched with guerdon o agni by the pioussouled sumitras

Sanskrit: de̱vāś ci̍t te a̱mṛtā̍ jātavedo mahi̱māna̍ṁ vādhryaśva̱ pra vo̍can   yat sa̱mpṛccha̱m mānu̍ṣī̱r viśa̱ āya̱n tvaṁ nṛbhi̍r ajaya̱s tvāvṛ̍dhebhiḥ
English: even immortal gods o jātavedas vadhryasva's kinsman have declared thy grandeur  when human tribes drew near with supplication thou conqueredst with men whom thou hadst strengthened

Sanskrit: pi̱teva̍ pu̱tram a̍bibhar u̱pasthe̱ tvām a̍gne vadhrya̱śvaḥ sa̍pa̱ryan   ju̱ṣā̱ṇo a̍sya sa̱midha̍ṁ yaviṣṭho̱ta pūrvā̍m̐ avano̱r vrādha̍taś cit
English: like as a father bears his son o agni vadhryasva bare thee in his lap and served thee  thou youngest god having enjoyed his fuel didst vanquish those of old though they were mighty

Sanskrit: śaśva̍d a̱gnir va̍dhrya̱śvasya̱ śatrū̱n nṛbhi̍r jigāya su̱taso̍mavadbhiḥ   sama̍naṁ cid adahaś citrabhā̱no 'va̱ vrādha̍ntam abhinad vṛ̱dhaś ci̍t
English: vadhryasva's agni evermore hath vanquished his foes with heroes who had pressed the soma  lord of bright rays thou burntest up the battle subduing as our help een mighty foemen

Sanskrit: a̱yam a̱gnir va̍dhrya̱śvasya̍ vṛtra̱hā sa̍na̱kāt preddho̱ nama̍sopavā̱kya̍ḥ   sa no̱ ajā̍mīm̐r u̱ta vā̱ vijā̍mīn a̱bhi ti̍ṣṭha̱ śardha̍to vādhryaśva
English: this agni of vadhryasva vṛtraslayer lit from of old must be invoked with homage  as such assail our enemies vadhryasva whether the foes be strangers or be kinsmen

Sanskrit: u̱da̱pruto̱ na vayo̱ rakṣa̍māṇā̱ vāva̍dato a̱bhriya̍syeva̱ ghoṣā̍ḥ   gi̱ri̱bhrajo̱ normayo̱ mada̍nto̱ bṛha̱spati̍m a̱bhy a1̱̍rkā a̍nāvan
English: like birds who keep their watch plashing in water like the loud voices of the thundering raincloud  like merry streamlets bursting from the mountain thus to bṛhaspati our hymns have sounded

Sanskrit: saṁ gobhi̍r āṅgira̱so nakṣa̍māṇo̱ bhaga̍ i̱ved a̍rya̱maṇa̍ṁ nināya   jane̍ mi̱tro na dampa̍tī anakti̱ bṛha̍spate vā̱jayā̱śūm̐r i̍vā̱jau
English: the son of aṅgirases meeting the cattle as bhaga brought in aryaman among us  as friend of men he decks the wife and husband as for the race bṛhaspati nerve our coursers

Sanskrit: sā̱dhva̱ryā a̍ti̱thinī̍r iṣi̱rāḥ spā̱rhāḥ su̱varṇā̍ anava̱dyarū̍pāḥ   bṛha̱spati̱ḥ parva̍tebhyo vi̱tūryā̱ nir gā ū̍pe̱ yava̍m iva sthi̱vibhya̍ḥ
English: bṛhaspati having won them from the mountains strewed down like barley out of winnowing baskets  the vigorous wandering cows who aid the pious desired of all of blameless form wellcoloured

Sanskrit: ā̱pru̱ṣā̱yan madhu̍na ṛ̱tasya̱ yoni̍m avakṣi̱pann a̱rka u̱lkām i̍va̱ dyoḥ   bṛha̱spati̍r u̱ddhara̱nn aśma̍no̱ gā bhūmyā̍ u̱dneva̱ vi tvaca̍m bibheda
English: as the sun dews with meath the seat of order and casts a flaming meteor down from heaven  so from the rock bṛhaspati forced the cattle and cleft the earth's skin as it were with water

Sanskrit: apa̱ jyoti̍ṣā̱ tamo̍ a̱ntari̍kṣād u̱dnaḥ śīpā̍lam iva̱ vāta̍ ājat   bṛha̱spati̍r anu̱mṛśyā̍ va̱lasyā̱bhram i̍va̱ vāta̱ ā ca̍kra̱ ā gāḥ
English: forth from mid air with light he dravc the darkness as the gale blows a lily from the fiver  like the wind grasping at the cloud of vala bṛhaspati gathered to himself the cattle
